en:
his grinding teeth
wake me...
a cold night

jp: .秋の夜や旅の男の針仕事
ro: aki no yo ya tabi no otoko no harishigoto
en:
autumn evening--
a traveling man busy
stitching

jp: .さらぬだに月に立待惣稼哉
ro: sara nu dani tsuki ni tachimatsu sôka kana
en:
not only waiting
for the harvest moon to rise...
streetwalker

jp: .花の原誰かさ敷る跡に哉
ro: hana nohara taga kasa shikeru ato ni kana
en:
field of flowers--
whose umbrella-hat
marked you?

jp: .手叩て親の教ゆるをどり哉
ro: te tataite oya no oshiyuru odori kana
en:
hands clapping
mother teaches her child
the dance

jp: .湖や鴛の側ゆく夜這星
ro: mizuumi ya oshi no soba yuku yobaiboshi
en:
in the lake
alongside the duck...
the sneaky Romeo Star

jp: .落し水魚も古郷へもどる哉
ro: oto[shi] mizu uo mo kokyô e modoru kana
en:
draining the rice field--
a fish also
heads home

jp: .鞍壷に三ッ四ッ六ッいなご哉
ro: kuratsubo ni mittsu yo[tsu] mutsu inago kana
en:
on the saddle
three, four, six...
locusts

jp: .きりぎりすしばし布団のうへに哉
ro: kirigirisu shibashi futon no ue ni kana
en:
katydid--
for a little while
on my futon

jp: .遠方や枯野の小家の灯の見ゆる
ro: enpô ya kareno no-goya no hi no miyuru
en:
distant sight--
in withered fields
a little house's lamp

jp: .君が世や寺へも配る伊勢暦
ro: kimi ga yo ya tera e mo kubaru ise-goyomi
en:
Great Japan!
even for a Buddhist temple
Ise Shrine's calendar

jp: .君が世やから人も来て年ごもり
ro: kimi ga yo ya karabito mo kite toshi-gomori
en:
Great Japan--
a foreigner also attends
the year's end service!

jp: .冬篭り鳥料理にも念仏哉
ro: fuyugomori tori ryôri ni mo nebutsu kana
en:
winter seclusion--
cooking a chicken
praising Buddha

jp: .思ふ人の側へ割込む炬燵哉
ro: omou hito no soba e warikomu kotatsu kana
en:
squeezing in next
to my lover...
quilt-covered brazier

jp: .すぎはひやほた一ッ掘に小一日
ro: sugiwai ya hota hitotsu horu ni ko ichi nichi
en:
an all-day job--
digging one small chunk
of firewood

jp: .糞土より梅へ飛んだりみそさざい
ro: fundo yori ume e tondari misosazai
en:
from crappy ground
to the plum tree
the wren

jp: .冬枯やあらしの中の御神灯
ro: fuyugare ya arashi no naka no go-shintô
en:
winter withering--
amid the storm
a sacred lantern

jp: .冬枯や桜もわらの掛どころ
ro: fuyugare ya sakura mo wara no kake-dokoro
en:
winter withering--
even the cherry tree
a place for straw

jp: .雑煮いはふ吾も物かは旅の春
ro: zôni iwau ware mo monoka wa tabi no haru
en:
I too celebrate
with zoni...
spring journey

jp: .初夢に古郷を見て涙哉
ro: hatsu yume ni furusato wo mite namida kana
en:
in the year's first dream
my home village...
tears

jp: .片乳を握りながらやはつ笑ひ
ro: kata chichi wo nigiri nagara ya hatsu warai
en:
while grasping
mama's breast...
the year's first smile

jp: .きぬぎぬやかすむ迄見る妹が家
ro: kinu-ginu ya kasumu made miru imo ga ie
en:
lovers parting--
looking back at her house
until only mist

jp: .窓明て蝶を見送る野原哉
ro: mado akete chô wo mi-okuru no hara kana
en:
opening the window
I see the butterfly off...
into the field

jp: .高山や花見序の寺参り
ro: takayama ya hanami tsuide no tera mairi
en:
Mount Taka--
while viewing blossoms
a temple pilgrimage

jp: .奈良坂や花の咲く夜も鹿の声
ro: narazaka ya hana no saku yo mo shika no koe
en:
Narazaka--
even as night's blossoms bloom
the cry of a deer

jp: .桃咲やおくれ年始のとまり客
ro: momo saku ya okure nenshi no tomari kyaku
en:
peach blossoms--
a belated "Happy New Year!"
for the inn's guests

jp: .茶の煙柳と共にそよぐ也
ro: cha no kemuri yanagi to tomo ni soyogu nari
en:
the tea smoke
and the willow
together trembling

jp: .夏の暁や牛に寝てゆく秣刈
ro: ge no ake ya ushi ni nete yuku magusa kari
en:
summer dawn--
riding an ox, asleep
the hay cutter

jp: .涼しさや半月うごく溜まり水
ro: suzushisa ya hangetsu ugoku tamarimizu
en:
cool air--
the half moon moves
across a puddle

jp: .棒突がごもくを流す白雨哉
ro: bô tsuki ga gomoku wo nagasu yudachi kana
en:
my walking stick
sends the trash floating...
cloudburst

jp: .雲の峰外山は雨に黒む哉
ro: kumo no mine toyama wa ame ni kuromu kana
en:
billowing clouds--
the mountains in the rain
all black

jp: .雲のみね見越見越て阿蘇煙
ro: kumo no mine mikoshi mikoshite aso kemuri
en:
peaks of clouds--
looking down, down...
Mount Aso's smoke

jp: .憎るる稗は穂に出て青田原
ro: nikumaruru hie wa ho ni dete aodabara
en:
the hated barnyard grass
rears its head...
green rice field

jp: .雨垂の内外にむるる藪蚊哉
ro: amadare no uchito ni mururu yabu ka kana
en:
in and out of raindrops
falling from the eaves they swarm...
mosquitoes

jp: .芥子の花々と見る間にあらし哉
ro: keshi no hana hana to miru ma ni arashi kana
en:
while looking
at poppies, poppies...
a storm

jp: .垣津旗よりあの虹は起りけん
ro: kakitsubata yori ano niji wa okoriken
en:
irises--
where that rainbow
starts from

jp: .露の野にかた袖寒き朝日哉
ro: tsuyu no no ni kata sode samuki asahi kana
en:
in the dewy field
one sleeve cold...
morning sun

jp: .あぢきなや魂迎へ火を火とり虫
ro: ajikina ya tama mukae hi wo hitorimushi
en:
bad luck!
into the bonfire for the dead
a tiger moth

jp: .すくも火やかがしの果も夕煙り
ro: sukumo-bi ya kagashi no hate mo yû keburi
en:
bonfire--
a scarecrow also ends up
in evening's smoke

jp: .せせなぎや氷を走る炊ぎ水
ro: sesenagi ya kôri wo hashiru kashigimizu
en:
a gutter--
racing over ice
the cooking water

jp: .冬の月いよいよいよの高根哉
ro: fuyu no tsuki iyo-iyo-iyo no takane kana
en:
winter moon--
more and more and more
tall peaks

jp: .初雪に昨夜の松明のほこり哉
ro: hatsu yuki ni kizo no taimatsu no hokori kana
en:
in first snow
last night's pine torch
remnant

jp: .家陰や吹雪吹雪の吹き溜り
ro: ie kage ya fubuki fubuki no fuki damari
en:
shady side of the house--
the blizzard blows
a pile

jp: .灯ちらちら疱瘡小家の吹雪哉
ro: hi chira-chira mogasa ko ie no fubuki kana
en:
lamplight flickers
in the smallpox shack...
a blizzard

jp: .畠打がうてば唸る霰かな
ro: hata uchi ga uteba unaru arare kana
en:
plowing the field--
the growl
of hailstones

jp: .朝霜に潮を散す宮居哉
ro: asa shimo ni ushio wo chirasu miyai kana
en:
morning frost melts
in the floodtide...
Shinto shrine

jp: .朝霜に野鍛冶が散火走る哉
ro: asa shimo ni no kaji ga chiribi hashiru kana
en:
on the morning frost
the blacksmith's sparks
spurting

jp: .暁の霜に風呂屋が門をたたく哉
ro: ake no shimo ni furoya ga kado wo tataku kana
en:
in dawn frost
at the bathhouse door
knocking

jp: .朝な朝な焼大根哉冬ごもり
ro: asana-asana yaki daiko kana fuyugomori
en:
morning after morning
damn roasted radishes!
winter seclusion

jp: .猪追ふやすすきを走る夜の声
ro: shishi ou ya susuki wo hashiru yoru no koe
en:
boar hunt--
swiftly through the pampas grass
evening shouts

jp: .落葉焚く妹が黒髪つつむ哉
ro: ochiba taku imo ga kuro-gami tsutsumu kana
en:
burning leaves--
sweet potatoes wrapped
in black paper

jp: .元日やさらに旅宿とおもほへず
ro: ganjitsu ya sara ni ryoshuku to omohoezu
en:
New Year's Day--
that I'm still on this journey
unbelievable

jp: .乞食も護摩酢酌むらん今日の春
ro: konjiki mo gomazu kumuran kyô [no] haru
en:
even beggars toast
with sesame sake...
first of spring

jp: .出て見れば我のみならず初旅寝
ro: dete mireba ware no mi narazu hatsu tabine
en:
off on a journey
I'm not alone...
first inn of the year

jp: .くっさめは我がうはさか旅の春
ro: kussame wa ware ga uwasa ka tabi no haru
en:
"Ah-choo!"
is someone gossiping about me?
spring journey

jp: .なべ一つ柳一本も是も春
ro: nabe hitotsu yanagi ippon mo kore mo haru
en:
one kettle
one willow tree...
this too is spring

jp: .召仕新しき哉小正月
ro: meshi tsukai atarashiki kana ko shôgatsu
en:
the servants
all are new...
Little New Year's

jp: .吾恵方参は正月ざくら哉
ro: waga ehô mairi wa shôgatsu-zakura kana
en:
my New Year's
lucky direction walk...
to cherry blossoms

jp: .家飛々凧も三ッ四ッふたつ哉
ro: ie tobi-tobi tako mo mitsu yotsu futatsu kana
en:
houses here and there
fly kites, three...four...
two

jp: .凧青葉を出つ入つ哉
ro: ikanobori aoba wo idetsu iritsu kana
en:
New Year's kite--
out of green leaves
then back in

jp: .日でり雨凧にかかると思ふ哉
ro: hideri ame tako ni kakaru to omou kana
en:
sunny day rain
has splashed the kite...
it seems

jp: .七草の音に負じと烏かな
ro: nanakusa no oto ni makeji to karasu kana
en:
pounding the seven herbs
doesn't drown him out...
crow

jp: .長閑や雨後の縄ばり庭雀
ro: nodokeshi ya ugo no nawabari niwa suzume
en:
spring peace--
after rain, a gang war
garden sparrows

jp: .長閑しや雨後の畠の朝煙り
ro: nodokeshi ya ugo no hatake no asa kemuri
en:
spring peace--
the rained-on field's
morning smoke

jp: .起て見れば春雨はれず日も暮れず
ro: okite mireba harusame harezu hi mo kurezu
en:
waking up--
the spring rain hasn't cleared
the day hasn't ended

jp: .春雨や独法談二はいかい
ro: harusame ya hitori hôdan ni haikai
en:
spring rain--
one Buddhist sermon
two haiku

jp: .春風や順礼共がねり供養
ro: harukaze ya junrei-domo ga nerikuyô
en:
spring breeze--
pilgrims on their way
to rites for the dead

jp: .朧々ふめば水也まよひ道
ro: oboro-oboro fumeba mizu nari mayoi michi
en:
in hazy night
stepping into water...
losing my way

jp: .朝がすみ天守の雨戸聞へけり
ro: asa-gasumi tenshu no amado kikoe keri
en:
morning mist--
the castle's shutters
bang open

jp: .門前や何万石の遠がすみ
ro: monzen ya nan man-goku no tôgasumi
en:
at the gate
how many thousands of bushels
of far mist?

jp: .汲みて知るぬるみに昔なつかしや
ro: kumite shiru nurumi ni mukashi natsukashi ya
en:
drawing water
it's tepid...
nostalgia for olden times

jp: .魁てうき草浮けり苗代田
ro: sakigakete uki kusa uki keri nawashiroda
en:
duckweed is first
to float...
rice-seedling bed

jp: .いつの間に乙鳥は皆巣立けり
ro: itsu no ma ni tsubakura wa mina su-dachi keri
en:
when did they go?
all the swallows' nests
empty

jp: .天に雲雀人間海にあそぶ日ぞ
ro: ten ni hibari ningen umi ni asobu hi zo
en:
larks in the sky
people in the sea...
a holiday

jp: .蛙鳴き鶏なき東しらみけり
ro: kawazu naki tori naki higashi shirami keri
en:
frogs sing, roosters sing
the east
turns light

jp: .蝶と共に吾も七野を巡る哉
ro: chô to tomo ni ware mo nana no wo meguru kana
en:
a butterfly my companion
through Nana Field
we wander

jp: .寝ころんで蝶泊らせる外湯哉
ro: ne-koronde chô tomaraseru soto yu kana
en:
lying down
with a visiting butterfly...
outer hot spring

jp: .白魚のしろきが中に青藻哉
ro: shirouo no shiroki ga naka ni aomo kana
en:
amid the white
of the whitebait
duckweed's green

jp: .平家蟹昔はここで月見船
ro: heike-gani mukashi wa koko de tsukimi-bune
en:
Heike crabs--
long ago they moon-gazed here
on boats

jp: .海のなき国をおもひきる田にし哉
ro: umi no naki kuni wo omoikiru tanishi kana
en:
resigning himself
to this oceanless province...
pond snail

jp: .藤咲くや順礼の声鳥の声
ro: fuji saku ya junrei no koe tori no koe
en:
wisteria in bloom--
voices of pilgrims
voices of birds

jp: .梅がかに障子ひらけば月夜哉
ro: ume ga ka ni shôji hirakeba tsuki yo kana
en:
plum blossom scent--
when I open my paper door
a bright moon

jp: .梅の月一枚のこす雨戸哉
ro: ume no tsuki ichi mai no kosu amado kana
en:
for the plum blossom moon
I remove
a rain shutter

jp: .正風の三尊見たり梅の宿
ro: shôfû no san-zon mitari ume no yado
en:
I view three masters
of the original style...
plum blossom inn

jp: .或時は花の都にも倦にけり
ro: aru toki wa hana no miyako ni mo aki ni keri
en:
there comes a time
even in blossoming Kyoto...
sick of it

jp: .拝上頭に花の雫かな
ro: ogami agu kashira ni hana no shizuku kana
en:
to my upturned face
as I pray, blossoms
drip down

jp: .塚の花にぬかづけや古郷なつかしや
ro: tsuka no hana ni nukazuke ya kokyô natsukashi ya
en:
amid his grave's
blossoms I bow...
missing him

jp: .遠山や花と見るより道急ぐ
ro: tôyama ya hana to miru yori michi isogu
en:
distant mountain--
looking at the blossoms
then hurrying on my way

jp: .冥加あれや日本の花惣鎮守
ro: myôga are ya nippon no hana sôchinju
en:
divine providence--
throughout Japan gods
guarding blossoms

jp: .桃柳庇々の花見かな
ro: momo yanagi hisashi hisashi no hanami kana
en:
peach blossoms and willow
decorate the eaves...
blossom viewing

jp: .軒の雨鉢うつさくら閑しや
ro: noki no ame hachi utsu sakura shizukeshi ya
en:
rain on the eaves--
the potted cherry tree
calm and still

jp: .落書の一句拙し山ざくら
ro: raku-gaki no hito ku tsutanashi yama-zakura
en:
an off-the-cuff haiku
for a poor crop...
mountain cherry blossoms

jp: .振向ばはや美女過る柳哉
ro: furimukeba haya bijo suguru yanagi kana
en:
turning 'round
just missing a pretty woman...
willow tree

jp: .五月雨や借傘五千五百ばん
ro: samidare ya kashigasa go sen go hyaku ban
en:
Fifth Month rain--
the five thousand five hundredth
rented umbrella

jp: .遠かたや青田のうへの三の山
ro: ochikata ya aoda no ue no mitsu no yama
en:
far distance--
above green rice fields
three mountains

jp: .つくづくと鵜ににらまるる鵜飼哉
ro: tsuku-zuku to u ni nirama[ru]ru ukai kana
en:
the cormorants stare
at them hard...
cormorant fishermen

jp: .衣がえ替ても旅のしらみ哉
ro: koromogae kaete mo tabi no shirami kana
en:
also changing
into a summer robe...
my journey's lice

jp: .更衣ふりかけらるる湯花哉
ro: koromogae furikakeraruru yubana kana
en:
my new summer robe
splashed by hot
purification water

jp: .鉢植の竹と我とが涼み哉
ro: hachi ue no take to ware to ga suzumi kana
en:
for the potted bamboo
and me...
cool air

jp: .暁や鶏なき里の時鳥
ro: akatsuki ya tori naki sato no hototogisu
en:
daybreak--
the rooster-less village
has a cuckoo!

jp: .つかれ鵜の見送る空やほととぎす
ro: tsukare u no miokuru sora ya hototogisu
en:
the weary cormorant
sees off the cuckoo
in the sky

jp: .御旅所を吾もの顔やかたつぶり
ro: o-tabisho wo waga mono-gao ya katatsuburi
en:
temporary shrine--
acting like he owns it
a snail

jp: .青梅や餓鬼大将が肌ぬいで
ro: aoume ya gaki-daishô ga hada nuide
en:
green plums--
the baddest of bad boys
bare-chested

jp: .天広く地ひろく秋もゆく秋ぞ
ro: ten hiroku chi hiroku aki mo yuku aki zo
en:
vast sky
vast earth
autumn passes too

jp: .笠の露眠むらんとすれば犬の声
ro: kasa no tsuyu nemuran to sureba inu no koe
en:
under dewy umbrella-hat
nodding off...
the dog barks!

jp: .義仲寺へいそぎ候はつしぐれ
ro: gichûji e isogi sôrô hatsu shigure
en:
to Gichu Temple
we run...
first winter rain

jp: .旅笠を小さく見せる霞かな
ro: tabi-gasa wo chiisaku miseru kasumi kana
en:
their traveling hats
looking small...
mist

jp: .鳥と共に人間くぐる桜哉
ro: tori to tomo ni ningen kuguru sakura kana
en:
birds and people
creeping through...
cherry blossoms

jp: .湖に鳥鳴初めて夜寒かな
ro: mizuumi ni tori naki-somete yozamu kana
en:
birds on the lake
all start honking...
a cold night

jp: .人並に畳のうえの月見哉
ro: hito nami ni tatami no ue no tsukimi kana
en:
like the others
on tatami mats...
moon gazing

jp: .降雪に草履で旅宿出たりけり
ro: furu yuki ni zôri de tabiyado detari keri
en:
in falling snow
in straw sandals
leaving the inn

jp: .正月の子供に成て見たき哉
ro: shôgatsu no kodomo ni natte mitaki kana
en:
turning into a child
on New Year's Day...
I'd like that!

jp: .塚の土いただひてふるしぐれかな
ro: tsuka no tsuchi itadaite furu shigure kana
en:
the grave's soil
welcomes its falling...
winter rain

jp: .とそ酌もわらじながらの夜明哉
ro: toso kumu mo waraji nagara no yoake kana
en:
my New Year's toast
with straw sandals on...
dawn

jp: .むく起の鼻の先よりかすみ哉
ro: mukuoki no hana no saki yori kasumi kana
en:
from the nose
of the sudden riser...
mist

jp: .苗代の雨を見て居る戸口哉
ro: nawashiro no ame wo mite iru toguchi kana
en:
watching rain fall
on the rice seedlings...
from the doorway

jp: .夕立に賑はしき野火山火かな
ro: yûdachi ni nigiwashiki nobi yamabi kana
en:
crackling in the rainstorm--
field fires
mountain fires

jp: .なの花に四ッのなる迄朝茶かな
ro: na no hana ni yotsu no naru made asa cha kana
en:
amid rape flowers
till the ten o'clock bell...
morning tea

jp: .梅の月階子を下りて見たりけり
ro: ume no tsuki hashigo wo orite mitari keri
en:
plum blossom moon--
descending the ladder
I see it

jp: .我もけさ清僧の部也梅の花
ro: waga mo kesa seiso no bu nari ume no hana
en:
this morning I'm one
of the pure-minded priests...
plum blossoms

jp: .あの鐘の上野に似たり花の雲
ro: ano kane no ueno ni nitari hana no kumo
en:
that temple bell
sounds like Ueno's...
clouds of blossoms

jp: .花雲三輪は真黒のくもりかな
ro: hana kumori miwa wa makuro no kumori kana
en:
the blossom clouds
over Mount Miwa...
pitch black

jp: .花さくやあれが大和の小口哉
ro: hana saku ya are ga yamato no koguchi kana
en:
cherry blossoms--
over there an edge
of Old Japan

jp: .花の雲あれが大和の小口哉
ro: hana no kumo are ga yamato no koguchi kana
en:
cherry blossom clouds--
over there an edge
of Old Japan

jp: .涼しさや雨をよこぎる稲光り
ro: suzushisa ya ame wo yokogiru inabikari
en:
in cool air
slicing the falling rain...
lightning!

jp: .ﾂあらしかいだるき雲のかかる也
ro: aoarashi kaidaruki kumo no kakaru nari
en:
wind on the greenery--
a weary cloud
hangs over

jp: .青あらし我家見に出る旭哉
ro: aoarashi waga ya mi ni deru asahi kana
en:
wind on the greenery--
coming to see my house
the morning sun

jp: .植込みにきのふのままのほたる哉
ro: uekomi ni kinou no mama no hotaru kana
en:
in the thick weeds
same as yesterday...
fireflies

jp: .ほたるよぶよこ顔過るほたる哉
ro: hotaru yobu yokogao yogiru hotaru kana
en:
while calling fireflies
crossing his profile...
a firefly

jp: .横町に蚤のござ打月夜哉
ro: yokochô ni nomi no goza utsu tsuki yo kana
en:
in an alley
beating fleas off a mat...
a bright moon

jp: .名月のこころになれば夜の明る
ro: meigetsu no kokoro ni nareba yo no akeru
en:
harvest moon--
when my heart's had its fill
it's dawn

jp: .今さらに別ともなし春がすみ
ro: imasara ni wakare tomonashi harugasumi
en:
leaving now
is especially hard...
spring mist

jp: .姨捨のきらき中より清水かな
ro: obasute no kiraki naka yori shimizu kana
en:
though Mount Obasute
is hateful...
pure water

jp: .夕山やいつまで寒い風の吹
ro: yû yama ya itsu made samui kaze no fuku
en:
evening mountain--
how long will the cold wind
blast?

jp: .炉のはたやよべの笑ひがいとまごひ
ro: ro no hata ya yobe no warai ga itomagoi
en:
by the hearth
last night, his smile
was farewell

jp: .きのふ迄毎日見しを若菜かな
ro: kinou made mainichi mishi wo wakana kana
en:
up to yesterday
I saw you every day...
New Year's herbs

jp: .さく花に拙きわれを呼子鳥
ro: saku hana ni tsutanaki ware wo yobu ko tori
en:
in the blossoms
calling to me clumsily...
a little bird

jp: .夏山に洗ふたやうな日の出哉
ro: natsu yama ni arauta yôna hi no de kana
en:
it seems to wash
the summer mountains...
sunrise

jp: .かつしかや早乙女がちの渡し舟
ro: katsushika ya saotome-gachi no watashibune
en:
Katsushika--
mostly rice planters
on the ferry

jp: .空錠と人には告よ田打人
ro: karajô to hito ni wa tsuge yo ta uchi hito
en:
his lock is worthless
he's told...
plowing the rice field

jp: .父ありて明ぼの見たし青田原
ro: chichi arite akebono mitashi aodabara
en:
if my father were here--
dawn colors
over green fields

jp: .鹿の親笹吹く風にもどりけり
ro: shika no oya sasa fuku kaze ni modori keri
en:
wind shakes the bamboo grass--
mother deer
returns

jp: .時鳥我も気相のよき日也
ro: hototogisu ware mo kiai no yoki hi nari
en:
cuckoo--
today I'm in good spirits
too

jp: .寝すがたの蠅追ふもけふがかぎり哉
ro: nesugata no hae ou mo kyô ga kagiri kana
en:
shooing flies too
today, as he sleeps
for the last time

jp: .夜々にかまけられたる蚤蚊哉
ro: yoru-yoru ni kamakera[re]taru nomi ka kana
en:
night after night
of pestering...
fleas, mosquitoes

jp: .足元へいつ来りしよかたつぶり
ro: ashi moto e itsu kitarishi yo katatsuburi
en:
at my feet
when did you get here?
snail

jp: .生残る我にかかるや草の露
ro: ikinokoru ware ni kakaru ya kusa no tsuyu
en:
splashing me
the survivor...
grassy dew

jp: .門松やひとりし聞は夜の雨
ro: kadomatsu ya hitorishi kiku wa yoru no ame
en:
New Year's pine--
alone, listening to
the evening rain

jp: .日の暮の山を見かけて凧
ro: hi no kure no yama wo mikakete ikanobori
en:
eye-catching
over the sunset mountain...
a kite

jp: .文七が下駄の白さよ春の月
ro: bunshichi ga geta no shirosa yo haru no tsuki
en:
the hairdresser's
white wooden clogs...
spring moon

jp: .茹汁の川にけぶるや春の月
ro: yudejiru no kawa ni keburu ya haru no tsuki
en:
a river of broth
is steaming...
spring moon

jp: .昼風呂の寺に立也春がすみ
ro: hiru furo no tera ni tatsu nari harugasumi
en:
from the temple's
noon bath rising...
spring mist

jp: .陽炎や小藪は雪のまじまじと
ro: kagerô ya ko yabu wa yuki no maji-maji to
en:
heat shimmers--
snow in the little thicket
winking

jp: .凍解や敷居のうちのよひの月
ro: ite-doke ya shiki-i no uchi no yoi no tsuki
en:
ice melting--
in the threshold
early evening's moon

jp: .初午を後に聞くや上野山
ro: hatsu uma wo ushiro ni kiku ya ueno yama
en:
behind me I hear
the Fox Festival...
Ueno Hill

jp: .初午の聞へぬ山や梅の花
ro: hatsu uma no kikoenu yama ya ume no hana
en:
no Fox Festival ruckus
on this hill...
plum blossoms

jp: .初午や山の小すみはどこの里
ro: hatsu uma ya yama no kosumi wa doko no sato
en:
Fox Festival--
what village is this
in the mountain's nook?

jp: .うぐひすのあごの下より淡路島
ro: uguisu no ago no shita yori awaji shima
en:
below the nightingale's
chin...
Awaji Island

jp: .湯の里とよび初る日やむら燕
ro: yu no sato to yobi-somuru hi ya mura tsubame
en:
today they're flying
in the bathhouse town...
swallow swarm

jp: .夕暮の松見に来しをかへる雁
ro: yûgure no matsu mi ni koshi wo kaeru kari
en:
stopping to watch
the evening pines...
geese flying north

jp: .よひ闇の一本榎なくかはづ
ro: yoiyami no ippon enoki naku kawazu
en:
darkening dusk--
in one nettle tree
singing frogs

jp: .草の蝶大雨だれのかかる也
ro: kusa no chô ôamadare no kakaru nari
en:
a meadow butterfly
bombarded by big raindrops
from the eaves

jp: .辻風の砂にまぶれし小てふ哉
ro: tsujikaze no suna ni mabureshi ko chô kana
en:
flecked with sand
from the whirlwind...
little butterfly

jp: .むら雨やきのふ時分の草のてふ
ro: murasame ya kinou jubun no kusa no chô
en:
rain shower--
yesterday at this time
meadow butterflies

jp: .一人はつつじにかかるわらび哉
ro: ichi nin wa tsutsuji ni kakaru warabi kana
en:
someone's draped them
over the azaleas...
bracken

jp: .片枝は都の空よむめの花
ro: kata eda wa miyako no sora yo mume no hana
en:
one branch makes
Kyoto's sky...
plum blossoms

jp: .なつかしや梅あちこちにゆふ木魚
ro: natsukashi ya ume achi kochi ni yû mokugyo
en:
like old times--
plum blossoms here and there
evening's wooden drum

jp: .ちる花やほっとして居る太郎冠者
ro: chiru hana ya hotto shite iru tarôkaja
en:
cherry blossoms scatter--
the servant Taro
is relieved

jp: .薄月の礎しめる柳哉
ro: usu-zuki no ishizue shimeru yanagi kana
en:
holding up
the hazy moon...
willow tree

jp: .水切の本道り也土用なり
ro: mizugire no hondôri nari doyô nari
en:
the main road
dry from drought...
midsummer

jp: .雨はらはら荒鵜の親よ枝に鳴
ro: ame hara-hara ara u no oya yo eda ni naku
en:
pitter-patter rain--
a wild cormorant mother
cries on a branch

jp: .枕から外見てをるやころもがへ
ro: makura kara soto mite oru ya koromogahe
en:
from my bed
I peek outside...
new summer robes

jp: .ひとりなは我星ならん天の川
ro: hitori na wa waga hoshi naran ama [no] kawa
en:
that one by itself
is my star...
Milky Way

jp: .むら竹に夜の更過し砧哉
ro: mura take ni yo no fuke-sugoshi kinuta kana
en:
in the bamboo grove
too late at night!
pounding cloth

jp: .鴫どもも立尽したり木なし山
ro: shigi-domo mo tachi tsukushitari kinashi yama
en:
the snipes too
tired of standing...
treeless hill

jp: .段々に雁なくなるや小田の月
ro: dan-dan ni kari nakunaru ya oda no tsuki
en:
gradually the geese
pass on...
rice field moon

jp: .浦の雨ほたをふまへて見たりけり
ro: ura no ame hota wo fumaete mitari keri
en:
rain on the beach
stamping out
the wood fire

jp: .頭巾とる門はどれどれ花の春
ro: zukin toru kado wa dore-dore hana no haru
en:
removing my skullcap--
at everywhich gate
spring blossoms

jp: .身じろぎのならぬ家さへ花の春
ro: mijirogi no naranu ie sae hana no haru
en:
even at my penned-in
house...
spring blossoms

jp: .春立といふばかりでも草木哉
ro: haru tatsu to iu bakari demo kusaki kana
en:
"Spring begins"
just saying it...
green everywhere

jp: .首上て亀も待たる初日哉
ro: kubi agete kame mo machitaru hatsu hi kana
en:
stretching his neck
the turtle waits too...
the year's first day

jp: .我々が顔も初日や御代の松
ro: ware-ware ga kao mo hatsu hi ya miyo no matsu
en:
even in our faces
the year's first dawn...
the emperor's pine

jp: .薮入のわざと暮れしや草の月
ro: yabuiri no waza to kureshi ya kusa no tsuki
en:
ending the Servants' Holiday
on purpose...
sliver moon

jp: .一ぱいにはれきる山の弓始
ro: ippai ni harekiru yama no yumi hajime
en:
under a clear sky
on a mountain...
year's first archery

jp: .明ぼのの春早々に借着哉
ro: akebono no haru haya-baya ni karigi kana
en:
at dawn
I start the spring...
borrowed clothes

jp: .万歳よも一ッはやせ春の雪
ro: manzai yo mo hitotsu hayase haru no yuki
en:
begging actors
play one more song!
spring snow

jp: .釜粥を洗ふて待や野はわか菜
ro: kama-gayu wo araute matsu ya no wa wakana
en:
the gruel cauldron
all clean and ready...
herbs in the field

jp: .切株は御顔の際やわかな摘
ro: kirikabu wa o-kao no kiwa ya wakana tsumi
en:
a tree stump at the edge
of his holy face...
picking herbs

jp: .竹かごにすこしあるこそわかな哉
ro: take kago ni sukoshi aru koso wakana kana
en:
in the bamboo basket
only a bit, of course...
New Year's herbs

jp: .わか菜摘袂の下や角田川
ro: wakana tsumu tamoto no shita ya sumida-gawa
en:
into my sleeve
fresh-picked New Year's herbs...
Sumida River

jp: .君が代を鶏も諷ふや餅の臼
ro: kimi ga yo wo tori mo utau ya mochi no usu
en:
the rooster also sings
to Great Japan...
on the rice cake mill

jp: .紫の袖にちりけり春の雪
ro: murasaki no sode ni chiri keri haru no yuki
en:
scattering onto
my purple sleeves...
spring snow

jp: .北さがや春の雨夜のむかし杵
ro: kita saga ya haru no amayo no mukashi-gine
en:
Kitasaga--
in evening rain
a pestle from olden times

jp: .膳先に雀なく也春の雨
ro: zen saki ni suzume naku nari haru no ame
en:
at my dinner tray
a sparrow chirps...
spring rain

jp: .春の雨よ所の社もめづらしき
ro: haru no ame yoso no yashiro mo mezurashiki
en:
spring rain--
elsewhere the shrines
are wonderful

jp: .焼餅に烏の羽や春の雨
ro: yakimochi ni karasu no hane ya haru no ame
en:
a crow's feather
on the toasted rice cake...
spring rain

jp: .春の風草深くても古郷也
ro: haru no kaze kusa fukakute mo kokyô nari
en:
spring breeze--
though deep in the grasses
my home village

jp: .京見えてすねをもむ也春がすみ
ro: kyô miete sune wo momu nari harugasumi
en:
seeing Kyoto
I massage my shins...
spring mist

jp: .馬上から黙礼するや薄霞
ro: bajô kara mokurei suru ya usu-gasumi
en:
on horseback
making a silent bow...
thin mist

jp: .陽炎や子をなくされし鳥の顔
ro: kagerô ya ko wo nakusareshi tori no kao
en:
heat shimmers--
having lost a child
the bird's face

jp: .雪どけや麓の里の山祭
ro: yuki-doke ya fumoto no sato no yama matsuri
en:
melting snow--
at the foot of the mountain
a festival!

jp: .焚残る巣をくわへ行烏哉
ro: taki nokoru su wo kuwae yuku karasu kana
en:
saved from the fire
a nest in its beak...
the crow moves on

jp: .鶯や松にとまれば松の声
ro: uguisu ya matsu ni tomareba matsu no koe
en:
when the nightingale
moves into the pine...
voice of the pine

jp: .鶯や南は鴻の嘴たたく
ro: uguisu ya minami wa kô no hashi tataku
en:
nightingale singing--
to the south a goose
clacking

jp: .松島はどれが寝よいぞ夕雲雀
ro: matsushima wa dore ga ne yoi zo yû hibari
en:
pine islands--
which one's good for sleeping
evening lark?

jp: .夕雲雀どの松島が寝所ぞ
ro: yû hibari dono matsushima ga ne-dokoro [zo]
en:
evening lark--
which pine island's
your sleeping place?

jp: .雨だれの有明月やかへる雁
ro: amadare no ariake tsuki ya kaeru kari
en:
the dawn moon in raindrops
from the eaves...
the geese depart

jp: .行灯で飯くふ人やかへる雁
ro: andon de meshi kuu hito ya kaeru kari
en:
eating my rice
by lamplight...
the geese depart

jp: .一度見度さらしな山や帰る雁
ro: ichi do mitaki sarashina yama ya kaeru kari
en:
all eager to see
Mount Sarashina...
departing geese

jp: .小田の雁一つとなりて春いく日
ro: oda [no] kari hito[tsu] to narite haru iku hi
en:
the rice field geese
all head north...
a lucky spring day

jp: .かへる雁駅の行灯かすむ也
ro: kaeru kari umaya no ando kasumu nari
en:
geese flying north--
the stage barn's lamplight
in mist

jp: .帰る雁何を咄して行やらん
ro: kaeru kari nani wo hanashite yukuyaran
en:
departing geese
what are you
gabbing about?

jp: .帰る雁北陸道へかへる也
ro: kaeru kari hokurokudô e kaeru nari
en:
departing geese
over Hokuroku Road
departing

jp: .帰る日も一番先や寡雁
ro: kaeru hi mo ichiban saki ya yamome kari
en:
on the day of departure, too
she leads...
the widow goose

jp: .門口の行灯かすみてかへる雁
ro: kado-guchi no andon kasumite kaeru kari
en:
the gateway's lamp
in mist...
the geese depart

jp: .草の雨松の月よやかへる雁
ro: kusa no ame matsu no tsuki yo ya kaeru kari
en:
rain-drenched grass
moon in the pine...
the geese depart

jp: .かりそめの娶入月よやなく蛙
ro: karisome no yomeri tsuki yo ya naku kawazu
en:
a fleeting moonlit
wedding night...
frogs singing

jp: .つるべにも一夜過ぎけりなく蛙
ro: tsurube ni mo hito ya sugi keri naku kawazu
en:
even in the well bucket
croaking all night...
a frog

jp: .鳴ながら蛙とぶ也草の雨
ro: naki nagara kawazu tobu nari kusa no ame
en:
while croaking he jumps--
frog in the rainy
grass

jp: .桑つむや負れし柿も手を出して
ro: kuwa tsumu ya owareshi kaki mo te wo dashite
en:
picking mulberry leaves--
the baby on her back
stretches a hand

jp: .細腕に桑の葉しごく雨夜哉
ro: hoso ude ni kuwa no ha shigoku amayo kana
en:
with thin arms
stripping mulberry leaves...
night rain

jp: .夕暮を待つ人いくら藤の花
ro: yûgure wo matsu hito ikura fuji no hana
en:
how many people
waiting for evening?
wisteria in bloom

jp: .あながちに留主とも見へず梅の花
ro: anagachi ni rusu to mo miezu ume [no] tuski
en:
it seems likely
someone's at home...
plum blossoms

jp: .梅さけど鶯なけどひとり哉
ro: ume sakedo uguisu nakedo hitori kana
en:
plum trees bloom
nightingales sing...
all alone

jp: .梅の月花の表は下水也
ro: ume no tsuki hana no omote wa gesui nari
en:
plum moon--
facing the blossoms
sewer water

jp: .梅一枝とる人を待ゆふべ哉
ro: ume hito e toru hito wo matsu yûbe kana
en:
a branch of blooming plum
awaits the thief...
evening

jp: .梅守に舌切らるるなむら雀
ro: ume mori ni shita kiraruru na mura suzume
en:
don't let the plum blossom guard
cut your tongues...
sparrows!

jp: .片枝の待遠しさよ梅の花
ro: kata eda no machi-dôshisa yo ume [no] hana
en:
waiting so long
for just one branch...
plum blossoms

jp: .かつしかに知人いくら梅の花
ro: katsushika ni shiru hito ikura ume no hana
en:
in Katsushika
how many connoisseurs!
plum blossoms

jp: .草分の貧乏家や梅の花
ro: kusawake no bimbô ie ya ume [no] hana
en:
at his house
though he's dirt-poor...
plum blossoms

jp: .手をかけて人の顔見て梅の花
ro: te wo kakete hito no kao mite ume no hana
en:
laying my hands on them
suddenly, a face...
plum blossoms

jp: .火種なき家を守るや梅の花
ro: hidane naki ie wo mamoru ya ume [no] hana
en:
guarding a house
with no live coals...
plum blossoms

jp: .梟がさきがけしたり梅の花
ro: fukurô ga sakigake shitari ume no hana
en:
the owl
sees them first...
plum blossoms

jp: .松間にひとりすまして梅の花
ro: matsu ai ni hitori sumashite ume no hana
en:
among the pines
all alone
a plum tree blooms

jp: .娶貰ふ時分となるや梅の花
ro: yome morau jibun to naru ya ume no hana
en:
tis the season
for taking a wife...
plum blossoms

jp: .あたら雨の昼ふりにけり花の山
ro: atara ame no hiru furi ni keri hana no yama
en:
a harsh rain
falls at noon...
blossoming mountain

jp: .方脇に息をころして花見哉
ro: kata waki ni iki wo koroshite hanami kana
en:
off to one side
they're breath-taking...
blossom viewing

jp: .としよりの追従わらひや花の陰
ro: toshiyori no tsuisho warai ya hana no kage
en:
an old man's
flattering laughter...
blossom shade

jp: .花の雲あれが大和の臣下哉
ro: hana no kumo are ga yamato no shinka kana
en:
blossom clouds--
the loyal retainers
of Old Japan

jp: .夕暮や鳥とる鳥の花に来る
ro: yûgure ya tori toru tori no hana ni kuru
en:
evening--
a bird of prey flies home
into blossoms

jp: .翌の分に一山残す桜哉
ro: asu no bu ni hito yama nokosu sakura kana
en:
by tomorrow
one mountain left...
cherry blossoms

jp: .安元の比の桜哉夕の鐘
ro: angen no koro no sakura ya yû no kane
en:
an ancient cherry tree
in bloom...
evening bell

jp: .暖国の麦も見えけり山桜
ro: dangoku no mugi no mie keri yama-zakura
en:
in a warm province
you see barley...
mountain cherry blossoms

jp: .一足も踏せぬ山の桜哉
ro: hito ashi mo fumasenu yama no sakura kana
en:
a mountain where
no foot has stepped...
cherry blossoms

jp: .人に喰れし桜咲也みよしの山
ro: hito ni kuwareshi sakura saku nari mi-yoshino yama
en:
these cherry blossoms
people eat...
Yoshino Hill

jp: .山桜きのふちりけり江戸の客
ro: yama-zakura kinou chiri keri edo no kyaku
en:
the mountain cherry blossoms
fell yesterday...
visitors from Edo

jp: .夕桜家ある人はとくかへる
ro: yûzakura ie aru hito wa toku kaeru
en:
evening cherry blossoms--
people with homes
hurry home

jp: .祈りしはしらぬ里也桃の花
ro: ino[rishi] wa shiranu sato nari momo no hana
en:
for the strange village
a prayer...
peach blossoms

jp: .青柳の先見ゆるぞや角田川
ro: ao yagi no mazu miyu[ru] zo ya sumida-gawa
en:
green willows
are the first thing seen...
Sumida River

jp: .是からは大日本と柳哉
ro: kore kara wa dainippon to yanagi kana
en:
from here on
it's Great Japan!
willow trees

jp: .六月の空さへ二十九日哉
ro: rokugatsu no sora sae ni jû kyû  hi kana
en:
it's still
a Sixth Month sky...
summer's last day

jp: .短夜の門にうれしき榎哉
ro: mijika yo no kado ni ureshiki enoki kana
en:
short summer night--
at the gate a happy
nettle tree

jp: .短夜の鹿の顔出す垣ね哉
ro: mijika yo no shika no kao dasu kakine kana
en:
short summer night--
a deer pokes his face
through the fence

jp: .涼しさは黒節だけの小川哉
ro: suzushisa wa kuro-bushi dake no ko-gawa kana
en:
such cool air!
just ankle-deep
the little river

jp: .木末から土用に入し月よ哉
ro: kozue kara doyô ni irishi tsuki yo kana
en:
from the treetop
gliding into midsummer...
bright moon

jp: .寝心や膝の上なる土用雲
ro: negokoro ya hiza no ue naru doyôgumo
en:
tucking me in
they cover my lap...
midsummer clouds

jp: .家一つ蔦と成りけり五月雨
ro: ie hitotsu tsuta to nari keri satsuki ame
en:
the house has become
one heap of ivy...
Fifth Month rain

jp: .五月雨の竹に隠るる在所哉
ro: samidare no take ni kakururu zaisho kana
en:
in Fifth Month rain
hidden by bamboo...
farmhouse

jp: .五月雨や二階住居の草の花
ro: samidare ya ni kai sumai no kusa no hana
en:
Fifth Month rain--
the second floor room
has wildflowers!

jp: .二階から見る木末迄五月雨
ro: ni kai kara miru kozue made satsuki ame
en:
even the branches
viewed from the second floor...
Fifth Month rain

jp: .川縁ははや月夜也雲の峰
ro: kawa-beri [wa] haya tsuki yo nari kumo no mine
en:
on the river's bank
already it's a moonlit night...
billowing clouds

jp: .雲の峰いささか松が退くか
ro: kumo no mine isasaka matsu ga shirizoku ka
en:
billowing clouds--
have the pine trees
shrunk a bit?

jp: .雲の峰の下から出たる小舟哉
ro: kumo no mine no shita kara detaru kobune kana
en:
emerging under
the peaks of clouds...
a little boat

jp: .しばらくは枕の上や雲の峰
ro: shibaruku wa makura no ue ya kumo no mine
en:
for the moment
straight above my pillow...
billowing clouds

jp: .あれ程の中洲跡なし夏の月
ro: arehodo no nakasu ato nashi natsu no tsuki
en:
a vast river island
gone without a trace...
summer moon

jp: .夏の月と申すも一夜二夜哉
ro: natsu no tsuki to môsu mo hito yo futa yo kana
en:
a so-called "summer moon"
one night
two nights...

jp: .なりどしの隣の梨や夏の月
ro: naridoshi no tonari no nashi ya natsu no tsuki
en:
a big crop
for my neighbor's pear tree...
summer moon

jp: .痩松も奢がましや夏の月
ro: yase matsu mo ogori ga mashi ya natsu no tsuki
en:
the scrawny pine, too
looks extravagant...
summer moon

jp: .たまたまに晴れば闇よ夏の山
ro: tama-tama ni hareba yami yo natsu no yama
en:
finally a clear sky
yet no moon...
summer mountain

jp: .夏山や一足づつに海見ゆる
ro: natsu yama ya hito ashi zutsu ni umi miyuru
en:
summer mountain--
with each step more
of the sea

jp: .空腹に雷ひびく夏野哉
ro: sukibara ni kaminari hibiku natsu no kana
en:
a rumble of thunder
in my empty stomach...
summer field

jp: .あさら井の今めかぬ也夏花つみ
ro: asara i no ima mekanu nari gebana tsumi
en:
the shallow well
loses its finery...
picking summer flowers

jp: .えた町に見おとされたる幟哉
ro: eta machi ni miotosaretaru nobori kana
en:
in the outcasts' village
easily overlooked...
summer banners

jp: .川狩のうしろ明りの木立哉
ro: kawagari no ushiro akari no kodachi kana
en:
behind the night fishing
light
in a grove

jp: .むら雨の北と東に夜川哉
ro: murusame no kita to higashi ni yo kawa kana
en:
rain showers
to the north and east...
fishing the night river

jp: .大名のなでてやりけり馬の汗
ro: daimyô no nadete yari keri uma no ase
en:
the great lord
does the brushing...
horse's sweat

jp: .飴ン棒横に加へて初袷
ro: amenbô yoko ni kuwaete hatsu awase
en:
chewing the side
of her candy stick...
summer kimono

jp: .常体の笠は似合ぬ袷哉
ro: tsunetei no kasa wa niawanu awase kana
en:
my everyday umbrella-hat
doesn't match it...
summer kimono

jp: .青山を始て見たる日傘哉
ro: aoyama wo hajimete mitaru higasa kana
en:
seeing the green mountain
for the first time...
ladies with parasols

jp: .木母寺が見ゆる見ゆると日傘哉
ro: mokuboji ga miyuru miyuru to higasa kana
en:
I see Mokubo Temple
I see ladies
with parasols

jp: .門々も雨ははれけり青すだれ
ro: kado-gado mo ame wa hare keri ao sudare
en:
gate after gate
the rain has cleared...
green bamboo blinds

jp: .風吹や穴だらけでも我蚊帳
ro: kaze fuku ya ana darake demo waga kachô
en:
wind blows--
lots of rips, yet still
my mosquito net

jp: .糊こはき帷子かぶる昼寝哉
ro: nori kowaki katabira kaburu hirune kana
en:
his starched summer
robe his blanket...
siesta

jp: .青い柳に任せて出たる扇哉
ro: aoyagi ni makasete detaru ôgi [kana]
en:
entrusting it
to the green willow...
my paper fan

jp: .あさ陰に関も越えたる扇哉
ro: asa kage ni kan mo koetaru ôgi kana
en:
in morning shadows
he passes through the barrier gate...
with paper fan

jp: .雨三粒はらって過し扇哉
ro: ame mi tsubu haratte sugishi ôgi kana
en:
sweeping off three drops
of rain in passing...
paper fan

jp: .海の月扇かぶって寝たりけり
ro: umi no tsuki ôgi kabutte netari keri
en:
moon on the sea--
he's under his fan
sleeping

jp: .朝顔に老づら居て団扇哉
ro: asagao ni oi-zura suete uchiwa kana
en:
my old face rests
in morning-glories...
fanning my paper fan

jp: .うつくしき団扇持けり未亡人
ro: utsukushiki uchiwa mochi keri mibôjin
en:
holding
such a pretty fan...
the widow

jp: .風下の蘭に月さす蚊やり哉
ro: kaza shimo no ran ni tsuki sasu ka yari kana
en:
downwind, an orchid
in moonlight...
smudge pot smoke

jp: .富士おろし又吹け吹けと蚊やり哉
ro: fuji oroshi mata fuke fuke to kayari kana
en:
descending Mount Fuji
blow! blow!
smudge pot smoke

jp: .餅音の西に東に蚊やり哉
ro: mochi oto no nishi ni higashi ni kayari kana
en:
pounding rice cakes
to the west, to the east
smudge pots

jp: .行灯を持ってかたづく涼み哉
ro: andon wo motte katazuku suzumi kana
en:
holding a lantern
tidying up...
evening cool

jp: .一尺の竹に毎晩涼み哉
ro: isshaku no take ni maiban suzumi kana
en:
in the foot-tall bamboo
night after night...
cool air

jp: .噂すれば鴫の立けり夕涼み
ro: uwasa sureba shigi no tachi keri yûsuzumi
en:
speak of the devil!
a snipe takes flight...
evening cool

jp: .木一本畠一枚夕涼み
ro: ki ippon hatake ichi mai yûsuzumi
en:
one tree
one farmer's field...
evening cool

jp: .さわってもとがむる木也夕涼み
ro: sawatte mo togamuru ki nari yûsuzumi
en:
even if I touch her
this tree rejects me...
evening cool

jp: .死跡の松をも植てゆふ涼み
ro: shini ato no matsu wo mo uete yûsuzumi
en:
planting a pine too
for after I die...
evening cool

jp: .近よれば祟る榎ぞゆふ涼み
ro: chika yoreba tataru enoki zo yûsuzumi
en:
if you get too close
the nettle tree will curse you!
evening cool

jp: .松苗ややがて他人のゆふ涼み
ro: matsu nae ya yagate tanin no yûsuzumi
en:
pine sapling--
before long, strangers enjoy
evening's cool

jp: .行過て茨の中よゆふ涼み
ro: yukisugite ibara no naka yo yûsuzumi
en:
going too far
into the thick of thorns...
evening cool

jp: .夜涼のやくそくありし門の月
ro: yo suzumi no yakusoku arishi kado no tsuki
en:
keeping her appointment
to enjoy evening's cool air...
moon at the gate

jp: .住来の人にすれたる鹿の子哉
ro: waurai no hito ni suretaru ka [no] ko kana
en:
brazen with people
who come and go...
fawn

jp: .傘の下にしばらくかのこ哉
ro: karakasa no shita ni shibaraku kanoko kana
en:
lingering
under the paper umbrella...
a fawn

jp: .暁のむぎの先よりほととぎす
ro: akatsuki no mugi no saki yori hototogisu
en:
dawn--
from atop the wheat
"cuckoo!"

jp: .下枝に子も口真ねや閑古鳥
ro: shita eda ni ko mo kuchi [ma]ne ya kankodori
en:
on a low branch
a child's imitation...
mountain cuckoo

jp: .はいかいの地獄のそこか閑古鳥
ro: haikai no jigoku no soko ka kankodori
en:
so is haiku hell
over that-a-way...
mountain cuckoo?

jp: .樅からも二つなきけりかんこ鳥
ro: momi kara mo futatsu naki keri kankodori
en:
from the fir tree too
two are singing...
mountain cuckoos

jp: .行々し尋ねる牛は吼へもせず
ro: gyôgyôshi tazune[ru] ushi wa hoe mo sezu
en:
reed thrush--
the cow doesn't answer
his question

jp: .蚊を殺す紙燭にうつる白髪哉
ro: ka wo korosu shishoku ni utsuru shiraga kana
en:
lit by the mosquito-murdering
taper...
my white hair

jp: .蚊一ッの一日さはぐ枕哉
ro: ka hitotsu no ichi nichi sawagu makura kana
en:
a mosquito
all day it whines...
by my pillow

jp: .宵越しのとうふ明りや蚊のさわぐ
ro: yoigoshi no tôfu akari ya ka no sawagu
en:
left out all night
the tofu gleams...
mosquitoes whisper

jp: .蝿一つ打ては山を見たりけり
ro: hae hitotsu utte wa yama wo mitari keri
en:
swatting a fly
looking at
a mountain

jp: .草の蚤はらはらもどる火かげ哉
ro: kusa no nomi hara-hara modoru hokage kana
en:
the grasses' fleas
pitter-patter move...
lamplight's shade

jp: .浮島やうごきながらの蝉時雨
ro: uki-jima ya ugoki nagara no semi shigure
en:
while the floating island
moves along...
cicada chorus

jp: .夕顔の長者になるぞ星見たら
ro: yûgao no chôja ni naru zo hoshi mitara
en:
the moonflowers
strike it rich!
the stars

jp: .夕顔やひとつひとつに風さわぐ
ro: yûgao ya hitotsu hitotsu ni kaze sawagu
en:
moonflowers--
one by one the wind
rustles them

jp: .陽炎のおびただしさやけしの花
ro: kagerô no obitadashisa ya keshi no hana
en:
heat shimmers
on top of heat shimmers...
poppies

jp: .けっくして松の日まけや芥子の花
ro: kekku shite matsu no hi make ya keshi [no] hana
en:
the tall pines
end up sunburned
O poppies!

jp: .咲く日より雨に逢けりけしの花
ro: saku hi yori ame ni ai keri keshi no hana
en:
from the day they bloomed
drenched by rain...
poppies

jp: .兵が足の跡ありけしの花
ro: tsuwamono ga ashi no ato ari keshi no hana
en:
in the footprints
of the warrior...
poppies

jp: .門番がほまちなるべしけしの花
ro: monban ga homachi naru-beshi keshi no hana
en:
the gatekeeper's
side-field...
let the poppies bloom!

jp: .暁に人気も見へぬはらす哉
ro: akatsuki ni hitoke mo mienu harasu kana
en:
at dawn
not a soul in sight...
lotus blossoms

jp: .白蓮に二筋三すじ柳哉
ro: shiro hasu ni ni suji san suji yanagi kana
en:
in the white lotuses
two or three strands
of willow

jp: .せせなぎの樋の口迄蓮の花
ro: sesenagi no toi no kuchi made hasu no hana
en:
even in the mouth
of the gutter pipe...
lotuses

jp: .蓮の香をうしろにしたり岡の家
ro: hasu no ka wo ushiro ni shitari oka no ie
en:
the scent of lotuses
in the back
house on a hill

jp: .山松に吹つけられし百合の花
ro: yama matsu ni fukitsukerareshi yuri [no] hana
en:
against the mountain pine
they're blown...
lilies

jp: .我見ても久しき蟾や百合の花
ro: ware mite mo hisashiki hiki ya yuri [no] hana
en:
staring at me
on and on...
toad in the lilies

jp: .浮草の花より低き通りかな
ro: ukikusa no hana yori hikuki tôri kana
en:
duckweed blooms--
and below that
a street

jp: .浮草や黒い小蝶のひらひらと
ro: ukikusa ya kuroi ko chô no hira-hira to
en:
duckweed--
a little black butterfly
flitting

jp: .麦刈の不二見所の榎哉
ro: mugi kari no fuji mi-dokoro no enoki kana
en:
a Mount Fuji viewing spot
for barley harvesters...
nettle tree

jp: .山水の溝にあまるや田麦刈
ro: yama mizu no mizo ni amaru ya ta mugi kari
en:
leftovers in the mountain
spring's ditch...
barley harvest

jp: .麦刈の用捨もなしやことし竹
ro: mugi kari no yôsha mo nashi ya kotoshi take
en:
the barley harvesters
show no mercy...
young bamboo

jp: .わか竹の起きんとすれば電り
ro: waka take no okin to sureba inabikari
en:
just when the young bamboo
starts to straighten...
lightning

jp: .おくればせに我が畠も茄子哉
ro: okurebase ni ware ga hatake mo nasubi kana
en:
also running late--
my garden's
eggplants

jp: .苗売の通る跡より初なすび
ro: naeuri no tôru ato yori hatsu nasubi
en:
growing where
the seedling seller passed...
first eggplant

jp: .も一日葉陰に見たき茄子哉
ro: mo ichi nichi ha kage ni mitaki nasubi kana
en:
one more day
of leafy shade for you...
eggplant

jp: .駒つなぐ門の杭にわか葉哉
ro: koma tsunagu kado no kuize ni wakaba kana
en:
on the gate's post
where the pony is tied...
fresh green leaves

jp: .大蛇の二日目につく茂り哉
ro: ôhebi no futsukame ni tsuku shigeri kana
en:
for the second day
the same big snake...
thick summer grasses

jp: .日々に四五本ちるや合歓の花
ro: nichi-nichi ni shi go hon chiru ya nemu no hana
en:
every day
four or five fall...
Sleeping Tree's blossoms

jp: .青梅に蟻の思ひも通じけん
ro: aoume ni ari no omoi mo tsûjiken
en:
the green plum
also accepts the feeling
of the ant

jp: .探る梅枝の蛙のをしげ也
ro: saguru ume eda no kawazu no oshige nari
en:
groping for plums--
the frog on the branch
is magnanimous

jp: .秋寒や行く先々は人の家
ro: akisamu ya yuku saki-zaki wa hito no ie
en:
autumn cold--
wherever I go people
have homes

jp: .朝寒にとんじゃくもなき稲葉哉
ro: asa-zamu ni tonjaku mo naki inaba kana
en:
paying no heed
to morning's cold...
shoots of rice

jp: .念入て竹を見る人朝寒き
ro: nen irete take wo miru hito asa samuki
en:
he checks the bamboo
with concern...
morning cold

jp: .殻俵たたいて見たる夜寒哉
ro: kara tawara tataite mitaru yozamu kana
en:
beating the empty
straw bag--nothing!
a cold night

jp: .よりかかる度に冷つく柱哉
ro: yorikakaru tabi ni hiyatsuku hashira kana
en:
while leaning on it
it's turned chilly...
the post

jp: .一つなくは親なし鳥よ秋の暮
ro: hitotsu naku wa oya nashi tori yo aki no kure
en:
alone he cries
the motherless bird...
autumn dusk

jp: .我植し松も老けり秋の暮
ro: waga ueshi matsu mo oi keri aki no kure
en:
even the pine tree
I planted grows old!
autumn dusk

jp: .ばか長き夜と申したる夜永哉
ro: baka nagaki yo to môshitaru yonaga kana
en:
"It's a foolishly long
night!" I say
in the long night

jp: .耳際に松風の噴く夜永哉
ro: mimi-giwa ni matsu kaze no fuku yonaga kana
en:
the pine wind
blows in my ear...
a long night

jp: .天の川都のうつけ泣やらん
ro: ama [no] kawa miyako no utsuke naku yaran
en:
Milky Way--
maybe the fools of Kyoto
are crying

jp: .雲形に寝て見たりけり天の川
ro: kumogata ni nete mitari keri ama [no] kawa
en:
a cloud zigzags
above where I lie...
Milky Way

jp: .汁なべもながめられけり天の川
ro: shiru nabe mo nagamerare keri ama [no] kawa
en:
a clear view
in the soup kettle...
Milky Way

jp: .深さうな所もありけり天の川
ro: fuka sôna toko mo ari keri ama no kawa
en:
some places up there
look deep...
Milky Way

jp: .我星はどこに旅寝や天の川
ro: waga hoshi wa doko ni tabine ya ama no kawa
en:
where will my star
stop for the night?
Milky Way

jp: .投られし角力も交じる月よ哉
ro: nagarareshi sumô mo majiru tsuki yo kana
en:
the defeated wrestler, too
joins the crowd...
bright moon

jp: .西向て小便もせぬ月よ哉
ro: nishi muite shôben mo senu tsuki yo kana
en:
no westward facing
pissing tonight...
bright moon

jp: .名月は翌と成けり夜の雨
ro: meigetsu wa asu to nari keri yoru no ame
en:
the harvest moon
comes tomorrow...
evening rain

jp: .草の雨松の月夜や十五日
ro: kusa no ame matsu no tsuki yo ya jû go nichi
en:
rain in the grass
moon in the pine...
night of the 15th

jp: .白石のしろき心の月見哉
ro: shira ishi no shiroki kokoro no tsukimi kana
en:
on the white rock's
white heart...
moon gazing

jp: .名月もそなたの空ぞ毛唐人
ro: meigetsu mo sonata no sora zo ketôjin
en:
harvest moon
up in that sky...
for foreigners, too!

jp: .刈株のうしろの水や秋日和
ro: karikabu no ushiro no mizu ya akibiyori
en:
there's water
beyond the stubble...
clear fall weather

jp: .秋雨やともしびうつる膝頭
ro: akisame ya tomoshibi utsuru hizagashira
en:
autumn rain--
the lamplight lights
my knees

jp: .秋の雨つい夜に入し榎哉
ro: aki no ame tsui yo ni irishi enoki kana
en:
autumn rain--
night begins now
for the nettle tree

jp: .馬の子の故郷はなるる秋の雨
ro: uma no ko no kokyô hanaruru aki no ame
en:
the pony leaves
his home village...
autumn rain

jp: .片袖の風冷つくや秋の雨
ro: kata sode no kaze hiya tsuku ya aki no ame
en:
the wind chills
one sleeve...
autumn rain

jp: .喰捨の瓜のわか葉や秋の雨
ro: kui sute no uri no wakaba ya aki no ame
en:
the half-eaten melon's
young green leaf...
autumn rain

jp: .口明て親待つ鳥や秋の雨
ro: kuchi akete oya matsu tori ya aki no ame
en:
its mouth open
waiting for mother...
baby bird in the autumn rain

jp: .田の雁の古郷いかに秋の雨
ro: ta no kari no furusato ika ni aki no ame
en:
what's your home village like
rice field goose?
autumn rain

jp: .膝節に灯のちらめくや秋の雨
ro: hizabushi ni hi no chirameku ya aki [no] ame
en:
lamplight glimmers
on my knees...
autumn rain

jp: .ひょろ長き草四五本に秋の雨
ro: hyoronaga[ki] kusa shi go [hon] ni aki no ame
en:
on four or five
slender blades of grass
autumn rain

jp: .松の木も在所めきけり秋の雨
ro: matsu no ki mo zaisho-meki keri aki no ame
en:
even the pine tree
looks rustic...
autumn rain

jp: .秋の風親なきに我を吹そぶり
ro: aki no kaze oyanaki ni ware wo fuku soburi
en:
the autumn wind
blows as if it knows
I'm an orphan

jp: .大根の二葉うれしや秋の風
ro: daikon no futaba ureshi [ya] aki no kaze
en:
two leaves of radish
rejoice!
autumn wind

jp: .一人づつ皆去にけり秋の風
ro: hitori-zutsu mina sari ni keri aki no kaze
en:
one by one
everyone has left...
autumn wind

jp: .夕月のけばけばしさを秋の風
ro: yûzuki no kebakebashisa wo aki no kaze
en:
shining up
the evening moon...
autumn wind

jp: .露けさや石の下より草の花
ro: tsuyukesa ya ishi no shita yori kusa no hana
en:
humidity--
from beneath a stone
wildflowers

jp: .露けしや草一本も秋の体
ro: tsuyukeshi ya kusa ippon mo aki no tei
en:
humidity--
even one blade of grass
is autumn

jp: .大名の笠にもかかる夜露哉
ro: daimyô no kasa ni mo kakaru yo tsuyu kana
en:
clinging to the lord's
umbrella-hat too...
evening dew

jp: .同じ年の顔の皺見ゆる灯籠哉
ro: onaji toshi no kao no shiwa miyuru tôro kana
en:
a wrinkled face
he's my age...
lanterns for the dead

jp: .灯籠やきのふの瓦けふ葎
ro: tôrô ya kinou no kawara kyô mugura
en:
Bon lanterns--
yesterday's tiles
today are weeds

jp: .盆灯籠三ッ二ッ見てやめにけり
ro: bon tôro mitsu futatsu mite yame ni keri
en:
stopping to watch
three, two...
lanterns for the dead

jp: .松陰におどらぬ人の白さ哉
ro: matsu kage ni odoranu hito no shirosa kana
en:
in pine-tree shade
the one who doesn't dance
ivory white

jp: .かぢのをとは耳を離れず星今よい
ro: kaji no oto wa mimi wo hanarezu hoshi ko yoi
en:
the sound of oars
lingers...
good stars tonight

jp: .かはがりの煙もとどけ星今よひ
ro: kawagari no kemuri mo todoke hoshi ko yoi
en:
for the fisherman's
rising smoke too...
good stars tonight

jp: .七夕や大和は男三分一
ro: tanabata ya yamato wa otoko san bun ichi
en:
Tanabata in Great Japan--
one out of three
are male

jp: .けふぎりの入日さしけり勝角力
ro: kyôgiri no irihi sashi keri kachi sumô
en:
the sun sets
on the tournament...
sumo champion

jp: .正面は親の顔也まけ角力
ro: shômen wa oya no kao nari make-zumô
en:
sitting in front
his father's face...
defeated wrestler

jp: .案山子にもうしろ向かれし栖哉
ro: kagashi ni mo ushiro mukareshi sumika kana
en:
even the scarecrow
turns his back to it...
my home

jp: .川音や鳴子の音や明近き
ro: kawa oto ya naruko no oto ya ake chikaki
en:
sound of river
sound of bird clapper...
daybreak is near

jp: .赤兀の山の贔屓や遠ぎぬた
ro: akahage no yama no hiiki ya tô-ginuta
en:
favoring
Mount Akahage...
distant cloth-pounding

jp: .片耳は尾上の鐘や小夜砧
ro: kata mimi wa onoe no kane ya sayo-ginuta
en:
in one ear a bell
on the ridge, someone pounding cloth
in the night

jp: .砧打夜より雨ふる榎哉
ro: kinuta utsu yo yori ame furu enoki kana
en:
pounding cloth
in the night...
rain on the nettle tree

jp: .口も手も人並でなし小夜砧
ro: kuchi mo te mo hitonami de nashi sayo-ginuta
en:
her mouth and hands
not like everyone's...
pounding cloth at night

jp: .洪水は去年のけふ也小夜砧
ro: kôzui wa kozo no kyô nari sayo-ginuta
en:
the flood was exactly
a year ago...
pounding cloth at night

jp: .更しなの蕎麦の主や小夜砧
ro: sarashina no soba no aruji ya sayo-ginuta
en:
the lord of Sarashina's
buckwheat fields...
pounding cloth at night

jp: .更しなや闇き方には小夜砧
ro: sarashina ya kuraki hô ni wa sayo-ginuta
en:
Sarashina--
in a dark direction
night cloth-pounding

jp: .昼中の須磨の秋也遠砧
ro: hiruchû no suma no aki nari tôginuta
en:
this afternoon in Suma
autumn begins...
distant cloth-pounding

jp: .小男鹿の角引っかけし葎哉
ro: saoshika no tsuno hikkakeshi mugura kana
en:
dangling from
the young buck's antler
weeds

jp: .小烏にあなどられたり小田の雁
ro: ko karasu ni anadoraretari oda no kari
en:
the little crow
is snubbed...
rice field geese

jp: .殺されにことしも来たよ小田の雁
ro: korosare ni kotoshi mo kita yo oda no kari
en:
another year
they're back for the massacre...
rice field geese

jp: .殺されに南へ行か天つ雁
ro: korosare ni minami e yuku ka amatsu kari
en:
flying south
for the slaughter?
celestial geese

jp: .一群は今来た顔や小田の雁
ro: hito mure wa ima kita kao ya oda [no] kari
en:
a new face
in the flock...
rice field geese

jp: .又来たら我家忘れな行燕
ro: mata kitara waga ya wasure na yuku tsubame
en:
when you return
don't forget my house!
departing swallows

jp: .人の世も我もよし也とぶいなご
ro: hito no yo mo waga mo yoshi nari tobu inago
en:
"The world of man
and me are good!"
locusts fly

jp: .捨られし夜より雨ふるきりぎりす
ro: suterareshi yo yori ame furu kirigirisu
en:
after a wasted night
the rain falls...
katydid

jp: .けふも死に近き入りて草の花
ro: kyô mo shinu ni chikaki irite kusa no hana
en:
today again
death draws nearer...
the wildflowers

jp: .染総のつっぱりとれて菊の花
ro: somefusa no tsuppari torete kiku no hana
en:
their many colors
fade so soon...
chrysanthemums

jp: .朝顔のこく咲にけりよ所の家
ro: asagao no koku saki ni keri yoso no ie
en:
morning-glories
blooming thick...
someone else's house

jp: .朝顔やしたたかぬれし通り雨
ro: asagao ya shitataka nureshi tôri ame
en:
morning-glories
utterly drenched...
a passing rain

jp: .松の蔦紅葉してから伐られけり
ro: matsu no tsuta momiji shite kara kirare keri
en:
pine's ivy--
after leaves turn red
cut down

jp: .御馬の屁ながれけり萩の花
ro: on-uma no he nagare keri hagi no hana
en:
Sir Horse's fart
wafting over...
blooming bush clover

jp: .神風のはや吹給ふ稲葉哉
ro: kamikaze no haya fuki tamau inaba kana
en:
the divine wind
blows a blessing...
spears of rice

jp: .大豚の顔出しけり芦の花
ro: ôbuta no kao idashi keri ashi no hana
en:
a big pig
sticks out his face...
blooming rushes

jp: .川下は知識の門よ夕紅葉
ro: kawa shimo wa chishiki no kado yo yûmomiji
en:
downstream, the gate
to knowledge...
evening's red leaves

jp: .ふまぬ地をふむ心也夕紅葉
ro: fumanu chi wo fumu kokoro nari yûmomiji
en:
trodding untrodden
earth to see...
evening's red leaves

jp: .人去って行灯きえて桐一葉
ro: hito satte andon kiete kiri hito ha
en:
people have gone
lanterns have died...
one leaf remains

jp: .手の前に蝶の息つく茸哉
ro: te no mae ni chô no ikitsuku kinoko kana
en:
it's all yours
butterfly, take a rest
on the mushroom

jp: .けろけろと師走月よの榎哉
ro: kero-kero to shiwasu-zuki yo no enoki kana
en:
keeping his cool
under a Twelfth Month moon...
nettle tree

jp: .旅の空師走も二十九日哉
ro: tabi no sora shiwasu mo ni jû ku nichi kana
en:
a traveler's sky--
Twelfth Month
29th day

jp: .降雨の中に寒の入にけり
ro: furu ame no naka ni mo kan no iri ni keri
en:
even from falling rain
stabbing
cold

jp: .掌に酒飯けぶる寒さ哉
ro: tenohira ni sakameshi keburu samu[sa] kana
en:
palms
in the cooking smoke
winter cold

jp: .流れ木のアチコチとしてとし暮ぬ
ro: nagare-gi no achi-kochi to shite toshi kurenu
en:
driftwood floating
this way, that way...
ends the year

jp: .片壁に海手の風や冬の月
ro: kata kabe ni umite no kaze ya fuyu no tsuki
en:
over one wall
the sea wind blows...
winter moon

jp: .冬の月さしかかりけりうしろ窓
ro: fuyu no tsuki sashikakari keri ushiro mado
en:
the winter moon
hanging over...
back window

jp: .冬の月膝元に出る山家哉
ro: fuyu no tsuki hizamoto ni deru yamaga kana
en:
the winter moon
on my lap...
mountain home

jp: .古郷に高い杉ありはつしぐれ
ro: furusato ni takai sugi ari hatsu shigure
en:
cedars are tall
in my hometown...
first winter rain

jp: .初時雨馬も御紋をきたりけり
ro: hatsu shigure uma mo o-mon wo kitari keri
en:
first winter rain--
even the warlord's horse
wears his crest

jp: .一時に二ッ時雨し山家哉
ro: ittoki ni futatsu shigureshi yamaga kana
en:
right away
a second winter rainfall...
mountain home

jp: .北時雨火をたく顔のきなくさき
ro: kita shigure hi wo taku kao no kinakusaki
en:
cold northern rain--
the fire-starter's face
smells burnt

jp: .けぶり立隣の家を時雨哉
ro: keburi tatsu tonari no ie wo shigure kana
en:
on the neighbor's house
where smoke rises...
winter rain

jp: .しぐるるや牛に引かれて善光寺
ro: shigururu ya ushi ni hikarete zenkôji
en:
winter rain--
led by a cow
to Zenko Temple

jp: .吹かれ吹かれ時雨来にけり痩男
ro: fukare fukare shigure ki ni keri yase otoko
en:
windblown here they come--
the winter rain
the thin man

jp: .山の家たがひ違ひに時雨哉
ro: yama no ie tagai chigai ni shigure kana
en:
mountain house--
it's off, it's on
the winter rain

jp: .夕時雨馬も古郷へ向てなく
ro: yû shigure uma mo furusato e muite naku
en:
rainy winter night--
the horse neighs too
toward his home village

jp: .夕時雨すっくり立や田鶴
ro: yûshigure sukkuri tatsu ya ta tsuru
en:
evening of winter rain--
a rice field crane
stands tall

jp: .夜時雨の顔を見せけり親の門
ro: yo shigure no kao wo mise keri oya no kado
en:
in night's winter rain
a face...
his parents' gate

jp: .我上にふりし時雨や上総山
ro: waga ue ni furishi shiture ya kazusa yama
en:
winter rain
pouring down on me...
Kazusa mountains

jp: .時雨雲毎日かかる榎哉
ro: shigure-gumo mainichi kakaru enoki kana
en:
winter raincloud
every day snagged
in the nettle tree

jp: .三度くふ旅もったいな時雨雲
ro: san do kuu tabi mottaina shigure-gumo
en:
three meals a day
this trip, living large!
winter storm clouds

jp: .風寒し寒し寒しと瓦灯哉
ro: kaze samushi samushi samushi to gwatô kana
en:
"The wind
is cold! cold! cold!"
ceramic lamp

jp: .木がらしの夜に入かかる榎哉
ro: kogarashi no yo ni irikakaru enoki kana
en:
settling into a night
of winter wind...
nettle tree

jp: .木がらしや鋸屑けぶる辻の家
ro: kogarashi ya ogakuzu keburu tsuji no ie
en:
winter wind--
smoke from a sawdust fire
house at the crossroads

jp: .木がらしや門に見えたる小行灯
ro: kogarashi ya kado ni mietaru ko andon
en:
winter wind--
looking in the gate
with a little lantern

jp: .木がらしや壁の際なる馬の桶
ro: kogarashi ya kabe no kiwa naru ume no oke
en:
winter wind--
on the wall's ledge
the horse's bucket

jp: .初雪に聞おじしたる翁哉
ro: hatsu yuki ni kiku ojishitaru okina kana
en:
hearing of first snow
a dreadful thing...
old man

jp: .初雪のふはふはかかる小鬢哉
ro: hatsu yuki no fuwa-fuwa kakaru kobin kana
en:
the first snow
softly, softly clings...
side lock of hair

jp: .海音は塀の北也夜の雪
ro: umi oto wa hei no kita nari yoru no yuki
en:
sound of the ocean
north of the fence...
night snow

jp: .真昼の草にふる也たびら雪
ro: mappiru no kusa ni furu nari tabira yuki
en:
onto high noon's grasses
flitting down...
snowflakes

jp: .衛士の火のますますもゆる霰哉
ro: eji no hi no masu-masu moyuru arare kana
en:
the imperial guard's fire
blazes still more...
hailstones

jp: .けしからぬ月夜となりしみぞれ哉
ro: keshikaranu tsuki yo to narishi mizore kana
en:
strange--
the moon shining
while sleet falls

jp: .酒菰の戸口明りやみぞれふる
ro: sakagomo no toguchi akari ya mizore furu
en:
my sake keg
open for business...
sleet pours down

jp: .酒飯の掌にかかるみぞれ哉
ro: sakameshi no tenohira ni kakaru mizore kana
en:
my tea-boiled rice
in the palm of my hand...
falling sleet

jp: .みぞれはく小尻の先の月よ哉
ro: mizore haku kojiri no saki no tsuki yo kana
en:
sweeping sleet--
at the rafter's metal tip
a bright moon

jp: .夕みぞれ竹一本もむつかしき
ro: yû mizore take ippon mo mutsukashiki
en:
night sleet--
even my bamboo plant
in a rotten mood

jp: .ゆで汁のけぶる垣根也みぞれふる
ro: yudejiru no keburu kakine nari mizore furu
en:
steam from boiling soup
a fence...
falling sleet

jp: .一人前菜も青けりけさの霜
ro: ichininmae na mo aomi keri kesa no shimo
en:
my full serving of vegetables
all greens...
morning frost

jp: .起々にくさめの音や草の霜
ro: oki-oki ni kusame no oto ya kusa no shimo
en:
waking up
with a sneeze...
frost on the grass

jp: .掌に酒飯けぶる今朝の霜
ro: tenohira ni sakameshi keburu kesa no shimo
en:
warming my palms
in the cooking smoke...
morning frost

jp: .としよりの高股立や今朝の霜
ro: toshiyori no takamomodachi ya kesa no shimo
en:
the old man's skirt
hiked up his thighs...
morning frost

jp: .かくれ家に日のほかほかとかれの哉
ro: kakurega ni hi no hoka-hoka to kareno kana
en:
on a secluded house
the warm sun...
withered fields

jp: .片袖に風吹通すかれの哉
ro: kata sode ni kaze fuki-tôsu kareno kana
en:
through one sleeve
the wind passes...
withered fields

jp: .子七人さはぐかれのの小家哉
ro: ko shichi nin sawagu kareno no ko ie kana
en:
a seven-child ruckus
in withered fields...
little house

jp: .ざぶりざぶりざぶり雨ふるかれの哉
ro: zaburi-zaburi-zaburi ame furu kareno kana
en:
splish-splash
splash-splish the rain...
withered fields

jp: .近道はきらひな人や枯野原
ro: chikamichi wa kiraina hito ya kareno hara
en:
he hates taking
the shortcut...
withered fields

jp: .鳥をとる鳥も枯野のけぶり哉
ro: tori wo toru tori mo kareno no keburi kana
en:
a bird of prey
and smoke...
over withered fields

jp: .虫除の札のひょりひょりかれの哉
ro: mushiyoke no fuda no hyoro-hyoro kareno kana
en:
the anti-insect charm
flutters, flutters...
withered fields

jp: .影ぼうしの翁に似たり初時雨
ro: kagebôshi no okina ni nitari hatsu shigure
en:
my shadow looks
like the Old Man's!
first winter rain

jp: .君が代を鶏も諷ふや餅の臼
ro: kimi ga yo wo tori mo utau ya mochi no usu
en:
even a rooster singing
Great Japan!
rice cake tub

jp: .もちつきはうしろになりぬ角田川
ro: mochi tsuki wa ushiro ni narinu sumida-gawa
en:
the rice cake pounding
is now behind me...
Sumida River

jp: .としとりに鶴も下たる畠哉
ro: toshitori ni tsuru mo oritaru hatake kana
en:
also a year older
the crane flies down...
a field

jp: .狩小屋の夜明也けり犬の鈴
ro: kari goya no yoake nari keri inu no suzu
en:
daybreak
at the hunting shack...
the dog's bell

jp: .不二颪真ともにかかる頭巾哉
ro: fuji oroshi matamo ni kakaru zukin kana
en:
in the teeth
of Mount Fuji's wind...
winter skullcap

jp: .昼比にもどりてたたむふとん哉
ro: hiru-goro ni modorite tatamu futon kana
en:
around noon
I come back to fold it up...
futon

jp: .三つ五つ星見てたたむふとん哉
ro: mitsu itsutsu hoshi mite tatamu futon kana
en:
three or five stars
by the time I fold it...
futon

jp: .御迎ひの鐘の鳴也冬篭
ro: o-mukai no kane no naru nari fuyugomori
en:
the death bell
tolls at the temple...
winter seclusion

jp: .親も斯見られし山や冬篭
ro: oya mo kô mirareshi yama ya fuyugomori
en:
my father saw
this same damn mountain...
winter seclusion

jp: .清水を江戸のはづれや冬篭
ro: kiyo mizu wo edo no hazure ya fuyugomori
en:
for pure water
go to Edo's outskirts...
winter seclusion

jp: .ぼんのくぼ夕日にむけて火鉢哉
ro: bon no kubo yûhi ni mukete hibachi kana
en:
on the nape
of my neck, setting sun
and hibachi

jp: .起てから烏聞く也おこり炭
ro: okite kara karasu kiku [nari] okori-zumi
en:
after getting up
I hear a crow...
starting my charcoal fire

jp: .炭の火のふくぶくしさよ藪隣
ro: sumi no hi no fukubukushisa yo yabu tonari
en:
a charcoal fire
happy and well...
the thicket next door

jp: .鳴鶏のはらはら時の炭火哉
ro: naku tori no hara-hara toki no sumibi kana
en:
the rooster flaps and crows
"It's time!"
morning's charcoal fire

jp: .ぱちぱちと椿咲けり炭けぶる
ro: pachi-pachi to tsubaki saki keri sumi keburi
en:
snap and crackle
the camellia blooms
the coal fire smokes

jp: .藪ごしに福々しさよおこり炭
ro: yabu-goshi ni fukubukushisa yo okori-zumi
en:
through the thicket
happy and well...
morning's charcoal fire

jp: .けふけふと命もへるや炭俵
ro: kyôkyô to inochi mo heru ya sumidawara
en:
in careful bits
your life slips away too...
charcoal bag

jp: .炭もはや俵の底ぞ三ケの月
ro: sumi mo haya tawara no soko zo mike no tsuki
en:
my charcoal goes quickly--
bag's bottom
lit by a sickle moon

jp: .忽に淋しくなりぬ炭俵
ro: tachimachi ni sabishiku narinu sumidawara
en:
in just a twinkling
you've gotten low...
charcoal bag

jp: .場ふさげと思ふ間もなし炭俵
ro: bafusage to omou ma mo nashi sumidawara
en:
no sooner than I thought
it an obstacle...
charcoal bag

jp: .雨の日やほたを踏へて夕ながめ
ro: ame no hi ya hota wo fumaete yû nagame
en:
rainy day--
tramping over firewood
to my evening's gazing

jp: .うれしさは暁方のほた火哉
ro: ureshisa wa akatsuki kata no hotabi kana
en:
happiness
just before dawn
is a wood fire

jp: .二軒前干菜かけたり草の雨
ro: ni ken mae hoshi na kaketari kusa no ame
en:
vegetables hung to dry
at two houses...
thatch dripping rain

jp: .二軒前干菜もかけし小家哉
ro: ni ken mae hoshi na mo kakeshi ko ie kana
en:
vegetables hung to dry
in front...
two little houses

jp: .御仏の真向ふ先がかけ菜哉
ro: mi-botoke no ma-muka[u] saki ga kake na kana
en:
smack in front
of Buddha, vegetables
hung to dry

jp: .浅ましと鰒や見らん人の顔
ro: asamashi to fugu ya miruran hito no kao
en:
looking shameful
to the pufferfish...
people's faces

jp: .親分と家向あふて鰒と汁
ro: oyabun to ie mukiaute fukuto-jiru
en:
for the headman
in the house facing mine...
pufferfish soup

jp: .京も京京の真中や鰒と汁
ro: kyô mo kyô kyô no manaka ya fukuto-jiru
en:
Kyoto, Kyoto
in the heart of Kyoto!
pufferfish soup

jp: .汝等が親分いくら鰒と汁
ro: nanjira ga oyabun ikura fukuto-jiru
en:
how much are you bringing
to the headman?
pufferfish soup

jp: .はらはらと紅葉ちりけり鰒と汁
ro: hara-hara to momiji chiri keri fukuto-jiru
en:
red leaves
flitting down...
pufferfish soup

jp: .鰒汁や大宮人の顔をして
ro: fugu shiru ya ômiyabito no kao wo shite
en:
pufferfish soup--
putting on airs
like a great courtier

jp: .鰒好と窓むきあふて借家哉
ro: fugu-zuki to mado mukiaute kariya kana
en:
a pufferfish soup-lover
in the facing window...
rented house

jp: .鰒と汁くひさくもなるつぶり哉
ro: fukuto-jiru kui[ta]ku mo naru tsuburi kana
en:
pufferfish soup--
not wanting to eat
the head

jp: .京にも子分ありとや鰒と汁
ro: miyako ni mo kobun ari to ya fukuto-jiru
en:
in Kyoto
even for apprentices!
pufferfish soup

jp: .ももしきの大宮人や鰒と汁
ro: momoshiki no ômiyabito ya fukuto-jiru
en:
for a great courtier
of the imperial palace...
pufferfish soup

jp: .山紅葉吹おろしけり鰒と汁
ro: yama momiji fuki-oroshi keri fukuto-jiru
en:
the mountain's red leaves
blowing down...
pufferfish soup

jp: .片袖は山手の風や鳴千鳥
ro: kata sode wa yamate no kaze ya naku chidori
en:
from one side
wind from the hills...
plovers singing

jp: .夕やけの鍋の上より千鳥哉
ro: yûyake [no] nabe no ue yori chidori kana
en:
from atop a kettle
in evening's glow...
a plover's song

jp: .水鳥のあなた任せの雨夜哉
ro: mizudori no anata makase no amayo kana
en:
trust in the Buddha
waterfowl!
a rainy night

jp: .どこを風が吹かとひとり鰒哉
ro: doko wo kaze ga fuka to hitori fukuto kana
en:
to wherever
the wind may blow it...
a pufferfish

jp: .かれ萩に裾引っかける日暮哉
ro: kare hagi ni suso hikkakeru higure kana
en:
hanging by a cuff
on withered bush clover...
sunset

jp: .冬枯の萩も長閑けく売家哉
ro: fuyu kare no hagi mo nodokeku uriya kana
en:
winter's withered bush clover
peaceful too...
house for sale

jp: .赤い実の毒々しさよかれすすき
ro: akai mi no dokudokushisa yo kare suzuki
en:
those red seeds
are poisonous!
withered pampas grass

jp: .かれすすき人に売れし一つ家
ro: kare susuki hito ni urareshi hitotsu ie
en:
withered pampas grass--
a solitary house
for sale

jp: .一本は翌の夕飯大根哉
ro: ippon wa asu no yûmeshi daikon kana
en:
that one is
tomorrow night's dinner...
radish

jp: .時雨よと一本残す大根哉
ro: shigure yo to ippon nokosu daikon kana
en:
even if winter rain falls
I'll save this one
radish

jp: .大根引一本づつに雲を見る
ro: daikon hiku ippon-zutsu ni kumo wo miru
en:
yanking radishes
one by one...
watching the clouds

jp: .むら雨にすっくり立や大根引
ro: murasame ni sukkuri tatsu ya daikon hiki
en:
in the rain shower
standing straight...
the radish puller

jp: .我庵の冬は来りけり痩大根
ro: waga io no fuyu wa kitari keri yase daikon
en:
winter arrives
at my hut...
a scrawny radish

jp: .畠人の思ひの外や帰り花
ro: hata-bito no omoi no hoka ya kaeri-bana
en:
surprising
the gardener...
out-of-season blooms

jp: .山川のうしろ冷し帰り花
ro: yama-gawa no ushiro tsumetashi kaeri-bana
en:
by a mountain stream
catching a chill...
out-of-season blooms

jp: .剰海へ向って冬椿
ro: amatsusae umi e mukatte fuyu tsubaki
en:
also facing
the sea...
winter camellias

jp: .日の目見ぬ冬の椿の咲にけり
ro: hi no me minu fuyu no tsubaki no saki ni keri
en:
without seeing sunlight
the winter camellia
blooms

jp: .晴天の真昼にひとり出る哉
ro: seiten no mahiru ni hitori izuru kana
en:
a clear sky
at high noon...
walking out alone

jp: .元日の寝聳る程は曇る也
ro: ganjitsu no nesoberu hodo wa kumoru nari
en:
on New Year's Day
tall as a sleeping man...
the clouds

jp: .正月やよ所に咲ても梅の花
ro: shôgatsu ya yoso ni saite mo ume no hana
en:
First Month--
the plum trees blooming
elsewhere

jp: .又土になりそこなうて花の春
ro: mata tsuchi ni narisokonaute hana no haru
en:
once again
I've managed not to die...
blossoming spring

jp: .わが春は竹一本に柳哉
ro: waga haru wa take ippon ni yanagi kana
en:
my spring--
a bit of bamboo
and a willow sprig

jp: .春立や四十三年人の飯
ro: haru tatsu ya shi jû san nen hito no meshi
en:
spring begins--
forty three years
fed by strangers

jp: .春立やよしのはおろか人の顔
ro: haru tatsu ya yoshino wa oroka hito no kao
en:
spring begins--
in Yoshino the faces
of fools

jp: .中々にかざらぬ松の初日哉
ro: naka-naka ni kazaranu matsu no hatsu hi kana
en:
without a shred
of pine decoration...
the year's first dawn

jp: .上段の代の初日哉旅の家
ro: jôdan no yo no hatsu hi kana tabi no ie
en:
I greet the year's first dawn
in the top bunk...
inn

jp: .上段の代の先あふ初日哉
ro: jôdan no yo no mazu au hatsu hi kana
en:
in the top bunk
I'm first to greet it...
year's first dawn

jp: .粥杖に撰らるる枝か小しほ山
ro: kayuzue ni eraruru eda ga oshio yama
en:
choosing a branch
for her "pregnancy stick"...
Mount Oshio

jp: .やぶ入の先に立けりしきみ桶
ro: yabuiri no saki ni tachi keri shikimi oke
en:
the homecoming servant
stands in front
visiting graves

jp: .やぶ入やきのふ過たる山神楽
ro: yabuiri ya kinou sugitaru yama kagura
en:
homecoming servant--
Shinto dances on the mountain
ended yesterday

jp: .やぶ入や先つつかなき墓の松
ro: yabuiri ya mazu tsutsuganaki haka no matsu
en:
homecoming servant--
the graveyard's pine
safe and sound

jp: .薮入よ君が代歌へ麦の雨
ro: yabuiri yo kimi ga yo utae mugi no ame
en:
Servants' Holiday!
sing "Great Japan"
rain on the wheat field

jp: .榎迄引抜れたる子の日哉
ro: enoki made hiki-nukeretaru ne [no] hi kana
en:
even a nettle tree
is uprooted...
first day of Rat

jp: .月見よと引残されし小松哉
ro: tsukimi yo to hiki-nokosareshi ko matsu kana
en:
yanking up trees
he saves one for moon gazing...
little pine

jp: .門の松おろしや夷の魂消べし
ro: kado no matsu oroshi ya ebisu no tamage-beshi
en:
down comes my New Year's pine--
let the God of Wealth
be shocked!

jp: .住の江ものべつけにして門の松
ro: sumi no e mo nobetsuke ni shite kado no matsu
en:
a Sumiyoshi shrine charm
attached too...
gate's pine decoration

jp: .ちる雪に立合せけり門の松
ro: chiru yuki ni tachiawase keri kado no matsu
en:
keeping the falling
snow company...
New Year's pine

jp: .万歳のまかり出たよ親子連
ro: manzai no makari ideta yo oyako-zure
en:
the begging actors
pay a visit...
parents and children

jp: .七草を敲き直すや昼時分
ro: nanakusa wo tataki naosu ya hiru jibun
en:
the pounding
of the seven herbs resumes...
noontime

jp: .あらためて鶴もおりるか初わかな
ro: aratamete tsuru mo oriru ka hatsu wakana
en:
are you coming down
crane, to see?
picking herbs

jp: .こてこてと鍋かけし若菜哉
ro: kote-kote to nabe kakeshi wakana kana
en:
the kettle's lid
rattle, rattle...
New Year's herbs

jp: .あの藪に人の住めばぞ薺打
ro: ano yabu ni hito no sumeba zo nazuna utsu
en:
in every thicket
where people live...
pounding New Year's herbs

jp: .親里へ水は流るる春辺哉
ro: oya-zato e mizu wa nagaruru harube kana
en:
to my home village
the water flows...
springtime

jp: .長閑さや去年の枕はどの木の根
ro: nodokasa ya kozo no makura wa dono ki [no] ne
en:
spring peace--
last year which tree root
was my pillow?

jp: .春の日や水さへあれば暮残り
ro: haru no hi ya mizu sae areba kure nokori
en:
the spring day's
remnants...
only in the water

jp: .春の夜や瓢なでても人の来る
ro: haru no yo ya fukube nadete mo hito no kuru
en:
spring evening--
he comes out to pet
the gourd

jp: .川見ゆる木の間の窓や春の雨
ro: kawa miyuru ko no ma no mado ya haru no ame
en:
watching the river
through a window of trees...
spring rain falls

jp: .酒ありと壁に張りけり春の雨
ro: sake ari to kabe ni hari keri haru no ame
en:
"Sake for sale"
a sign on a wall...
spring rain

jp: .春雨で恋しがらるる榎哉
ro: harusame de koishigararuru enoki kana
en:
because of spring rain
the dear nettle tree
is missed

jp: .春雨になれて灯とぼる薮の家
ro: harusame ni narete hi toboru yabu no ie
en:
becoming inured
to spring's rain...
lamp-lit house in the trees

jp: .春雨の中に立たる榎哉
ro: harusame no naka ni tachitaru enoki kana
en:
standing tall
in the spring rain...
nettle tree

jp: .春雨やけぶりの脇は妹が門
ro: harusame ya keburi no waki wa imo ga kado
en:
spring rain--
at the edge of the spray
my dear one's gate

jp: .春雨や雀口明く膳の先
ro: harusame ya suzume kuchi aku zen no saki
en:
spring rain--
a sparrow begs
by my dinner tray

jp: .春雨や火もおもしろきなべの尻
ro: harusame ya hi mo omoshiroki nabe no shiri
en:
spring rain--
a delightful fire
under the kettle

jp: .昼過の浦のけぶりや春の雨
ro: hiru sugi no ura no keburi ya haru no ame
en:
steam on the bay
past midday...
spring rain

jp: .ほうろくをかぶって行や春の雨
ro: hôroku wo kabutte yuku ya haru [no] ame
en:
walking along
a baking pan on his head...
spring rain

jp: .山の鐘も一ッひびけ春の雨
ro: yama no kane mo hitotsu hibike haru no ame
en:
clang once more
mountain temple bell!
spring rain

jp: .我松もかたじけなさや春の雨
ro: waga matsu mo katajikenasa ya haru no ame
en:
my pine tree too
is grateful...
spring rain

jp: .小盥の貫すは青し春の風
ro: ko-darai no nukisu wa aoshi haru no kaze
en:
the little tub's
braided bamboo is green...
spring breeze

jp: .春風の吹かぬ草なし田舎飴
ro: haru kaze no fukanu kusa nashi inaka ame
en:
not a blade of grass
untouched by the spring breeze...
country jelly

jp: .春風や黄金花咲むつの山
ro: harukaze ya kogane hana saku mutsu no yama
en:
spring breeze--
golden flowers in bloom
on Mount Mutsu

jp: .松苗も肩過にけり春の風
ro: matsu nae mo kata sugi ni keri haru no kaze
en:
the pine saplings
over shoulder-high...
spring breeze

jp: .霞み行や二親持し小すげ笠
ro: kasumi yuku ya futa oya mochishi ko suge-gasa
en:
walking in mist
in a little sedge hat
with both parents

jp: .陽炎によしある人の素足哉
ro: kagerô ni yoshi aru hito no suashi kana
en:
in heat shimmers
the holy man's
bare feet

jp: .雪汁のかかる地びたに和尚顔
ro: yuki-jiru no kakaru jibita ni oshôgao
en:
splashed with slush
close to the ground...
a monk's face

jp: .かくれ家も人に酔けり春の山
ro: kakurega mo hito ni yoi keri haru no yama
en:
secluded house--
even here, crowd-sick
spring mountain

jp: .老僧のけばけばしさよ春の山
ro: rôsô no kebakebashisa yo haru no yama
en:
the old priest
in his fancy clothes...
spring mountain

jp: .髪虱ひねる戸口も春野哉
ro: kami-jirami hineru toguchi mo haru no kana
en:
pinching head lice
in a doorway...
spring fields

jp: .苔桃も節句に逢ふや赤い花
ro: kokemomo mo sekku ni au ya akai hana
en:
kokemomo berries too
at the festival...
red flowers

jp: .かつしかや昔のままの雛哉
ro: katsushika ya mukashi no mama no hiina kana
en:
in Katsushika
like olden times, unchanged...
Doll Festival

jp: .女から先へかすむぞ汐干がた
ro: onna kara saki e kasumu zo shiohigata
en:
the mist covers up
the women first...
shell gathering

jp: .淋しさや汐の干る日も角田河
ro: sabishisa ya shio no hiru hi mo sumida-gawa
en:
solitude--
even on a low tide day
Sumida River

jp: .汐干潟雨しとしとと暮かかる
ro: shiohi-gata ame shito-shito to kure kakaru
en:
low tide
in a soft, soft rain...
darkness coming

jp: .汐干潟女のざいに遠走り
ro: shiohi-gata onna no zai ni  toppashiri
en:
low tide--
to my woman's house
a long way to go

jp: .汐干潟しかも霞むは女也
ro: shiohi-gata shikamo kasumu wa onna nari
en:
low tide--
the mist wrecks my view
of the women

jp: .汐干潟松がなくても淋しいぞ
ro: shiohi-gata matsu ga nakute mo sabishii zo
en:
low tide
without pine trees...
lonelier still

jp: .住吉や汐干過ても松の月
ro: sumiyoshi ya shiohi sugite mo matsu no tsuki
en:
at Sumiyoshi
all through the low tide...
moon in the pine

jp: .折角の汐の干潟をざんざ雨
ro: sekkaku no shio no hi-gata wo zanza ame
en:
waited so long
for the low tide...
a driving rain

jp: .鶏のなく家も見へたる汐干哉
ro: tori no naku ie mo mietaru shioi kana
en:
a house
with a rooster crowing...
low tide

jp: .降雨や汐干も終に暮の鐘
ro: furu ame ya shiohi mo tsui ni kure no kane
en:
rain falling--
for the low tide gatherers at last
the sunset bell

jp: .御寺から直に行るる汐干哉
ro: mi-tera kara sugu ni yukaruru shioi kana
en:
from the temple
easy access...
shell gathering

jp: .鳥の巣を見し辺りぞや山を焼
ro: tori no su wo mishi atari zo ya yama wo yaku
en:
where I've seen
birds nesting...
they burn the mountain

jp: .巣の鳥の口明く方や暮の鐘
ro: su no tori no kuchi aku hô ya kure no kane
en:
toward the open mouth
of the nesting bird...
the sunset bell tolls

jp: .つつがなき鳥の巣祝へあみだ坊
ro: tsutsuganaki tori no su iwae amida-bô
en:
pray good health
for the nesting bird!
Amida's priest

jp: .鳥の巣のありありみゆる榎哉
ro: tori no su no ariari miyuru enoki kana
en:
the bird nest
in plain sight for all to see...
nettle tree

jp: .鳥の巣や翌は切らるる門の松
ro: tori no su ya asu wa kiraruru kado no matsu
en:
bird's nest--
tomorrow the pine by the gate
will be cut down

jp: .子雀は千代千代千代と鳴にけり
ro: ko suzume wa chiyo chiyo [chiyo] to naki ni keri
en:
the baby sparrow
cheep! cheep! cheep!
he cries

jp: .雀子も梅に口明く念仏哉
ro: suzumego mo ume ni kuchi aku nebutsu kana
en:
sparrow babies
in plum blossoms
praise Buddha!

jp: .鶯ももどりがけかよおれが窓
ro: uguisu mo modori-gake ka yo ore ga mado
en:
nightingale
are you also returning?
my window

jp: .鶯よこちむけやらん赤の飯
ro: uguisu yo kochi muke yaran aka no meshi
en:
hey nightingale
turn this way!
red beans and rice

jp: .窓あれば下手鶯も来たりけり
ro: mado areba heta uguisu mo kitari keri
en:
to every window
an off-key nightingale
comes too

jp: .痩藪の下手鶯もはつ音哉
ro: yase yabu no heta uguisu mo hatsu ne kana
en:
in a sparse thicket
an off-key nightingale too...
first song

jp: .片山は雨のふりけり鳴雲雀
ro: kata yama wa ame no furi keri naku hibari
en:
on the mountain
rain falling
lark singing

jp: .住吉に灯のとぼりけり鳴雲雀
ro: sumiyoshi ni hi no tobori keri naku hibari
en:
at Sumiyoshi
lamps are burning
larks are singing

jp: .鳴雲雀人の顔から日の暮るる
ro: naku hibari hito no kao kara hi no kururu
en:
a skylark sings--
a man facing
sunset

jp: .鳴雲雀貧乏村のどこが果
ro: naku hibari bimbô mura no doko ga hate
en:
singing skylark
where is this poor village's
border?

jp: .野大根も花咲にけり鳴雲雀
ro: no daiko mo hana saki ni keri naku hibari
en:
even the field's
radishes are blooming...
the lark singing!

jp: .雲雀鳴通りに見ゆる大和哉
ro: hibari naku tôri ni miyuru yamato kana
en:
the lark sings
as it flies along...
Great Japan!

jp: .故郷の見へなくなりて鳴雲雀
ro: furusato no mienaku narite naku hibari
en:
my home village
no longer in sight...
singing lark

jp: .夕急ぐ干潟の人や鳴雲雀
ro: yû isogu higata no hito ya naku hibari
en:
evening rushes in--
someone on the tideland
a lark singing

jp: .夕雲雀野辺のけぶりに倦るるな
ro: yû hibari nobe no keburi ni akaruru na
en:
evening lark
don't let the field's smoke
annoy you

jp: .雷に鳴あはせたる雉哉
ro: kaminari ni naki awasetaru kigisu kana
en:
mingling
with the thunder--
a pheasant's cry

jp: .雉なくや千島のおくも仏世界
ro: kiji naku ya chishima no oku mo butsu sekai
en:
a pigeon cries--
even deep in the Thousand Islands
it's Buddha's world

jp: .朝雨を祝ふてかへれ小田の雁
ro: asa ame wo iwaute kaere oda no kari
en:
celebrate the morning rain
then off you go!
rice field geese

jp: .跡立は雨に逢ひけりかへる雁
ro: atodachi wa ame ni ai keri kaeru kari
en:
the last in line
hits the rain...
departing geese

jp: .かへる雁翌はいづくの月や見る
ro: kaeru kari asu wa izuku no tsuki ya miru
en:
departing geese
where will you moon-gaze
tomorrow?

jp: .立雁のぢろぢろみるや人の顔
ro: tachi kari no jiro-jiro miru ya hito no kao
en:
the departing goose
stares the man
in the face

jp: .田の雁のかへるつもりか帰らぬか
ro: ta no kari no kaeru tsumori ka kaeranu ka
en:
are the rice field's geese
planning to fly north?
planning not to?

jp: .田の人の笠に糞してかへる雁
ro: ta no hito no kasa ni hako shite kaeru kari
en:
pooping on the farmer's
umbrella-hat
the goose departs

jp: .はげ山も見知ておけよかへる雁
ro: hage yama mo mishirite oke yo kaeru kari
en:
the bald mountain, too
memorize by sight!
geese flying north

jp: .一ッでも鳴て行也かへる雁
ro: hitotsu demo naite yuku nari kaeru kari
en:
just one
but he goes honking...
departing goose

jp: .行雁に呑せてやらん京の水
ro: yuku kari ni nomasete yaran kyô no mizu
en:
geese taking off
have a drink on me...
Kyoto's water

jp: .行雁やきのふは見へぬ小田の水
ro: yuku kari ya kinou wa mienu oda no mizu
en:
traveling geese--
those rice fields weren't flooded
yesterday

jp: .行な雁廿日も居れば是古郷
ro: yuku na kari hatsuka [mo] ireba kore kokyô
en:
don't go geese!
after twenty days
this is your home

jp: .我恋はさらしな山ぞかへる雁
ro: waga koi wa sarashina yama zo kaeru kari
en:
"My love
is at Mount Sarashina!"
the goose departs

jp: .油火のうつくしき夜やなく蛙
ro: aburabi no utsukushiki yo ya naku kawazu
en:
a lovely night lit
with oil lamps...
croaking frogs

jp: .蛙なくや始て寝たる人の家
ro: kawazu naku ya hajimete netaru hito no ie
en:
croaking frogs--
my first night
visiting this house

jp: .鍋ずみを目口に入てなく蛙
ro: nabe-zumi wo meguchi ni irete naku kawazu
en:
the kettle's soot
in his mouth and eyes...
croaking frog

jp: .初蛙梢の雫又おちよ
ro: hatsu kawazu kozue no shizuku mata ochi yo
en:
spring's first frog--
another drop falls
from the twig

jp: .あたふたに蝶の出る日や金の番
ro: atafuta ni chô no deru hi ya kane no ban
en:
on a hurry-scurry
butterfly day
guarding the money

jp: .今上げし小溝の泥やとぶ小蝶
ro: ima ageshi ko mizo no doro ya tobu ko chô
en:
fresh-scooped mud
from the little ditch...
a little flitting butterfly

jp: .うそうそと雨降中を春のてふ
ro: uso-uso to ame furu naka wo haru no chô
en:
nervously
through the raindrops...
spring butterfly

jp: .川縁や蝶を寝さする鍋の尻
ro: kawaberi ya chô wo nesasuru nabe no shiri
en:
riverbank--
the butterfly's bed
a kettle's bottom

jp: .手のとどく山の入日や春の蝶
ro: te no todoku yama no irihi ya haru no chô
en:
the mountain sunset
within my grasp...
spring butterfly

jp: .通り抜ゆるす寺也春のてふ
ro: tôrinuke yurusu tera nari haru no chô
en:
a shortcut through
the temple with permission...
spring butterfly

jp: .とぶ蝶や溜り水さへ春のもの
ro: tobu chô ya tamari mizu sae haru no mono
en:
flitting butterfly
even stagnant water
a spring thing

jp: .初蝶のいきおひ猛に見ゆる哉
ro: hatsu chô no ikioi mou ni miyuru kana
en:
the year's first
butterfly
full of swagger

jp: .吹やられ吹やられたる小てふ哉
ro: fuki yarare fuki yararetaru ko chô kana
en:
blowing along
blowing along...
a little butterfly

jp: .又窓へ吹もどさるる小てふ哉
ro: mata mado e fuki-modosaruru ko chô kana
en:
blown to the window
again
little butterfly

jp: .湖の駕から見へて春の蝶
ro: mizuumi no kago kara miete haru no chô
en:
from a palanquin
at the lake, watching
spring butterflies

jp: .目の砂をこする握に小てふ哉
ro: me no suna wo kosuru kobushi ni ko chô kana
en:
rubbing sand from his eyes
in my hand...
little butterfly

jp: .行人のうしろ見よとや風のてふ
ro: yuku hito no ushiro mi yo to ya kaze no chô
en:
to the man walking
"Look behind you!"
windblown butterfly

jp: .よしずあむ槌にもなれし小てふ哉
ro: yoshizu amu tsuchi ni mo nareshi ko chô kana
en:
getting used to
the screen weaver's hammer...
little butterfly

jp: .女衆に追ぬかれけり菫原
ro: onna shu ni oinukare keri sumire-bara
en:
a group of women
overtake me...
field of violets

jp: .菫咲門や夜さへなつかしき
ro: sumire saku kado ya yoru sae natsukashiki
en:
violets on the gate--
even at night
sweet nostalgia

jp: .花菫便ない草もほじらるる
ro: hana sumire bin nai kusa mo hojiraruru
en:
blooming violets--
some worthless grass
dug up too

jp: .我前に誰々住し菫ぞも
ro: waga mae ni dare dare sumishi sumire zo mo
en:
before me
who also lived here
with these violets?

jp: .雨だれの毎日たたく椿哉
ro: amadare no mainichi tataku tsubaki kana
en:
clobbered every day
by raindrops from the eaves...
camellias

jp: .片浦の汐よけ椿咲にけり
ro: kata ura no shio yoke tsubaki saki ni keri
en:
a tide wall
for the coast, camellias
blooming

jp: .赤貝を我もはかるよ梅の花
ro: akagai wo ware mo hakaru yo ume no hana
en:
surveying also
bloody clams...
plum blossoms

jp: .あれ梅といふ間に曲る小舟哉
ro: are ume to iu ma ni magaru kobune kana
en:
"Look! Plum blossoms!"
the little boat
turns around

jp: .家一ッあればはたして梅の花
ro: ie hitotsu areba hatashite ume [no] hana
en:
if there's a house
standing alone, sure enough...
plum blossoms

jp: .いたいけに梅の咲けり本道
ro: itai-ke ni ume no saki keri hondôri
en:
precious little plum trees
in bloom...
the main road

jp: .一日も我家ほしさよ梅の花
ro: ichi-nichi mo waga ya hoshisa yo ume [no] hana
en:
if only for a day
to have my own house!
plum blossoms

jp: .うしろからぼろを笑ふよ梅の花
ro: ushiro kara boro wo warau yo ume no hana
en:
behind me
laughter at my rags...
plum blossoms

jp: .梅がかやどなたが来ても欠茶碗
ro: ume ga ka ya donate ga kite mo kake chawan
en:
plum blossom scent--
for whoever shows up
a cracked teacup

jp: .梅さくに鍋ずみとれぬ皴手哉
ro: ume saku ni nabe-zumi torenu shiwade kana
en:
in plum blossoms
kettle soot won't come off...
my wrinkled hands

jp: .梅咲くや木を割さへも朝げしき
ro: ume saku ya ki wo waru sae mo asa-geshiki
en:
plum in bloom--
even wood chopping
a morning scene

jp: .梅咲や去年は越後のあぶれ人
ro: ume saku ya kozo wa echigo no abure-bito
en:
plum blossoms--
last year's unemployed worker
from Echigo

jp: .梅の木は咲ほこりけりかけ硯
ro: ume no ki wa saki-hokori keri kake suzuri
en:
plum trees bloom
in full glory...
my broken inkstone

jp: .梅の月牛の尻迄見ゆる也
ro: ume no tsuki ushi no shiri made miyuru nari
en:
plum blossoms, moon
and the rump
of a cow

jp: .梅見ても青空見ても田舎哉
ro: ume mite mo ao-zora mite mo inaka kana
en:
viewing plum blossoms
viewing blue sky...
but I'm in the sticks

jp: .大原やぶらりと出ても梅の月
ro: ôhara ya burari to dete mo ume no tsuki
en:
also rambling
over the big field...
plum blossom moon

jp: .来るも来るも下手鶯よ窓の梅
