ro: kuru mo kuru mo heta uguisu yo mado no ume
en:
one by one they come
off-key nightingales
to the plum blossom window

jp: .此当り洛陽なるか梅の月
ro: kono atari rakuyô naru ka ume no tsuki
en:
has this place become
old Lo-yang?
plum blossom moon

jp: .咲日から梅にさわるや馬の首
ro: saku hi kara ume ni sawaru ya uma no kubi
en:
after blooming
the plum tree a scratching post...
horse's head

jp: .袖すれば祟る杉ぞよ梅の花
ro: sode sureba tataru sugi zo yo ume [no] hana
en:
the damn cedars
ripping sleeves!
plum trees in bloom

jp: .ちる梅のかかる賎しき身柱哉
ro: chiru ume no kakaru iyashiki chirike kana
en:
a plum blossom falls
to a low place...
scar from burning wormwood

jp: .膝の児の指始梅の花
ro: hiza no ko no yubisashi hajime ume no hana
en:
the lap-baby's
first pointing...
plum blossoms

jp: .ひたすらに咲うでもなし門の梅
ro: hitasura ni sakô demo nashi kado [no] ume
en:
not very devoted
to blooming...
plum tree at my gate

jp: .むづかしやだまって居ても梅は咲
ro: muzukashi ya damatte ite mo ume wa saku
en:
quite a feat--
in utter silence
the plum tree blooms

jp: .我庵の貧乏梅の咲にけり
ro: waga io no bimbô ume no saki ni keri
en:
my hut's
down-and-out plum tree
has bloomed!

jp: .狙どのも赤いべえきて梅の花
ro: saru dono mo akai bee kite ume no hana
en:
Mister Monkey too
wears a funny face...
plum blossoms

jp: .白妙の僧白妙の梅の花
ro: shirotae no sô shirotae no ume no hana
en:
white as a monk's
whitest robe...
plum blossoms

jp: .雀らも身祝するか梅の花
ro: suzumera mo mi-awai suru ka ume no hana
en:
are the sparrows too
having a private party?
plum blossoms

jp: .咲くからに雨に逢けり花の山
ro: saku kara ni ame ni ai keri hana no yama
en:
soon after blooming
pelted by rain...
mountain cherry trees

jp: .どこからの花のなぐれぞ角田川
ro: doko kara no hana no nagure zo sumida-gawa
en:
from where
did those blossoms float?
Sumida River

jp: .奈良漬を丸でかじりて花の陰
ro: narazuke wo maru de kajirite hana no kage
en:
eating my pickle
rind and all...
blossom shade

jp: .初花や山の粟飯なつかしき
ro: hatsu hana ya yama no awameshi natsukashiki
en:
first flowers--
boiled mountain millet
sweet nostalgia

jp: .花びらの埃流にふる雨か
ro: hanabira no hokori nagashi ni furu ame ka
en:
are you falling
to wash dust off blossoms
rain?

jp: .ふる雨に一人残りし花の陰
ro: furu ame ni hitori nokorishi hana no kage
en:
in falling rain
one man remains...
blossom shade

jp: .見かぎりし古郷の山の桜哉
ro: mikagirishi kokyô no yama no sakura kana
en:
the home village
I abandoned...
mountain cherry blossoms

jp: .江戸衆に見枯らされたる桜哉
ro: edo shû ni mi karasaretaru sakura kana
en:
made to wither
by the people of Edo's eyes...
cherry blossoms

jp: .大川へ吹なぐられし桜哉
ro: ôkawa e fuki nagurareshi sakura kana
en:
blown to the big river
floating away...
cherry blossoms

jp: .大降りや桜の陰に居過して
ro: ôburi ya sakura no kage ni i-sugoshite
en:
heavy rain--
in cherry blossom shade
I stayed too long

jp: .京人にせっちうされし桜哉
ro: kyôbito ni setchû sareshi sakura kana
en:
blended in
with people of Kyoto...
cherry blossoms

jp: .咲からに縄を張れし桜哉
ro: saku kara ni nawa wo harareshi sakura kana
en:
after blooming
they're roped off...
cherry blossoms

jp: .四五九年見ても初花ざくら哉
ro: shi go ku nen mite mo hatsu hana-zakura kana
en:
four, five, nine years
always the first to bloom...
cherry tree

jp: .聖人に見放されたる桜哉
ro: seijin ni mi-hanasaretaru sakura kana
en:
the holy man leaves
them behind...
cherry blossoms

jp: .袖たけのはつ花桜咲にけり
ro: sodetake no hatsu hana-zakura saki ni keri
en:
the first cherry tree
long as my sleeve...
in bloom

jp: .初桜はやちりかかる人の顔
ro: hatsu sakura haya chiri kakaru hito no kao
en:
the first cherry blossoms
soon scatter and stick...
people's faces

jp: .花桜一本一本のいさほしや
ro: hana sakura ippon ippon no isaoshi ya
en:
cherry blossoms--
tree after tree
of good karma

jp: .本降のゆふべとなりし桜哉
ro: homburi no yûbe to narishi sakura kana
en:
an evening
of steady rainfall...
cherry blossoms

jp: .又人の立ふさがるや初桜
ro: mata hito wo tachi-fusagaru ya hatsu sakura
en:
again someone stands
blocking my view!
first cherry blossoms

jp: .むら雨に半かくれし桜哉
ro: murasame ni nakaba kakureshi sakura kana
en:
half-hidden
in the rain shower...
cherry blossoms

jp: .夕暮や池なき方もさくらちる
ro: yûgure ya ike naki kata mo sakura chiru
en:
evening--
in the area with no pond, too
cherry blossoms scatter

jp: .桜花どっちへ寝ても手のとどく
ro: sakura hana dotchi e nete mo te [no] todoku
en:
cherry blossoms--
whichever side I sleep on
within hand's reach

jp: .福蟾ものさばり出たり桃の花
ro: fuku-biki mo nosabari detari momo [no] hana
en:
Lucky the Toad, too
swaggers out...
peach blossoms

jp: .青柳や蛍よぶ夜の思はるる
ro: ao yagi ya hotaru yobu [yo] no omowaruru
en:
green willow--
thinking of a night
of calling fireflies

jp: .青柳ややがて蛍をよぶところ
ro: ao yagi ya yagate hotaru wo yobu tokoro
en:
green willow--
soon we'll be calling
fireflies here

jp: .しるよしの郷の鐘なる柳哉
ro: shiruyoshi no sato no kane naru yanagi kana
en:
Shiruyoshi's bell
is clanging...
willow tree

jp: .鳥どもに糞かけられし柳哉
ro: tori domo ni kuso kakerareshi yanagi kana
en:
all spattered
with bird poop...
the willow tree

jp: .独寝るつもりの家か柳陰
ro: hitori neru tsumori no ie ka yanagi kage
en:
no one at home
to sleep with?
willow shade

jp: .蛍よぶ夜のれうとやさし柳
ro: hotaru yobu yoru no ryô to ya sashi yanagi
en:
an evening spot
for calling fireflies...
planting a willow

jp: .身じろぎもならぬ塀より柳哉
ro: mijirogi mo naranu hei yori yanagi kana
en:
from where a fence
pens it in...
a willow

jp: .三筋程松にかくれし柳哉
ro: mi suji hodo matsu kakureshi yanagi kana
en:
three strands or so
hide in the pine...
willow tree

jp: .柳見へ東寺も見へて昔也
ro: yanagi mie tôji mo miete mukashi nari
en:
looking at willows
and Toh Temple...
olden times return

jp: .段々に夏の夜明や人の顔
ro: dan-dan ni natsu no yoake ya hito no kao
en:
little by little
the summer night turns dawn...
people's faces

jp: .けふも暮けふも暮けり五月雨
ro: kyô mo kure kyô mo kure keri satsuki ame
en:
all day, all day
day after day...
Fifth Month rain

jp: .五月雨の里やいつ迄笛法度
ro: samidare no sato ya itsu made fue hatto
en:
Fifth Month rain--
in the town how long
this flute ban?

jp: .五月雨や弥陀の日延もきのふ迄
ro: samidare ya mida no hinobe mo kinou made
en:
Fifth Month rain--
postponed by Amida
till yesterday

jp: .鳴烏けふ五月雨の降りあくか
ro: naku karasu kyô samidare no furiaku ka
en:
cawing crow
today will the Fifth Month rains
peter out?

jp: .二人とは行かれぬ厨子や五月雨
ro: futari towa ikarenu zushi ya satsuki ame
en:
two won't fit
in the little shrine...
Fifth Month rain

jp: .うつくしき寝蓙も見へて夕立哉
ro: utsukushiki negoza mo miete yûdachi kana
en:
a pretty sleeping mat
also in view...
cloudburst

jp: .夕立や竹一本の小菜畠
ro: yûdachi ya take ippon [no] ko na-batake
en:
rainstorm--
a one-bamboo
little farm field

jp: .夕立や舟から見たる京の山
ro: yûdachi ya fune kara mitaru kyô no yama
en:
rainstorm--
watching from a boat
Kyoto's mountain

jp: .雲の峰立や野中の握飯
ro: kumo no mine tatsu ya no naka no nigirimeshi
en:
billowing clouds
rise over the field...
eating rice balls

jp: .どの人も空腹顔也雲の峰
ro: dono hito mo hidaru kao nari kumo no mine
en:
on every man's face
a hungry look...
billowing clouds

jp: .湖に手をさし入て雲の峰
ro: mizuumi ni te wo sashi irete kumo no mine
en:
plunging my hand
into the lake...
billowing clouds

jp: .虫のなる腹をさぐれば雲の峰
ro: mushi no naru hara wo sagureba kumo no mine
en:
patting my belly
full of worms...
billowing clouds

jp: .汁なべも厠も夏の月よ哉
ro: shiru nabe mo kawaya mo natsu no tsuki yo kana
en:
in soup kettle
and outhouse
the summer moon

jp: .夏の月柱なでても夜の明る
ro: natsu no tsuki hashira nadete mo yo no akuru
en:
summer moon--
in one pet of the post
it's dawn

jp: .水切の騒ぎいつ迄夏の月
ro: mizugire no sawagi itsu made natsu no tsuki
en:
how much longer
this damn drought?
summer moon

jp: .親の家見へなくなりぬ夏の山
ro: oya no ie mienaku narinu natsu [no] yama
en:
my parents' house
no longer in sight...
summer mountain

jp: .夏の山京を見る時雨かかる
ro: natsu yama ya kyô wo miru toki ame kakaru
en:
summer mountain--
just when I sight Kyoto
rain!

jp: .夏山やつやつやしたる小順礼
ro: natsu yama ya tsuya-tsuyashitaru ko junrei
en:
summer mountain--
a glowing
little pilgrim

jp: .柱拭く人も見へけり夏の山
ro: hashira fuku hito mo mie keri natsu no yama
en:
a man wiping
a post...
the summer mountain

jp: .浅ぢふも月さへさせば清水哉
ro: asajiu mo tsuki sae saseba shimizu kana
en:
even in the rushes
if the moon is shining...
pure water

jp: .かくれ家や月ささずとも湧清水
ro: kakurega ya tsuki sasazu to mo waku shimizu
en:
secluded house--
no moonlight
but gushing pure water

jp: .清水湧く翌の山見て寝たりけり
ro: shimizu waku asu no yama mite netari keri
en:
pure water gushes--
looking at tomorrow's mountain
lying down

jp: .松迄は月もさしけり湧く清水
ro: matsu made wa tsuki mo sashi keri waku shimizu
en:
the moon shines
up to the pine...
pure water gushes

jp: .湧く清水浅間のけぶり又見ゆる
ro: waku shimizu asama no keburi mata miyuru
en:
gushing pure water--
Mount Asama's smoke
appears again

jp: .悪まれし草は穂に出し青田哉
ro: nikumareshi kusa wa ho ni deshi aoda kana
en:
the hated grasses
rear their heads...
green rice field

jp: .木がくれに母のほまちの青田哉
ro: kogakure ni haha no homachi no aoda kana
en:
hidden by trees
mother's side-field...
rice so green

jp: .更衣そもそも藪の長者也
ro: koromogae somo-somo yabu no chôja nari
en:
new summer robes--
the thicket's become
opulent

jp: .更衣松の木ほしくなりにけり
ro: koromogae matsu no ki hoshiku nari ni keri
en:
new summer robes--
now I want
a pine tree!

jp: .高砂は榎も友ぞころもがへ
ro: takasago wa enoki mo tomo zo koromogae
en:
on Takasago
even for the nettle tree...
a new summer robe

jp: .痩藪も窓も月さすころもがへ
ro: yase yabu mo mado mo tsuki sasu koromogae
en:
in a sparse thicket, in my window
the bright moon...
new summer robes

jp: .袷きて見ても淋しや東山
ro: awase kite mite mo sabishi ya higashi yama
en:
even trying on my summer kimono
lonely...
Higashi Mountains

jp: .あばら家に入ると見へしよ日傘
ro: abaraya ni iru to mieshi yo higarakasa
en:
entering my ramshackle
hut you see...
a parasol

jp: .僧正が野糞遊ばす日傘哉
ro: sôjô ga no-guso asobasu higasa kana
en:
the high priest
poops in the field...
parasol

jp: .窓だけに月のさし入る紙帳哉
ro: mado dake ni tsuki no sashi iru shichô kana
en:
moonlight enters
only through the window...
paper mosquito net

jp: .二番火の酒試るうちは哉
ro: ni ban hi [no] sake kokoromiru uchiwa kana
en:
after trying out
the twice-fired sake...
paper fan

jp: .一人では手張畠や渋団扇
ro: hitori de wa tebaru hatake ya shibu uchiwa
en:
the field's too much
for one man alone...
rustic fan

jp: .松の露ぽちりぽちりと蚊やり立つ
ro: matsu no tsuyu pochiri-pochiri to kayari kana
en:
the pine tree dew
dripping, dripping...
smudge pot smoke

jp: .木に打ってば竹にたらざる流哉
ro: ki ni utteba take ni tarazaru nagare kana
en:
when the tree is watered
the bamboo makes do...
run-off

jp: .朝顔の折角咲ぬ門涼み
ro: asagao no sekkaku sakinu kado suzumi
en:
morning-glories blooming
just for me...
cool air at the gate

jp: .翌は剃る仏が顔や夕涼み
ro: asu wa soru hotoke ga kao ya yûsuzumi
en:
tomorrow
Buddha will be shaved...
evening cool

jp: .門涼み余所は朝顔咲にけり
ro: kado suzumi yoso wa asagao saki ni keri
en:
cooling at the gate--
morning-glories have bloomed
elsewhere

jp: .涼にもはりあひあらじ門の月
ro: suzumu ni mo hariai araji kado no tsuki
en:
even cool air basking
not worth the effort...
moon at the gate

jp: .竹笛は鎌倉ぶりよ田植がさ
ro: take fue wa kamakura-buri yo taue-gasa
en:
a bamboo flute
Kamakura-style, rice planters
in umbrella-hats

jp: .松よりも古き顔して心太
ro: matsu yori mo furuki kao shite tokoroten
en:
his face older
than the pine...
sweet jelly

jp: .かつしかやどこに住でも時鳥
ro: katsushika ya doko ni sunde mo hototogisu
en:
even living
in Katsushika...
"cuckoo!"

jp: .角田川もっと古びよ時鳥
ro: sumida-gawa motto furubi yo hototogisu
en:
Sumida River
even more old-timey...
"cuckoo!"

jp: .雷のごろつく中を行々し
ro: kaminari no gorotsuku naka wo gyôgyôshi
en:
amid the thunder's
rumble...
a reed thrush singing

jp: .行々しどこが葛西の行留り
ro: gyôgyôshi doko ga kasai no yukidomari
en:
O reed thrush
which road is the dead end
of Kasai?

jp: .行々しどこが昔の難波なる
ro: gyôgyôshi doko ga mukashi [no] naniwa naru
en:
hey reed thrush
which way to ancient
Naniwa?

jp: .はつはつに松島見へて行々し
ro: hatsu-hatsu ni matsushima miete gyôgyôshi
en:
Matsushima
barely in sight...
warble of a reed thrush

jp: .風道を塞ぐ枝より蛍哉
ro: kazamichi wo fusagu eda yori hotaru kana
en:
from branches that block
the wind...
fireflies

jp: .けしからぬ夕晴人やとぶ蛍
ro: keshikaranu yûbare hito ya tobu hotaru
en:
disgraceful!
'round the red-faced drunkard
fireflies flit

jp: .小竹さへよそのもの也とぶ蛍
ro: ko take sae yoso no mono nari tobu hotaru
en:
even the little bamboo
isn't mine...
flitting fireflies

jp: .とぶ蛍家のうるさき夜也けり
ro: tobu hotaru ie no urusaki yo nari keri
en:
flitting fireflies--
another annoying night
in the house

jp: .大雨や大ナ月や松の蝉
ro: ôame ya ôkina tsuki ya matsu no semi
en:
big rain
big moon
cicada in the pine

jp: .かくれ家は浴過けり松の蝉
ro: kakurega wa yuami sugi keri matsu no semi
en:
secluded house--
a hot bath
and cicadas in the pines

jp: .聞倦て人は去也枝の蝉
ro: kiki aite hito wa saru nari eda no semi
en:
tired of listening
the man walks away...
cicada on a branch

jp: .蝉なくや柳ある家の朝の月
ro: semi naku ya yanagi aru ya no asa no tsuki
en:
cicadas chirr--
house in the willows
morning moon

jp: .宵越の茶水明りやかたつぶり
ro: yoigoshi no cha mizu akari ya katatsuburi
en:
glimmer of tea water
left out overnight...
a snail

jp: .初松魚序ながらも富士の山
ro: hatsu-gatsuo tsuide nagara mo fuji [no] yama
en:
viewed in passing
after summer's first bonito...
Mount Fuji

jp: .初松魚山の際迄江戸気也
ro: hatsu-gatsuo yama no kiwa made edoki nari
en:
summer's first bonito--
even at the mountain's edge
a taste of Edo

jp: .草の葉に半分見ゆる牡丹哉
ro: kusa no ha ni hambun miyuru botan kana
en:
half of it showing
in the deep grass...
peony

jp: .青柳ははや夜に入て蓮の花
ro: ao yagi wa haya yo ni irite hasu [no] hana
en:
for the green willow
night rushes in...
lotus blossoms

jp: .大沼や一つ咲ても蓮の花
ro: ônuma ya hitotsu saite mo hasu no hana
en:
in a big swamp
just one bloom...
but it's a lotus!

jp: .雀等が浴なくしたり蓮の水
ro: suzumera ga abi nakushi tari hasu no mizu
en:
sparrows bathing
have scattered it...
lotus water

jp: .百合の花朝から暮るるけしき也
ro: yuri [no] hana asa kara kururu keshiki nari
en:
lilies in bloom--
from morning on
sunset colors

jp: .冷し瓜二日立てども誰も来ぬ
ro: hiyashi uri futsuka tatedo mo dare mo konu
en:
the melon cooling
two days now...
no one has come

jp: .待もせぬ月のさしけり冷し瓜
ro: machi mo senu tsuki no sashi keri hiyashi uri
en:
unexpected moonlight
shines down...
cooling melon

jp: .とぶ蝶や青葉桜も縄の中
ro: tobu shô yo aoba sakura mo nawa no naka
en:
a flitting butterfly
and green-leafed cherry tree
roped off

jp: .灰汁桶の蝶のきげんや木下闇
ro: aku oke no chô no kigen ya ko shita yami
en:
round the lye bucket
a happy butterfly...
deep tree shade

jp: .卯の花に蛙葬る法師哉
ro: u no hana ni kawazu hômuru hôshi kana
en:
in deutzia blossoms
the priest buries
the frog

jp: .卯の花や葬の真似する子ども達
ro: u [no] hana ya sô no mane suru kodomotachi
en:
deutzia blossoms--
the children play
funeral

jp: .卯の花や水の明りになく蛙
ro: u no hana ya mizu no akari ni naku kawazu
en:
deutzia blossoms--
in the water's gleam
a croaking frog

jp: .淋しさに蠣殻ふみぬ花卯木
ro: sabishisa ni kakigara fuminu hana u [no] ki
en:
in solitude
walking on oyster shells...
deutzia in bloom

jp: .立秋や旅止まくと思ふ間に
ro: tatsu aki ya tabi yamemaku to omou ma ni
en:
autumn begins--
I thought by now this journey
would've ended

jp: .雨だれや三粒おちてもけさの秋
ro: amadare ya san tsubu ochite mo kesa no aki
en:
from the roof's overhang
three drops...
first autumn morning

jp: .朝寒や松は去年の松なれど
ro: asa-zamu ya matsu wa kyonen no matsu naredo
en:
a cold morning--
but the same pine tree
as last year

jp: .兄分の門とむきあふ夜寒哉
ro: anibun no kado to mukiau yozamu kana
en:
facing the gate
of elder brother...
a cold night

jp: .すりこ木もけしきに並ぶ夜寒哉
ro: surikogi mo keshiki ni narabu yozamu kana
en:
a pounding pestle
completes the scene...
a cold night

jp: .野のけぶり袖にぞ這る夜寒哉
ro: no no keburi sode ni zo hairu yozamu kana
en:
the field's smoke
crawls into my sleeves...
a cold night

jp: .秋の夜やよ所から来ても馬のなく
ro: aki no yo ya yoso kara kite mo uma no naku
en:
autumn evening--
from elsewhere another horse
neighs in reply

jp: .すりこ木もけしきにならぶ夜永哉
ro: surikogi mo keshiki ni narabu yonaga kana
en:
even the pestle
becomes part of the scene...
a long night

jp: .出る度に馬の嘶く夜永哉
ro: deru tabi ni uma no inanaku yonaga kana
en:
every time I go out
the horse neighs...
a long night

jp: .利根川の秋もなごりの月よ哉
ro: tone-gawa no aki mo nagori no tsuki yo kana
en:
Tone River's
farewell to autumn...
bright moon

jp: .木に鳴はやもめ烏か天の川
ro: ki ni naku wa yamome karasu ka ama [no] kawa
en:
singing in the tree
are you a widow, crow?
Milky Way above

jp: .やぶ陰も月さへさせば我家哉
ro: yabu kage mo tsuki sae saseba waga ya kana
en:
shaded by thicket
'til the moon breaks through...
my house

jp: .名月や雨なく見ゆるよ所の空
ro: meigetsu ya ame naku miyuru yoso no sora
en:
harvest moon
on a clear, rainless night
elsewhere!

jp: .名月や石のあはひの人の顔
ro: meigetsu ya ishi no awai no hito no kao
en:
harvest moon--
people on the stone
with pale faces

jp: .名月や都に居てもとしのよる
ro: meigetsu ya miyako ni ite mo toshi no yoru
en:
harvest moon--
even in Kyoto
growing old

jp: .橋見へて暮かかる也秋の空
ro: hashi miete kure kakaru nari aki no sora
en:
watching the bridge
as evening falls...
autumn sky

jp: .秋雨や人げも見へぬうらの門
ro: akesame ya hitoge mo mienu ura no kado
en:
autumn rain--
not a soul in sight
the back gate

jp: .秋雨や我にひとしきかたつぶり
ro: akisame ya ware ni hitoshiki katatsuburi
en:
autumn rain--
he's just like me
the snail

jp: .秋の雨松一本に日の暮るる
ro: aki no ame matsu ippon ni hi no kururu
en:
autumn rain--
for a lonely pine
day's end

jp: .売馬の親かへり見る秋の雨
ro: uri uma no oya kaeri miru aki no ame
en:
the sold pony
looks back at mother...
autumn rain

jp: .かつしかや遠く降っても秋の雨
ro: katsushika ya tôku futte mo aki no ame
en:
in Katsushika
falling in the distance...
autumn rain

jp: .手の皺の一夜に見ゆる秋の雨
ro: te no shiwa no hito ya ni miyuru aki no ame
en:
all night looking
at my wrinkled hands...
autumn rain

jp: .山里や秋の雨夜の遠歩き
ro: yamazato ya aki no ame yo no tô aruki
en:
mountain village--
a rainy autumn evening's
long walk

jp: .秋の風乞食は我を見くらぶる
ro: aki no kaze kojiki wa ware wo mikuraburu
en:
autumn wind--
a beggar looking
sizes me up

jp: .秋の風蝉もぶつぶつおしと鳴く
ro: aki no kaze semi mo butsu-butsu oshi to naku
en:
autumn wind--
the cicadas' grumbling
is louder

jp: .秋の風剣の山を来る風か
ro: aki no kaze tsurugi no yama wo kuru kaze ka
en:
does this autumn wind
come from the Mountain
of Swords?

jp: .秋の風我が参るはどの地獄
ro: aki no kaze waga [ga] mairu wa dono jigoku
en:
autumn wind--
on my pilgrimage
to which hell?

jp: .松苗のけばけばしさよ秋の風
ro: matsu nae no kebakebashisa yo aki [no] kaze
en:
the little pine tree
puts on a show...
autumn wind

jp: .垣際の足洗盥野分哉
ro: kaki-giwa no ashi arai-darai nowaki kana
en:
next to the fence
a foot-washing tub...
autumn gale

jp: .ぽつぽつと馬の爪切る野分哉
ro: potsu-potsu to uma no tsume kiru nowaki kana
en:
bit by bit
trimming the horse's hooves...
autumn gale

jp: .山本の祭の釜に野分哉
ro: yamamoto no matsuri no kama ni nowaki kana
en:
festival at the mountain's foot--
in the cauldron
an autumn gale

jp: .人は旅日は朝朗けさの露
ro: hito wa tabi hi wa asaborake kesa no tsuyu
en:
travelers set out
the sun rises...
a world of morning dew

jp: .秋霧や河原なでしこ見ゆる迄
ro: aki-giri ya kawara nadeshiko miyuru made
en:
autumn mist--
the river beach's pinks
barely visible

jp: .仰山に霧のはれけり付木突
ro: gyôsan ni kiri no hare keri tsukegi-tsuki
en:
when the mist clears
a mountain...
of fire chips

jp: .しきみ桶手からも霧は立にけり
ro: shikimi oke te kara mo kiri wa tachi ni keri
en:
from a hand that holds
a bucket of sacred branches...
mist rises

jp: .しきみさす手からも霧は立にけり
ro: shikimi sasu te kara mo kiri wa tachi ni keri
en:
from a hand
pricked by sacred shikimi...
mist rises

jp: .山霧のかかる家さへ祭哉
ro: yama-giri no kakaru ie sae matsuri kana
en:
even at a house
shrouded in mist...
a festival

jp: .妹が家は跡になりけり花の原
ro: imo ga ie wa ato ni nari keri hana no hara
en:
my dear one's house
behind it a field
of flowers

jp: .赤紙のちさい草履を玉迎
ro: aka-gami no chisai zôri wo tama mukae
en:
tiny sandals
made of red paper...
for the ancestor

jp: .迎鐘ならぬ前から露のちる
ro: mukae-gane naranu mae kara tsuyu no chiru
en:
when the bell tolls
for the ancestors...
dewdrops scatter

jp: .うかうかと盆も過たる灯ろ哉
ro: uka-uka to bon mo sugitaru tôrô kana
en:
the Bon Festival
flickers out too...
lanterns for the dead

jp: .夕風や木のない門の高灯籠
ro: yûkaze ya ki no nai kado no takadôro
en:
evening wind--
for the tree-less gate
a tall Bon lantern

jp: .よ所事と思へ思へど灯ろ哉
ro: yoso-goto to omoe omoedo tôro kana
en:
someone else's affair
you think...
lanterns for the dead

jp: .山かげの一軒家さへおどり哉
ro: yama kage no ikken-ya sae odori kana
en:
an isolated house
in mountain shade
but a festival dance!

jp: .山里やおどりもしらで年のよる
ro: yama-zato ya odori mo shirade toshi no yoru
en:
mountain village--
the old man doesn't know
the dance

jp: .七夕や都もおなじ秋の山
ro: tanabata ya miyako mo onaji aki no yama
en:
Tanabata Night
in Kyoto, the same
autumn mountain

jp: .人の世や山の小すみもほし迎
ro: hito no yo ya yama no kosumi mo hoshi mukae
en:
world of man--
in a mountain nook too
Tanabata stars

jp: .我星は上総の空をうろつくか
ro: waga hoshi wa kazusa no sora wo urotsuku ka
en:
sky over Kazusa--
is my star up there
prowling?

jp: .無縁時の鐘も聞へて大花火
ro: muen-ji no kane mo kikoete ôhanabi
en:
Muen Temple's bell
clangs too...
great fireworks

jp: .秋角力初まる日から山の雲
ro: aki sumô hajimaru hi kara yama no kumo
en:
autumn sumo tournament--
from day one
mountain clouds

jp: .咲かかる草の辺りに角力哉
ro: saki kakaru kusa no atari ni sumô kana
en:
heading straight
to the wildflowers...
sumo wrestler

jp: .淋さを鶴に及ぼすかがし哉
ro: sabishisa wo tsuru ni oyo[bo]su kagashi kana
en:
making the crane
feel lonely...
the scarecrow

jp: .最う古いかがしはないか角田川
ro: mô furui kagashi wa nai ka sumida-gawa
en:
was there ever
an older looking scarecrow?
Sumida River

jp: .えた町も夜はうつくしき砧哉
ro: eta mura mo yo wa utsukushiki kinuta kana
en:
in the outcasts' village too
a lovely night...
pounding cloth

jp: .小夜砧菰きて蘇鉄立にけり
ro: sayo-ginuta komo kite sotetsu tachi ni keri
en:
cloth-pounding at night--
a cycad tree wrapped
in a reed mat

jp: .兀山も見棄られぬぞ小夜砧
ro: hage yama mo misuterarenu zo sayo-ginuta
en:
even the bald mountain
isn't left out...
night cloth-pounding

jp: .身祝の榊もうへて砧哉
ro: mi-iwai no sakaki mo uete kinuta kana
en:
a sakaki tree planted
for good luck...
cloth-pounding

jp: .さをしかや恋初めてより山の雨
ro: saoshika ya koi somete yori yama no ame
en:
young buck--
when he starts to make love
mountain rain

jp: .死所もかなりに葺て鹿の鳴
ro: shinidoko mo kanari ni fuite shika no naku
en:
his dying place
fairly well thatched...
crying deer

jp: .なけ鶉邪魔なら庵もたたむべき
ro: nake uzura jama nara io mo tatamubeki
en:
sing, quail!
if my hut bothers you
I'll close it

jp: .人は年とるべきものぞ鴫の立
ro: hito wa toshitorubeki mono zo shigi no tatsu
en:
all people must
grow old...
the snipe rises

jp: .あのやうに我も老しか秋のてふ
ro: ano yô ni waga mo oishi ka aki no chô
en:
will I grow old
like you?
autumn butterfly

jp: .うろたへな寒くなるとて赤蜻蛉
ro: urotae na samuku naru tote aka tombo
en:
don't be bewildered
by the cold weather!
dragonfly

jp: .蜻蛉や二尺飛では又二尺
ro: tombô ya ni shaku tonde wa mata ni shaku
en:
dragonfly--
flying two feet
then two feet more

jp: .きりぎりす隣に居ても聞へけり
ro: kirigirisu tonari ni itte mo kikoe keri
en:
the katydid next door
clear
as a bell

jp: .その草はむしり残すぞきりぎりす
ro: sono kusa wa mushiri nokosu zo kirigirisu
en:
that grass over there
won't be cut...
katydid

jp: .焼原やはやくも鳴やきりぎりす
ro: yake hara ya hyaku mo naku [ya] kirigirisu
en:
a burned field
but soon he's singing...
katydid

jp: .夕月や流残りのきりぎりす
ro: yûzuki ya nagare nokori no kirigirisu
en:
evening moon--
surviving the flood
a katydid

jp: .雨落に生へ合せたり草の花
ro: amaochi ni hae awasetari kusa [no] hana
en:
in the rain gutter too
wildflowers
have sprouted

jp: .五六日居過す門や草の花
ro: go roku nichi I sugosu kado ya kusa no hana
en:
lasting five, six days
at the gate...
wildflower

jp: .魚どもの遊びありくや菊の花
ro: uodomo no asobi ariku ya kiku no hana
en:
fish frolicking
on foot...
chrysanthemums

jp: .菊園につっと出たる葎哉
ro: kiku-zono ni tsutto idetaru mugura kana
en:
in the mum garden
sprouting all at once...
weeds

jp: .柴門の薮の中迄小菊哉
ro: shiba kado no yabu no naka made ko-giku kana
en:
even in the thicket
beyond the bramble gate
a little chrysanthemum

jp: .白菊に拙き手水かかる也
ro: shira-giku ni tsutanaki chôzu kakaru nari
en:
a splash for the white
chrysanthemum...
hand-wash water

jp: .たやすくも菊の咲けり川の縁
ro: tayasuku mo kiku no saki keri kawa no fuchi
en:
chrysanthemums bloom
with ease...
river's edge

jp: .痩土にぼつぼつ菊の咲にけり
ro: yase tsuchi ni botsu-botsu kiku no saki ni keri
en:
in poor soil
little by little it blooms...
chrysanthemum

jp: .僧も立鶴も立たる野菊哉
ro: sô mo tachi tsuru mo tachitaru nogiku kana
en:
a standing priest
a standing crane...
field chrysanthemums

jp: .朝顔や藪蚊の中にりんとして
ro: asagao ya yabu ka no naka ni rin to shite
en:
morning-glories--
amid the mosquitoes
standing tall

jp: .蔦紅葉口紅つけし庇也
ro: tsuta momiji kuchibeni tsukeshi hisashi nari
en:
red-leaf ivy--
lipstick is applied
to the roof

jp: .しなのぢはそば咲けりと小幅綿
ro: shinano ji wa soba saki keri to kohabawata
en:
the Shinano road
through blooming buckwheat...
a swath of cloth

jp: .そばの花咲くや仏と二人前
ro: soba no hana saku ya hotoke to futarimae
en:
buckwheat blossoms
enough for the Buddha
and me

jp: .痩山にぽっと咲けりそばの花
ro: yase yama ni patto saki keri soba no hana
en:
on a barren mountain
it bloomed in a flash
buckwheat

jp: .啄木も日の暮かかる紅葉哉
ro: kitsutsuki mo hi no kure kakaru momiji kana
en:
the woodpecker too
engulfed in sunset...
red leaves

jp: .松切に鳥も去けり夕紅葉
ro: matsu kiru ni tori mo sari keri yûmomiji
en:
the birds have left
the chopped down pine...
evening's red leaves

jp: .箕をかつぐ人と連立紅葉哉
ro: mi wo katsugu hito to tsuredatsu momiji kana
en:
following the man
who shoulders a winnow...
red leaves

jp: .うかうかと出水に逢し木槿哉
ro: uka-uka to demizu ni aishi mukuge kana
en:
acting fidgety
in the flood...
roses of Sharon

jp: .寝る外に分別はなし花木槿
ro: neru hoka ni funbetsu wa nashi hana mukuge
en:
outside of sleeping
lacking good sense...
rose of Sharon

jp: .不平な垣もむくげは咲にけり
ro: futairana kaki mo mukuge wa saki ni keri
en:
an unlevel hedge, too
in bloom...
roses of Sharon

jp: .雨三粒おちてもぬれし瓢哉
ro: ame san tsube ochite mo nureshi fukube kana
en:
three drops of rain
and it's drenched...
the gourd

jp: .うきうきと草の咲そふ瓢哉
ro: uki-uki to kusa no sakisô fukube kana
en:
with light hearts
the grasses bloom...
gourds

jp: .見覚して鳥の立らん大瓢
ro: mioboe shite tori no tachiran ô fukube
en:
the bird flies off
making a mental note...
the big gourd

jp: .闇の夜に段々なるぞ種瓢
ro: yami [no] yo ni dan-dan naru zo tane fukube
en:
in the gloom of night
bit by bit it grows...
the gourd

jp: .前の人も春を待しか古畳
ro: mae no hito mo haru wo machishi ka furu-datami
en:
did others sit here too
waiting for spring?
old tatami mat

jp: .大年のよい夢見るかぬり枕
ro: ôtoshi no yoi yume miru ka nuri makura
en:
a good dream
for the year's end?
lacquered pillow

jp: .寝所はきのふ葺けり初時雨
ro: ne-dokoro wa kinou fuki keri hatsu shigure
en:
my sleeping place
just thatched yesterday...
first winter rain

jp: .寝始る其夜を竹の時雨哉
ro: ne hajimaru sono yo wo take no shigure kana
en:
falling to sleep--
tonight on the bamboo
winter rain

jp: .木がらしに口淋しいとゆふべ哉
ro: kogarashi ni kuchi sabishii to yûbe kana
en:
in winter wind
no one to talk to...
evening

jp: .木がらしに三尺店も我夜也
ro: kogarashi ni sanjakudana mo waga yo nari
en:
in winter wind
in three-foot wide lodgings...
my night

jp: .木がらしや小溝にけぶる竹火箸
ro: kogarashi ya ko dobu ni keburu take hibashi
en:
winter wind--
in a little ditch smoke
and bamboo tongs

jp: .木がらしや地びたに暮るる辻うたひ
ro: kogarashi ya jibita ni kururu tsuji-utai
en:
winter wind--
the street singer at dusk
hunkers to the ground

jp: .はつ雪に白湯すすりても我家哉
ro: hatsu yuki ni sayu susurite mo waga ya kana
en:
in first snowfall
though slurping only hot water...
my home

jp: .はつ雪や翌のけぶりのわら一把
ro: hatsu yuki ya asu no keburi no wara ichi wa
en:
first snowfall--
tomorrow's smoke one
bundle of straw

jp: .はつ雪や竹の夕を独寝て
ro: hatsu yuki ya take no yûbe wo hitori nete
en:
first snowfall--
in the bamboo evening
sleeping alone

jp: .初雪や古郷見ゆる壁の穴
ro: hatsu yuki ya furusato miyuru kabe no ana
en:
first snowfall--
my home village in a hole
in the wall

jp: .藪菊や霰ちる日に咲合
ro: yabu-giku ya arare chiru hi ni saki-awase
en:
thicket's chrysanthemum
on a day of hailstorm...
blooms

jp: .大霜の古家も人の地内也
ro: ôshimo no furuya mo hito no chinai nari
en:
heavy frost
on the old house, its owner
in the ground

jp: .淋しさは得心しても窓の霜
ro: sabishisa wa tokushin shite mo mado no shimo
en:
adding to
my solitude...
frost on the window

jp: .枯原の雨のひびきし枕哉
ro: kare-bara no ame no hibikishi makura kana
en:
rain on withered fields
resounds...
my pillow

jp: .野はかれて何ぞ喰たき庵哉
ro: no wa karete nani zo kuitaki iori kana
en:
withering fields--
oh for a bite to eat
in my hut!

jp: .芭蕉忌に先つつがなし菊の花
ro: bashôki ni mazu tsutsuganashi kiku [no] hana
en:
safe and sound
on Basho's Death-Day...
chrysanthemum

jp: .西山はもう鶯かはち敲
ro: nishi yama wa mô uguisu ka hachi tataki
en:
in western mountains
a nightingale already?
a monk beats his bowl

jp: .鉢敲今のが山の凹み哉
ro: hachi tataki ima no ga yama no kubomi kana
en:
a monk beats his bowl--
by now a dent
in the mountain!

jp: .月さすや年の市日の待乳山
ro: tsuki sasu ya toshi no ichibi no matsuchi yama
en:
shining moon--
the year's end fair
on Mount Matsuchi

jp: .年の市何しに出たと人のいふ
ro: toshi no ichi nani shi ni deta to hito no iu
en:
year's end fair
"What's he doing here?"
they ask

jp: .我宿は蠅もとしとる浦辺哉
ro: waga yado wa hae mo toshitoru urabe kana
en:
at my home
the flies too, a year older...
seacoast

jp: .冬篭其夜に聞くや山の雨
ro: fuyugomori sono yo ni kiku ya yama no ame
en:
winter seclusion--
all night the sound
of mountain rain

jp: .炭俵はやぬかるみに踏れけり
ro: sumidawara haya nukarumi ni fumare keri
en:
empty charcoal bag--
in the mud so quickly
trampled

jp: .ほたの火や目出度き御代の顔と顔
ro: hota no hi ya medetaki miyo no kao to kao
en:
wood fire--
oh happy age!
on every face

jp: .久木おふ片山かげや鰒汁
ro: hisagi-fû kata yama kage ya fukuto-jiru
en:
under tall oaks
in the mountain's shade
pufferfish soup

jp: .山風を踏こたへたりみそさざい
ro: yama kaze wo fumi kotaetari misosazai
en:
fighting the mountain wind
on foot...
a wren

jp: .みそさざいちっといふても日の暮る
ro: misosazai chitto iute mo hi no kururu
en:
little wren
despite your cheeping
the day ends

jp: .夕雨を鳴出したりみそさざい
ro: yû ame wo naki-ideshitari misosazai
en:
breaking out in song
at the evening rain...
wren

jp: .片壁は千鳥に住す夜也けり
ro: kara kabe wa chidori ni sumisu yo nari keri
en:
a plover lives
in one of my walls...
evening

jp: .麦の葉の夜はうつくしや千鳥鳴
ro: mugi no ha no yo wa utsukushi ya chidori naku
en:
"This evening in the barley field
so pretty!"
sings the plover

jp: .麦の葉は春のさま也なく千鳥
ro: mugi no ha wa haru no sama nari naku chidori
en:
"The field of barley
so spring-like!"
sings the plover

jp: .楢の葉の朝からちるやとうふぶね
ro: nara [no] ha no asa kara chiru ya tôfu-bune
en:
an oak leaf this morning
fallen
in the tofu tank

jp: .有明や窓の名残をちる紅葉
ro: ariake ya mado no nagori wo chiru momiji
en:
at dawn a keepsake
left on the window
red leaves

jp: .年立や日の出を前の舟の松
ro: toshi tatsu ya hi no de wo mae no fune no matsu
en:
a new year begins--
before sunrise
a pine-decorated boat

jp: .元日のけしきになるや泥に雪
ro: ganjitsu no keshiki ni naru ya doro ni yuki
en:
it's become
a First Month scene...
snow on the mud

jp: .鳥なくや野老畳もお正月
ro: tori naku ya norôtatami mo o-shôgatsu
en:
birds singing--
on a tatami mat in a field, too
happy New Year

jp: .わが春やたどん一つに小菜一把
ro: waga haru ya tadon hitotsu ni ona ichi wa
en:
my spring--
one charcoal ball
and a bundle of greens

jp: .欠鍋も旭さす也是も春
ro: kake nabe mo asahi sasu nari kore mo haru
en:
a cracked kettle
and the rising sun...
this too is spring

jp: .はつ春も月夜となるや顔の皺
ro: hatsu haru mo tsuki yo to naru ya kao no shiwa
en:
the new spring
turns moonlit night...
my wrinkled face

jp: .初春も月夜もよ所に伏家哉
ro: hatsu haru mo tsuki yo mo yoso ni fuseya kana
en:
spring's beginning
and bright moon are elsewhere...
my humble hut

jp: .ちぐはぐの下駄から春は立にけり
ro: chiguhagu no geta kara haru wa tachi ni keri
en:
the offbeat clomping
of clogs...
must be spring!

jp: .春立や草さへ持ったぬ門に迄
ro: haru tatsu ya kusa sae mottanu kado ni made
en:
spring begins--
even for a gate
without grass

jp: .葎家も春になりけり夜の雨
ro: mugura ya mo haru ni nari keri yoru [no] ame
en:
spring comes too
to the weed-thatched house...
evening rain

jp: .家二ッ三ッ四ッ凧の夕哉
ro: ie futatsu mitsu yotsu tako no yûbe kana
en:
two houses, three, four...
an evening
of kites

jp: .凧今木母寺は夜に入るぞ
ro: ikanobori ima mokuboji wa yo ni iru zo
en:
a kite--
Mokubo Temple settles
into evening

jp: .山かげや薮のうしろや凧
ro: yama kage ya yabu no ushiro ya ikanobori
en:
mountain shade--
deep in a thicket
a kite

jp: .霞む日も寝正月かよ山の家
ro: kasumu hi mo neshôgatsu ka yo yama no ie
en:
on this misty day
sleeping through New Year's?
mountain home

jp: .一桶は如来のためよ朝わかな
ro: hito oke wa nyorai no tame yo asa wakana
en:
one bucketful
for Buddha...
morning herbs

jp: .わかな摘鷺も淋しく思ふやと
ro: wakana tsumi sagi mo sabishiku omou ya to
en:
picking herbs
the heron also
seems lonely

jp: .わかなのや一葉摘んでは人をよぶ
ro: wakana no ya hito ha tsunde wa hito wo yobu
en:
herb garden--
picking one, he shouts
"Over here!"

jp: .揚土のいかにも春の日也けり
ro: agetsuchi no ikanimo haru no hi nari keri
en:
the earth mound's
part of it indeed...
a fine spring day

jp: .破風からも青空見ゆる春日哉
ro: hafu kara mo ao-zora miyuru haru hi kana
en:
even from the gable
clear blue sky...
a spring day

jp: .春の日を背筋にあてることし哉
ro: haru no hi [wo] sesuji ni ateru kotoshi kana
en:
exposing my spine
to the spring sun...
this year

jp: .春の日を降りくらしたる都哉
ro: haru no hi wo furikurashitaru miyako kana
en:
on the spring day
all day, rain...
Kyoto

jp: .春の日や暮ても見ゆる東山
ro: haru no hi ya kurete mo miyuru higashi yama
en:
spring day--
visible even after sunset
Higashi Mountains

jp: .砂をする大淀舟や暮遅き
ro: suna wo suru ôyodobune ya kure osoki
en:
grating on sand
the big ferryboat...
late sunset

jp: .雨がちに都の春も暮る也
ro: amegachi ni miyako no haru mo kururu nari
en:
in falling rain
in Kyoto too
dusk of spring

jp: .顔染し乙女も春の暮る哉
ro: kao someshi otome mo haru no kururu kana
en:
for the painted faced
maiden too...
spring dusk

jp: .下京の窓かぞへけり春の暮
ro: shimogyô no mado kazoe keri haru no kure
en:
counting the windows
of Shimogyo Town...
spring dusk

jp: .松に藤春も暮れぬと夕哉
ro: matsu ni fuji haru mo kurenu to yûbe kana
en:
for the wisteria in the pine, too
spring's dusk
this evening

jp: .木兎の面魂よ春の暮
ro: mimizuku no tsuradamashii haru no kure
en:
the little owl
makes a face...
spring dusk

jp: .舞々や翌なき春を顔を染て
ro: mai-mai ya asu naki haru wo kao wo somete
en:
water spider
on spring's last day
blushing

jp: .大和路や翌なき春をなく烏
ro: yamato-ji ya asu naki haru wo naku karasu
en:
road to Nara--
a crow caws
at spring's last day

jp: .小田の鶴又おりよかし春の雨
ro: oda no tsuru mata oriyokashi haru no ame
en:
rice field crane
again, come on down!
spring rain

jp: .黒門の半分見へて春の雨
ro: kurumon no hambun miete haru no ame
en:
the Black Gate
just half visible...
spring rain

jp: .春雨や家鴨よちよち門歩き
ro: harusame ya ahiru yochi-yochi kado aruki
en:
spring rain--
ducks waddle-waddle
to the gate

jp: .春雨や膳の際迄茶の木原
ro: harusame ya zen no kiwa made cha no kibara
en:
spring rain--
to the dinner tray's edge
the tea grove

jp: .春雨や蛤殻の朝の月
ro: harusame ya hamaguri-gara no asa no tsuki
en:
spring rain--
the morning moon
is a clam shell

jp: .春風の闇にも吹くや浦の家
ro: haru kaze no yami ni mo fuku ya ura no ie
en:
the spring breeze
blows in the dark...
house on the shore

jp: .春風や土人形をゑどる也
ro: haru kaze ya tsuchi ningyô wo wedoru nari
en:
spring breeze--
the clay doll
gets some color

jp: .棒先の茶笊かわくや春の風
ro: bô saki no chazaru kawaku ya haru no kaze
en:
on the tip of the pole
the tea strainer dries...
spring breeze

jp: .浅川や鍋すすぐ手も春の月
ro: asa kawa ya nabe susugu te mo haru no tsuki
en:
shallow river--
on hands rinsing a kettle
spring moon

jp: .春の月さはらば雫たりぬべし
ro: haru no tsuki sawaraba shizuku tarinubeshi
en:
spring moon--
if I touched it
it would drip

jp: .春の月軒の雫の又おちよ
ro: haru no tsuki noki no shizuku no mata ochi yo
en:
the spring moon
in a raindrop from the eaves...
falls again

jp: .夜明ても朧也けり角田川
ro: yoakete mo oboro nari keri sumida-gawa
en:
even at dawn
spring haze hovers...
Sumida River

jp: .青苔や膝の上迄春の虹
ro: ao-goke ya hiza no ue made haru no niji
en:
green moss--
all the way to my lap
spring's rainbow

jp: .鰯焼片山畠や薄がすみ
ro: iwashi yaku kata yama hata ya usu-gasumi
en:
grilling sardines
in a mountain field...
thin mist

jp: .薄霞む夕々の菜汁哉
ro: usu-gasumu yûbe-yûbe no na-zuyu kana
en:
thin mist--
night after night
vegetable soup

jp: .うら窓にいつもの人が霞む也
ro: ura mado ni itsumo [no] hito ga kasumu nari
en:
at the back window
the same person...
mist

jp: .かすむ日もうしろ見せたる伏家哉
ro: kasumu hi mo ushiro misetaru fuseya kana
en:
the misty day, too
viewed out back...
my humble hut

jp: .かすむ日や夕山かげの飴の笛
ro: kasumu hi ya yûyama kage no ame no fue
en:
misty day--
in evening mountain's shadow
candyman's flute

jp: .かりそめに出て霞むやつくば山
ro: karisome ni idete kasumu ya tsukuba yama
en:
peeking in, peeking out
of the mist...
Mount Tsukuba

jp: .盗する烏よそれも春がすみ
ro: nusumi suru karasu yo sore mo harugasumi
en:
thieving crow!
under a cloak
of spring mist

jp: .柱をも拭じまひけり春霞
ro: hashira wo mo fuki-jimai keri harugasumi
en:
the post is wiped
all clean...
spring mist

jp: .我袖も一ッに霞むゆふべ哉
ro: waga sode mo hitotsu ni kasumu yûbe kana
en:
even my sleeve
is one with the mist...
evening

jp: .陽炎の内からも立葎哉
ro: kagerô no nai kara mo tatsu mugura kana
en:
standing deep inside
the heat shimmers...
weeds

jp: .陽炎やいとしき人の杖の跡
ro: kagerô ya itoshiki hito no tsue no ato
en:
heat shimmers--
traces of a dear friend's
walking stick

jp: .陽炎や笠の手垢も春のさま
ro: kagerô ya kasa no teaka mo haru no sama
en:
heat shimmers--
umbrella-hat's handprints too
a sign of spring

jp: .家形に月のさしけり春の水
ro: ie nari ni tsuki [no] sashi keri haru no mizu
en:
moonlight halos
the house...
spring water

jp: .草の葉や彼岸団子にむしらるる
ro: kusa no ha ya higan dango ni mushiraruru
en:
blades of grass
are plucked for their sake...
equinox dumplings

jp: .山陰も桃の日あるか砂糖売
ro: yama kage mo momo no hi aru ka satô uri
en:
even in mountain shade
is it Peach Day?
sugar vendor

jp: .猿も来よ桃太郎来よ草の餅
ro: saru mo koyo momotarô koyo kusa no mochi
en:
come, monkey!
come, Peach Boy!
herb cakes

jp: .我宿の餅さへ青き夜也けり
ro: waga yado no mochi sae aoki yo nari keri
en:
even at my home
herbs for cake turn green...
evening

jp: .草つみのこぶしの前の入日哉
ro: kusa tsumi no kobushi no mae no irihi kana
en:
the herb picker
reaches...
for the setting sun

jp: .うつくしい鳥見し当よ山をやく
ro: utsukushii tori mishi ate yo yama wo yaku
en:
where I saw
a pretty bird...
they burn the mountain

jp: .又一つ山をやく也おぼろ也
ro: mata hitotsu yama wo yaku nari oboro nari
en:
another mountain
set on fire...
the haze thickens

jp: .山やくや眉にはらはら夜の雨
ro: yama yaku ya mayu ni hara-hara yoru no ame
en:
dead grass burning--
on my eyebrows pattering
evening rain

jp: .草蒔や肴焼香も小昼過
ro: kusa maku ya sakana yaku ka mo ko-biru sugi
en:
sowing herbs--
the smell of fish cooking
a little past noon

jp: .妻乞や一角とれしのらの猫
ro: tsuma-goi ya hito kado toreshi nora no neko
en:
his looking for a wife
makes him sociable...
stray cat

jp: .のら猫も妻かせぎする夜也けり
ro: nora neko mo tsuma kasegi suru yo nari keri
en:
the stray cat too
goes wife-hunting...
nightfall

jp: .山猫も恋は致すや門のぞき
ro: yama neko mo koi wa itasu yo kado nozoki
en:
even the wild cat
looks for sex...
peeking in the gate

jp: .山猫や恋から直に里馴るる
ro: yama neko ya koi kara sugu ni sato naruru
en:
wild cat--
after making love
he's the town pet

jp: .鳥の巣の乾く間もなし山の雨
ro: tori no su no kawaku ma mo nashi yama no ame
en:
no break for the bird's nest
to dry...
mountain rain

jp: .其夜から雨に逢けり巣立鳥
ro: sono yo kara ame ni ai keri su-dachi tori
en:
from night onward
rain...
birds who've left the nest

jp: .人鬼が野山に住ぞ巣立鳥
ro: hito oni ga no yama ni sumu zo su-dachi tori
en:
"There's human goblins
in the fields and mountains!"
bird leaving the nest

jp: .浅草や乙鳥とぶ日の借木履
ro: asakusa ya tsubame tobu hi no kari bokuri
en:
Asakusa--
on the day the swallows fly
rented clogs

jp: .草の葉のひたひた汐やとぶ乙鳥
ro: kusa no ha no hita-hita shio ya tobu tsubame
en:
blades of grass
swish in the tide...
a swallow flies

jp: .草の葉や燕来初てうつくしき
ro: kusa no ha ya tsubame kisomete utsukushiki
en:
blades of grass--
swallows start arriving
so pretty

jp: .さし汐も朝はうれしやとぶ乙鳥
ro: sashishio mo asa wa ureshi ya tobu tsubame
en:
high tide
and a happy morning...
swallows flying

jp: .乙鳥のけぶたい顔はせざりけり
ro: tsubakura no kebutai kao wa sezari keri
en:
a swallow--
not at all bothered
by my smoke

jp: .乙鳥もことし嫌ひし葎哉
ro: tsubakura mo kotoshi kiraishi mugura kana
en:
the swallows, too
avoid it this year...
patch of weeds

jp: .あさぢふは夜もうれしや雉なく
ro: asajiu wa yoru mo ureshi ya kigisu naku
en:
a happy night
even among the rushes...
a pheasant cries

jp: .雉なくやきのふは見へぬ山畠
ro: kiji naku ya kinou wa mienu yama hatake
en:
a pheasant cries--
yesterday it wasn't there
mountain field

jp: .雉なくや立草伏し馬の顔
ro: kiji naku ya tachi kusa fuseshi uma no kao
en:
a pheasant cries--
bedded down in tall grass
a horse's face!

jp: .草山に顔おし入て雉のなく
ro: kusa yama ni kao oshi-irete kiki no naku
en:
poking his face
into the haystack...
a pheasant cries

jp: .菜の花がはなれにくいか小田の雁
ro: na no hana ga hanare nikui ka oda [no] kari
en:
is it hard leaving behind
the rape blossoms?
rice field geese

jp: .あさぢふや目出度雨になく蛙
ro: asajiu ya medetai ame ni naku kawazu
en:
celebrating the rain
in the reeds
croaking frogs

jp: .入相は蛙の目にも涙哉
ro: iriai wa kawazu no me ni mo namida kana
en:
sunset--
tears shine in a frog's eyes
too

jp: .片ひざは月夜也けり夕蛙
ro: katahiza wa tsuki yo nari keri yû kawazu
en:
on one knee
the moonlight...
frog in the evening

jp: .蛙とぶ程はふる也草の雨
ro: kawazu tobu hodo wa furu nari kusa no ame
en:
looks almost
like frogs hopping!
rain on the grass

jp: .草陰にぶつくさぬかす蛙哉
ro: kusa kage ni butsukusa nukasu kawazu kana
en:
in grassy shade
such rude grumbling...
a frog

jp: .草かげや何をぶつくさゆふ蛙
ro: kusa kage ya nani wo butsukusa yû kawazu
en:
in grassy shade
what's that grumbling?
evening frog

jp: .なく蛙此夜葎も伸ぬべし
ro: naku kawazu kono yo mugura mo nobinu-beshi
en:
frogs singing--
"Tonight let the weeds
grow taller!"

jp: .葉がくれに鳴ぬつもりの蛙哉
ro: ha-gakure ni nakanu tsumori no kawazu kana
en:
in leafy shade
deciding not to croak...
a frog

jp: .痩藪も己が夜也なく蛙
ro: yase yabu mo ore ga yoru nari naku kawazu
en:
even in a sparse thicket
"This is our night!"
croak the frogs

jp: .糸屑にきのふの露や春のてふ
ro: itokuzu ni kinou no tsuya ya haru no chô
en:
in the waste threads
yesterday's dewdrops...
spring butterfly

jp: .すのへりにひたとひっつく小てふ哉
ro: su no heri ni hitato hittsuku ko chô kana
en:
clinging to the edge
of the reed mat...
little butterfly

jp: .すりこ木の舟にひっつく小てふ哉
ro: surikogi no fune ni hittsuku ko chô kana
en:
clinging to
the pestle's trough...
little butterfly

jp: .蝶とぶや二軒もやひの痩畠
ro: chô tobu ya ni ken mo yahi no yase hatake
en:
a butterfly flits--
two houses with piss-poor
gardens

jp: .蝶とぶや夕飯過の寺参り
ro: chô tobu ya yûmeshi sugi no tera mairi
en:
flitting butterfly--
after dinner, a temple
pilgrimage

jp: .とぶ蝶に追抜れけり紙草履
ro: tobu chô ni oi-nukure keri kami zôri
en:
a flitting butterfly
outstrips me...
paper sandals

jp: .鳥もなき蝶も飛けり古畳
ro: tori mo naki chô mo tobi keri furu tatami
en:
birds singing
butterflies flitting...
old tatami mat

jp: .二三本茄子植ても小てふ哉
ro: ni sanbon nasubi uete mo ko chô kana
en:
even when planting
two or three eggplants...
little butterflies

jp: .文七とたがひ違ひに小てふ哉
ro: bunshichi to tagai chigai ni ko chô kana
en:
now on, now off
the hairdresser...
little butterfly

jp: .町口ははや夜に入し小てふ哉
ro: machiguchi wa haya yo ni irishi ko chô kana
en:
at Machiguchi
night falls so fast...
little butterfly

jp: .豆程の人顕れし小てふ哉
ro: mame hodo no hito arawareshi ko chô kana
en:
a little person
enters the scene...
a little butterfly

jp: .我庵は蝶の寝所とゆふべ哉
ro: waga io wa chô no nedoko to yûbe kana
en:
my hut
the butterfly's sleeping place
tonight

jp: .二三日はなぐさみといふ蚕哉
ro: ni san hi wa nagusami to iu kaiko kana
en:
for two or three days
its pure fun...
for silkworms

jp: .三ケ月や田螺をさぐる腕の先
ro: mikazuki ya tanishi wo saguru ude no saki
en:
a sickle moon--
hands groping
for pond snails

jp: .蜆さへ昔男のゆかりにて
ro: shijimi sae mukashi otoko no yukari nite
en:
even the clams
are related to the great
men of old

jp: .田芹摘み鶴に拙く思れな
ro: ta seri tsumi tsuru ni tsutanaku omoware na
en:
parsley pickers--
don't let the crane
think you're clumsy!

jp: .菜の花も一ッ夜明やよしの山
ro: na no hana mo hitotsu yoake ya yoshino yama
en:
one more dawn
for the flowering rape...
Yoshino Hill

jp: .今晴れし雨とも見へてわらび哉
ro: ima hareshi ame tomo miete warabi kana
en:
the rain cleared
recently, I see...
dripping bracken

jp: .誰が手につみ切れしよ痩蕨
ro: tare ga te ni tsumikirareshi yo yase warabi
en:
I wonder who picked
all this?
skinny bracken

jp: .金のなる木のめはりけりえたが家
ro: kane no naru ki no me hari keri eta ga ie
en:
turning gold
budding branches overspread...
outcast's home

jp: .びんずるを一なでなでて木の芽哉
ro: binzuru wo hito nade-nadete ki no me kana
en:
giving Holy Binzuru
a rub...
the budding tree

jp: .庵椿見すぼらしくはなかりけり
ro: io tsubaki misuborashiku wa nakari keri
en:
my hut's camellias--
not a shoddy one
among them

jp: .牛の子の顔をつん出す椿哉
ro: ushi no ko no kao wo tsundasu tsubaki kana
en:
a calf's face
stretches forward...
camellias

jp: .馬貝を我もはかうよ里の梅
ro: umagai wo waga mo hakau yo sato no ume
en:
I'll put on shell-sandals
too!
village plum blossoms

jp: .梅咲くや三文笛も音を出して
ro: ume saku ya san mon fue mo ne wo dashite
en:
plum blossoms--
the sound of a three-penny
flute

jp: .梅咲くや山の小すみは誰が家
ro: ume saku ya yama no kosumi wa tare ga ie
en:
plum blossoms--
in a mountain nook
somebody's house

jp: .梅のちる空は巳午の間哉
ro: ume no chiru sora wa mi uma no aida kana
en:
plum blossoms scatter
in the sky, nine a.m.
to one p.m.

jp: .蒲焼の香にまけじとや梅の花
ro: kabayaki no ka ni makeji to ya ume [no] hana
en:
unconquered
by the smell of broiled eels...
plum blossoms

jp: .袖口は去年のぼろ也梅の花
ro: sodeguchi wa kozo no boro nari ume no hana
en:
my kimono cuffs
are last year's rags...
plum blossoms

jp: .ちるは梅畠の足跡大きさよ
ro: chiru wa ume hata no ashiato ôkisa yo
en:
through the garden's fallen
plum blossoms, footprints...
he was big!

jp: .塊に裾引ずって梅の花
ro: tsuchikure ni suso hikizutte ume no hana
en:
in cuffs dragging
through the dirt...
plum blossoms

jp: .寝勝手や夜はさまざまの梅の花
ro: ne katte ya yo wa sama-zama no ume [no] hana
en:
while I slept--
night unfurled all kinds
of plum blossoms

jp: .松が根に一息しては梅の花
ro: matsu ga ne [ni] hito iki shite wa ume no hana
en:
catching its breath
on the pine tree's root...
plum blossom

jp: .梅咲や江戸見て来る子ども客
ro: ume saku ya edo mite kitaru kodomo kyaku
en:
plum blossoms--
they've come to see Edo
child tourists

jp: .梅さくやかねの盥の三ケの月
ro: ume saku ya kane no tarai no mike no tsuki
en:
plum blossoms--
in a metal tub
a sickle moon

jp: .素湯売りも久しくなるや花の山
ro: sayu uri mo hisashiku naru ya hana no yama
en:
even the hot water vendor
lingers...
blossoming mountain

jp: .ちる花を屁とも思はぬ御顔哉
ro: chiru hana wo he to mo omowanu o-kao kana
en:
not giving a damn
that cherry blossoms fall...
his stern face

jp: .ちる花に活過したりとゆふべ哉
ro: chiru hana ni iki-sugoshitari to yûbe kana
en:
in scattering blossoms
I've lived too long...
evening

jp: .ちる花や土の西行もうかれ顔
ro: chiru hana ya tsuchi no saigyô mo ukare kao
en:
cherry blossoms scatter--
even the clay Saigyo
looks merry

jp: .花さけや惟然が鼾止るやら
ro: hana sake ya izen [ga] ibiki tomaru yara
en:
bloom, cherry trees!
Izen's snoring
may stop

jp: .花に雨糸楯着たる御顔哉
ro: hana ni ame itodate kitaru o-kao kana
en:
rain on blossoms--
under a hemp tarp
his stern face

jp: .花の山飯買家はかすむ也
ro: hana no yama meshi kau ie wa kasumu nari
en:
blossoming mountain--
the little food shop
lost in mist

jp: .後から吹来る桜々哉
ro: ushiro kara fuki-kuru sakura sakura kana
en:
from behind me
they blow...cherry blossoms!
cherry blossoms!

jp: .かいはいの口すぎになる桜哉
ro: kaiwai no kuchi sugi ni naru sakura kana
en:
feeding the whole
neighborhood...
cherry blossoms

jp: .米袋空しくなれど桜哉
ro: kome-bukuro munashiku naredo sakura kana
en:
though my rice sack
is empty...
cherry blossoms!

jp: .桜咲く春の山辺や別の素湯
ro: sakura saku haru no yamabe ya betsu no sayu
en:
cherry blossoms
on the spring mountain...
another hot water?

jp: .一里の身すぎの桜咲にけり
ro: hito sato no misugi no sakura saki ni keri
en:
it's how the village
makes a living...
cherry trees in bloom

jp: .桃の門猫を秤にかける也
ro: momo no kado neko wo hakari ni kakeru nari
en:
peach blossoms--
at the gate he weighs
the cat

jp: .青柳や二軒もやひの茶呑橋
ro: ao yagi ya ni ken moyai no cha nomi hashi
en:
green willow--
jointly owned by neighbors
a tea-drinker's bridge

jp: .朝やけも又めづらしき柳哉
ro: asayake mo mata mezurashiki yanagi kana
en:
dawn's glow
even more of a wonder...
willow tree

jp: .入相を待遠しがる柳哉
ro: iriai wo machidôshigaru yanagi kana
en:
waiting and waiting
for sunset...
the willow tree

jp: .入口に柳の立し都哉
ro: iriguchi ni yanagi no tatashi miyako kana
en:
a willow stands
at the entrance gate...
Kyoto

jp: .うとましき片壁かくす柳哉
ro: utomashiki kata kabe kakusu yanagi kana
en:
annoyingly
it hides one wall...
willow

jp: .さし柳翌は出て行庵也
ro: sashi-yanagi asu wa dete yuku iori nari
en:
willow tree graft--
tomorrow you leave
the hut

jp: .土染もうれしく見へて柳哉
ro: tsuchizome mo ureshiku miete yanagi kana
en:
the earth-dyed cotton
looking happy too...
willow tree

jp: .炎天にてり殺されん天窓哉
ro: enten ni teri korosaren atama kana
en:
in sweltering heat
sunshine kills...
my poor head!

jp: .夏の夜やあなどる門の草の花
ro: natsu no ya ya anadoru kado no kusa no hana
en:
summer night--
the disdained gate's
wildflowers

jp: .五月雨におっぴしげたる住居哉
ro: samidare ni oppishigetaru sumai kana
en:
crushed
under the Fifth Month rain...
my home

jp: .すき腹に風の吹けり雲の峰
ro: sukihara ni kaze no fuki keri kumo no mine
en:
for my empty belly
the wind blows...
billowing clouds

jp: .峰となる雲が行ぞよ笠の先
ro: mine to naru kumo ga yuku zo yo kasa no saki
en:
billowing clouds
on the move...
before my umbrella-hat

jp: .あさぢふや夏の月夜の遠砧
ro: asajiu ya natsu no tsuki yo no tô-ginuta
en:
a reedy place--
in summer moonlight, distant
cloth-pounding

jp: .鶯も鳴さふらふぞ苔清水
ro: uguisu mo naki sôrô zo koke shimizu
en:
the nightingale
sings too...
pure water over moss

jp: .青田中さまさせて又入る湯哉
ro: aoda naka samasasete mata iru yu kana
en:
chilled amid the green
rice field...
back into the hot tub

jp: .其次の稗もそよそよ青田哉
ro: sono tsugi no hie mo soyo-soyo aoda kana
en:
barnyard grass too
rustles, rustles...
like the green rice field

jp: .うれしさや御祓の宵の天の川
ro: ureshisa ya misogi no yoi no ama no kawa
en:
a happy sight--
on purification evening
the Milky Way

jp: .夕はらひ竹をぬらして済す也
ro: yû harai take wo nureshite sumasu nari
en:
evening purification--
a splash of water on bamboo
will do

jp: .身一ッや死ば簾の青いうち
ro: mi hitotsu ya shinaba sudare no aoi uchi
en:
my life--
if I die may the bamboo blinds
still be green

jp: .団扇張って先そよがする葎哉
ro: uchiwa hatte mazu soyogasuru mugura kana
en:
after re-papering
the first thing I fan...
weeds

jp: .反故団扇しゃにかまへたるひとり哉
ro: hogo uchiwa sha ni kamaetaru hitori kana
en:
with my wastepaper fan
striking poses...
alone

jp: .夕陰のはらはら雨に団扇哉
ro: yûkage no hara-hara ame ni uchiwa kana
en:
evening shadows--
rain pitter-patters
on my fan

jp: .買水を皆竹に打つゆふべ哉
ro: kai mizu wo mina take ni utsu yûbe kana
en:
all the bought water
is for the bamboo...
evening

jp: .板塀に鼻のつかへる涼哉
ro: itabei ni hana no tsukaeru suzumi kana
en:
my nose
to a wooden fence...
cool air

jp: .宵々や下水の際もゆふ涼み
ro: yoi-yoi ya gesui no kiwa mo yûsuzumi
en:
every evening
at the canal's edge...
evening cool

jp: .夜涼や蟾が出ても福といふ
ro: yo suzumi ya hiki ga idete mo fuku to iu
en:
evening cool--
the toad who comes out
I call "Lucky"

jp: .降雨は去年のさま也時鳥
ro: furu ame wa kozo no sama nari hototogisu
en:
this falling rain
feels like last year...
"cuckoo!"

jp: .午の貝うしろになりて閑古鳥
ro: uma no kai ushiro ni narite kankodori
en:
after the trumpet-shell's
blast, another...
mountain cuckoo

jp: .草も木も源氏の風やとぶ蛍
ro: kusa mo ki mo genji no kaze ya tobu hotaru
en:
in grass, in trees
the army of the Genji...
fireflies flit

jp: .一しめり松浦のうらを蛍哉
ro: hito shimeri matsura no ura wo hotaru kana
en:
a rain sprinkle...they're off
to Matsura Lagoon!
fireflies

jp: .宵々はきたない竹も蛍哉
ro: yoi-yoi wa kitanai take mo hotaru kana
en:
every evening
even in the dirty bamboo...
fireflies

jp: .蜘の巣に月さしこんで夜のせみ
ro: kumo no su ni tsuki sashikonde yoru no semi
en:
on the moonlit spider web
an evening
cicada

jp: .蝉時雨蝶は日やけもせざりけり
ro: semi shigure chô wa hiyake mo se[za]ri keri
en:
cicada chorus--
for the butterfly too
no sunburn

jp: .せみ啼や梨にかぶせる紙袋
ro: semi naku ya nashi ni kabuseru kami-bukuro
en:
a cicada chirrs--
covering the pears
a paper bag

jp: .朝やけがよろこばしいかかたつぶり
ro: asayake ga yorokobashii ka katatsuburi
en:
does the red dawn
delight you
snail?

jp: .かたつぶり蝶はいきせきさわぐ也
ro: katatsuburi chô wa ikiseki sawagu nari
en:
snail--
the butterfly in a mad
hurry

jp: .昼顔の秣の員に刈れけり
ro: hirugao no magusa no kazu ni karare keri
en:
day flowers
along with the hay...
clipped

jp: .蓮の花辰上りしと人のいふ
ro: hasu [no] hana tatsu noborishi to hito no iu
en:
lotus blossom--
a dragon once rode you
people say

jp: .足首の埃たたいて花さうぶ
ro: ashikubi no hokori-tataite hana shôbu
en:
dusting off
my ankles...
irises blooming

jp: .うしろ日のいらいらしさよ花あやめ
ro: ushiro hi no irairashisa yo hana ayame
en:
the sunlight behind
is irritating...
blooming irises

jp: .見るうちに日のさしにけり花せふぶ
ro: miru uchi ni hi no sashi ni keri hana shôbu
en:
while looking at them
sunlight hits...
blooming irises

jp: .瓜一ッ丸にしづまぬ井也けり
ro: uri hitotsu maru ni shizumanu i nari keri
en:
the melon
can't sink completely...
the well

jp: .加茂川や瓜つけさせて月は入る
ro: kamo-gawa ya uri tsukesasete tsuki wa iru
en:
Kamo River--
after making a melon soak
the moon sets

jp: .僧入れぬ垣の卯の花咲にけり
ro: sô irenu kaki no u [no] hana saki ni keri
en:
a hedge where no priests
enter...
deutzia in bloom

jp: .人形りに穴の明く也花うの木
ro: hito nari ni ana no aku nari hana u no ki
en:
a person-shaped
hole beckons...
deutzia blossoms

jp: .小朝顔大朝顔も九月哉
ro: ko asagao ôasagao mo kugatsu kana
en:
little morning-glories
big morning-glories...
it's Ninth Month!

jp: .朝寒し寒しと菜うり箕うり哉
ro: asa samushi samushi to nauri miuri kana
en:
so cold in morning's cold--
vegetable vendor
winnow vendor

jp: .朝寒や蟾も眼を皿にして
ro: asa-zamu ya hiki mo manako wo sara ni shite
en:
morning cold--
the toad's eyes too
open wide

jp: .青柳の門にはらはら夜寒哉
ro: ao yagi no kado ni hara-hara yozamu kana
en:
green willow at the gate
rustling...
a cold night

jp: .二度生の瓜も花咲く夜寒哉
ro: ni do-bae no uri mo hana saku yozamu kana
en:
even the replanted
melon blooms...
a cold night

jp: .有明に躍りし時の榎哉
ro: ariake ni odorishi toki no enoki kana
en:
dawn is your time
for dancing...
nettle tree

jp: .鶴亀の上にも秋の夕哉
ro: tsuru kame no ue ni mo aki no yûbe kana
en:
even tortoise and crane
meet their fate...
autumn evening

jp: .かつしかや月さす家は下水端
ro: katsushika ya tsuki sasu ie wa gesui-bata
en:
Katsushika--
a moonlit house
by a sewer

jp: .里の火の古めかしたる月夜哉
ro: sato no hi no furumekashitaru tsuki yo kana
en:
the village fires
burn anciently...
a moonlit night

jp: .汁の実を取に出ても月よ哉
ro: shiru no mi wo tori ni idete mo tsuki yo kana
en:
going out
to get soup stock...
bright moon

jp: .むさしのに住居合せて秋の月
ro: musashi no ni sumai awasete aki no tsuki
en:
on Musashi Plain
complementing a house...
autumn moon

jp: .むさしのや犬のこふ家も月さして
ro: musashi no ya inu no kôka mo tsuki sashite
en:
Musashi Plain--
over the dog's toilet too
a bright moon

jp: .山の月親は綱引子はおがむ
ro: yama no tsuki oya [wa] tsuna hiki ko wa ogamu
en:
mountain moon--
father pulls the bell rope
his child prays

jp: .待宵の松葉焚さへさが野哉
ro: matsuyoi no matsuba taku sae saga no kana
en:
almost a harvest moon
burning pine needles...
Saga Field

jp: .雨降らぬ空も見へけり月一夜
ro: ame furanu sora mo mie keri tsuki hito yo
en:
in some sky
rain isn't falling...
harvest moon night

jp: .雨降も角田河原や月一夜
ro: ame furi mo sumida kawara ya tsuki hito yo
en:
rain falling, too
on Sumida's river beach...
harvest moon night

jp: .家かりて先名月も二度目哉
ro: ie karite mazu meigetsu mo ni do me kana
en:
after renting the house
the first thing: moon gazing
twice

jp: .家かりてから名月も二度目哉
ro: ie karite kara meigetsu mo ni do me kana
en:
after renting the house
moon-gazing there...
twice

jp: .大雨や月見の舟も見へてふる
ro: ôame ya tsukimi no fune mo miete furu
en:
a big rain--
on the moon-gazing boat
watching it fall

jp: .けふの月我もむさしに住合せ
ro: kyô no tsuki waga mo musashi ni sumi-awase
en:
tonight's moon--
I, too, am staying
in Musashi!

jp: .年よりや月を見るにもなむあみだ
ro: toshiyori ya tsuki wo miru ni mo namuamida
en:
growing old--
even while moon gazing
praising Buddha!

jp: .後の月片山かげのくひ祭
ro: nochi no tsuki kata yama kage no kui matsuri
en:
Ninth Month moon--
in the mountain's shade
a food festival

jp: .雨がちに十三夜とは成にけり
ro: amegachi ni jû san yo to wa nari ni keri
en:
rain, rain!
on the 13th night
of Ninth Month

jp: .そば花は山にかくれて後の月
ro: soba hana wa yama ni kakurete nochi no tsuki
en:
the mountain's blooming
buckwheat hides it...
Ninth Month moon

jp: .秋雨のこぼれ安さよ片山家
ro: aki ame no kobore yasusa yo katayamaga
en:
no fear
of autumn rain's downpour...
mountainside house

jp: .翌の茶の松葉かくらん秋の雨
ro: asu no cha no matsuba kakuran aki [no] ame
en:
he rakes pine needles
for tomorrow's tea, perhaps...
autumn rain

jp: .殻桶に鹿の立ち添ふ秋の雨
ro: kara oke ni shika no tachisou aki no ame
en:
the deer stands close
to the husk bucket...
autumn rain

jp: .草切の足にひっつく秋の雨
ro: kusa-gire no ashi ni hittsuku aki no ame
en:
the cut grass
sticks to my feet...
autumn rain

jp: .けふもけふも秋雨す也片山家
ro: kyô mo kyô mo aki amesu nari katayamaga
en:
today too, today too
autumn rain...
mountainside house

jp: .山畠や鳩が鳴ても秋の雨
ro: yama hata ya hato ga naite mo aki no ame
en:
mountain field--
pigeons cooing
in autumn rain

jp: .秋風にあなた任の小蝶哉
ro: aki kaze ni anata makase no ko chô kana
en:
in autumn wind
trusting in the Buddha...
little butterfly

jp: .秋風の吹夜吹夜や窓明り
ro: aki kaze no fuku yo fuku yo ya mado akeri
en:
an autumn wind's
blowing! blowing! night...
open window

jp: .秋風や家さへ持たぬ大男
ro: aki kaze ya ie sae motanu dai [no] otoko
en:
autumn wind--
without even a house
the "big man"

jp: .秋風や草より先に人の顔
ro: aki kaze ya kusa yori saki ni hito no kao
en:
autumn wind--
topping the grasses
someone's face

jp: .穴底の仏の顔も秋の風
ro: anasoko no hotoke no kao mo aki no kaze
en:
reaching the face
of Buddha in his niche...
autumn wind

jp: .水打し石なら木なら秋の風
ro: mizu uchishi ishi nara ki nara aki no kaze
en:
water splashed
on the stone, on the tree...
autumn wind

jp: .見る度に秋風吹や江戸の空
ro: miru tabi ni aki kaze fuku ya e[do] no sora
en:
each time I look
autumn wind is blowing...
Edo's sky

jp: .朝霧の引からまりし柳哉
ro: asa-giri no hikikaramarishi yanagi kana
en:
the morning mist
tangled
in the willow

jp: .一薮は別の夕霧かかる也
ro: hito yabu wa betsu no yûgiri kakaru nari
en:
over one thicket
a custom-made shroud...
evening mist

jp: .秋の山活て居とてうつ鉦か
ro: aki no yama ikite iru tote utsu kane ka
en:
autumn mountain--
is he banging that gong
because he's alive?

jp: .秋の山一つ一つに夕哉
ro: aki no yama hitotsu hitotsu ni yûbe kana
en:
autumn mountains
one by one
the evening falls

jp: .足元に日落て秋の山辺哉
ro: ashi moto ni hi ochite aki no yamabe kana
en:
at my feet
sunset's rays, autumn
mountain

jp: .鳥鳴て又鐘がなる秋の山
ro: tori naite mata kane ga naru aki no yama
en:
bird sings again
bell tolls again...
autumn mountain

jp: .人顔も同じ夕や秋の山
ro: hito-gao mo onaji yûbe ya aki no yama
en:
in people's faces
the same darkness...
autumn mountain

jp: .戸口迄秋の野らなる雨日哉
ro: toguchi made aki no nora naru ame hi kana
en:
up to my doorway
the autumn field blooms...
rainy day

jp: .あばら家も夜は涼しき灯籠哉
ro: abaraya mo yoru wa suzushiki tôro kana
en:
at my ramshackle hut, too
night is cool...
lanterns for the dead

jp: .寒い程草葉ぬらして灯籠哉
ro: samui hodo kusaba nurashite tôro kana
en:
almost cold
drenched in grass...
lanterns for the dead

jp: .松風も念入て吹く灯籠哉
ro: matsu kaze mo nen irete fuku tôro kana
en:
the pine breeze too
blows carefully...
lanterns for the dead

jp: .隠家も星待顔の夜也けり
ro: kakurega mo hoshi machi-gao no yo nari keri
en:
at the hermit's hut, too--
an upturned face awaits
the stars

jp: .星待や亀も涼しいうしろつき
ro: hoshi matsu ya kame mo suzushii ushirotsuki
en:
awaiting the stars--
even a turtle cools
his behind

jp: .しゃんとした松と並ぶや男星
ro: shan to shita matsu to nara[bu] otoko-boshi
en:
lined up perfectly
with the pine...
Herder Star

jp: .とうとうと紅葉吹つけるかがし哉
ro: tôtô to momiji fuki-tsukeru kagashi kana
en:
a rush of red leaves
blown against him...
scarecrow

jp: .一ッ宛寒い風吹鳴子哉
ro: hitotsu-zutsu samui kaze fuku naruko kana
en:
one by one
the frigid gusts...
bird clapper

jp: .浅山や砧の後もなつかしき
ro: asa yama ya kinuta no ato mo natsukashiki
en:
Mount Asa--
even when cloth-pounding stops
sweet nostalgia

jp: .新しい家も三ッ四ッきぬた哉
ro: atarashii ie mo mitsu yotsu kinuta kana
en:
new house--
here too, three or four
cloth-pounders

jp: .けぶり立松立そして砧哉
ro: keburi tachi matsu tachi soshite kinuta kana
en:
rising smoke
towering pine, then...
cloth-pounding

jp: .梟も役にして来る砧哉
ro: fukurô mo yaku ni shite kuru kinuta kana
en:
the owl comes
to lend a hand...
cloth-pounding

jp: .みちのくの鬼のすみかも砧哉
ro: michi no ku no oni no sumika mo kinuta kana
en:
remote province--
even in the haunted field
pounding cloth

jp: .投やりの菊も新酒のゆふべ哉
ro: nageyari no kikumo shinshu no yûbe kana
en:
I leave my chrysanthemum
for the evening...
fresh-brewed sake

jp: .大汐にざぶりざぶりと男鹿哉
ro: ôshio ni zaburi-zaburi to oshika kana
en:
high tide--
splish-splash
goes the buck

jp: .さをしかの萩にかくれしつもり哉
ro: saoshika no hagi ni kakureshi tsumori kana
en:
the young buck
tries to hide
in bush clover

jp: .むら萩に隠れた気かよ鹿の顔
ro: mura hagi ni kakureta ki ka yo shika no kao
en:
do you think you're hiding
in that bush clover?
face of a deer

jp: .山の雨鹿の涙も交るべし
ro: yama no ame shika no namida mo majirubeshi
en:
this mountain rain
and the deer's tears
must be mingling

jp: .木つつきの飛んでから入る庵哉
ro: kitsutsuki no tonde kara iru iori kana
en:
only after the woodpecker
flies...
back in my hut

jp: .木つつきの松に来る迄老にけり
ro: kitsutuki no matsu ni kuru made oi ni keri
en:
the woodpecker returns
to the pine...
now I'm old

jp: .木つつきや一ッ所に日の暮るる
ro: kitsutsuki ya hitotsu tokoro ni hi no kururu
en:
the woodpecker works
one spot...
all through sunset

jp: .木つつきの死ねとて敲く柱哉
ro: kitsutsuki no shine tote tataku hashira kana
en:
the woodpecker
pecks it to death...
the post

jp: .雁鳴や旅寝の空の目にうかぶ
ro: kari naku ya tabine no sora no me ni ukabu
en:
honking geese--
I picture skies
over inns

jp: .けふ翌の秋となりけり小田の雁
ro: kyô asu no aki to nari keri oda [no] kari
en:
just today and tomorrow
left of autumn!
rice field geese

jp: .虫なくやきのふは見へぬ壁の穴
ro: mushi naku ya kinou wa mienu kabe no ana
en:
an insect chirps--
yesterday it wasn't there
hole in the wall

jp: .こおろぎや江戸の人にも住馴るる
ro: kôrogi ya edo no hito ni mo sumi naruru
en:
cricket--
you too have adapted to life
in Edo

jp: .きりぎりすきりきり死もせざりけり
ro: kirigirisu kiri-kiri shini mo sezari keri
en:
katydid--
"katy-katy!" not dead
yet

jp: .きりぎりす鳴する藪もなかりけり
ro: kirigirisu nakasuru yabu mo nakari keri
en:
not a thicket
for a katydid's singing
in sight

jp: .蔵陰も草さへあれば秋の花
ro: kura kage mo kusa sae areba aki no hana
en:
even in the barn's shade
if there's grass
there's autumn blooms

jp: .空に迄仏ましまして草の花
ro: sora ni made hotoke mashimashite kusa no hana
en:
even in the sky
Buddha dwells...
wildflowers

jp: .朝顔に入口もないしだら哉
ro: asagao ni iriguchi mo nai shidara kana
en:
blocking the gate--
morning-glories
and a slob

jp: .朝顔に片肌入れし羅漢哉
ro: asagao ni katahada ireshi rakan kana
en:
into morning-glories
with one shoulder bare...
holy man

jp: .朝顔に子供の多き在所哉
ro: asagao ni kodomo no ôki zaisho kana
en:
morning-glories
and loads of children...
farmhouse

jp: .あさがほに咲なくさるる小家哉
ro: asagao ni saki nakusaruru ko ie kana
en:
lost
in the morning-glories
little house

jp: .朝顔に雫拵へて居りけり
ro: asagao ni shizuku koshiraete suwari keri
en:
droplets forming
on the morning-glories...
sitting still

jp: .朝顔に背中の冷り冷り哉
ro: asagao ni senaka no hiyari hiyari kana
en:
in morning-glories
a chill chilling
my spine

jp: .朝顔にほかほかとして寒哉
ro: asagao ni hoka-hoka to shite samusa kana
en:
in the morning-glories
warming up...
the cold

jp: .朝顔や下水の泥もあさのさま
ro: asagao ya gesui no doro mo asa no sama
en:
morning-glories
even in sewer mud
a morning scene

jp: .朝露の朝顔売るやあら男
ro: asa tsuyu no asagao uru ya araotoko
en:
selling morning-glories
wet with morning dew...
a tough character

jp: .鐘の声朝顔先へそよぐ也
ro: kane no koe asagao saki e soyogu nari
en:
voice of the bell--
the morning-glories are the first
to stir

jp: .取込みの門も朝顔咲にけり
ro: torikomi no kado mo asagao saki ni keri
en:
on the busy gate, too
morning-glories
bloom

jp: .我宿の悪朝顔も夜明哉
ro: waga yado no waru asagao mo yoake kana
en:
my house's pitiful
morning-glories, too
greet the dawn

jp: .片枝は真さかさまに紅葉哉
ro: kata eda wa massakasama ni momiji kana
en:
on one branch
tumbling head over heels...
autumn colors

jp: .山畠は鼠の穴も紅葉哉
ro: yama hata wa nezumi no ana mo momiji kana
en:
mountain field--
the mouse's hole too
under red leaves

jp: .秋霜に又咲ほこるむくげ哉
ro: aki shimo ni mata saki hokoru mukuge kana
en:
in autumn frost
lushly blooming again
roses of Sharon

jp: .浦向に咲かたまりし槿哉
ro: ura muki ni saki katamarishi mukuge kana
en:
they crowd to bloom
facing the sea...
roses of Sharon

jp: .遅咲の木槿四五本なく蚊哉
ro: oso-zaki no mukuge shi go hon naku ka kana
en:
late-blooming roses of Sharon
four or five...
mosquitoes whine

jp: .酒冷すちょろちょろ川の槿哉
ro: sake hiyasu choro-choro kawa no mukuge kana
en:
a babbling brook
chills the sake...
roses of Sharon

jp: .木槿さへすがれになるをなく蚊哉
ro: mukuge sae sugare ni naru wo naku ka kana
en:
roses of Sharon, too
have passed their season...
mosquitoes whine

jp: .木槿咲く凸ミ凹ミや金谷迄
ro: mukuge saku takami kubomi ya takaya made
en:
roses of Sharon
on peaks, in valleys
all the way to Takaya

jp: .柳まで淋しくしたる槿哉
ro: yanagi made sabishiku shitaru mukuge kana
en:
even the willow
is lonely...
rose of Sharon

jp: .夜々はよい風の吹く槿哉
ro: yoru yoru wa yoi kaze no fuku mukuge kana
en:
night after night
a good wind blows...
roses of Sharon

jp: .曲り目に月の出たる瓢哉
ro: magarime ni tsuki no idetaru fukube kana
en:
the moon emerges
'round a curve...
the gourd

jp: .山々も年よるさまや種瓢
ro: yama-yama mo toshiyoru-sama ya tane fukube
en:
all the mountains
are looking old...
gourds

jp: .枯し木の空しく暮るることし哉
ro: kare[shi] ki no munashiku kururu kotoshi kana
en:
with the emptiness
of bare trees...
this year ends

jp: .我と松あはれことしも今暮るる
ro: ware to matsu aware kotoshi mo ima kururu
en:
for me and the pine
this damned year, too
ends

jp: .口明て春を待らん犬はりこ
ro: kuchi akete haru wo matsuran inu hariko
en:
its mouth open
waiting for spring?
paper dog

jp: .春待や雀も竹を宿として
ro: haru matsu ya suzume mo take wo yado to shite
en:
waiting for spring
sparrows also make a home
in the bamboo

jp: .大年や我死所の鐘もなる
ro: ôtoshi ya waga shinidoko no kane mo naru
en:
year's end--
the bell of my death place
tolls too

jp: .大年や我はいつ行寺の鐘
ro: ôtoshi ya waga wa itsu yuku tera no kane
en:
year's end--
when will my turn come
temple bell?

jp: .むら竹や大晦日も夜の雨
ro: muratake ya ôtsugomori mo yoru no ame
en:
bamboo thicket--
on the year's last day, too
evening rain

jp: .はつ雪やかさい烏がうかれ鳴
ro: hatsu yuki ya kasai karasu ga u[ka]re naki
en:
first snowfall--
the crows of Kasai
happily caw

jp: .只居ればおるとて雪の降にけり
ro: tada o[re]ba oru tote yuki no furi ni keri
en:
just existing
I exist...
snow flitting down

jp: .夜の雪だまって通る人もあり
ro: yoru no yuki damatte tôru hito mo ari
en:
night snow--
in a hush people
passing

jp: .いざ走れ霰ちる夜の古木履
ro: iza hashire arare chiru yo no furu bokuri
en:
hurry along!
in nighttime hail
on wooden clogs

jp: .春の夜のおもはくもあり夜の霜
ro: haru no yo no omowaku mo ari yoru no shimo
en:
expecting a night
of spring...
night frost

jp: .名月や松の天窓の煤もはく
ro: meigetsu ya matsu no atama no susu mo haku
en:
harvest moon--
the pine tree's head too
swept for soot

jp: .松風や小野のおくさへせき候と
ro: matsu kaze ya ono no oku sae sekizoro to
en:
pine breeze--
in the middle of a field too
Twelfth Month singers

jp: .もちつきも夜に入るさまの角田川
ro: mochi tsuki mo yo ni iru sama ni sumida-gawa
en:
pounding rice cakes
gliding into evening...
Sumida River

jp: .もちつきや門は雀の遊処
ro: mochi tsuki ya kado wa suzume no asobi-doko
en:
pounding rice cakes--
the gate is the sparrows'
playground

jp: .餅つきや羅漢の鴻もつつがなく
ro: mochi tsuki [ya] rakan no kô mo tsutsuganaku
en:
pounding rice cakes--
the holy man's goose, too
alive and well

jp: .夜に入れば餅の音する榎哉
ro: yo ni ireba mochi no oto suru enoki kana
en:
at night a sound
like rice cake pounding...
the nettle tree

jp: .我門は常の雨夜や餅の音
ro: waga kado wa tsune no amayo ya mochi no oto
en:
at my gate
the usual evening rain...
pounding rice cakes

jp: .若松に雪も来よ来よ衣配
ro: waka matsu ni yuki mo ko yo ko yo kinu kubari
en:
come, come, snow!
the young pine needs
new clothes

jp: .浄土寺の年とる鐘や先は聞
ro: jôdo ji no toshitori kane ya mazu wa kike
en:
a Pure Land temple's
bell of old age...
listen!

jp: .鷹がりや麦の旭を袖にして
ro: takagari ya mugi no asahi wo sode ni shite
en:
falconry--
a barley field's rising sun
on one sleeve

jp: .あっさりと浅黄頭巾の交ぞ
ro: assari to asagi zukin no majiriwari zo
en:
plain, light-blue
skullcaps...
sprinkled in

jp: .ちとの間は我宿めかすおこり炭
ro: chito no ma wa waga yado mekasu okori-zumi
en:
in a flash my home's
dressed to the nines...
morning's charcoal fire

jp: .宵々に見べりもするか炭俵
ro: yoi-yoi ni miberi mo suru ka sumidawara
en:
every evening
you're also more depleted...
charcoal bag

jp: .雨ふるや翌からほたの当もなき
ro: ame furu ya asu kara hota no ate mo naki
en:
rain falling--
tomorrow's chance of firewood
is nil

jp: .ほた焚て皺くらべせんかがみ山
ro: hota taite shiwa kurabesen kagami yama
en:
by the wood fire
comparing our wrinkles...
Mount Kagami

jp: .埋火に桂の鴎聞へけり
ro: uzumibi ni katsura no kamome kikoe keri
en:
banked fire--
gulls clamor
in the redbud tree

jp: .埋火や山松風を枕元
ro: uzumibi ya yama matsu kaze wo makura moto
en:
banked fire--
the mountain pine wind
at my pillow

jp: .鳴鹿に紅葉もほろりほろり哉
ro: naku shika ni momiji mo horori horori kana
en:
when the deer cries
the red leaves too
fall like tears

jp: .月よ闇よ吉原行も冬枯るる
ro: tsuki yo yamiyo yoshiwara yuku mo fuyugaruru
en:
moonlight! shadow!
even en route to Yoshiwara
winter's withering

jp: .人かげや地蔵の塔も冬枯るる
ro: hitokage ya jizô no tô mo fuyugaruru
en:
a man's shadow--
even on St. Jizo's monument
winter withering

jp: .冬枯もそしらぬ顔や都鳥
ro: fuyugare mo soshiranu kao ya miyakodori
en:
even for winter's withering
an indifferent face...
sea gull

jp: .冬枯や親に放れし馬の顔
ro: fuyugare ya oya ni hanareshi uma no kao
en:
winter withering--
departing from mother
the pony's face

jp: .又ことし娑婆塞ぞよ草の家
ro: mata kotoshi shaba-fusage zo yo kusa no ie
en:
another year
just taking up space...
thatched hut

jp: .長閑しや梅はなくともお正月
ro: nodokeshi ya ume wa naku [to] mo o-shôgatsu
en:
spring peace--
no plum blossoms yet
this First Month

jp: .我宿もうたたあるさまや御代の春
ro: waga yado mo utata aru same ya miyo no haru
en:
even my house
is all decked out...
the emperor's spring

jp: .へら鷺も万才聞か君が春
ro: herasagi mo manzai kiku ka kimi ga haru
en:
does the spoonbill too
hear the begging actors?
"Happy New Year!"

jp: .君が世やよ所の膳にて花の春
ro: kimi ga yo ya yoso no zen nite hana no haru
en:
Great Japan!
with your dinner trays
spring blossoms

jp: .正月を寝てしまひけり山の家
ro: shôgatsu wo nete shimai keri yama no ie
en:
sleeping through
the New Year's celebration...
mountain home

jp: .相持の橋の春めく月よ哉
ro: aimochi no hachi no harumeku tsuki yo kana
en:
on Aimochi Bridge
spring has sprung...
bright moon

jp: .軒の雨ぽちりぽちりと暮遅き
ro: noki no ame pochiri-pochiri to kure osoki
en:
rain from the eaves
drip-drip...
a late sunset

jp: .山守や春の行方を箒して
ro: yamamori ya haru no yukigata wo hôki shite
en:
forest ranger--
he sweeps away spring
with a broom

jp: .行春の空はくらがり峠哉
ro: yuku haru no sora wa kuragari tôge kana
en:
departing spring's
sky turns dark...
mountain pass

jp: .二葉から朝顔淋し春の霜
ro: futaba kara asagao sabishi haru no shimo
en:
down to two leaves
the lonely morning-glory...
spring frost

jp: .あさぢふや逆に寝てさへ春の雨
ro: asajiu ya gyaku ni nete sae haru no ame
en:
shelter in the reeds--
even when I turn over
spring rain

jp: .春雨のめぐみにもれぬ草葉哉
ro: harusame no megumi ni morenu kusaba kana
en:
not missing
the spring rain's blessing...
blades of grass

jp: .春雨や千代の古道菜漬売
ro: harusame ya chiyo no furu michi nazuke uri
en:
spring rain
on an ancient road...
the pickle vendor

jp: .春雨や窓も一人に一つづつ
ro: harusame ya mado mo hitori ni hitotsu-zutsu
en:
spring rain--
there's one window
per person

jp: .笠程の窓持て候春の風
ro: kasa hodo no mado mochite soro haru no kaze
en:
through a window big
as an umbrella-hat...
spring breeze

jp: .春の風垣の雑巾かわく也
ro: karu no kaze kaki no zôkin kawaku nari
en:
spring breeze--
the mop on the fence
drying

jp: .春の風草にも酒を呑すべし
ro: haru no kaze kusa ni mo sake wo nomasu-beshi
en:
spring breeze--
let the grass also
drink sake!

jp: .山寺や春の月夜の連歌道
ro: tera yama ya haru no tsuki yo no renga michi
en:
temple mountain--
under a spring moon heading
to a poem party

jp: .宵々や軒の雫も春の月
ro: yoi-yoi ya noki no shizuku mo haru no tsuki
en:
every evening
in raindrops from the eaves...
spring moon

jp: .段々に朧よ月よこもり堂
ro: dan-dan ni oboro yo tsuki yo komori-dô
en:
bit by bit
more haze, more moon...
secluded temple

jp: .かすむ日に窓さへ見へぬ獄屋哉
ro: kasumu hi ni mado sae mienu hitoya kana
en:
in the misty day
no window can be seen...
a prison

jp: .霞む日や門の草葉は昼時分
ro: kasumu hi ya kado no kusaba wa hiru jibun
en:
misty day--
grasses at the gate
at noon

jp: .片袖はばらばら雨や春がすみ
ro: kata sode wa bara-bara ame ya harugasumi
en:
on one sleeve
rain pitter-patters...
spring mist

jp: .菜畠のふくら雀もかすみ哉
ro: na-batake no fukura suzume mo kasumi kana
en:
fat little sparrows
in the farm field too...
in mist

jp: .春がすみ鍬とらぬ身のもったいな
ro: harugasumi kuwa toranu mi no mottaina
en:
spring mist--
not taking up a hoe
a shameless loafer

jp: .むさしのや我等が宿も一かすみ
ro: musashi no ya warera gay ado mo hito kasumi
en:
Musashi Plain--
our dwelling too
in mist

jp: .山里の寝顔にかかるかすみ哉
ro: yama-zato no ne-gao ni kakaru kasumi kana
en:
draping the mountain
village's sleeping face...
mist

jp: .陽炎や蚊のわく薮もうつくしき
ro: kagerô ya ka no waku yabu mo utsukushiki
en:
heat shimmers--
the mosquito-breeding thicket
is pretty too

jp: .妹が家も田舎雛ではなかりけり
ro: imo ga ya mo inaka hina de wa nakari keri
en:
in my dear one's house
not one provincial doll
on Doll's Day

jp: .古郷は雛の顔も葎哉
ro: furusato wa hina no kao mo mugura kana
en:
my home village--
even the doll's face
made of weeds

jp: .染色の傘のちらちら汐干哉
ro: some-iro no kasa no chira-chira shiohi kana
en:
their colorful umbrellas
fluttering...
low tide

jp: .田を打てば露もおりけり門の口
ro: ta wo uteba tsuyu mo ori keri kado no kuchi
en:
plowing the rice field
dewdrops fall too...
entrance gate

jp: .畠打や祭々も往く所
ro: hata uchi ya matsuri-matsuri mo iku tokoro
en:
plowing fields--
festivals, festivals
all over!

jp: .うら道や草の上迄種を蒔く
ro: ura michi ya kusa no ue made tane wo maku
en:
back road--
even on top of grasses
sowing herbs

jp: .山畠や種蒔よしと鳥のなく
ro: yama hata ya tane maki yoshi to tori no naku
en:
mountain field--
"Nice job of seeding!"
sing the birds

jp: .鶯のあてにして来る垣ね哉
ro: uguisu no ate ni shite kuru kakine kana
en:
the nightingale aims
and arrives...
my fence

jp: .山烏山のうぐひすさそひ来よ
ro: yama-garasu yama no uguisu sasoi kiyo
en:
mountain crows
bring the mountain nightingales
when you come

jp: .巣乙鳥や草の青山よそにして
ro: su tsubame ya kusa no aoyama yoso ni shite
en:
hey nesting swallows--
grassy green mountains
are elsewhere

jp: .とぶ燕君が代ならぬ草もなし
ro: tobu tsubame kimi ga yo naranu kusa mo nashi
en:
flying swallows--
wherever there's grass
hail Great Japan!

jp: .野烏に藪を任せて鳴雲雀
ro: no-garasu ni yabu wo makasete naku hibari
en:
entrusting the thicket
to the field crow...
the lark sings

jp: .足がらの片山雉子靄祝へ
ro: ashigara no kata yama kigisu moya iwae
en:
Mount Ashigara's
mountain pheasant,
celebrate the haze!

jp: .丘の雉鷺の身持をうらやむか
ro: oka no kiji sagi no mimochi wo urayamu ka
en:
hilltop pheasant
are you jealous of the heron's
style?

jp: .昼比やほろほろ雉の里歩き
ro: hiru-goro ya horo-horo kiji no sato aruki
en:
around noon, squawking
the pheasant walks
through town

jp: .山陰も畠となりてなく雉子
ro: yama kage mo hatake to narite naku kigisu
en:
even in mountain shade
a plowed field!
the pheasant cries

jp: .行雁や更科見度望みさへ
ro: yuku kari ya sarashina mitai nozomi sae
en:
geese fly north--
how they yearn to see
Mount Sarashina

jp: .見知られし雁もそろそろ立田哉
ro: mishirareshi kari mo soro-soro tatsu ta kana
en:
the geese I know
by sight, are they gone?
rice field of Nara

jp: .蛙なくやとりしまりなき草の雨
ro: kawazu naku ya torishimarinaki kusa no ame
en:
frogs croaking--
"This rain on the grass
is unsanctioned!"

jp: .あだしのに蝶は罪なく見ゆる也
ro: adashi no ni chô wa tsumi naku miyuru nari
en:
in Adashi Field
the butterflies seem
sinless

jp: .跡のてふ松原西へ這入なり
ro: ato no chô matsuhara nishi e hairu nari
en:
behind me a butterfly
west toward Matsuhara
crawls

jp: .一姫の神笑み給へ草のてふ
ro: ichihime no kami emi tamae kusa no chô
en:
O goddess Ichihime
smile!
a meadow butterfly

jp: .うつつなの人の迷ひや野べの蝶
ro: utsutsuna no hito no mayoi ya nobe no chô
en:
casting a spell
on the man...
meadow butterflies

jp: .かつしかや雪隠の中も春のてふ
ro: katsushika ya setchin no naka mo haru no chô
en:
in Katsushika
even in the outhouse...
a spring butterfly

jp: .門々を一々巡る小てふ哉
ro: kado-gado wo ichi-ichi meguru ko chô kana
en:
gate after gate
making the rounds...
butterfly

jp: .杭の鷺蝶はいきせきさわぐ也
ro: kui no sagi chô wa ikiseki sawagu nari
en:
heron on a post--
butterflies in a breathless
flurry

jp: .草の蝶牛にも詠られにけり
ro: kusa no chô ushi ni mo nagamerare ni keri
en:
meadow butterflies--
the cow also
gazes

jp: .蝶ひらひら仏のひざをもどる也
ro: chô hira-hira hotoke no hiza wo modoru nari
en:
flitting butterfly
to Buddha's lap
returns

jp: .若草に冷飯すすむ伏家哉
ro: waka-gusa ni hiya meshi susumu fuseya kana
en:
the new grass
cools my cold rice...
humble hut

jp: .わか草に夜も来てなく雀哉
ro: waka-gusa ni yoru mo kite naku suzume kana
en:
in the new grass too
evening comes...
chirping sparrow

jp: .わか草や油断を責る暮の鐘
ro: waka-gusa ya yudan wo semeru kure no kane
en:
chiding the new grass
for not being ready...
sunset bell

jp: .薄菫是にも月のやどる也
ro: usu sumire kore ni mo tsuki no yadoru nari
en:
straggly violets--
here, too
the moon's dwelling

jp: .ついついと藪の中より菜種哉
ro: tsui-tsui to yabu no naka yori na tane kana
en:
a swish-swish
deep in the thicket...
flowering rape

jp: .なの花にうしろ下りの住居哉
ro: na no hana ni ushiro sagari no sumai kana
en:
flowering rape
drapes the back...
my home

jp: .人しらぬ藪もつやつや木の芽哉
ro: hito shiranu yabu mo tsuya-tsuya ki [no] me kana
en:
in the thicket no one
knows about
trees budding bright

jp: .春ぞとてしぶしぶ咲し椿哉
ro: haru zo tote shibu-shibu sakushi tsubaki kana
en:
springtime
yet it blooms reluctantly...
the camellia

jp: .古郷は牛も寝て見る椿哉
ro: furusato wa ushi mo nete miru tsubaki kana
en:
my home village--
even lying-down cows
look at camellias

jp: .ありふれの野さへ原さへ梅の花
ro: arifure no no sae hara sae ume [no] hana
en:
in plain old everyday
plains and fields...
plum blossoms!

jp: .梅がかを都へさそふ風も哉
ro: ume ga ka wo miyako e sasou kaze mo gana
en:
may the wind send
this plum blossom scent
to Kyoto!

jp: .梅がかに鼬もないて通りけり
ro: ume ga ka ni itachi mo naite tôri keri
en:
plum blossom scent--
even the weasel passes
with a song

jp: .梅がかに引くるまりし小家哉
ro: ume ga ka ni hiki-kurumarishi ko ie kana
en:
wrapped in the scent
of plum blossoms...
little house

jp: .梅がかや針穴すかす明り先
ro: ume ga ka ya hari ana sukasu akarisaki
en:
plum blossom scent--
through a needle's eye
the light

jp: .下草も香に匂ひけり梅の花
ro: shitagusa mo ka ni nioi keri ume no hana
en:
even weeds under the tree
smell nice...
plum blossoms

jp: .山里は油手ふくも梅の花
ro: yama-zato wa aburate fuku mo ume no hana
en:
mountain village--
wiping greasy hands
on plum blossoms

jp: .金の糞しそうな犬ぞ花の陰
ro: kin no fun shisôna inu zo hana no kage
en:
that dog ought to poop
pure gold!
blossom shade

jp: .咲ちるやけふも昔にならんずる
ro: saki chiru ya kyô mo mukashi ni naranzu[ru]
en:
scattering blossoms--
today too
like olden times

jp: .鼻先の上野の花も過にけり
ro: hana saki no ueno no hana mo sugi ni keri
en:
up close
even the cherry blossoms of Ueno
pass on

jp: .花咲や二十の比の鐘もなる
ro: hana saku ya hatachi no koro no kane mo naru
en:
cherry blossoms--
I also hear a temple bell
from my twenties

jp: .花の陰此世をさみす人も有
ro: hana no kage kono yo wo samisu hito mo ari
en:
in cherry blossom shade
there are even those
who hate this world

jp: .今からは桜一人よ窓の前
ro: ima kara wa sakura hitori yo mado no mae
en:
from now on
cherry blossom solitude!
my window

jp: .姥捨し片山桜咲にけり
ro: ubasuteshi kata yama-zakura saki ni keri
en:
on Mount Ubasute
where the old were left to die...
cherry blossoms

jp: .大かたは泥にひっつく桜哉
ro: ôkata wa doro ni hittsuku sakura kana
en:
most end up
stuck in mud...
cherry blossoms

jp: .穀つぶし桜の下にくらしけり
ro: gokutsubushi sakura no shita ni kurashi keri
en:
an idler--
under the cherry blossoms
I live

jp: .土鳩が寝に来ても鳴く桜哉
ro: tsuchibato ga ne ni kite mo naku sakura kana
en:
even in sleep
pigeons come to coo...
cherry blossoms

jp: .初桜花ともいはぬ伏家哉
ro: hatsu sakura hana to mo iwanu fuseya kana
en:
no one says
"First cherry blossoms!"
my humble hut

jp: .人寄せぬ桜咲けり城の山
ro: hito yosenu sakura saki keri shiro no yama
en:
cherry trees in bloom
with no crowds...
castle mountain

jp: .夕過や桜の下に小言いふ
ro: yû sugi ya sakura no shita ni kogoto iu
en:
all night
under the cherry blossoms
nagging

jp: .留主寺やせい出してさく桃さくら
ro: rusu tera ya seidashite saku momo sakura
en:
vacant temple--
industriously blooming
peach and cherry

jp: .日本は柳の空となる夜哉
ro: nippon wa yanagi no sora to naru yo kana
en:
Japan's night sky
has become
all willows

jp: .夕山に肩を並ぶる柳哉
ro: yû yama ni kata wo naraburu yanagi kana
en:
lined up
with the evening mountain...
a willow

jp: .明安き榎持けりうしろ窓
ro: ake yasuki enoki mochi keri ushiro mado
en:
in summer's early dawn
a nettle tree...
back window

jp: .明安き鳥の来て鳴榎哉
ro: ake yasuki tori no kite naku enoki kana
en:
in summer's early dawn
a bird comes chirping...
nettle tree

jp: .月さして遊びでのない夜也けり
ro: tsuki sashite asobi de no nai yo nari keri
en:
the moon shining--
no carousing
this summer night!

jp: .夕涼や凡一里の片小山
ro: yûsuzu ya oyoso hito sato no kata oyama
en:
evening cool--
for each little village
one little hill

jp: .夕涼や薬師の見ゆる片小藪
ro: yûsuzume ya yakushi no miyuru kata ko yabu
en:
evening cool--
a Buddha of healing
in a thicket

jp: .夕立に次の祭りの通りけり
ro: yûdachi ni tsugi no matsuri no tôri keri
en:
in a cloudburst
