another festival shrine
passes by

jp: .夕立の祈らぬ里にかかる也
ro: yûdachi no inoranu sato ni kakaru nari
en:
rainstorm--
hanging over the village
that doesn't pray

jp: .夕立や草花ひらく枕元
ro: yûdachi ya kusabana hiraku makura moto
en:
rainstorm--
a wildflower blooms
at my pillow

jp: .切雲の峰となる迄寝たりけり
ro: kire-gumo no mine to naru made netari keri
en:
only when a scrap of cloud
billows to form peaks...
then to bed

jp: .寝返ればはや峰作る小雲哉
ro: ne-kaereba haya mine tsukuru ko-gumo kana
en:
when I go back to sleep
it quickly forms peaks...
little cloud

jp: .柴門も青田祝ひのけぶり哉
ro: shiba no to mo aoda iwai no keburi kana
en:
at my humble hut, too
celebration smoke
for green rice fields

jp: .手枕におのが青田と思ふ哉
ro: temakura ni ono ga aoda to omou kana
en:
an arm for a pillow
imagining the green rice field
is mine

jp: .かん仏やふくら雀も親連れて
ro: kanbutsu ya fukura suzume mo oya tsurete
en:
Buddha's birthday--
fat little sparrows
and their parents

jp: .花つみや替々のうちは持
ro: hana tsumi ya kawaru-gawaru no uchiwa mochi
en:
picking flowers--
everyone with a different
style of fan

jp: .わざわざに蝶も来て舞ふ夏花哉
ro: waza-waza ni chô mo kite mau gebana kana
en:
a butterfly deigns
to come and dance...
summer flowers

jp: .涼風もけふ一日の御不二哉
ro: suzukaze mo kyô tsuitachi no o-fuji kana
en:
a cool wind today
the first of the month...
Mount Fuji

jp: .軒の菖蒲しなびぬうちに寝たりけり
ro: noki no shôbu shinabinu uchi ni netari keri
en:
irises on the eaves--
before they shrivel
to bed I go

jp: .更衣里は汐干る日也けり
ro: koromogae sato wa shiohiru hi nari keri
en:
new summer robes--
the town today
at the low-tide beach

jp: .あかざをも目出度しといふ団扇哉
ro: akaza wo mo medetashi to iu uchiwa kana
en:
a "Good fortune!" wish
even for the pigweed...
paper fan

jp: .入相に片耳ふさぐ団扇哉
ro: iriai ni kata mimi fusagu uchiwa kana
en:
sunset bell--
one ear covered
with my paper fan

jp: .煙してかはほりの世もよかりけり
ro: keburi shite kawahori no yo mo yokari keri
en:
smoke rising--
the bats' world, too
is good

jp: .時鳥火宅の人を笑らん
ro: hototogisu kataku no hito wo warauran
en:
cuckoo--
laughing at the man
in the burning house?

jp: .芋茶屋もうれしいものよ閑古鳥
ro: imo chaya mo ureshii mono yo kankodori
en:
even a penny teahouse
a happy thing!
mountain cuckoo

jp: .かんこ鳥しなのの桜咲にけり
ro: kankodori shinano no sakura saki ni keri
en:
mountain cuckoo--
the cherry blossoms of Shinano
have bloomed!

jp: .山のはへ足を伸せばかんこ鳥
ro: yama no ha e ashi wo nobaseba kankodori
en:
when you step one foot
on the mountain...
mountain cuckoo

jp: .庵の蛍痩なくなりもせざりけり
ro: io no hotaru yase nakunari mo sezari keri
en:
my hut's firefly
still hasn't starved
to death

jp: .痩蛍大舟竿にかかる也
ro: yase hotaru ôfunezao ni kakaru nari
en:
skinny firefly
on the big boat's mast
clinging

jp: .我家や町の蛍の逃所
ro: waga ie ya machi no hotaru no nige-dokoro
en:
my house
where the town's fireflies
hide out

jp: .我門や蛍をやどす草もなき
ro: waga kado ya hotaru wo yadosu kusa mo naki
en:
my gate--
lodging for the fireflies
there being no grass

jp: .我薮は時分はづれの蛍哉
ro: waga yabu wa jibun hazure no hotaru kana
en:
in my thicket
at the end of their time...
fireflies

jp: .目出度さは上総の蚊にも喰れけり
ro: medetasa wa kazusa no ka ni mo kuware keri
en:
a celebration--
the mosquitoes of Kazusa
feast on me too

jp: .焼にけりさしてとがなき藪蚊迄
ro: yake ni keri sashite toga naki yabu ka made
en:
everything has burned
even the blameless
mosquitoes

jp: .蝿打てけふも聞也山の鐘
ro: hae uchite kyô mo kiku nari yama no kane
en:
while swatting a fly
today again...
the mountain temple bell

jp: .馬の子も同じ日暮よかたつぶり
ro: uma no ko mo onaji higure yo katatsuburi
en:
sharing the sunset
with the pony...
a snail

jp: .小盥も蓮もひとつ夕べ哉
ro: ko-darai mo harasu mo hitotsu yûbe kana
en:
one little tub
one lotus
one evening falls

jp: .蓮の花乞食のけぶりかかる也
ro: hasu [no] hana kojiki no keburi kakaru nari
en:
lotus blossoms--
the beggar's smoke
wafts over

jp: .蓮の花燕はとしのよらぬ也
ro: hasu [no] hana tsubame wa toshi no yoranu nari
en:
among lotus blossoms
the swallows don't
grow old

jp: .福蟇も這出給へ蓮の花
ro: fuku-biki [mo] haide tamae hasu no hana
en:
Lucky the Toad
crawl out!
lotus blossom

jp: .霧雨にあらのの百合のさきぬべし
ro: kirisame ni arano no yuri no sa[ki]nu-beshi
en:
misty rain--
let the lilies in the desolate field
bloom!

jp: .筍に娑婆の嵐のかかる也
ro: takenoko ni shaba no arashi no kakaru nari
en:
the bamboo shoots suffer
this crappy world's
storm

jp: .痩梅のなりどしもなき我身哉
ro: yase ume no naridoshi mo naki waga mi kana
en:
the scrawny plum tree
is fruitless too...
my life

jp: .長月の空色袷きたりけり
ro: naga tsuki no sora iro awase kitari keri
en:
Ninth Month--
the sky wears a colorful
kimono

jp: .なでしこの気を引立る夜寒哉
ro: nadeshiko no ki wo hikitateru yozamu kana
en:
the blooming pink
rallies its spirits...
a cold night

jp: .なでしこの一花ほこる夜寒哉
ro: nadeshiko no hito hana hokoru yozamu kana
en:
the pink flaunts
a single bloom...
a cold night

jp: .人の声森に夜寒はなかりけり
ro: hito [no] koe mori ni yozamu wa nakari keri
en:
people's voices--
in the grove the cold night
isn't

jp: .山里や夜寒の宵の歩き好
ro: yamazato ya yozamu [no] yoi no arukizuki
en:
mountain village--
a cold night's
night walker

jp: .背中から冷かかりけり日枝の雲
ro: senaka kara hie kakari keri hie [no] kumo
en:
a chill running
up my spine...
chilly clouds

jp: .冷々と日の出給ふうしろ哉
ro: hie-bie to hi no ide tamau ushiro kana
en:
chilly, chilly
the sun deigns to rise
behind me

jp: .又人にかけ抜れけり秋の暮
ro: mata hito ni kakenukare keri aki no kure
en:
yet another traveler
overtakes me...
autumn dusk

jp: .子供等が翌なき秋をさわぐ也
ro: kodomora ga asu naki aki wo sawagu nari
en:
children
on autumn's last day...
a ruckus!

jp: .是程の月にかまはぬ小家哉
ro: kore hodo no tsuki ni kamawanu ko ie kana
en:
taking no notice
of such a moon...
little house

jp: .煤くさき畳も月の夜也けり
ro: susu kusaki tatami mo tsuki no yo nari keri
en:
on a soot-grimed
straw mat too...
moon gazing

jp: .秋風に吹なれ顔の山家哉
ro: aki kaze ya fuki-nare karo no yamaga kana
en:
autumn wind--
a face used to its blast
in his mountain home

jp: .うしろから秋風吹やもどり足
ro: ushiro kara aki kaze fuku ya modori ashi
en:
behind me
the autumn wind blows
me home

jp: .どの星の下が我家ぞ秋の風
ro: dono hoshi no shita ga waga ya zo aki no kaze
en:
under which star
is my home?
autumn wind

jp: .朝顔のぞくぞく生て野分吹
ro: asagao no zoku-zoku haete nowaki fuku
en:
morning-glories shiver
as they sprout...
an autumn gale blows

jp: .今に見よ人とる人も草の露
ro: ima ni miyo hito toru hito mo kusa no tsuyu
en:
soon enough
for the murderer too...
dew on the grass

jp: .おく露や丘は必けぶり立
ro: oku tsuyu ya oka wa kanarazu keburi tatsu
en:
dewdrops forming--
on the hill, of course
smoke rising

jp: .草の露先うれしさよ涼しさよ
ro: kusa no tsuyu mazu ureshisa yo suzushisa yo
en:
dewdrops on the grass
at first so happy!
so cool!

jp: .露の玉一ッ一ッに古郷あり
ro: tsuyu no tama hitotsu hitotsu ni furusato ari
en:
in beads of dew
one by one my home
village

jp: .稲妻やむら雨いはふ草の原
ro: inazuma ya murasame iwau kusa no hara
en:
lightning flash--
a rain shower party
for the wild grasses

jp: .おく露は馬の涙か秋の山
ro: oku tsuyu wa uma no namida ka aki no yama
en:
is that dew
the horse's tears?
autumn mountain

jp: .涼しさは七夕雲とゆふべ哉
ro: suzushisa wa tanabata kumo to yûbe kana
en:
such cool air!
Tanabata clouds
and evening

jp: .七夕に一本茄子立りけり
ro: tanabata ni hito moto nasubi tateri keri
en:
Tanabata Night--
a single eggplant
standing up

jp: .彦星のにこにこ見ゆる木間哉
ro: hiko-boshi no niko-niko miyuru konoma kana
en:
the Boy Star
beams his smile...
through the trees

jp: .勝角力其有明も昔也
ro: kachi sumô sono ariake mo mukashi nari
en:
the sumo champion
and the dawn...
classics

jp: .昔々角力にかちし伏家哉
ro: mukashi mukashi sumô ni kachishi fuseya kana
en:
once upon a time
he was the champ...
humble cottage

jp: .夕暮は風が吹いても角力哉
ro: yûgure wa kaze ga fuite mo sumô kana
en:
evening--
the wind also chills
the sumo wrestler

jp: .かがし立て餅なき家はなかりけり
ro: kagashi tatte mochi naki ie wa nakari keri
en:
scarecrows standing--
a house without rice cakes
can't be found

jp: .松苗のうつくしくなるかがし哉
ro: matsu nae no utsukushiku naru kagashi kana
en:
the pine saplings
looking pretty...
a scarecrow

jp: .我方へ向てしぐるるかがし哉
ro: waga hô e mukete shigururu kagashi kana
en:
facing my way
in the cold rain...
a scarecrow

jp: .小田の水おとした人も淋しいか
ro: oda no mizu otoshita hito mo sabishii ka
en:
that farmer
draining his rice field...
lonely too?

jp: .小田守も落した水を見たりけり
ro: oda mori mo otoshita mizu wo mitari keri
en:
the rice field guard
also watches...
water drains away

jp: .みよしのの古き夜さりを砧哉
ro: miyoshino no furuki yosai wo kinuta kana
en:
in Yoshino's
ancient night...
someone pounding cloth

jp: .小田の雁年寄声はなかりけり
ro: oda [no] kari toshiyori-goe wa nakari keri
en:
rice field geese--
not a single voice
sounds old

jp: .おちつくと直に鳴けり小田の雁
ro: ochitsuku to sugu ni naki keri oda [no] kari
en:
once they settle down
another clamor...
rice field geese

jp: .風吹てそれから雁の鳴にけり
ro: kaze fuite sore kara kari no naki ni keri
en:
wind is blowing
and so the geese
are honking

jp: .雁鳴て直に夜に入る小家哉
ro: kari naite sugu ni yo ni iru ko ie kana
en:
geese honking
hasten the evening...
little house

jp: .夕風やふり向度に雁の鳴
ro: yûkaze ya furimuku tabi ni kari no naku
en:
evening wind--
the geese turn around
honking

jp: .日短かは蜻蛉の身にも有にけり
ro: hi mijika wa tombo no mi ni mo ari ni keri
en:
the day is short
as is the life
of the dragonfly

jp: .朝顔を鳴なくしたりきりぎりす
ro: asagao wo naki naku shitari kirigirisu
en:
leaving the morning-glory
songless...
a katydid

jp: .草花に汁鍋けぶる祭哉
ro: kusabana ni shiru nabe keburu matsuri kana
en:
over wildflowers
soup steam wafts...
autumn festival

jp: .たやすくも菊の咲たる川辺哉
ro: tayasuku mo kiku no sakitaru kawabe kana
en:
chrysanthemums bloom
with ease...
riverbank

jp: .はづかしの庇葺けり菊の花
ro: hazukashi no hisashi fuki keri kiku no hana
en:
among my pitifully
thatched eaves...
a chrysanthemum

jp: .朝顔や再生と秋を咲
ro: asagao ya futatabibae to aki wo saku
en:
born again
morning-glories make
autumn bloom

jp: .朝顔の咲くたびれもせざりけり
ro: asagao no saki kutabire mo sezari keri
en:
morning-glories--
they also aren't tired
of blooming

jp: .朝顔や引切捨し所に咲
ro: asagao ya hikkiri suteshi toko ni saku
en:
morning-glories
on the saw scrap heap
bloom

jp: .おく露は馬の涙か稲の花
ro: oku tsuyu wa uma no namida ka ine no hana
en:
is that dew
the horse's tears?
rice blossoms

jp: .狗の寝所迄も紅葉哉
ro: enokoro no ne-dokoro made mo momiji kana
en:
even where the puppy
sleeps...
red fallen leaves

jp: .小男鹿の枕にしたる紅葉哉
ro: saoshika no makura ni shitaru momiji kana
en:
a fluffy pillow
for the young buck...
red leaves

jp: .蔓草におしつけられし槿哉
ro: tsurakusa ni oshitsukerareshi mukuge kana
en:
oppressed by creepers
roses
of Sharon

jp: .花木槿烏叱りてながらふる
ro: hana mukuge karasu shikarite nagara furu
en:
roses of Sharon
despite the scolding crows
survive

jp: .栗おちて一つ一つに夜の更る
ro: kuri ochite hitotsu hitotsu ni yo no fukeru
en:
chestnuts dropping
one by one...
the night deepens

jp: .芝栗のいく度人に踏れけり
ro: shibaguri [no] iku tabi hito ni fumare keri
en:
little chestnuts
how often are you
stepped on!

jp: .芝栗や馬のばりしてうつくしき
ro: shibaguri ya uma no bari shite utsukushiki
en:
little chestnuts
pissed on by the horse...
shiny new

jp: .鐘氷る山をうしろに寝たりけり
ro: kane kôru yama wo ushiro ni netari keri
en:
a frozen bell clangs
on the mountain out back
at bedtime

jp: .大年にかぎって雪の降にけり
ro: ôtoshi ni kagitte yuki no furi ni keri
en:
marking the end
of another year...
snowfall

jp: .梅干と皺くらべせんはつ時雨
ro: umeboshi to shiwa kurabesen hatsu shigure
en:
comparing my wrinkles
with the pickled plums...
first winter rain

jp: .かたつぶり我と来て住め初時雨
ro: katatsuburi ware to kite sume hatsu shigure
en:
come in snail
and live with me...
first winter rain

jp: .祭り酒紅葉かざして初時雨
ro: matsuri sake momiji kazashite hatsu shigure
en:
festival sake
festooned with red leaves...
first winter rain

jp: .切株の茸かたまる時雨哉
ro: kirikabu no kinoko katamaru shigure kana
en:
mushrooms congregate
on the tree stump...
winter rain

jp: .我と山とかはるがはるに時雨哉
ro: ware to yama to kawaru-gawaru ni shigure kana
en:
on me, on the mountain
we take our turns...
winter rain

jp: .売飯に夕木がらしのかかりけり
ro: urimeshi ni yû kogarashi no kakari keri
en:
over the vendor's cooked food
evening's
winter wind

jp: .木がらしの袖に吹けり酒強飯
ro: kogarashi no sode ni fuki keri sakakohai
en:
winter wind
blowing in my sleeves...
sake, beans and rice

jp: .木がらしの日なたに立や待乳山
ro: kogarashi no hinata ni tatsu ya matsuchi yama
en:
in winter wind
basking in the sun...
Mount Matsuchi

jp: .雪ちるや我宿に寝るは翌あたり
ro: yuki chiru ya waga yado ni neru wa asu atari
en:
falling snow
we'll sleep at my house
maybe tomorrow

jp: .膝ぶしの皺にひっつく霰哉
ro: hizabushi no shiwa ni hittsuku arare kana
en:
stuck in the wrinkles
of my knees...
hailstones

jp: .散みぞれ臼の湯気さへ見られけり
ro: chiru mizore usu no yuge sae mirare keri
en:
sleet falling
into steam rising...
rice cake tub

jp: .飯の湯のうれしくなるやちるみぞれ
ro: meshi no yu no ureshiku naru ya chiru mizore
en:
hot water on rice
and I'm happy...
sleet falling

jp: .初霜や茎の歯ぎれも去年迄
ro: hatsu shimo ya kuki no hagire mo kyonen made
en:
first frost--
my teeth could crack radishes
up to last year

jp: .草の霜あはれことしも踏そむる
ro: kusa no shimo aware kotoshi mo fumi-somuru
en:
frost on the grass
this damned year, too
the trampling begins

jp: .酒呑まぬ家のむきあふ霜夜哉
ro: sake nomanu ie no mukiau shimo yo kana
en:
facing a house
without sake...
night frost

jp: .あちこちに茄子も下る枯の哉
ro: achi kochi ni nasubi mo sagaru kareno kana
en:
here and there
eggplants dangle too...
withered fields

jp: .もろもろの愚者も月見る十夜哉
ro: moro-moro no gusha mo tsuki miru jûya kana
en:
all sorts of fools
moon-gaze too...
winter prayers

jp: .はづかしや喰って寝て聞く寒念仏
ro: hazukashi ya kutte nete kiku kan nebutsu
en:
ashamed--
eating then going to bed
I hear the winter prayers

jp: .手前茶の口切にさへゆふべ哉
ro: temae cha no kuchikiri ni sae yûbe kana
en:
all the tea at hand
I unseal...
evening time

jp: .かつしかや煤の捨場も角田川
ro: katsushika ya susu no suteba mo sumida-gawa
en:
in Katsushika
they dump soot there too...
Sumida River

jp: .節季候の見むきもせぬ角田川
ro: sekizoro no mimuki mose nu ya sumida-gawa
en:
the Twelfth Month singers
don't turn around and look...
Sumida River

jp: .衾音聞しりて来る雀哉
ro: fusuma oto kikishirite kuru suzume kana
en:
hearing the winter quilt
unfold, here comes
sparrow

jp: .馬迄もよいとしとるか雪車の唄
ro: uma made mo yoi toshitoru ka sori no uta
en:
is the horse also
growing old well?
snow sled song

jp: .君が代を雀も唄へそりの唄
ro: kimi ga yo wo suzume mo utae sori no uta
en:
"Great Japan!"
join the snow sled song
sparrows

jp: .なかなかに梅もほだしや冬篭
ro: naka-naka ni ume mo hodashi ya fuyugomori
en:
the plum tree too
is soon snowed in...
winter seclusion

jp: .はやばやと誰冬ごもる細けぶり
ro: haya-baya to taga fuyugomoru hoso keburi
en:
early winter seclusion--
whose thin smoke
over there?

jp: .冬篭雁は夜迄かせぐ也
ro: fuyugomori kari wa yoru made kasegu nari
en:
winter seclusion--
the wild geese labor
till evening

jp: .冬三月こもるといふも齢哉
ro: fuyu mi tsuki komoru to iu mo yowai kana
en:
for three months
my winter seclusion...
old age

jp: .猪の今寝た跡も見ゆる也
ro: inoshishi no ima neta ato mo miyuru nari
en:
wild boar--
it looks like you just
woke up

jp: .風吹や猪の寝顔の欲げなき
ro: kaze fuku ya shishi no ne-gao no hoshige naki
en:
wind blows--
the wild boar's sleeping face
so innocent

jp: .我家を踏つぶす気かむら千鳥
ro: waga ie wo fumi-tsubusu ki ka mura chidori
en:
trampling my house
to pieces, are you?
flock of plovers

jp: .かれ草や茶殻けぶりもなつかしき
ro: karegusa ya chagara keburi mo natsukashiki
en:
winter hay
and smoke from tea grounds...
sweet nostalgia

jp: .とくとくと枯仕廻ぬか小藪垣
ro: toku-toku to kare shimawanu ka ko yabu kaki
en:
why so slow
withering?
little thicket's hedge

jp: .帰り咲分別もない垣ね哉
ro: kaeri-zaku funbetsu mo nai kakine kana
en:
lacking good sense
out-of-season flowers
on the fence

jp: .元日もここらは江戸の田舎哉
ro: ganjitsu mo kokora wa edo no inaka kana
en:
even on New Year's Day
around here Edo
is countrified

jp: .亀の身の正月も立日也けり
ro: kame no mi no shôgatsu mo tatsu hi nari keri
en:
for the turtle too
it's the First Month
first day

jp: .さかゆきに神の守らん御代の春
ro: sakayuki ni kami no mamoran miyo no haru
en:
may the gods grant
prosperity!
the emperor's spring

jp: .はつ春やけぶり立るも世間むき
ro: hatsu haru ya keburi tateru mo seken muki
en:
spring begins--
I send up my smoke
like everyone else

jp: .我門や芸なし鳩も春を鳴
ro: waga kado ya gei nashi hato mo haru wo naku
en:
at my gate
the artless pigeon too
sings "It's spring!"

jp: .けぶりさへ千代のためしや春の立
ro: keburi sae chiyo [no] tameshi ya haru no tatsu
en:
even the smoke
rises anciently...
spring begins

jp: .沙汰なしに春は立けり草屋敷
ro: sata nashi ni haru wa tachi keri kusa yashiki
en:
with no cards or letters
spring has begun...
thatched house

jp: .春立といふより見ゆる壁の穴
ro: haru tatsu to iu yori miyuru kabe no ana
en:
"Spring's begun"
I say then see
the hole in the wall

jp: .けふもけふも凧引かかる榎哉
ro: kyô mo kyô mo tako hikkakaru enoki kana
en:
today too, today too
the nettle tree snags
the kite

jp: .猿引は猿に持せて凧
ro: saru hiki wa saru ni motasete ikanobori
en:
the trainer lets
his monkey hold it...
New Year's kite

jp: .機音は竹にかくれて凧
ro: hata oto wa take ni kakurete ikanobori
en:
sound of a loom--
hidden in bamboo
a New Year's kite

jp: .正月を寝て見る梅でありしょな
ro: shôgatsu wo nete miru ume de arishôna
en:
sleeping through New Year's
dreaming of plum blossoms
probably

jp: .けふはとて垣の小すみもわかな哉
ro: kyô wa tote kaki no ko sumi mo wakana kana
en:
it being today
even in a nook of the hedge
picking herbs

jp: .ちる雪をありがたがるやわかなつみ
ro: chiru yuki wo arigatagaru ya wakana tsumi
en:
appreciating
the falling snow...
picking herbs

jp: .鶯の東訛りも春辺哉
ro: uguisu no azuma namari mo harube kana
en:
the nightingale sings
with a country twang...
springtime

jp: .ついついと草に立たる春日哉
ro: tsui-tsui to kusa ni tachitaru haru hi kana
en:
rising over
the swishing grasses...
spring sun

jp: .春の日やついつい草に立安き
ro: haru no hi ya tsui-tsui kusa ni tachi yasuki
en:
spring sun--
over the swishing grasses
gliding up

jp: .岩の亀不断日永と思ふ哉
ro: iwa no kame fudan hinaga to omou kana
en:
for the turtle on a rock
it's the usual
long day

jp: .うら門のひとりでに明く日永哉
ro: ura kado no hitori de ni aku hi naga kana
en:
the back gate
opens on its own...
a long day

jp: .鶏の人の顔見る日永哉
ro: niwatori no hito no kao miru hi naga kana
en:
the chicken stares
at the man...
a long day

jp: .木兎は不断日永と思ふ哉
ro: mimizuku wa fudan hi naga to omou kana
en:
in the owl's opinion
every day
is long

jp: .春の雪せまき袂にすがりけり
ro: haru no yuki semaki tamoto ni sugari keri
en:
spring snow
on my narrow sleeves...
clinging

jp: .春の雪地祭り唄にかかる哉
ro: haru no yuki chi matsuri uta ni kakaru kana
en:
spring snow sprinkles
the earth god's
festival song

jp: .古郷や餅につき込春の雪
ro: furusato ya mochi ni tsukikomu haru no yuki
en:
my home village--
rice cakes soaked
with spring snow

jp: .木母寺の夜を見に行春の雨
ro: mokuboji no yoru wo mi ni yuku haru no ame
en:
going to see
Mokubo Temple's evening...
spring rain

jp: .山里は常正月や春の雨
ro: yama-zato wa jô shôgatsu ya haru no ame
en:
for the mountain village
the usual First Month...
spring rain

jp: .春風がならして行くぞ田にし殻
ro: haru kaze ga narashite yuku zo tanishi-gara
en:
the spring breeze
whistles through...
pond snail shells

jp: .春風に箸を掴んで寝る子哉
ro: haru kaze ni hashi wo tsukande neru ko kana
en:
in spring's breeze
clutching chopsticks
the sleeping child

jp: .ぼた餅に宵の春風吹にけり
ro: botamochi ni yoi no haru kaze fuki ni keri
en:
over rice cakes and jelly
the good spring breeze
blows

jp: .かすむ日や麓の飯のめづらしき
ro: kasumu [hi] ya fumoto no meshi no mezurashiki
en:
misty day--
the meal at the mountain's foot
marvelous

jp: .陽炎にさらさら雨のかかりけり
ro: kagerô ni sara-sara ame no kakari keri
en:
through heat shimmers
the murmuring
rain

jp: .陽炎やあの穴たしかきりぎりす
ro: kagerô ya ano ana tashika kirigirisu
en:
heat shimmers--
in that hole perhaps?
a katydid

jp: .鬼島の涅槃の桜咲にけり
ro: oni-jima no nehan no sakura saki ni keri
en:
on Devil's Island
on Buddha's Death-Day...
cherry blossoms

jp: .角力取も雛祭に遊びけり
ro: sumotori mo hina matsuri ni asobi keri
en:
even the sumo wrestler
has a blast...
Doll Festival

jp: .人一人二人汐干の小すみ哉
ro: hito hitori futari shioi no kosumi kana
en:
by ones and twos
in little nooks they crouch...
low tide

jp: .深川や桃の中より汐干狩
ro: fukagawa ya momo no naka yori shiohi-gari
en:
Fukagawa--
from a peach tree gathering
low tide shells

jp: .茶をこくやふくら雀の顔へ迄
ro: cha wo koku ya fukura suzume no kao e made
en:
threshing tea--
leaves fly at a fat sparrow's
face too

jp: .鍋ずみに一際蒔る草葉哉
ro: nabezumi ni hito kiwa makeru kusaba kana
en:
sowing seeds to the edge
of the kettle's soot-pile...
herbs

jp: .御僧の其後見へぬつぎ木哉
ro: on sô [no] sono nochi mienu tsugiki kana
en:
the blessed priest
won't see it in his next life...
grafted tree

jp: .なく烏門のつぎ穂を笑ふらん
ro: naku karasu kado no tsugiho wo warauran
en:
at my gate
the crow laughs
at the branch I grafted

jp: .のら猫も妻乞ふ声は持にけり
ro: nora neko mo tsuma kou koe wa mochi ni keri
en:
even the stray cat
begging
for a wife!

jp: .巣の鳥や人が立ても口を明く
ro: su no tori ya hito ga tatte mo kuchi wo aku
en:
nestling--
even when people come
opening its mouth

jp: .見るうちに一人かせぎや雀の子
ro: miru uchi ni hitori kasegi ya suzume no ko
en:
while I watch
he's off to make a living alone...
baby sparrow

jp: .鶯が呑んでから汲古井哉
ro: uguisu ga nonde kara kumu furu i kana
en:
after the nightingale drinks
water is drawn...
old well

jp: .鶯が人は何とも思はぬか
ro: uguisu ga hito wa nan to mo omo[wa]nu ka
en:
nightingale--
what don't you know
about people?

jp: .鶯にかさい訛はなかりけり
ro: uguisu ni kasai namari wa nakari keri
en:
the nightingale sings--
no trace of a country
accent

jp: .鶯や摺小木かけも梅の花
ro: uguisu ya surikogi kake mo ume no hana
en:
nightingale sings
a pestle pounds...
plum blossoms

jp: .島々も仏法ありて燕哉
ro: shima-jima mo buppô arite tsubame kana
en:
even on the little islands
Buddha's law...
swallows

jp: .巣乙鳥の目を放さぬや暮の空
ro: su tsubame no me wo hanasanu ya kure no sora
en:
baby swallows in the nest--
eyes glued
on the evening sky

jp: .山里は乙鳥の声も祝ふ也
ro: yama-zato wa tsubame no koe mo iwau nari
en:
mountain village--
even the swallows sing
in celebration

jp: .夕燕我には翌のあてはなき
ro: yûtsubame ware ni wa asu no ate wa naki
en:
evening swallows--
no hope for tomorrow
for me

jp: .売布を透かす先より雲雀哉
ro: uri nuno wo sukasu saki yori hibari kana
en:
through a gap
in the cloths for sale...
a skylark

jp: .鳴雲雀朝から咽のかわく也
ro: naku hibari asa kara nodo no kawaku nari
en:
singing since morning
skylark, your throat
is parched

jp: .鳴雲雀小草も銭に成にけり
ro: naku hibari o-gusa mo zeni ni nari ni keri
en:
singing lark--
little grasses too
become money

jp: .馬の呑水になれたる雉哉
ro: uma no nomu mizur ni naretaru kigisu kana
en:
getting used to drinking
the horse's water...
a pheasant

jp: .雉鳴て姥が田麦もみどり也
ro: kiji naite uba ga ta mugi mo midori nari
en:
a pheasant crying
the old woman's plot of wheat, too
all green

jp: .雉なくやきのふ焼れし千代の松
ro: kiji naku ya kinou yakareshi chiyo no matsu
en:
a pheasant cries--
burnt black yesterday
this ancient pine

jp: .雉子なくや気のへるやうに春の立
ro: kiji naku ya ki no heru yô ni haru no tatsu
en:
the pheasant's cry sounds
half-hearted...
spring begins

jp: .痩臑にいきみをつける雉哉
ro: yase-zune ni isami wo tsukeru kigisu kana
en:
giving these skinny legs
new life...
a pheasant

jp: .雁行って人に荒行草葉哉
ro: kari itte hito ni areyuku kusaba kana
en:
geese have gone--
the field's grass chafing
people

jp: .立雁が大きな糞をしたりけり
ro: tatsu kari ga ôkina hako wo shitari keri
en:
the departing goose
drops an enormous
crap

jp: .藪蕎麦のとくとく匂へかへる雁
ro: yabu soba no toku-toku nioe kaeru kari
en:
smell the buckwheat
in the thicket!
departing geese

jp: .行雁がつくづく見るや煤畳
ro: yuku kari ga tsuku-zuku miru ya susu tatami
en:
the traveling geese
check it out thoroughly...
sooty mat

jp: .行雁や人の心もうはの空
ro: yuku kari ya hito no kokoro mo uwa no sora
en:
traveling geese--
the human heart, too
soars

jp: .あさぢふや臼の中よりなく蛙
ro: asajiu ya usu no naka yori naku kawazu
en:
from the tub in the reeds
a croaking
frog

jp: .影ぼふし我にとなりし蛙哉
ro: kagebôshi ware ni tonari shi kawazu kana
en:
next to my shadow
that
of a frog

jp: .なく蛙夜はあつけなく成にけり
ro: naku kawazu yo wa akkenaku nari ni keri
en:
frogs croaking
the nights becoming
shorter

jp: .葉隠に年寄声の蛙哉
ro: ha-gakure ni toshiyori koe no kawazu kana
en:
in leafy shade
an old man's voice...
a frog!

jp: .葉隠の椿見つめてなく蛙
ro: ha-gakure no tsubaki mitsumete naku kawazu
en:
in leafy shade
gazing at the camellia...
croaking frog

jp: .むさい家の夜を見にござれなく蛙
ro: musai ya no yo wo mi ni gozare naku kawazu
en:
"Come see
the crappy house at night!"
croak the frogs

jp: .夕蛙葎の雨に老をなく
ro: yû kawazu mugura no ame ni oi wo naku
en:
an evening frog
in rainy weeds sings
of old age

jp: .我門のしはがれ蛙鳴にけり
ro: waga kado no shiwagare kawazu naki ni keri
en:
at my gate
the hoarse frog
keeps singing

jp: .蝶おりおり馬のぬれ足ねぶる也
ro: chô ori-ori uma no nure ashi neburu nari
en:
a butterfly on the wet
horse's leg
now and then, sleeps

jp: .藪の蜂来ん世も我にあやかるな
ro: yabu no hachi kon'yo mo ware ni ayakaru na
en:
thicket bees
in the next life don't
be like me

jp: .あさぢふや馬の見て居る梅の花
ro: asajiu ya uma no mite iru ume no hana
en:
cogan grass--
the horse gazes
at plum blossoms

jp: .馬の子の襟する梅の咲にけり
ro: uma no ko no eri suru ume no saki ni keri
en:
the pony's
favorite neck-scratcher...
blooming plum

jp: .藪脇にこそり咲けり梅の花
ro: yabu waki ni kosori saki keri ume [no] hana
en:
at the thicket's edge
blooming on the sly...
plum trees

jp: .傘で来し人をにらむや花の陰
ro: kasa de koshi hito wo niramu ya hana no kage
en:
glaring at the newcomer
with his umbrella...
blossom shade

jp: .かつしかの空と覚へて花の雲
ro: katsushika no sora to oboete hana no kumo
en:
like the sky
over Katsushika...
clouds of blossoms

jp: .咲花やけふをかぎりの江戸住居
ro: saku hana ya kyô wo kagiri no edo sumai
en:
cherry blossoms--
I've been living in Edo
for this day!

jp: .花の雨ことしも罪を作りけり
ro: hana no ame kotoshi mo tsumi wo tsukuri keri
en:
rain of cherry blossoms--
this year, too
I've sinned

jp: .花の陰よい雷といふも有
ro: hana no kage yoi kaminari to iu mo ari
en:
cherry blossom shade--
"That was good thunder!"
he says

jp: .花の雲翌から江戸におらぬ也
ro: hana no kumo asu kara edo ni oranu nari
en:
cherry blossom clouds--
leaving Edo
tomorrow

jp: .花の山仏を倒す人も有
ro: hana no yama hotoke wo taosu hito mo ari
en:
blossoming mountain--
even men who've knocked over Buddha
are here

jp: .貧乏人花見ぬ春はなかりけり
ro: bimbônin hana minu haru wa nakari keri
en:
for the poor
there's not a spring
without blossoms!

jp: .降雨もしすまし顔や花の陰
ro: furu ame mo shi-sumashi kao ya hana no kage
en:
even in falling rain
satisfied faces...
blossom shade

jp: .うしろから犬のあやしむ桜哉
ro: ushiro kara inu no ayashimu sakura kana
en:
behind me a dog
barks his distrust...
cherry blossoms!

jp: .鉦太鼓敲止ば桜哉
ro: kane taiko tataki yamereba sakura kana
en:
bells and big drums
all stop...
cherry blossoms

jp: .桜守り仏の気にはそむくべし
ro: sakura mori hotoke no ki ni wa somukubeshi
en:
cherry blossom guard--
not much
of a Buddhist

jp: .ただ頼々とや桜咲
ro: tada tanome tada tanome to ya sakura saku
en:
simply trust,
simply trust!
cherry blossoms in bloom

jp: .菜畠もたしに見らるる桜哉
ro: na-batake mo tashi ni miraruru sakura kana
en:
the farm field too
is worth a look...
cherry blossoms

jp: .山吹に大宮人の薄着哉
ro: yamabuki ni ômiyabito no usugi kana
en:
in yellow roses
a great courtier's
thin kimono

jp: .里の子が柳掴で寝たりけり
ro: sato no ko ga yanagi tsukande netari keri
en:
the village child
clutching the willow
sound asleep

jp: .草植て夜は短くぞ成にけり
ro: kusa uete yo wa mijikaku zo nari ni keri
en:
planting grass--
the nights are growing
shorter

jp: .短夜やけさは枕も草の露
ro: mijika yo ya kesa wa makura mo kusa no tsuyu
en:
short summer night--
this morning on my pillow
dewdrops

jp: .五月雨や烏あなどる草の家
ro: samidare ya karasu anadoru kusa no ie
en:
Fifth Month rain--
the crow scorns
my thatched house

jp: .五月雨や二軒して見る草の花
ro: samidare ya ni ken shite miru kusa no hana
en:
Fifth Month rain--
they watch from two houses
wildflowers

jp: .見直せば見直せば人の青田哉
ro: minaoseba minaoseba hito no aoda kana
en:
looking again
looking again...
someone else's green field

jp: .曙の空色衣かへにけり
ro: akebono no sora iro koromo kae ni keri
en:
the sky colors
of dawn have changed
to summer clothes

jp: .袷きる度にとしよると思哉
ro: awase kiru tabi ni toshiyoru to omou kana
en:
every time I put on
the summer kimono...
feel old

jp: .此月に扇かぶって寝たりけり
ro: kono tsuki ni ôgi kabutte netari keri
en:
such a moon!
yet he's under his fan
asleep

jp: .川々は昔の闇や時鳥
ro: kawa-gawa wa mukashi no yami ya hototogisu
en:
the rivers have
an ancient darkness...
cuckoo

jp: .時鳥都にして見る月よ哉
ro: hototogisu miyako ni shite miru tsuki yo kana
en:
cuckoo--
since you're in Kyoto
look at that moon!

jp: .時鳥ことしも見るは葎也
ro: hototogisu kotoshi mo miru wa mugura nari
en:
cuckoo--
this year again, nothing
but weeds

jp: .時鳥常と成たる月よ哉
ro: hototogisu tsune to naritaru tsuki yo kana
en:
the cuckoo's becoming
a regular...
moonlit night

jp: .鶯に老を及す草家哉
ro: uguisu ni oi wo oyobosu kusaya kana
en:
making the nightingale
reach old age...
my thatched hut

jp: .鶯の寝に来て垣も老にけり
ro: uguisu no ne ni kite kaki mo oi ni keri
en:
my fence where the nightingale
comes to sleep...
it too is old

jp: .手の皺が歩み悪いか初蛍
ro: te no shiwa ga arumi nikui ka hatsu-botaru
en:
is my wrinkled hand
bad for walking?
first firefly

jp: .鶯と留主をしておれかたつぶり
ro: uguisu to rusu wo shite ore katatsuburi
en:
while I'm gone
you and the nightingale are in charge
my snail

jp: .わか葉吹々とて寝たりけり
ro: wakaba fuku fuku tote netari keri
en:
fresh green leaves
blowing, blowing...
where I lie

jp: .越後山背筋あたりを冷つきぬ
ro: echigo yama sesuji atari wo hiyatsukinu
en:
Echigo mountains--
a chill runs up
my spine

jp: .背筋から冷つきにけり越後山
ro: sesuji kara hiyatsuki ni keri echigo yama
en:
a chill runs up
my spine...
Echigo mountains

jp: .冷つくや背すじあたりの斑山
ro: hiyatsuku ya sesuji atari no madara yama
en:
autumn chill--
my spine feels
the mottled mountain

jp: .秋の夕親里らしくなかりけり
ro: aki no yû oya-zato-rashiku nakari keri
en:
autumn evening--
this is nothing like
my home village

jp: .行雲やかへらぬ秋を蝉の鳴く
ro: yuku kumo ya kaeranu aki wo semi no naku
en:
departing clouds--
"Autumn won't return"
the cicadas sing

jp: .たまに来た古郷の月は曇りけり
ro: tama ni kita furusato no tsuki wa kumori keri
en:
a glimpse of moon
over my home village...
then clouds

jp: .たまたまの古郷の月も涙哉
ro: tama-tama no furusato no tsuki mo namida kana
en:
even the moon
over my home village...
brings tears

jp: .月さしてちいさき薮も祭り也
ro: tsuki sashite chiisaki yabu mo matsuri nari
en:
bright moon--
in a little thicket too
a festival!

jp: .山霧や声うつくしき馬糞かき
ro: yama-giri ya koe utsukushiki ma-guso-kaki
en:
mountain mist--
the beautiful voice
of the dung-hauler

jp: .里の子のおもしろがるか迎へ鐘
ro: sato no ko no omoshiragaru ka mukae-gane
en:
does it delight
the village child?
bell for the ancestors

jp: .玉棚に必風の吹といふ
ro: tama-dana ni kanarazu kaze no fuku to iu
en:
on the ancestors' altar
without fail
a lucky wind blows

jp: .迎へ火と見かけて降か山の雨
ro: mukaebi to mikakete furu ka yama no ame
en:
you saw the bonfires
for the dead?
mountain rain

jp: .間々に松風の吹角力哉
ro: aiai ni matsu kaze no fuku sumô kana
en:
now and then
a pine breeze...
sumo wrestler

jp: .草花をよけて居るや勝角力
ro: kusabana wo yokete suwaru ya kachi sumô
en:
avoiding the wildflowers
he squats...
sumo champion

jp: .角力とり松も年よる世也けり
ro: sumôtori matsu mo toshiyoru yo nari keri
en:
the sumo wrestler
and the pine
grow old together

jp: .まどいして紅葉を祭る山の鹿
ro: madoi shite momiji [wo] matsuru yama no shika
en:
a little party
in the red leaves...
mountain deer

jp: .鍬の罰思ひつく夜や雁の鳴
ro: kuwa no batsu omoitsuku yo ya kari no naku
en:
the hoe's a curse
I'm thinking tonight...
wild geese calling

jp: .窓の蓋おろしすまして雁の鳴
ro: mado no futa oroshi sumashite kari no naku
en:
pulling shut
the window covers...
geese honking

jp: .草原のその長き赤とんぼ
ro: kusabara no sono nagaki aka tombo
en:
in the grassy meadow
how l-o-n-g you are!
red dragonfly

jp: .そば所と人はいふ也赤蜻蛉
ro: soba toko to hito wa iu nari aka tombo
en:
people call it
the "Buckwheat Place"
red dragonfly

jp: .とんぼうの赤きは人に追れけり
ro: tombô no akaki wa hito ni oware keri
en:
the dragonfly's redness--
chased away
by people

jp: .とんぼうの糸も日々古びけり
ro: tombô no ito mo nichi-nichi furubi keri
en:
the dragonfly's tail, too
day by day
grows old

jp: .庇から引つづく也草の花
ro: hisashi kara hikitsuzuku nari kusa no hana
en:
from the eaves
one by one...
wildflowers

jp: .咲直し咲直しけり祭り菊
ro: saki naoshi saki naoshi keri matsuri kiku
en:
blooming better
and better!
the festival chrysanthemum

jp: .里犬の尿をかけけり菊の花
ro: sato inu no bari wo kake keri kiku no hana
en:
watered by
the village dog...
chrysanthemum

jp: .雪国の大朝顔の咲にけり
ro: yuki-guni no ôasagao no saki ni keri
en:
snow country's
humongous morning-glories
have bloomed!

jp: .きたないといふまま萩の咲にけり
ro: kitanai to iu mama hagi no saki ni keri
en:
down and dirty
just as is...
bush clover blooms

jp: .咲日から足にからまる萩の花
ro: saku hi kara ashi ni karamaru hagi no hana
en:
after blooming day
twining 'round my legs...
bush clover

jp: .痩萩やぶくりぶくりと散にけり
ro: yase hagi ya bukuri-bukuri to chiri ni keri
en:
barren bush clover--
softly, softly its blooms
have scattered

jp: .小烏も嬉し鳴する稲ほ哉
ro: ko-garasu mo ureshinaki suru inaho kana
en:
the little crow
also weeps for joy...
heads of rice

jp: .小男鹿の水鼻拭ふ紅葉哉
ro: saoshika no mizu-bana nuguu momiji kana
en:
the young buck
wipes his wet nose...
autumn leaves

jp: .近づけば急に淋しき紅葉哉
ro: chikazukeba [kyû] ni sabishiki momiji kana
en:
drawing near them
a sudden loneliness...
autumn leaves

jp: .人先に鷺の音する氷哉
ro: hito saki ni sagi no oto suru kôri kana
en:
before people do
herons raise a clamor
"Ice!"

jp: .としの暮亀はいつ迄釣さるる
ro: toshi [no] kure kame wa itsu made tsuru saruru
en:
the year ends--
how long will that turtle
hang there?

jp: .牛の汗あらし木がらし吹にけり
ro: ushi no ase arashi kogarashi fuki ni keri
en:
winter storm, winter wind--
the cow's sweat
blown away

jp: .木がらしにくすくす豚の寝たりけり
ro: kogarashi ni kusu-kusu buta no netari keri
en:
in winter wind
the pig giggles
in his sleep

jp: .心からしなのの雪に降られけり
ro: kokoro kara shinano no yuki ni furare keri
en:
from the deep heart
of Shinano
snow is falling

jp: .寝ならふやしなのの山も夜の雪
ro: ne narau ya shinano no yama mo yoru no yuki
en:
sleeping side by side
Shinano's mountains too...
evening snow

jp: .雪の日や古郷人もぶあしらひ
ro: yuki no hi ya furusato-bito mo buashirai
en:
snowy day--
people of my village too
unwelcoming

jp: .はつ霜や何を願ひのきりぎりす
ro: hatsu shimo ya nani wo negai no kirigirisu
en:
first frost--
what are you praying for
katydid?

jp: .我塚もやがて頼むぞ鉢敲
ro: waga tsuka mo yagate tanomu zo hachi tataki
en:
my grave too
will soon need his prayer...
a monk beats his bowl

jp: .すす払藪の雀の寝所迄
ro: susu harai yabu no suzume no nedoko made
en:
sweeping soot--
even the sparrow's bed
in the thicket

jp: .ぶつぶつと鳩の小言や衣配
ro: butsu-butsu to hato no kogoto ya kinu kubari
en:
grumble, grumble
the pigeon nags...
no gift of new clothes

jp: .高砂の松や笑はんとしの豆
ro: takasago no matsu ya warawan toshi no mame
en:
the pines of Takasago
laughing...
the year's last day

jp: .立枯の木にはづかしき頭巾哉
ro: tachigare no ki ni hazukashiki zukin kana
en:
looking pitiful
in the blighted tree...
a skullcap

jp: .けふもけふもけふも竹見る火桶哉
ro: kyô mo kyô mo kyô mo take miru hioke kana
en:
today too, today too
bamboo viewing...
wooden brazier

jp: .正月の来るもかまはぬほた火哉
ro: shôgatsu no kuru mo kamawanu hotabi kana
en:
paying no heed
that spring is coming...
the wood fire

jp: .地蔵さへとしよるやうに木の葉哉
ro: jizô sae toshiyoru yô ni ko[no]ha kana
en:
even holy Jizo
is looking older...
fallen leaves

jp: .鶯に一葉かぶさる紅葉哉
ro: uguisu ni hito ha kabusaru momiji kana
en:
for the nightingale
one is a hat...
red leaves

jp: .翌ありと思ふ烏の目ざし哉
ro: asu ari to omou karasu no mezashi kana
en:
the crow
is thinking, "There's always
tomorrow!"

jp: .さりながら道の悪るさよ日の始
ro: sari nagara michi no wa[ru]sa yo hi no hajime
en:
ah well
the road is wretched...
year's first day

jp: .あら玉のとし立かへる虱哉
ro: aratama no toshi tachikaeru shirami kana
en:
a shiny-new year
has come again...
for my lice

jp: .正月や猫の塚にも梅の花
ro: shôgatsu [ya] neko no tsuka ni mo ume no hana
en:
First Month--
at the cat's grave too
plum blossoms

jp: .正月や村の小すみの梅の花
ro: shôgatsu ya mura no kosumi no ume no hana
en:
First Month--
in a nook of the village
plum blossoms!

jp: .古羽織長の正月も過にけり
ro: furu haori naga no shôgatsu mo sugi ni keri
en:
my old coat--
a long First Month
creeps by

jp: .藪並や貧乏草も花の春
ro: yabu nami ya bimbôgusa mo hana no haru
en:
stand of trees--
even from poor grasses
flowering spring

jp: .貧乏草愛たき春に逢にけり
ro: bimbô-gusa medetaki haru ni ai ni keri
en:
the wild daisies
are celebrating...
spring's first day

jp: .春立と猿も袖口見ゆる也
ro: haru tatsu to saru mo sodeguchi miyuru nari
en:
a new spring
and a monkey!
viewed through my cuff

jp: .春立や我家の空もなつかしき
ro: haru tatsu ya waga ya no sora mo natsukashiki
en:
spring's begun--
the sky over my house too
like old times

jp: .寝勝手に梅の咲けり我恵方
ro: ne katte ni ume no saki keri waga ehô
en:
while I slept
the plum tree bloomed!
lucky direction walk

jp: .それそこの梅も頼むぞ畚おろし
ro: sore soko no ume mo tanomu zo fugo oroshi
en:
those plum blossoms too
must trust...
lowering the basket

jp: .やぶ入の顔にもつけよ梅の花
ro: yabuiri no kao ni mo tsuke yo ume no hana
en:
on the homecoming servant's
face too...
plum blossoms

jp: .やぶ入のかくしかねたる白髪哉
ro: yabuiri no kakushi kanetaru shiraga kana
en:
on the Servants' Holiday
there's no hiding
the white hair

jp: .相場原子の日の時の松ならん
ro: sôba hara ne [no] hi no toki no matsu naran
en:
Soba Field--
on the first day of Rat
picking a pine tree

jp: .喰つみも子隅の春と成にけり
ro: kuitsumi mo ko sumi no haru to nari ni keri
en:
stockpiling rice
for Little New Year's...
little nook of spring

jp: .門松の陰にはづるる我家哉
ro: kadomatsu no kage ni hazururu waga ya kana
en:
out of place
with the New Year's pine...
my house

jp: .きそ始山の梟笑ふらん
ro: kiso hajime yama no fukurô warauran
en:
putting on my
New Year's clothes...
the mountain owl laughs

jp: .わか水のよしなき人に汲れけり
ro: wakamizu no yoshi naki hito ni kumare keri
en:
New Year's water--
an unfortunate soul
ladles it

jp: .万歳のけふも昔に成りにけり
ro: manzai no kyô mo mukashi ni nari ni keri
en:
begging actors--
the olden times return
today

jp: .としよりの今を春辺や夜の雨
ro: toshiyori no ima wo harube ya yoru no ame
en:
now it's a springtime
befitting old men...
evening rain

jp: .春の日や雪隠草履の新しき
ro: haru no hi ya setchin zôri no atarashiki
en:
spring day--
the outhouse sandals
are new

jp: .鶯の咽かはかする日永哉
ro: uguisu no nodo kawakasuru hi naga kana
en:
the nightingale's
throat is parched...
a long day

jp: .のべの草蝶の上にも日や長き
ro: nobe no kusa chô no ue ni mo hi ya nagaki
en:
even for the meadow
butterflies...
the day is long

jp: .ぽちゃぽちゃと鳩の太りて日の長き
ro: pocha-pocha to hato no futorite hi no nagaki
en:
roly-poly pigeons
growing fatter...
a long day

jp: .角田川どこから春は暮るるぞよ
ro: sumida-gawa doko kara haru wa kururu zo yo
en:
Sumida River
from whence will spring's dusk
come?

jp: .春の夜や一の宝の火吹竹
ro: haru no yo ya ichi no takara no hifukitake
en:
spring evening--
the bamboo fire-feeding pipe
is a treasure

jp: .壁の穴幸春の雨夜哉
ro: kabe no ana saiwai haru no amayo kana
en:
hole in the wall--
"blessed" spring's
night rain

jp: .春雨やかまくら雀何となく
ro: harusame ya kamakura suzume nan to naku
en:
in spring rain
Kamakura's sparrow's...
how they sing!

jp: .古郷や草の春雨鍬祭
ro: furusato ya kusa no harusame kuwa matsuri
en:
home village--
spring rain on the grass
Hoe Festival

jp: .膳先に夜の春風吹にけり
ro: zen saki ni yoru no haru kaze fuki ni keri
en:
to my dinner tray
evening's spring breeze
comes wafting

jp: .霞日や大宮人の髪の砂
ro: kasumu hi ya ômiyabito no kami no suna
en:
misty day--
the great courtier
with sand in his hair

jp: .玉琴も乞食の笛もかすみけり
ro: tamagoto mo kojiki no fue mo kasumi keri
en:
a precious harp
a beggar's flute
deep in mist

jp: .吹下手の笛もほのぼのかすみ哉
ro: fuki-beta no fue mo hono-bono kasumi kana
en:
a poorly played flute
faintly, faintly...
spring mist

jp: .陽炎の手の皺からも立にけり
ro: kagerô no te no shiwa kara mo tachi ni keri
en:
heat shimmers rise
even from my hand's
wrinkles!

jp: .陽炎や翌の酒価の小柴垣
ro: kagerô ya asu no sakane no ko shiba-gaki
en:
heat shimmers--
tomorrow's sake price
on a little brushwood fence

jp: .陽炎やきのふ鳴たる田にし殻
ro: kagerô ya kinou nakitaru tanashi-gara
en:
heat shimmers--
yesterday it sang
pond snail shell

jp: .陽炎や人に聞れし虫の殻
ro: kagerô ya hito ni kikareshi mushi no kara
en:
heat shimmers--
someone listening to
a snail shell

jp: .雛の日もろくな桜はなかりけり
ro: hina no hi mo rokuna sakura wa nakari keri
en:
by Doll Festival time
not a decent cherry tree
blooming anywhere

jp: .煙たいとおぼしめすかよ雛顔
ro: kebutai to oboshimesu ka yo hiina kao
en:
do you think
it's too smoky in here?
face of the doll

jp: .そろそろと蝶も雀も汐干哉
ro: soro-soro to chô mo suzume mo shioi kana
en:
the butterfly and sparrow
creep along with it...
low tide

jp: .麦の葉に汐干なぐれの烏哉
ro: mugi no ha ni shiohi nagure no karasu kana
en:
some stay behind
in the barley...
low tide crows

jp: .うぐひすもうかれ鳴する茶つみ哉
ro: uguisu mo ukare naki suru cha tsumi kana
en:
the nightingale, too
has a merry song...
tea pickers

jp: .鳥をとる鳥の栖も焼れけり
ro: tori wo toru tori no sumika mo yakare keri
en:
even bird-eating birds
lose their nests
in the burning grass

jp: .寝蝶や焼野の煙かかる迄
ro: neru chô ya yakeno no kemuri kakaru made
en:
the butterfly sleeps--
until the burning field's smoke
covers it

jp: .畠打やかざしにしたる梅の花
ro: hata uchi ya kazashi ni shitaru ume no hana
en:
giving shade
for the farmer's plowing...
plum blossoms

jp: .鶯の鳴とばかりにつぎ穂哉
ro: uguisu no naku to bakari ni tsugiho kana
en:
just hearing a nightingale
is enough...
grafting a branch

jp: .鶯の寝所になれとつぎ穂哉
ro: uguisu no nedoko ni nare to tsugiho kana
en:
become the nightingale's
sleeping place...
my grafted tree

jp: .夜に入れば直したくなるつぎ穂哉
ro: yo ni ireba naoshitaku naru tsugiho kana
en:
after dark
now I want to fix it...
grafted tree

jp: .梅がかにうかれ出けり不精猫
ro: ume ga ka ni ukare ide keri bushô neko
en:
plum blossom scent
sends him off carousing...
lazy cat

jp: .鳥の巣をやめるつもりか夕の鐘
ro: tori no su wo yameru tsumori ka yû no kane
en:
are you planning
to leave your nest, little bird?
evening bell

jp: .鳥の巣にあてがうておく垣根哉
ro: tori no su ni ategaute oku kakine kana
en:
anchoring
the bird's nest...
the fence

jp: .鳥の巣に作り込れし桜哉
ro: tori no su ni tsukuri komareshi sakura kana
en:
adding themselves
to the bird's nest...
cherry blossoms

jp: .鶯に亀も鳴たいやうす哉
ro: uguisu ni kame mo nakitai yôsu kana
en:
nightingale--
even the turtle wants
to break into song

jp: .鶯にだまって居らぬ雀かな
ro: uguisu ni damatte iranu suzume kana
en:
not hushing up
for the nightingale...
sparrows

jp: .鶯や懐の子も口を明く
ro: uguisu ya futokoro no ko mo kuchi wo aku
en:
nightingale--
the nursing baby also
opens her mouth

jp: .巣乙鳥や何をつぶやく小くらがり
ro: su tsubame ya nani wo tsubuyaku ko kuragari
en:
nesting swallows
what are you grumbling about?
darkness

jp: .なまけ日をさっさと雲雀鳴にけり
ro: namake hi wo sassa to hibari naki ni keri
en:
speeding along
a lazy day, the singing
of a skylark

jp: .雉なくや彼梅わかの涙雨
ro: kiji naku ya kano ume waka no namida ame
en:
a pheasant cries--
the teardrop rain
of Umewaka Day

jp: .尻尾から月の出かかる雉哉
ro: shippo kara tsuki no dekakaru kigisu kana
en:
its tail points
to the rising moon...
pheasant

jp: .野の雉の隠所の庵哉
ro: no no kiji no kakure-dokoro no iori kana
en:
the field pheasant's
hiding place...
my hut

jp: .木母寺は暮ても雉の鳴にけり
ro: mokuboji wa kurete mo kiji no naki ni keri
en:
Mokubo Temple--
even at dusk the pheasant
still crying

jp: .山寺や雪隠も雉のなき所
ro: yamadera ya setchin mo kiji no naki-dokoro
en:
mountain temple--
in the outhouse too
a pheasant cries

jp: .我門や何をとりえに雉の鳴
ro: waga kado ya nani wo torie ni kiji no naku
en:
at my gate
what's your point?
crying pheasant

jp: .雁にさへとり残されし栖哉
ro: kari ni sae tori-nokosareshi sumika kana
en:
even the wild geese
leave it alone...
my home

jp: .梅の木を鳴古したる蛙哉
ro: ume no ki wo naki furushitaru kawazu kana
en:
that croaking at the plum tree
is growing old...
frog

jp: .浦人のお飯の上もかはづ哉
ro: urabito no o-meshi no ue mo kawazu kana
en:
even atop
the seaside dweller's rice...
a frog

jp: .ちる花を口明て待かはづ哉
ro: chiru hana wo kuchi akete matsu kawazu kana
en:
his mouth open
for the falling blossoms...
a frog

jp: .昼顔にうしろの見ゆるかへる哉
ro: hirugao ni ushiro no miyuru kaeru kana
en:
ensconced behind
the day flower...
a frog

jp: .山の鐘蛙もとしのよりぬべし
ro: yama no kane kawazu mo toshi no yorinubeshi
en:
mountain temple bell--
the frog too
must feel old

jp: .我を見てにがひ顔する蛙哉
ro: ware wo mite nigai-gao suru kawazu kana
en:
watching me
with a grumpy face...
a frog

jp: .あか棚に蝶も聞くかよ一大事
ro: aka tana ni chô mo kiku ka yo ichi daiji
en:
on the offering shelf
does the butterfly also hear
Buddha's promise?

jp: .仇し野や露に先立草の蝶
ro: adashi no ya tsuyu ni sakidatsu kusa no chô
en:
Adashi Field--
preceding the dewdrops
butterflies

jp: .門の蝶朝から何がせはしない
ro: kado no chô asa kara nani ga sewashinai
en:
gate's butterfly
since dawn, how have you
kept yourself busy?

jp: .酒好の蝶ならば来よ角田川
ro: sake suki no chô naraba ko yo sumida-gawa
en:
if you like sake
butterfly, come!
Sumida River

jp: .蝶飛んで箸に折るる藪の梅
ro: chô tonde hashi ni oraruru yabu no ume
en:
a flying butterfly
broken by chopsticks...
wild plum

jp: .初蝶の一夜寝にけり犬の椀
ro: hatsu chô no hito yo ne ni keri inu no wan
en:
spring's first butterfly
sleeps one night...
dog's bowl

jp: .初蝶もやがて烏の扶食哉
ro: hatsu chô mo yagate karasu no fujiki kana
en:
first butterfly--
before long some crow's
bite

jp: .春の蝶牛は若やぐ欲もなし
ro: haru no chô ushi wa wakayagu yoku mo nashi
en:
spring butterflies--
the cow has no desire
to be young again

jp: .山鳥のほろほろ雨やとぶ小蝶
ro: yamadori no horo-horo ame ya tobu ko chô
en:
like a mountain bird's
cooing the rain...
flitting butterflies

jp: .白魚に大泥亀も遊びけり
ro: shirauo ni ôdoro-game mo asobi keri
en:
among the whitebait
a big mud turtle
plays too

jp: .白魚のどっと生るるおぼろ哉
ro: shirauo no dotto umaruru oboro kana
en:
darting whitebait
suddenly are born...
night haze

jp: .白魚やきのふも亀の放さるる
ro: shirauo ya kinou mo kame no hanasaruru
en:
whitebait--
yesterday they parted ways
with the turtle

jp: .わか草に我もことしの袂哉
ro: waka-gusa ni waga mo kaotoshi no tamoto kana
en:
in new grass
even I'm in fashion!
this year's sleeves

jp: .わか草や我と雀と遊ぶ程
ro: waka-gusa ya ware to suzume to asobu hodo
en:
new grass--
a sparrow and I
just playing

jp: .凡に三百年の菫かな
ro: ôyoso ni san-byaku nen no sumire kana
en:
in round numbers
three hundred years old...
violets

jp: .菜の花のさし出て咲けりよしの山
ro: na no hana no sashidete saki keri yoshino yama
en:
flowering rape
barging in, blooms...
Yoshino Hill

jp: .なの花の横に寝て咲く庵哉
ro: na no hana no yoko ni nete saku iori kana
en:
rape flowers bloom
while lying down...
my hut

jp: .なの花や雨夜に見ても東山
ro: na no hana ya amayo ni mite mo higashi yama
en:
flowering rape--
even on a rainy night
Higashi Mountains

jp: .棚つけて一度も咲かず藤の花
ro: tana tsukete ichi do mo sakazu fuji no hana
en:
tied to the trellis
it blooms no more...
wisteria

jp: .有がたや楮裂く人の梅の花
ro: arigata ya kazosaku hito no ume [no] hana
en:
the way things are--
the bark-stripper's plum trees
are in bloom

jp: .梅が香をすすり込だる菜汁哉
ro: ume ga ka wo susuri kondaru na-zuyu kana
en:
plum blossom scent--
slurping it in
with the vegetable soup

jp: .梅がかにかぶり馴たる筵哉
ro: ume ga ka ni kaburi naretaru mushiro kana
en:
getting used to this blanket
of plum blossom scent...
straw mat

jp: .梅がかに引くるまりて寝たりけり
ro: ume ga ka ni hikiku[ru]marite netari keri
en:
tucked into folds
of plum blossom scent
I sleep

jp: .梅ちりて急に古びる都哉
ro: ume chirite kyû ni furubiru miyako kana
en:
plum blossoms gone
suddenly Kyoto
looks old

jp: .梟の分別顔や梅の花
ro: fukurô no funbetsu kao ya ume no hana
en:
the owl
has a connoisseur's face...
plum blossoms

jp: .いざさらば死げいこせん花の陰
ro: iza saraba shinigeiko sen hana no kage
en:
"Well then, we'll teach you
how to die..."
blossom shade

jp: .乞食も一曲あるか花の陰
ro: konjiki mo ikkyoku aru ka hana no kage
en:
is even the beggar
singing a song?
blossom shade

jp: .咲く花に部張り給はぬ御馬哉
ro: saku hana ni bubari tamawanu o-uma kana
en:
among cherry blossoms
not so soldierly...
Sir Horse

jp: .さく花や昔々はこの位
ro: saku hana ya mukashi mukashi donokurai
en:
cherry blossoms--
how long
since olden times?

jp: .ちる花をざばざば浴る雀哉
ro: chiru hana wo zabu-zabu abiru suzume kana
en:
splish-splash
the sparrow takes
a blossom bath

jp: .ちる花や鶯もなく我もなく
ro: chiru hana ya uguisu mo naku ware mo naku
en:
cherry blossoms scatter--
a nightingale sings
I cry

jp: .花盛り必風邪のはやりけり
ro: hana saka[ri] kanarazu kaze no hayari keri
en:
cherry trees in full bloom--
colds, no doubt
are spreading

jp: .花さくや目を縫れたる鳥の鳴
ro: hana saku ya me wo nuwaretaru tori no naku
en:
cherry blossoms--
chickens with eyes stitched shut
clucking

jp: .花の雨虎が涙も交るべし
ro: hana no ame tora ga namida mo majiru-beshi
en:
rain of blossoms
and the Tiger's tears...
let them mingle

jp: .又しても橋銭かする花見哉
ro: mata shite mo hashisen ka-suru hanami kana
en:
once again
there's a toll on the bridge...
blossom viewing

jp: .山盛の花の吹雪や犬の椀
ro: yamamori no hana no fubuki ya inu no wan
en:
a cherry blossom
blizzard...
the dog's bowl

jp: .翌あらばあらばと思ふ桜哉
ro: asu araba araba to omou sakura kana
en:
tomorrow and tomorrow
will they still be?
cherry blossoms

jp: .大汗に拭ひ込だる桜哉
ro: ôase ni nugui kondaru sakura kana
en:
polished to a shine
by my sweat...
cherry blossoms

jp: .小坊主や親の供して山桜
ro: ko bôzu ya oya no tomo shite yama-zakura
en:
the little boy
goes with his father...
mountain cherry blossoms

jp: .米踏みも唄をば止よ桜ちる
ro: komefumi mo uta woba yame yo sakura chiru
en:
even the rice grinders
stop singing...
cherry blossoms scatter

jp: .桜花賎しき袖にかかりけり
ro: sakura hana iyashiki sode ni kakari keri
en:
cherry blossoms--
to my lowly sleeve
they cling

jp: .死下手と又も見られん桜花
ro: shinibeta to mata mo miraren sakura-bana
en:
that they're no good at dying
again can be seen...
cherry blossoms

jp: .煤臭い笠も桜の咲日哉
ro: susu kusai kasa mo sakura no saku hi kana
en:
a soot-grimed
umbrella-hat too...
on cherry blossom day

jp: .祟りなす杉はふとりてちる桜
ro: tatari nasu sugi wa futorite chiru sakura
en:
the cursed cedar
growing fat...
cherry blossoms fall

jp: .ちる桜けふもむちゃくちゃくらしけり
ro: chiru sakura kyô mo mucha-kucha kurashi keri
en:
cherry blossoms scatter--
another day
of life's chaos

jp: .花咲くや桜が下のばくち小屋
ro: hana saku ya sakura ga shita no bakuchi-goya
en:
under the cherry tree
in bloom
a little gambling shack

jp: .ぼた餅や跡の祭りに桜ちる
ro: botamochi ya ato no matsuri ni sakura chiru
en:
rice cakes and jelly--
but too late
cherry blossoms fall

jp: .御仏もこち向給ふ桜哉
ro: mi-botoke mo kochi muki tamau sakura kana
en:
the Buddha too
looks this way...
cherry blossoms!

jp: .山桜髪なき人にかざさるる
ro: yamazakura kami naki hito ni kazasaruru
en:
mountain cherry blossoms--
hair decoration
for a bald man

jp: .山桜松は武張って立にけり
ro: yamazakura matsu wa buhatte tachi ni keri
en:
mountain cherry blossoms--
the pine trees
stand guard

jp: .桃苗は花を持けり数珠嫌
ro: momo nae wa hana wo mochi keri juzu-girai
en:
his peach sapling
has blossomed...
though he never prays

jp: .大藪の入りの入りなる桃の花
ro: ôyabu no iri no iri naru momo no hana
en:
the servant returns
and welcoming him home...
peach blossoms

jp: .蚊所の八重山吹の咲にけり
ro: ka-dokoro no yae yamabuki no saki ni keri
en:
in mosquito territory
the double blossom
yellow roses

jp: .山吹や培ふ草は日まけして
ro: yamabuki ya tsuchikau kusa wa hi makeshite
en:
yellow rose--
the cultivated grasses
blocking your sun

jp: .山吹は時鳥待つもり哉
ro: yamabuki wa hototogisu matsu tsumori kana
en:
the yellow rose
wants to hang around...
for the cuckoo

jp: .青柳のかかる小隅も都哉
ro: ao yagi no kakaru kosumi mo miyako kana
en:
even in little nooks
green willows...
Kyoto

jp: .鶏〆る門の柳の青みけり
ro: tori shimeru kado no yanagi no aomi keri
en:
killing a chicken--
the willow at the gate
so green

jp: .短夜を継たしてなく蛙哉
ro: mijika yo wo tsugitashite naku kawazu kana
en:
stitching together
the short summer nights...
singing frogs

jp: .涼風に立ちふさがりし茨哉
ro: suzukaze ni tachi-fusagarishi ibara kana
en:
choking off
the cool breeze...
wild roses

jp: .とくとくと水の涼しや蜂の留守
ro: toku-toku to mizu no suzushi ya hachi no rusu
en:
drip-drip
goes the cool water...
the bees are gone

jp: .寝所も五月雨風の吹にけり
ro: nedokoro mo samidare kaze no fuki ni keri
en:
even where I sleep
the Fifth Month rain
sends its wind

jp: .夕立にとんじゃくもなし舞の袖
ro: yûdachi ni tonjaku mo nashi mai no sode
en:
in the cloudburst
paying no heed...
sleeves of the dancers

jp: .夏山や目にもろもろの草の露
ro: natsu yama ya me ni moro-moro no kusa no tsuyu
en:
summer mountain--
dewdrops in the grass
all shapes and sizes

jp: .芒から菩薩の清水流れけり
ro: susuki kara bosatsu no shimizu nagare keri
en:
from the pampas grass
the saint's pure water
flows

jp: .なでしこの折ふせらるる清水哉
ro: nadeshiko no ori fuseraruru shimizu kana
en:
the blooming pinks
folded over...
pure water

jp: .蜂の巣のてくてく下る清水哉
ro: hachi no su no teku-teku sagaru shimizu kana
en:
the beehive dangles
heavily above...
pure water

jp: .山清水木陰にさへも別けり
ro: yama shimizu kokage ni sae mo wakare keri
en:
mountain's pure water--
though shaded by trees
it disperses

jp: .山清水守らせ給ふ仏哉
ro: yama shimizu mamorase tamau hotoke kana
en:
deigning to guard
the pure water...
a stone Buddha

jp: .古葎祭の風のとどく也
ro: furu mugura matsuri no kaze no todoku nari
en:
old weeds--
the festival's breeze
reaches them

jp: .かん仏にとんじゃくもなし草の花
ro: kanbutsu ni tonjaku mo nashi kusa no hana
en:
paying no heed
to Buddha's birthday...
wildflowers

jp: .藤棚も今日に逢けり花御堂
ro: fujidana mo kyô ni ai keri hanamidô
en:
a wisteria trellis
joins the fray...
Buddha's birthday flowers

jp: .夏菊の花ととしよる団扇哉
ro: natsugiku no hana to toshiyoru uchiwa kana
en:
growing old
with the early chrysanthemum
paper fan

jp: .夕暮の虫を鳴する団扇哉
ro: yûgure no mushi wo nakasuru uchiwa kana
en:
conducting the choir
of evening's insects...
paper fan

jp: .鶯の寝所迄も蚊やり哉
ro: uguisu no nedokoro made mo ka yari kana
en:
it reaches
the nightingale's bed too...
smudge pot smoke

jp: .四五尺の山吹そよぐ蚊やり哉
ro: shi go shaku no yamabuki soyogu kayari kana
en:
a four or five foot
yellow rose trembles...
smudge pot smoke

jp: .柴門や蚊にいぶさるる草の花
ro: shiba no to ya ka ni ibusaruru kusa no hana
en:
at my humble hut
smoked by mosquito smudge...
wildflowers

jp: .露おくや晩の蚊やりの草の花
ro: tsuyu oku ya ban no kayari no kusa [no] hana
en:
dewdrops--
evening's smudge pot smoke
over wildflowers

jp: .痩脛や涼めば虻に見込まるる
ro: yase-zune ya suzumeba abu ni mikomaruru
en:
thin legs--
while cooling myself appraised
by a horsefly

jp: .かはほりの住古したる柱哉
ro: kawahori no sumi-furushitaru hashira kana
en:
the bats' home
getting on in years...
the post

jp: .かはほりよ行々京の飯時分
ro: kawahori yo yuke-yuke kyô no meshi jibun
en:
get a move on, bat!
it's dinnertime
in Kyoto

jp: .悪酒や此時鳥此木立
ro: waru-zake ya kono hototogisu kono kodachi
en:
drinking cheap sake--
this cuckoo
this grove

jp: .鶯もとしのよらぬや山の酒
ro: uguisu mo toshi no yoranu ya yama no sake
en:
the nightingale, too
isn't growing old!
mountain sake

jp: .うつくしき花の中より薮蚊哉
ro: utsukushiki hana no naka yori yabu ka kana
en:
from deep inside
the pretty flower...
a mosquito

jp: .蚊の声やさらさら竹もそしらるる
ro: ka no koe ya sara-sara take mo soshiraruru
en:
mosquitoes whine--
even the rustling bamboo
is slandered

jp: .時鳥聞所とて薮蚊哉
ro: hototogisu kiki dokoro tote yabu ka kana
en:
a great spot
to hear the cuckoo...
but mosquitoes!

jp: .蠅打に敲かれ玉ふ仏哉
ro: hae uchi ni tatakare tamau hotoke kana
en:
swatting a fly
but hitting
the Buddha

jp: .草の葉やたっぷりぬれて蝉の鳴
ro: kusa no ha ya tappuri nurete semi no naku
en:
blades of grass--
utterly drenched the cicada
sings

jp: .蝉ばかり涼しき衣きたりけり
ro: semi bakari suzushiki koromo ki[ta]ri keri
en:
worn by only
a cicada...
cool kimono

jp: .投足の蝉へもとどけ昼の空
ro: nageashi no semi e mo todoke hiru no sora
en:
for the cicada too
with outstretched legs...
the noon sky

jp: .片里はおくれ鰹も月よ哉
ro: kata-zato wa okure katsuo mo tsuki yo kana
en:
in one village
late-summer bonito
and bright moon

jp: .昼顔に大きな女通りけり
ro: hirugao ni ôkina onna tôri keri
en:
through day flowers
a large woman
makes her way

jp: .昼顔にころころ虫の鳴にけり
ro: hirugao [ni] koro-koro mushi no naki ni keri
en:
in day flowers
"Cricky! Cricky!" cricket
sings

jp: .昼顔や赤くもならぬ鬼茄子
ro: hirugao ya akaku mo naranu oni nasubi
en:
day flower--
as red
as the devil's eggplant

jp: .昼顔やけぶりのかかる石に迄
ro: hirugao ya keburi no kakaru ishi ni made
en:
day flowers--
even on the smoke-covered
rocks

jp: .夕顔の花めで給へ後架神
ro: yûgao no hana medetamae kôka-gami
en:
enjoy the moonflowers
you gods
of the outhouse!

jp: .夕顔やはらはら雨も福の神
ro: yûgao ya hara-hara ame mo fuku no kami
en:
moonflowers--
the pitter-pattering rain
a good luck god

jp: .筍や鶯親子連立て
ro: takenoko ya uguisu oya-go tsure-dachite
en:
bamboo shoots--
the nightingale brings
her children

jp: .瓜むいて芒の風に吹かれけり
ro: uri muite susuki no kaze ni fukare keri
en:
peeling a melon
in the pampas grass...
a breeze

jp: .長月や廿九日のきくの花
ro: naga tsuki ya ni jû ku nichi no kiku no hana
en:
Ninth Month--
the 29th day
the chrysanthemum blooms

jp: .秋立や寝れば目につく雪の山
ro: aki tatsu ya nereba me ni tsuku yuki no yama
en:
autumn begins--
lying down, looking at
snowy mountains

jp: .今朝の秋山の雪より来る風が
ro: kesa no aki yama no yuki yori kuru kaze ga
en:
first autumn morning
the mountain snow's wind
arrives

jp: .いななくや馬も夜寒は同じ事
ro: inanaku ya uma mo yozamu wa onaji koto
en:
for the neighing horse
the cold night
same as for me

jp: .かくべつの松と成たる夜寒哉
ro: kakubetsu no matsu to naritaru yozamu kana
en:
a pine tree
like none other...
a cold night

jp: .門の木に階子かかりし夜寒哉
ro: kado no ki ni hashigo kakarishi yozamu kana
en:
against the tree
by the gate a ladder...
a cold night

jp: .ことごとく仏の顔も夜寒哉
ro: koto-gotoku hotoke no kao mo yozamu kana
en:
one and all
faces of the Buddhas
cold tonight

jp: .行灯を引ったくられて夜寒哉
ro: andon wo hittaku[ra]rete yozamu kana
en:
my paper lantern
is snatched away...
a cold night

jp: .かたつむり何をかせぐぞ秋の暮
ro: katasumuri nani wo kasegu zo aki no kure
en:
O snail
how do you make your living?
autumn dusk

jp: .梟の一人きげんや秋の暮
ro: fukurô no hitori kigen ya aki no kure
en:
the owl is happy
in his solitude...
autumn dusk

jp: .入月に退くやうな小山哉
ro: iri tsuki ni shirizoku yôna ko yama kana
en:
with the moon out
it seems to shrink back...
little mountain

jp: .ことごとく月はささぬぞらかん達
ro: koto-gotoku tsuki wa sasanu zo rakan-tachi
en:
no sight yet
of the rising moon...
holy men

jp: .しなのぢやいく夜なれても軒の月
ro: shinano ji ya iku yo narete mo noki [no] tsuki
en:
Shinano road--
how many nights now
that moon on the eaves?

jp: .湯けぶりにふすぼりもせぬ月の顔
ro: yu keburi ni fusubori mo senu tsuki no kao
en:
not looking smoky
through hot spring steam...
face of the moon

jp: .いさらいに石あたたまる月よ哉
ro: isarai ni ishi atatamaru tsuki yo kana
en:
under my bottom
the stone warms up...
moonlit night

jp: .名月の御覧の通り屑家也
ro: meigetsu no goran no tôri kuzuya nari
en:
lit by the harvest moon
no different...
trashy house

jp: .秋の天小鳥一つのひろがりぬ
ro: aki no ten ko tori hitotsu no hirogarinu
en:
autumn heavens--
for one little bird
so vast

jp: .秋風に御任せ申す浮藻哉
ro: aki kaze ni o-makase mô[su] ukimo kana
en:
trusting its fate
to the autumn wind...
duckweed

jp: .秋風にことし生たる紅葉哉
ro: aki kaze ni kotoshi haetaru momiji kana
en:
in autumn wind
this year's crop...
red leaves

jp: .秋風や仏に近き年の程
ro: aki kaze ya hotoke ni chikaki toshi no hodo
en:
autumn wind--
death draws closer
with every year

jp: .なけなしの歯を秋風の吹にけり
ro: nakenashi no ha wo aki kaze no fuki ni keri
en:
through what teeth
I have left
autumn's wind whistles

jp: .白露を何とおぼすぞかかし殿
ro: shira tsuyu wo nani to obosu zo kakashi dono
en:
what do you think
of the silver dew
Mr. Scarecrow?

jp: .白露にお花の種を蒔ばやな
ro: shira tsuyu ni obana no tane wo makaba ya na
en:
in the silver dew
I'd like to sow seeds
of pampas grass

jp: .露置てうれしく見ゆる蛙哉
ro: tsuyu oite ureshiku miyuru kawazu kana
en:
happily watching
the dewdrops forming...
a frog

jp: .毒虫もいつか一度は草の露
ro: dokumushi mo itsuka ichi do wa kusa no tsuyu
en:
stinging bug
you too someday, some time...
dewy grass

jp: .乙鳥のつくづく見たる切籠哉
ro: tsubakura no tsuku-zuku mitaru kiriko kana
en:
the swallow's steady
stare...
lantern for the dead

jp: .かがし暮かがし暮けり人の顔
ro: kagashi kure kagashi kure keri hito no kao
en:
scarecrows at dusk
darkening...
human faces

jp: .大切に仕廻って置しかがし哉
ro: taisetsu ni shimatte okishi kagashi kana
en:
stored away
with reverence...
the scarecrow

jp: .人に人かがしにかがし日の暮るる
ro: hito ni hito kagashi ni kagashi hi no kuru[ru]
en:
for people
and for scarecrows
the day ends

jp: .さをしかの鳴も尤も山の雨
ro: saoshika no naku mo mottomo yama no ame
en:
despite your cries
young buck
rain falls on the mountain

jp: .小男鹿や後の一声細長き
ro: saoshika ya ato no hito koe hosonagaki
en:
young buck--
his last cry
thin and long

jp: .山の鹿小萩の露に顔洗へ
ro: yama no shika kohagi no tsuyu ni kao arae
en:
mountain deer
in bush clover dew...
wash your face!

jp: .雁よりも先へ場とりし烏哉
ro: kari yori mo saki e ba torishi karasu kana
en:
before the geese
can take their seats...
crows

jp: .はつ雁や貧乏村を一番に
ro: hatsu kari ya bimbô mura wo ichiban ni
en:
autumn's first geese
come first
to the poor town

jp: .行灯に来馴し虫の鳴にけり
ro: andon ni ki-nareshi mushi no naki ni keri
en:
when a lantern comes
the insect breaks out
in song

jp: .籠の虫けぶりけぶりに鳴馴るる
ro: kago no mushi keburi keburi ni naki naruru
en:
caged insect--
he's learned to sing
in all this smoke

jp: .五六本稲もそよぎて虫の籠
ro: go roku hon ine mo soyogite mushi no kago
en:
five or six trembling
rice plants...
my insect cage

jp: .鳴虫の小さくしたる社哉
ro: naku mushi no chiisaku shitaru yashiro kana
en:
the insects' chorus
makes it smaller...
shrine

jp: .御仏も杓子も虫に鳴かれけり
ro: mi-botoke mo shakushi mo mushi ni nakare keri
en:
Buddha and spoons
the whole wide world!
insects singing

jp: .むさしのの野中の宿の虫籠哉
ro: musashi no no no naka no yado no mushi ko kana
en:
Musashi Plain--
in its middle at a inn
an insect cage

jp: .夜涼みのかぎりを鳴やかごの虫
ro: yo suzumi no kagiri wo naku ya kago no mushi
en:
singing all
the cool night long...
caged insect

jp: .葉の虫ハ化して飛けり朝の月
ro: ha no mushi wa ka shite tobi keri asa no tsuki
en:
a butterfly emerges
and flies away...
morning moon

jp: .羽根生へてな虫ハとぶぞ引がへる
ro: hane haete namushi wa tobu zo hikigaeru
en:
hey toad
the caterpillar will grow
and fly away!

jp: .朝寒もはや合点のとんぼ哉
ro: asa-zamu mo haya gatten no tombo kana
en:
he, too, quickly learns
how cold the morning is...
dragonfly

jp: .こおろぎの巣にはいつなる我白髪
ro: kôrogi no su [ni] wa itsu naru waga shiraga
en:
when will it become
a cricket's nest?
my white hair

jp: .世の中のよしよしといふいなご哉
ro: yo [no] naka no yoshi-yoshi to iu inago kana
en:
"The world is good!
Good!" so say
the locusts

jp: .入相にたじろぎもせず草の花
ro: iriai ni tajirogi mo sezu kusa no hana
en:
not shrinking back
from the sunset...
wildflowers

jp: .狼の毛ずれの草の咲にけり
ro: ôkami no kezure no kusa no saki ni keri
en:
in grass where the wolf
shed his fur...
wildflowers

jp: .草の花人の上には鐘がなる
ro: kusa no hana hito no ue ni wa kane ga naru
en:
wildflowers--
high over people's heads
the bell tolls

jp: .草の花よんどころなく咲にけり
ro: kusa no hana yondokoronaku saki ni keri
en:
out of the grasses
the inevitable
wildflowers!

jp: .鳥鳴て貧乏草も咲にけり
ro: tori naite bimbô-gusa mo saki ni keri
en:
birds singing--
wild daisies too
are blooming

jp: .鉄砲の先に立たり女郎花
ro: teppô no saki ni tachitari ominaeshi
en:
in the musket's
line of fire...
a maiden flower

jp: .狗のかざしにしたり萩の花
ro: enokoro no kazashi ni shitari hagi no hana
en:
decorating the puppy
bush clover
blooms

jp: .子供等が鹿と遊ぶや萩の花
ro: kodomora ga shika to asobu ya hagi no hana
en:
children play
with the deer
bush clover blooming

jp: .萩の花大な犬の寝たりけり
ro: hagi no hana ôkina inu no netari keri
en:
bush clover blooming--
the big dog
sound asleep

jp: .宵々に古くもならず萩の花
ro: yoi-yoi ni furuku mo narazu hagi no hana
en:
every evening
not growing old...
blooming bush clover

jp: .片袂すすきの風に荒れにけり
ro: kata tamoto susuki no kaze ni are ni keri
en:
in one sleeve
the pampas grass wind
buffets

jp: .秋蝿の終の敷寝の一葉哉
ro: aki hae no tsui no shikine no hito ha kana
en:
the autumn fly's
final sleeping spot...
paulownia leaf

jp: .狗のどさりとねまる一葉かな
ro: enokoro no dosari to nemaru hito ha kana
en:
dropping plop!
onto the puppy...
one leaf

jp: .一日の人の中より一葉哉
ro: ichi nichi no hito no naka yori hito ha kana
en:
after one day
among people...
one leaf left

jp: .むづかしや桐の一葉の吹れやう
ro: muzukashi ya kiri no hito ha no fukare yô
en:
not a pretty sight
the paulownia leaf
wind-blown

jp: .ぞくぞくと人のかまはぬ茸哉
ro: zoku-zoku to hito no kamawanu kinoko kana
en:
one by one
ignored by people...
mushrooms

jp: .念仏のころりと出たる茸哉
ro: nembutsu no korori to detaru kinoko kana
en:
a "Praise Buddha!"
pops to my lips...
mushrooms

jp: .松散や茸の時は誰かある
ro: matsu chiru ya kinoko no toki wa dareka aru
en:
pines shed their needles--
come mushroom-hunting time
who'll be here?

jp: .あさぢふや大三十日の夕木魚
ro: a[sa]jiu [ya] ôtsugomori no yû mokugyo
en:
among the reeds
on the year's last evening...
a wooden drum

jp: .大年の日向に立る榎哉
ro: ôtoshi no hinata ni tateru enoki kana
en:
standing
in the dying year's sun...
nettle tree

jp: .梅の木や都のすすの捨所
ro: ume no ki ya miyako no susu no sute-dokoro
en:
plum tree--
the dumping ground for
Kyoto's soot

jp: .すす竹や馬の首も其序
ro: susutake ya uma no kôbe mo sono tsuide
en:
bamboo soot broom--
the horse's head too
by and by

jp: .すす竹や先鶯の鳴ところ
ro: susutake ya mazu uguisu no naku tokoro
en:
bamboo soot broom--
the first nightingale's
singing spot

jp: .すす掃て長閑に暮る菜畠哉
ro: susu haite nodoka ni kururu na hata kana
en:
sweeping soot
the sun sets in peace...
vegetable field

jp: .すすはきやけろけろ門の梅の花
ro: susu haki ya kero-kero kado no ume [no] hana
en:
sweeping soot--
plum blossoms at the gate
indifferent

jp: .木隠やあみだ如来の餅をつく
ro: kogakure ya amida nyorai no mochi wo tsuku
en:
in the tree's shade
pounding rice cakes
for Amida Buddha

jp: .餅つきや都の鶏も皆目覚
ro: mochi tsuki ya miyako no tori mo mina mezamu
en:
pounding rice cakes--
in Kyoto all chickens
are awake

jp: .住吉の隅にとしよる鴎哉
ro: sumiyoshi no sumi ni toshiyoru kamome kana
en:
in a Sumiyoshi nook
growing a year older...
sea gulls

jp: .関守に憎まれ千鳥鳴にけり
ro: sekimori ni nikumare chidori naki ni keri
en:
despised
by the barrier guard...
a plover sings

jp: .礎や元日しまの巣なし鳥
ro: ishizue ya ganjitsu shima no su nashi tori
en:
cornerstone--
on New Year's morning
a bird without a nest

jp: .元日や我のみならぬ巣なし鳥
ro: ganjitsu ya ware nominaranu su nashi tori
en:
on New Year's Day
I have company
bird without a nest

jp: .元日に曲眠りする美人哉
ro: ganjitsu ni kyoku nemuri suru bijin kana
en:
on New Year's Day
a balancing act in her sleep...
pretty woman

jp: .正月がへる夜へる夜の霞かな
ro: shôgatsu ga heru yo heru yo no kasumi kana
en:
less and less First Month
as nights pass by...
mist

jp: .正月は後の祭や春の風
ro: shôgatsu wa ato no matsuri ya haru no kaze
en:
missing the boat
for First Month...
spring breeze

jp: .朝笑いくらに買か花の春
ro: asa warai ikura ni kau ka hana no haru
en:
morning's laugh--
"How much do they cost,
spring's blossoms?"

jp: .家なしの身に成て見る花の春
ro: ie nashi no mi ni natte miru hana [no] haru
en:
now with homeless eyes
I see it...
blossoming spring

jp: .家なしの此身も春に逢ふ日哉
ro: ie nashi no kono mi mo haru ni au hi kana
en:
for this homeless body
of mine, spring's
first day

jp: .薮入が柿の渋さをかくしけり
ro: yabuiri ga kaki no shibusa wo kakushi keri
en:
homecoming servant--
pretending the persimmon
is sweet

jp: .薮入や桐の育ちもついついと
ro: yabuiri ya kiri no soda[chi] mo tsui-tsui to
en:
homecoming servant--
the paulownia tree too
grew up fast

jp: .雑巾のほしどころ也門の松
ro: zôkin no hoshi-dokoro nari kado no matsu
en:
in the mop's
drying place...
my New Year's pine

jp: .生炭団一ッ一ッの日永哉
ro: ike tadon hitotsu hitotsu no hi naga kana
en:
making charcoal balls
one by one...
a long day

jp: .永の日に口明通る烏哉
ro: naga no hi ni kuchi ake-tôru karasu kana
en:
in the long day
passing with mouth wide...
a crow

jp: .春の行夜を梟の小言哉
ro: haru no yuku yo wo fukurô no kogoto kana
en:
at spring's last night
the owl
is nagging

jp: .行春にさしてかまはぬ烏哉
ro: yuku haru ni sashite kamawanu karasu kana
en:
paying no attention
to the departing spring...
crows

jp: .神棚は皆つつじ也春の雨
ro: kami-dana wa mina tsutsuji nari haru no ame
en:
the little shrine
is all azaleas...
spring rain

jp: .けふもけふも同じ山見て春の雨
ro: kyô mo kyô mo onaji yama mite haru no ame
en:
today too
looking at the same mountain...
spring rain

jp: .春雨や土のだんごも遠土産
ro: harusame ya tsuchi no dango mo tômiyage
en:
spring rain--
mud-dumplings too
gifts from afar

jp: .春雨や人の花より我小薮
ro: harusame ya hito no hana yori waga ko yabu
en:
spring rain--
better than the flowers of others
my little thicket

jp: .春風の夜も吹也東山
ro: haru kaze no yoru mo fuku nari higashi yama
en:
the spring breeze
blows all evening too...
Higashi Mountains

jp: .春風や草よりかわく犬張子
ro: haru kaze ya kusa yori kawaku inu hariko
en:
spring breeze--
drying in the grass
a paper dog

jp: .春風や柱の穴も花の塵
ro: haru kaze ya hashira no ana mo hana no chiri
en:
spring wind--
even in the pillar's hole
pollen

jp: .春風や夜にして見たき東山
ro: harukaze ya yo ni shite mitaki higashi yama
en:
spring breeze--
on a night journey to see
Higashi Mountains

jp: .春風や夜も市立なにはがた
ro: harukaze ya yoru mo ichidachi naniwagata
en:
spring breeze--
even at night a market stand
on Naniwa Bay

jp: .愚さを松にかづけて夕がすみ
ro: orokasa wo matsu ni kazukete yûgasumi
en:
accusing the pine
of foolishness...
evening mist

jp: .窓先や常来る人の薄霞
ro: mado saki ya tsune kuru hito no usu-gasumi
en:
to my window
he comes as usual...
thin mist

jp: .夕風呂のだぶりだぶりとかすみ哉
ro: yûfuro no daburi-daburi to kasumi kana
en:
the evening bath
slish-slosh...
mist

jp: .我笠ぞ雁は逃るな初霞
ro: waga kasa zo kari wa nigeru na hatsu-gasumi
en:
it's my umbrella-hat
don't run, geese!
first mist

jp: .陽炎ににくまれ蔓の見事也
ro: kagerô ni nikumare tsuru no migoto kana
en:
in heat shimmers
the vines people loathe...
beautiful

jp: .陽炎やきのふは見へぬだんご茶屋
ro: kagerô ya kinou wa mienu dango chaya
en:
heat shimmers--
yesterday it wasn't there
tea-and-dumpling shop

jp: .雪どけや門の雀の十五日
ro: yuki-doke ya kado no suzume no jûgo nichi
en:
snow melting--
for sparrows at the gate
good as a harvest moon!

jp: .雪解や門は雀の御一日
ro: yuki-doke ya kado wa suzume no o-ichi nichi
en:
snow melting--
at the gate the sparrows'
New Year's bash!

jp: .出代の己が一番烏かな
ro: degawari no ono ga ichiban karasu kana
en:
"I'm the first
of the migrating servants!"
a crow

jp: .夕暮の笠も小褄もこき茶哉
ro: yûgure no kasa mo kozuma mo koki cha kana
en:
umbrella-hat and skirt
in the evening...
threshing tea leaves

jp: .畠打の顔から暮るつくば山
ro: hata uchi no kao kara kururu tsukuba yama
en:
a plowman facing
sunset...
Mount Tsukuba

jp: .有明や家なし猫も恋を鳴
ro: ariake ya ie nashi neko mo koi wo naku
en:
at dawn
the homeless cat, too
cries for love

jp: .恋猫の源氏めかする垣根哉
ro: koi neko no genji mekasuru kakine kana
en:
the lover cat
dandied up like Genji
at the fence

jp: .穴一の穴に馴けり雀の子
ro: ana ichi no ana ni nare keri suzume no ko
en:
settling into
the penny toss hole...
baby sparrow

jp: .五六間烏追けり親雀
ro: gorokken karasu oi keri oya suzume
en:
chasing the crow
ten or twelve yards...
mother sparrow

jp: .雀子や人のこぶしに鳴初る
ro: suzumego ya hito no kobushi ni naki someru
en:
baby sparrow
inside a person's fist
its first cry

jp: .巣放れの顔を見せたる雀哉
ro: su hana[re] no kao wo misetaru suzume kana
en:
fledgling faces
peek out the nest...
sparrows

jp: .鶯のだまって聞や茶つみ唄
ro: uguisu no damatte kiku ya cha tsumi uta
en:
the nightingale
hushes to listen...
tea-picking song

jp: .むら雨を尾であしらひし雉哉
ro: murasame wo o de ashiraishi kigisu kana
en:
accompanying the rain
with its tail...
a pheasant

jp: .雁立った跡を見に行小松哉
ro: kari tatta ato wo mi ni yuku ko matsu kana
en:
seeing off
the departing geese...
little pines

jp: .大切の廿五日やかへる雁
ro: taisetsu no nijûgo nichi ya kaeru kari
en:
an auspicious
twenty fifth day...
the geese depart

jp: .行雁や我湖をすぐ通り
ro: yuku kari ya waga mizuumi wo sugu tôri
en:
traveling geese
my lake is crossed
in no time

jp: .蝶とぶや此世に望みないやうに
ro: chô tobu ya kono yo ni nozomi nai yô ni
en:
a butterfly flits
as if wanting nothing
in this world

jp: .蝶とんでかはゆき竹の出たりけり
ro: chô tonde kawayuki take no detari keri
en:
butterflies flitting--
pretty little bamboo shoots
shooting up

jp: .なの花の咲連もない庵哉
ro: na no hana no saki-tsure mo nai iori kana
en:
nothing else blooming
but rape...
my hut

jp: .藤棚や後ろ明りの草の花
ro: fuji-dana ya ushiro akari no kusa no hana
en:
wisteria trellis--
behind it, in the light
wildflowers

jp: .梅が香やそもそも春は夜の事
ro: ume ga ka ya somo-somo haru wa yoru no koto
en:
plum blossom scent--
I tell you spring
is a night thing

jp: .のら猫のうかるる梅が咲にけり
ro: nora neko no ukaruru ume ga saki ni keri
en:
the plum tree
where the stray cat carouses
in bloom

jp: .古郷や卯月咲ても梅の花
ro: furusato ya uzuki saite mo ume no hana
en:
my home village--
even in summer
plum trees bloom

jp: .梅がかや神酒を備へる御制札
ro: ume ga ka ya omiki wo sonaeru o-seisatsu
en:
plum blossom scent--
the edict board furnished
with sacred sake

jp: .ただ頼め花ははらはらあの通り
ro: tada tanome hana wa hara-hara ano tôri
en:
simply trust!
cherry blossoms flitting
down

jp: .ちる花や仏ぎらひが浮れけり
ro: chiru hana ya hotoke-girai ga uka[re] keri
en:
cherry blossoms scatter--
bad Buddhists
carousing

jp: .花さくや田舎鶯いなか飴
ro: hana saku ya inaka uguisu inaka ame
en:
cherry blossoms!
country nightingales
country candy

jp: .一本は桜もちけり娑婆の役
ro: ippon wa sakura mochi keri shaba [no] yaku
en:
one cherry tree
has kept blooming...
the corrupt world

jp: .隠家や遅山桜おそ鰹
ro: kakurega ya oso yamazakura oso katsuo
en:
secluded house--
the cherry blossoms late
the bonito...late

jp: .風所の一本桜咲にけり
ro: kazadoko no ippon sakura saki ni keri
en:
a windy place!
but one cherry tree
in bloom

jp: .五十年見れども見れど桜哉
ro: go jû nen miredo mo miredo sakura kana
en:
fifty years
of gazing, gazing...
cherry blossoms

jp: .住吉の隅の小すみの桜哉
ro: sumiyoshi no sumi no kosumi no sakura kana
en:
in a Sumiyoshi nook
blooming
cherry blossoms

jp: .ただ頼桜ぼたぼたあの通り
ro: tada tanome sakura bota-bota ano tôri
en:
simply trust!
cherry blossoms fall
pit-a-pat

jp: .つくづくと蛙が目にも桜哉
ro: tsukuzuku to kawazu ga me ni mo sakura kana
en:
even the frog's eyes
can't turn away...
cherry blossoms!

jp: .にくい程桜咲たる小家哉
ro: nikui hodo sakura sakitaru ko ie kana
en:
green with envy--
blooming cherry trees
little house

jp: .古桜倒るる迄と咲にけり
ro: furu-zakura taoruru made to saki ni keri
en:
the old cherry tree
blooming
till it drops

jp: .山桜さくや八十八所
ro: yama-zakura saku ya hachi jû hachi-dokoro
en:
mountain cherry blossoms--
in all 88
sacred sites

jp: .苦桃の花のほちゃほちゃ咲にけり
ro: niga momo no hana no hocha-hocha saki ni keri
en:
my mean peach tree
nice and chubby
with blossoms

jp: .桃さくや先祈るる麦の露
ro: momo saku ya mazu inoruru mugi no tsuyu
en:
peach tree in bloom--
but first a prayer
for the dewy barley

jp: .青柳や十づつ十の穴一に
ro: ao yagi ya jû-zutsu jû no ana ichi ni
en:
green willows--
at ten out of ten
gamblers tossing pennies

jp: .観音の心をそよぐ柳哉
ro: kannon no kokoro wo soyogu yanagi kana
en:
rustling
in Goddess Kannon's heart...
the willow

jp: .さし柳涼む夕は誰か有
ro: sashi yanagi suzushimu yû wa dare ka ari
en:
planting a willow--
someday, in summer
who'll enjoy its cool air?

jp: .又六が門の外なる柳哉
ro: mata roku ga kado no soto naru yanagi kana
en:
again there is splendor
beyond the gate...
willow tree

jp: .今来るは木曽夕立か浅間山
ro: ima kuru wa kisô yudachi ka asama yama
en:
coming now
is it a Kiso cloudburst?
Mount Asama

jp: .夕立にすくりと森の灯哉
ro: yûdachi ni sukuri to  mori no tomoshi kana
en:
under the cloudburst
standing tall...
lamps in the grove

jp: .夕立になでしこ持たぬ門もなし
ro: yûdachi ni nadeshiko motanu kado mo nashi
en:
in the cloudburst
there's not a gate
without a pink

jp: .夕立の枕元よりすすき哉
ro: yûdachi no makura moto yori susuki kana
en:
extending from my pillow
in the downpour...
pampas grass

jp: .夕々夕立雲の目利哉
ro: yûbe yûbe yûdachi kumo no mekiki kana
en:
every evening
"Rain is coming!"
cloud watchers

jp: .宵祭大夕立の過にけり
ro: yoi matsuri ôyûdachi no sugi ni keri
en:
night festival--
a big cloudburst
strolls through

jp: .ｼ風に菩薩の清水流れけり
ro: matsu kaze ni bosatsu no shimizu nagare keri
en:
in the pine breeze
the saint's pure water
flows

jp: .夏籠のけしきに植し小松哉
ro: ge-gomori no keshiki ni ueshi ko matsu kana
en:
raising it for
my summer seclusion's view...
little pine

jp: .蟷螂が不二の麓にかかる哉
ro: tôrô ga fuji no fumoto ni kakaru kana
en:
a praying mantis
at the base of Mount Fuji
clings

jp: .不二の草さして涼しくなかりけり
ro: fuji no kusa sashite suzushiku nakari keri
en:
it's Mount Fuji's grass
but no trace
of cool air

jp: .またぐ程の不二へも行かぬことし哉
ro: matagu hodo no fuji e mo ikanu kotoshi kana
en:
no Mount Fuji
I can almost straddle
this year

jp: .菖蒲ふけ浅間の煙しづか也
ro: ayame fuke asama no keburi shizuka nari
en:
let's thatch with irises--
Mount Asama's smoke
looks calm

jp: .乙鳥もしょうぶ葺く日に逢りけり
ro: tsubakura mo shôbu fuku hi ni aeri keri
en:
swallows too
the day eaves are thatched with irises
show up

jp: .我門を山から見たる幟哉
ro: waga kado wo yama kara mitaru nobori kana
en:
from the mountain
I see my own gate...
summer banner

jp: .はらはらと汗の玉ちる稲葉哉
ro: hara-hara to ase no tama chiru ine ha kana
en:
pit-a-pat pearls
of sweat drip down...
rice plants

jp: .鶯の飯時ならん更衣
ro: uguisu no meshi [toki] naran koromogae
en:
it's the nightingale's
dinnertime...
I change to a summer robe

jp: .更衣朝から松につかはるる
ro: koromogae asa kara matsu ni tsukawaruru
en:
new summer robe--
from morning on used
by the pine

jp: .春日野の鹿にかがるる袷かな
ro: kasugano no shika ni kagaruru awase kana
en:
Kasuga Field's deer
sniff it...
my summer kimono

jp: .一日の渋帷子をきたりけり
ro: tsuitachi no shibu katabira wo ki[ta]ri keri
en:
first day of summer
my summer kimono...
rustic

jp: .帷子の白きを見れば角田川
ro: katabira no shiroki wo mireba sumida-gawa
en:
watching the whiteness
of summer kimonos...
Sumida River

jp: .木男が薄帷子をきたりけり
ro: ki otoko ga usu katabira wo kitari keri
en:
a boor with the ladies
but he puts one on...
thin summer kimono

jp: .翌も翌も同じ夕か独蚊屋
ro: asu mo asu mo onaji yûbe ka hitori kaya
en:
tomorrow night and the next
the same?
in my mosquito net, alone

jp: .蚊屋の穴かぞへ留りや三ケの月
ro: kaya no ana kazoe tomari ya mike no tsuki
en:
stopping to count
my mosquito net's holes...
sickle moon

jp: .昼比や蚊屋の中なる草の花
ro: hiru-goro ya kaya no naka naru kusa no hana
en:
high noon--
inside the mosquito net
wildflowers blooming

jp: .宵々や団扇とるさへむつかしき
ro: yoi-yoi ya uchiwa toru sae mutsukashiki
en:
stroke victim--
even holding a paper fan
an ordeal

jp: .蚊いぶしにやがて蛍も去りにけり
ro: ka ibushi ni yagate hotaru mo sari ni keri
en:
smoking out mosquitoes--
soon the fireflies
are gone too

jp: .夕月の正面におく蚊やり哉
ro: yûzuki no shômen ni oku ka yari kana
en:
veiling the face
of the evening moon...
smudge pot smoke

jp: .おれが田を誰やらそしる夕涼み
ro: ore ga ta wo dare yara soshiru yûsuzumi
en:
they're all slandering
my rice field!
evening cool

jp: .目をぬひて鳥を鳴かせて門涼
ro: me wo nuite tori wo nakasete kado suzumi
en:
stitching her eyes shut
makes the bird cry...
cool air at the gate

jp: .鹿の子の枕にしたるつつじ哉
ro: shika no ko no makura ni shitaru tsutsuji kana
en:
a pillow
for the fawn...
azalea bush

jp: .萩の葉と一所に伸びるかのこ哉
ro: hagi no ha to issho ni nobiru kanoko kana
en:
growing up
with the bush clover...
a fawn

jp: .木母寺は夜さへ見ゆる時鳥
ro: mokuboji wa yoru sae miyuru hototogisu
en:
Mokubo Temple
even at night can be seen...
cuckoo

jp: .時鳥声をかけたか御伐木
ro: hototogisu koe wo kaketa ka gobatsuboku
en:
hey cuckoo
did you call out?
logs for the temple

jp: .時鳥田のない国の見事也
ro: hototogisu ta no nai kuni no mi-goto nari
en:
cuckoo--
in a province without rice fields
splendid

jp: .時鳥鳴く空持し在所哉
ro: hototogisu naku sora mochishi zaisho kana
en:
it has a sky
for singing cuckoos...
farmhouse

jp: .雨三粒蛍も三ッ四ッかな
ro: ame mi tsubu hotaru mo mitsu yotsu kana
en:
three raindrops
and three or four
fireflies

jp: .そよそよと世直し風やとぶ蛍
ro: soyo-soyo to yonaoshi kaze ya tobu hotaru
en:
a softly blowing
world-improving breeze...
fireflies flit

jp: .はづかしき鍋に折々蛍哉
ro: hazukashiki nabe ni ori-ori hotaru kana
en:
into my pitiful kettle
now and then...
fireflies

jp: .蛍来よ一本竹も我夜也
ro: hotaru ko yo ippon take mo waga yo nari
en:
"Come, fireflies!"
a single stalk of bamboo
makes my night

jp: .蛍火や蛙もこうと口を明く
ro: hotarubi ya kawazu mo kô to kuchi wo aku
en:
sparkling fireflies--
even the frog's mouth
gapes

jp: .夕暮や蛍にしめる薄畳
ro: yûgure ya hotaru ni shimeru usu-datami
en:
evening falls--
fireflies dampen
the thin tatami mat

jp: .あばれ蚊の生所の御花哉
ro: aba[re] ka no umare-dokoro no o-hana kana
en:
the pesky mosquito's
birthplace...
temple flower

jp: .母恋し恋しと蝉も聞ゆらん
ro: haha koishi koishi to semi mo kikoyaran
en:
do you also miss
your mother?
cicada

jp: .世直しの竹よ小藪よ蝉時雨
ro: yo naoshi no take yo ko yabu yo semi shigure
en:
the world-healing
bamboo! little thicket!
cicada chorus

jp: .ともかくもあなた任せかかたつぶり
ro: tomokaku mo anata makase ka katatsuburi
en:
come what may
won't you trust in the Buddha
snail?

jp: .御仏の雨が降ぞよかたつぶり
ro: mi-botoke no ame ga furu zo yo katatsuburi
en:
it's Buddha's rain
that's falling!
snail

jp: .咲ぼたん一日雀鳴にけり
ro: saku botan ichi nichi suzume naki ni keri
en:
the peony has bloomed!
the whole day
sparrows chirping

jp: .猫の鈴ぼたんのあっちこっち哉
ro: neko no rin botan no atchi kotchi kana
en:
the cat's bell tinkling
in the peonies
here and there

jp: .我庵やあくたれ烏痩ぼたん
ro: waga io ya akutare karasu yase botan
en:
at my hut--
rascally crows
emaciated peonies

jp: .筍を見つめてござる仏哉
ro: takenoko wo mitsumete gozaru hotoke kana
en:
staring at the shoots
of new bamboo...
Buddha

jp: .瓜になれなれなれとや蜂さわぐ
ro: uri ni nare nare nare to ya hachi sawagu
en:
"Grow, grow, grow
melons!"
buzz the bees

jp: .うの花にどっさりかかる柳哉
ro: u no hana ni dossari kakaru yanagi kana
en:
thick drapes over
the deutzia blossoms...
willow

jp: .うの花や蛙葬る明り先
ro: u no hana ya kawazu hômuru akarisaki
en:
deutzia blossoms--
by lantern light
I bury the frog

jp: .うの花や二人が二人仏好
ro: u no hana ya futari ga futari hotoke-zuki
en:
blooming deutzia--
both of us
Buddha's devotees

jp: .梅おちて又落にけり露の玉
ro: ume ochite mata ochi ni keri tsuyu no tama
en:
a plum drops
and then another...
beads of dew

jp: .沙汰なしに実をむすびたる野梅哉
ro: sata nashi ni mi wo musubitaru no ume kana
en:
without fanfare
they've borne plums!
trees in the field

jp: .山の院梅は熟して立りけり
ro: yama no in ume wa jukushite tateri keri
en:
mountain mansion--
the plum trees
stand ripening

jp: .有明や空うつくしき蚊の行方
ro: ariake ya sora utsukushiki ka no yukue
en:
moon in the autumn dawn--
to the pretty sky flies
a mosquito

jp: .名月のさしかかりけり貰ひ餅
ro: meigetsu no sashikakari keri mora[i] mochi
en:
the harvest moon
hangs over it...
rice cake gift

jp: .名月やそもそも寒きしなの山
ro: meigetsu ya somo-somo samuki shinano yama
en:
harvest moon--
I tell you it's cold
on Shinano Mountain!

jp: .名月やどこに居っても人の邪魔
ro: meigetsu ya doko ni otte mo hito no jama
en:
harvest moon--
wherever you are
someone's annoyed

jp: .秋雨や乳放馬の市に行
