ro: aki ame ya chibanare [uma] no ichi ni yuku
en:
autumn rain--
the weaned pony
goes to market

jp: .かたつぶり何をかせぐぞ秋の雨
ro: katatsuburi nani wo kasegu zo aki no ame
en:
oh snail
how do you make your living?
autumn rain

jp: .薬呑む馬もありけり秋の雨
ro: kusuri nomu uma mo ari keri aki no ame
en:
the horse drinks
medicine too...
autumn rain

jp: .さらしなもそろそろ秋の雨よ哉
ro: sarashina mo soro-soro aki no ame yo kana
en:
even in Sarashina
one by one...
rainy autumn nights

jp: .山寺や霧にまぶれし鉋屑
ro: yamadera ya kiri ni mabureshi kannakuzu
en:
mountain temple--
mist covers up
the wood shavings

jp: .なまなかに消きりもせぬ灯ろ哉
ro: namanaka ni kiekiri mo senu tôro kana
en:
about halfway
burned out...
lanterns for the dead

jp: .きりぎりす星待人に取られけり
ro: kirigirisu hoshi matsu hito ni torare keri
en:
katydid--
caught by someone
waiting for the stars

jp: .星待や茶殻をほかす千曲川
ro: hoshi matsu ya chagara wo hokasu chikuma-gawa
en:
awaiting the stars
throwing out tea grounds...
Chikuma River

jp: .荒駒の木曽を離るる尾をふりぬ
ro: arakoma no kiso wo hanaruru o wo furinu
en:
the wild pony
is led away from Kiso...
his tail waving goodbye

jp: .こおろぎの声も添へけりおとし水
ro: kôrogi no koe mo soe keri otoshi mizu
en:
the cricket's song
is accompaniment...
the rice field drains

jp: .夕けぶり鳩吹人にかかりけり
ro: yû keburi hato fuku hito ni kakari keri
en:
evening smoke--
on the man playing pigeon flute
it hangs

jp: .松竹は昔々のきぬた哉
ro: matsu take wa mukashi mukashi no kinuta kana
en:
for pine and bamboo
it's like olden days...
cloth-pounding

jp: .唐の吉野もかくや小夜ぎぬた
ro: morokoshi no yoshino mo kaku ya sayo-ginuta
en:
like in Old China
Yoshino, too, clonks...
cloth-pounding

jp: .ことし酒先は葎のつつがなき
ro: kotoshi sake mazu wa mugura no tsutsuganaki
en:
this year's sake--
first toast:
to the weeds!

jp: .深草の鶉鳴けりばばが糊
ro: fuku kusa no uzura naki keri baba ga nori
en:
in deep grass
a quail sings...
grandma starches clothes

jp: .渡り鳥いく組我を追ぬくか
ro: watari-dori iku-gumi ware wo oinuku ka
en:
migrating birds--
how many of your flocks
have overtaken me?

jp: .渡り鳥日本の我を見しらぬか
ro: watari-dori nihon no ware wo mishiranu ka
en:
migrating birds
haven't you seen me before
in Japan?

jp: .蓑虫や梅に下るはかれが役
ro: minomushi ya ume ni sagaru wa kare ga yaku
en:
bagworm--
hanging in the plum tree
his job

jp: .蓑虫や花に下る己が役
ro: minomushi ya hana ni sagaru wa ono ga yaku
en:
bagworm--
hanging from flowers
his job

jp: .日ぐらしや急に明るき湖の方
ro: higurashi ya kyû ni aka[ru]ki umi no kata
en:
a cicada chirrs--
suddenly light breaks
toward the lake

jp: .代官の扇の上のいなご哉
ro: daikan no ôgi no ue no inago kana
en:
atop the magistrate's
folding fan...
a locust

jp: .とぶいなご柳もとしのよりにけり
ro: tobu inago yanagi mo toshi no yori ni keri
en:
flying locusts--
the willow tree too
grows old

jp: .八朔の鱠に逢しいなご哉
ro: hatsusaku no namasu ni aishi inago kana
en:
on the raw slices
of first day, Eighth Month...
locusts

jp: .鼻唄にどっといなごのきげん哉
ro: hana-uta ni dotto inago no kigen kana
en:
all together
the locusts in a humming
mood

jp: .草萩の咲ふさげけり這入口
ro: kusa hagi no saki fusage keri hairiguchi
en:
grasses and bush clover
clog it with blooms...
doorway

jp: .萩の末ききやうの下になく蚊哉
ro: hagi no sue kikyô no shita ni naku ka kana
en:
over the bush clover
under the bell-flowers
mosquitoes whisper

jp: .なむだ仏なむあみだ仏まんじゅさ花
ro: namuda butsu namu amida butsu manjusake
en:
"Praise Buddha!
All praise to Amida Buddha!"
manjusa flower

jp: .我植た稲を見知ってしたりけり
ro: waga ueta ine wo mishitte shitari keri
en:
the rice I planted--
I know it
by sight

jp: .我門は稲四五本の夕哉
ro: waga kado wa ine shi go hon no yûbe kana
en:
four or five rice stalks
at my gate...
evening falls

jp: .鶯がさくさく歩く紅葉哉
ro: uguisu ga saku-saku aruku momiji kana
en:
the nightingale struts
crunch crunch...
red leaves

jp: .懐の猫も見て居る一葉哉
ro: futokoro no neko mo mite iru hito ha kana
en:
even the suckling
kitten watches...
falling leaf

jp: .赤木槿咲くや一人涼む程
ro: aka mukuge saku ya ichi nin suzumu hodo
en:
red roses of Sharon
enough to cool
a man

jp: .芝栗のえむといふ日もなかりけり
ro: shibaguri no emu to iu hi mo nakari keri
en:
little chestnuts
it's not yet your day
to burst

jp: .あさぢふや門の口からきのこがり
ro: a[sa]jiu [ya] kado no kuchi kara kinoko-gari
en:
a reedy place--
from the gate onward
gathering mushrooms

jp: .虻よぶや必茸ある通り
ro: abu yobu ya kanarazu kinoko aru tôri
en:
the horsefly calls
"Surely the mushrooms
are this way!"

jp: .此方に茸ありとや虻のとぶ
ro: kono kata ni kinoko ari to ya abu no tobu
en:
"This way
to the mushrooms!"
the horsefly flies

jp: .ぞくぞくと鼠の穴もきのこ哉
ro: zoku-zoku to nezumi no ana mo kinoko kana
en:
one by one--
even the mouse's hole
has mushrooms

jp: .身に添や前の主の寒さ迄
ro: mi ni sou ya mae no aruji no samusa made
en:
it suits me--
even the former owner's
winter cold

jp: .はつ雪や何を願ひのきりぎりす
ro: hatsu yuki ya nani wo negai no kirigirisu
en:
first snowfall--
what are you praying for
katydid?

jp: .此次は我身の上かなく烏
ro: kono tsugi wa waga mi no ue ka naku karasu
en:
will I be the next one
you caw over?
crows

jp: .家なしも江戸の元日したりけり
ro: ie nashi mo edo no ganjitsu shitari keri
en:
homeless, too
seeing in the new year
in Edo

jp: .牛馬も元日顔の山家哉
ro: ushi uma mo ganjitsu kao no yamaga kana
en:
even cows and horses
with New Year's faces...
mountain home

jp: .古郷や馬も元日いたす顔
ro: furusato ya uma mo ganjitsu itasu kao
en:
my home village--
even the horse
with a New Year's face

jp: .老が身の値ぶみをさるるけさの春
ro: oi ga mi no nebumi wo saruru kesa no haru
en:
taking stock
of this old body...
spring's first dawn

jp: .大江戸や芸なし猿も花の春
ro: ôedo [ya] geinashi-zaru mo hana no haru
en:
great Edo--
even for a monkey without tricks
spring blossoms

jp: .下京や闇いうちから花の春
ro: shimogyô ya kurai uchi kara hana no haru
en:
Shimogyo Town--
in the dark before dawn
spring blossoms

jp: .身一つも同じ世話也花の春
ro: mi hitotsu mo onaji sewa nari hana no haru
en:
for my life too
help arrives...
spring blossoms

jp: .我庵や菜の二葉より花の春
ro: waga io ya na no futaba yori hana no haru
en:
my hut--
just two green leaves
my blossoming spring

jp: .門々の下駄の泥より春立ぬ
ro: kado-gado no geta no doro yori haru tachinu
en:
muddy clogs
at the gates reveal...
it's spring!

jp: .春立と申すもいかが上野山
ro: haru tatsu to mô[su] mo ikaga ueno yama
en:
how do the words
"Spring's begun" strike you?
Ueno Hill

jp: .あばら家も年徳神の御宿哉
ro: abaraya mo toshi tokujin no o-yado kana
en:
even my ramshackle
hut, home
to the New Year's god

jp: .大原や後れ薮入おくれ梅
ro: ôhara ya okure yabuiri okure ume
en:
big field--
the late homecoming servant
late plum blossoms

jp: .薮入や墓の松風うしろ吹
ro: yabuiri ya haka no matsukaze ushiro fuku
en:
homecoming servant--
behind the graveyard's pines
the wind

jp: .朔日や一文凧も江戸の空
ro: tuitachi ya ichi mon-dako mo edo no sora
en:
New Year's Day--
a one-penny kite, too
in Edo's sky

jp: .舞扇猿の涙のかかる哉
ro: mai ôgi saru no namida no kakaru kana
en:
the monkey with
a dancer's fan...
a tear rolls down

jp: .朝陰や親ある人のわかなつみ
ro: asa kage ya oya aru hito no wakana tsumi
en:
morning shadows--
someone who has parents
picking herbs

jp: .ひょりひょりと磯田の鶴も日永哉
ro: hyoro-hyoro to iso ta no tsuru mo hi naga kana
en:
tottering in the seaside
rice field...for the crane too
the day is long!

jp: .長の春今尽る也角田川
ro: naga no haru ima tsukiru nari sumida-gawa
en:
the long spring
finally at an end...
Sumida River

jp: .若雀翌なき春をさわぐ也
ro: waka suzume asu naki haru wo sawagu nari
en:
the young sparrows
clamor at spring's
last day

jp: .行灯で畠を通る春の雨
ro: andon de hatake wo tôru haru no ame
en:
crossing the field
with a paper lantern...
spring rain

jp: .春雨や魚追逃す浦の犬
ro: harusame ya uo oi-nogasu ura no inu
en:
in spring rain
chasing the elusive fish...
dog on the shore

jp: .春雨や盃見せて狐よぶ
ro: harusame ya sakazuki misete kitsune yobu
en:
spring rain--
showing a sake cup
calling foxes

jp: .春雨や少古びし刀禰の鶴
ro: harusame ya sukoshi furubishi tone no tsuru
en:
in spring rain
a bit bedraggled...
Tone River crane

jp: .鳩の恋烏の恋や春の雨
ro: hato no koi karasu no koi ya haru no ame
en:
pigeons mating
crows mating...
the spring rain falls

jp: .春ひと風の夜にして見たる我家哉
ro: harukaze no yo ni shite mitaru waga ya kana
en:
seeing it
on a spring breeze night...
my house

jp: .春風や残らず晴しらかん達
ro: harukaze ya nokorazu hareshi rakan-tachi
en:
spring breeze--
completely gone now
the holy men

jp: .春風やはや陰作るかきつばた
ro: haru kaze ya haya kage tsukuru kakitsubata
en:
in the spring breeze
already casting shadows...
irises

jp: .親にらむ平目もかすむ一つ哉
ro: oya niramu hirame mo kasumu hitotsu kana
en:
father's steady glare
another thing
in the mist

jp: .かすむぞよ松が三本夫婦鶴
ro: kasumu zo yo matsu ga sanbon meoto-zuru
en:
in spring mist
three pines, two cranes
husband and wife

jp: .此門の霞むたそくや隅田の鶴
ro: kono kado no kasumu tasoku ya sumida no tsuru
en:
at the gate
so many in the mist!
Sumida River cranes

jp: .柴の戸やかすむたそくの隅田鶴
ro: shiba no to ya kasumu tasoku no sumida-zuru
en:
at my humble hut
so many in the mist!
Sumida River cranes

jp: .とくかすめとくとくかすめ放ち鳥
ro: toku kasume toku toku kasume hanachi-dori
en:
hurry into mist
hurry, hurry!
a bird set free

jp: .夕暮れや霞中より無常鐘
ro: yûgure ya kasumu naka yori mujô-gane
en:
from evening mist
the bell
of life passing

jp: .片隅に烏かたまる雪げかな
ro: kata sumi ni karasu katamaru yukige kana
en:
in one spot
the crows congregate...
snow is melting!

jp: .雁起よ雪がとけるぞとけるぞよ
ro: kari oki yo yuki ga tokeru zo tokeru zo yo
en:
the geese awake
"snow is melting!
melting!"

jp: .長々の雪のとけけり大月夜
ro: naga-naga no yuki no toke keri ôtsuki yo
en:
a winter's worth of snow
melting...
a humongous moon

jp: .雪とけてくりくりしたる月よ哉
ro: yuki tokete kuri-kuri shitaru tsuki yo kana
en:
snow melting--
tonight a fat round
moon

jp: .雪どけや順礼衆も朝の声
ro: yuki-doke ya junrei shû mo asa no koe
en:
melting snow--
the morning voices
of pilgrims

jp: .雪どけや巣鴨辺りのうす月夜
ro: yuki-doke ya su kamo hotori [no] usu tsuki yo
en:
snow melting--
where ducks are nesting
soft moonlight

jp: .雪とけるとけると鳩の鳴木かな
ro: yuki tokeru tokeru to hato no naku ki kana
en:
"Snow's melting! Melting!"
pigeons celebrate
in the tree

jp: .おぼろげや同じ夕をよその雛
ro: oboroge ya onaji yûbe wo yoso no hina
en:
this same hazy night
somewhere else...
the Doll Festival

jp: .乞食子がおろおろ拝む雛哉
ro: kojiki ko ga oro-oro ogamu hiina kana
en:
the beggar child prays
with trembling voice...
for a doll

jp: .むさい家との給ふやうな雛哉
ro: musai ya to no tamau yôna hiina kana
en:
looking like she's enduring
my crappy house...
the doll

jp: .草餅を先吹にけり筑波東風
ro: kusamochi wo masu fuki ni keri tsukuba kochi
en:
first one to blow
on the hot herb cakes...
Mount Tsukuba's east wind

jp: .蓬餅そのの鶯是ほしき
ro: yomogi mochi sono no uguisu kore hoshiki
en:
herb cakes--
the garden's nightingale
wants this one

jp: .鶯の嘴の先より汐干哉
ro: uguisu no hashi no saki yori shioi kana
en:
from the tip
of the nightingale's beak
the tide rushes out

jp: .雀鳴庭の小隅も汐干哉
ro: suzume naku niwa no kosumi mo shiohi kana
en:
sparrows chirp
in a garden nook, here too...
low tide

jp: .折ふしは鹿も立添茶つみ哉
ro: orifushi wa shika mo tachisou cha tsumi kana
en:
now and then the deer
stand close by...
tea pickers

jp: .幾日やら庵の雀も皆巣立つ
ro: ikka yara io no suzume mo mina su ta[tsu]
en:
what day then?
all the hut's sparrows
leave the nest

jp: .鳴よ鳴よ親なし雀おとなしき
ro: nake yo nake yo oya [na]shi suzume otonashiki
en:
sing, sing!
orphan sparrow...
so quiet

jp: .人鬼に鳴かかりけり親雀
ro: hito oni ni naki-kakari keri oya suzume
en:
she cries and attacks
the human goblins...
mother sparrow

jp: .人鬼よおによと鳴か親雀
ro: hito oni yo oni yo to naku ka oya suzume
en:
"Beware the human goblins!"
is that what you're chirping?
mother sparrow

jp: .むつまじき二親もちし雀哉
ro: mutsumajiki futaoya mochishi suzume kana
en:
living in harmony--
the sparrow has
both parents!

jp: .夕暮や親なし雀何と鳴
ro: yûgure ya oya nashi suzume nanto naku
en:
evening--
how the orphan sparrow
cries!

jp: .浅草や家尻の不二も鳴雲雀
ro: asakusa ya yajiri no fuji mo naku hibari
en:
Asakusa--
behind the house Mount Fuji
and a singing lark

jp: .けふもけふも一つ雲雀や亦打山
ro: kyô mo kyô mo hitotsu hibari ya matchi yama
en:
today too, today too
a single skylark...
Mount Matchi

jp: .青山を拵へてなく雉哉
ro: ao yama wo koshiraete naku kigisu kana
en:
completing
the green mountain
a pheasant cries

jp: .蟻程に人は暮れしぞ雉の鳴
ro: ari hodo ni hito wa kureshi zo kiji no naku
en:
like marching ants
people at dusk...
a pheasant cries

jp: .酒桶や雉の声の行とどく
ro: sake oke ya kigisu no koe [no] yuki-dokoro
en:
the sake bucket--
where the pheasant
goes to sing

jp: .鳴く雉や尻尾でなぶる角田川
ro: naku kiji ya shippo de naburu sumida-gawa
en:
the crying pheasant
teases it with his tail...
Sumida River

jp: .我庵のけぶり細さを雉の鳴
ro: waga io no keburi hososa wo kiji no naku
en:
my hut's thin
thread of smoke...
a pheasant's cry

jp: .我夕や里の犬なく雉のなく
ro: waga yû ya sato no inu naku kiji no naku
en:
my evening--
a village dog barks
a pheasant cries

jp: .有明や念仏好の雁も行
ro: ariake ya nembutsu suki no kari mo yuku
en:
dawn--
a Buddha-praising goose
flies too

jp: .いざさらばさらばと雁のきげん哉
ro: iza saraba saraba to kari no kigen kana
en:
in a mood for farewell
farewell!
the wild geese

jp: .帰る雁我をかひなき物とやは
ro: kae[ru] kari ware wo kainaki mono to ya wa
en:
to the returning geese
I'm just a useless
so-and-so

jp: .雁行な今錠明る藪の家
ro: kari yuku na ima jô akeru yabu no ie
en:
don't go, geese!
now I'm unlocking
the house in the trees

jp: .念仏をさづけてやらん帰る雁
ro: nembutsu wo sazukete yaran kae[ru] kari
en:
teaching how to
praise Buddha...
the geese depart

jp: .花びらに舌打したる蛙哉
ro: hanabira ni shitauchi shitaru kawazu kana
en:
on a flower petal
clucking his tongue...
a frog

jp: .藪並や仕様事なしに鳴蛙
ro: yabu nami ya shiyô koto nashi ni naku kawazu
en:
stand of trees--
the inevitable croaking
frog

jp: .夕陰や連にはぐれてなく蛙
ro: yûkage ya tsure ni hagurete naku kawazu
en:
evening shadows--
separated from his friends
a frog croaks

jp: .入相を合点したやら蝶のとぶ
ro: iriai wo gaten shita yara chô no tobu
en:
aware of the sun
setting, the butterfly
flits away

jp: .木曽山や蝶とぶ空も少の間
ro: kiso yama [ya] chô tobu sora mo sukoshi [no] ma
en:
Kiso Mountains--
butterflies fill your sky
so briefly!

jp: .蝶とんで我身も塵のたぐひ哉
ro: chô tonde waga mi mo chiri no tagui kana
en:
butterfly flitting--
I too am made
of dust

jp: .ついついと常正月ややもめ蝶
ro: tsui-tsui to tsune shôgatsu ya yamome chô
en:
she had a husband
when the year was new...
widow butterfly

jp: .とぶ蝶の邪魔にもならぬけぶり哉
ro: tobu chô [no] jama ni mo naranu keburi kana
en:
the flitting butterfly
not bothered at all...
smoke

jp: .はづかしや蝶はひらひら常ひがん
ro: hazukashi ya chô wa hira-hira tsune higan
en:
what a shame--
the butterfly flits off
to the Other Shore

jp: .はづかしや三十日が来ても草のてふ
ro: hazukashi ya misoka ga kite mo kusa no chô
en:
shame, shame!
on the month's last day
a meadow butterfly

jp: .蓑虫はそれで終かとぶ小蝶
ro: minomushi wa sore de owari ka tobu ko chô
en:
"Hey bagworm
are you ready?" asks
the flitting butterfly

jp: .はつ蝶やつかみ込れな馬糞かき
ro: hatsu chô [ya] tsukami komare na ma-guso kaki
en:
first butterfly
don't get caught up!
horse dung raking

jp: .山住や蜂にも馴て夕枕
ro: yama-zumi ya hachi ni mo narete yûmakura
en:
living on the mountain
I'm used to the bees...
evening pillow

jp: .入相や桜のさわぐ鮎さわぐ
ro: iriai ya sakura no sawagu ayu sawagu
en:
sunset--
a ruckus of cherry blossoms
a ruckus of trout

jp: .心して桜ちれちれ鮎小鮎
ro: kokoro shite sakura chire-chire ayu ko ayu
en:
"Be brave, cherry blossoms
and fall!"
the little trout

jp: .笹陰を空頼みなる小鮎哉
ro: sasa kage wo soradanomi naru ko ayu kana
en:
the bamboo grass shade
an empty hope...
little trout

jp: .花の散る拍子に急ぐ小鮎哉
ro: hana no chiru hyôshi ni isogu ko ayu kana
en:
darting to the rhythm
of blossoms falling...
little trout

jp: .わか鮎は西へ落花は東へ
ro: waka ayu wa nishi e ochi hana wa hingashi e
en:
little trout
swimming west while blossoms
flow east

jp: .蛤の芥を吐する月夜かな
ro: hamaguri no gomi wo hakasuru tsuki yo kana
en:
the clam vomits
mud...
a moonlit night

jp: .山の草芽出すと直に売られけり
ro: yama no kusa me dasu [to] sugu ni urare keri
en:
mountain grass--
soon as it sprouts
it's sold

jp: .草々もわかいうちぞよ村雀
ro: kusa-gusa mo wakai uchi zo yo mura suzume
en:
the grasses too
are in their youth...
flock of sparrows

jp: .蒲公英も天窓剃たるせっく哉
ro: tanpopo mo atama soritaru sekku kana
en:
the dandelions too
have shaved heads...
festival day

jp: .うす菫桜の春はなく成ぬ
ro: usu sumire sakura no haru wa nakinarinu
en:
straggly violets--
the cherry blossom spring
has passed

jp: .きりぎりすけふや生れん菫さく
ro: kirigirisu kyô ya umaren sumire saku
en:
the katydid
born just today...
blooming violets

jp: .住吉の隅に菫の都哉
ro: sumiyoshi no sumi ni sumire no miyako kana
en:
in a Sumiyoshi nook
violets have
their capital

jp: .にくまれし妹が菫は咲にけり
ro: nikumareshi imo ga sumire wa saki ni keri
en:
his detested wife's
violets...
all have bloomed

jp: .花菫椿の春はなくなるぞ
ro: hana sumire tsubaki no haru wa nakunaru zo
en:
violets blooming--
the camellia spring
has passed

jp: .水上は皆菫かよ角田川
ro: minakami wa mina sumire ka yo sumida-gawa
en:
do your headwaters horde
all the violets?
Sumida River

jp: .草餅とともどもそよぐ菫哉
ro: kusa mochi to tomo-domo soyogu sumire kana
en:
herb cake herbs
join in the rustling
violets

jp: .菜の花や袖を苦にする小傾城
ro: na no hana ya sode [wo] ku ni suru ko keisei
en:
flowering rape--
the little beauty
worries about her sleeves

jp: .深山木の芽出しもあへず喰れけり
ro: miyama-gi no me dashi mo aezu kuware keri
en:
deep mountain trees--
soon as buds appear
they're eaten

jp: .梅を見て梅を蒔けり人の親
ro: ume wo mite ume wo maki keri hito no oya
en:
plum blossom lovers
who planted plum trees...
parents

jp: .梅咲や里に広がる江戸虱
ro: ume saku ya sato ni hirogaru edo-jirami
en:
plum blossoms--
spreading into the countryside
lice of Edo

jp: .幼子や掴々したり梅の花
ro: osanago ya nigi nigi shitari ume no hana
en:
the child
clutches them tightly...
plum blossoms

jp: .人の世や田舎の梅もおがまるる
ro: hito no yo ya inaka no ume mo ogamaruru
en:
world of man--
even in the country bowing
to plum blossoms!

jp: .斯う活て居るも不思議ぞ花の陰
ro: kô ikite iru mo fushigi zo hana no kage
en:
to be alive like this
is a wonder...
blossom shade

jp: .さく花に長逗留の此世哉
ro: saku hana ni naga-tôryû no kono yo kana
en:
among cherry blossoms
a long stay
in this world

jp: .さく花にぶっきり棒の翁哉
ro: saku hana ni bukkiribô no okina kana
en:
amid cherry blossoms
he's plain as dirt...
old man

jp: .さく花や此世住居も今少し
ro: saku hana ya kono yo-zumai mo ima suko[shi]
en:
cherry blossoms--
residents of this world
a short time

jp: .さざ波や花に交る古木履
ro: sazanami ya hana ni majiwaru furu bokuru
en:
ripples on water--
mingling with cherry blossoms
an old clog

jp: .ちる花や已におのれも下り坂
ro: chiru hana ya sude ni onore mo kudarizaka
en:
cherry blossoms scatter--
my life too is heading
downhill

jp: .花ちるや已が年も下り坂
ro: hana chiru ya sude ga toshi mo kudarizaka
en:
blossoms scatter--
my years too
on a downhill slide

jp: .手の奴足の乗もの花の山
ro: te no yakko ashi no norimono hana no yama
en:
all by itself
without any help...
blossoming mountain

jp: .花咲や欲のうきよの片すみに
ro: hana saku ya yoku no ukiyo no kata sumi ni
en:
cherry blossoms
in a nook in this floating
world of craving

jp: .花ちるや称名うなる寺の犬
ro: hana chiru ya shômyô unaru tera no inu
en:
in falling blossoms
growling to Amida Buddha...
temple dog

jp: .花の雨扇かざさぬ人もなし
ro: hana no ame ôgi kazasanu hito mo nashi
en:
rain of cherry blossoms--
not a face
without a fan

jp: .花の陰我は狐に化されし
ro: hana no kage waga wa kitsune ni bakasareshi
en:
cherry blossom shade--
a fox spirit
has enchanted me!

jp: .花びらがさわっても出る涙哉
ro: hanabira ga sawatte mo deru namida kana
en:
just touching
the cherry blossom petals
brings tears

jp: .腹中の鬼も出て見よ花の山
ro: fukuchû no oni mo dete mi yo hana [no] yama
en:
even my inner devil--
come out, look!
blossoming mountain

jp: .夕暮はもとの旅也花の山
ro: yûgure wa moto no tabi nari hana no yama
en:
in the evening
my usual journey...
blossoming mountain

jp: .汚坊花の表に立りけり
ro: yogore-bô hana no omote ni tateri keri
en:
a defiled priest--
before the cherry blossoms
he stands

jp: .天の邪鬼踏れながらもさくら哉
ro: ama no jaku fumare nagara mo sakura kana
en:
stubborn they are
even while trampled...
cherry blossoms

jp: .えた寺の桜まじまじ咲にけり
ro: eta tera no sakura maji-maji saki ni keri
en:
at the outcasts' temple
with cool defiance...
cherry blossoms

jp: .狗が供して参る桜かな
ro: enokoro ga tomo shite mairu sakura kana
en:
the puppy is escort
on the pilgrimage...
cherry blossoms!

jp: .鬼の角ぽっきり折るる桜哉
ro: oni no tsuno pokkiri oruru sakura kana
en:
the devil's horns
snap off!
cherry blossoms

jp: .観音のあらんかぎりは桜かな
ro: kannon no aran kagiri wa sakura kana
en:
where Goddess Kannon
is found, expect
cherry blossoms!

jp: .咲くからに罪作らする桜哉
ro: saku kara ni tsumi tsukurasuru sakura kana
en:
before blooming
they already seduce...
cherry blossoms

jp: .桜木や同じ盛も御膝元
ro: sakura ki ya onaji sakari mo o-hizamoto
en:
cherry tree--
the same blooming splendor
for Father Emperor

jp: .桜々花も三月三十日哉
ro: sakura sakura hana mo sangatsu misoka kana
en:
cherry blossoms
cherry blossoms
Third Month, 30th day!

jp: .桜花何が不足でちりいそぐ
ro: sakura hana nani ga fusoku de chiri isogu
en:
hey cherry blossoms--
why the rush
to scatter so soon?

jp: .さざ波やさもなき桜咲にけり
ro: sazanami ya samonaki sakura saki ni keri
en:
ripples on water--
fair to middling
cherry blossoms

jp: .死支度致せ致せと桜哉
ro: shinijitaku itase itase to sakura kana
en:
"Get ready, get ready
for death!"
cherry blossoms

jp: .上人は菩薩と見たる桜哉
ro: shônin wa bosatsu to mitaru sakura kana
en:
to saintly eyes
they are bodhisattvas...
cherry blossoms

jp: .散桜肌着の汗を吹せけり
ro: chiru sakura hadagi no ase wo fukase keri
en:
cherry blossoms
brush my sweaty underwear...
windblown

jp: .散桜よしなき口を降埋めよ
ro: chiru sakura yoshi naki kuchi wo furi ume yo
en:
fall, cherry blossoms--
stop up
their foul mouths!

jp: .三十日か三十日かとやちるさくら
ro: tsugomori ka tsugomori ka to ya chiru sakura
en:
is today the 30th?
the 30th?
cherry blossoms scatter

jp: .年よりの目にさへ桜々哉
ro: toshiyori no me ni sae sakura sakura to
en:
even to these old eyes--
cherry blossoms!
cherry blossoms!

jp: .なんのその西方よりもさくら花
ro: nanno sono saihô yori mo sakura hana
en:
how they bloom
even in the west...
cherry trees

jp: .山桜々も二十九日かな
ro: yama-zakura sakura mo ni jû ku nichi kana
en:
mountain cherry blossoms
cherry blossoms!
even on the 29th

jp: .山桜中々花が病かな
ro: yama-zakura chûchû hana ga yamai kana
en:
mountain cherry trees--
the blossoms quite
sickly

jp: .山桜花をしみれば歯のほしき
ro: yama-zakura hana wo shimireba ha no hoshiki
en:
seeing the mountain
cherry blossoms...
I miss my teeth

jp: .夕桜鬼の涙のかかるべし
ro: yûzakura oni no namida kakarubeshi
en:
evening cherry blossoms--
the devil is moved
to tears

jp: .夕ざくらけふも昔に成にけり
ro: yûzakura kyô mo mukashi ni nari ni keri
en:
evening cherry blossoms--
today too
like olden times

jp: .よるとしや桜のさくも小うるさき
ro: yorutoshi ya sakura no saku mo ko urusaki
en:
growing old--
even the cherry blossoms
a bit annoying

jp: .山吹や草にかくれて又そよぐ
ro: yamabuki ya kusa ni kakurete mata soyogu
en:
yellow roses--
hidden in the grass
they rustle

jp: .夏の夜やうらから見ても亦打山
ro: natsu no yo ya ura kara mite mo matchi yama
en:
in the summer night
out the back door too...
Mount Matchi

jp: .明安き闇の小すみの柳哉
ro: ake yasuki yami no kosumi no yanagi kana
en:
summer's early dawn--
in a dark little corner
a willow

jp: .あつき夜や江戸の子隅のへらず口
ro: atsuki yo ya edo no kosumi no herazuguchi
en:
hot night--
in an Edo nook
rude words

jp: .立じまの草履詠る暑哉
ro: tatejima no zôri nagameru atsusa kana
en:
I gaze at straw sandals
with stripes...
the heat

jp: .門の夜や涼しい空も今少し
ro: kado no yo ya suzushii sora mo ima sukoshi
en:
evening at the gate--
a cool sky
coming soon

jp: .涼風や力一っぱいきりぎりす
ro: suzukaze ya chikara ippai kirigirisu
en:
a cool breeze--
the katydid brims
with energy

jp: .涼風はあなた任せぞ墓の松
ro: suzukaze wa anata makase zo haka no matsu
en:
the cool breeze
a gift from Buddha...
pine by the grave

jp: .涼しさに忝さの夜露哉
ro: suzushisa ni katajikenasa no yo tsuyu kana
en:
in this cool air--
grateful drops
of evening dew

jp: .涼しさや山から見へる大座敷
ro: suzushisa ya yama kara mieru ôzashiki
en:
cool summer air--
viewed from the mountain
a big sitting room

jp: .涼しさや闇の隅なる角田川
ro: suzushisa ya yami no sumi naru sumida-gawa
en:
cool air--
a dark little nook
on Sumida River

jp: .月涼しすずしき松のたてりけり
ro: tsuki suzushi suzushiki matsu no tateri keri
en:
cool moon
and a cool pine tree
standing

jp: .五月雨や胸につかへるちちぶ山
ro: samidare ya mune ni tsukaeru chichibu yama
en:
Fifth Month rain--
pressing on my chest
Chichibu mountain

jp: .いかめしき夕立かかる柳哉
ro: ikameshiki yûdachi kakaru yanagi kana
en:
with dignity
in the cloudburst drooping...
willow

jp: .小祭や人木隠て夕立す
ro: ko matsuri ya hito kogakurete yûdachisu
en:
little festival--
people in the tree shade
while it pours

jp: .夕立に大の朝顔咲にけり
ro: yûdachi ni ô no asagao saki ni keri
en:
in the cloudburst
an enormous morning-glory
has bloomed!

jp: .夏山や一人きげんの女郎花
ro: natsu yama ya hitori kigen no ominaeshi
en:
summer mountain--
the maiden flower
happy by herself

jp: .昔々々の釜が清水哉
ro: mukashi mukashi mukashi no kama ga shimizu kana
en:
in an old, old kettle
from olden times...
pure water

jp: .夕陰や清水を馬に投つける
ro: yûkage ya shimizu wo uma ni nagetsukeru
en:
evening shadows--
he throws pure water
on the horse

jp: .けいこ笛田はことごとく青みけり
ro: keiko fue ta wa kotogotoku aomi keri
en:
flute pratice--
the rice fields one and all
so green!

jp: .春日のの鹿も立ちそう花御堂
ro: kasuga no no shika mo tachi sô hanamidô
en:
Kasuga Field's deer
also attend...
Buddha amid birthday flowers

jp: .里の子や烏も交る花御堂
ro: sato no ko ya karasu mo majiru hanamidô
en:
village children
and crows mingle...
Buddha amid birthday flowers

jp: .旅烏江戸の御祓にとしよりぬ
ro: tabikarasu edo no misogi ni toshitorinu
en:
traveling crow
at Edo's purification...
now you're old

jp: .蟾親子づれして夕祓
ro: hikigaeru oya-go-zure shite yû harai
en:
toad parents
bring their children...
evening purification

jp: .夕祓鴫十ばかり立にけり
ro: yû harai shigi jû bakari tachi ni keri
en:
evening's shrine boats--
about ten snipes
stand guard

jp: .茅の輪や始三度は母の分
ro: chino[wa] ya hajime san do wa haha no bun
en:
purification hoop--
the first three times
for Mother

jp: .形代の後れ先立角田川
ro: katashiro no okure sakidatsu sumida-gawa
en:
plague gods lag behind
others in the lead...
Sumida River

jp: .形代やとても流れば西の方
ro: katashiro ya totemo nagareba nishi no hô
en:
plague gods--
how wise of them
drifting west

jp: .かたしろや水になる身もいそがしき
ro: katashiro ya mizu ni naru mi mo isogashiki
en:
plague gods--
setting them on the water
heavy traffic

jp: .夕あらし我形代を頼むぞよ
ro: yûarashi waga katashiro wo tanomu zo yo
en:
night storm--
I rely on my little
plague god

jp: .鰍鳴月の山川狩られけり
ro: kajika naku tsuki no yamagawa karare keri
en:
bullheads sing--
he fishes the moonlit
mountain stream

jp: .川がりや鳴つくばかりきりぎりす
ro: kawagari ya nakitsuku bakari kirigirisu
en:
night fishing--
the pleading
of a katydid

jp: .鵜匠にとしのとれとや姫小松
ro: u-dakumi ni toshi no tore to ya hime ko matsu
en:
grow old
with the cormorant fisherman
little pine

jp: .鵜匠や鵜を遊する草の花
ro: u-dakumi ya u wo asobasuru kusa no hana
en:
the cormorant fisherman
tends to his cormorants...
wildflowers

jp: .うつくしき草のはづれのう舟哉
ro: utsukushiki kusa no hazure no u-bune kana
en:
beyond the pretty
grasses...
a cormorant boat

jp: .風そよそよ今始たる鵜舟哉
ro: kaze soyo-soyo ima hajimetaru u-bune kana
en:
wind wafting
it now sets forth...
cormorant boat

jp: .草花のちらちら見へてう舟哉
ro: kusabana no chira-chira miete u-bune kana
en:
watching wildflowers
flit and flutter...
cormorant boat

jp: .人の子や鵜を遊する草の花
ro: hito no ko ya u wo asobasuru kusa no hana
en:
the man's child
tends to the cormorant...
wildflowers

jp: .見る人に夜露のかかる鵜舟哉
ro: miru hito ni yo tsuyu no kakaru u-bune kana
en:
evening dew hangs
on the man who watches...
cormorant boat

jp: .更衣此日も山と小藪かな
ro: koromogae kono hi mo yama to ko yabu kana
en:
in their new summer robes
today too...
mountain, little thicket

jp: .何をして腹をへらさん更衣
ro: nani wo shite hara wo herasan koromogae
en:
doing what I can
to shrink the belly...
new summer robe

jp: .鶯に声かけらるる袷かな
ro: uguisu ni koe kakeraruru awase kana
en:
the nightingale
sings to it!
my summer kimono

jp: .四月の二日の旦の袷かな
ro: shingatsu no futsuka no asa no awase kana
en:
Fourth Month, second morning
I put on
the summer kimono

jp: .帷子に忝の夜露哉
ro: katabira ni katajikenasa no yo tsuyu kana
en:
grateful
for the summer kimono
evening dew

jp: .草そよそよ簾のそよりそより哉
ro: kusa soyo-soyo sudare no soyori soyori kana
en:
soft-blowing grasses
and soft, soft
green bamboo blind

jp: .吹風のきのふは青き簾哉
ro: fuku kaze no kinou wa aoki sudare kana
en:
green yesterday
in the blowing wind...
bamboo blind

jp: .から舟や鷺が三疋蚊屋の番
ro: kara fune ya sagi sambiki kaya no ban
en:
empty boat--
three herons guard
the mosquito net

jp: .梟よ蚊屋なき家と沙汰するな
ro: fukurô yo kaya naki ie to sata suru na
en:
O owl
don't tell the world my house
has no mosquito net!

jp: .暮行や扇のはしの浅間山
ro: kure yuku ya ôgi no hashi no asama yama
en:
evening falls--
on the tip of my fan
Mount Asama

jp: .山けぶり扇にかけて急ぐ哉
ro: yama keburi ôgi ni kakete isogu kana
en:
smoke from the mountain--
my paper fan
speeds it along

jp: .うつくしや蚊やりはづれの角田川
ro: utsukushi ya ka yari hazure no sumida-gawa
en:
pretty--
beyond the smudge pot smoke
Sumida River

jp: .蚊いぶしをはやして行や夕烏
ro: ka ibushi wo hayashite yuku ya yû karasu
en:
rushing into
the smudge pot smoke...
evening crow

jp: .今に入草葉の陰の夕涼
ro: ima ni iru kusaba no kage no yûsuzumi
en:
in grasses' shade
where soon I'll enter...
evening cool

jp: .うら門や誰も涼まぬ大榎
ro: ura kado ya dare mo suzumana ôenoki
en:
back gate--
under the big nettle tree
nobody cooling off

jp: .巾着の殻が流るる夕涼み
ro: kinchaku no kara ga nagaruru yûsuzumi
en:
the empty purse
floats away...
evening cool

jp: .茶のけぶり仏の小田も植りけり
ro: cha no keburi hotoke no oda mo uwari keri
en:
tea smoke--
Buddha's little rice field
is planted too

jp: .弓提し人の跡おふかのこ哉
ro: yumi sageshi hito no ato ou kanoko kana
en:
following behind
the hunter with his bow...
a fawn

jp: .かはほりをもてなすやうな小竹哉
ro: kawahori wo motenasu yôna ko take kana
en:
like it's throwing a party
for the bats...
grove of new bamboo

jp: .暁の夢をはめなん時鳥
ro: akatsuki no yume wo hamenan hototogisu
en:
gobble up
my dawn dream...
cuckoo!

jp: .朝々やけふは何の日ほととぎす
ro: asa-asa ya kyô wa nan no hi hototogisu
en:
morning after morning--
what day is it now
cuckoo?

jp: .有様は待申さぬぞ時鳥
ro: ariyô wa machi môsanu zo hototogisu
en:
he's not the type
to wait around...
cuckoo

jp: .十日程雲も古びぬほととぎす
ro: tôka hodo kumo mo furubinu hototogisu
en:
ten cloudy days--
this is getting old
cuckoo!

jp: .なでしこの正月いたせ郭公
ro: nadeshiko no shôgatsu itase hototogisu
en:
it's New Year's
for the blooming pinks...
"cuckoo!"

jp: .なでしこもすすきも起よほととぎす
ro: nadeshiko mo susuki mo oki yo hototogisu
en:
wake up, pinks
and pampas grass...
"cuckoo!"

jp: .汝らもとしとり直せ時鳥
ro: nanjira mo toshitori naose hototogisu
en:
you too
should grow old...
cuckoo

jp: .時鳥木を植るとてしかる也
ro: hototogisu ki wo ueru tote shikaru nari
en:
cuckoo--
he even scolds
the tree planter

jp: .時鳥我湖水ではなかりけり
ro: hototogisu waga mizuumi de wa nakari keri
en:
hey cuckoo--
this lake doesn't
belong to me!

jp: .むさしのに只一つぞよほととぎす
ro: musashi no ni tada hitotsu zo yo hototogisu
en:
in all Musashi Plain
just one...
cuckoo

jp: .用なしは我と葎ぞ時鳥
ro: yô nashi wa ware to mugura zo hototogisu
en:
useless me
useless weeds...
the cuckoo's opinion

jp: .若い衆にきらはれ給ふほととぎす
ro: wakai shu ni kiraware tamau hototogisu
en:
he's hated
by the young folk...
the dear cuckoo

jp: .我汝を待こと久し時鳥
ro: ware nanji wo matsu koto hisashi hototogisu
en:
I've waited long
for thee
O cuckoo!

jp: .何事もなむあみだ仏閑古鳥
ro: nanigoto mo namu a[mi]da butsu kankodori
en:
come what may
praise Buddha!
mountain cuckoo

jp: .行々し下手盗人をはやすらん
ro: gyôgyôshi heta nusubito wo hayasuran
en:
cheered on
by a reed thrush
the incompetent thief

jp: .笠程の花が咲たぞとぶ蛍
ro: kasa hodo no hana ga saita zo tobu hotaru
en:
a flower big
as an umbrella-hat...
flitting firefly

jp: .手枕や小言いうても来る蛍
ro: temakura ya kogoto iute mo kuru hotaru
en:
an arm for a pillow--
though there's nagging
a firefly guest

jp: .人鬼の中へさっさと蛍哉
ro: hito oni no naka e sassato hotaru kana
en:
so quickly they join
the human goblins...
fireflies

jp: .梟や蛍々をよぶやうに
ro: fukurô ya hotaru hotaru wo yobu yô ni
en:
the owl
seems to be hooting
for fireflies

jp: .山伏が気に喰ぬやら行く蛍
ro: yamabushi ga ki ni kuwanu yara yuku hotaru
en:
shunning
the mountain hermit...
flitting fireflies

jp: .悪土の国とも見えぬ蛍哉
ro: waru tsuchi no kuni tomo mienu hotaru kana
en:
this poor-soiled province
ain't so bad...
fireflies

jp: .老ぬれば只蚊をやくを手がら哉
ro: oi nureba tada ka wo yaku wo tegara kana
en:
in old age
mosquito-burning
the only great feat

jp: .鐘鳴るや蚊の国に来よ来よ来よと
ro: kane naru ya ka no kuni ni ko yo ko yo to
en:
the bell clangs
"Come to mosquito country!
Come! Come!"

jp: .蚊柱や凡そ五尺の菊の花
ro: ka-bashira ya oyoso go shaku no kiku no hana
en:
swarm of mosquitoes--
a five foot tall
chrysanthemum

jp: .山人や袂の中の蝉の声
ro: yamaudo ya tamoto no naka no semi no koe
en:
mountain hermit--
deep in his sleeve
singing, a cicada

jp: .朝雨やすでにとなりのかたつぶり
ro: asa ame ya sude ni tonari no katatsuburi
en:
morning rain--
look! next to me
a snail

jp: .それなりに成仏とげよかたつぶり
ro: sore nari ni jôbutsu toge yo katatsuburi
en:
just as you are
become Buddha!
snail

jp: .陶の笹もそよそよ松魚哉
ro: suemono no sasa mo soyo-soyo katsuo kana
en:
the potted bamboo
rustles, rustles...
bonito!

jp: .只たのめ山時鳥初松魚
ro: tada tanome yama hototogisu hatsu-gatsuo
en:
simply trust
mountain cuckoo!
summer's first bonito

jp: .とうふ屋が来る昼顔が咲にけり
ro: tôfu ya ga kuru hirugao ga saki ni keri
en:
the tofu vendor comes--
the day flower
blooms

jp: .生て居るばかりぞ我とけしの花
ro: ikite iru bakari zo ware to heshi [no] hana
en:
just being alive
I
and the poppy

jp: .ひろびろと麦に咲そうぼたん哉
ro: hiro-biro to mugi [ni] saki sô botan kana
en:
a vast wheat field
dotted with blooming
peonies

jp: .うき葉うき葉蓮の虻にぞ喰れける
ro: uki ha uki ha hasu no abu ni zo kuwarekeru
en:
floating leaves, floating leaves
lotus blossom horseflies
feed

jp: .馬喰し虻が逃行蓮の花
ro: uma kuishi [abu] ga nigeyuku hasu no hana
en:
after biting the horse
the horsefly hides out...
lotus blossoms

jp: .花盛蓮の虻蚊に喰れけり
ro: hana-zakari hasu no abuka ni kuware keri
en:
lotuses at their peak
horseflies and mosquitoes
feast

jp: .けふからの念仏聞々ゆりの花
ro: kyô kara no nebutsu kiki kiki yuri no hana
en:
from today on
hear my "Praise Buddha!"
lilies

jp: .さくゆりになむあみだぶのはやる也
ro: saku yuri ni namu amida bu no hayaru nari
en:
amid blooming lilies
many, many prayers
to Amida Buddha

jp: .しんしんとゆりの咲けり鳴雲雀
ro: shin-shin to yuri no saki keri naku hibari
en:
quietly the lilies
have bloomed...
a skylark sings

jp: .寝る牛はゆりの心にかなふべし
ro: neru [ushi] wa yuri no kokoro ni kanau-beshi
en:
sleeping cow--
at one with the heart
of lilies

jp: .ゆり咲てとりしまりなき夕哉
ro: yuri saite torishimari naki yûbe kana
en:
lilies blooming
with no one's sanction...
evening

jp: .ゆり咲や大骨折って雲雀鳴く
ro: yuri saku ya ôhone otte hibari naku
en:
lilies blooming!
giving his all to his song
the skylark

jp: .鶯やうき世の隅も麦の秋
ro: uguisu ya ukiyo no sumi mo mugi no aki
en:
nightingale--
in a floating world nook
ripened barley

jp: .麦秋の小隅に咲くは何の花
ro: mugi aki no kosumi ni saku wa nan no hana
en:
blooming in a nook
of ripened barley...
what's that flower?

jp: .せい出してそよげわか竹今のうち
ro: sei dashite soyoge waka take ima no uchi
en:
with all your might
wiggle young bamboo
while you can!

jp: .そよげそよげそよげわか竹今のうち
ro: soyoge soyoge soyoge waka take ima no uchi
en:
wiggle wiggle
wiggle young bamboo
while you can!

jp: .わか竹や是も若は二三日
ro: waka take ya kore mo wakaki wa ni san nichi
en:
young bamboo--
just two or three days
of youth

jp: .竹の子といふ竹の子のやみよかな
ro: takenoko to iu takenoko no yamiyo kana
en:
for bamboo shoots
a dark night
for bamboo shoots

jp: .竹の子にへだてられけり草の花
ro: takenoko ni hedaterare keri kusa no hana
en:
living apart
from the bamboo shoots...
wildflowers

jp: .竹の子の兄よ弟よ老ぬ
ro: takenoko no ani yo ototo yo toshiyorinu
en:
bamboo shoots--
big brothers, little brothers
growing up

jp: .竹の子や痩山吹も夜の花
ro: takenoko ya yase yamabuki mo yoru no hana
en:
bamboo shoots--
scraggly yellow roses, too
grew overnight

jp: .夜々は門も筍分限哉
ro: yoru-yoru wa kado mo takenoko bugen kana
en:
night after night
the gate's bamboo shoots
rise in the world

jp: .旦夕にふすぼりもせぬわかば哉
ro: asa yû ni fusubori mo senu wakaba kana
en:
morning and night
yet still not smoldered...
fresh green leaves

jp: .桑の木や旦々の初わか葉
ro: kuwa no ki ya ashita ashita no hatsu wakaba
en:
mulberry tree--
tomorrow, tomorrow
your new leaves

jp: .下やみや萩のやうなる草の咲
ro: shitayami ya hagi no yônaru kusa no saku
en:
deep tree shade--
some bush clover-like grass
in bloom

jp: .堅どうふあな卯の花の在所哉
ro: kata-dôfu ana u [no] hana no zaisho kana
en:
hard tofu--
amid deutzia blossoms
a farmhouse

jp: .古郷やよるも障るも茨の花
ro: furusato ya yoru mo sawa[ru] mo bara no hana
en:
the closer I get
to my village, the more pain...
wild roses

jp: .小柱や己が夜寒の福の神
ro: ko-bashira ya ono ga yozamu no fuku no kami
en:
little post--
on a cold night
my good luck god

jp: .古郷や是も夜寒の如来様
ro: furusato ya kore mo yozamu no nyorai sama
en:
my home village--
Lord Buddha
in the cold night

jp: .赤紐の草履も見ゆる秋の夕
ro: aka himo no zôri mo miyuru aki no yû
en:
red-laced straw sandals
pass by too...
autumn evening

jp: .赤紐の草履も見ゆる秋の暮
ro: aka himo no zôri mo miyuru aki no kure
en:
red-laced straw sandals
pass by too...
autumn dusk

jp: .争ひや夜長のすみの角田川
ro: araso[i] ya yonaga no sumi no sumida-gawa
en:
bickering in the long night
in a nook
of Sumida River

jp: .あばら骨あばらに長き夜也けり
ro: abarabone abara ni nagaki yo nari keri
en:
to my rib cage ribs
O the night
is long!

jp: .行秋をぶらりと大の男哉
ro: yuku aki wo burari to dai no otoko kana
en:
autumn's end--
a big man strolls
along

jp: .行秋やすでに御釈迦は京の空
ro: yuku aki ya sude ni o-shaka wa kyô no sora
en:
autumn ends--
already the Buddha
fills Kyoto's sky

jp: .名月をにぎにぎしたる赤子哉
ro: meigetsu wo nigi-nigishitaru akago kana
en:
trying and trying
to grasp the harvest moon--
toddler

jp: .名月やけふはあなたもいそがしき
ro: meigetsu ya kyô wa anata mo isogashiki
en:
harvest moon--
tonight even you
are busy!

jp: .名月は汐に流るる小舟かな
ro: meigetsu ya shio ni nagaruru kobune kana
en:
the harvest moon
drifts with the tide...
a little boat

jp: .夕暮や鬼の出さうな秋の雲
ro: yûgure ya oni no desôna aki no kumo
en:
evening falls--
like demons emerging
autumn clouds

jp: .秋の雨小さき角力通りけり
ro: aki no ame chii[sa]ki sumô tôri keri
en:
autumn rain--
a little sumo wrestler
passes

jp: .秋風やあれも昔の美少年
ro: aki kaze ya are mo mukashi no bishonen
en:
autumn wind--
he was good-looking too
in olden times

jp: .秋風や腹の上なるきりぎりす
ro: aki kaze ya hara no ue naru kirigirisu
en:
autumn wind--
landing on my belly
a katydid

jp: .草の葉や雨にまぎれぬ秋の露
ro: kusa no ha [ya] ame ni magirenu aki no tsuyu
en:
blades of grass--
lost among the raindrops
autumn dew

jp: .白露にまぎれ込だる我家哉
ro: shira tsuyu ni magire kondaru waga ya kana
en:
in the silver dewdrops
vanishing...
my house

jp: .涼しさに忝さの夜露哉
ro: suzushisa ni katajikenasa no yo tsuyu kana
en:
grateful
for the cool, cool air...
evening dew

jp: .露ちるや後生大事に鳴雀
ro: tsuyu chiru ya goshô daiji ni naku suzume
en:
dewdrops scatter--
the sparrow sings
of next-life salvation

jp: .露の世の露の中にてけんくわ哉
ro: tsuyu no yo no tsuyu no naka nite kenka kana
en:
amid dewdrops
of this dewdrop world
a quarrel

jp: .露ほろりほろりと鳩の念仏哉
ro: tsuyu horori horori to hato no nebutsu kana
en:
amid weeping dewdrops
pigeons coo
"Praise Buddha!"

jp: .露見ても酒は呑るることし哉
ro: tsuyu mite mo sake wa nomaruru kotoshi kana
en:
even viewing dewdrops
an occasion for sake...
this year

jp: .我門の宝もの也露の玉
ro: waga kado no takara mono nari tsuyu no tama
en:
a treasure at my gate
pearls
of dew

jp: .迎鐘落る露にも鳴にけり
ro: mukae-gane ochiru tsuyu ni mo nari ni keri
en:
bell for the ancestors--
in falling dewdrops
it rings

jp: .我仏けふもいづくの草枕
ro: waga hotoke kyô mo izuku no kusamakura
en:
my ancestors--
today too they wander
to points unknown

jp: .迎へ火をおもしろがりし子供哉
ro: mukaebi wo omoshirogarishi kodomo kana
en:
delighted by bonfires
for the dead...
children

jp: .草原にそよそよ赤い灯ろ哉
ro: kusabara ni soyo-soyo akai tôro kana
en:
in the grassy meadow
flickering red...
lantern for the dead

jp: .下手祭妹がすすきは荒にけり
ro: heta matsuri imo ga susuki wa are ni keri
en:
a clumsy festival!
my love wrecks her chopsticks
of pampas grass

jp: .朝顔を一垣咲す角力哉
ro: asagao wo hito kaki sakasu sumô kana
en:
morning-glories
make the fence bloom...
sumo wrestling

jp: .角力とりや是は汝が女郎花
ro: sumotori ya kore wa nanji ga ominaeshi
en:
sumo wrestler--
for you this maiden
flower

jp: .立かがしそもそも御代の月夜也
ro: tatsu kagashi somo-somo miyo no tsuki yo nari
en:
a scarecrow stands--
now the age
of moonlit nights!

jp: .どちらから寒くなるぞよかがし殿
ro: dochira kara samuku naru zo yo kagashi dono
en:
where did this cold
come from...
Mr. Scarecrow?

jp: .笛吹て山のかがしの御礼哉
ro: fue fuite yama [no] kagashi no orei kana
en:
flute melody--
thanking the mountain
scarecrows

jp: .君が代や牛かひが笛小夜砧
ro: kimi ga yo ya ushikai ga fue sayo-ginuta
en:
Great Japan!
a cowherd's flute
and cloth-pounding at night

jp: .恋猫の片顔見ゆる小夜砧
ro: koi neko no kata-gao miyuru sayo-ginuta
en:
the lover cat
watches with one eye...
pounding cloth at night

jp: .直そこのわか松諷ふきぬた哉
ro: sugu soko no waka matsu utau kinuta kana
en:
singing with
the young pine nearby...
pounding cloth

jp: .なでしこの一花咲ぬ小夜ぎぬた
ro: nadeshiko no ichi-bana sakinu sayo-ginuta
en:
one pink
has bloomed...
cloth-pounding at night

jp: .故郷や寺の砧も夜の雨
ro: furusato ya tera no kinuta mo yoru no ame
en:
home village--
pounding cloth at the temple
and evening rain

jp: .故郷や母の砧のよわり様
ro: furusato ya haha no kinuta no yowari sama
en:
home village--
mother's cloth-pounding
faintly heard

jp: .古松や我身の秋もあの通り
ro: furu matsu ya waga mi no aki mo ano tôri
en:
old pine--
my own life's autumn
is like that

jp: .古松や我身の秋が目に見ゆる
ro: furu matsu ya waga mi no aki ga me ni miyuru
en:
old pine--
my own life's autumn
fills my eyes

jp: .うら口やすすき三本雁夫婦
ro: ura-guchi ya susuki sanbon kari fûfu
en:
back door--
three spears of pampas grass
and Mr. and Mrs. Goose

jp: .大橋や鑓もちどのの跡の雁
ro: ôhashi ya yarimochi dono no ato no kari
en:
big bridge--
the hunter is followed
by a goose

jp: .暮行や雁とけぶりと膝がしら
ro: kure yuku ya kari to keburi to hizagashira
en:
evening falls--
wild geese, smoke
and my bended knees

jp: .出る月に門田の雁の行儀哉
ro: deru tsuki ni kado ta no kari no gyôgi kana
en:
the moon's out!
in the gate's rice field
polite geese

jp: .赤蜻蛉かれも夕が好じゃやら
ro: aka tombô kare mo yûbe ga suki ja yara
en:
the red dragonfly
savors the evening too...
doesn't he?

jp: .夕汐や草葉の末の赤蜻蛉
ro: yû shio ya kusaba no sue no aka tombo
en:
evening tide--
on the grass blade's tip
a red dragonfly

jp: .こおろぎのなくやころころ若い同士
ro: kôrogi no naku ya koro-koro wakai doshi
en:
crickets sing
"Cricky! Cricky!"
two young lovers

jp: .枯々の野辺に恋するいなご哉
ro: kare-gare no nobe ni koi suru inago kana
en:
making love
in the withered fields...
locusts

jp: .庵の夜や棚捜しするきりぎりす
ro: io no yo ya tana sagashi suru kirigirisu
en:
night in the hut--
a katydid forages
for food

jp: .きりぎりすさがし歩くや庵の棚
ro: kirigirisu sagashi aruku ya io no tana
en:
a katydid walking
searching...
my hut's shelf

jp: .大切のぼたもちふむなりきりぎりす
ro: taisetsu no botamochi fumu nari kirigirisu
en:
trampling the god's
rice cake and jam...
katydid

jp: .ぼた餅を踏へて鳴やきりぎりす
ro: botamochi wo fumaete naku ya kirigirisu
en:
stomping and singing
on rice cake and jelly...
katydid!

jp: .夕汐や塵にすがりてきりぎりす
ro: yû shio ya chiri ni sugarite kirigirisu
en:
at evening tide
clinging to flotsam...
a katydid

jp: .草花やいふもかたるも秋の風
ro: kusabana ya iu mo kataru mo aki no kaze
en:
wildflowers--
all we say or speak about
is autumn wind

jp: .ふくろふよ鳴ばいくらの草の花
ro: fukurô ya nakeba ikura no kusa no hana
en:
when the owl hoots
how many are left?
wildflowers

jp: .雷の焦し給ひぬ女郎花
ro: kaminari no kogashi tamainu ominaeshi
en:
singed by a bolt
of lightning...
maiden flowers

jp: .よろよろは我もまけぬぞ女郎花
ro: yoro-yoro wa ware mo makenu zo ominaeshi
en:
you can't beat me
in tottering!
maiden flower

jp: .有明や親もつ人の稲の花
ro: ariake ya oya motsu hito no ine no hana
en:
dawn--
the rice blossoms of a man
with parents

jp: .茶けぶりや丘穂の露をただ頼む
ro: cha keburi ya okabo no tsuyu wo tada tanomu
en:
tea smoke--
the upland rice
trusts in the dew

jp: .名月の大事として稲の花
ro: meigetsu no ôgoto to shite ine no hana
en:
a great thing
under the harvest moon...
rice blossoms!

jp: .夕月や大々として稲の花
ro: yûzuki ya dai-dai to shite ine no hana
en:
evening moon--
the fantastically great
rice blossoms!

jp: .三ケ月の御若い顔や桐一葉
ro: mikazuki no o-wakai kao ya kiri hito ha
en:
the young face
of the sickle moon...
a paulownia leaf falls

jp: .柿を見て柿を蒔けり人の親
ro: kaki wo mite kaki wo maki keri hito no oya
en:
looking at persimmons--
someone's parents
planted seeds

jp: .十月の中の十日の霰哉
ro: jûgatsu no naka no tôka no arare kana
en:
Tenth Month
on the tenth day...
hail

jp: .十月やほのぼのかすむ御綿売
ro: jûgatsu ya honobono kasumu o-wata uri
en:
first winter month--
dimly in the mist
selling temple cotton

jp: .とし暮て薪一把も栄耀哉
ro: toshi kurete takigi ichi wa mo eyô kana
en:
the year ending--
one bundle of firewood
a luxury

jp: .わらの火のめらめら暮ることし哉
ro: wara no hi no mera-mera kururu kotoshi kana
en:
straw fire--
this year goes up
in smoke

jp: .鶯が親の跡追ふ初時雨
ro: uguisu ga oya no ato ou hatsu shigure
en:
the nightingale follows
his mother...
first winter rain

jp: .必や湯屋休みてはつ時雨
ro: kanarazu ya yuya yasumite hatsu shigure
en:
without fail
the bathhouse, closed...
first winter rain

jp: .初時雨俳諧流布の世也けり
ro: hatsu shigure haikai rufu no yo nari keri
en:
first winter rain--
the world fills up
with haiku

jp: .しぐるるや苦い御顔の仏達
ro: shigururu ya nigai o-kao no hotoke-tachi
en:
in winter rain
how they scowl...
the Buddhas

jp: .誰ためにしぐれておはす仏哉
ro: taga tame ni shigurete owasu hotoke kana
en:
enduring the winter rain
for whom?
stone Buddha

jp: .寝筵にさっと時雨の明り哉
ro: nemushiro ni satto shigure no akari kana
en:
on my sleeping mat
the winter rain suddenly
gives off light!

jp: .蕗の葉に酒飯くるむ時雨哉
ro: fuki no ha ni sakameshi kurumu shigure kana
en:
wrapping dinner
in butterbur leaves...
winter rain

jp: .又犬にけつまづきけり小夜時雨
ro: mata inu ni ketsumazuki [ke]ri sayo shigure
en:
tripping over the dog
again...
night of winter rain

jp: .山里は槌ならしても時雨けり
ro: yama-zato wa tsuchi narashite mo shigure keri
en:
in the mountain village
the clonk of a hammer...
winter rain

jp: .けふもけふも只木がらしの菜屑哉
ro: kyô mo kyô mo tada kogarashi no na kuzu kana
en:
today too, today too
the winter wind has strewn about
the vegetables

jp: .木がらしに大事大事の月よ哉
ro: kogarashi ni daiji daiji no tsuki yo kana
en:
in the winter wind
a great thing, the great
moon!

jp: .木がらしや額にさわる東山
ro: kogarashi ya hitai ni sawaru higashi yama
en:
in winter wind
my forehead throbs...
Higashi Mountains

jp: .はつ雪をいまいましいと夕哉
ro: hatsu yuki wo ima-imashii to yûbe kana
en:
the first snowfall
becomes a nuisance...
evening

jp: .はつ雪が降とや腹の虫が鳴
ro: hatsu yuki ga furu to ya hara no mushi ga naku
en:
first snowfall--
the worms in my belly
sing

jp: .はつ雪や朝夷する門乞食
ro: hatsu yuki ya asaebisu suru kado kojiki
en:
first snowfall--
early morning at my gate
a beggar

jp: .はつ雪や犬なき里の屑拾ひ
ro: hatsu yuki ya inu naki sato no kuzu hiroi
en:
first snowfall--
for a dog-less village
the garbage remover

jp: .はつ雪やそれは世にある人の事
ro: hatsu yuki ya sore wa yo ni aru hito no koto
en:
first snowfall--
a big deal for people
in the world

jp: .初雪や鶏の朝声浅草寺
ro: hatsu yuki ya tori no asa-goe sensôji
en:
first snowfall--
the rooster's morning crow
at Senso Temple

jp: .はつ雪や仏の方より湧清水
ro: hatsu yuki ya hotoke no hô yori waku shimizu
en:
first snowfall--
from Buddha's direction
pure water gushes

jp: .初雪やほのぼのかすむ御式台
ro: hatsu yuki ya hono-bono kasumu o-shikidai
en:
first snowfall--
the temple walkway
misty dim

jp: .はつ雪や雪やといふも歯なし哉
ro: hatsu yuki ya yuki ya to ium mo ha nashi kana
en:
"First snowfall, snowfall!"
he says
without teeth

jp: .むつかしや初雪見ゆるしなの山
ro: mutsukashi ya hatsu yuki miyuru shinano yama
en:
watching first snowfall
in a rotten mood...
Shinano Mountain

jp: .玉霰瓦の鬼も泣やうに
ro: tama arare kawara no oni mo naku yô ni
en:
hailstones--
even the gargoyle demon
seems to cry

jp: .散霰鳩が因果をかたる様
ro: chiru arare hato ga inga wo kataru-yô
en:
hailstones falling--
the pigeons hear
their fate

jp: .霰来とうたへる口へあられ哉
ro: arare ku to utaeru kuchi e arare kana
en:
into the mouth singing
"Come, hailstones!"
a hailstone

jp: .けふの日や鳩も数珠かけて初時雨
ro: kyô no hi ya hato mo juzu kakete hatsu shigure
en:
today even the pigeon
says a prayer...
first winter rain

jp: .ほかほかと煤がかすむぞ又打山
ro: hoka-hoka to susu ga kasumu zo matchi yama
en:
click-clack
in a soot-sweeping mist...
Mount Matchi

jp: .都鳥それさへ煤をかぶりけり
ro: miyakodori sore sae susu wo kaburi keri
en:
sea gull--
even you
covered in soot

jp: .せき候やそれそれそこの梅の花
ro: sekizoro ya sore-sore soko no ume no hana
en:
Twelfth Month singers
look! over there!
plum blossoms

jp: .加茂川を二番越さず紙子哉
ro: kamo-[gawa] wo ni ban koesazu kamiko kana
en:
not crossing
Kamo River twice!
paper robe

jp: .朔日の拇出る足袋で候
ro: tsuitachi no oyayubi izuru tabi de soro
en:
on winter's first day
big toes emerge...
toe socks

jp: .こおろぎの寒宿とする衾哉
ro: kôrogi no kanshuku to suru fusuma kana
en:
the cricket's
winter residence...
my quilt

jp: .埋火に作りつけたる法師哉
ro: uzumibi ni tsuku[ri]-tsuketaru hôshi kana
en:
staying glued
to the banked fire...
a priest

jp: .埋火の餅をながむる烏哉
ro: uzumibi no mochi wo nagamuru karasu kana
en:
eyeing the rice cake
on the banked fire...
crow

jp: .埋火をはねとばしけり盗み栗
ro: uzumibi wo hanetobashi keri nusumi kuri
en:
tossing 'em on
the banked fire...
stolen chestnuts

jp: .埋火の天窓張りこくるきせる哉
ro: uzumibi no atama hari-kokuru kiseru kana
en:
rapping on
the banked fire's head...
my pipe

jp: .埋火やきせるで天窓はりこくり
ro: usumibi ya kiseru de atama hari-kokuri
en:
banked fire--
with my pipe rapping
its head

jp: .埋火や白湯もちんちん夜の雨
ro: uzumibi ya sayu mo chin-chin yoru no ame
en:
banked fire--
hot water burbles too
evening rain

jp: .茎漬の氷こごりを歯切哉
ro: kukizuke no kôri kogori wo hagiri kana
en:
frozen pickle water--
my teeth
crackle

jp: .朝々に半人前の納豆哉
ro: asa-asa ni haninmae no natto kana
en:
morning after morning
just a half portion...
natto

jp: .有明や納豆腹を都迄
ro: ariake ya nattô hara wo miyako made
en:
dawn--
for a bellyful of natto
a trip to Kyoto

jp: .有明や紅葉吹おろす鰒汁
ro: ariake ya momiji fuki-orosu fukuto-jiru
en:
at dawn red leaves
blowing down...
pufferfish soup

jp: .梟や我から先へ飯買に
ro: fukurô ya ware kara saki e meshi kai ni
en:
O owl--
let me shop for food
first!

jp: .鶯や黄色な声で親をよぶ
ro: uguisu ya kiirona koe de oya wo yobu
en:
nightingale--
with a shrill voice
calling mother

jp: .笹鳴も手持ぶさたの垣根哉
ro: sasa naki mo temochi-busata no kakine kana
en:
birdsong in bamboo grass--
too shy
for the fence

jp: .小夜千鳥人は三十日を鳴にけり
ro: sayo chidori hito wa misoka wo naki ni keri
en:
evening plovers--
bills are due
people are crying

jp: .其やうに朝きげんかよ川千鳥
ro: sono yô ni asa kigen ka yo kawa chidori
en:
you call that
your morning mood?
river plover

jp: .袂へも飛入ばかり千鳥哉
ro: tamoto he mo tobi-iru bakari chidori kana
en:
even flying
into my sleeve...
a plover

jp: .人ならば仏性なるなまこ哉
ro: hito nara[ba] hotokeshû naru namako kana
en:
if they were people
they'd be Buddhas!
sea slugs

jp: .尋常に枯て仕廻ぬ野菊哉
ro: jinjô ni karete shimainu nogiku kana
en:
following custom
all have withered...
wild chamomile

jp: .かつしかや鷺が番する土大根
ro: katsushika ya sagi ga ban suru tsuchi daikon
en:
Katsushika--
a heron guards the radish
in the mud

jp: .ちる木の葉渡世念仏通りけり
ro: chiru ki[no]ha tosei nembutsu tôri keri
en:
leaves falling--
a prayer-chanting monk
passes by

jp: .鶯の山と成したるおち葉哉
ro: uguisu no yama to nashitaru ochiba kana
en:
forming a mountain
for the nightingale...
fallen leaves

jp: .霜がれや勧化法度の藪の宿
ro: shimogare ya kange hatto no yabu no yado
en:
frost-killed grass--
"No Begging Allowed"
at the thicket's inn

jp: .例の通り梅の元日いたしけり
ro: rei no tô[ri] ume no ganjitsu itashi keri
en:
a typical New Year's Day
spent viewing
plum blossoms

jp: .正月の町にするとや雪がふる
ro: shôgatsu no machi ni suru to ya yuki ga furu
en:
spring's first month
in the town...
snow falling

jp: .正月や外はか程の御月夜
ro: shôgatsu ya soto ha kahodo no on-tsuki yo
en:
First Month--
such a night
of bright moon!

jp: .正月や奴に髭のなささうに
ro: shôgatsu ya yakko ni hige no nasasô ni
en:
First Month--
on the servant no sign
of a beard

jp: .今朝の春四九じゃもの是も花
ro: kesa no haru shi jû ku ja mono kore mo hana
en:
first spring morning
my 49th year
of blossoms

jp: .けさ程やちさい霞も春じゃとて
ro: kesa hodo ya chisai kasumi mo haru ja tote
en:
this morning
just a tiny bit of mist...
it's springtime!

jp: .我春も上々吉よ梅の花
ro: waga haru mo jôjôkichi yo ume no hana
en:
my spring
is lucky, lucky!
plum blossoms

jp: .春立や夢に見てさへ小松原
ro: haru tatsu ya yume ni mite sae ko matsu-bara
en:
spring's begun--
I even dream about
the grove of young pines

jp: .壁の穴や我初空もうつくしき
ro: kabe no ana ya waga hatsuzora mo utsukushiki
en:
hole in the wall
pretty
my year's first sky

jp: .初空へさし出す獅子の首哉
ro: hatsuzora e sashidasu shishi no kashira kana
en:
to the year's first sky
the lion-puppet
rears his head

jp: .初空を拵へているけぶり哉
ro: hatsuzora wo koshiraete iru keburi kana
en:
it's forming
the New Year's sky...
smoke

jp: .初空にならんとすらん茶のけぶり
ro: hatsuzora ni naran to suran cha no keburi
en:
so that the year's
first sky might come to be...
tea smoke

jp: .初空の色もさめけり人の顔
ro: hatsu-zora no iro mo same keri hito no kao
en:
the color of the year's
first sky fades--
people's faces

jp: .初空のはづれの村も寒いげな
ro: hatsu-zora no hazure no mura mo samui-gena
en:
village at the edge
of the year's first sky...
must be cold

jp: .初空のはなばなしさを庵哉
ro: hatsu-zora no hanabanashi[sa] wo iori kana
en:
under the brilliance
of the year's first sky...
a hut

jp: .初空のもやうに立るけぶり哉
ro: hatsu-zora no moyô ni tateru keburi kana
en:
rising into
the year's first sky...
smoke

jp: .初空やはばかり乍ら茶のけぶり
ro: hatsu-zora ya habakari naga[ra] cha no keburi
en:
year's first sky--
please allow
my tea smoke!

jp: .初空や縁の色の直さむる
ro: hatsu-zora ya heri no iro no sugu samuru
en:
year's first sky--
at the edges its color
is faded

jp: .蓬莱に南無南無といふ童哉
ro: hôrai ni nammu nammu to iu warabe kana
en:
to the eternal
youth ornament the child
prays

jp: .蓬莱に夜が明込ぞ角田川
ro: hôrai ni yo ga akekome zo sumida-gawa
en:
day breaks
over the eternal youth ornament...
Sumida River

jp: .蓬莱の下から出たる旭かな
ro: hôrai no shita kara detaru asahi kana
en:
from under the eternal
youth ornament rising...
sun

jp: .蓬莱や只三文の御代の松
ro: hôrai ya tada san mon no miyo no matsu
en:
my eternal youth ornament--
just three cents
of emperor's pine

jp: .正夢や春早々の貧乏神
ro: masayume ya haru haya-baya no bimbô-gami
en:
my dream comes true--
this spring my god
the god of the poor

jp: .今様の凧上りけり乞食小屋
ro: ima yô no tako agari keri kojiki goya
en:
a trendy kite soars--
below
a beggar's hut

jp: .今様の凧の上りし山家哉
ro: ima yô no tako no agarishi yamaga kana
en:
a trendy kite soars
over the mountain
home

jp: .辻うたひ凧も上っていたりけり
ro: tsujiutai tako mo nobo[t]te itari keri
en:
the street singer's
kite also...
rising and rising

jp: .万歳や馬の尻へも一祝
ro: manzai ya uma no shiri e mo hito iwai
en:
begging actors--
even the horse's rump
gets a blessing

jp: .万ざいや門に居ならぶ鳩雀
ro: manzai ya kado ni inarabu hato suzume
en:
begging actors at the gate--
pigeons and sparrows
in a row

jp: .万ざいや麦にも一つ祝ひ捨
ro: manzai ya mugi ni mo hitotsu iwai sute
en:
begging actors--
even the wheat field
gets a song

jp: .獅子舞や大口明て梅の花
ro: shishimai ya ôkuchi akete ume no hana
en:
the lion puppet
opens wide...
plum blossoms

jp: .だまっても行ぬやけさの遅烏
ro: damatte mo yukanu ya kesa no oso karasu
en:
not shutting up
New Year morning's late riser...
the crow

jp: .二月や天神様の梅の花
ro: kisaragi ya tenjin-zama no ume no hana
en:
Second Month--
the heavenly gods'
plum blossoms!

jp: .月さして一文橋の春辺哉
ro: tsuki sashite ichi mon hashi no harube kana
en:
moon shining
on a one-penny bridge...
springtime

jp: .長閑しや酒打かける亦打山
ro: nodokeshi ya sake uchi-kakeru matchi yama
en:
spring peace--
smash goes the sake bottle
on Mount Matchi

jp: .鳩鳴や大事の春がなくなると
ro: hato naku ya daiji no haru ga nakunaru to
en:
a pigeon coos--
"That great thing, spring
has passed!"

jp: .ゆさゆさと春が行ぞよのべの草
ro: yusa-yusa to haru ga yuku zo yo nobe no kusa
en:
swish-swish
spring is departing...
field of grass

jp: .鳥どもよだまって居ても春は行
ro: tori domo yo damatte ite mo haru wa yuku
en:
hey birds!
even if you shut up
spring would go

jp: .野大根烏のかがし春の雨
ro: no daikon karasu no kagashi haru no ame
en:
warding off crows
in the radish field...
spring rain

jp: .萩の葉に鹿のくれけり春の雨
ro: hagi no ha ni shika no kure keri haru [no] ame
en:
in bush clover
a deer hides out...
spring rain

jp: .春雨に大欠する美人哉
ro: harusame ni ôakubi suru bijin kana
en:
in the spring rain
a big yawn...
pretty woman

jp: .春雨や小島も金の咲くやうに
ro: harusame yak o-jima mo kane no saku yô ni
en:
spring rain--
a little island too
blooms golden

jp: .春雨や是は我家の夜の松
ro: harusame ya kore wa waga ya no yoru no matsu
en:
spring rain--
here's my house's
evening pine

jp: .春雨やつつじでふきし犬の家
ro: harusame [ya] tsutsuji de fukishi inu no ie
en:
spring rain--
thatched with azaleas
the doghouse

jp: .春雨や貧乏樽の梅の花
ro: harusame ya bimbôdaru no ume no hana
en:
spring rain--
in an old keg
a plum tree blooms

jp: .人のいふ法ほけ経や春の雨
ro: hito no iu hôhokekyô ya haru no ame
en:
someone recites
the Lotus Sutra...
spring rain falls

jp: .春風や東下りの角力取
ro: haru kaze ya azuma kudari no sumôtori
en:
spring breeze--
going down to the east
a sumo wrestler

jp: .春風や牛に引かれて善光寺
ro: haru kaze ya ushi ni hikarete zenkôji
en:
spring breeze--
a cow leads the way
to Zenko Temple

jp: .彼の桃が流れ来よ来よ春がすみ
ro: ka[no] momo ga nagare ki yo ki yo harugasumi
en:
oh peach
come float to me!
spring mist

jp: .死鐘と聞さへのらのかすみ哉
ro: shini kane to kiku sae nora no kasumi kana
en:
a death bell too
can be heard...
misty field

jp: .ちとの間にかすみ直すや山の家
ro: chito no ma ni kasumi naosu ya yama no ie
en:
in a flash
the mist is mended...
mountain home

jp: .古郷や下手念仏も春がすみ
ro: furusato ya heta nembutsu mo harugasumi
en:
my home village--
a poor "Praise Buddha!" too
in spring mist

jp: .湖を風呂にわかして夕がすみ
ro: mizuumi wo furo ni wakashite yûgasumi
en:
the lake steams
like a hot bath...
evening mist

jp: .陽炎や道灌どのの物見塚
ro: kagerô [ya] dôkan dono no monomi tsuka
en:
heat shimmers--
Lord Dokan's
lookout mound

jp: .けふの日や庵の小草も餅につく
ro: kyô no hi ya io no ko kusa mo mochi ni tsuku
en:
today
my hut's little herbs too
become cakes

jp: .妹が子やけふの汐干の小先達
ro: imo ga ko ya kyô no shiohi no ko sendatsu
en:
my child--
today's low tide
little guide

jp: .深川や五尺の庭も汐干狩
ro: fukagawa ya go shaku no niwa mo shiohi-gari
en:
Fukagawa--
even in a five-foot garden
low tide shell-gathering

jp: .なむあみだなむあみだとてこき茶哉
ro: namu amida namu amida to[te] koki cha kana
en:
"Praise Amida!
Praise Amida!"
threshing tea leaves

jp: .二番茶にこき交られしつつじ哉
ro: ni ban cha ni [ko]ki mazerareshi tsutsuji kana
en:
mixed in
with the second tea harvest
azaleas

jp: .田を打って弥々空の浅黄哉
ro: ta wo utte iyo-iyo sora no asagi kana
en:
plowing the rice field--
the sky a paler and paler
blue

jp: .畠打や手洟をねぢる梅の花
ro: hata uchi ya tebana wo nejiru ume no hana
en:
plowing the field
and wiping snot
on plum blossoms

jp: .真直に人のさしたるしきみかな
ro: massugu ni hito no sashitaru shikimi kana
en:
he grafts the branch
perfectly straight...
sacred shikimi

jp: .赤馬の鼻で吹きけり雀の子
ro: aka uma no hana de fuki keri suzume no ko
en:
blown by the red
horse's nose...
baby sparrow

jp: .大勢の子に疲たり雀哉
ro: ôzei no ko ni tsukaretari suzume kana
en:
children crowded 'round
wear her out...
mother sparrow

jp: .晴天に産声上る雀かな
ro: seiten ni ubugoe ageru suzume kana
en:
rising to the blue sky
baby sparrow's
first cry

jp: .夕暮とや雀のまま子松に鳴
ro: yûgure to ya suzume no mamako matsu ni naku
en:
evening falls--
a stepchild sparrow
cries in the pine

jp: .鶯の足をふく也梅の花
ro: uguisu no ashi wo fuku nari ume no hana
en:
the nightingale
wipes his feet...
on plum blossoms

jp: .鶯のけむい顔する垣根哉
ro: uguisu no kemui kao suru kakine kana
en:
the nightingale
makes a face in the smoke...
fence sitting

jp: .鶯の鳴ておりけりひとり釜
ro: uguisu n naite ori keri hitori kama
en:
a nightingale
is singing...
in the kettle

jp: .鶯の法ほけ経を信濃哉
ro: uguisu no hôhokekyô wo shinnô kana
en:
listening to the nightingale's
Lotus Sutra...
Shinano

jp: .鶯や仕へ奉る梅の花
ro: uguisu ya tsukae-matsuru ume no hana
en:
a nightingale--
and made to order
plum blossoms

jp: .おく山も今はうぐひすと鳴にけり
ro: oku yama mo ima wa uguisu to naki ni keri
en:
in deep mountains too
now the nightingale
sings!

jp: .かさい酒かさい鶯鳴にけり
ro: kasai sake kasai uguisu naki ni keri
en:
drinking country sake--
a country nightingale
singing

jp: .鍬のえに鶯鳴くや小梅村
ro: kuwa no e ni uguisu naku koume mura
en:
on the hoe's handle
a nightingale sings...
Little-Plum village

jp: .信濃なる鶯も法ほけ経哉
ro: shinano naru uguisu mo hohokekyô kana
en:
even the nightingale
of Shinano sings it...
Lotus Sutra

jp: .三日月やふはりと梅にうぐひすが
ro: mikazuki ya fuwari to ume ni uguisu ga
en:
sickle moon--
through plum blossoms softly
the nightingale

jp: .有明や鶯が鳴く綸が鳴る
ro: ariake ya uguisu ga naku rin ga naru
en:
daybreak--
a nightingale sings
a bell rings

jp: .小社や尾を引っかけて夕雉
ro: ko yashiro ya o wo hikkakete yû kigisu
en:
at a little shrine
dragging his tail...
evening pheasant

jp: .祠から頭出して鳴きぎす哉
ro: hokora kara kao dashite naku kigisu kana
en:
poking his head
out the little shrine
crying pheasant

jp: .三月や三十日になりて帰る雁
ro: sangetsu ya misoka ni narite kae[ru] kari
en:
Third Month--
come the 30th day
the geese depart

jp: .ﾀふや歩きながらになく蛙
ro: asajiu ya aruki nagara ni naku kawazu
en:
in cogan grass
croaking while walking...
a frog

jp: .象潟や桜を浴てなく蛙
ro: kisagata ya sakura wo abite naku kawazu
en:
Kisa Lagoon--
bathing in cherry blossoms
croaking frog

jp: .我庵や蛙初手から老を鳴く
ro: waga io ya kawazu shote kara oi wo naku
en:
frogs at my hut
from the beginning have sung
"We grow old!"

jp: .蝶とぶやしなののおくの草履道
ro: chô tobu ya shinano no oku no zôri michi
en:
butterflies flit--
deep in Shinano
tracks of sandals

jp: .むつまじや生れかはらばのべの蝶
ro: mutsumaji ya umare kawaraba nobe no chô
en:
such sweet harmony
to be reborn
a meadow butterfly!

jp: .世の中や蝶のくらしもいそがしき
ro: yo no naka ya chô no kurashi mo isogashiki
en:
this world--
the butterfly also toils
busily

jp: .うつるとも花見虱ぞよしの山
ro: utsuru tomo hanami-jirami zo yoshino yama
en:
though infested with lice
blossom viewing...
Yoshino Hill

jp: .上人の西の藤波そよぐ也
ro: shônin no nishi no fujinami soyogu nari
en:
the holy man's
westward waves of wisteria
rustling

jp: .上人の西の藤波今やさく
ro: shônin no nishi no fujinami ima ya saku
en:
the holy man's
westward waves of wisteria
fresh-bloomed

jp: .鳶のいる餅屋が藤は咲にけり
ro: tobi no iru mochiya ga fuji wa saki ni keri
en:
black kite--
the rice cake dealer's wisteria
in bloom

jp: .藤さくやすでに三十日の両大師
ro: fuji saku ya sude ni misoka no ryôdaishi
en:
wisteria in bloom
on the 30th day...
Ryodaishi Temple

jp: .鶯の親子仕へる梅の花
ro: uguisu no oyako tsukaeru ume [no] hana
en:
for the nightingale
parents and children...
plum blossoms!

jp: .梅咲くや一日ごろのつくば山
ro: ume saku ya tsuitachi goro no tsukuba yama
en:
plum blossoms--
a new year begins
on Moutn Tsukuba

jp: .大空のはづれは梅の在所哉
ro: ôsora no hazure wa ume no zaisho kana
en:
at the edge
of the big sky...
plum blossom farmhouse

jp: .かま獅子や大口明て梅の花
ro: kamashishi ya ôkuchi akete ume no hana
en:
the antelope's
mouth opens wide...
plum blossoms

jp: .黒土も団子になるぞ梅の花
ro: kuro tsuchi mo dango ni naru zo ume no hana
en:
making dumplings
from black mud...
plum blossoms

jp: .黒土や草履のうらも梅の花
ro: kuro tsuchi ya zôri no ura mo ume [no] hana
en:
black mud--
stuck to my straw sandals, too
plum blossoms

jp: .米搗や臼に腰かけて梅の花
ro: kome tsuki ya usu ni koshikakete ume no hana
en:
the rice husker sits
on his rice cake tub...
plum blossoms

jp: .三尺も麓とあれば梅の花
ro: san shaku mo fumoto to areba ume no hana
en:
for every three feet
of mountain's foot...
plum blossoms!

jp: .三方の銭五六文梅の花
ro: sanbô no zeni go roku mon ume no hana
en:
on the offering stand
five or six pennies...
plum blossoms

jp: .ちりめんの猿狙が三疋梅の花
ro: chirimen no saru ga sanbiki ume no hana
en:
cloth monkeys
three in all...
plum blossoms

jp: .古郷や犬の番する梅の花
ro: furusato ya inu no ban suru ume no hana
en:
my home village--
a dog stands guard
over plum blossoms

jp: .物売を梅からよぶや下屋敷
ro: monouri wo ume kara yobu ya shimoyashiki
en:
from plum blossoms
he calls to the peddlar...
country villa

jp: .梅咲て打切棒の小家哉
ro: ume saite bukkirabô no ko ie kana
en:
plum tree blooming--
a plain and to-the-point
little house

jp: .貝殻で家根ふく茶屋や梅の花
ro: kaigara de yane fuku chaya ya ume no hana
en:
the teahouse
is roofed with shells...
plum blossoms

jp: .さく花にけぶりの嗅いｔばこ哉
ro: saku hana ni keburi no nioi tabako kana
en:
amid cherry blossoms
the smell of smoke...
pipes

jp: .如意輪は御花の陰の寝言哉
ro: nyoirin wa o-hana no kage no negoto kana
en:
Saint Nyoirin
in cherry blossom shade
sleep talking

jp: .花咲て祖師のゆるしの肴哉
ro: hana saite soshi no yurushi no sakana kana
en:
cherry blossoms--
with the Founder's blessing
eating fish

jp: .花さくや桜所の俗坊主
ro: hana saku ya sakura tokoro no zoku bôzu
en:
spring blossoms--
in the cherry grove
a worldly priest

jp: .花の木にさっと隠るる倅哉
ro: hana no ki ni satto kakururu segare kana
en:
in blossoming trees
suddenly he's hidden...
my son

jp: .花の日も精進ものや山の犬
ro: hana no hi mo shôjin mono ya yama no inu
en:
on cherry blossom day
fasting too...
wild dog

jp: .売ものの札を張られし桜哉
ro: urimono no fuda wo harareshi sakura kana
en:
someone has slapped on
a price tag...
cherry tree

jp: .大桜さらに買人はなかりけり
ro: ôsakura sara ni kaite wa nakari keri
en:
the big cherry blossoms--
no buyers
at all

jp: .からからと下駄をならして桜哉
ro: kara-kara to geta wo narashite sakura kana
en:
click-clack
go the wooden clogs...
cherry blossoms!

jp: .桜見て歩く間も小言哉
ro: sakura mite aruku aida mo kogoto kana
en:
even while walking
through cherry blossoms...
nagging!

jp: .下々に生れて夜もさくら哉
ro: shimojimo ni umarete yoru mo sakura kana
en:
born poor
viewing them even at night...
cherry-blossoms

jp: .誰も居ぬうしろ座敷の桜哉
ro: dare mo inu ushiro sashiki no sakura kana
en:
a rear sitting room
no one enters...
cherry blossoms

jp: .花守や夜は汝が山桜
ro: hana mori ya yoru wa nanji ga yama-zakura
en:
flower guard
at night they're yours...
mountain cherry blossoms

jp: .懐の子が喰たがる桜哉
ro: futokoro no ko ga kuitagaru sakura kana
en:
the baby at her breast
wants to eat...
cherry blossoms

jp: .家根をはく人の立けり夕桜
ro: yane wo haku hito no tachi keri yûzakura
en:
the roof sweeper
stands still...
evening cherry blossoms

jp: .山桜咲や附たり仏の事
ro: yama-zakura saku ya tsuketari butsu no koto
en:
soon as the mountain
cherry trees bloom...
Buddhist whatnots are attached

jp: .山ざくらそなたの空も三十日哉
ro: yama-zakura sonata no sora mo misoka kana
en:
mountain cherry blossoms--
for you too
an end-of-month sky

jp: .山桜それが上にも三十日有
ro: yama-zakura sore ga ue ni mo misoka ari
en:
mountain cherry blossoms--
over you too
an end-of-month sky

jp: .夕桜蟻も寝所は持にけり
ro: yûzakura ari mo nedoko wa mochi ni keri
en:
evening cherry blossoms--
the ants also
have a place to sleep

jp: .つき合はむりにうかるる桜哉
ro: tsukiai wa muri ni ukaruru sakura kana
en:
the whole gang
forced to merriment...
cherry blossoms

jp: .麦などもほちゃほちゃ肥て桃の花
ro: mugi nado mo hocha-hocha koete momo no hana
en:
barley and all
fattening nicely...
peach blossoms

jp: .山吹をさし出し顔の垣ね哉
ro: yamabuki wo sashidashi kao no kakine kana
en:
a yellow rose
offered as a gift...
by the fence

jp: .雁鴨のづうづうしさよ門柳
ro: kari kamo no zûzûshisa yo kado yanagi
en:
the geese and ducks
are brazen...
willow at the gate

jp: .けろりくわんとして雁と柳哉
ro: kerorikan to shite kari to yanagi kana
en:
keeping their cool--
the wild goose
the willow

jp: .下総へ一すじかかる柳かな
ro: shimôsa e hito suji kakaru yanagi kana
en:
one strand dangles
toward Shimosa...
willow tree

jp: .柳さし柳さしては念仏哉
ro: yanagi sashi yanagi sashite wa nebutsu kana
en:
with each willow tree
he plants
"Praise Buddha!"

jp: .楽々と家鴨の留主の柳哉
ro: raku-raku to ahiru no rusu no yanagi kana
en:
the ducks have gone--
peace and quiet
of the willow

jp: .夜のつまる峠も下り月夜哉
ro: yo no tsumaru tôge mo sagari tsuki yo kana
en:
on a short summer night
setting on the mountain pass...
moon

jp: .涼風も仏任せの此身かな
ro: suzukaze mo hotoke makase no kono mi kana
en:
cool breeze
you, too, surrender to Buddha
this life!

jp: .涼風や鼠のしらぬ小隅迄
ro: suzukaze ya nezumi no shiranu kosumi made
en:
cool breeze--
reaching even nooks
the mouse doesn't know!

jp: .涼しさに一本草もたのみ哉
ro: suzushisa ni ippon kusa mo tanomi kana
en:
on the cool air
one blade of grass also
relies

jp: .涼しさにぶらぶら地獄巡り哉
ro: suzushisa ni bura-bura jigoku meguri kana
en:
in summer cool
ambling down my road
to hell

jp: .涼しさや門も夜さりは仏在世
ro: suzushisa ya kado no yosari wa butsu zaise
en:
cool evening--
at my gate the age
of Buddha

jp: .涼しさや松見ておはす神の蛇
ro: suzushisa ya matsu mite owasu kami no hebi
en:
cool air--
admiring the pine
the shrine's snake

jp: .涼しさは雲の作りし仏哉
ro: suzushisa wa kumo no tsukurishi hotoke kana
en:
cool air--
the shape of the cloud
is Buddha

jp: .蝉の世も我世も涼し今少し
ro: semi no yo mo waga yo mo suzushi ima sukoshi
en:
the cicadas' world
and my world of cool air...
coming soon

jp: .夕立に打任せたりせどの不二
ro: yûdachi ni uchi makasetari sedo no fuji
en:
trusting the cloudburst
to water it...
back door Fuji

jp: .夕立やすすき刈萱女郎花
ro: yûdachi ya susuki karigaya ominaeshi
en:
rainstorm--
pampas grass, rushes,
maiden flowers

jp: .夕立や辻の乞食が鉢の松
ro: yûdachi ya tsuji no kojiki ga hachi no matsu
en:
rainstorm--
a crossroads beggar
with a potted pine

jp: .心から鬼とも見ゆる雲の峰
ro: kokoro kara oni to mo miyuru kumo no mine
en:
I swear
I see a demon...
billowing clouds

jp: .ちさいのは門にほしさよ雲の峰
ro: chisai no wa kado ni hoshisa yo kumo no mine
en:
I'd like that little one
for my gate...
billowing clouds

jp: .ちさいのは皆正面ぞ雲の峰
ro: chiisai no wa mina shômen zo kumo no mine
en:
the little ones
are all to the front...
billowing clouds

jp: .よい風や中でちひさい雲の峰
ro: yoi kaze ya naka de chiisai kumo no mine
en:
a good wind!
in it, a tiny
mountain of cloud

jp: .柴門や天道任せの田の青む
ro: shiba no to ya tentô makase no ta no aomu
en:
my humble hut--
trusting in the sun
rice field greening

jp: .御仏やえぞが島へも御誕生
ro: mi-botoke ya ezo ga shima e mo o-tanjô
en:
Buddha--
all the way to Hokkaido
your birthday party!

jp: .乙鳥まちを祈るや川社
ro: tsubakurame machi wo inoru ya kawa yashiro
en:
the swallows too
pray for the town...
river shrine

jp: .菖草巣に引たがる雀哉
ro: ayame-gusa su ni hiki-tagaru suzume kana
en:
trying to yank
the thatch of irises for its nest...
sparrow

jp: .わか様がせうぶをしゃぶる湯どの哉
ro: wakasama ga shôbu wo shaburu yudono kana
en:
the young folk
lick the iris leaves...
bath time

jp: .今ぞりの児や帷うつくしき
ro: ima-zori no chigo ya katabira utsukushiki
en:
the toddler's head fresh-shaved
his summer kimono
pretty

jp: .雨笠も日笠もあなた任せ哉
ro: ama-gasa mo higasa mo anata makase kana
en:
umbrella-hats
sun hats...
trust in Buddha!

jp: .八九間柳を去て日傘哉
ro: hachi ku ken yanagi wo sarite higasa kana
en:
fifty, sixty feet away--
the willow
the parasols

jp: .かつしかや猫の逃込むかやのうち
ro: katsushika ya neko [no] nigekomu kaya no uchi
en:
Katsushika--
the cat seeks shelter
in the mosquito net

jp: .白扇どこで貰ふたと人のいふ
ro: shiro ôgi doko de morauta to hito no iu
en:
a white fan--
"Who gave it to you?"
they ask

jp: .門涼爺が乙鳥の行儀也
ro: kado suzumi jiji ga tsubame no gyôgi nari
en:
cooling at the gate--
the old man's swallows
behaving

jp: .月様もそしられ給ふ夕涼
ro: tsuki sama mo soshirare tamau yûsuzumi
en:
even Mr. Moon
is slandered!
evening cool

jp: .月さへもそしられ給ふ夕涼
ro: tsuki sae mo soshirare tamau yûsuzumi
en:
even the moon
is slandered...
evening cool

jp: .植る田やけふもはらはら帰る雁
ro: ueru ta ya kyô mo hara-hara kaeru kari
en:
rice planting--
today too, traveling geese
flutter down

jp: .浅草や上野泊りのほととぎす
ro: asakusa ya ueno-domari no hototogisu
en:
Asakusa--
the cuckoo stays close by
in Ueno

jp: .あさくらや名乗て通る時鳥
ro: asakura ya nanorite tôru hototogisu
en:
Asakura--
introducing himself in passing
a cuckoo

jp: .いざ名乗れ松の御前ぞ時鳥
ro: iza na nore matsu no gozen zo hototogisu
en:
announce yourself
to Lord Pine...
cuckoo!

jp: .えた村や山時鳥ほととぎす
ro: eta mura ya yama hototogisu hototogisu
en:
outcast village--
instead of a cuckoo
a mountain cuckoo

jp: .こんな夜は唐にもあろか時鳥
ro: konna yo wa kara ni mo aro ka hototogisu
en:
is the night this nice
in China?
cuckoo

jp: .時鳥汝も京は嫌ひしな
ro: hototogisu nanji mo kyô wa kirai shina
en:
oh cuckoo
you also hate Kyoto
don't you?

jp: .時鳥橋の乞食も聞れけり
ro: hototogisu hashi no kojiki mo kikare keri
en:
a cuckoo--
the bridge beggar
listens too

jp: .鶯も愚に返るかよだまってる
ro: uguisu mo gu ni kaeru ka yo damatteru
en:
are you a fool, too
nightingale?
singing no more

jp: .熊坂が長刀にちる蛍哉
ro: kumasaka ga naginata ni chiru hotaru kana
en:
scattered by
Kumasaka's halberd...
fireflies

jp: .子ありてや橋の乞食もよぶ蛍
ro: ko arite ya hashi no kojiki mo yobu hotaru
en:
they have kids--
the bridge beggars
calling fireflies

jp: .さし柳蛍とぶ夜と成にけり
ro: sashi yanagi hotaru tobu yo to nari ni keri
en:
a night of fireflies
has arrived...
my spring-planted willow

jp: .念仏の口からよばる蛍哉
ro: nembutsu no kuchi kara yobaru hotaru kana
en:
the mouth that
praised Amida Buddha
calling fireflies

jp: .茨藪になることなかれとぶ蛍
ro: bara yabu ni naru koto nakare tobu hotaru
en:
don't turn into
a thorn bush!
flitting firefly

jp: .庵の蚊にあはれことしも喰れけり
ro: io no ka ni aware kotoshi mo kuware keri
en:
hut's mosquitoes
this damned year, too
feasting

jp: .夕空や蚊が鳴出してうつくしき
ro: yûzora ya ka ga nakidashite utsukushiki
en:
evening sky--
the whine of mosquitoes
pretty

jp: .盃に蚤およぐぞよおよぐぞよ
ro: sakazuki ni nomi oyogu [zo]yo oyogu [zo]yo
en:
in a sake cup
a flea
swimming! swimming!

jp: .山里やおがんで借りし蚤莚
ro: yama-zato ya ogande karishi nomi mushiro
en:
mountain village--
begging I borrow
a flea-infested mat

jp: .けふ切の声を上けり夏の蝉
ro: kyô-giri no koe wo age keri natsu no semi
en:
raising their chirr
on their last day...
summer cicadas

jp: .蝉なくや鷺のつっ立寺座敷
ro: semi naku ya sagi no tsuttatsu tera zashiki
en:
cicadas chirr
herons stand at attention...
temple sitting room

jp: .露の世の露を鳴也夏の蝉
ro: tsuyu no yo no tsuyu wo naku nari natsu no semi
en:
in a dewdrop world
singing of dewdrops...
summer cicada

jp: .住吉のすみの小隅もせうぶ哉
ro: sumiyoshi no sumi no [ko] sumi mo shôbu kana
en:
in a Sumiyoshi nook
here too
blooming irises

jp: .番町や谷底見れば瓜の花
ro: banchô ya tani soko mireba uri no hana
en:
Bancho Town--
deep in the valley
melon blossoms

jp: .夕陰や鳩の見ている冷し瓜
ro: yûkage ya hato no mite iru hiyashi uri
en:
evening shadows--
a pigeon watches
the melon cool

jp: .卯の花の垣根に吹雪はらはらと
ro: u no hana no kakine ni fubuki hara-hara to
en:
a blizzard
of deutzia blossoms
on the fence

jp: .うしろから大寒小寒夜寒哉
ro: ushiro kara ôsamu kosamu yozamu kana
en:
behind me--
big cold, little cold
night cold

jp: .さぼてんのさめはだ見れば夜寒哉
ro: saboten no same hada mireba yozamu kana
en:
just looking at the shark skin
of a cactus...
the night turns cold

jp: .まじまじと梁上君の夜寒哉
ro: maji-maji to ryôjôkun no yozamu kana
en:
brazenly
the mouse sneaks in...
a cold night

jp: .象潟や田中の島も秋の暮
ro: kisagata ya tanaka no shima mo aki no kure
en:
Kisa Lagoon--
on an island in a rice field, too
autumn dusk

jp: .島々や思々の秋の暮
ro: shima-jima ya omoi-omoi no aki no kure
en:
every little island
in its own way...
autumn dusk

jp: .なかなかに人と生れて秋の暮
ro: naka-naka ni hito to umarete aki no kure
en:
quite remarkable
being born human...
autumn dusk

jp: .松島や一こぶしづつ秋の暮
ro: matsushima ya hito kobushi-zutsu aki no kure
en:
little pine islands
fist after fist...
autumn dusk

jp: .吉原やさはさりながら秋の暮
ro: yoshiwara ya saa sari nagara aki no kure
en:
this is Yoshiwara
and yet...
autumn dusk

jp: .秋の夜や窓の小穴が笛を吹
ro: aki no yo ya mado no ko ana ga fue wo fuku
en:
autumn evening--
wind in the window's little hole
plays flute

jp: .秋の夜やしょうじの穴が笛を吹
ro: aki no yo ya shôji no ana ga fue wo fuku
en:
autumn evening--
the hole in the paper door
blows flute

jp: .おもしろき夜永の門の四隅哉
ro: omoshiroki yonaga no kado no yosumi kana
en:
delightful, the view
from the gate in the long night...
all four directions

jp: .秋行や沢庵番のうしろから
ro: aki yuku ya takuan ban no ushiro kara
en:
autumn departs
trailing the pickled radish
vendor

jp: .赤い月是は誰のじゃ子ども達
ro: akai tsuki kore wa tare no ja kodomodachi
en:
which of you owns
that red moon
children?

jp: .婆々どのが酒呑に行く月よ哉
ro: baba dono ga sake nomi ni yuku tsuki yo kana
en:
granny walks along
drinking sake...
a moonlit night

jp: .名月や門から直にしなの山
ro: meigetsu [ya] kado kara sugu ni shinano yama
en:
harvest moon--
from my gate then up
Shinano Mountain

jp: .名月や暮ぬ先から角田川
ro: meigetsu ya kurenu saki kara sumida-gawa
en:
just a tip remains
of the harvest moon...
Sumida River

jp: .名月や高観音の御ひざ元
ro: meigetsu ya taka kannon no o-hizamoto
en:
harvest moon--
at the divine knees
of Kannon

jp: .名月や薮蚊だらけの角田川
ro: meigetsu ya yabu ka darake no sumida-gawa
en:
harvest moon--
Sumida River thick
with mosquitoes

jp: .牛の子が旅に立也秋の雨
ro: ushi no ko ga tabi ni tatsu nari aki no ame
en:
the calf begins
his journey...
autumn rain

jp: .秋風や壁のへまむしよ入道
ro: aki kaze ya kabe no hemamushi yo nyûdô
en:
autumn wind--
graffiti on a wall
the monk Hemamushiyo

jp: .秋風や皮を剥れしかんばの木
ro: aki kaze ya kawa wo hagareshi kanba no ki
en:
autumn wind--
stripping the birch tree's
bark

jp: .秋風や松苗うへて人の顔
ro: aki kaze ya matsu nae uete hito no kao
en:
autumn wind--
the face of the man
planting pines

jp: .牛の子の旅に立つ也秋の風
ro: ushi no ko no tabi ni tatsu nari aki no kaze
en:
the calf begins
his journey...
autumn wind

jp: .さぼてんの鮫はだみれば秋の風
ro: saboten no same hada mireba aki no kaze
en:
just looking at the shark skin
of a cactus...
autumn wind

jp: .月ちらちら野分の月の暑哉
ro: tsuki chira-chira nowaki no tsuki no atsusa kana
en:
dazzling moon
over the autumn gale...
nice and hot

jp: .生あつい月がちらちら野分哉
ro: nama atsui tsuki ga chira-chira nowaki kana
en:
the toasty warm moon
dazzling bright
over the autumn gale

jp: .蚤の跡二人吹るる野分哉
ro: nomi no ato futari fukaruru nowaki kana
en:
blowing two people
after their fleas...
autumn gale

jp: .門の露雀がなめて仕舞けり
ro: kado no tsuyu suzume ga namete shimai keri
en:
dew at the gate--
the sparrow licks it
clean

jp: .杭の鷺いかにも露を見るやうに
ro: kui no sagi ikanimo tsuyu wo miru yô ni
en:
heron on a post
gazing down, it seems
at dewdrops

jp: .白露にざぶとふみ込む烏哉
ro: shira tsuyu ni zabu to fumi-komu karasu kana
en:
into the silver dew
splashing struts
the crow

jp: .柴の戸や手足洗ふも草の露
ro: shiba no to [ya] teashi arau mo kusa no tsuyu
en:
my humble hut--
washing arms and legs
in dewy grass

jp: .うす霧の引からまりし垣ね哉
ro: usu-giri no hikikaramarishi kakine kana
en:
the thin mist
in a tangle...
hedgerow

jp: .送り火やばたりと消てなつかしき
ro: okuribi ya batari to keshite natsukashiki
en:
bonfires for the dead
sputter and die...
a flood of memories

jp: .木の股の人は罪なし辻角力
ro: ki no mata no hito wa tsuminashi tsuji sumô
en:
the man in the tree
can't be blamed...
outdoor sumo match

jp: .梟はやはり眠るぞ大角力
ro: fukurô wa yahari nemuru zo ôsumô
en:
the owl sleeps
nevertheless...
sumo wrestling

jp: .夕暮をそら合点のかがし哉
ro: yûgure wo sora gatten no kagashi kana
en:
not grasping
the autumn evening...
the scarecrow

jp: .梟が高みで笑ふ砧かな
ro: fukurô ga takami de warau kinuta kana
en:
the owl high above
laughs to the beat...
pounding cloth

jp: .さをしかや角に又候蝉の鳴
ro: saoshika ya tsuno ni matazoro semi no naku
en:
young buck--
on his antler again
the cicada sings

jp: .我庵も二の足ふむや迷ひ鹿
ro: waga io mo ni no ashi fumu ya mayoi shika
en:
hesitating
at my hut
the stray deer

jp: .小庇やけむいけむいとなく鶉
ro: ko-bisashi ya kemui-kemui to naku uzura
en:
little eaves--
"It's smoky! smoky!"
sings the quail

jp: .門の雁いくら鳴ても米はなき
ro: kado no kari ikura naite mo kome wa naki
en:
geese at my gate
cry all you like...
no rice

jp: .雁の首長くして見る門口哉
ro: kari no kubi nagaku shite miru kado-guchi kana
en:
stretching her neck
the goose peeks in
my gate

jp: .田の雁や里の人数はけふもへる
ro: ta no kari ya sato no ninzu wa kyô moeru
en:
rice field geese--
the village's population
surges

jp: .はつ雁が人にはこして通りけり
ro: hatsu kari ga hito ni hako shite tôri keri
en:
autumn's first geese
crapping on people
fly on

jp: .はつ雁やあてにして来る庵の畠
ro: hatsu kari ya ate ni shite kuru io no hata
en:
autumn's first geese
hitting the mark...
field by my hut

jp: .はつ雁やすすきはまねく人は追ふ
ro: hatsu kari ya susuki wa maneku hito wa ou
en:
autumn's first geese--
pampas grass beckons
people chase

jp: .髭どのがおじゃるぞだまれ小田の雁
ro: hige dono ga ojaru zo damare oda [no] kari
en:
Mr. Long-Beard's coming
hush up!
rice field geese

jp: .二親にどこで別れし小田の雁
ro: futa oya ni doko de wakareshi oda no kari
en:
where did you
leave your parents?
rice field goose

jp: .こおろぎがうごかして行柱哉
ro: kôrogi ga ugokashite yuku hashira kana
en:
the cricket moves
to a new post...
on the post

jp: .象がたを鳴なくしけりきりぎりす
ro: kisagata wo naku-nakushi keri kirigirisu
en:
crying and crying
at Kisa Lagoon...
the katydid

jp: .きりぎりすふと鳴出しぬ鹿の角
ro: kirigirisu futo nakidashinu shika no tsuno
en:
the katydid
breaks out into song...
on the deer's antler

jp: .なつかしや籠かみ破るきりぎりす
ro: natsukashi ya kago kami yaburu kirigirisu
en:
like one long ago--
the katydid rips
its paper cage

jp: .石仏誰が持たせし草の花
ro: ishi-botoke tare ga motaseshi kusa no hana
en:
stone Buddha--
who gave you wildflowers
to hold?

jp: .かつしかやなむ廿日月草の花
ro: katsushika ya namu hatsuka-zuki kusa no hana
en:
Katsushika--
praise the twentieth-day moon
wildflowers!

jp: .かつしかやかやの中から菊の花
ro: katsushika ya kaya no naka kara kiku no hana
en:
Katsushika--
growing in a mosquito net
a chrysanthemum

jp: .菊さくや我に等しき似せ隠者
ro: kiku saku ya ware ni hitoshiki nise inja
en:
a chrysanthemum blooms--
just like me
a would-be hermit

jp: .とんぼうのはこしているや菊の花
ro: tombô no hako shite iru ya kiku no hana
en:
the dragonfly
takes a crap...
chrysanthemum

jp: .我庵は朝顔の花の長者哉
ro: waga io wa asagao no hana no chôja kana
en:
my hut
with its morning-glories
a palace

jp: .一日もみそかもないか女郎花
ro: tsuitachi mo misoka mo nai ka ominaeshi
en:
on the month's first day
last day, no vacation?
maiden flowers

jp: .墓原や一人くねりの女郎花
ro: hakawara ya hitori kuneri no ominaeshi
en:
graveyard--
all alone a maiden flower
twisting

jp: .さほしかの黙礼したり萩の花
ro: saoshika no mokurei shitari hagi no hana
en:
the young buck
silently bows...
blooming bush clover

jp: .のら猫も宿と定る萩の花
ro: nora neko mo yado to sadamuru hagi no hana
en:
the stray cat also
picks this inn...
bush clover blooming

jp: .山里や昔かたぎの猫と萩
ro: yama-zato ya mukashi katagi no neko to hagi
en:
mountain village--
an old-style cat
and bush clover

jp: .青稲や薙倒されて花の咲
ro: ao ine ya nagitaosarete hana no saku
en:
green rice field--
razed to the ground
still blooming

jp: .豊年を招き出したるすすき哉
ro: hônen wo maneki dashitaru susuki kana
en:
waving in
