a fruitful year...
pampas grass

jp: .紅葉たく人をじろじろ仏哉
ro: momiji taku hito wo jiro-jiro hotoke kana
en:
staring at the man
burning leaves...
stone Buddha

jp: .咲仕廻忘れて居るか花木槿
ro: saki shimai wasurete iru ka hana mukuge
en:
have you forgotten
blooming season's over?
roses of Sharon

jp: .生残り生残りたる寒さ哉
ro: ikinokori ikinokoritaru samu[sa] kana
en:
surviving
and surviving...
how cold it is!

jp: .合点して居ても寒いぞ貧しいぞ
ro: gaten shite ite mo samui zo mazushi zo
en:
all according to plan, yet
I'm cold!
poor!

jp: .闇がりの畳の上も氷哉
ro: kuragari no tatami no ue mo kôri kana
en:
in darkness
even on the tatami mat...
ice

jp: .子ども達江戸の氷は甘いげな
ro: kodomo tachi edo no kôri wa amaigena
en:
children--
Edo's ice tastes sweet
I bet!

jp: .草の戸やどちの穴から春が来る
ro: kusa no to ya dochi no ana kara haru ga kuru
en:
my hut--
from which hole
will spring come?

jp: .雁鴨よなけなけとしが留るなら
ro: kari kamo yo nake-nake toshi ga tomaru nara
en:
geese and ducks
sing! sing!
stop the year from ending

jp: .寒月や喰つきさうな鬼瓦
ro: kangetsu ya kui tsuki sôna onigawara
en:
like he's biting
the cold moon...
gargoyle

jp: .青柴や秤にかかるはつ時雨
ro: ao shiba ya hakari ni kakaru hatsu shigure
en:
green brushwood
weighed in the scales...
first winter rain

jp: .此時雨なぜおそいとや鳴烏
ro: kono shigure naze osoi to ya naku karasu
en:
"Why's this winter
rain so late?"
the crow caws

jp: .時雨して名札吹るる俵哉
ro: shigure shite nafuda fukaruru tawara kana
en:
its name tag blowing
in the winter rain...
bag of rice

jp: .木がらしにしくしく腹のぐあい哉
ro: kogarashi ni shiku-shiku hara no guai kana
en:
in winter wind
a churning, churning
in my belly

jp: .木がらしや是は仏の二日月
ro: kogarashi ya kore wa hotoke no futsuka tsuki
en:
winter wind--
and there's the Buddha's
two-day moon

jp: .はつ雪ぐわらぐわらさはぐ腹の虫
ro: hatsu yuki ya guwara-guwara sawagu hara no mushi
en:
first snowfall--
the worms in my gut
raise a ruckus

jp: .初雪や雪隠の供の小でうちん
ro: hatsu yuki ya setchin no tomo no kojôchin
en:
first snow--
the outhouse attendant's
little lantern

jp: .おく霜や白きを見れば鼻の穴
ro: oku shimo ya shiroki wo mireba hana no ana
en:
frost has formed--
I see whiteness
in my nostrils!

jp: .塚の霜雁も参て啼にけり
ro: tsuka no shimo kari mo mairite naki ni keri
en:
frost on the graves--
the pilgrim geese above
honking

jp: .掛取が土足ふみ込むいろり哉
ro: kaketori ga dosoku fumi-komu irori kana
en:
the bill collector
with shoes on steps inside
to the hearth

jp: .煎豆の福がきたぞよ懐へ
ro: iri mame no fuku ga kita zo yo futokoro e
en:
stowing the good luck
of roasted beans...
in my heart

jp: .としとるや竹に雀がぬくぬくと
ro: toshitoru ya take ni suzume ga nuku-nuku to
en:
a year older
sparrows in the bamboo...
warm-hearted

jp: .ほたの火や白髪のつやをほめらるる
ro: hota [no] hi ya shiraga no tsuya wo homeraruru
en:
wood fire--
my white hair's luster
gets a compliment

jp: .埋火の芋をながむる烏哉
ro: uzumibi no imo wo nagamuru karasu kana
en:
eyeing the potato
on the banked fire...
crow

jp: .むさしのに誰々たべぬ鰒汁
ro: musashi no ni tare-tare tabenu fukuto-jiru
en:
on Musashi Plain
who are they?
eating pufferfish soup

jp: .浅ましの尿瓶とやなくむら千鳥
ro: asamashi no shibin to ya mura chidori
en:
"Shameful, that piss-pot!"
the flock of plovers
sing

jp: .芦火たく盥の中もちどり哉
ro: ashibi taku tarai no naka mo chidori kana
en:
even in the tub
where reeds are burning...
a plover!

jp: .庵崎の犬と仲よいちどり哉
ro: iosaki no inu to nakayoi chidori kana
en:
on friendly terms
with the dog of Iosaki...
a plover

jp: .御地蔵のひざよ袂よ鳴千鳥
ro: o-jizô no hiza yo tamoto yo naku chidori
en:
on holy Jizo's lap!
in his sleeves!
plovers singing

jp: .千鳥鳴九月三十日と諷ひけり
ro: chidori naku kugatsu misoka to utai keri
en:
plovers singing--
"It's the last day
of Ninth Month!"

jp: .鳴千鳥俵かぶって通りけり
ro: naku chidori tawara kabutte tôri keri
en:
a plover sings--
with a rice bag on his head
he passes

jp: .冬の蝿逃せば猫にとられけり
ro: fuyu no hae nigaseba neko ni torare keri
en:
the winter fly
I spare, the cat
snatches

jp: .衆生ありさて鰒あり月は出給ふ
ro: shujô ari sate fugu ari tsuki wa ide tamau
en:
on people
and on pufferfish
the same moon shines

jp: .橋下の乞食が投る鰒哉
ro: hashi shita no kojiki ga nageru fukuto kana
en:
beggars under a bridge
give it a toss...
pufferfish

jp: .むさしのへまかり出たる鰒哉
ro: musashi no e makari-idetaru fukuto kana
en:
presenting itself
to Musashi Plain...
the pufferfish

jp: .わら巻やそれとも見ゆる鰒の顔
ro: warazura ya soretomo miyuru fugu no kao
en:
wrap it in straw
or it'll show...
face of the pufferfish

jp: .わら巻やもちろん鰒と梅の花
ro: warazura ya mochiron fugu to ume [no] hana
en:
wrapped in straw--
of course! a pufferfish
and plum blossoms

jp: .冬木立むかしむかしの音す也
ro: fuyu kodachi mukashi mukashi no oto su nari
en:
winter trees--
an old sound
from olden times

jp: .逃足の人にかまふな散紅葉
ro: nige ashi no hito ni kamau na chiru momiji
en:
let the fleeing people
alone!
red leaves falling

jp: .けふ迄はちらぬつもりか帰り花
ro: kyô made wa shiranu tsumori ka kaeri-bana
en:
up to today
still no decision to scatter?
out-of-season blooms

jp: .月花や四十九のむだ歩き
ro: tsuki hana ya shi jûku nen no muda aruki
en:
moon! blossoms!
forty-nine years walking around
a waste

jp: .花の月のとちんぷんかんのうき世哉
ro: hana no tsuki no to chinpunkan no ukiyo kana
en:
"moon" and "blossoms"
empty babble
of a floating world

jp: .口べたの東烏もけさの春
ro: kuchibeta no higashi-garasu mo kesa no haru
en:
even for the tongue-tied
crow of the east...
spring's first dawn

jp: .みどり子や御箸いただくけさの春
ro: midori ko ya o-hashi itadaku kesa no haru
en:
the baby given chopsticks
digs in...
spring's first morning

jp: .おのれやれ今や五十の花の春
ro: onore yare ima ya go jû no hana no haru
en:
well, well...
now I've seen fifty
blossoming springs

jp: .五十年あるも不思議ぞ花の春
ro: go jû nen aru mo fushigi zo hana no haru
en:
amazing to reach
my fiftieth year...
blossoming spring

jp: .春立や菰もかぶらず五十年
ro: haru tatsu ya komo mo kaburazu go jû nen
en:
spring begins--
no reed mat over my head
fifty years now

jp: .春立や先人間の五十年
ro: haru tatsu ya mazu ningen no go jû nen
en:
spring begins--
at least I'm human
fifty years now

jp: .春立やみろく十年辰の年
ro: haru tatsu ya miroku jû nen tatsu no toshi
en:
spring begins--
the Future Buddha in ten more
Years of the Dragon

jp: .うつくしき春に成しけり夜の雨
ro: utsukushiki haru ni nashi keri yoru no ame
en:
creating a pretty
spring...
the evening rain

jp: .同じ世をへらへら百疋小ばん哉
ro: onaji yo wo hera-hera mukade koban kana
en:
to the same world
one after another...
temple coin souvenirs

jp: .小一尺それも門松にて候
ro: ko isshaku sore mo kadomatsu nite sôrô
en:
just a foot long
but it'll do...
New Year's pine

jp: .辻だんぎちんぷんかんも長閑哉
ro: tsuji dangi chinpunkan mo nodoka kana
en:
a crossroads sermon
gibberish
spring peace

jp: .長閑しや大宮人の裾埃
ro: nodokeshi ya ômiyabito no suso-bokori
en:
spring peace--
in the great courtier's hem
dust

jp: .やみくもに長閑になりし烏哉
ro: yamikumo ni nodoka ni narishi karasu kana
en:
all of a sudden
he shuts up...
crow

jp: .永の日を喰やくわずや池の亀
ro: naga no hi wo kû ya kuwazu ya ike no kame
en:
in the long day
they eat, they don't eat
pond turtles

jp: .野烏の巧者にすべる春の雨
ro: no-garasu no kôsha ni suberu haru no ame
en:
the field crow
slips so cleverly...
spring rain

jp: .野鼠も福を鳴ぞよ春の雨
ro: no nezumi mo fuku wo naku zo yo haru [no] ame
en:
even the field mouse
squeaks, "What luck!"
spring rain

jp: .春雨やてうちん持の小傾城
ro: harusame ya chôchin mochi no ko keisei
en:
in spring rain
with a paper lantern...
little beauty

jp: .はちの木や我春風のけふも吹
ro: hachi no ki ya waga haru kaze no kyô mo fuku
en:
potted tree--
I blow a spring breeze on you
again today

jp: .春風や傾成丁の夜の体
ro: harukaze ya keisei  machi no yoru no tei
en:
spring breeze--
the pleasure quarter's
night life

jp: .春風や十づつ十の石なごに
ro: harukaze ya jû-zutsu jû no ishinago ni
en:
spring breeze--
over the game stones
ten at a time

jp: .春風やひらたく成って家根をふく
ro: haru kaze ya hirataku natte yane wo fuku
en:
spring wind--
my thatched roof
blown flat

jp: .春の風足むく方へいざさらば
ro: haru no kaze ashi muku hô e iza saraba
en:
spring breeze--
where my feet are pointed
I'm on my way

jp: .春の風いつか出てある昼の月
ro: haru no kaze itsuka dete aru hiru no tsuki
en:
spring breeze--
when did you come out
noon moon?

jp: .細長い春風吹くや女坂
ro: hosonagai harukaze fuku ya onnazaka
en:
long and narrow
the spring breeze blows...
gentle slope

jp: .亀の甲並べて東風に吹れけり
ro: kame no kô narabete kochi ni fukare keri
en:
turtle shells
blown into a row...
east wind

jp: .かすむぞよ金のなる木の植所
ro: kasumu zo yo kane no naru ki no ue tokoro
en:
spring mist--
the place where money trees
are planted

jp: .かすむ日の咄するやらのべの馬
ro: kasumu hi no hanashi suru yara nobe no uma
en:
on a misty day
they chat...
horses in the field

jp: .かすむ日やさぞ天人の御退屈
ro: kasumu hi ya sazo tennin no o-taikutsu
en:
misty day--
no doubt Heaven's saints
bored stiff

jp: .古鐘やかすめる声もむづかしき
ro: furu kane ya kasumeru koe mo muzukashiki
en:
an old temple bell
and voices too
muffled in mist

jp: .古椀がはやかすむぞよ角田川
ro: furu wan ga haya kasumu zo yo sumida-gawa
en:
the old bowl
quickly misted over...
Sumida River

jp: .麦の葉も朝きげんぞよ青霞
ro: mugi no ha mo asa kigen zo yo ao-gasumi
en:
even the wheat
in a morning mood...
blue mist

jp: .我ににた能なし山もかすみ哉
ro: ware ni nita nô nashi yama mo kasumi kana
en:
imitating me
the good-for-nothing mountain
in the mist

jp: .老松や改て又幾かすみ
ro: oi matsu ya aratamete mata iku kasumi
en:
old pine
starting a new year...
how many spring mists?

jp: .霞から人のつづくや寛永寺
ro: kasumi kara hito no tsuzuku ya kan-eiji
en:
out of mist
one by one they come...
Kan-ei Temple

jp: .夕客の行灯霞む野寺哉
ro: yû kyaku no andon kasumu no tera kana
en:
the night guest's lamp
in mist...
temple in a field

jp: .陽炎に何やら猫の寝言哉
ro: kagerô ni nani yara neko no negoto kana
en:
heat shimmers--
how the cat talks
in her sleep!

jp: .陽炎にめしを埋たる烏哉
ro: kagerô ni meshi wo ume[ta]ru karasu kana
en:
in heat shimmers
covering the rice...
crows

jp: .陽炎や見むく奴がうしろから
ro: kagerô ya mimuku yatsu ga ushiro kara
en:
heat shimmers--
the lackey turns to look
behind him

jp: .小酒屋の出現したり春の山
ro: ko sakaya no shutsugen shitari haru no yama
en:
the little tavern
open for business...
spring mountain

jp: .山々は袂にすれて青むぞよ
ro: yama-yama wa tamoto ni surete aomu zo yo
en:
brushed by her sleeves
every mountain
is greening!

jp: .草餅にいつか来ている小蝶哉
ro: kusamochi ni itsuka kite iru ko chô kana
en:
herb cakes--
when did you get here
little butterfly?

jp: .米蒔くも罪ぞよ鶏がけあふぞよ
ro: kome maku mo tsumi zo yo tori ga keau zo yo
en:
even tossing rice
is a sin...
sparring chickens

jp: .晴天の又晴天の汐干哉
ro: seiten no mata seiten no shiohi kana
en:
blue skies
nothing but blue skies...
low tide

jp: .草つみや狐の穴に礼をいふ
ro: kusa tsumi ya kitsune no ana ni rei wo iu
en:
picking herbs--
the fox's hole gets
a "Hello!"

jp: .里の子や草つんで出る狐穴
ro: sato no ko ya kusa tsunde deru kitsune ana
en:
the village child
picking herbs, reveals
a foxhole

jp: .猿が猿に負れて見たるやけの哉
ro: saru ga saru ni owarete mitaru yakeno kana
en:
monkey on the monkey
watches...
the burning field

jp: .松苗や一つ植ては孫の顔
ro: matsu nae ya hitotsu uete wa mago no kao
en:
planting one
pine sapling...
my grandchild's face

jp: .へら鷺がさしつかましてつぎ木哉
ro: herasagi ga sashi-tsukamashite tsugiki kana
en:
snatched
by the spoonbill...
the grafted branch

jp: .山烏おれがつぎ木を笑ふ哉
ro: yama-garasu ore ga tsugiki wo warau kana
en:
the mountain crow
laughs at the branch
I grafted

jp: .山烏おれがさし木を笑ふ哉
ro: yama-garasu ore ga sashi-gi wo warau kana
en:
mountain crow--
he sees my grafted tree
and laughs

jp: .猫なくや中を流るる角田川
ro: neko naku ya naka wo nagaruru sumida-gawa
en:
cats' love calls--
between them flows
Sumida River

jp: .江戸猫のあはただしさよ角田川
ro: edo neko no awatadashisa yo sumida-gawa
en:
the Edo cat
in a frenzy...
Sumida River

jp: .火の上を上手にとぶはうかれ猫
ro: hi no ue wo jyôzu ni tobu wa ukare neko
en:
jumping so well
over the fire...
the love-crazed cat

jp: .むさしのや只一つ家のうかれ猫
ro: musashi no ya tada hitotsu ya no ukare neko
en:
Musashi Plain--
just one house
one love-crazed cat

jp: .親雀子雀山もいさむぞよ
ro: oya suzume ko suzume yama mo isamu zo yo
en:
parent sparrows
baby sparrows...
a happy mountain

jp: .雀子や親のけん嘩をしらぬ顔
ro: suzumego ya oya no ken[ka] wo shiranu kao
en:
baby sparrow--
his face unaware
of his parents' fights

jp: .鶯のひとり娘か跡で鳴
ro: uguisu no hitori musume ka ato de naku
en:
are you the nightingale's
only daughter
behind the others, singing?

jp: .鶯のやれ大面もせざりけり
ro: uguisu no yare ôzura mo sezari keri
en:
nightingale--
his face doesn't look
like a big shot's

jp: .今来たと顔を並べる乙鳥哉
ro: ima kita to kao wo naraberu tsubame kana
en:
lining up
with newcomers' faces...
swallows

jp: .乙鳥や小屋のばくちをべちゃくちゃと
ro: tsubakura ya ko ya [no] bakuchi wo becha-kucha to
en:
at the little gambling shack
the swallow
prattles

jp: .うつくしや雲雀の鳴し跡の空
ro: utsukushi ya hibari no nakushi ato no sora
en:
lovely--
the sky after a lark
has sung

jp: .うつくしや昼の雲雀の鳴し空
ro: utsukushi ya hiru [no] hibari no nakushi sora
en:
lovely--
the sky where a noon lark
is singing

jp: .おりよおりよ野火が付いたぞ鳴雲雀
ro: ori yo ori yo nobi ga tsuita zo naku hibari
en:
come down! come down!
brushfires have started...
singing lark

jp: .けふもけふも竹のそちらや鳴雲雀
ro: kyô mo kyô mo take no sochira ya naku hibari
en:
today too, today too
over in the bamboo
a lark sings

jp: .二三尺人をはなるる雲雀哉
ro: ni san shaku hito wo hanaruru hibari kana
en:
missing people
by two or three feet...
skylarks

jp: .はたご屋のおく庭見へて鳴雲雀
ro: hatagoya no oku niwa miete naku hibari
en:
seeing the inn's
inner garden, the lark
sings

jp: .細ろ次のおくは海也なく雲雀
ro: hosoroji no oku wa umi nari naku hibari
en:
down a narrow alley
the ocean...
a singing lark

jp: .山人は鍬を枕や鳴雲雀
ro: yamaudo wa kuwa wo makura ya naku hibari
en:
the mountain man's
hoe is his pillow...
singing lark

jp: .雉うろうろうろ門を覗くぞよ
ro: kigisu uro-uro-uro kado wo nozoku yo
en:
a pheasant
loitering about, peeks
in my gate

jp: .雉と臼寺の小昼は過にけり
ro: kiji to usu tera no kobiru wa sugi ni keri
en:
crying pheasant, pounding mill
morning till noon
at the temple

jp: .雉鳴や関八州を一呑に
ro: kiji naku ya kanhasshû wo hito nomi ni
en:
crying pheasant--
swallow the Eight Provinces
in a gulp!

jp: .雉なくや見かけた山のあるやうに
ro: kiji naku ya mikaketa yama no aru yô ni
en:
the pheasant cries
as if catching sight
of a mountain

jp: .走る雉山や恋しき妻ほしき
ro: hashiru kiji yama ya koishiki tsuma hoshiki
en:
a pheasant rushing
to the mountain, missing
his darling wife

jp: .青柳も見ざめのしてや帰る雁
ro: ao yagi mo mizame [no] shite ya kaeru kari
en:
the green willow too
tires of watching...
departing geese

jp: .帰る雁人はなかなか未練也
ro: kae[ru] kari hito wa naka-naka miren nari
en:
departing geese--
human beings miss them
terribly

jp: .雁行や跡は本間の角田川
ro: kari yuku ya ato wa honma no sumida-gawa
en:
after the geese depart
back to normal...
Sumida River

jp: .からさきの松真黒に蛙かな
ro: karasaki no matsu makkuro ni kawazu kana
en:
in the Karasaki pine
jet black...
a frog

jp: .草陰に蛙の妻もこもりけり
ro: kusa kage ni kawazu no tsuma mo komori keri
en:
in grassy shade
the frog's wife also lives
in seclusion

jp: .小便の滝を見せうぞ鳴蛙
ro: shôben no taki wo mishô zo naku kawazu
en:
get ready to see
my piss waterfall!
croaking frog

jp: .づうづうし畳の上の蛙哉
ro: zûzûshi tatami no ue no kawazu kana
en:
brazenly squatting
on the tatami mat...
a frog

jp: .どち向も万吉とやなく蛙
ro: dochi muku mo yorozu yoshi to ya naku kawazu
en:
in every direction
ten thousand blessings...
croaking frogs

jp: .逃足や尿たれながら鳴蛙
ro: nige ashi ya shito tare nagara naku kawazu
en:
taking flight
and a leak...
croaking frog

jp: .橋わたる盲の跡の蛙哉
ro: hashi wataru mekura no ato no kawazu kana
en:
crossing the bridge
behind the blind man...
a frog

jp: .花の根へ推参したる蛙哉
ro: hana no ne e suisan shitaru kawazu kana
en:
paying a visit
to the flower's root...
a frog

jp: .蕗の葉に片足かけて鳴く蛙
ro: fuki no ha ni kata ashi kakete naku kawazu
en:
one foot
on the butterbur leaf...
croaking frog

jp: .山吹の御味方申す蛙かな
ro: yamabuki no o-mikata mô[su] kawazu kana
en:
the yellow rose's
honorable ally...
a frog

jp: .夕空をにらみつけたる蛙哉
ro: yûzora wo nirami tsuketaru kawazu kana
en:
scowling
at the evening sky...
a frog

jp: .夕不二に尻を並べてなく蛙
ro: yû fuji ni shiri wo narabete naku kawazu
en:
next to evening's Mount Fuji
his butt...
croaking frog

jp: .起よ起よ雀はおどる蝶はまふ
ro: oki yo oki yo suzume wa odoru chô wa mau
en:
wake up! wake up!
sparrows, butterflies
are dancing

jp: .なまけるな雀はおどる蝶はまふ
ro: namakeru na suzume wo odoru chô wa mau
en:
don't be lazy!
sparrows, butterflies
are dancing

jp: .かせぐぞよてふの三夫婦五夫婦
ro: kasegu zo yo chô no mi meoto itsu meoto
en:
making their living
butterfly couples...
three...five!

jp: .糞汲が蝶にまぶれて仕廻けり
ro: koekumi ga chô ni maburete shimai keri
en:
the poop scooper
utterly smeared...
with butterflies

jp: .小むしろや蝶と達磨と村雀
ro: samushiro ya chô to daruma to mura suzume
en:
little straw mat--
Bodhidharma, butterfly
and sparrows

jp: .猪ねらふ腕にすがる小てふ哉
ro: shishi nerau kaina ni sugaru ko chô kana
en:
clinging to
the boar hunter's arm...
little butterfly

jp: .蝶が来てつれて行けり庭のてふ
ro: chô ga kite tsurete yuki keri niwa no chô
en:
one came
and two left...
garden butterflies

jp: .蝶と鹿のがれぬ仲と見ゆる也
ro: chô to shika nogarenu naka to miyuru nari
en:
the butterfly
and the deer, best
of friends

jp: .蝶まふや鹿の最期の矢の先に
ro: chô mau ya shika no saigo no ya no saki ni
en:
butterfly dances
'round the arrow
in a dying deer

jp: .鉄砲の三尺先の小てふかな
ro: teppô no san shaku saki no ko chô kana
en:
three feet
from the musket's barrel...
little butterfly

jp: .寺山や児はころげる蝶はとぶ
ro: tera yama ya chigo [wa] korogeru chô wa tobu
en:
temple mountain--
a baby tumbles
a butterfly flits

jp: .夜明から小てふの夫婦かせぎ哉
ro: yoake kara ko chô no meoto kasegi kana
en:
from dawn to dusk
the butterfly couple
makes their living

jp: .青芝ぞここ迄ござれ田にし殿
ro: ao shiba zo koko made gozare tanishi dono
en:
a green lawn--
come have a seat
Sir Pond Snail!

jp: .小盥や今むく田螺すべりあそぶ
ro: ko-darai ya ima muku tanishi suberi asobu
en:
little tub--
pond snails ready for shelling
play sliding games

jp: .尋常に引つかまるる田にし哉
ro: jinjô ni hittsukama[ru]ru tanishi kana
en:
making no fuss
they are captured...
pond snails

jp: .鳴田にし鍋の中ともしらざるや
ro: naku tanishi nabe no naka tomo shirazaru ya
en:
pond snails sing
they're in the kettle
but don't know it

jp: .寝たり寝たり天下太平の田にし哉
ro: netari netari tenka taihei no tanishi kana
en:
sound asleep
there is peace on earth...
pond snail

jp: .木母寺や花見田にしとつくば山
ro: mokuboji ya hanami tanishi to tsukuba yama
en:
Mokubo Temple--
a blossom-viewing pond snail
and Mount Tsukuba

jp: .うつくしや貧乏蔓もまだ二葉
ro: utsukushi ya bimbô-zuru mo mada futaba
en:
a pretty thing
on the beggarly vine...
buds

jp: .世につれて庵の草もわかいぞよ
ro: yo ni tsurete iori no kusa mo wakai zo yo
en:
following the times
even my hut's grasses
so young!

jp: .わか草や町のせどのふじの山
ro: waka-gusa ya machi no sedo no fuji no yama
en:
new grass--
at the town's back door
Mount Fuji

jp: .なく蛙溝のなの花咲にけり
ro: naku kawazu mizo no na no hana saki ni keri
en:
croaking frogs--
"Rape flowers in the ditch
have bloomed!"

jp: .なの花に上総念仏のけいこ哉
ro: na no hana ni kazusa nebutsu no keiko kana
en:
in the flowering rape
Kazusa-style
"Praise Buddha!"

jp: .菜の花にやれやれいなり大明神
ro: na no hana ni yare-yare inari daimyôjin
en:
in the flowering rape
well, well
the great god Inari!

jp: .なの花の門の口より角田川
ro: na no hana no kado no kuchi yori sumida-gawa
en:
beyond the gate
of flowering rape...
Sumida River

jp: .なの花のとっぱづれ也ふじの山
ro: na no hana no toppazure nari fuji no yama
en:
at the edge
of the flowering rape...
Mount Fuji

jp: .なむあみだおれがほまちの菜も咲た
ro: namu amida ore ga homachi no na mo saita
en:
Praise Buddha!
my little side-field
has bloomed with rape

jp: .ほのぼのと乞食の小菜も咲にけり
ro: hono-bono to kojiki no ona mo saki ni keri
en:
flimsily
the beggar's rape flowers too
have bloomed

jp: .鶯を招くやうなるわらび哉
ro: uguisu wo maneku yônaru warabi kana
en:
like they're calling
to the nightingale...
the bracken

jp: .梅さくや乞食の花もつい隣
ro: ume sake ya kojiki no hana mo tsui tonari
en:
plum in bloom--
a beggar's blossoms too
next door

jp: .切ござや銭が四五文梅の花
ro: kiri-goza ya zeni ga shi go mon ume no hana
en:
on his scrap of mat
four or five pennies...
plum blossoms

jp: .御不運の仏の野梅咲にけり
ro: go-fu-un no hotoke no no ume saki ni keri
en:
in the field
of the Buddha of Misfortune
plum blossoms!

jp: .咲ばとて見るかげもなき梅の花
ro: sakaba tote miru kage mo naki ume no hana
en:
though they bloomed
they're not much to look at...
plum blossoms

jp: .浄はりや梅盗む手が先うつる
ro: jôhari ya ume nusu[mu] te ga mazu utsuru
en:
in hell's mirror
the plum-blossom thief's
reflection

jp: .せなみせへ作兵衛店の梅だんべへ
ro: sena misee sakubei-dana no ume danbee
en:
brother, look!
Sakubei's shop has
plums

jp: .銭からから敬白んめの花
ro: zeni kara-kara tsutsushinde môsu n-me no hana
en:
coins clattering
he thanks them politely...
plum blossoms

jp: .銭ねだる縄の先より梅の花
ro: zeni nedaru nawa no saki yori ume no hana
en:
at the end of the money-
begging rope...
plum blossoms

jp: .ももんじの出さうな藪を梅の花
ro: momonji no de sôna yabu wo ume no hana
en:
in the woods where
a wild boar was spotted...
plum blossoms

jp: .穴一のあなかしましや花の陰
ro: ana ichi no ana kashimashi ya hana no kage
en:
an uproar 'round
the penny toss hole...
blossom shade

jp: .おくえぞや仏法わたる花も咲
ro: oku ezo ya buppô wataru hana mo saku
en:
spreading as far
as Hokkaido...
Buddha's law and blossoms

jp: .さく花の中にうごめく衆生哉
ro: saku hana no naka ni ugomeku shujô kana
en:
squirming
through the cherry blossoms...
people

jp: .ちる花に仏とも法ともしらぬ哉
ro: chiru hana ni butsu tomo nori tomo shiranu kana
en:
in scattering blossoms
Buddha and Buddhism
unknown

jp: .ちる花や呑みたい水も遠がすみ
ro: chiru hana ya nomitaki mizu wa tôgasumi
en:
in scattering cherry blossoms
thirsty for that faraway
mist

jp: .としどしの花の罪ぞよ人の皺
ro: toshi-doshi no hana no tsumi zo yo hito no shiwa
en:
year after year
the sin of blossoms...
wrinkled now

jp: .花さけや仏法わたるえぞが島
ro: hana sake ya buppô wataru ezo ga shima
en:
bloom, cherry trees!
Buddha's law spreads
to Hokkaido

jp: .世の中は地獄の上の花見哉
ro: yo [no] naka wa jigoku no ue no hanami kana
en:
in this world
over hell...
viewing spring blossoms

jp: .まま子花いぢけ仕廻もせざりけり
ro: mamako hana ijike shimai mo sezari keri
en:
stepchild cherry blossoms--
not stunted
at all

jp: .花掘し跡をおぼへて風の吹く
ro: hana horishi ato wo oboete kaze no fuku
en:
where they dug up
the blooming cherry tree
the wind blows

jp: .市に出て二日ほさるる桜哉
ro: ichi ni dete futsuka hosaruru sakura kana
en:
second day
at market, drying up...
cherry blossoms

jp: .天からでも降たるやうに桜哉
ro: ten kara demo futtaru yô ni sakura kana
en:
like they fell
from heaven...
cherry blossoms

jp: .十日様九日さまのさくらかな
ro: tôka sama kokonoka sama no sakura kana
en:
the month's
Mr. Ten and Mr. Nine...
cherry blossoms

jp: .山桜花きちがひの爺哉
ro: yama-zakura hana kichigai no jijii kana
en:
he's a mountain
cherry blossom-crazed
old man

jp: .花咲と直に掘らるる桜哉
ro: hana saku to sugu ni horaruru sakura kana
en:
as soon as it bloomed
they dug up
the cherry tree

jp: .山吹や午つながるる古地蔵
ro: yamabuki ya uma tsunagaruru furu jizô
en:
yellow roses--
a horse tied
to an old Jizo

jp: .山吹にぶらりと牛のふぐり哉
ro: yamabuki ni burari to ushi no fuguri kana
en:
dangling in
the yellow roses
the bull's balls

jp: .六月は丸にあつくもなかりけり
ro: rokugatsu wa maru ni atsuku mo nakari keri
en:
Sixth Month--
the brutal heat
is no more

jp: .我上も青みな月の月よ哉
ro: waga ue [mo] aomina-zuki no tsuki yo kana
en:
over my head
a Sixth Month night
of moon

jp: .明安き夜のはづれの柳哉
ro: ake yasuki yoru no hazure no yanagi kana
en:
summer's early dawn--
dwindling night reveals
a willow

jp: .江戸の夜は別にみじかく思ふ也
ro: edo no [yo wa] betsu ni mijikaku omou nari
en:
nighttime in Edo
is especially short...
it seems

jp: .短くて夜はおもしろやなつかしや
ro: mijika[ku]te yo wa omoshiro ya natsukashi ya
en:
nights growing shorter
a delight...
sweet nostalgia

jp: .短夜をあくせくけぶる浅間哉
ro: mijika yo wo akuseku keburu asama kana
en:
all the short summer night
hard at work puffing...
Mount Asama

jp: .短夜やまりのやうなる花の咲
ro: mijika yo ya mari no yô naru hana no saku
en:
short summer night--
little puff-ball flowers
have bloomed

jp: .短夜やよやといふこそ人も花
ro: mijika yo ya yo ya to iu koso hito mo hana
en:
"The summer night
so brief, so brief!"
people and blossoms agree

jp: .暑き日の宝と申す小薮哉
ro: atsuki hi no takara to mô[su] ko yabu kana
en:
a hot day's treasure
they say, little clump
of trees

jp: .粟の穂がよい元気ぞよ暑いぞよ
ro: awa no ho ga yoi genki zo yo atsuiu zo yo
en:
the beards of millet
in good health...
such heat!

jp: .鷺並べどっこも同じ涼風ぞ
ro: sagi narabe dokko mo onaji suzukaze zo
en:
herons in a row--
everywhere the same
cool breeze

jp: .涼しさのうしろから来る三十日哉
ro: suzushisa [no] ushiro kara kuru misoka kana
en:
trailing behind
the cool air...
the month's last day

jp: .涼しさよ手まり程なる雲の峰
ro: suzushisa yo temari hodo naru kumo no mine
en:
summer cool--
the puffy clouds
like handballs

jp: .夜に入れば江戸の柳も涼しいぞ
ro: yo ni ireba edo no yanagi mo suzushii zo
en:
when evening falls
the willows of Edo
chill

jp: .よるとしや涼しい月も直あきる
ro: yorutoshi ya suzushii tsuki mo sugu akiru
en:
old age--
even the cool moon
soon grows tiresome

jp: .芦の葉を蟹がはさんで五月雨
ro: ashi no ha wo kani ga hasande satsuki ame
en:
a crab pinches
the leaf of a reed--
Fifth Month rain

jp: .坂本や草家草家の五月雨
ro: sakamoto ya kusaya kusaya no samidare
en:
Sakamoto--
thatched huts, thatched huts
and Fifth Month rain

jp: .五月雨つつじをもたぬ石もなし
ro: samidare tsutsuji wo motanu ishi mo nashi
en:
Fifth Month rain--
not a rock
without azaleas

jp: .蟾どののはつ五月雨よ五月雨よ
ro: hiki dono no hatsu samidare yo samidare yo
en:
Mr. Toad--
the Fifth Month rains
have begun!

jp: .蓑虫の運の強さよ五月雨
ro: minomushi no un no tsuyosa yo satsuki ame
en:
the bagworm
has strong karma...
Fifth Month rain

jp: .三粒でもそりや夕立といふ夜哉
ro: mi tsubu demo sori ya yûdachi to iu yo kana
en:
just three raindrops
and they call it
"A stormy night!"

jp: .三粒でもそりや夕立よ夕立よ
ro: mi tsubu demo sori ya yûdachi yo yûdachi yo
en:
just three raindrops
"A stormy night!
A stormy night!"

jp: .夕立が始る海のはづれ哉
ro: yûdachi ga hajimaru umi no hazure kana
en:
rainstorm--
at the edge of the sea
it starts

jp: .夕立に鶴亀松竹のそぶり哉
ro: yûdachi ni tsurukame matsutake no soburi kana
en:
in the cloudburst
a crane-tortoise-pine-bamboo
attitude

jp: .夕立の天窓にさはるすすき哉
ro: yûdachi no atama ni sawaru susuki kana
en:
touching the head
of the raining cloud...
pampas grass

jp: .夕立のとんだ所の野茶屋哉
ro: yûdachi no tonda tokoro no no chaya kana
en:
the cloudburst's
target...
teahouse in a field

jp: .夕立の日光さまや夜の空
ro: yûdachi no nikkô sama ya yoru no sora
en:
the cloudburst's
answer to sunlight...
a night sky

jp: .夕立やかみつくやうな鬼瓦
ro: yûdachi ya kamitsuku yôna onigawara
en:
like he's snapping
at the downpour...
gargoyle

jp: .夕立やけろりと立し女郎花
ro: yûdachi ya kerori to tateshi ominaeshi
en:
standing in the cloudburst
keeping her cool...
maiden flower

jp: .夕立や貧乏徳利のころげぶり
ro: yûdachi ya bimbô tokuri no korogeburi
en:
rainstorm--
a poor sake bottle
rolls along

jp: .雲の峰草一本にかくれけり
ro: kumo no mine kusa ippon ni kakure keri
en:
the peaks of clouds
behind one blade of grass
vanish

jp: .雲の峰草にかくれてしまひけり
ro: kumo no mine kusa ni kakurete shimai keri
en:
the peaks of clouds
hiding
in the grass

jp: .ﾕせよ小雲も山を拵る
ro: matsuri se yo ko-gumo mo yama wo koshiraeru
en:
festival day--
even the little clouds
forming peaks

jp: .三ケ月に逃ずもあらなん雲のみね
ro: mikazuki ni nigezu mo aranan kumo no mine
en:
don't run away
from the sickle moon
billowing clouds!

jp: .むさしのや蚤の行衛も雲の峰
ro: musashi no ya nomi no yukue mo kumo no mine
en:
Musashi Plain--
the flea also heads
for the peaks of clouds

jp: .象がたや能因どのの夏の月
ro: kisagata ya nôin dono no natsu no tsuki
en:
Kisa Lagoon--
a summer moon worthy
of Noin

jp: .さほ姫の御子も出給へ夏の月
ro: saohime no miko mo detamae natsu no tsuki
en:
the goddess of spring's
child, come out too!
summer moon

jp: .小便に川を越けり夏の月
ro: shôben ni kawa wo koe keri natsu no tsuki
en:
crossing the river
taking a leak...
summer moon

jp: .蝶と成って髪さげ虫も夏の月
ro: chô to natte kami sage mushi mo natsu no tsuki
en:
the hairy bug
becomes a butterfly...
summer moon

jp: .戸口から難波がた也夏の月
ro: toguchi kara naniwagata nari natsu no tsuki
en:
the door opens
to Naniwa Bay...
summer moon

jp: .夏の月無きずの夜もなかりけり
ro: natsu no tsuki mukizu no yoru mo nakari keri
en:
summer moon--
there's no such thing
as a flawless night

jp: .観音の番してござる清水哉
ro: kannon no ban shite gozaru shimizu kana
en:
guarded by the goddess
Kannon...
pure water

jp: .苔清水さあ鳩の来よ雀来よ
ro: koke shimizu saa hato no ki yo suzume ki yo
en:
pure water over moss--
come, pigeons!
come, sparrows!

jp: .なむ大悲大悲大悲の清水哉
ro: namu daihi daihi daihi no shimizu kana
en:
praise Buddha's
compassionate saints!
pure water

jp: .古郷や厠の尻もわく清水
ro: furusato ya kawaya no shiri mo waku shimizu
en:
my home village--
even behind the outhouse
pure water gushes

jp: .夜に入ればせい出してわく清水哉
ro: yo ni ireba seidashite waku shimizu kana
en:
come nightfall
it still gushes diligently...
pure water

jp: .浅ぢふに又そよぐ也ちまき殻
ro: asajiu ni mata soyogu nari chimaki-gara
en:
in the cogan grass
it rustles again...
rice dumpling wrapper

jp: .がさがさと粽をかぢる美人哉
ro: gasa-gasa to chimaki wo kajiru bijin kana
en:
rustle-rustle
nibbling on a rice dumpling...
a pretty woman

jp: .がやがやと鵜も正月を致す哉
ro: gaya-gaya to u mo shôgatsu wo itasu kana
en:
clamorous cormorants
see in the New Year
too

jp: .婆々が鵜も三日正月致す哉
ro: baba ga u mo mikka shôgatsu itasu kana
en:
granny's cormorant too
celebrates the third day
of First Month

jp: .雁鴨よ是世の中は更衣
ro: kari kamo yo kono yo [no] naka wa koromogae
en:
for the geese and ducks
of this world...
new summer robes

jp: .能なしもどうやらかうやら更衣
ro: nô nashi mo dô yara kô yara koromogae
en:
even no-good me
somehow pulls it off...
a new summer robe

jp: .先以朝の柳やころもがへ
ro: mazu motte asa no yanagi ya koromogae
en:
the morning willow
is first...
a new summer robe

jp: .雇れて念仏申すころもがへ
ro: yatowarete nembutsu mô[su] koromogae
en:
chanting "Praise Buddha!"
changing into
my summer robe

jp: .薮蔭の乞食村もころもがへ
ro: yabu kage no kojiki mura mo koromogae
en:
in the beggar's town, too
in thicket shade
new summer robe

jp: .明がたや袷を通す松の月
ro: akegata ya awase wo tôsu matsu no tsuki
en:
dawn--
through my summer kimono shining
moon in the pine

jp: .瓢たんで鯰おさゆる袷哉
ro: hyôtan de namazu osayuru awase kana
en:
a catfish caught
in a gourd...
summer kimono

jp: .青空のやうな帷きたりけり
ro: ao-zora no yôna katabira kitari keri
en:
like blue sky
the summer kimono
I'm wearing

jp: .帷を帆にして走る小舟かな
ro: katabira wo ho ni shite hashiru kobune kana
en:
a kimono for a sail
rushing along...
little boat

jp: .帷に摺りやへらさん亦打山
ro: katabira ni suri yaerasan matchi yama
en:
printed small
on ahe summer kimono
Mount Matchi

jp: .帷やふし木のやうな大男
ro: katabira ya fushigi no yôna daiotoko
en:
like a felled tree
in his summer kimono...
big man

jp: .臑きりの麻帷も祭り哉
ro: sune kiri no asa katabira mo matsuri kana
en:
summer kimonos, too
cut to show shins...
festival

jp: .大竹のおくのおく也昼の蚊屋
ro: ô take no oku no oku nari hiru no kaya
en:
in the deep heart
of the tall bamboo...
an afternoon mosquito net

jp: .古郷は蚊屋の中から見ゆるぞよ
ro: furusato wa ka[ya] no naka kara miyuru zo yo
en:
my home village--
from inside my mosquito net
I watch

jp: .草花が咲候と扇かな
ro: kusabana ga saki sôrô to ôgi kana
en:
wildflowers
at full bloom...
her paper fan

jp: .西行の不二してかざす扇哉
ro: saigyô no fuji shite kazasu ôgi kana
en:
shading my eyes
with Saigyo's Mount Fuji...
paper fan

jp: .貧乏神からさづかりし団扇哉
ro: bimbô-gami kara sazukarishi uchiwa kana
en:
a gift
from the god of the poor...
paper fan

jp: .うしろ手に数珠つまぐりて夕すずみ
ro: ushirode ni juzu tsumagurite yûsuzumi
en:
behind my back
fingers rolling prayer beads...
evening cool

jp: .馬は鈴虫ははたをる夕涼み
ro: uma wa rin mushi wo hata oru yûsuzumi
en:
the horse's bell
the insects' weaving...
evening cool

jp: .江戸の夜もけふ翌ばかり門涼
ro: edo no yo mo kyô asu bakari kado suzumi
en:
nights in Edo
today and tomorrow...
cool air at the gate

jp: .空山に蚤を捻って夕すずみ
ro: kûzan ni nomi [wo] hinette yûsuzumi
en:
on a deserted mountain
pinching fleas...
evening cool

jp: .乞食が何か侍る夕すずみ
ro: konjiki ga nanika hanberu yûsuzumi
en:
a beggar offers
his services...
evening cool

jp: .煤くさき弥陀と並んで夕涼
ro: susu kusaki mida to narande yûsuzumi
en:
a soot-grimed Amida Buddha
at my side...
evening cool

jp: .捨人や袷をめして夕涼み
ro: sutebito ya awase wo meshite yûsuzumi
en:
the holy hermit
puts on a kimono...
evening cool

jp: .鶴亀や裃ながらの夕涼
ro: tsurukame ya kamishimo nagara yûsuzumi
en:
live long!
in your ceremonial robe
enjoy the evening cool

jp: .町住や涼むうちでもなむあみだ
ro: machi-zumi ya suzumu uchi demo [na]mu amida
en:
life in town--
while enjoying the cool air
"Praise Buddha!"

jp: .行月や都の月も一涼み
ro: yuku tsuki ya miyako no tsuki mo hito suzumi
en:
the moon departs--
in Kyoto even she enjoys
the cool breeze

jp: .夜々は貧乏づるも涼哉
ro: yoru yoru wa bimbô-zuru mo suzumi kana
en:
night after night--
even the beggarly vine
enjoys the cool air

jp: .鶯よ江戸の氷室は何が咲
ro: uguisu yo edo no himuro wa nani ga saku
en:
hey nightingale
what blooms at the icehouses
of Edo?

jp: .掌の虱と並ぶ氷かな
ro: tenohira no shirami to narabu kôri kana
en:
in my palm
next to one of my lice...
ice

jp: .雪国の雪いはふ日や浅黄空
ro: yuki-guni no yuki iwau hi ya asagi-zora
en:
a day to celebrate
snow country's snow!
a pale blue sky

jp: .鹿の子の跡から奈良の烏哉
ro: shika no ko no ato kara nara no karasu kana
en:
following behind the fawn
a crow
of Nara

jp: .朝々や花のう月のほととぎす
ro: asa-asa ya hana no uzuki no hototogisu
en:
morning after morning
blossoming Fourth Month's
cuckoo

jp: .有明や今えど入のほととぎす
ro: ariake ya ima edo iri no hototogisu
en:
at dawn
Edo's new arrival...
"cuckoo!"

jp: .今ごろや大内山のほととぎす
ro: imagoro ya ôuchiyama no hototogisu
en:
always around now
from the palace...
"cuckoo!"

jp: .江戸入の一ばん声やほととぎす
ro: edo iri no ichiban koe ya hototogisu
en:
entering Edo
the first voice I hear
"cuckoo!"

jp: .大淀やだまって行と鳥時
ro: ôyodo ya damatte yuke to hototogisu
en:
Oyodo Town--
leave in silence
cuckoo

jp: .それでこそ御時鳥松の月
ro: sore de koso on-hototogisu matsu no tsuki
en:
worthy of Sir Cuckoo--
the moon
in the pine

jp: .時鳥大内山を夜逃して
ro: hototogisu ôuchiyama wo yo nigeshite
en:
cuckoo--
escaping the palace
at night

jp: .時鳥竹がいやなら木に泊れ
ro: hototogisu take ga iyanara ki ni tomare
en:
cuckoo--
if you don't like the bamboo
stay in the tree!

jp: .時鳥つつじまぶれの野よ山よ
ro: hototogisu tsutsuji ma[bu]re no no yo yama yo
en:
cuckoo--
azalea clotted fields!
mountains!

jp: .時鳥つつじは笠にさされたり
ro: hototogisu tsutsuji wa kasa ni sasaretari
en:
cuckoo--
azaleas adorn
my umbrella-hat

jp: .時鳥花のお江戸を一呑に
ro: hototogisu hana no o-edo wo hito nomi ni
en:
oh cuckoo--
swallow blossom-filled Edo
in a gulp!

jp: .三日月とそりがあふやら時鳥
ro: mikazuki to sori ga au yara hototogisu
en:
a good match--
the sickle moon
the cuckoo

jp: .無縁寺の念仏にまけな時鳥
ro: muenji no nebutsu ni makena hototogisu
en:
don't let Muen Temple's
prayers drown you out...
cuckoo!

jp: .山国やなぜにすくないほととぎす
ro: yama-guni ya naze ni sukunai hototogisu
en:
mountain country--
why do you dislike it
cuckoo?

jp: .行舟や天窓の際のほととぎす
ro: yuku fune ya atama no kiwa no hototogisu
en:
the boat departs--
right next to his head
a cuckoo

jp: .我ら儀は只やかましい時鳥
ro: warera gi wa tada yakamashii hototogisu
en:
to our ears
just a lot of noise...
the cuckoo

jp: .かんこ鳥鳴や馬から落るなと
ro: kankodori naku ya uma kara ochiru na to
en:
a mountain cuckoo sings
"Don't fall off
that horse!"

jp: .白壁の里見くだしてかんこ鳥
ro: shiro kabe no sato mikudashite kankodori
en:
looking down at the village
of white walls
mountain cuckoo

jp: .よしきりのよしも一本角田川
ro: yoshikiri no yoshi mo ippon sumida-gawa
en:
just one reed
for the reed thrush...
Sumida river

jp: .よしきりや四五寸程なつくば山
ro: yoshikiri ya shi go sun hodo na tsukuba yama
en:
hey reed thrush--
it's four or five inches tall
Mount Tsukuba

jp: .よしきりや空の小隅のつくば山
ro: yoshikiri ya sora no kosumi no tsukuba yama
en:
a reed thrush--
Mount Tsukuba
in a corner of the sky

jp: .水鶏なく拍子に雲が急ぐぞよ
ro: kuina naku hyôshi ni kumo ga isogu zo yo
en:
to the rhythm
of a moorhen's cries...
a cloud speeds by

jp: .木母寺の鉦の真似してなく水鶏
ro: mokuboji no kane no mane shite naku kuina
en:
mocking Mokubo Temple's
prayer gong...
a moorhen calls

jp: .一本の草さへまねく蛍かな
ro: ippon no kusa sae maneku hotaru kana
en:
a single blade
of grass beckons...
the firefly

jp: .江戸者にかはいがらるる蛍かな
ro: edo mono ni kawaigararuru hotaru kana
en:
kept as pets
by citizens of Edo...
fireflies

jp: .笠にさす草が好やらとぶ蛍
ro: kasa ni sasu kusa ga suki yara tobu hotaru
en:
he likes the grass
of my umbrella-hat...
flitting firefly

jp: .草の葉や犬に嗅れてとぶ蛍
ro: kusa no ha ya inu ni kagarete tobu hotaru
en:
the grass sniffed
by the dog...
a firefly flies

jp: .さくさくと飯くふ上をとぶ蛍
ro: saku-saku to meshi kuu ue wo tobu hotaru
en:
over the crunch-crunch
of my eating...
a firefly flits

jp: .其石が天窓あぶないとぶ蛍
ro: sono ishi ga atama abunai tobu hotaru
en:
"Don't bump your head
on that stone!"
flitting firefly

jp: .とべ蛍庵はけむいぞけむいぞよ
ro: tobe hotaru io wa kemui zo kemui zo yo
en:
fly away, firefly
my hut's smoky!
smoky!

jp: .髭どのに呼れたりけりはつ蛍
ro: hige dono ni yobaretari keri hatsu hotaru
en:
called forth
by Mr. Long-Beard...
the first firefly

jp: .蛍よぶ口へとび入るほたる哉
ro: [hotaru] yobu kuchi e tobi iru hotaru kana
en:
a mouth calling fireflies--
one
flies in

jp: .夕暮や今うれる草をとぶ蛍
ro: yûgure ya ima ureru kusa wo tobu hotaru
en:
evening falls--
to the just-sold grass
fireflies flit

jp: .まゆひとつ仏のひざに作る也
ro: mayu hitotsu hotoke no hiza ni tsukuru nari
en:
one cocoon
in the stone Buddha's
lap

jp: .蚊柱の外は能なし榎哉
ro: ka-bashira no hoka wa nô nashi enoki kana
en:
beyond the swarming
mosquitoes, the no-good
nettle tree

jp: .ひとつ蚊の咽へとび込むさわぎ哉
ro: hitotsu ka no nodo e tobikomu sawagi kana
en:
one mosquito
flies down my throat...
an uproar!

jp: .庵の蚤かはいや我といぬる也
ro: io no nomi kawai ya ware [to] inuru nari
en:
my hut's fleas
how cute!
they sleep with me

jp: .蚤とぶや笑仏の御口へ
ro: nomi tobu ya warai-botoke no ôkuchi e
en:
a flea jumps
in the laughing Buddha's
mouth

jp: .夕暮や大盃の月と蚤
ro: yûgure ya ô sakazuki no tsuki to nomi
en:
evening--
in a big sake cup
moon and a flea

jp: .蝉鳴や赤い木の葉のはらはらと
ro: semi naku ya akai ki [no] ha no hara-hara to
en:
cicadas chirring
the red leaf flutters
down

jp: .初蝉といへば小便したりけり
ro: hatsu semi to ieba shôben shitari keri
en:
"first cicada!"
he says
while it pisses

jp: .湖に尻を吹かせて蝉の鳴
ro: mizuumi ni shiri wo fukasete semi no naku
en:
cooling his butt
toward the lake...
cicada singing

jp: .むく犬や蝉鳴く方へ口を明く
ro: muku inu ya semi naku kata e kuchi wo aku
en:
the dog turns
in the cicada's direction...
mouth agape

jp: .朝顔もさらりと咲て松魚哉
ro: asagao mo sarari to saite katsuo kana
en:
the morning-glories
brightly bloom...
and bonito!

jp: .江戸者に三日也けり初鰹
ro: edo mono ni mikka nari keri hatsu-gatsuo
en:
a third day
for citizens of Edo...
summer's first bonito

jp: .髭どのに先こされけりはつ松魚
ro: hige dono ni saki kosare keri hatsu-gatsuo
en:
Sir Whiskers
has first crack
at summer's first bonito

jp: .むさしのは不二と鰹に夜が明ぬ
ro: musashi no wa fuji to katsuo ni yo ga akenu
en:
Musashi Plain--
Mount Fuji and bonito
on everyone's mind

jp: .大汐や昼顔砂にしがみつき
ro: ôshio ya hirugao suna ni shigamitsuki
en:
big tide--
the day flower clings
to the sand

jp: .昼顔やざぶざぶ汐に馴てさく
ro: hirugao ya zabu-zabu shio ni narete saku
en:
the day flower
splish-splash in the tide
blooms anyway

jp: .夕顔の花で洟かむ娘かな
ro: yûgao no hana de hana kamu musume kana
en:
blowing her snot
on the moonflower...
a young girl

jp: .夕顔の花で洟かむおばば哉
ro: yûgao no hana de hana kamu o-baba kana
en:
blowing her snot
on the moonflower...
granny

jp: .夕顔の花にぬれたる杓子哉
ro: yûgao no hana ni nuretaru shakushi kana
en:
the moonflowers
get a drenching...
from my spoon

jp: .大原や前キの小村がけしの花
ro: ôhara ya saki no ko mura ga keshi no hana
en:
a big field
by a little village...
poppies

jp: .何をいふはりあひもなし芥子の花
ro: nani wo iu hariai mo nashi keshi no hana
en:
words
are a waste of time...
poppies

jp: .裸子が這ふけしの咲にけり
ro: hadaka-go ga harabau keshi no saki ni keri
en:
the naked child crawls--
the blooming
poppies

jp: .花げしのふはつくやふな前歯哉
ro: hana-geshi no fuwatsuku yôna maeba kana
en:
like a poppy
how it sways...
front tooth

jp: .蓮の葉に乗せたやうなる庵哉
ro: hasu no ha ni noseta yô naru iori kana
en:
looks like it's built
on lotus leaves...
the hut

jp: .べら坊に日の永くなるはすの花
ro: berabô ni hi no nagaku naru hasu no hana
en:
the day grows
devilishly long...
lotus blossoms

jp: .御地蔵や花なでしこの真中に
ro: o-jizô ya hana nadeshiko no man naka ni
en:
holy Jizo
in the blooming pinks...
dead center

jp: .なでしこが大な蜂にさされけり
ro: nadeshiko ga ôkina hachi ni sasare keri
en:
a blooming pink--
the big bee
stings it!

jp: .雁鴨が足を拭也かきつばた
ro: kari kamo ga ashi wo fuku nari kakitsubata
en:
geese and ducks
wipe their feet...
on the irises

jp: .さをしかの角にかけたりゆりの花
ro: saoshika no tsuno ni kaketari yuri no hana
en:
dangling from
the young buck's antler...
lilies

jp: .長々と犬の寝にけりゆりの花
ro: naga-naga to inu no ne ni keri yuri no hana
en:
all stretched out
the dog naps
in the lilies

jp: .夕闇やかのこ斑のゆりの花
ro: yû yami ya kanoko madara no yuri no hana
en:
evening gloom--
a fawn's spots
in the lilies

jp: .浮草にぞろりと並ぶ乙鳥哉
ro: ukikusa ni zorori to narabu tsubame kana
en:
over the duckweed
one by one in a row...
swallows

jp: .浮草の花よ来い来い爺が茶屋
ro: ukikusa no hana yo kii kii jiji ga chaya
en:
duckweed blooms
"Come! Come to the old man's
teahouse!"

jp: .浮草も願ひ有やら西にさく
ro: ukikusa mo negai aru yara nishi ni saku
en:
the duckweed too
may have prayed...
blooming in the west

jp: .麦秋やうらの苫屋は魚の秋
ro: mugi aki ya ura mo tomaya wa uo no aki
en:
"barley's autumn"--
but in the hut of reeds
"fish autumn"

jp: .麦秋やしはがれ声の小田の雁
ro: mugi aki ya shiwagare-goe no oda no kari
en:
ripened barley--
the rice paddy geese
with hoarse voices

jp: .故郷や細い柱の苔もさく
ro: furusato ya hosoi hashira no koke mo saku
en:
home village--
even on a thin post
moss has bloomed

jp: .藪竹もわかいうちとてさわぐ也
ro: yabu take mo wakai uchi tote sawagu nari
en:
the thicket's bamboo
like all young folk
raising a ruckus

jp: .わか竹をたのみに思ふ小家哉
ro: waka take ni tanomi ni omou ko ie kana
en:
depending on
the young bamboo...
little house

jp: .わか竹やさもうれしげに嬉しげに
ro: waka take ya samo ureshige ni ureshige ni
en:
summer's young bamboo--
joyful!
joyful!

jp: .瓜の香に手をかざしたる鼬哉
ro: uri no ka ni te wo kazashitaru itachi kana
en:
smelling the melon
shading his eyes to gaze...
a weasel

jp: .瓜の香やどこにどうしてきりぎりす
ro: uri no ka ya doko ni dôshite kirigirisu
en:
I smell melons--
where might they be
katydid?

jp: .はつ瓜の天窓程なる御児哉
ro: hatsu uri no atama hodo naru o-chigo kana
en:
the year's first melon
big as her head...
baby

jp: .朝顔もたしにざわつく茄子哉
ro: asagao no tashi ni zawatsuku nasubi kana
en:
the morning-glories' rustle
mere extra...
eggplant

jp: .]戸者にかはいがらるる茄子哉
ro: edo mono ni kawaigararuru nasubi kana
en:
caressed by citizens
of Edo...
eggplant

jp: .吾庵の巾着茄子にくにくし
ro: waga io no kinchaku nasubi nikunikushi
en:
the eggplant I'm growing
in my hut...
a horror!

jp: .一本の茂りを今はたのみ哉
ro: ippon no shigeri wo ima wa tanomi kana
en:
just one blade
of thick summer grass
works fine

jp: .笹の葉に飴を並べる茂り哉
ro: sasa no ha ni ame wo naraberu shigeri kana
en:
candy lined up
on leaves of bamboo...
thick summer grasses

jp: .塩からい飴のうれたる茂り哉
ro: shiokarai ame no uretaru shiguri kana
en:
salty candy
for sale...
thick summer grasses

jp: .住の江の隅の飴屋の茂り哉
ro: sumi no e no sumi no ameya no shigeri kana
en:
a candy stand in a nook
of Suminoe...
thick summer grasses

jp: .目の上の瘤とひろがる榎哉
ro: me no ue [no] kobu to hirogaru enoki kana
en:
spreading so thick
what an eyesore...
nettle tree

jp: .秋立や隅のこすみの小松島
ro: aki tatsu ya sumi no kosumi no ko matsushima
en:
autumn begins--
in a little pine island's
little nook

jp: .赤玉は何のつぼみぞ秋の夕
ro: akadama wa nanno tsubomi zo aki no yû
en:
the red gems
of a flower's buds...
autumn evening

jp: .秋の暮かはゆき鳥の通りけり
ro: aki no kure kawayuki tori no tôri keri
en:
autumn dusk--
a pretty little bird
passes by

jp: .十ばかり屁を棄てに出る夜永哉
ro: jû bakari he wo sute ni deru yonaga kana
en:
going out to fart
about ten times...
a long night

jp: .秋風やのらくら者のうしろ吹
ro: aki kaze ya norakuramono no ushiro fuku
en:
autumn wind--
on the loafer's back
it blows

jp: .有明や露にまぶれしちくま川
ro: ariake ya tsuyu ni mabureshi chikuma-gawa
en:
at dawn
slick with dew...
Chikuma River

jp: .老蛙それそれ露がころげるぞ
ro: oi kawazu sore-sore tsuyu ga korogeru zo
en:
old frog
dewdrops are tumbling
look! there!

jp: .けさ程は草家も露の化粧哉
ro: kesa hodo wa kusaya mo tsuyu no keshô kana
en:
this morning
even my thatched hut
made-up with dew

jp: .小便の露のたし也小金原
ro: shôben no tsuyu no tashi nari kogane hara
en:
taking a leak
adding to the dew...
Kogane Field

jp: .涼しさは露の大玉小玉哉
ro: suzushisa wa tsuyu no ôtama ko-dama kana
en:
such cool air--
big pearls, little pearls
of dew

jp: .露の世や露の小脇のうがひ達
ro: tsuyu no yo ya tsuyu no kowaki no ugai-tachi
en:
dewdrop world--
clinging to dewdrops...
cormorant fishermen

jp: .露の世や露のなでしこ小なでしこ
ro: tsuyu no yo ya tsuyu no nadeshiko ko nadeshiko
en:
a dewdrop world--
dewy pinks
big and little

jp: .露はらりはらり世の中よかりけり
ro: tsuyu harari-harari yo [no] naka yokari keri
en:
dewdrops falling
drip-drip, this world
is good!

jp: .露三粒上野の蝉の鳴出しぬ
ro: tsuyu mi tsubu ueno no semi no nakidashinu
en:
three dewdrops--
Ueno's cicadas
break out into song

jp: .笛吹て白露いわふ在所哉
ro: fue fuite shiro tsuyu iwau zaisho kana
en:
blowing a flute
to celebrate the silver dew...
my hometown

jp: .ふんどしと小赤い花と夜露哉
ro: fundoshi to ko akai hana to yo tsuyu kana
en:
on loincloth
and little red flowers...
evening dew

jp: .稲妻をとらまへたがる子ども哉
ro: inazuma wo toramaetagaru kodomo kana
en:
trying to catch
the lightning bolt...
a child

jp: .有明や浅間の霧が膳をはふ
ro: ariake ya asama no kiri ga zen wo hau
en:
dawn--
Mount Asama's mist on the dinner tray
crawls

jp: .浅ぢふや聖霊棚に蝉がなく
ro: asajiu ya jô[ryô] tana ni semi ga naku
en:
on a holy shrine
in cogan grass...
a singing cicada

jp: .蚊柱の先立にけり聖霊棚
ro: ka-bashira no mazu tachi ni keri shôryûdana
en:
the first to arise
a mosquito swarm...
ancestors' altar

jp: .玉棚にしてもくねるや女郎花
ro: tama-dana ni shite mo kuneru ya ominaeshi
en:
even on the ancestors' altar
they wriggle...
maiden flowers

jp: .玉棚やはたはた虫も茶をたてる
ro: tamadana ya hata-hata mushi no cha wo tateru
en:
ancestors' altar--
for gnawing silkworms, too
a tea offering

jp: .送り火や焚く真似しても秋の露
ro: okuribi ya taku mane shite mo aki [no] tsuyu
en:
like bonfires for the dead
burning to nothing...
autumn dew

jp: .送り火やどちへも向かぬ平家蟹
ro: okuribi ya dochi e mo mukanu heike-gani
en:
bonfires for the dead--
in every direction
Heike crabs

jp: .泣く虫も七夕さまよ七夕よ
ro: naku mushi mo tanabata-sama yo tanabata yo
en:
even the insects sing:
"It's great Tanabata!
Tanabata!"

jp: .星迎庵はなでしこさくのみぞ
ro: hoshi mukae io wa nadeshiko saku no mizo
en:
greeting the stars
of Tanabata
at my hut, pinks

jp: .勝角力やあごにてなぶる草の花
ro: kachi sumô ya ago nite naburu kusa no hana
en:
the sumo champion
caresses with his chin...
wildflowers

jp: .草花をあごでなぶるや勝角力
ro: kusabana wo ago de naburu ya kachi sumô
en:
wildflowers caressed
by his chin...
sumo champion

jp: .我庵や二所ながら下手砧
ro: waga io ya futa toko nagara heta-ginuta
en:
my hut
and two out-of-sync
cloth-pounders

jp: .どこをおせばそんな音が出る山の鹿
ro: doko wo oseba sonna ne ga deru yama no shika
en:
where were you poked
to make that sound...
mountain deer?

jp: .跡の雁やれやれ足がいたむやら
ro: ato no kari yare-yare ashi ga itamu yara
en:
the rear goose--
well, well
a sore foot

jp: .庵の夜や竹には雀芦に雁
ro: io no yo ya take ni suzume ashi ni kari
en:
hut's evening
sparrows in the bamboo
geese in the rushes

jp: .うしろから雁の夕と成にけり
ro: ushiro kara kari no yûbe to nari ni keri
en:
behind me--
it's become a night
of wild geese!

jp: .小田の雁我通てもねめつける
ro: oda no kari ware tôtte mo nemetsukeru
en:
rice field geese
glare at me
as I pass

jp: .かしましや将軍さまの雁じゃとて
ro: kashimashi ya shôgun sama no kari ja tote
en:
what an uproar--
those wild geese
are the Shogun's!

jp: .雁鳴や霧の浅間へ火を焚と
ro: kari naku ya kiri no asama e hi wo taku to
en:
geese honking--
into Mount Asama's mist
a fire

jp: .雁わやわやおれが噂を致す哉
ro: kari waya-waya ore ga uwasa wo itasu kana
en:
the wild geese
honking! honking!
about me

jp: .けふからは日本の雁ぞ楽に寝よ
ro: kyô kara wa nihon no kari zo raku ni ne yo
en:
from today on
you are Japanese geese...
rest easy

jp: .死迄もだまり返って小田の雁
ro: shinu made mo damari kaete oda no kari
en:
settling back
to dead silence...
rice field geese

jp: .初雁に旅の寝やうをおそはらん
ro: hatsu kari ni tabi no ne yô wo osowaran
en:
autumn's first geese--
from you I could learn
where to sleep

jp: .はつ雁よ汝に旅をおそはらん
ro: hatsu kari yo nanji ni tabi wo osowaran
en:
autumn's first geese--
from you I could learn
about travels!

jp: .湖へおりぬは雁の趣向哉
ro: mizuumi e orinu wa kari no shukô kana
en:
not landing
on the lake...
the geese's plan

jp: .夕月に尻つんむけて小田の雁
ro: yûzuki ni shiri tsunmukete oda no kari
en:
aiming their butts
at the evening moon...
rice field geese

jp: .こおろぎや子鹿の角のてんぺんに
ro: kôrogi ya koshika no tsuno no tenpen ni
en:
cricket--
on the young buck's antler's
tip

jp: .猫の飯打くらひけりきりぎりす
ro: neko no meshi uchikurai keri kirigirisu
en:
gorging himself
on the cat's food...
katydid

jp: .頬っぺたに飯粒つけてきりぎりす
ro: hoppeta ni meshi tsubu tsukete kirigirisu
en:
a grain of rice
stuck to his cheek...
katydid

jp: .又も来よ膝をかさうぞきりぎりす
ro: mata mo koyo hiza wo kasô zo kirigirisu
en:
come again
I'll lend you my lap...
katydid

jp: .草花に蝿も恋するさわぎ哉
ro: kusabana ni hae mo koi suru sawagi kana
en:
the wildflowers
a-buzz with flies
making love

jp: .朝顔の花で鼻かむ女哉
ro: asagao no hana de hana kamu onna kana
en:
blowing her nose
with a morning-glory...
a woman

jp: .朝顔の花で葺たる庵哉
ro: asagao no hana de fukitaru iori kana
en:
thatched with
morning-glories
my little hut

jp: .狗の朝顔さきぬ門先に
ro: enokoro no asagao sakinu kado saki ni
en:
the puppy's morning-glory
has bloomed...
at the gate

jp: .じゃらつくもけふ翌ばかり女郎花
ro: jaratsuku mo kyô asu bakari ominaeshi
en:
just today and tomorrow
for your flirting...
maiden flowers

jp: .世の中はくねり法度ぞ女郎花
ro: yo [no] naka wa kuneri hatto zo ominaeshi
en:
in this world
no wriggling allowed!
maiden flowers

jp: .誰ぞ来よ来よとてさわぐすすき哉
ro: tare zo ko yo ko yo tote sawagu susuki kana
en:
come one! come all!
the rustling
pampas grass

jp: .びんづるは撫なくさるる紅葉哉
ro: binzuru wa nade nakusaruru momiji kana
en:
keeping Holy Binzuru
from being rubbed...
a red leaf

jp: .きり一葉とてもの事に西方へ
ro: kiri hito ha totemo no koto ni saihô e
en:
one paulownia leaf
good choice!
it falls westward

jp: .きり一葉二は三は四はせはしなや
ro: kiri hito ha futa ha mi ha yo ha sewashina ya
en:
one paulownia leaf
then two, three, four...
a downpour!

jp: .さをしかの角にかけたり一葉哉
ro: saoshika no tsuno ni kaketari hito ha kana
en:
snagged by the buck's
antler, one
fallen leaf

jp: .念仏に拍子のつきし一葉哉
ro: nembutsu ni hyôshi no tsukishi hito ha kana
en:
dying to the beat
of the prayer to Buddha...
one leaf falls

jp: .三ケ月の細き際より一葉哉
ro: mikazuki no hosoki kiwa yori hito ha kana
en:
from the thin curve
of the sickle moon...
one leaf falls

jp: .七尺の粟おし分て木槿哉
ro: shichi shaku no awa oshi-wakete mukuge kana
en:
pushing up through
seven feet of millet...
rose of Sharon

jp: .木槿さくや親代々の細けぶり
ro: mukuge saku ya oya dai-dai no hoso keburi
en:
roses of Sharon--
for generations
thin smoke rising

jp: .老たりな瓢と我が影法師
ro: oitari na fukube to ware ga kagebôshi
en:
the aging gourd
and I
cast our shadows

jp: .しなのぢの山が荷になる寒さ哉
ro: shinano ji no yama ga ni ni naru samu[sa] kana
en:
Shinano road's mountains
bearing down...
the cold!

jp: .年の内に春は来にけり猫の恋
ro: toshi no uchi ni haru wa ki ni keri neko no koi
en:
the year's not over
but spring comes anyway...
cats making love

jp: .有様は寒いばかりぞはつ時雨
ro: ariyô wa samui bakari zo hatsu shigure
en:
truthfully
it's cold, nothing more!
first winter rain

jp: .はつ時雨酒屋の唄に実が入ぬ
ro: hatsu shigure sakaya no uta ni mi ga irinu
en:
first winter rain--
songs in the tavern
become ripe

jp: .椋鳥の釣瓶おとしやはつ時雨
ro: mukudori no tsurube otoshi ya hatsu shigure
en:
the well bucket
for the "starlings"
first winter rain

jp: .山寺の茶に焚かれけりはつ時雨
ro: yamadera no cha ni takare keri hatsu shigure
en:
tea is steaming
at the mountain temple...
first winter rain

jp: .初時雨走り入けり山の家
ro: hatsu shigure hashiri iri keri yama no ie
en:
first winter rain--
a mad dash
to the mountain house

jp: .女郎花結れながら時雨けり
ro: ominaeshi musubare nagara shigure keri
en:
while tying up
the maiden flowers...
winter rain

jp: .柿一つつくねんとして時雨哉
ro: kaki hitotsu tsukunen to shite shigure kana
en:
one persimmon
droops listlessly...
winter rain

jp: .鶏頭のつくねんとして時雨哉
ro: keitô no tsukunen to shite shigure kana
en:
the blooming cockscomb
droops listlessly...
winter rain

jp: .しぐるるや菊を踏へてなく蛙
ro: shigururu ya kiku wo fumaete naku kawazu
en:
winter rain--
stomping on the mum
the croaking frog

jp: .しぐるるや闇の図星を雁のなく
ro: shigururu ya yami no zuboshi wo kari no naku
en:
in winter rain
toward the heart of darkness...
honking geese

jp: .はやばやとしぐれて仕廻小家哉
ro: haya-baya to shigurete shimau ko ie kana
en:
the winter rain
hurries to a finish...
little house

jp: .夕暮を下手な時雨の道りけり
ro: yûgure wo hetana shigure no tôri keri
en:
passing through evening
clumsily...
the winter rain

jp: .はつ雪に口さし出すな手どり鍋
ro: hatsu yuki ni kuchi sashidasuna tedori nabe
en:
first snow falling--
close your mouth
skillet!

jp: .はつ雪に餅腹こなす烏哉
ro: hatsu yuki ni mochi hara konasu karasu kana
en:
in first snow
digesting his rice cake...
the crow

jp: .はつ雪や俵のうへの小行灯
ro: hatsu yuki ya tawara no ue no ko andon
en:
first snowfall--
atop the rice bag
a little lamp

jp: .はつ雪や犬が先ふむ二文橋
ro: hatsu yuki ya inu ga mazu fumu ni mon-bashi
en:
in first snow
the dog goes first...
two-penny bridge

jp: .是がまあつひの栖か雪五尺
ro: kore ga maa tsui no sumika ka yuki go shaku
en:
well here it is,
my final home?
five feet of snow

jp: .掌へはらはら雪の降りにけり
ro: tenohira e hara-hara yuki no furi [ni] keri
en:
to my open palms
snowflakes flitting
down

jp: .ほちほちと雪にくるまる在所哉
ro: hochi-hochi to yuki ni kurumaru jûsho kana
en:
softly, softly
blanketed with snow...
my residence

jp: .痩脛へざくりざくりと丸雪哉
ro: yase-zune e zakuri-zakuri to arare kana
en:
on my thin legs
smack! smack!
hailstones

jp: .かくれ家や犬の天窓のすすもはく
ro: kakurega ya inu no atama no susu mo haku
en:
secluded house--
sweeping soot
off the dog's head, too

jp: .名月や御煤の過し善光寺
ro: meigetsu ya o-susu no sugishi zenkôji
en:
harvest moon--
so much soot to sweep
at Zenko Temple

jp: .せき候や七尺去って小せき候
ro: sekizoro ya shichi shaku satte ko sekizoro
en:
Twelfth Month singers--
seven feet away
a little one sings

jp: .餅つきや今それがしも古郷入
ro: mochi tsuki ya ima soregashi mo kokyô iri
en:
pounding rice cakes--
now, even I return
to my home village

jp: .山しろや小野のおく迄衣配
ro: yamashiro ya ono no oku made kinu kubari
en:
mountain castle--
even in a little field
gifts of new clothes

jp: .入相に片耳ふさぐ衾哉
ro: iriai ni kata mimi fusagu fusuma kana
en:
at the sunset bell
one ear plugged...
winter quilt

jp: .こおろぎの鳴き々這入る衾かな
ro: kôrogi no naki-naki hairu fusuma kana
en:
the cricket crawls in
chirping...
winter quilt

jp: .梟のくすくす笑ふ衾哉
ro: fukurô no kusu-kusu warau fusuma kana
en:
the owl laughs
hoo-hoo! hoo-hoo!
winter quilt

jp: .夢の世と亀を笑ふかふゆ篭
ro: yume no yo to kame wo warau ka fuyugomori
en:
in dream world
was I laughing at a turtle?
winter seclusion

jp: .鶯が先とまったぞ炭俵
ro: uguisu ga mazu tomatta zo sumi-dawara
en:
the nightingale
alit on it first...
charcoal bag

jp: .さが山や納豆汁とんめの花
ro: saga yama ya nattô shiru to n-me no hana
en:
Mount Saga--
with the natto soup
plum blossoms

jp: .納豆と同じ枕に寝る夜哉
ro: nattô to onaji makura ni neru yo kana
en:
my natto shares
my pillow...
my night's sleep

jp: .皆ござれ鰒煮る宿の角田川
ro: mina gozare fugu niru yado no sumida-gawa
en:
"Come and get it!"
boiled pufferfish
at a Sumida River inn

jp: .皆ごされ猪煮宿の角田川
ro: mina gozare shishi niru yado no sumida-gawa
en:
"Come and get
your boar stew!"
Sumida River inn

jp: .十月の十日生かみそさざい
ro: jûgatsu no tôka umare ka misosazai
en:
were you born
Tenth Month, tenth day?
wren

jp: .夜に入れば日本橋に鳴千鳥
ro: yo ni ireba nihonbashi ni naku chidori
en:
as evening falls
in Nihonbashi, a chorus
of plovers

jp: .大菊の天窓張たるおち葉哉
ro: ôgiku no atama haritaru ochiba kana
en:
slapping the big
chrysanthemum's face...
falling leaf

jp: .おち葉して憎い烏はなかりけり
ro: ochiba shite nikui karasu wa nakari keri
en:
fallen leaves--
not a single crow
is irksome

jp: .生若い紅葉もほろりほろり哉
ro: nama wakai momiji mo horori horori kana
en:
even newborn leaves
turned red...
fall like tears

jp: .紫の雲にいつ乗るにしの海
ro: murasaki no kumo ni itsu noru nishi no umi
en:
on purple clouds
when will I set sail?
western sea

jp: .浅ましや杖が何本老の松
ro: asamashi ya tsue ga nanbon oi no matsu
en:
what a shame!
how many canes prop you up
old pine?

jp: .五寸釘松もほろほろ涙哉
ro: go sun kugi matsu mo horo-horo namida kana
en:
a five-inch nail--
the pine tree
is weeping

jp: .仏ともならでうかうか老の松
ro: hotoke [to]mo narade uka-uka oi no matsu
en:
not yet Buddha--
the mindless old
pine

jp: .松蔭に寝てくふ六十よ州かな
ro: matsu kage ni nete kû roku jû yoshû kana
en:
in pine-tree shade
sleeping, eating...
sixty provinces!

jp: .竹にさへいびつでないはなかりけり
ro: take ni sae ibitsu de nai wa nakari keri
en:
even for bamboo
there's nothing but
crookedness

jp: .竹林是も丸きはなかりけり
ro: takebayashi kore mo maruki wa nakari keri
en:
bamboo grove--
here, too, there's no
perfection

jp: .あの世は千年目かよ鶴婦夫
ro: ano yo wa sennen me ka yo tsuru meoto
en:
a thousand years
until the next life?
Mr. and Mrs. Crane

jp: .草の戸も子を持って聞夜の鶴
ro: kusa no to mo ko wo motte kiku yoru no tsuru
en:
at my hut too
holding a child, listening...
evening crane

jp: .千年もけふ一日か鶴のなく
ro: sennen mo kyô ichi nichi ka tsuru no naku
en:
are your thousand years
ending today?
song of the crane

jp: .大釜の湯やたぎるらん亀の夢
ro: ôkama no yu ya tagiruran kame no yume
en:
maybe water's boiling
in the big kettle...
turtle's nightmare

jp: .亀どののいくつのとしぞ不二の山
ro: kame dono no ikutsu no toshi zo fuji no yama
en:
and how old are you
Mr. Turtle?
Mount Fuji

jp: .からからと音して亀を引ずりぬ
ro: kara-kara to oto shite kame wo hikizurinu
en:
with a thump, thump
the turtle drags
along

jp: .どこへなとも我もおぶへ磯の亀
ro: doko e na to mo ware mo obue iso no kame
en:
carry me off too
wherever you like...
beach turtle

jp: .のら猫が仏のひざを枕哉
ro: nora neko ga hotoke no hiza wo makura kana
en:
the stray cat
makes Buddha's lap
her pillow

jp: .恥入ってひらたくなるやどろぼ猫
ro: haji itte hirataku naru ya dorobo neko
en:
filled with shame
flat to the ground...
the thief cat

jp: .松島の松に生れて小すみ哉
ro: matsushima no matsu ni umarete kosumi kana
en:
born in the pines
of Matsushima...
this little nook

jp: .亡母や海見る度に見る度に
ro: naki haha ya umi miru tabi ni miru tabi ni
en:
my dead mother--
every time I see the ocean
every time...

jp: .腹中は誰も浅間のけぶり哉
ro: fukuchû wa dare mo asama no keburi kana
en:
deep inside
of everyone, Mount Asama's
smoke

jp: .正月や梅のかはりの大吹雪
ro: shôgatsu ya ume no kawari no ôfubuki
en:
First Month--
instead of plum blossoms
a blizzard

jp: .よ所並の正月もせぬしだら哉
ro: yoso nami no shôgatsu mo senu shidara kana
en:
no customary
New Year's Day
for the slob

jp: .花じゃもの我もけさから廿九
ro: hana ja mono ware mo kesa kara ni jû kyû
en:
blossoms--
from this morning on
29 springs to go

jp: .骨っぽい柴のけぶりをけさの花
ro: honeppoi shiba no keburi wo kesa no hana
en:
the brushwood fire's smoke
coaxes
morning's blossoms

jp: .すりこ木のやうな歯茎も花の春
ro: surikogi no yôna haguki mo hana no haru
en:
with gums for grinders
greeting the blossoming
spring

jp: .大雪の我家なればぞ花の春
ro: ôyuki no waga ie nareba zo hana no haru
en:
just when my house
has gotten used to deep snow...
spring blossoms

jp: .ふがいない身となおぼしそ人は春
ro: fugainai mi to na oboshiso hito wa haru
en:
do not think me
a poor-spirited soul...
mankind's spring

jp: .世の中の梅よ柳よ人は春
ro: yo [no] naka no ume yo yanagi yo hito wa haru
en:
a world of plum blossoms
and willows!
mankind's spring

jp: .人の日や改めがたし庵のかゆ
ro: hito no hi ya arata[me]gatashi io no kayu
en:
Mankind's Day--
but nothing special
in my rice gruel

jp: .薮入が供を連たる都哉
ro: yabuiri ga tomo wo tsuretaru miyako kana
en:
back from holiday
the servant brings a friend...
Kyoto

jp: .薮入の大輿の通りけり
ro: yabuiri no ô omikoshi no tôri keri
en:
Servants' Holiday--
the great festival shrine
passes by

jp: .薮入の供して行や大男
ro: yabuiri no tomo shite iku ya ô otoko
en:
joining the travelers
on Servants' Holiday...
a huge man

jp: .薮入やうらから拝む亦打山
ro: yabuiri ya ura kara ogamu matchi yama
en:
a servant on holiday
behind me says a prayer...
Mount Matchi

jp: .福豆も福茶も只の一人哉
ro: fuku mame mo fukucha mo tada no hitori kana
en:
lucky beans
and lucky tea
just for me alone

jp: .門の春雀が先へ御慶哉
ro: kado no haru suzume ga saki e gyokei kana
en:
spring at my gate--
the first New Year's greeting
from sparrows

jp: .都辺や凧の上るもむづかしき
ro: miyakobe ya tako no age[ru] mo muzukashiki
en:
a Kyoto suburb--
even flying kites
is hard

jp: .乞食も福大黒のつもり哉
ro: konjiki mo fuku daikoku no tsumori kana
en:
even the beggar
hopes to get rich...
god of wealth singers

jp: .乞食の春駒などもかすみ哉
ro: konjiki no haru koma nado mo kasumi kana
en:
a beggar's New Year's song
too
in the mist

jp: .鶯に一葉とらするわかな哉
ro: uguisu ni hito ha torasuru wakana kana
en:
one leaf
for the nightingale...
New Year's herbs

jp: .垢爪やなずなの前もはづかしき
ro: akazume ya nazuna no mae mo hazukashiki
en:
dirty nails
facing my New Year's dish
ashamed

jp: .大びらな雪のぼたぼた長閑さよ
ro: ôbirana yuki no bota-bota nodokesa yo
en:
blatantly the snow
falls pit-a-pat...
spring peace

jp: .鶏やちんば引々日の長き
ro: niwatori ya chinba hiki-hiki hi no nagaki
en:
the lame chicken
dragging, dragging...
a long day

jp: .雉の鳴く拍子に春は暮にけり
ro: kiji no naku hyôshi ni haru wa kure ni keri
en:
to the beat
of a pheasant's cries
spring dusk

jp: .鑓持よ春を逃すな合点か
ro: yari mochi yo haru wo nogasu na gatten ka
en:
hey spear holder!
don't let the spring
escape!

jp: .穴蔵の中で物いふ春の雨
ro: anagura no naka de mono iu haru no ame
en:
small talk
down in the cellar...
spring rain

jp: .起々の目に付る也春の雨
ro: oki-oki no me ni tsukeru nari haru no ame
en:
first thing after waking up
spring rain
in my eyes

jp: .挑灯を親に持たせて春の雨
ro: choûchin wo oya ni motasete haru no ame
en:
letting her parent carry
the paper lantern...
spring rain

jp: .春雨や喰れ残りの鴨が鳴
ro: harusame ya kuware-nokori no kamo ga naku
en:
spring rain--
the uneaten ducks
are quacking

jp: .春雨や鼠のなめる角田川
ro: harusame ya nezumi no nameru sumida-gawa
en:
spring rain--
a mouse licking up
Sumida River

jp: .一ッ舟に馬も来りけり春の雨
ro: hitotsu fune ni uma mo nori keri haru no ame
en:
in one boat
a horse rides too...
spring rain

jp: .草山の雨だらけ也春の風
ro: kusa yama no ame darake nari haru no kaze
en:
the haystack
soaking with rain...
spring breeze

jp: .てうちんでたばこ吹也春の風
ro: chôchin de tabako fuku nari haru no kaze
en:
smoking a pipe
by lantern light...
spring breeze

jp: .春風に尻を吹るる屋根屋哉
ro: haru kaze ni shiri wo fukaruru yaneya kana
en:
his butt cooled
by the spring breeze
roof thatcher

jp: .春風や御祓うけて帰る犬
ro: harukaze ya o-harai ukete kaeru inu
en:
spring breeze--
purified at a shrine
the dog comes home

jp: .春風や鼠のなめる角田川
ro: haru kaze ya nezumi no nameru sumida-gawa
en:
spring breeze--
a mouse licking up
Sumida River

jp: .春の風おまんが布のなりに吹
ro: haru no kaze oman ga nuno no nari ni fuku
en:
spring breeze--
Oman's cloth simply
blowing

jp: .春の風垣の茶笊を吹にけり
ro: haru no kaze kaki no chazaru wo fuki ni keri
en:
spring breeze--
the fence's tea strainer
blowing

jp: .芦の鶴宵の朧を拵ぬ
ro: ashi no tsuru yoi no oboro wo koshiraenu
en:
crane in the rushes
the evening's haze
is your doing

jp: .おぼろ夜や餅腹こなす東山
ro: oboro yo ya mochi hara konasu higashi yama
en:
night of haze
with a bellyful of rice cakes...
Higashi Mountains

jp: .かすむ日も雪の上なる住居哉
ro: kasumu hi mo yuki no ue naru sumai kana
en:
even in spring mist
it's snow-covered...
my home

jp: .かすむ日や目を縫たる雁が鳴
ro: kasumu hi ya me wo nuwaretaru kari ga naku
en:
misty day--
with their eyes sewn shut
geese honking

jp: .かすむやら目が霞やらことしから
ro: kasumu yara me ga kasumu yara kotoshi kara
en:
all is misty
even my eyes!
from this new year on

jp: .すりこ木の音に始るかすみ哉
ro: suriko-gi no oto ni hajimaru kasumi kana
en:
with the pounding
of a pestle
the mist gathers

jp: .泣な子供赤いかすみがなくなるぞ
ro: naku na kodomo akai kasumi ga nakunaru zo
en:
don't cry, children!
the red mist
has passed away

jp: .西山やおのれがのるはどのかすみ
ro: nishi yama ya onore ga noru wa dono kasumi
en:
western mountains
when I'm carried away
which mist will I ride?

jp: .御仏の手桶の月もかすむ也
ro: mi-botoke no teoke no tsuki mo kasumu nari
en:
the moon
in Buddha's bucket, too...
mist-covered

jp: .陽炎に成っても仕舞へ草の家
ro: kagerô ni natte mo shimae kusa no ie
en:
you, too, turn to
heat shimmers...
my thatched house

jp: .陽炎や臼の中からま一すじ
ro: kagerô ya usu no naka kara ma hito suji
en:
heat shimmers--
from inside the rice cake tub
one more

jp: .陽炎や鍬で追やる村烏
ro: kagerô ya kuwa de oiyaru mura-garasu
en:
heat shimmers--
chasing the village crow
with a hoe

jp: .陽炎や子に迷ふ鶏の遠歩き
ro: kagerô ya ko ni mayou tori no tô aruki
en:
heat shimmers--
the child's lost chicken
struts in the distance

jp: .庵の雪下手な消やうしたりけり
ro: io no yuki hetana keshiyô shitari keri
en:
my hut's snow
not very good
at dying

jp: .雁鴨に鳴立られて雪げ哉
ro: kari kamo ni naki taterarete yukige kana
en:
geese and ducks
honking, quacking it away...
melting snow

jp: .しなのぢや雪が消れば蚊がさはぐ
ro: shinano ji ya yuki ga kiereba ka ga sawagu
en:
Shinano road--
when the snow finally melts
mosquitoes whine

jp: .雀来よ四角にとけし門の雪
ro: suzume ki yo yosumi ni tokeshi kado no yuki
en:
come, sparrows
in all four corners the gate's
snow is melting!

jp: .大切な雪がきへけり朝寝坊
ro: taisetsuna yuki ga kie keri asanebô
en:
the momentous snow
has melted away...
late riser

jp: .けふぎりや出代る隙の凧
ro: kyôgiri ya degawa[ru] hima no ikanobori
en:
servants take a break
from their migration...
kite flying

jp: .出代やいづくも同じ梅の花
ro: degawari ya izuku mo onaji ume no hana
en:
migrating servants--
wherever you go, the same
plum blossoms!

jp: .後家雛も一つ桜の木の間哉
ro: goke hina mo hitotsu sakura no ki no ma kana
en:
the widow, too
leaves a doll
among the cherry trees

jp: .草つみや羽織の上になく蛙
ro: kusa tsumi ya haori no ue ni naku kawazu
en:
picking herbs--
on my coat a croaking
frog

jp: .古笠へざくりざくりとこき茶哉
ro: furu kasa e zakuri-zakuri to koki cha kana
en:
on the old umbrella-hat
smack! smack!
threshing tea leaves

jp: .山烏手伝ふてやく小藪哉
ro: yama-garasu tetsudaute yaku ko yabu kana
en:
a mountain crow
helps the fire setters...
little thicket

jp: .山やけや畠の中の水風呂へ
ro: yama yake ya hatake no naka no suifuro e
en:
grass fire on its way
to the hot tub
in the field

jp: .子どもらが遊ぶ程ずつやくの哉
ro: kodomora ga asobu hodo-zutsu yaku no kana
en:
the children
make it a playground...
burnt field

jp: .里人のねまる程づつやく野哉
ro: sato-bito no nemaru hodo-zutsu yaku no kana
en:
as if the villagers
are frozen...
burning field

jp: .野火山火夜も世の中よいとやな
ro: nobi yama hi yoru mo yo [no] naka yoi to ya na
en:
fire on field and mountain--
at night this world
ain't bad!

jp: .我蒔いた種をやれやれけさの霜
ro: waga maita tane wo yareyare kesa no [shimo]
en:
where I planted seeds
oh well!
morning frost

jp: .鶏の番をしているつぎ木哉
ro: niwatori no ban wo shite iru tsugiki  kana
en:
the chicken
is standing guard...
my grafted tree

jp: .庵の猫玉の盃そこなきぞ
ro: io no neko tama no sakazuki soko naki zo
en:
hut's cat
deep in the sake goblet
yowling!

jp: .大猫よはやく行け行け妻が鳴く
ro: ô neko yo hayaku ike ike tsuma ga naku
en:
hey big cat
shake a leg!
the wife calls

jp: .なの花にまぶれて来たり猫の恋
ro: na no hana ni maburete kitari neko no koi
en:
smeared with flowering
rape, here comes
the lover cat

jp: .菜の花も猫の通ひぢ吹とぢよ
ro: na no hana mo neko no kayoiji fukitoji yo
en:
O flowering rape
blow the cat's prowling route
shut!

jp: .春日のやあくたれ鹿も角落る
ro: kasuga no ya akutare shika mo tsuno ochiru
en:
Kasuga Field--
even the rascally buck
sheds his antlers

jp: .さをしかに手拭かさん角の跡
ro: saoshika ni tenugui kasan tsuno no ato
en:
may I offer you
a head scarf?
buck after antler-shedding

jp: .さをしかの桜を見てや角落る
ro: saoshika no sakura wo mite ya tsuno ochi[ru]
en:
the buck looks
at cherry blossoms...
shedding his antlers

jp: .我宿は何にもないぞ巣立鳥
ro: waga yado wa nannimo nai zo su-dachi tori
en:
at my house
there's nothing!
the bird's left the nest

jp: .今生えた竹の先也雀の子
ro: ima haeta take no saki nari suzume no ko
en:
on the tip of the
newly sprouted bamboo...
a baby sparrow

jp: .かはるがはる巣の番したり親雀
ro: kawaru-gawaru su no ban shitari oya suzume
en:
taking turns
guarding the nest...
parent sparrows

jp: .雀子を遊ばせておく畳哉
ro: suzumego wo asobasete oku tatami kana
en:
the baby sparrow
is allowed to play...
tatami mat

jp: .雀子も朝開帳の間にあひぬ
ro: suzumego mo asa kaichô no ma ni ainu
en:
baby sparrows, too
arrive for the Buddha's
morning show

jp: .雀の子庵の埃がむさいやら
ro: suzume no ko io no hokori ga musai yara
en:
baby sparrow--
the dust in this hut
is filthy!

jp: .大仏の鼻で鳴也雀の子
ro: daibutsu no hana de naku nari suzume no ko
en:
in the great bronze
Buddha's nose chirping...
sparrow babies

jp: .鶯のけむい顔する山家哉
ro: uguisu no kemui kao suru yamaga kana
en:
the nightingale
makes a face in the smoke...
mountain home

jp: .跡なるは鶯のひとり娘哉
ro: ato naru wa uguisu no hitori musume kana
en:
staying behind--
the nightingale's only
daughter

jp: .鶯にあてがっておく垣ね哉
ro: uguisu ni ategatte oku kakine kana
en:
nightingale
this fence is reserved
for you

jp: .鶯の御気に入けり御侍
ro: uguisu no o-ki ni iri keri o-samurai
en:
catching the spirit
of the nightingale's song...
samurai

jp: .鶯のかたもつやうな雀哉
ro: uguisu [no] kata motsu yôna suzume kana
en:
he seems to have
the nightingale's back...
sparrow

jp: .鶯の苦にもせぬ也ばくち小屋
ro: uguisu no ku ni mo senu nari bakuchi goya
en:
the nightingale
not at all concerned...
little gambling shack

jp: .鶯の真似して居れば鶯ぞ
ro: uguisu no mane shite ireba uguisu yo
en:
while imitating
a nightingale...
a nightingale!

jp: .鶯や何が不足ですぐ通り
ro: uguisu ya nani ga fusoku de sugu tôri
en:
hey nightingale--
why the rush
to go so soon?

jp: .鶯よたばこにむせな江戸の山
ro: uguisu yo tabako ni musena edo no yama
en:
nightingale, don't suffocate
from the pipe smoke!
Edo mountain

jp: .武士や鶯に迄つかはるる
ro: samurai ya uguisu ni made tsukawaruru
en:
samurai--
even the nightingale
gives orders

jp: .鳴けよ鳴けよ下手でもおれが鶯ぞ
ro: nake yo nake yo heta demo ore ga uguisu zo
en:
sing! sing!
though off key
my nightingale

jp: .寝ながらや軒の鶯うぐひすな
ro: ne nagara ya noki no uguisu uguisu na
en:
trying to sleep--
that nightingale on the eaves
is a nightingale!

jp: .宮様の鶯と云ぬばかり哉
ro: miyasama no uguisu to iwanu bakari kana
en:
he's a prince
of a nightingale!
you could say

jp: .久しぶりの顔もって来る燕哉
ro: hisashiburi no kao motte kuru tsubame kana
en:
arriving with faces that say
it's been a long time...
swallows

jp: .大井川見へてそれから雲雀哉
ro: ôigawa miete so[re] kara hibari kana
en:
seeing Oi River
and then...
a lark

jp: .釣舟は花の上こぐ雲雀哉
ro: tsuri-bune wa hana no ue kogu hibari kana
en:
a fishing boat rows
over blossoms...
a skylark

jp: .昼飯をたべに下りたる雲雀哉
ro: hirumeshi wo tabe ni oritaru hibari kana
en:
coming down
to eat his lunch...
skylark

jp: .きじ鳴や汁鍋けぶる草の原
ro: kiji naku ya shiru nabe keburu kusa no hara
en:
a pheasant cries--
soup steam wafts over
wild grasses

jp: .野社の赤過しとやきじの鳴
ro: no yashiro no aka sugoshi to ya kiji no naku
en:
"The shrine in the field
is too red!"
the pheasant cries

jp: .昼ごろや雉の歩く大座敷
ro: hiru goro ya kigisu no aruku ôzashiki
en:
around noon a pheasant
passes through...
the big sitting room

jp: .焼飯は烏とるとやきじの鳴
ro: yakimeshi wa karasu toru to ya kiji no naku
en:
"The crow took
the fried rice!"
the pheasant cries

jp: .夕雉の寝所にしたる社哉
ro: yû kiji no ne-doko ni shitaru yashiro kana
en:
the evening pheasant's
sleeping place...
a little shrine

jp: .夕きじの走り留まりや草と空
ro: yû kiji no hashiri-domari ya kusa to sora
en:
the evening pheasant
runs then stops...
grass and sky

jp: .かしましや江戸見た雁の帰り様
ro: kashimashi ya edo mita kari no kaeri-sama
en:
clamorous
wild geese who saw Edo
returning home

jp: .善光寺も直ぐ通りして帰る雁
ro: zenkôji mo sugu tôri shite kae[ru] kari
en:
Zenko Temple, too
quickly passed over...
geese flying north

jp: .又かとて鹿の見るらん帰る雁
ro: mata ka tote shika no miruran kaeru kari
en:
once again
the deer see them off..
geese flying north

jp: .行な雁どっこも茨のうき世ぞや
ro: yuku na kari dokko mo bara no ukiyo zo ya
en:
don't go geese!
everywhere it's a floating world
of sorrow

jp: .浅草の不二を踏へてなく蛙
ro: asakusa no fuji wo fumaete naku kawazu
en:
trampling Asakusa's
little Fuji...
a croaking frog

jp: .狗にここ迄来いと蛙哉
ro: enokoro ni koko made kii to kawazu kana
en:
"Hey puppy
come here!" croaks
the frog

jp: .草の葉にかくれんぼする蛙哉
ro: kusa no ha ni kakurenbo suru kawazu kana
en:
in leaves of grass
playing hide-and-seek...
a frog

jp: .ちる花にあごを並べる蛙哉
ro: chiru hana ni ago wo naraberu kawazu kana
en:
chin-deep
in the fallen blossoms...
a frog

jp: .なの花に隠居してなく蛙哉
ro: na no hana ni inkyo shite naku kawazu kana
en:
in his retreat
in the flowering rape
a croaking frog

jp: .のさのさと恋をするかの蛙哉
ro: nosa-nosa to koi wo suru ka no kawazu kana
en:
enjoying your sex
so shamelessly?
frogs

jp: .疱瘡のさんだらぼしへ蛙哉
ro: hôsô no sandara-boshi e kawazu kana
en:
onto a straw lid
marked "Smallpox"
hops a frog

jp: .むきむきに蛙のいとこはとこ哉
ro: muki muki ni kawazu no itoko hatoko kana
en:
facing every-which way
frog cousins
and second cousins!

jp: .むだ口は一つも明ぬ蛙哉
ro: muda kuchi wa hitotsu mo akenu kawazu kana
en:
never opening
their mouths in vain...
frogs

jp: .木母寺の花を敷寝の蛙哉
ro: mokuboji no hana wo shikine no kawazu kana
en:
at Mokubo Temple
bunking on a flower...
a frog

jp: .ゆうぜんとして山を見る蛙哉
ro: yûzen to shite yama wo miru kawazu kana
en:
serene and still
the mountain-viewing
frog

jp: .世の中は是程よいを啼蛙
ro: yo [no] naka wa kore hodo yoi wo naku kawazu
en:
even around here
the world is good!
frogs croaking

jp: .うら住や五尺の空も春のてふ
ro: urazumi ya goshaku no sora mo haru no chô
en:
my back-alley home--
five feet of sky
but spring butterflies

jp: .けさの雨蝶がねぶって仕廻けり
ro: kesa no ame chô ga nebutte shimai keri
en:
morning rain--
a butterfly licks
it up

jp: .するがぢは蝶も見るらん不二の夢
ro: surugaji wa chô mo miruran fuji no yume
en:
Suruga Road--
even the butterflies dream
about Mount Fuji

jp: .茶の淡や蝶は毎日来てくれる
ro: cha no awa ya chô wa mainichi kite kureru
en:
weak tea--
every day the butterfly
stops by

jp: .茶のけぶり蝶の面へ吹かける
ro: cha no keburi chô no tsura e fukikakeru
en:
tea smoke--
into the butterfly's face
it blows

jp: .蝶来るや何のしやうもない庵へ
ro: chô kuru ya nanno shiyô mo nai io e
en:
a butterfly comes
to my good-for-nothing
hut

jp: .てふ小てふ小蝶の中の山家哉
ro: chô ko chô ko chô no naka no yamaga kana
en:
amid butterflies
little butterflies
mountain home

jp: .蝶々や猫と四眠の寺座敷
ro: chô[chô] ya neko to shimin no tera zashiki
en:
a butterfly, a cat
deep asleep...
temple sitting room

jp: .手枕や蝶は毎日来てくれる
ro: temakura ya chô wa mainichi kite kureru
en:
an arm for a pillow--
every day the butterfly
visits

jp: .寝るてふにかしておくぞよ膝がしら
ro: neru chô ni kashite oku zo yo hizagashira
en:
lending it
to the sleeping butterfly...
my knee

jp: .のら猫よ見よ見よ蝶のおとなしき
ro: nora neko yo mi yo mi yo chô no otonashiki
en:
stray cat
look! the butterfly's
well-behaved

jp: .丸く寝た犬にべったり小てふ哉
ro: maruku neta inu ni bettari ko chô kana
en:
stuck to the dog
curled asleep...
a butterfly

jp: .山蜂や鳴々抜る寺座敷
ro: yama hachi ya naki-naki nukeru tera zashiki
en:
mountain bees
buzz-buzz pass through
the temple room

jp: .大鶴の大事に歩く菫哉
ro: ôtsuru no daiji ni aruku sumire kana
en:
the big crane walks
with great importance...
violets

jp: .菫咲川をとび越す美人哉
ro: sumire saku kawa wo tobi-kosu bijin kana
en:
hopping over the river
of blooming violets...
pretty woman

jp: .かるた程門のなの花咲にけり
ro: karuta hodo kado no na no hana saki ni keri
en:
like playing cards
these blossoms of rape
at the gate

jp: .鉄釘のやうな蕨も都哉
ro: kanakugi no yôna warabi mo miyako kana
en:
even the bracken
are like nails...
Kyoto

jp: .草陰に棒のやうなる蕨哉
ro: kusa kage ni bô no yô naru warabi kana
en:
in grassy shade
looking like canes...
the bracken

jp: .鳥べのの地蔵菩薩の蕨哉
ro: tori be no no jizô bosatsu no warabi kana
en:
for Toribe Field's
holy Jizo...
bracken

jp: .茨の芽も皆々人に喰れけり
ro: bara no me mo mina-mina hito ni kuware keri
en:
even wild rose buds--
all eaten
by people

jp: .かまくらや昔どなたの千代椿
ro: kamakura ya mukashi donata no chiyo tsubaki
en:
Kamakura--
who planted these camellias
in olden times?

jp: .梅がかに四角な家はなかりけり
ro: ume ga ka ni shikaku-na ie wa nakari keri
en:
plum blossom scent--
a house with four walls
can't be found

jp: .梅がかや子供の声の穴かしこ
ro: ume ga ka ya kodomo no koe no ana kashiko
en:
plum blossom scent--
the voices of children
sound reverent

jp: .梅さくや飴の鶯口を明く
ro: ume sake ya ame no uguisu kuchi wo aku
en:
plum blossoms--
the candy nightingale
opens his mouth

jp: .梅さくや犬にまたがる桃太郎
ro: ume saku ya inu ni matagaru momotarô
en:
plum blossoms--
riding a dog
the Peach Boy

jp: .かくれ家や茶をにる程は梅の花
ro: kakurega ya cha wo niru hodo wa ume [no] hana
en:
secluded house--
enough plum blossoms
for brewing tea

jp: .里犬のなぐさみなきや梅の花
ro: sato inu no nagusami naki ya ume no hana
en:
nothing special
to the village dog...
plum blossoms

jp: .のら猫に引っかかれけり梅の花
ro: nora neko ni hikkakare keri ume no hana
en:
snatched
by the stray cat...
plum blossoms

jp: .畠の梅したたか犬におとさるる
ro: hata no ume shitata[ka] inu ni otosaruru
en:
plum blossoms
of the field dropped...
naughty dog

jp: .人のするほふほけ経も梅の花
ro: hito no suru hôhokekyô mo ume no hana
en:
someone chanting
the Lotus Sutra...
plum blossoms

jp: .滝かぶり側で見てさへ花の雲
ro: taki keburi soba de mite sae hana no kumo
en:
waterfall's mist--
even here, off to the side
blossom clouds

jp: .ちる花を引っかぶりたる狗哉
ro: chiru hana wo hikkabu[ri]taru enoko kana
en:
tucking himself in
under fallen blossoms
puppy

jp: .ちる花に息を殺して都鳥
ro: chiru hana ni iki wo koroshite miyakodori
en:
in scattering blossoms
holding their breath...
sea gulls

jp: .ちる花や今の小町が尻の跡
ro: chiru hana ya ima no komachi ga shiri no ato
en:
fallen blossoms--
the stylish woman leaves
her butt print

jp: .乗り物の花盗人よぬす人よ
ro: norimono no hana nusubito yo nusubito yo
en:
riding in a palanquin
the blossom thief!
blossom thief!

jp: .花の山心の鬼も出てあそべ
ro: hana no yama kokoro no oni mo dete asobe
en:
blossoming mountain--
come out and play
devil in me!

jp: .古垣も花の三月十日哉
ro: furu kaki mo hana no sangatsu tôka kana
en:
the old fence too
has Third Month, 10th day
blossoms!

jp: .笠きるや桜さく日を吉日と
ro: kasa kiru ya sakura saku hi wo kichi nichi to
en:
donning my umbrella-hat--
cherry blossoms portend
a lucky day

jp: .傘にべたりべたりと桜哉
ro: karakasa ni betari-betari to sakura kana
en:
sticking, sticking
to paper umbrellas...
cherry blossoms

jp: .塵箱にへばり付たる桜哉
ro: chiribako ni hebari tsuketaru sakura kana
en:
lining the bottom
of the trash can...
cherry blossoms

jp: .ちる桜犬に詫して通りけり
ro: chiru sakura inu ni wabishite tôri keri
en:
the cherry blossoms fall--
I apologize to a dog
in passing

jp: .待々し桜と成れどひとり哉
ro: machi-machishi sakura to naredo hitori kana
en:
cherry blossoms
I waited and waited for...
I'm alone

jp: .山桜序に願をかける也
ro: yama-zakura tsuide ni gan no kakeru nari
en:
while viewing mountain
cherry blossoms...
a prayer

jp: .夕桜鉦としゅもくの間にちる
ro: yûzakura kane to shumoku no ai ni chiru
en:
evening cherry blossoms
to the prayer gong's beat
scatter

jp: .柳から梅から御出狐哉
ro: yanagi kara ume kara on-deru kitsune kana
en:
from willow tree
from plum tree comes
the fox!

jp: .柳からももんぐわとて出る子哉
ro: yanagi kara momonguwa tote deru ko kana
en:
from the willow
a ghost attacks!
the child

jp: .夏のよや焼飯程の不二の山
ro: natsu no yo ya yakimeshi hodo no fuji no yama
en:
summer night--
like a lump of fried rice
Mount Fuji

jp: .露ちりて急にみじかくなるよ哉
ro: tsuyu chirite kyû ni mijikaku naru yo kana
en:
dewdrops spilling--
suddenly the nights
grow short

jp: .短夜の真中にさくつつじ哉
ro: mijika yo no man naka ni saku tsutsuji kana
en:
in the middle of the short
summer night blooming...
azaleas

jp: .短夜や妹が蚕の喰盛
ro: mijika yo ya imo ga kaiko no kui-zakari
en:
short summer night--
sister's silkworms
in a feeding frenzy

jp: .短よや獅ﾌ口のさわがしき
ro: mijika yo ya kaiko no kuchi no sawagashiki
en:
short summer night--
the silkworms' mouths
chomping

jp: .短よや髪ゆひどのの草の花
ro: mijika yo ya kamiyui dono no kusa no hana
en:
short summer night--
the hairdresser's wildflowers
blooming

jp: .短夜や傘程の花のさく
ro: mijika yo ya karakasa hodo no hana no saku
en:
short summer night--
an umbrella-shaped flower
has bloomed

jp: .短夜やくねり盛の女郎花
ro: mijika yo ya kuneri-zakari no ominaeshi
en:
in the short summer night
wriggling to climax...
maiden flowers

jp: .短夜やにくまれ口をなく蛙
ro: mijika yo ya nikumare-guchi wo naku kawazu
en:
short summer night--
the frogs croaking
trash talk

jp: .風鈴のやうな花さく暑哉
ro: fûrin no yôna hana saku atsusa kana
en:
the flower that looks
like a wind-chime blooms...
the heat

jp: .おお涼しおお涼し夜も三十日哉
ro: ôsuzushi ôsuzushi yo mo misoka kana
en:
oh cool cool
evening!
the month's last day

jp: .下々も下々下々の下国の涼しさよ
ro: gege mo gege gege no gegoku no suzushisa yo
en:
it's a down, down
downtrodden land...
but cool!

jp: .涼風の月も〆出す丸屋哉
ro: suzukaze [no] tsuki mo shimedasu maroya kana
en:
the cool, windy moon
is shut out too...
thatched hut

jp: .涼しさに雪も氷も二文哉
ro: suzushisa ni yuki mo kôri mo ni mon kana
en:
what cool air--
snow and ice
two cents apiece

jp: .涼しさに我と火に入るきりぎりす
ro: suzushisa ni ware to hi ni iru kirigirisu
en:
in the cool air
me and flame-drawn
katydid

jp: .涼しさや今拵へし夜の山
ro: suzushisa ya ima koshiraeshi yoru no yama
en:
cool air--
the evening mountain
becomes itself

jp: .涼しさや枕程なる門の山
ro: suzushisa ya makura hodo naru kado no yama
en:
cool air--
like pillows beyond the gate
the mountains

jp: .涼しさや又西からも夕小雨
ro: suzushisa ya mata nishi kara mo yûkosame
en:
cool air--
again from the west
an evening shower

jp: .涼しさは天王様の月よ哉
ro: suzushisa wa tennôsama no tsuki yo kana
en:
cool air--
a moonlit night fit
for a god

jp: .大の字に寝て涼しさよ淋しさよ
ro: dai no ji ni nete suzushisa yo sabishisa yo
en:
lying spread-eagle
cool
lonely

jp: .何もないが心安さよ涼しさよ
ro: nanimo nai ga kokoroyasusa yo suzushisa yo
en:
nothing at all
but a calm heart
and cool air

jp: .草二本我夕立をはやす也
ro: kusa nihon ware yûdachi wo hayasu nari
en:
two blades of grass
cheer for the cloudburst
I bring

jp: .ござるぞよ戸隠山の御夕立
ro: gozaru zo yo togakushiyama no o-yûdachi
en:
blessings fall
on Mount Togakushi...
a cloudburst

jp: .小むしろやはした夕立それもよい
ro: sa mushiro ya hashita yûdachi sore mo yoi
en:
little straw mat--
the cloudburst just a spurt
but a good one

jp: .真丸に一夕立の始りぬ
ro: man maru ni hito yûdachi no hajimarinu
en:
perfectly round
the cloud's first
burst

jp: .身にならぬ夕立ほろりほろり哉
ro: mi ni naranu yûdachi horori horori kana
en:
taking the cloudburst's
place
just teardrops

jp: .夕立に椀をさし出す庵哉
ro: yûdachi ni wan wo sashida[su] iori kana
en:
a bowl to catch
the cloudburst...
my hut

jp: .夕立やかゆき所へ手のとどく
ro: yûdachi ya kayuki tokoro e te no todoku
en:
a summer rainstorm--
scratches
my itch

jp: .たのもしや西紅の#38642;の峰
