ro: tanomoshi ya nishi kurenai no kumo no mine
en:
a good omen--
in the west, deep red
billowing clouds

jp: .投出した足の先也雲の峰
ro: nagedashita ashi no saki nari kumo no mine
en:
on the tips
of my outstretched toes...
billowing clouds

jp: .昼ごろや枕程でも雲の峰
ro: hiru goro ya makura hodo demo kumo no mine
en:
noontime--
about pillow high
the billowing clouds

jp: .水およぐ蚤の思ひや雲の峰
ro: mizu oyogu nomi no omoi ya kumo no mine
en:
the swimming flea
thinks to reach them...
peaks of clouds

jp: .むだ雲やむだ山作る又作る
ro: muda kumo ya muda yama tsukuru mata tsukuru
en:
vain clouds
forming vain peaks
in vain

jp: .雲見てもつい眠る也夏の山
ro: kumo mite mo tsui nemuru nari natsu no yama
en:
watching the clouds
drifting to sleep...
summer mountain

jp: .鶯が果報過たる清水哉
ro: uguisu ga kahô sugitaru shimizu kana
en:
the nightingale's
good karma overflows...
pure water

jp: .つつじから出てつつじの清水哉
ro: tsutsuji kara idete tsutsuji no shimizu kana
en:
from the azaleas
the azaleas' pure
water

jp: .ほのぼのと朝顔がさくし水哉
ro: hono-bono to asagao ga saku shimizu kana
en:
flimsily
the morning-glories bloom...
pure water

jp: .山里は馬の浴るも清水哉
ro: yama-zato wa uma no abiru mo shimizu kana
en:
mountain village--
even the horse bathes
in pure water

jp: .わか赤い花の咲きけり苔清水
ro: waka akai hana no saki keri koke shimizu
en:
new red flowers
have bloomed...
pure water over moss

jp: .我宿はしなのの月と清水哉
ro: waga yado wa shinano no tsuki to shimizu kana
en:
at my home
Shinano's moon
and pure water!

jp: .門先や掌程の田も青む
ro: kado saki ya tenohira hodo no ta mo aomu
en:
at the gate
a palm-sized rice field too
has greened

jp: .一人前田も青ませて夕木魚
ro: hitorimae ta mo aomasete yû mokugyo
en:
my portion of rice field
turns green too...
evening's wooden drum

jp: .ほまし田も先青むぞよ青むぞよ
ro: homachi ta mo mazu aomu zo yo aomu zo yo
en:
my side-field of rice--
the first to turn
green! green!

jp: .軒下も人のもの也青田原
ro: noki shita mo hito no mono nari aodabara
en:
even under the eaves
human handiwork...
a green rice field

jp: .御祭りや誰子宝の赤扇
ro: o-matsuri ya taga ko-dakara no aka ôgi
en:
festival--
for whose treasured child
this red fan?

jp: .御祭り扇ならして草臥ぬ
ro: on-matsuri ôgi narashite kutabirenu
en:
festival--
snapping my fan
wore me out

jp: .灯籠のやうな花さく御祓哉
ro: tôrô no yôna hana saku misogi kana
en:
a flower shaped
like a Bon lantern...
purification ritual

jp: .都鳥古く仕へよ川やしろ
ro: miyakodori furuku tsukae yo kawa yashiro
en:
the sea gull
is an old devotee...
river shrine

jp: .宿かりに鴎も来るか川やしろ
ro: yadokari ni kamome mo kuru ka kawa yashiro
en:
are you renting a home
sea gull?
river shrine

jp: .川がりや地蔵のひざの小脇差
ro: kawagari ya jizô no niza no ko wakazashi
en:
night fishing--
on St. Jizo's lap
a short sword

jp: .月のすみ松の陰より夜川哉
ro: tsuki no sumi matsu no kage yori yo kawa kana
en:
moonlight nook--
from the pine's shadow
night fishing

jp: .舟の鵜や子の鳴窓を跡にして
ro: fune no u ya ko no naku mado wo ato ni shite
en:
cormorant boat--
her children cry in the window
left behind

jp: .牛馬の汗の玉ちる草葉哉
ro: ushi uma no ase no tama chiru kusaba kana
en:
sweat drops from cows
from horses...
blades of grass

jp: .老の身や一汗入れて直ぐに又
ro: oi no mi ya hito ase irete sugu ni mata
en:
growing old--
one drop of sweat
soon, another

jp: .けふの日や替てもやはり苔衣
ro: kyô no hi ya kaete mo yahari kokegoromo
en:
this day perhaps
even I'll do it...
new summer robe

jp: .更衣門の榎と遊びけり
ro: koromogae kado no enoki to asobi keri
en:
in our new summer robes
the gate's nettle tree
and me

jp: .下谷一番の顔してころもがへ
ro: shitaya ichiban no kao shite koromogae
en:
the first and best
of Shitaya Ward...
in summer kimono

jp: .渋紙のやうな顔して更衣
ro: shibugami no yôna kao shite koromogae
en:
with a face like he's licked
persimmon paper...
a new summer robe

jp: .四ン月のしの字嫌ひや更衣
ro: shingatsu no shi no ji-girai ya koromogae
en:
hating the "four"
of Fourth Month...
the change to summer clothes

jp: .手の皺を引伸しけり更衣
ro: te no shiwa wo hikinobashi keri koromogae
en:
stretching out
the hand's wrinkles...
a new summer robe

jp: .白雲を袂に入て袷かな
ro: shira-gumo wo tamoto ni irete awase kana
en:
letting white cloud
into the sleeves...
summer robe

jp: .滝けぶり袂に這入る袷哉
ro: taki keburi tamoto ni hairu awase kana
en:
waterfall's mist
crawls into my sleeves...
summer kimono

jp: .帷を真四角にぞきたりけり
ro: katabira wo masshikaku ni zo kitari keri
en:
putting on
the summer kimono...
a perfect square!

jp: .帷子にいよいよ四角な爺哉
ro: katabira ni iyo-iyo shikaku na jijii kana
en:
in his summer kimono
more and more square...
old man

jp: .古郷や蚊屋につり込草の花
ro: furutsato ya kaya ni tsuri-komu kusa no hana
en:
my home village--
dangling into the mosquito net
wildflowers

jp: .御祭りや誰子宝の赤扇
ro: o-matsuri ya taga ko-dakara no aka ôgi
en:
festival day--
some treasured child's
red fan

jp: .西山や扇おとしに行く月夜
ro: nishi yama ya ôgi otoshi ni yuku tsuki yo
en:
western mountains--
I'm off to play paper fan gliders
under the moon

jp: .髭どののかざさるる也京扇
ro: hige dono no kazasaruru nari kyô ôgi
en:
shading
Mr. Long-Beard's eyes...
a paper fan from Kyoto

jp: .帯に似て山のこし巡る蚊やり哉
ro: obi ni nite yama no koshi meguru ka yari kana
en:
like a belt encircling
the mountain's hips...
smudge pot smoke

jp: .蚊いぶしもなぐさみになるひとり哉
ro: ka ibushi mo nagusami ni naru hitori kana
en:
the smudge pot smoke
is a comfort...
my life alone

jp: .古郷や蚊やり蚊やりのよこがすみ
ro: furusato ya ka yari ka yari no yoko-gasumi
en:
my home village--
the smudge pots trailing
mist

jp: .門へ打つ水も銭なり江戸住居
ro: kado e utsu mizu mo zeni nari edo sumai
en:
even water sprinkled
at the gate costs money...
life in Edo

jp: .虫干やふとんの上のきりぎりす
ro: mushiboshi ya futon no ue no kirigirisu
en:
airing out the bedding--
atop the futon
a katydid

jp: .有明に涼み直すやおのが家
ro: ariake ni suzumi naosu ya ono ga ie
en:
at dawn
cool air is restored...
my house

jp: .大涼無疵な夜もなかりけり
ro: ôsuzumi mukizuna yoru mo nakari keri
en:
this evening's
cooling off...
not quite flawless

jp: .門涼み夜は煤くさくなかりけり
ro: kado suzumi yo wa susu kusaku nakari keri
en:
cool air at the gate--
the evening isn't
soot-grimed

jp: .臑一本竹一本ぞ夕涼み
ro: sune ippon take ippon zo yûsuzumi
en:
just me
and a stalk of bamboo...
evening cool

jp: .芭蕉翁の脛をかじって夕涼
ro: bashô-ô no sune wo kajitte yûsuzumi
en:
feeding on
Old Basho's legs...
evening cool

jp: .夜々は本ンの都ぞ門涼
ro: yoru yoru wa hon no miyako zo kado suzumi
en:
night after night
this is true Kyoto!
cooling at the gate

jp: .山人や雪の御かげに京ま入
ro: yamaudo ya yuki no o-kage ni kyô mairi
en:
the mountain hermit
under a bundle of snow
Kyoto-bound

jp: .一尺の滝も涼しさや心太
ro: isshaku no taki mo suzushisa ya tokoroten
en:
the one-foot waterfall
is also cool...
sweet jelly

jp: .小盥や不二の上なる心太
ro: ko-darai ya fuji no ue naru tokoroten
en:
little tub--
on top of Mount Fuji
sweet jelly

jp: .旅人や山に腰かけて心太
ro: tabibito ya yama ni koshi kakete tokoroten
en:
traveler--
on a mountain he sits
with sweet jelly

jp: .心太から流けり男女川
ro: tokoroten kara nagare keri minano-gawa
en:
from a tub
of sweet jelly it flows...
Minano River

jp: .心太すすきもともにそよぐぞよ
ro: tokoroten susuki mo tomo ni soyogu zo yo
en:
sweet jelly
along with the pampas grass
sways

jp: .臼程の月が出たとや時鳥
ro: usu hodo no tsuki ga deta to ya hototogisu
en:
the moon like a tub
has risen...
"cuckoo!"

jp: .江戸の雨何石呑んだ時鳥
ro: edo no ame nan goku nonda hototogisu
en:
how many gallons
of Edo's rain did you drink?
cuckoo

jp: .江戸迄も只一息かほととぎす
ro: edo made mo tada hito iki ka hototogisu
en:
almost spitting distance
to Edo, eh?
cuckoo

jp: .木曽山や雪かき分て時鳥
ro: kiso yama ya yukikaki wakete hototogisu
en:
Kiso Mountains--
plowing through the snow
a cuckoo

jp: .小けぶりが雲を作るぞ時鳥
ro: ko keburi ga kumo wo tsuku[ru] zo hototogisu
en:
a little smoke
makes a cloud...
"cuckoo!"

jp: .さをしかの角傾けて時鳥
ro: saoshika no tsuno katamukete hototogisu
en:
the young buck's
antlers tilting...
"cuckoo!"

jp: .せはしさを人にうつすな時鳥
ro: sewashisa wo hito ni utsusuna hototogisu
en:
I hope your busy-ness
isn't contagious
cuckoo!

jp: .どれどれが汝が山ぞほととぎす
ro: dore-dore ga nanji ga yama zo hototogisu
en:
which, oh which
is your mountain?
cuckoo

jp: .仲々に聞かぬが仏ほととぎす
ro: naka-naka ni kikanu ga hotoke hototogisu
en:
heard so rarely
makes it precious...
"cuckoo!"

jp: .汝迄蚤とり目ほととぎす
ro: nanji made nomi tori manako hototogisu
en:
even you
have "flea-spotting eyes"...
cuckoo

jp: .寝ぼけたかばか時鳥ばか烏
ro: neboketa ka baka hototogisu baka karasu
en:
are you half-asleep?
foolish cuckoo
foolish crow

jp: .寝ぼけたか八兵衛村の時鳥
ro: neboketa ka hachibee mura no hototogisu
en:
are you half-asleep?
prostitute quarter
cuckoo

jp: .寝ぼけたか八兵衛と馬と時鳥
ro: neboketa ka hachibee to uma to hototogisu
en:
are you half-asleep?
prostitute quarter
horse and cuckoo

jp: .時鳥お江戸の雨が味いやら
ro: hototogisu o-edo no ame ga umai yara
en:
cuckoo--
the rain of Great Edo
is sweet!

jp: .時鳥退く時をしりにけり
ro: hototogisu shirizoku toki wo shiri ni keri
en:
cuckoo--
you know when it's time
to run

jp: .時鳥のらくら者を叱るかや
ro: hototogisu norakura mono wo shikaru ka ya
en:
hey cuckoo--
are you scolding
the loafer?

jp: .時鳥湯けぶりそよぐ草そよぐ
ro: hototogisu yu keburi soyogu kusa soyogu
en:
cuckoo--
hot tub steam stirs
as does the grass

jp: .山人のたばこにむせなほととぎす
ro: yamabito no tabako ni musena hototogisu
en:
don't suffocate
from the hermit's pipe smoke!
cuckoo

jp: .我庵は目に這入ぬかほととぎす
ro: waga io wa me ni hairanu ka hototogisu
en:
are you trying not to
look at my hut?
cuckoo

jp: .前の世のおれがいとこか閑古鳥
ro: saki no yo no ore ga itoko ka kankodori
en:
in a previous
life, my cousin?
mountain cuckoo

jp: .淋しさを我にさづけよかんこ鳥
ro: sabishisa wo ware ni sazuke yo kankodori
en:
pass your solitude
to me...
mountain cuckoo

jp: .我庵のひいきしてやら閑古鳥
ro: waga io no hiiki shite yara kankodori
en:
so my hut
is your favorite!
mountain cuckoo

jp: .我門にしるしに鳴やかんこ鳥
ro: waga kado no shirushi ni naku ya kankodori
en:
on the sign
on my gate singing
mountain cuckoo

jp: .百両の鶯もやれ老を鳴く
ro: hyaku ryô no uguisu mo yare oi wo naku
en:
even the priceless nightingale
well!
warbles in summer

jp: .筏士が箸にかけたるほたる哉
ro: ikadashi ga hashi ni kaketaru hotaru kana
en:
clinging to
the raftsman's chopstick...
firefly

jp: .筏士のうんじ果たる蛍哉
ro: ikadashi no unji hatetaru hotaru kana
en:
the raftsman
has had his fill...
fireflies

jp: .いかだ士の箸に又候蛍哉
ro: ikadashi no hashi ni mata-zoro hotaru kana
en:
on the raftsman's chopstick
once again...
firefly

jp: .笹の家や掴み捨ても来る蛍
ro: sasa no ya ya tsukami sutete mo kuru hotaru
en:
thatched house--
catching and releasing
fireflies

jp: .すすきから松から蛍々哉
ro: susuki kara matsu kara hotaru hotaru kana
en:
from the pampas grass
from the pine
fireflies! fireflies!

jp: .手枕やぼんの凹よりとぶ蛍
ro: temakura ya bon no kubo yori tobu hotaru
en:
an arm for a pillow--
from the nape of my neck
a firefly flits

jp: .古壁や理窟もなしに行蛍
ro: furu kabe ya rikutsu mo nashi ni yuku hotaru
en:
old wall--
for no particular reason
fireflies visit

jp: .ほけ経の一葉投ればとぶ蛍
ro: hokekyô no ichiyô hôreba tobu hotaru
en:
he flips a page
of the Lotus Sutra...
a firefly flies

jp: .木母寺や犬が呼んでも来る蛍
ro: mokuboji ya inu ga yonde mo kuru hotaru
en:
Mokubo Temple--
the dog calls, too
fireflies come

jp: .行な蛍都は夜もやかましき
ro: yuku na hotaru miyako wa yoru mo yakamashiki
en:
don't go, firefly!
even at night Kyoto
is noisy

jp: .行け蛍薬罐の口がさし出たぞ
ro: yuke hotaru yakwan no kuchi ga sashidata zo
en:
go away, firefly!
the teapot's mouth
gapes

jp: .我宿や鼠と仲のよい蛍
ro: waga yado ya nezumi to naka no yoi hotaru
en:
my dwelling--
mingling with the mice
pretty fireflies

jp: .ぼうふらや日にいく度のうきしづみ
ro: bôfuri ya hi ni iku tabi no uki-shizumi
en:
mosquito larvae--
in a day how many
ups and downs?

jp: .蚊の声の中に赤いぞ草の花
ro: ka no koe no naka [ni] akai zo kusa no hana
en:
amid the buzz of mosquitoes
a bit of red...
wildflower

jp: .蚊柱をよけよけ這入乙鳥哉
ro: ka-bashira wo yoke-yoke hairu tsubame kana
en:
into the mosquito swarm
take care! take care!
swallow

jp: .蚊柱が袂の下に立にけり
ro: ka-bashira ga tamoto no shita ni tachi ni keri
en:
mosquito swarm--
into my sleeve
they rise

jp: .尻くらべ観音堂の藪蚊哉
ro: shiri kurabe kannon dô no yabu ka kana
en:
comparing butts
in Kannon's temple...
mosquitoes

jp: .人あれば蚊も有り柳見事也
ro: hito areba ka mo ari yanagi migoto nari
en:
where there's people
there's mosquitoes...
admiring the willow

jp: .我庵の蠅をも連て帰りけり
ro: waga io no hae wo mo tsurete kaeri keri
en:
my hut's flies
come along too...
returning home

jp: .あばれ蚤我手にかかって成仏せよ
ro: abare nomi waga te kakate jôbutsu seyo
en:
pesky flea
caught in my hand
become a Buddha!

jp: .有明や不二へ不二へと蚤のとぶ
ro: ariake ya fuji [e] fuji [e] to nomi no tobu
en:
dawn--
to Fuji! to Fuji!
fleas jumping off

jp: .門榎人から蚤をうつりけり
ro: kado enoki hito kara nomi wo utsuri keri
en:
the gate's nettle tree
catches fleas
from people

jp: .草原や何を目当に蚤のとぶ
ro: kusabara ya nani wo meate ni nomi no tobu
en:
grassy meadow--
the flea jumps
to points unknown

jp: .皺腕歩きあきてや蚤のとぶ
ro: shiwa kaina aruki akite ya nomi no tobu
en:
tired of walking
my wrinkled arm
the flea jumps

jp: .蚤どもに松島見せて逃しけり
ro: nomi domo ni matsushima misete nigashi keri
en:
hop off, fleas
and see
Matsushima

jp: .蚤の跡それもわかきはうつくしき
ro: nomi no ato sore mo wakaki wa utsukushiki
en:
even flea bites
on the young
are pretty

jp: .蚤蠅にあなどられつつけふも暮ぬ
ro: nomi hae ni anadorare tsutsu kyô mo kurenu
en:
held in contempt
by fleas and flies...
today too ends

jp: .ふくれ蚤腹ごなしかや木にのぼる
ro: fukure nomi hara gonashi ka ya ki ni noboru
en:
bloated flea
are you walking it off?
up a tree

jp: .痩蚤の達者にさはぐ山家哉
ro: yase nomi no tassha ni sawagu yamaga kana
en:
a skinny flea
makes a healthy ruckus...
mountain home

jp: .よい日やら蚤がおどるぞはねるぞよ
ro: yoi hi yara nomi ga odoru zo haneru zo yo
en:
a good day, eh?
fleas dancing
and hopping

jp: .逃る也紙魚が中にも親よ子よ
ro: nigeru nari shimi [ga] naka ni mo oya yo ko yo
en:
the silverfish scurry
away...
parents and children

jp: .恋をせよ恋をせよせよ夏のせみ
ro: koi wo seyo koi wo seyo seyo natsu no semi
en:
go ahead, make love!
make love!
summer cicadas

jp: .せみ鳴や笠のやうなるにほの海
ro: semi naku ya kasa no yô naru nio no umi
en:
cicadas chirr--
looking like an umbrella-hat
Lake Biwa

jp: .蝉鳴や空にひっつく最上川
ro: semi naku ya sora ni hittsuku mogami-gawa
en:
cicadas chirr--
sticking to the sky
Mogami River

jp: .蝉なくや我家も石になるやうに
ro: semi naku ya waga ya mo ishi ni naru yô ni
en:
cicadas chirr--
my hut, too, becoming
stone

jp: .だまれ蝉今髭どのがござるぞよ
ro: damare semi ima hige dono ga gozaru zo yo
en:
hush cicada!
Mr. Long-Beard
has arrived

jp: .寺山や袂の下を蝉のとぶ
ro: tera yama ya tamoto no shita wo semi no tobu
en:
temple mountain--
buzzing into my sleeve
a cicada

jp: .夏の蝉恋する隙も鳴にけり
ro: natsu no semi koi suru hima mo naki ni keri
en:
summer cicada--
even in his lovemaking break
singing!

jp: .逃くらし逃くらしけり夏のせみ
ro: nigekurashi nigekurashi keri natsu no semi
en:
a life of running away
running away...
summer cicada

jp: .山蝉や鳴々抜る大座敷
ro: yama semi ya naki naki nukeru ôzashiki
en:
mountain cicada--
singing, singing passes through
the big sitting room

jp: .かたつむり仏ごろりと寝たりけり
ro: katatsumuri [hotoke] gorori to netari keri
en:
the snail-Buddha
curls up
to sleep

jp: .でで虫や莚の上の十文字
ro: dedemushi ya mushiro no ue no jû monji
en:
snail on the straw mat
has written
"10"!

jp: .何事の一分別ぞかたつぶり
ro: nanigoto no hitofunbetsu zo katatsumuri
en:
why
such careful consideration
snail?

jp: .古郷や仏の顔のかたつむり
ro: furusato ya hotoke no kao no katatsumuri
en:
my home village--
Buddha's face
on the snail

jp: .夕月や大肌ぬいでかたつぶり
ro: yûzuki ya ôhada nuide katatsuburi
en:
in evening moonlight
going bare-chested...
snail

jp: .みそ豆の数珠がそよぐぞ芥子の花
ro: misomame no juzu ga soyogu zo keshi [no] hana
en:
my soybean prayer beads
click and clack...
blooming poppies

jp: .牛のやうなる蜂のなくぼたん哉
ro: ushi no yônaru hashi no naku botan kana
en:
like a cow
the bee buzzes...
a peony

jp: .福相と脇から見ゆるぼたん哉
ro: fukusô to waki kara miyuru botan kana
en:
looking pleased
sidelong glances
at the peony

jp: .乞食の枕に並ぶうき葉哉
ro: kojiki no makura ni narabu uki ha kana
en:
alongside
the beggar's pillow...
lotus leaves float

jp: .誰家や蓮に吹かれて夕茶漬
ro: taga ie ya hasu ni fukarete yû chazuke
en:
whose house?
wafting over lotuses
evening's tea-and-rice

jp: .児達や盃をく也蓮の花
ro: chigotachi ya sakazuki oku nari hasu no hana
en:
the toddlers
put them in sake cups...
lotus blossoms

jp: .はす池やつんとさし出る乞食小屋
ro: hasu ike ya tsunto sashideru kojiki goya
en:
lotus pond--
with a stuck-up attitude
the beggar's hut

jp: .なでしこや一ッ咲ては露のため
ro: nadeshiko ya hitotsu saite wa tsuyu no tame
en:
pinks--
one is blooming
thanks to the dew

jp: .赤犬の欠の先やかきつばた
ro: aka inu no akubi no saki ya kakitsubata
en:
before
the red dog's yawn...
irises

jp: .磯寺やこっぱの中のかきつばた
ro: iso-dera ya koppa no naka no kakitsubata
en:
seaside temple--
among the wood chips
irises

jp: .沢潟に日陰とられてかきつばた
ro: omodaka ni hikage torarete kakitsubata
en:
shading the arrowheads
from the sun...
irises

jp: .さりとてはばか長き日よかきつばた
ro: saritote wa baka naga[ki] hi yo kakitsubata
en:
well, well
the day is foolishly long...
irises

jp: .ひょろひょろと草の中よりかきつばた
ro: hyo[ro]-hyoro to kusa no naka yori kakitsubata
en:
tottering
amid the grass...
an iris blooms

jp: .陽炎の真盛也麦の秋
ro: kagerô no massakari nari mugi no aki
en:
the heat shimmers
in full bloom...
ripened barley

jp: .朝顔のあつらへたやうなことし竹
ro: asagao no atsuraeta yôna kotoshi take
en:
made-to-order
for the morning-glories...
this year's bamboo

jp: .うれしげや垣の小竹もわか盛
ro: ureshige ya kaki no ko take mo waka-zakari
en:
joyful!
the fence's little bamboo
at the peak of youth

jp: .陽炎の真盛り也ことし竹
ro: kagerô no massakari nari kotoshi take
en:
in heat shimmers
at their peak...
this year's bamboo

jp: .君が代や世やとそよぐことし竹
ro: kimi ga yo ya yo ya to soyogu kotoshi take
en:
"O great Japan!
O world!"
the rustling young bamboo

jp: .さては月君がわか松わか竹よ
ro: sate wa tsuki kimi ga waka matsu waka take yo
en:
well, moon
now you have young pines!
young bamboo!

jp: .鳩遊べわがわか竹ぞわか竹ぞ
ro: hato asobe waga waka take zo waka take zo
en:
play, pigeons
in my young bamboo!
young bamboo!

jp: .わか竹と云るるも一夜ふたよ哉
ro: waka take to iwaruru mo hito yo futa yo kana
en:
it's called "young bamboo"
for one night only...
or two

jp: .わか竹に一癖なきもなかりけり
ro: waka take ni [hito] kuse naki mo nakari keri
en:
among the young bamboo
not a single one
flawless

jp: .若竹の世をはばからぬわか葉哉
ro: waka take no yo wo habakaranu wakaba kana
en:
for the young bamboo
bold and fresh
green leaves

jp: .わか竹や盲蜻蛉に遊ばるる
ro: waka take [ya] mekura tombo ni asobaruru
en:
young bamboo--
the blind dragonfly
carousing

jp: .うつくしや苦竹の子のついついと
ro: utsukushi ya niga takenoko no tsui-tsui to
en:
pretty--
the bitter bamboo shoots
swishing

jp: .閑居して筍番をしたりけり
ro: kankyo shite takenoko ban wo shitari keri
en:
life in seclusion--
guarding the growing
bamboo shoots

jp: .竹の子に病のなきもなかりけり
ro: takenoko ni yamai no naki mo nakari keri
en:
shoots of new bamboo--
not one of them
looks healthy

jp: .露ちるや若竹お子のぞくぞくと
ro: tsuyu chiru ya waka takenoko no zoku-zoku to
en:
a dewdrop spills--
the bamboo shoot
shivers

jp: .石川や有明月と冷し瓜
ro: ishi-gawa ya ariake tsuki to hiyashi uri
en:
shallow river--
a dawn moon
melons cooling

jp: .葉がくれの瓜と寝ころぶ子猫哉
ro: ha-gakure no uri to ne-korobu ko neko kana
en:
in leafy shade
curled up with a melon...
a kitten

jp: .人来たら蛙になれよ冷し瓜
ro: hito kitara kawazu to nare yo hiyashi uri
en:
if someone comes
change into frogs!
cooling melons

jp: .盗人の見るともしらで冷し瓜
ro: nusubito no miru to mo shirade [hiya]shi uri
en:
unaware of the thief's
eyes, melons
cooling in water

jp: .一本の下闇作る榎かな
ro: ippon no shitayami tsukuru enoki kana
en:
just one's enough
for deep, cool shade...
nettle tree

jp: .長の日やびんづるどのと合歓の花
ro: naga no hi ya binzuru dono to nemu [no] hana
en:
a long day--
Holy Binzuru and blossoms
of Sleeping Tree

jp: .卯の花や伏見へ通ふ犬の道
ro: u no hana ya fushimie kayou inu no michi
en:
deutzia blossoms--
on the road to Fushimi
a dog

jp: .うそ寒や親といふ字を知ってから
ro: uso samu ya oya to iu ji wo shitte kara
en:
nippy weather--
the meaning of "parent"
sinks in

jp: .朝寒を猿も合点か小うなづき
ro: asa-zamu wo saru mo gaten ka ko unazuki
en:
does the monkey understand
"morning cold"?
a little nod

jp: .あばら骨なでじとすれど夜寒哉
ro: abarabone nadeji to suredo yozamu kana
en:
I rub, rub my ribs
still the night
is cold

jp: .救世観世音かかる夜寒を介給へ
ro: guze-kanzeon kakaru yozamu wo tasuke tamae
en:
oh Goddess of Mercy
from this cold night
deliver me!

jp: .鳩部屋に鳩が顔出す夜寒哉
ro: hato heya ni hato ga kao dasu yozamu kana
en:
from the pigeon coop
a head pokes out...
a cold night

jp: .一夜一夜虫喰ふ虫も寒い声
ro: hito yo hito yo mushi kuu mushi mo samui koe
en:
night after night
the bug-eating bugs'
cold voices

jp: .窓の竹うごくや夜寒始ると
ro: mado no take ugoku ya yozamu hajimaru to
en:
bamboo in the window
stirs, night's cold
begins

jp: .両国の両方ともに夜寒哉
ro: ryôgoku no ryôhô to mo ni yozamu kana
en:
on Ryogoku Bridge
in both directions...
the cold night

jp: .雨雲が山をかくして夜寒かな
ro: amagumo ga yama wo kakushite yozamu kana
en:
a rain cloud
hides the mountain...
a cold night

jp: .今に成って念入て見る秋の暮
ro: ima ni natte nen irite miru aki no kure
en:
now I watch
with careful attention...
autumn dusk

jp: .親と云ふ字を知ってから秋の暮
ro: oya to iu ji wo shitte kara aki no kure
en:
since the day I knew
the word "Parent"...
autumn dusk

jp: .かな釘のやうな手足を秋の暮
ro: kanakugi no yôna teashi wo aki no kure
en:
my arms and legs
thin as nails...
autumn dusk

jp: .死神により残されて秋の暮
ro: shini-gami ni yori-nokosarete aki no kure
en:
the god of death
has passed me over...
autumn dusk

jp: .庵の夜も小長く成るや遊ぶ程
ro: io no yo mo ko nagaku naru ya asobu hodo
en:
at my hut too
the night turns long...
bottoms up!

jp: .庵の夜や寝あまる罪は何貫目
ro: io no yo ya ne-amaru tsumi wa nan kanme
en:
night at my hut--
this sinful oversleeping
weighs heavily!

jp: .おそろしや寝あまり夜の罪の程
ro: osoroshi ya ne-amari yoru no tsumi no hodo
en:
feeling afraid--
nights of so much sleep
are sinful!

jp: .下駄からりからり夜永のやつら哉
ro: geta karari karari yo naga no yatsura kana
en:
wooden clogs
clomp! clomp!
a long, weary night

jp: .虱ども夜永かろうぞ淋しかろ
ro: shirami-domo yonaga karô zo sabishikaro
en:
for you lice
is the night long?
is it lonely?

jp: .長いぞよ夜が長いぞよなむあみだ
ro: nagai zo yo yo ga nagai zo yo namu amida
en:
long!
the night is long!
"Praise Amida..."

jp: .長き夜や心の鬼が身を責る
ro: nagaki [yo] ya kokoro no oni ga mi wo semeru
en:
a long night--
the devil in me
torments me

jp: .なむあみだあむみだ仏夜永哉
ro: namu amida amu mida butsu yonaga kana
en:
"Praise Buddha!
Praise Buddha!"
it's a long night

jp: .蚤どもがさぞ夜永だろ淋しかろ
ro: nomi domo ga sazo yonaga daro sabishi karo
en:
for you fleas
the night must be long...
and lonely?

jp: .のら猫が夜永仕事かひたと鳴
ro: nora neko ga yonaga shigoto ka hita to naku
en:
stray cat
all the long night is this your job?
yowling nearby

jp: .ばらばらと夜永の蚤のきげん哉
ro: bara-bara to yonaga no nomi no kigen kana
en:
thippity thump!
the fleas this long night
in a fine mood

jp: .腹の上に字を書ならふ夜永哉
ro: hara no ue ni ji wo kakinarau yonaga kana
en:
practicing calligraphy
on my belly...
a long night

jp: .翌からは冬の空ぞよ蝶蜻蛉
ro: asu kara wa fuyu no sora zo yo chô tombo
en:
from tomorrow on
it's a winter sky...
butterflies, dragonflies!

jp: .暮る秋も猿合点か小うなづき
ro: kureru aki mo saru gatten ka ko unazuki
en:
do you also know
that autumn's ending?
the monkey nods

jp: .行秋を尾花もさらばさらば哉
ro: yuku aki wo obana mo saraba saraba kana
en:
even pampas grass
waves farewell, farewell...
to autumn

jp: .うつくしやしょうじの穴の天の川
ro: utsukushi ya shôji no ana no ama [no] kawa
en:
looking pretty
in a hole in the paper door...
Milky Way

jp: .あの月をとってくれろと泣子哉
ro: ano tsuki wo totte kurero to naku ko kana
en:
"Gimme that moon!"
cries the crying
child

jp: .三ケの月かすまんとして入にけり
ro: mika no tsuki kasuman to shite iri ni keri
en:
the sickle moon
all clouded over...
when I go out

jp: .名月や家より出て家に入
ro: meigetsu ya ie yori dete ie ni iru
en:
harvest moon--
going out
going back in

jp: .名月や上座して鳴きりぎりす
ro: meigetsu ya jôza shite naku kirigirisu
en:
harvest moon--
in the seat of honor
a katydid chirrs

jp: .山里は汁の中迄名月ぞ
ro: yama-zato wa shiru no naka made meigetsu zo
en:
mountain village--
even in my soup
the harvest moon

jp: .秋雨や人を身にする山烏
ro: aki ame ya hito wo mi ni suru yama-garasu
en:
autumn rain--
in the same boat as people
mountain crow

jp: .秋の雨いやがる蚤をとばせけり
ro: aki no ame iyagaru nomi wo tobase keri
en:
autumn rain--
I send an unwilling flea
flying

jp: .放たる蚤の又来る秋の雨
ro: hanasetaru nomi no mata kuru aki no ame
en:
my evicted fleas
have returned...
autumn rain

jp: .秋風に歩行て逃る蛍哉
ro: aki kaze ni aruite nigeru hotaru kana
en:
in autumn wind
escaping on foot...
firefly

jp: .秋風やそとば踏へてなく烏
ro: aki kaze ya sotoba fumaete naku karasu
en:
autumn wind--
trampling the grave tablet
a crow caws

jp: .鉄釘のやうな手足を秋の風
ro: kanakugi no yôna teashi wo aki no kaze
en:
on my arms and legs
thin as nails...
the autumn wind

jp: .熊坂が大長刀を秋の風
ro: kumasaka ga ônaginata wo aki no kaze
en:
blowing on Kumasaka's
great halberd...
autumn wind

jp: .行先も只秋風ぞ小順礼
ro: yukisaki mo tada aki kaze zo kojunrei
en:
his destination
only the autumn wind...
little pilgrim

jp: .粟ひへが家より高き野分哉
ro: awa hie ga ie yori takaki nowaki kana
en:
millet and barnyard grass
taller than the house...
autumn gale

jp: .膳先は葎雫や野分吹
ro: zen saki wa mugura shizuku ya nowaki kana
en:
at the dinner tray
dripping weeds...
an autumn gale

jp: .裸児と烏とさはぐ野分哉
ro: hadaka-go to karasu to sawagu nowaki kana
en:
a naked baby
and a crow raise a ruckus...
autumn gale

jp: .朝露に浄土参りのけいこ哉
ro: asa tsuyu ni jôdo mairi no keiko kana
en:
in morning dew
a reaching-the-Pure-Land
lesson

jp: .芋の葉や親碗程の露の玉
ro: imo no ha ya oya wan hodo no tsuyu no tama
en:
potato leaf--
a rice bowl's worth
of dew!

jp: .後からぞっとするぞよ露時雨
ro: ushiro kara zotto suru zo yo tsuyu shigure
en:
a shiver
runs up my spine...
dew dripping down

jp: .越後馬夜露払って通りけり
ro: echigo uma yo tsuyu haratte tôri keri
en:
Echigo horse--
sweeping away the evening dew
in passing

jp: .置露に蝶のきげんの直りけり
ro: oku tsuyu ni chô no kigen no naori keri
en:
among the dewdrops
the butterfly's mood
improves

jp: .白露と仲間よく見ゆる影ぼふし
ro: shiro tsuyu to nakama yoku miyuru kagebôshi
en:
silver dewdrops
and my companion...
sharp shadows

jp: .露を吸ふたぐひ也けり草の庵
ro: tsuyu wo suu tagui nari keri kusa no io
en:
sucking up
all the dewdrops...
my thatched hut

jp: .露ちるや已におのれもあの通り
ro: tsuyu chiru ya sude ni onore mo ano tôri
en:
dewdrops scatter--
soon enough
there go I

jp: .露ちるやむさい此世に用なしと
ro: tsuyu chiru ya musai kono yo ni yô nashi to
en:
dewdrops scatter--
done with this crappy
world

jp: .露の玉いくつ入たる土瓶哉
ro: tsuyu no tama ikutsu haitaru dobin kana
en:
beads of dew
when did you sneak in?
earthen teapot

jp: .古壁の草もたのみや露の玉
ro: furu kabe no kusa mo tanomi ya tsuyu no tama
en:
the old wall's grass
trusting...
beads of dew

jp: .朝々や茶がむまく成る霧おりる
ro: asa-asa ya cha ga mumaku naru kiri oriru
en:
morning after morning
my tea tastes better...
falling mist

jp: .袖からも霧立のぼる山路哉
ro: sode kara mo kiri tachi-noboru yamaji kana
en:
even from my sleeves
mist rising...
mountain road

jp: .山霧のさっさと抜る座敷哉
ro: yama-giri no sassa to nukeru zashiki kana
en:
the mountain mist
rushes through...
the sitting room

jp: .鶺鴒を作ったやうな灯ろ哉
ro: sekirei wo tsukutta yôna tôro kana
en:
maybe the wagtail
put it there...
lantern for the dead

jp: .軒葺もすすき御はしもすすき哉
ro: noki-buki mo susuki o-hashi mo susuki kana
en:
even the eaves' thatch
chopsticks
of pampas grass

jp: .うす闇き角力太鼓や角田川
ro: usu-guraki sumô daiko ya sumida-gawa
en:
in twilight the big
sumo match drum...
Sumida River

jp: .朝顔のちょいの咲たるかがし哉
ro: asagao no choi no sakitaru kagashi kana
en:
the morning-glories
bloom so briefly...
scarecrow

jp: .庵の畠かがし納もなかりけり
ro: io no hata kagashi osame mo nakari keri
en:
field by my hut--
no thank-you offering
for the scarecrow

jp: .むら雨に水洟たるるかがし哉
ro: murasame ni mizubana taruru kagashi kana
en:
in the rain shower
with a runny nose...
scarecrow

jp: .遠山のやうの榎よ小夜砧
ro: tôyama no yôna enoki yo sayo-ginuta
en:
the nettle tree looks
like a far-off mountain...
night cloth-pounding

jp: .隣とは合点しても小夜砧
ro: tonari to wa gatten shite mo sayo-ginuta
en:
my neighbor and I
have an understanding...
cloth-pounding at night

jp: .梟の口真似したる砧哉
ro: fukurô no kuchi mane shitaru kinuta kana
en:
imitating
the owl's hoots...
pounding cloth

jp: .さをしかは萩に糞して別れけり
ro: saoshika wa hagi ni kuso shite wakare keri
en:
the young buck
craps in the bush clover
and moves on

jp: .鳴蝉に角をかしたる男鹿哉
ro: naku semi ni tsuno wo kashitaru oshika kana
en:
leasing his antler
to the cicada...
the young buck

jp: .鳴な雁どっこも同じうき世ぞや
ro: naku na kari dokko mo onaji ukiyo zoya
en:
don't cry, geese--
everywhere, the same
floating world

jp: .雁とぶや門の家鴨も貰ひ鳴
ro: kari tobu ya kado no ahiru mo morai naki
en:
geese flying south--
the ducks at the gate
cheer them on

jp: .蛙穴に入て弥勒の御代を頼む哉
ro: kawazu ana ni irite miroku no miyo wo tanomu kana
en:
the frog enters his hole
in the Future Buddha
he trusts

jp: .小筵や青菜のやうな虫が鳴
ro: sa mushiro ya aona no yôna mushi ga naku
en:
little straw mat--
a green plant-like insect
singing

jp: .又泊れ行灯にとまれ青い虫
ro: mata tomare ando ni tomare aoi mushi
en:
stop again!
with your lantern stop!
a green insect

jp: .秋のてふかがしの袖にすがりけり
ro: aki no chô kagashi no sode ni sugari keri
en:
autumn butterfly
on the scarecrow's sleeve
clinging

jp: .蜻蛉ににらまれ給ふ仏かな
ro: tombô ni niramare tamau hotoke kana
en:
glared at
by the dragonfly...
the Buddha

jp: .蜻蛉の尻でなぶるや角田川
ro: tombô no shiri de naburu ya sumida-gawa
en:
the dragonfly
dips his butt...
Sumida River

jp: .なまけるな蜻蛉赤く成る程に
ro: namakeru na tombo akaku naru hodo ni
en:
don't be lazy!
O dragonfly turned
so red

jp: .こおろぎを叱て寝たる草家哉
ro: kôrogi wo shikatte netaru kusaya kana
en:
scolding the cricket
in my sleep...
thatched hut

jp: .こおろぎの大声上る三十日哉
ro: kôrogi no ôgoe ageru misoka kana
en:
the crickets raise
a ruckus...
another month ends

jp: .今掃し箒の中のきりぎりす
ro: ima hakishi hôki no naka no kirigirisu
en:
inside the broom
I'm sweeping with...
a katydid

jp: .おとなしく留主をしていろきりぎりす
ro: otonashiku rusu wo shite iro kirigirisu
en:
you be good
and guard the house...
katydid

jp: .けふ迄はまめで鳴たよきりぎりす
ro: kyô made wa mame de naita yo kirigirisu
en:
up to today
such a healthy singer...
katydid

jp: .粉引に叱られてなくきりぎりす
ro: konahiki [ni] shikararete naku kirigirisu
en:
the grain grinder
gives it a scolding...
katydid

jp: .妻やなきしはがれ声のきりぎりす
ro: tsuma ya naki shiwagare koe no kirigirisu
en:
still no wife
his voice grows hoarse...
katydid

jp: .橋杭や泥にまぶれしきりぎりす
ro: hashigui ya doro ni mabureshi kirigirisu
en:
on the bridge pile
smeared with mud...
katydid

jp: .我天窓草と思ふかきりぎりす
ro: waga atama kusa to omou ka kirigirisu
en:
do you think my head's
grass?
katydid

jp: .痩草のよろよろ花と成にけり
ro: yase kusa no yoro-yoro hana to nari ni keri
en:
the emaciated grass
totters
into bloom

jp: .馬蝿の遊び所也きくの花
ro: uma-bae no asobi toko nari kiku no hana
en:
it's the horseflies'
playground...
chrysanthemum

jp: .菊さくや馬糞山も一けしき
ro: kiku saku ya ma-guso yama mo hito keshiki
en:
chrysanthemum blooming
horse-dung mountain...
one scene

jp: .夕暮や馬糞の手をも菊でふく
ro: yûgure ya ma-guso no te wo mo kiku de fuku
en:
evening--
he wipes horse dung off his hand
with a chrysanthemum

jp: .朝顔や朝々蚤の逃所
ro: asagao ya asa-asa nomi no nige-dokoro
en:
morning-glories--
every morning the fleas'
hideout

jp: .一本に門をふさげる木萩哉
ro: ippon ni kado wo fusageru kihagi kana
en:
with one branch
it blocks the gate...
bush clover

jp: .かくれ家やあなた任せの稲の花
ro: kakurega ya anata makase no ine no hana
en:
secluded house--
trusting in the Buddha
rice plants bloom

jp: .古薮や小すみの稲も五六尺
ro: furu yabu ya kosumi no ine mo go roku shaku
en:
old thicket--
a nook of rice
five or six feet tall

jp: .我庵の大刀より切るるすすきかな
ro: waga io no tachi yori kiruru susuki kana
en:
more cutting than my hut's
old sword...
pampas grass

jp: .柿の葉に小判色なる木の葉哉
ro: kaki no ha [ni] koban iro naru ki [no] ha kana
en:
persimmon tree--
the color of gold coins
its leaves

jp: .柿の葉や真赤に成て直にちる
ro: kaki no ha ya makka ni natte sugu ni chiru
en:
persimmon leaves--
once they turn crimson
game over

jp: .大栗や漸とれば虫の穴
ro: ôguri ya yôyaku toreba mushi no ana
en:
after great effort
picking the big chestnut...
a wormhole

jp: .草原や子にひろはする一つ栗
ro: kusabara ya ko ni hirowasuru hitotsu kuri
en:
grassy meadow--
letting the child harvest one
chestnut

jp: .虫喰が一番栗ぞ一ばんぞ
ro: mushi kui ga ichiban kuri zo ichiban zo
en:
worm-eaten--
the best chestnut!
the best!

jp: .山陰に心安げよ実なし栗
ro: yama kage ni kokoroyasuge yo mi nashi kuri
en:
in mountain shade
rest without a care!
nut-less chestnut tree

jp: .うつくしやあら美しや毒きのこ
ro: utsukushi ya ara utsukushi ya doku kinoko
en:
it's so pretty!
so pretty!
the poison mushroom

jp: .御子達よ赤い木の子に化されな
ro: o-kodachi yo akai ki[no]ko ni bakasare na
en:
watch out, kids!
don't let those red mushrooms
cast a spell

jp: .折々や庵の柱の茸狩
ro: ori-ori [ya] io no hashira no kinoko-gari
en:
now and then
on the post of my hut...
gathering mushrooms

jp: .赤い葉におつ広がりし寒さ哉
ro: akai ha ni oppirogarishi samu[sa] kana
en:
coating
the red leaf...
the cold

jp: .草庵は夢に見てさへ寒さ哉
ro: sôan wa yume ni mite sae samu[sa] kana
en:
in my thatched hut
even dreaming
the cold

jp: .有明や月より丸き棄氷
ro: ariake ya tsuki yori maruki sute kôri
en:
dawn--
round as the moon
the tossed-out ice

jp: .鶯の軒廻りする小春哉
ro: uguisu no noki meguri suru ko haru kana
en:
a nightingale makes his rounds
eave to eave...
a spring day in winter

jp: .けふもけふもけふも小春の雉子哉
ro: kyô mo kyô mo kyô mo ko haru no kigisu kana
en:
today too, today too
on a spring day in winter
a pheasant

jp: .椋鳥が唄ふて走る小春哉
ro: mukudori ga utaute hashiru ko haru kana
en:
the gray starling
rushes his song...
a spring day in winter

jp: .杭の鷺汝がとしはどう暮る
ro: kui no sagi nanji ga toshi wa dô kururu
en:
heron on a post--
how is your year
ending?

jp: .とく暮よことしのやうな悪どしは
ro: toku kure yo kotoshi no yôna akudoshi wa
en:
end quickly!
this year, you've been
an evil one

jp: .梟がとしおしむやら竿の先
ro: fukurô ga toshi oshimu yara sao no saki
en:
the owl's year
is running out...
atop the pole

jp: .かすむぞや大三十日の寛永寺
ro: kasumu zoya ômisoka no kan-eiji
en:
misty--
the year's last day
Kan-ei Temple

jp: .どこを風が吹かと寝たり大三十日
ro: doko wo kaze ga fuku ka to netari ômisoka
en:
what will be, will be--
on the year's last day
I sleep

jp: .夜も夜大三十日のたびら雪
ro: yoru mo yoru ômisoka no tabira yuki
en:
evening of the year's
last day...
flitting snow

jp: .人のためしぐれておはす仏哉
ro: hito no tame shigurete owasu hotoke kana
en:
for our sake enduring
the winter rain...
stone Buddha

jp: .しぐるるや迎に出たる庵の猫
ro: shigururu ya mukae ni detaru io no neko
en:
winter rain--
I meet my hut's cat
at the door

jp: .時雨るや母親もちし網代守
ro: shiguru[ru] ya haha oya mochishi ajiro mori
en:
winter rain--
the night fisherman
with his mother

jp: .草庵や菊から先へしぐれたり
ro: sôan ya kiku kara saki e shiguretari
en:
thatched hut--
the chrysanthemum hit first
by winter rain

jp: .日本と砂へ書たる時雨哉
ro: nippon to suna e kakitaru shigure kana
en:
spelling "Japan"
in the sand...
the winter rain

jp: .目ざす敵は鶏頭よ横時雨
ro: mezasu teki wa keitô yo yoko shigure
en:
taking aim
at the blooming cockscomb...
slanting winter rain

jp: .綿玉のひそかにはぜる時雨哉
ro: wata tama no hisoka ni hazeru shigure kana
en:
the cotton bolls burst
in secret...
winter rain

jp: .木がらしやかます着て行く箱根山
ro: kogarashi ya kamasu kite yuku hakone yama
en:
winter wind--
wearing a straw bag
on Mount Hakone

jp: .かり家や村一番の冬日向
ro: kari ie ya mura no ichiban no fuyu hinata
en:
rented house--
the village's best spot
for basking in the winter sun

jp: .はつ雪を敵のやうにそしる哉
ro: hatsu yuki wo kataki no yô ni soshiru kana
en:
first snowfall--
like my worst enemy
damn you!

jp: .はつ雪を皆ふんづけし烏哉
ro: hatsu yuki wo mina funzukeshi karasu kana
en:
the year's first snow
all trampled...
by the crows

jp: .はつ雪が焼飯程の外山哉
ro: hatsu yuki ga yakimeshi hodo no toyama kana
en:
the first snow
makes fried rice balls...
of mountains

jp: .はつ雪や雪隠のきはも角田川
ro: hatsu yuki ya setchin no kiwa mo sumida-gawa
en:
first snowfall--
bordering the outhouse
Sumida River

jp: .はつ雪やとある木陰の神楽笛
ro: hatsu yuki ya toaru kokage no kagura-bue
en:
first snowfall--
in the tree's shade
a Shinto flute

jp: .はつ雪やといへば直に三四尺
ro: hatsu yuki ya to ieba sugu ni san shi shaku
en:
"First snowfall!"
and then, soon enough
three or four feet

jp: .はつ雪や軒の菖蒲もふはふはと
ro: hatsu yuki ya noki no shôbu mo fuwa-fuwa to
en:
first snowfall
on irises in the eaves
softly, softly

jp: .むまさうな雪がふうはりふはり哉
ro: mumasôna yuki ga fûwari fuwari kana
en:
looking delicious
the snow flitting softly
softly

jp: .大雪の山をづかづか一人哉
ro: ôyuki no yama wo zuka-zuka hitori kana
en:
chop-chopping
a mountain of snow...
a man alone

jp: .大雪やおれが真上の天の川
ro: ôyuki ya ore ga ma ue no ama no kawa
en:
a big snow--
straight above me
the Milky Way

jp: .大雪や印の竿を鳴く烏
ro: ôyuki ya shirushi no sao wo naku karasu
en:
deep snow--
on the signpost
a crow caws

jp: .大雪や膳の際から越後山
ro: ôyuki ya zen no kiwa kara echigo yama
en:
heavy snow--
from the dinner tray's edge
Echigo mountains

jp: .雁鴎おのが雪とてさわぐ哉
ro: kari kamome ono ga yuki tote sawagu kana
en:
geese and gulls
raise a ruckus...
"It's my snow!"

jp: .下窓の雪が明りのばくち哉
ro: shita mado no yuki ga akari no bakuchi kana
en:
by the light of the snow
under the window...
gambling

jp: .雪ちるやきのふは見へぬ明家札
ro: yuki chiru ya kinou wa mienu akiya fuda
en:
falling snow--
yesterday it wasn't there
"Empty House" sign

jp: .雪の夜や苫屋の際の天の川
ro: yuki no yo ya tomaya no kiwa no ama no kawa
en:
snowy night--
near the hut of reeds
Milky Way

jp: .我郷の鐘や聞くらん雪の底
ro: waga sato no kane ya kikuran yuki no soko
en:
my village bell
heard maybe, deep
in the snow

jp: .霰ちれくくり枕を負ふ子ども
ro: arare chire kukurimakura woo u kodomo
en:
fall, hailstones!
with pillow on his head
a child

jp: .熊坂が大長刀をあられ哉
ro: kumasaka ga ônaginata wo arare kana
en:
falling on Kumasaka's
great halberd...
hailstones

jp: .鶏頭に三十棒のあられ哉
ro: keitô ni san jû bô no arare kana
en:
for the blooming cockscomb
thirty cudgels...
hailstones

jp: .来よ来よとよんだる霰ふるにけり
ro: ko yo ko yo to yondaru arare furi ni keri
en:
come! come!
counting hailstones
as they fall

jp: .小筵の嫁がはち子よちる丸雪
ro: samushiro no yome ga hachiko yo chiru arare
en:
a serving tray for the bride
on the little straw mat...
hailstones

jp: .玉霰それそれ兄が耳房に
ro: tama arare sore sore ani ga mimi fusa ni
en:
hailstones--
look! there's one
in brother's ear

jp: .ちりめんの猿を抱く子よ丸雪ちる
ro: chirimen no saru wo daku ko yo arare chiru
en:
the child hugs
her cloth monkey...
hailstorm

jp: .散丸雪張子の犬も狂ふぞよ
ro: chiru arare hariko no inu mo kuruu zo yo
en:
hailstones falling--
the paper dog, too
going nuts!

jp: .一降は小雀交りのあられ哉
ro: hito furi wa kogara majiri no arare kana
en:
one falls smack
amid the marsh tits...
hailstones

jp: .盛任が横面たたくあられ哉
ro: moritô ga yokotsura tataku arare kana
en:
smacking the side
of Morito's face...
hailstone

jp: .大菊のさんだらぼしをみぞれ哉
ro: ôgiku no sandaraboshi wo mizore kana
en:
the big chrysanthemum
wears a straw hat...
falling sleet

jp: .門番は足で掃寄るみぞれ哉
ro: monban wa ashi de haki-yosuru mizore kana
en:
the gatekeeper sweeps
a pile with his foot...
sleet

jp: .戸口迄ついと枯込野原哉
ro: toguchi made tsui to kare komu no hara kana
en:
up to my doorway
so quickly the fields
have withered

jp: .有明や梅にも一ッ鉢たたき
ro: ariake ya ume ni mo hitotsu hachi tataki
en:
at dawn by the plum tree
there's one too...
a monk beats his bowl

jp: .君が代や鳥も経よむはちたたき
ro: kimi ga yo ya tori mo kyô yomu hachi tataki
en:
Great Japan!
a bird recites a sutra
a monk beats a bowl

jp: .殊勝さや同じ瓢のたたき様
ro: shushôsa ya onaji fukube no tataki-sama
en:
admirable!
he beats the gourd
non-stop

jp: .冴る夜や梅にも一ッ寒念仏
ro: saeru yo ya ume ni [mo] hitotsu kan nebutsu
en:
a cold, clear night--
a winter prayer for the plum tree
too

jp: .二人していろりの縁を枕哉
ro: futari shite irori no fuchi wo makura kana
en:
two sleep
at the edge of the hearth
their pillows

jp: .有明やあみだ如来とすす祝
ro: ariake [ya] mida nyorai to susu iwai
en:
daybreak--
Amida Buddha's soot
is swept

jp: .庵のすすざっとはく真似したりけり
ro: io no susu zatto haku mane shitari keri
en:
my hut's soot--
I go through the motion
of sweeping it

jp: .門雀米ねだりけり煤いはひ
ro: kado suzume kome nedari keri susu iwai
en:
sparrows at the gate
beg for rice...
soot-sweeping

jp: .水仙も煤をかぶって立りけり
ro: suisen mo susu wo kabutte tatari keri
en:
the daffodil too
covered with soot
stands

jp: .煤はきや池の汀の亀に迄
ro: susu haki ya ike no migiwa no kame ni made
en:
soot sweeping--
even the turtle by the pond
gets swiped

jp: .煤はきや花の水仙梅つばき
ro: susu haki ya hana no suisen ume tsubaki
en:
sweeping soot--
off daffodil, plum blossom
camellia

jp: .すすはくや藪は水仙梅つばき
ro: susu haku ya yabu wa suisen ume tsubaki
en:
dumping soot in a thicket--
daffodils, plum blossoms
camellias

jp: .煤ほこり天窓下しや梅つばき
ro: susu hokori atama kudashi ya ume tsubaki
en:
soot and dust dumping--
I bow to plum blossoms
and camellias

jp: .山里や煤をかぶって梅椿
ro: yama-zato ya susu wo kabutte ume tsubaki
en:
mountain village--
soot-covered plum blossoms
and camellias

jp: .我庵やすすはき竹も其序
ro: waga io ya susu haki take mo sono tsuide
en:
my hut--
I'll get to the bamboo soot broom
by and by

jp: .おく小野や小藪隠れも節き候
ro: oku ono ya ko yabu kakure mo sekkizoro
en:
remote field--
hidden in trees, here too
Twelfth Month singers

jp: .節季候にけられ給ふな跡の児
ro: sekizoro ni kerare tamau na ato no chigo
en:
Twelfth Month singers--
don't kick that baby
to the rear!

jp: .せき候よ女せき候それも御代
ro: sekizoro yo onna sekizoro sore mo miyo
en:
the Twelfth Month singers
are female...
our Great Age!

jp: .節季候を女もす也それも御代
ro: sekizoro wo onna mo su nari sore mo miyo
en:
women also
are Twelfth Month singers...
our Great Age!

jp: .あこが餅あこが餅とて並べけり
ro: ako ga mochi ako ga mochi tote narabe keri
en:
my child's rice cakes
my child's rice cakes...
all in a row

jp: .跡臼は烏のもちや西方寺
ro: ato usu wa karasu no mochi ya saihôji
en:
the next batch of rice cakes
is for the crow...
Saiho Temple

jp: .餅臼にそれうぐひすようぐひすよ
ro: mochi usu ni sore uguisu yo uguisu yo
en:
on the rice cake tub
a nightingale!
nightingale!

jp: .餅臼に例の鶯とまりけり
ro: mochi usu ni rei no uguisu tomari keri
en:
on the rice cake tub
the nightingale perches
again

jp: .もち搗や軒から首を出す烏
ro: mochi tsuki ya noki kara kubi wo dasu karasu
en:
pounding rice cakes--
from the eaves a crow
sticks out his head

jp: .妹が子は餅負ふ程に成にけり
ro: imo ga ko wa mochi ou hodo [ni] nari ni keri
en:
my child can almost
carry them...
rice cakes for the neighbors

jp: .我宿へ来さうにしたり配り餅
ro: waga yado e kisô ni shitari kubari mochi
en:
to my home
he seemed to be coming...
neighbor with rice cakes

jp: .餅花の木陰にてうちあはは哉
ro: mochibana [no] kokage nite uchi awawa kana
en:
in the shade
of the rice cake flower...
making baby laugh

jp: .其次に猫も並ぶや衣配
ro: sono tsugi ni neko mo narabu ya kinu kubari
en:
next in line
the cat...
gifts of new clothes

jp: .誰が子ぞ辻の仏へ衣配
ro: tare [ga] ko zo tsuji no hotoke e kinu kubari
en:
whose child has dressed
the crossroads Buddha?
new clothes

jp: .としの市かますかぶって通りけり
ro: toshi no ichi kamasu kabutte tôri keri
en:
year's end fair--
a straw bag on her head
she passes

jp: .福豆や福梅ぼしや歯にあはぬ
ro: fuku mame ya fuku umeboshi ya ha ni awanu
en:
lucky beans
lucky pickled plums...
yet no teeth

jp: .鬼の出た跡へ先さす月夜哉
ro: oni no deta ato e saki sasu tsuki yo kana
en:
after the demons
have all gone...
bright moon

jp: .かくれ家や歯のない口で福は内
ro: kakurega ya ha no nai kuchi de fuku wa uchi
en:
secluded house--
a toothless mouth cries
"Luck indoors!"

jp: .闇がりへ鬼追出して笑ひ哉
ro: kuragari e oni oi-dashite warai kana
en:
driving demons
into the darkness...
laughing

jp: .高砂や鬼追出も歯ぬけ声
ro: takasago ya oni oi-dasu mo hanuke-goe
en:
Takasago--
shouting away demons
a toothless one too

jp: .あなた任せ任せぞとしは犬もとり
ro: anata makase makase zo toshi wa inu mo tori
en:
trust, trust in Buddha!
you're a year older too
dog

jp: .としとるや犬も烏も天窓数
ro: toshitoru ya inu mo karasu mo atama kazu
en:
a year older
the dog and the crow...
headcount

jp: .君が代や厄おとしに御いせ迄
ro: kimi ga yo ya yaku wo otoshi ni o-ise made
en:
Great Japan!
to drive out devils
to Ise I go

jp: .三ケ月と肩を並べてあじろ守
ro: mikazuki to kata wo nara[be]te ajiro mori
en:
his shoulder aligned
with the sickle moon...
fisherman

jp: .一掴み麦を蒔たり堂の隅
ro: hito tsukami mugi wo makitari dô no sumi
en:
sowing a fistful
of wheat...
temple nook

jp: .一掴み麦を蒔ぞよ門雀
ro: hito tsukami mugi wo maku zo yo kado suzume
en:
sowing a fistful
of wheat...
sparrows at the gate

jp: .ここらから都か紙子きる女
ro: kokora kara miyako ka kamiko kiru onna
en:
"Are these the outskirts
of Kyoto?"
woman in a paper robe

jp: .時雨来よ来よとて紙衣かな
ro: shigure ko yo ko yo tote kamiko kana
en:
winter rain--
come! come!
my paper robe

jp: .其木から奈良かよ紙衣きる女
ro: sono ki kara nara ka yo kamiko kiru onna
en:
"From this tree on
am I in Nara?"
woman in a paper robe

jp: .似合しや女坂下る紙衣達
ro: niaishi ya onnazaka oriru kamiko-dachi
en:
well suited--
down the slope they go
in paper robes

jp: .町並に紙子なんどとむづかしき
ro: machinami ni kamiko nando [to] muzukashiki
en:
row of houses--
the people in paper robes
hard to count

jp: .明神の御猿とあそぶ紙子哉
ro: myôjin no o-saru to asobu kamiko kana
en:
playing with the god's
sacred monkeys...
paper robe

jp: .唐の吉野へいざと紙子哉
ro: morokoshi no yoshino e i[za] to kamiko kana
en:
like in old China
to Yoshino they go...
paper robes

jp: .衾から顔出してよぶ菜うり哉
ro: fusuma kara kao dashite yobu nauri kana
en:
a face pokes out
the winter quilt...
"Hey, vegetable man!"

jp: .安房猫おのがふとんは知にけり
ro: ahô neko ono ga futon wa shiri ni keri
en:
fool cat--
yet he knows which futon
is his

jp: .今少雁を聞とてふとん哉
ro: ima sukoshi kari wo kiku tote futon kana
en:
won't be long now
I'll hear the wild geese...
futon

jp: .さる人が真丸に寝るふとん哉
ro: saru hito ga manmaru ni neru futon kana
en:
the man who left
slept in a ball...
futon

jp: .ふとんきて達磨もどきに居りけり
ro: futon kite daruma modoki ni suwari keri
en:
tucking into my futon
just like Dharma
I sit

jp: .ふとんきるや翌のわらじを枕元
ro: futon kiru ya asu no waraji wo makura moto
en:
tucking into my futon
tomorrow's straw sandals
by the pillow

jp: .まじまじと達磨もどきのふとん哉
ro: maji-maji to daruma modoki no futon kana
en:
my eyes glaring, glaring--
just like Dharma
in my futon

jp: .目覚しの人形並べるふとん哉
ro: mezameshi no ningyô naraberu futon kana
en:
waking up
to a row of dolls...
my futon

jp: .侘ぬれば猫のふとんをかりにけり
ro: wabi nureba neko no futon wo kari ni keri
en:
my last resort--
I borrow the cat's
futon

jp: .我宿はつくねた雪の麓哉
ro: waga yado wa tsukuneta yuki no fumoto kana
en:
at my dwelling
the lumped-together snow...
foothills

jp: .有明や雪で作るも如来様
ro: ariake ya yuki de tsukuru mo nyorai-sama
en:
dawn--
with snow I make
Lord Buddha

jp: .うす雪の仏を作る子ども哉
ro: usu yuki no hotoke wo tsukuru kodomo kana
en:
he rolls thin snow
into a Buddha...
the child

jp: .御ひざに雀鳴也雪仏
ro: on-hiza ni suzume naku nari yuki-botoke
en:
a sparrow chirping
in his lap...
snow Buddha

jp: .とるとしもあなた任せぞ雪仏
ro: torutoshi mo anata makase zo yuki-botoke
en:
growing old too
I trust in a Buddha
of snow

jp: .はづかしや子どもも作る雪仏
ro: hazukashi ya kodomo mo tsukuru yuki-botoke
en:
ashamed--
even a child has made
a snow Buddha

jp: .はつ雪や仏にするもむづかしき
ro: hatsu yuki ya hotoke ni suru mo muzukashiki
en:
first snow--
making a Buddha of you
is hard too

jp: .雪仏犬の子どもが御好げな
ro: yuki-botoke inu no kodomo ga o-sukigena
en:
the snow Buddha
likes the puppy
it seems

jp: .我門にとしとり給へ雪仏
ro: waga kado ni toshitori tamae yuki-botoke
en:
grow old
at my gate, if you wish...
snow Buddha

jp: .わんぱくが仕業ながらも雪仏
ro: wanpaku ga shiwaza nagara mo yuki-botoke
en:
naughty child--
instead of his chores
a snow Buddha

jp: .雪礫馬が喰んとしたりけり
ro: yukitsubete uma ga kuwan to shitari keri
en:
my snowball--
the horse
ate it

jp: .雪礫投る拍子にころぶかな
ro: yukitsubute tojiru hyôshi ni korobu kana
en:
to the beat
of the snowballs
he tumbles

jp: .我袖になげてくれぬや雪礫
ro: waga sode ni nagete kurenu ya yukitsubute
en:
hurled, it lands
in my sleeve...
a snowball

jp: .大菊を喰仕廻迄冬篭
ro: ôgiku wo kui shimau made fuyugomori
en:
until the big chrysanthemum's
completely gobbled...
my winter seclusion

jp: .菊喰虫と云れて冬篭り
ro: kiku kurau mushi to iwarete fuyugomori
en:
he's called
the mum-gobbling bug...
winter seclusion

jp: .君が代は女もす也冬篭り
ro: kimi ga yo wa onna mo su nari fuyugomori
en:
in Great Japan
women do it too...
winter seclusion

jp: .猪熊と隣づからや冬篭
ro: shishi kuma to tonari-zukara ya fuyugomori
en:
boars and bears
are my neighbors...
winter seclusion

jp: .梨柿は烏任せよ冬ごもり
ro: nashi kaki wa karasu makase yo fuyugomori
en:
pears and persimmons
left for the crows...
winter seclusion

jp: .冬篭けしきに並ぶ小薮哉
ro: fuyugomori keshiki ni narabu ko yobu kana
en:
in my winter seclusion
line of sight...
a little thicket

jp: .冬篭る奴が喰ふぞよ菊の花
ro: fuyugomoru yatsu ga kuu zo yo kiku no hana
en:
winter seclusion--
some little pest nibbles
my chrysanthemum

jp: .雀来よ炬燵弁慶是に有
ro: suzume ki yo kotatsu-benkei kore ni ari
en:
come, sparrows!
get warm at my brazier
I'm a great hero!

jp: .前の世によい種蒔て炬燵哉
ro: mae no yo ni yoi tane maite kotatsu kana
en:
in my previous life
good seeds were sown...
my cozy brazier!

jp: .朝晴にぱちぱち炭のきげん哉
ro: asa hare ni pachi-pachi sumi no kigen kana
en:
on a clear morning
the coal fire in a crackling
mood

jp: .一茶坊に過たるものや炭一俵
ro: issa-bô ni sugitaru mono ya sumi ippyô
en:
more than enough
for Priest Issa...
one bag of coal

jp: .おこり炭峰の松風通ひけり
ro: okori-zumi mine no matsu kaze kayoi keri
en:
morning's charcoal fire--
the mountain's pine breeze
wafting by

jp: .直なるも曲るも同じ炭火哉
ro: sugu naru mo magaru mo onaji sumibi kana
en:
whether upright
or crooked it's the same...
charcoal fire

jp: .すりこ木も炭打程に老にけり
ro: surikogi mo sumi utsu hodo ni oi ni keri
en:
my pestle, too
for pounding charcoal
has grown old

jp: .手さぐりに掴んでくべる粉炭哉
ro: tesaguri ni tsukan[de] kuberu funtan kana
en:
groping for it
to feed the fire...
coal dust

jp: .一人にはありあまる也ひろひ炭
ro: hitori ni wa ariamaru nari hiroi-zumi
en:
for one person
it's more than enough...
gathered charcoal

jp: .深川や一升炭もわたし舟
ro: fukagawa [ya] isshô sumi mo watashibune
en:
Fukagawa--
one measure of charcoal too
on the ferry

jp: .福の神やどらせ給へおこり炭
ro: fuku no kami yadorase tamae okori-zumi
en:
good luck god
come live here, please!
morning's charcoal fire

jp: .ふだらくや岸打波をはしり炭
ro: fudaraku ya kishi utsu nami wo hashiri sumi
en:
"O Fudaraku
where waves pound the shore..."
winter's first charcoal fire

jp: .曲ったも一ッけしきやおこり炭
ro: magatta mo hitotsu keshiki ya okori-zumi
en:
though crooked
it's quite a sight...
morning's charcoal fire

jp: .待時は犬も来ぬ也おこりずみ
ro: matsu toki wa inu mo konu nari okori-zumi
en:
in the waiting time
even the dog won't come...
morning's charcoal fire

jp: .魚串のさし所也炭俵
ro: uogushi no sashi-dokoro nari sumidawara
en:
stuck
to the fish-skewer
a bag of charcoal

jp: .雲と見し桜は炭にやかれけり
ro: kumo to mishi sakura wa sumi ni yakare keri
en:
the cherry tree
that made blossom clouds
becomes charcoal

jp: .炭竈のちょぼちょぼけぶる長閑さよ
ro: sumigama no chobo chobo keburu nodokasa yo
en:
the charcoal kiln's smoke
puff by puff...
tranquility

jp: .炭竈やあれが桜の夕けぶり
ro: sumigama ya are ga sakura no yû keburi
en:
charcoal kiln--
the cherry tree becoming
evening smoke

jp: .炭竈や今に焼るる山ざくら
ro: sumigama ya ima ni yakeruru yama-zakura
en:
charcoal kiln--
the soon-to-be-cooked
mountain cherry tree

jp: .炭竈や師走らしくもなかりけり
ro: sumigama [ya] shiwasurashiku mo nakari keri
en:
a charcoal kiln smokes--
doesn't feel
like Twelfth Month

jp: .見よ子ども爺が炭竈今けぶる
ro: mi yo kodomo jiji ga sumigama ima keburu
en:
look, children!
the old man's charcoal kiln
is smoking

jp: .今の世や女もすする鰒汁
ro: ima no yo ya onna mo susuru fukuto-jiru
en:
the world today!
even a woman slurps
pufferfish soup

jp: .肩越に馬の覗くや鰒汁
ro: katagoshi ni uma no nozoku ya fukuto-jiru
en:
the horse peeks
over his shoulder...
pufferfish soup

jp: .鰒喰ぬ奴には見せな不二の山
ro: fugu kuwanu yatsu ni wa misena fuji no yama
en:
no pufferfish soup
for the lackey...
no view of Mount Fuji

jp: .鰒汁やせ中にあてる箱根山
ro: fugu shiru ya senaka ni ateru hakone yama
en:
pufferfish soup--
turning my back
to Mount Hakone

jp: .木兎はとしの暮るがおかしいか
ro: mimizuku wa toshi no kureru ga okashiii ka
en:
hey scops owl!
is the year's end
funny to you?

jp: .朝々にうぐひすも鳴けいこ哉
ro: asa-asa ni uguisu mo naku keiko kana
en:
morning after morning
the nightingale's
singing lesson

jp: .みそさざいこの三十日を合点か
ro: misosazai kono tsugomori wo gatten ka
en:
hey wren!
do you realize
it's the 30th?

jp: .我ひざもかぞへて行やみそさざい
ro: waga hiza mo kazoete yuku ya misosazai
en:
coming to count
my lap too...
the wren

jp: .芦の家や枕の上も鳴千鳥
ro: ashi no ya ya makura no ue mo naku chidori
en:
the reed house--
even on the pillow
a plover sings

jp: .御地蔵と日向ぼこして鳴千鳥
ro: o-jizô to hinata bokoshite naku chidori
en:
basking in the sun
with holy Jizo...
a plover sings

jp: .象潟の欠をかぞへて鳴千鳥
ro: kisagata no kake wo kazoete naku chidori
en:
counting the remains
of Kisa Lagoon...
a singing plover

jp: .象潟の欠を掴んで鳴千鳥
ro: kisagata no kake wo tsukande naku chidori
en:
clutching a piece
of Kisa Lagoon...
a singing plover

jp: .雪隠も名所のうちぞ鳴千鳥
ro: setchin mo meisho no uchi zo naku chidori
en:
the outhouse too
in a famous resort...
a plover sings

jp: .ちちははの小言聞々千鳥哉
ro: chichi haha no kogoto kiki-kiki chidori kana
en:
I hear my father
and mother nagging...
plovers

jp: .鳴な鳴な春が来るぞよばか千鳥
ro: naku na naku na haru ga kuru zo yo baka chidori
en:
stop crying!
spring's on its way
foolish plover

jp: .干菜切音も須磨也鳴千鳥
ro: hoshina kiru oto mo suma nari naku chidori
en:
chopping dried rape
another sound on Suma Beach...
singing plovers

jp: .けふもけふもだまって暮す小鴨哉
ro: kyô mo kyô mo damatte kurasu ko kamo kana
en:
today too
keeping perfectly quiet...
little duck

jp: .不便さよ豆に馴たる鴨鴎
ro: fubinsa yo mame ni naretaru kamo kamome
en:
what a pity--
getting used to beans
ducks and gulls

jp: .君が世のとっぱづれ也浮寝鳥
ro: kimi ga yo no toppazure nari ukinedori
en:
at all the edges
of Great Japan...
waterfowl

jp: .君が世や国のはづれもうき寝鳥
ro: kimi ga yo ya kuni no hazure mo ukinedori
en:
Great Japan!
on the country's outskirts, too
waterfowl

jp: .人鬼をいきどほるかよ鰒の顔
ro: hito oni wo ikidôru ka yo fugu no kao
en:
are you mad
at the human goblins?
face of the pufferfish

jp: .おち葉してけろりと立し土蔵哉
ro: ochiba shite kerori to tateshi dozô kana
en:
among fallen leaves
cool and aloof...
storehouse

jp: .淋しさやおち葉が下の先祖達
ro: sabishisa ya ochiba ga shita no senzotachi
en:
solitude--
under the fallen leaves
my ancestors

jp: .霜がれや壁のうしろは越後山
ro: shimogare ya kabe no ushiro wa echigo yama
en:
frost-killed grass--
behind the wall
Echigo mountains

jp: .編の目に水仙の花咲にけり
ro: ami no me ni suisen no hana saki ni keri
en:
in the meshes
of the net daffodils
in bloom

jp: .家ありてそして水仙畠かな
ro: ie arite soshite suisen hatake kana
en:
there's a house!
a field full
of daffodils

jp: .窪村は小便小屋も水仙ぞ
ro: kubo mura wa shôben goya mo suisen zo
en:
low-lying village--
at the outhouse, too
daffodils

jp: .水仙の笠をかりてや寝る小雀
ro: suisen no kasa wo karite ya neru ko suzume
en:
borrowing the umbrella-hat
daffodil, asleep...
little sparrow

jp: .水仙の花の御港誕生時
ro: suisen no hana no o-minato tanjôji
en:
a harbor
of blooming daffodils...
Tanjo Temple

jp: .水仙や大仕合せのきりぎりす
ro: suisen ya ôshiawase no kirigirisu
en:
daffodils--
and for good luck
a katydid!

jp: .水仙や垣にかひ込角田川
ro: suisen ya kaki ni kaikomu sumida-gawa
en:
daffodils
grow into the fence...
Sumida River

jp: .水仙やせ中にあてる上総山
ro: suisen ya senaka ni ateru kazusa yama
en:
daffodils--
I show Kazusa mountains
my back

jp: .水仙や隙とも見へぬ古かがし
ro: suisen ya hima tomo mienu furu kagashi
en:
daffodils--
the old scarecrow
seems busy

jp: .御侍御傘忘れな水仙花
ro: mi-saburai mi-kasa wasure na suisen hana
en:
Sir Samurai
don't forget your umbrella!
daffodil

jp: .茶の花に隠んぼする雀哉
ro: cha no hana ni kakurenbo suru suzume kana
en:
playing hide-and-seek
in tea blossoms...
sparrows

jp: .山道の曲り々し心かな
ro: yama michi no magari-magarishi kokoro kana
en:
the mountain road's
twisting, winding
heart

jp: .あれ小雪さあ元日ぞ元日ぞ
ro: are ko yuki saa ganjitsu zo ganjitsu zo
en:
hey little snow
it's New Year's Day!
New Year's Day!

jp: .かれらにも元日させん鳩すずめ
ro: karera ni mo ganjitsu-sasen hato suzume
en:
for them too
a New Year's feast...
pigeons, sparrows

jp: .又ことし娑婆塞なる此身哉
ro: mata kotoshi shaba-fusagi naru kono mi kana
en:
another year
just taking up space...
my life

jp: .正月や辻の仏も赤頭巾
ro: shôgatsu ya tsuji no hotoke mo aka zukin
en:
First Month--
on the crossroads Buddha
a red skullcap

jp: .骨っぽい柴のけぶるをけさの春
ro: honeppoi shiba no keburu wo kesa no hana
en:
the brushwood fire's smoke
coaxes
spring's first dawn

jp: .わが春も上々吉よけさの空
ro: waga haru mo jôjôkichi yo kesa no sora
en:
my spring
is lucky, lucky!
this morning's sky

jp: .男風今や吹らん島の春
ro: otoko kaze ima ya fukaran shimo no haru
en:
now a manly wind
blows...
spring island

jp: .あっさりと春は来にけり浅黄空
ro: assari to haru wa ki ni keri asagi-zora
en:
spring comes simply
with a pale blue
sky

jp: .御傘めす月から春は来たりけり
ro: o-kasa mesu tsuki kara haru wa kitari keri
en:
with that moon
and its halo...
spring has come

jp: .湯けぶりも月夜の春となりにけり
ro: yu keburi mo tsuki yo no haru to nari ni keri
en:
hot bath steam--
it's become a moonlit
night of spring

jp: .うす墨の夕ながらもはつ空ぞ
ro: usu-zumi no yû nagara mo hatsu-zora zo
en:
at evening
like washed-out ink...
the year's first sky

jp: .うす墨のやうな色でも初空ぞ
ro: usu-zumi no yôna iro demo hatsuzora zo
en:
a drab color
but it's the year's
first sky!

jp: .塀合や三尺ばかりはつ空ぞ
ro: heiai ya sanjaku bakari hatsu-zora [zo]
en:
facing fences--
just three feet wide
the year's first sky

jp: .松間や少ありてもはつ空ぞ
ro: matsu ai ya sukoshi arite mo hatsu-zora zo
en:
among the pines
just a piece of it but still...
the year's first sky!

jp: .松並や木の間木の間のはつ空ぞ
ro: matsu nami ya ki no ma ki no ma no hatsu-zora zo
en:
row of pines--
in patches between trees
the year's first sky

jp: .よわ足を又年神の御せわ哉
ro: yowa ashi wo mata toshi-gami no o-sewa kana
en:
praying the New Year's god
will heal my weak foot...
again

jp: .ちさいのはおれが在所のどんど哉
ro: chisai no wa ore ga zaisho no dondo kana
en:
it's tiny
at my farmhouse...
New Year's bonfire

jp: .はやされよ庵の飾のけぶり様
ro: hayasare yo io no kazari no keburi-sama
en:
with a cheer
my hut's New Year's decorations
up in smoke

jp: .山添やはやしてもなきどんどやき
ro: yamazoi ya hayashite [mo] naki dondo yaki
en:
foot of the mountain--
without a cheer
my New Year's bonfire

jp: .世の中はどんどと直るどんど哉
ro: yo [no] naka wa don do to naoru dondo kana
en:
this world of ours--
so fast the bonfires
burn out

jp: .わか草よわか松さまよ門の松
ro: waka-gusa yo waka matsu-sama yo kado no matsu
en:
young grasses
young pine...
my New Year's decoration

jp: .福わらや雀が踊る鳶がまふ
ro: fukuwara ya suzume ga odoru tobi ga mau
en:
fresh straw for the garden!
a sparrow dances
a black kite wheels

jp: .福わらや十ばかりなる供奴
ro: fukuwara ya jû bakari naru tomo yakko
en:
fresh straw for the garden--
about ten servants
at work

jp: .玉も玉御とし玉ぞまめな顔
ro: tama mo tama o-toshi-dama zo mamena kao
en:
a present, a present
a New Year's present!
her pink cheeks

jp: .我庵やけさのとし玉とりに来る
ro: waga io ya kesa no toshidama tori ni kuru
en:
my hut--
all morning they come by
for New Year's gifts

jp: .番町や夕飯過の凧
ro: banchô ya yûmeshi sugi no ikanobori
en:
Bancho Town--
after dinner flying
a kite

jp: .大凧のりんとしてある日暮哉
ro: ôtako no rin to shite aru higure kana
en:
the big kite
cuts a brave figure...
Sunset

jp: .凧の尾を追かけ廻る狗
ro: tako no o wo oikake mawaru enoko kana
en:
chasing the kite's tail
'round and 'round...
puppy

jp: .江戸芥の山をえりはりわかな哉
ro: edo gomi no yama wo eriwari wakana kana
en:
on one of Edo's
mountains of rubbish...
picking herbs

jp: .負た子が先へ指さすわかな哉
ro: outta ko ga saki e yubi [sa]su wakana kana
en:
the child on her back
points them out first...
New Year's herbs

jp: .わかい衆や庵の薺も唄でつむ
ro: wakai shu ya io no nazuna mo uta de tsumu
en:
young folk--
even while picking my hut's herbs
they sing

jp: .門の木のあはう烏もはつ音哉
ro: kado no ki no ahô karasu mo hatsu koe zo
en:
tree by the gate
the year's first bird song
a foolish crow

jp: .さあ春が来たと一番烏哉
ro: saa haru ga kita to ichiban karasu kana
en:
"Well, spring has come!"
the year's first
crow

jp: .土の鍋土の狗の長閑也
ro: tsuchi no nabe tsuchi no enoko no nodoka nari
en:
an earthen pot
and an earthen puppy...
spring peace

jp: .菜畠に幣札立る日永哉
ro: na-batake ni nusa fuda tateru hi naga kana
en:
an offering placard
in the farm field...
a long day

jp: .茨薮に紙のぶらぶら日永哉
ro: bara yabu ni kami no bura-bura hi naga kana
en:
in a thorn patch
some paper, to and fro...
a long day

jp: .鑓もちて馬にまたがる日永哉
ro: yari mochite uma ni matagaru hi naga kana
en:
holding a spear
riding a horse...
a long day

jp: .やよ虱這へ這へ春の行方へ
ro: yayo shirami hae-hae haru no yuku kata e
en:
hey lice--
crawl after the departing
spring!

jp: .淡雪や野なら薮なら道者達
ro: awayuki [ya] no nara yabu nara dôsha-dachi
en:
a light snow
over fields, through woods...
pilgrims

jp: .思出し思出してや春の雪
ro: omoidashi omoidashite ya haru no yuki
en:
remembering
to fall again...
a light spring snow

jp: .一村は柳の中や春の雪
ro: hito mura wa yanagi no naka ya haru no yuki
en:
in a village
deep in the willows...
spring snow

jp: .梅鉢や竹に雀や春の雨
ro: ume-bachi ya take ni suzume ya haru no ame
en:
potted plum tree
sparrows in bamboo...
spring rain

jp: .客ぶりや犬も並んで春の雨
ro: kyakuburi ya inu mo narande haru no ame
en:
like a proper guest
the dog falls in...
spring rain

jp: .梟も面癖直せ春の雨
ro: fukurô mo tsuraguse naose haru no ame
en:
cheer up, owl!
the spring rain
is falling

jp: .藪尻の賽銭箱や春の雨
ro: yabu-jiri no saisen-bako ya haru no ame
en:
behind the thicket
an offering box...
spring rain

jp: .藪といふ藪がそれぞれ春の雨
ro: yabu to iu yabu ga sore-zore haru no ame
en:
for every thicket
every thicket...
spring rain

jp: .馬の背の幣に先吹春の風
ro: uma no se no nusa ni mazu fuku haru no kaze
en:
the horse's paper decorations
feel it first...
spring breeze

jp: .春風にお江戸の春も柳かな
ro: haru kaze ni o-edo no haru mo yanagi kana
en:
with the spring breeze
spring reaches Edo...
the willows!

jp: .春風に二番たばこのけぶり哉
ro: harukaze ni ni ban tabako no keburi kana
en:
in the spring breeze
my second pipe's
smoke

jp: .春風や大宮人の野雪隠
ro: haru kaze ya ômiyabito no no setchin
en:
spring breeze--
the great courtier
poops in the field

jp: .春風や小薮小祭小順礼
ro: haru kaze ya ko yabu ko matsuri ko junrei
en:
spring breeze--
a little thicket, little festival
little pilgrim

jp: .春風や地蔵の口の御飯粒
ro: haru kaze ya jizô no kuchi no o-meshi tsubu
en:
spring breeze--
on holy Jizo's lips
a grain of rice

jp: .春風や人でつくねし寺の山
ro: harukaze ya hito de tsukuneshi tera no yama
en:
spring breeze--
packed with people
the mountain temple

jp: .ぼた餅や地蔵のひざも春の風
ro: botamochi ya jizô no hiza mo haru no kaze
en:
rice cake with bean paste
on holy Jizo's lap
the spring breeze

jp: .白水の畠へ流て春の月
ro: shiro mizu no hata e nagarete haru no tsuki
en:
silver water flowing
toward the garden...
spring moon

jp: .土橋の御神酒得利や春の月
ro: tsuchi-bashi no o-[mi]ki dokuri ya haru no tsuki
en:
on an earthen bridge
an offering of sake...
spring moon

jp: .湯けぶりも月夜の春と成りにけり
ro: yu keburi mo tsuki yo no haru to nari ni keri
en:
steam from my bath
and the moonlight...
springtime!

jp: .雨だれのぽちぽち朧月夜哉
ro: amadare [no] pochi-pochi oboro tsuki yo kana
en:
from the roof's overhang
dripping, dripping...
hazy moon

jp: .我立た畠の棒もおぼろ月
ro: waga tateta hatake no bô mo oboro-zuki
en:
over the pole I stuck
in the garden...
hazy moon

jp: .かすむとてよろこび烏ばかり哉
ro: kasumu tote yorokobi karasu bakari kana
en:
in the mist
crows are rejoicing...
nothing else

jp: .かすむ夜やうらから見ても吉原ぞ
ro: kasumu yo ya ura kara mite mo yoshiwara zo
en:
misty evening--
out the back door too
Yoshiwara

jp: .折角にかすんでくれし榎哉
ro: sekkaku ni kasunde kureshi enoki kana
en:
a custom-made mist
just for it...
nettle tree

jp: .野ばくちや藪の法談も一かすみ
ro: no bakuchi ya yabu no dangi mo hito kasumi
en:
gambling in the field
a sermon in the thicket...
one mist

jp: .一聳かすみ放しの榎哉
ro: hito sobie kasumi hanashi no enoki kana
en:
one soars
released from the mist...
nettle tree

jp: .ぼた餅をつかんでかすむ烏哉
ro: botamochi wo tsukande kasumu karasu kana
en:
snatching a jellied rice cake
in the mist...
crow

jp: .我里はどうかすんでもいびつ也
ro: waga sato wa dô kasunde mo ibitsu nari
en:
even in the mist
my village
is a mess

jp: .我をよぶ人の顔よりかすみ哉
ro: ware wo yobu hito [no] kao yori kasumi kana
en:
from the face
of the man yelling for me...
mist

jp: .陽炎にぐいぐい猫の鼾かな
ro: kagerô ni gui-gui neko no ibiki kana
en:
in heat shimmers
the cat snores
deeply

jp: .陽炎や縁からころり寝ぼけ猫
ro: kagerô ya en kara korori neboke neko
en:
heat shimmers--
off the verandah tumbles
the half-asleep cat

jp: .今解る雪を流や千曲川
ro: ima tokeru yuki wo nagasu ya chikuma kawa
en:
the snow melting
now flows away...
Chikuma River

jp: .沙汰なしに大雪とれし御山哉
ro: sata nashi ni ôyuki toreshi o-yama kana
en:
without fanfare
the great snow has left...
mountain

jp: .十ばかり鍋うつむける雪げ哉
ro: jû bakari nabe utsumukeru yukige kana
en:
about ten cooking pots
upside-down...
snow is melting!

jp: .丸い雪四角な雪も流れけり
ro: marui yuki yosumina yuki mo naga[re] keri
en:
the round patches
the square patches...
snow floats away!

jp: .薮村や雪の解るもむづかしき
ro: yabu mura ya yuki no tokeru mo muzukashiki
en:
in the remote village
snow melting also
is not easy

jp: .雪とけて村一ぱいの子ども哉
ro: yuki tokete mura ippai no kodomo kana
en:
snow melting
the village brimming over...
with children!

jp: .我国は何にも咲かぬ彼岸哉
ro: waga kuni wa nannimo sakanu higan kana
en:
in my province
nothing blooming yet...
spring equinox

jp: .大原に出代駕の通りけり
ro: ôhara ni degawari kago no tôri keri
en:
across the wide plain
a migrating servant
in a palanquin

jp: .家並や土の雛も祭らるる
ro: ienami ya tsuchi no hina mo matsuraruru
en:
every house on the street
celebrates the festival...
clay dolls

jp: .けふの日や山の庵も雛の餅
ro: kyô no hi ya yama no iori mo hina no mochi
en:
today
even in the mountain hut
rice cake for a doll

jp: .笹の家や雛の顔へ草の雨
ro: sasa no ya ya hiina no kao e kusa no ame
en:
thatched house--
on the doll's face dripping
rain

jp: .雛棚やたばこけぶりも一気色
ro: hina-dana ya tabako keburi mo hito keshiki
en:
a shelf of dolls
and pipe smoke...
one scene

jp: .薮村の雛の餅つくさわぎ哉
ro: yabu mura no hina no mochi tsuku sawagi kana
en:
remote village--
they pound rice cakes
for their dolls

jp: .盃よ先流るるな三ケの月
ro: sakazuki yo mazu nagaruru na mika no tsuki
en:
oh sake cup
don't go floating away!
a sickle moon

jp: .鶏が先踏んでみる炉蓋哉
ro: niwatori ga saki funde miru robuta kana
en:
the chicken tries
walking on it first...
lid on the sunken hearth

jp: .欠にも節の付たる茶つみ哉
ro: akubi ni mo fushi no tsukitaru cha tsumi kana
en:
even while yawning
she keeps the tune...
tea picking

jp: .しがらきや大僧正も茶つみ唄
ro: shiragaki ya ôsôjô mo cha tsumi uta
en:
Shigaraki--
even the high priest sings
a tea-picking song

jp: .だまってもつまぬや尻の茶の木藪
ro: damatte mo tsumanu ya shiri no cha no kiyabu
en:
in the thicket
behind the house, silence...
no one picking tea

jp: .烏等も恋をせよとてやく野哉
ro: karasura mo koi wo seyo tote yaku no kana
en:
make love, crows
while you can!
burning fields

jp: .わらんべも蛙もはやす焼の哉
ro: waranbe mo kawazu mo hayasu yaku no kana
en:
children and frogs
raise a cheer...
the field on fire

jp: .雲に似て山の腰起す畠哉
ro: kumo ni nite yama no koshi okosu hatake kana
en:
like clouds
on the mountain's hips...
plowed fields

jp: .畠打の真似して歩く烏哉
ro: hata uchi no mane shite aruku karasu kana
en:
mocking the farmer
plowing, the strutting
crow

jp: .畠打や腕の先のにほの海
ro: hata uchi ya kaina no saki no nio no umi
en:
he plows his field
an arm's length away...
sea of grebes

jp: .畠打やざぶりと浴る山桜
ro: hata uchi ya zaburi to abiru yama-zakura
en:
plowing the field
in a shower of mountain
cherry blossoms

jp: .あまり鳴て石になるなよ猫の恋
ro: amari naite ishi ni naru na yo neko no koi
en:
such yowling
don't turn to stone!
lover cat

jp: .うかれ猫奇妙に焦れて参りけり
ro: ukare neko kimyô ni jirete mairi keri
en:
the love-crazed cat
strangely on edge
wanders off

jp: .梅のきず桜のとげや猫の恋
ro: ume no kizu sakura no toge ya neko no koi
en:
plum trees are eyesores!
cherry trees have thorns!
cats in heat

jp: .つりがねのやうな声して猫の恋
ro: tsurigane no yôna koe shite neko no koe
en:
with a voice
like a temple bell...
the lover cat

jp: .猫の恋打切棒に別れけり
ro: neko no koi bukkirabô ni wakare keri
en:
the lover cats
bluntly go
their separate ways

jp: .親のない一つ雀のふとりけり
ro: oya no nai hitotsu suzume no futori keri
en:
the lone orphan sparrow
nice
and plump

jp: .来い来いと腹こなさする雀の子
ro: koi koi to hara konasasuru suzume no ko
en:
come! come here!
digest your food
baby sparrow

jp: .参詣のたばこにむせな雀の子
ro: sankei no tabako ni musena suzume no ko
en:
temple visit--
don't choke on the pipe smoke
baby sparrow!

jp: .雀の子地蔵の袖にかくれけり
ro: suzume no ko jizô no sode ni kakure keri
en:
baby sparrow
safe in holy Jizo's
sleeve

jp: .竹に来よ梅に来よとや親雀
ro: take ni kiyo ume ni kiyo to ya oya suzume
en:
"Come to the bamboo!
Come to the plum tree!"
mother sparrow calls

jp: .むら雀さらにまま子はなかりけり
ro: mura suzume sara ni mamako wa nakari keri
en:
flock of sparrows--
and not one of them
a stepchild

jp: .我と来てあそぶや親のない雀
ro: ware to kite asobu ya oya no nai suzume
en:
coming to play
with me...
orphan sparrow

jp: .赤い実を咥た所が鶯ぞ
ro: akai mi wo kuwaete toko ga uguisu zo
en:
a red berry
in its beak posing...
nightingale

jp: .鶯が呑ぞ浴るぞ割下水
ro: uguisu ga nomu zo abiru zo wari gesui
en:
the nightingale
drinks and bathes...
sewage canal

jp: .鶯に仏の飯のけぶりけり
ro: uguisu ni hotoke no meshi no keburi keri
en:
in the nightingale's
song, steam
from the Buddha's rice

jp: .鶯の袖するばかり鳴にけり
ro: uguisu no sode suru bakari naki ni keri
en:
nightingale--
only an off-the-cuff
song

jp: .鶯のぬからぬ顔や京の山
ro: uguisu no nukaranu kao ya kyô no yama
en:
the nightingale's
"I'm perfect" face...
Kyoto's mountain

jp: .鶯のふいふい田舎かせぎ哉
ro: uguisu no fui-fui inaka kasegi kana
en:
the nightingale
flitting about makes his living
in the country

jp: .鶯やあのものといふやうな顔
ro: uguisu ya ano mono to iu yôna kao
en:
nightingale--
just a run-of-the-mill
face

jp: .鶯があのものといふ口つきぞ
ro: uguisu ya ano mono to iu kuchitsuki zo
en:
nightingale--
just a run-of-the-mill
voice

jp: .鶯や田舎の梅も咲だんべい
ro: uguisu ya inaka no ume mo saku-danbei
en:
a nightingale--
plum trees in the countryside
should be blooming

jp: .鶯や田舎廻りが楽だんべい
ro: uguisu ya inaka mawari ga raku-danbei
en:
a nightingale--
touring the countryside
should be fun

jp: .鶯や会釈もなしに梅の花
ro: uguisu ya eshaku mo nashi ni ume no hana
en:
the nightingale
doesn't bow...
plum trees in bloom

jp: .鶯やかさい訛りもけさの空
ro: uguisu ya kasai namari mo kesa no sora
en:
nightingales--
country accents, too
in the morning sky

jp: .鶯や泥足ぬぐふ梅の花
ro: uguisu ya doro ashi nuguu ume no hana
en:
a nightingale wipes
his muddy feet...
plum blossoms

jp: .鶯や鳴けども鳴けども里遠き
ro: uguisu ya nake [do]mo nake [do]mo sato tôki
en:
hey nightingale
sing! sing!
the town's far away

jp: .なけよなけ下手鶯もおれが窓
ro: nake yo nake heta uguisu mo ore ga mado
en:
sing! sing!
off-key nightingale
at my window

jp: .山崎や山鶯も下々の客
ro: yamazaki ya yama uguisu mo gege no kyaku
en:
Yamazaki--
the nightingale from the mountain, too
a third-class guest

jp: .我友の後家鶯よ鶯よ
ro: waga tomo no goke uguisu yo uguisu yo
en:
my friend's widow--
a nightingale!
a nightingale!

jp: .今植た木へぶら下る乙鳥哉
ro: ima ueta ki e burasagaru tsubame kana
en:
dangling over
the fresh-planted tree...
a swallow

jp: .起よ起よあこが乙鳥鳩すずめ
ro: oki yo oki yo ako ga tsubame hato suzume
en:
wake up! wake up! my children--
swallows, pigeons
sparrows

jp: .乙鳥よ是はそなたが桃の花
ro: tsubakura yo kore wa sonata ga momo no hana
en:
swallows--
these peach blossoms belong
to you

jp: .乙鳥とぶや二度とふたたび来ぬふりに
ro: tsubame tobu ya nido to futa tabi konu furi ni
en:
flying swallows--
as if there's no turning back
for them

jp: .とび下手は庵の燕ぞ燕ぞよ
ro: tobi heta wa io no tsubame zo tsubame zo yo
en:
not much of a flyer
my hut's
swallow!

jp: .まあな尻ついと並る乙鳥哉
ro: mamena shiri tsui to naraberu tsubame kana
en:
their cute butts suddenly
all in a row...
swallows

jp: .飯前に京へいて来る乙鳥哉
ro: meshimae ni kyô e ite kuru tsubame kana
en:
before dinner
off to Kyoto and back...
swallows

jp: .我庵や先は燕のまめな顔
ro: waga io ya mazu wa tsubame no mamena kao
en:
at my hut, first thing--
the healthy face
of a swallow

jp: .から腹と人はいふ也朝雲雀
ro: kara hara to hito wa iu nari asa hibari
en:
people call it
"empty belly" hunger...
morning lark

jp: .人は蟻と打ちらかって鳴雲雀
ro: hito wa ari to uchi-chirakatte naku hibari
en:
people scatter
like ants...
the lark sings

jp: .むさし野にたった一ッの雲雀哉
ro: musashi no ni tatta hitotsu no hibari kana
en:
over Musashi Plain
only one...
skylark

jp: .門番が花桶からも雲雀哉
ro: kado ban ga hana oke kara mo hibari kana
en:
from the gate sentinel's
flowerpot...
a skylark!

jp: .薮尻はまだ闇いぞよ鳴雲雀
ro: yabu-jiri wa mada kurai zo yo naku hibari
en:
the rear of the thicket
still dark...
a lark sings

jp: .朝寝坊が窓からのろり雉哉
ro: asanebô ga mado kara norori kigisu kana
en:
a late riser
he's slow to leave my window...
pheasant

jp: .石川をざぶざぶ渡る雉哉
ro: ishi-gawa wo zabu-zabu wataru kigisu kana
en:
splish splash
across the shallow river...
a pheasant!

jp: .大筵雉を鳴せて置にけり
ro: ômushiro kiji wo nakisete oki ni keri
en:
laying out my big mat
I make a pheasant
cry

jp: .大屋根の桶の中から雉哉
ro: ôyane no oke no naka kara kigisu kana
en:
from the bucket
on the big roof...
a pheasant

jp: .立臼に片尻かけてきじの鳴く
ro: tachi usu ni kata shiri kakete kiji no naku
en:
on the rice cake tub
tail hanging
the pheasant cries

jp: .野の雉起給へとや雉の鳴く
ro: no no kiji oki tamae to ya kiji no naku
en:
go wake the pheasants
in the field!
crying pheasant

jp: .花のちるちるとてきじの夜鳴哉
ro: hana no chiru-chiru tote kiji no yo naku kana
en:
"Blossoms are falling!
falling!" the pheasant's
night cry

jp: .髭どのを伸上りつつきじの鳴
ro: hige dono wo nobi-agaritsutsu kiji no naku
en:
Sir Whiskers gets an earful--
on tiptoe
the pheasant cries

jp: .一星見つけたやうにきじの鳴
ro: hitotsu hoshi mitsuketa yô ni kiji no naku
en:
as if it just spotted
a star
the pheasant cries

jp: .びんずるの御膝に寝たる雉哉
ro: binzuru no o-hiza ni netaru kigisu kana
en:
in Holy Binzuru's lap
sound asleep...
a pheasant

jp: .本堂に首つつ込んで雉の鳴
ro: hon dô ni kubi tsutsu konde kiji [no] naku
en:
sticking their necks
into the temple hall
pheasants sing

jp: .山きじの妻をよぶのか叱るのか
ro: yama kiji no tsuma wo yobu no ka shikaru no ka
en:
mountain pheasant
are you calling the wife?
scolding her?

jp: .山の雉あれでも妻をよぶ声か
ro: yama no kiji are demo tsuma wo yobu koe ka
en:
mountain pheasant--
is that your wife-calling
voice?

jp: .辛崎の松はどう見た帰る雁
ro: karasaki no matsu wa dô mita kae[ru] kari
en:
how did the pine
of Karasaki look?
returning geese

jp: .我顔にむっとしたやら帰る雁
ro: waga kao ni mutto shita yara kae[ru] kari
en:
all in a huff
seeing my face...
migrant goose

jp: .うす縁にばりして逃る鳴蛙
ro: usuberi [ni] bari shite nigeru naku kawazu
en:
piddling on the mat
as he flees...
croaking frog

jp: .草陰につんとしている蛙かな
ro: kusa kage ni tsunto shite iru kawazu kana
en:
in grassy shade
acting stuck-up...
a frog

jp: .ちる花にのさばり廻る蛙哉
ro: chiru hana ni nosabari mawaru kawazu kana
en:
lording over
the scattering blossoms...
a frog

jp: .菜畠に妻やこもりて鳴蛙
ro: na-batake ni tsuma ya komorite naku kawazu
en:
in the farm field
his wife hides...
croaking frog

jp: .一ッ星見つけたやうになく蛙
ro: hitotsu hoshi mi-tsuketa yô ni naku kawazu
en:
like he just now
spotted a star...
croaking frog

jp: .我一人醒たり顔の蛙哉
ro: ware hitori sametari kao no kawazu kana
en:
for me all alone
his sober face...
a frog

jp: .天窓干すお婆々や蝶も一むしろ
ro: atama hosu o-baba ya chô mo hito mushiro
en:
granny drying her hair
and a butterfly...
one straw mat

jp: .大雨の降って涌たる小てふ哉
ro: ôame no futte waitaru ko chô kana
en:
in the big rain
gushing down
little butterfly

jp: .さをしかの角をも遊ぶ小てふ哉
ro: saoshika no tsuno wo asobu ko chô kana
en:
even the buck's antlers
are a plaything...
little butterfly

jp: .蝶とんでくわらくわら川のきげん哉
ro: chô tonde kara-kara kawa no kigen kana
en:
butterflies flitting--
the river laughing
ha-ha-ha!

jp: .蝶べたり「あ」みだ如来の頬べたへ
ro: chô betari [a]mida nyorai no hobbeta e
en:
a butterfly
stuck fast to Amida
Buddha's cheek

jp: .ちる花にがっかりしたる小てふ哉
ro: chiru hana ni gakkari shitaru ko chô kana
en:
crestfallen
by the scattering blossoms...
little butterfly

jp: .とぶ蝶も三万三千三百かな
ro: tobu chô mo san man san-zen san-byaku kana
en:
flitting butterflies--
thirty three thousand
three hundred!

jp: .泥足を蝶に任せて寝たりけり
ro: doro ashi wo chô ni makasete netari keri
en:
my muddy foot
left to the butterfly
I sleep

jp: .菜よ梅よ蝶がてんてん舞をまふ
ro: na yo ume yo chô ga ten-ten mai wo mau
en:
vegetables! plum blossoms!
butterfly dances
from one to another

jp: .春のてふ大盃を又なめよ
ro: haru no chô ôsakazuki wo mata name yo
en:
spring butterfly
at the big sake cup...
sip again!

jp: .べったりと蝶の咲たる枯木哉
ro: bettari to chô no sakitaru kareki kana
en:
blooming
with butterflies
the dead tree

jp: .麦に菜にてんてん舞の小てふ哉
ro: mugi ni na ni ten-ten mai no ko chô kana
en:
to wheat field, to vegetable patch
the little butterfly
dances

jp: .大蚤の中にはたはた蚕哉
ro: ônomi no naka ni hata-hata kaiko kana
en:
fleas thumping
and the gnawing, gnawing
silkworms

jp: .みよしのへ遊びに行や庵の蜂
ro: miyoshino e asobi ni iku ya io no hachi
en:
they're off to play
in Yoshino...
my hut's bees

jp: .陽炎にぱっかり口を浅蜊哉
ro: kagerô ni pakkari kuchi wo asari kana
en:
in heat shimmers
his mouth clacks shut...
clam

jp: .毒草のそぶりも見へぬわか葉哉
ro: dokusô no soburi mo mienu waka-gusa kana
en:
no telling which
are poisonous...
new grasses

jp: .わか草の勇に負たる庵かな
ro: wakakusa [no] yû ni maketaru iori kana
en:
conquered
by the young grasses...
my hut

jp: .わか草ののうのうとする葉ぶり哉
ro: waka-gusa no nô nô to suru haburi kana
en:
new grass growing--
a masterful
leaf arrangement!

jp: .愛想やのべの草さへ若盛り
ro: aisô ya nobe no kusa sae waka-zakari
en:
lovely--
even the meadow grasses
hit their peak young

jp: .餅になる草が青むぞ青むぞよ
ro: mochi ni naru kusa ga aomu zo aomu zo yo
en:
on their way to becoming
herb cakes
grasses turn green! green!

jp: .臼と盥の間より菫かな
ro: usu to tarai no aida yori sumire kana
en:
from the rice cake tub
from the basin...
violets

jp: .ちぐはぐの菜種も花と成にけり
ro: chigu-hagu no na tane mo hana to nari ni keri
en:
rape seeds cast
pell-mell too...
have bloomed

jp: .針程のなの花咲ぬやれ咲ぬ
ro: hari hodo no na no hana sakinu yare sakinu
en:
the needle-like rape
has flowered!
flowered!

jp: .藪の芽や人がしらねば鹿が喰ふ
ro: yabu no me ya hito ga shiraneba shika ga kuu
en:
buds in the thicket
that people missed
eaten by deer

jp: .石なごの玉の手元へ椿哉
ro: ishinado no tama no temoto e tsubaki kana
en:
reaching toward
the marble shooter's marble...
camellias

jp: .赤いぞよあのものおれが梅の花
ro: akai zo yo ano mono ore ga ume no hana
en:
I call dibs
on the red ones!
plum blossoms

jp: .梅がかや生覚なるうばが家
ro: ume ga ka ya namaoboe naru uba ga ie
en:
plum blossom scent--
a hazy memory
of my nanny's house

jp: .下戸村やしんかんとして梅の花
ro: geko mura ya shinkan to shite ume no hana
en:
the village of nondrinkers
is silent...
plum blossoms

jp: .正面は乞食の窓ぞ梅の花
ro: shômen wa kojiki no mado zo ume no hana
en:
facing
the beggar's window...
plum blossoms

jp: .谷の梅忽然と咲給ひけり
ro: tani no ume kotsuzen to saki tamai keri
en:
the valley's plum trees
in a flash deign
to bloom

jp: .古郷や梅干婆々が梅の花
ro: furusato ya umeboshi baba ga ume no hana
en:
my home village--
a wrinkled old woman's
plum blossoms

jp: .山里やまぐれ当りも梅の花
ro: yama-zato ya magure-atari mo ume no hana
en:
mountain village--
a stroke of rare luck
these plum blossoms!

jp: .有様は我も花より団子哉
ro: ariyô wa ware mo hana yori dango kana
en:
I'm the type
who'd rather have dumplings
than blossoms

jp: .妹が家や庵の花にまぎれ込
ro: imo ga ya ya iori no hana ni magirekomu
en:
my dear one's hut--
lost amid blooming
blossoms

jp: .気に入た花の木陰もなかりけり
ro: ki [ni] ita hana no kokage mo nakari keri
en:
no favorite
blossoming tree's shade
for me

jp: .小泥棒花の中から出たりけり
ro: ko dorobô hana no naka kara detari keri
en:
little thief--
from deep in the blossoms
he comes

jp: .ちる花に罪も報もしら髪哉
ro: chiru hana ni tsumi mo mukui mo shiraga kana
en:
in scattering blossoms
sin and karma...
white hair

jp: .ちる花に鉢をさし出す羅漢哉
ro: chiru hana ni hachi wo sashidasu rakan kana
en:
in scattering blossoms
holding out his bowl...
holy man

jp: .花見るも役目也けり老にけり
ro: hana miru mo yakume nari keri oi ni keri
en:
even blossom viewing
becomes a chore...
growing old

jp: .山里やかりの後架も花の陰
ro: yama-zato ya kari no kôka mo hana no kage
en:
mountain village--
a temporary toilet
in blossom shade

jp: .我に似てちり下手なるや門の花
ro: ware ni nite chiri-beta naru ya kado no hana
en:
like me
no good at dying...
blossoms at the gate

jp: .うしろから冷々したる桜哉
ro: ushiro kara hiya-hiyashitaru sakura kana
en:
something behind me
tingles my spine...
cherry blossoms!

jp: .売わらじぶらりと下る桜哉
ro: uri waraji burari [to] sagaru sakura kana
en:
straw sandals for sale
dangle...
cherry blossoms

jp: .大江戸の隅の小すみの桜哉
ro: ôedo no sumi no kosumi no sakura kana
en:
in one of great Edo's
little nooks...
cherry blossoms

jp: .気に入た桜の蔭もなかりけり
ro: ki ni itta sakura no kage mo nakari keri
en:
the cherry blossoms
that stirred me, shade me
no more

jp: .ことしきりことしきりとや古ざくら
ro: kotoshi kiri kotoshi kiri to ya furu-zakura
en:
only this year
this year, blooming!
old cherry tree

jp: .此やうな末世を桜だらけ哉
ro: kono yôna masse wo sakura darake kana
en:
this corrupt world
plastered
with cherry blossoms

jp: .桜さく大日本ぞ日本ぞ
ro: sakura saku dainippon zo nippon zo
en:
cherry trees in bloom--
oh great Japan!
Japan!

jp: .三尺に足らぬも花の桜哉
ro: san shaku ni taranu mo hana no sakura kana
en:
though less
than three feet tall...
cherry blossoms

jp: .大の字に踏んぞり返て桜哉
ro: dai no ji ni funzori-kaete sakura kana
en:
falling to my back
spread eagle...
cherry blossoms!

jp: .花ながらまがきに曲るさくら哉
ro: hana nagara magaki ni magaru sakura kana
en:
leaning on the fence
it flowers...
cherry tree

jp: .髭どのの鍬かけ桜咲にけり
ro: hige dono no kuwa kake sakura saki ni keri
en:
Mr. Long-Beard's
hoe stand...
blooming cherry tree

jp: .人声にぼっとしたやら夕桜
ro: hitogoe ni botto shita yara yûzakura
en:
hearing people's voices
they blush...
evening cherry blossoms

jp: .隙あれや桜かざして喧嘩買
ro: hima are ya sakura kazashite kenkakai
en:
liesure time--
in cherry blossom shade
picking fights

jp: .迷子のしっかり掴むさくら哉
ro: mayoigo no shikkari tsukamu sakura kana
en:
the lost child
clutches them tightly...
cherry blossoms

jp: .みちのくの鬼住里も桜かな
ro: michi no ku no oni sumu sato mo sakura kana
en:
remote province--
even in a haunted place
cherry blossoms

jp: .桃柳桜の風を引にけり
ro: momo yanagi sakura no kaze wo hiki[ni] keri
en:
peach tree, willow tree
catch the blossom-scented wind
of the cherry

jp: .山桜皮を剥れて咲にけり
ro: yama-zakura kawa wo hagarete saki ni keri
en:
mountain cherry tree
though its bark peeling
blooming

jp: .山桜ちれちれ腹にたまる程
ro: yama-zakura chire chire hara ni tamaru hodo
en:
mountain cherry blossoms
fall! fall!
enough to fill my belly

jp: .山桜花の主や石仏
ro: yamazakura hana no aruji ya ishi-botoke
en:
lord of the mountain's
cherry blossoms...
stone Buddha

jp: .夕暮や下手念仏も桜ちる
