ro: yûgure ya heta nembutsu mo sakura chiru
en:
evening--
even for a poor prayer "Praise Buddha!"
cherry blossoms scatter

jp: .犬の子の加へて寝たる柳哉
ro: inu no ko no kuwaete netaru yanagi kana
en:
the sleeping puppy
gnaws
on the willow

jp: .門柳仏頂面をさする也
ro: kado yanagi butsu chôzura wo sasuru nari
en:
willow at the gate
strokes his sour
face

jp: .観音のやうに人眠る柳哉
ro: kannon no yô ni hito nemuru yanagi kana
en:
like peaceful Kannon
the man sleeps...
willow tree

jp: .ちょんぼりと不二の小脇の柳哉
ro: chonbori to fuji no kowaki no yanagi kana
en:
a trifle
next to Mount Fuji...
willow

jp: .寝る隙にふいとさしても柳哉
ro: neru hima ni fui to sashite mo yanagi kana
en:
while napping
swish-swish stroked
by the willow

jp: .畠打の内股くぐる柳かな
ro: hata uchi no uchimata kuguru yanagi kana
en:
viewed between
the plowman's legs...
willow tree

jp: .柳からなびきつずくや下総山
ro: yanagi kara nabiki-tsuzuku ya shimôsa yama
en:
a willow droops
and continuing the drooping...
Shimosa mountains

jp: .明安き天窓はづれや東山
ro: akeyasuki atama hazure ya higashi yama
en:
dawn comes quick
to their crowns...
Higashi Mountains

jp: .明安き夜を触歩く雀哉
ro: akeyasuki yo wo fure-aruku suzume kana
en:
"Dawn's coming quick!"
cries the town crier...
sparrow

jp: .遊ぶ夜は手のなく成りぬなく成ぬ
ro: asobu yo wa [te] no naku narinu naku narinu
en:
my nights of carousing
over so soon!
so soon!

jp: .短よや十七年も一寝入
ro: mijika yo ya jû shichi nen mo hito ne-iri
en:
short summer night--
for seventeen years
one long sleep

jp: .行雲やだらだら急に夜がつまる
ro: yuku kumo ya dara-dara kyû ni yo ga tsumaru
en:
moving clouds--
step by step, so soon
the dawn

jp: .一本の草も涼風やどりけり
ro: ippon no kusa mo suzukaze yadori keri
en:
even on one blade of grass
the cool wind
lives

jp: .草雫今拵へし涼風ぞ
ro: kusa shizuku ima koshiraeshi suzukaze zo
en:
a water drop in grass
fresh-made...
cool wind

jp: .涼風の第一番は後架也
ro: suzukaze no dai ichi ban wa kôka nari
en:
the number one
best cool breeze...
outhouse

jp: .涼風の横すじかひに入る家哉
ro: suzukaze no yoko sujikai ni iru ya kana
en:
the cool breeze
slips in slantwise...
my house

jp: .涼しさの江戸もけふ翌ばかり哉
ro: suzushisa no edo mo kyô asu bakari kana
en:
cool air of Edo--
today, tomorrow
that's all

jp: .涼しさや畠掘っても湯のけぶり
ro: suzushisa ya hatake hotte mo yu no keburi
en:
cool air--
even for the dirt farmer
hot bath steam

jp: .古薮も夜は涼風の出所哉
ro: furu yabu mo yo wa suzukaze no dedoko kana
en:
old thicket--
the source of the cool
evening wind

jp: .夕涼や水投つける馬の尻
ro: yûsuzu ya mizu nage-tsukeru uma no shiri
en:
evening cool--
tossing water on the
horse's rump

jp: .鬼と成り仏となるや土用雲
ro: oni to nari hotoke to naru ya doyôgumo
en:
becoming demons
becoming Buddhas...
the midsummer clouds

jp: .草刈のざくりざくりや五月雨
ro: kusakari no zakuri zakuri ya satsukiame
en:
the grass cutter's
splish and splash...
Fifth Month rain

jp: .五月雨 に さくさく歩く烏かな
ro: samidare [ni] saku-saku aruku karasu kana
en:
in Fifth Month rain
splish-splash the strutting
crow

jp: .一舟は皆草花ぞ五月雨
ro: hito fune wa mina kusabana zo satsukiame
en:
on one boat
all the wildflowers!
Fifth Month rain

jp: .とかくしてはした夕立ばかり哉
ro: tokaku shite hashita yûdachi bakari kana
en:
all too often--
the cloudburst just
a spurt

jp: .西からと北と夕立ち並びけり
ro: nishi kara to kita to yûdachi narabi keri
en:
from the west
from the north
cloudbursts taking turns

jp: .夕暮の一夕立が身に成りぬ
ro: yûgure no hito yûdachi ga mi ni narinu
en:
sunset
takes the cloudburst's
place

jp: .夕立や三文花もそれそよぐ
ro: yûdachi ya san mon hana mo sore soyogu
en:
rainstorm--
the three-penny flower too
trembles

jp: .夕立や一人醒たる小松島
ro: yûdachi ya hitori sametaru ko matsushima
en:
rainstorm--
waking up alone
on a little pine island

jp: .夕立は是切とぱらりぱらり哉
ro: yûdachi wa koregiri to parari parari kana
en:
now the cloudburst
only a pitter
patter

jp: .稲葉から出現したか雲の峰
ro: ine ha kara shutsugen shita ka kumo no mine
en:
did you emerge
from the rice plants?
billowing clouds

jp: .順々にうごき出しけり雲の峰
ro: jun-jun ni ugoki-dashi keri kumo no mine
en:
one by one
they rise and form...
peaks of clouds

jp: .涼しさは雲の大峰小みね哉
ro: suzushisa wa kumo no ômine komine kana
en:
cool air--
cloud mountain peaks
and hills

jp: .富士に似た雲よ雲とや鳴烏
ro: fuji ni nita kumo yo kumo to ya naku karasu
en:
"Look! that cloud
looks like Mount Fuji!"
the crow caws

jp: .穴蔵に一風入て夏の月
ro: anagura ni hito kaze irete natsu no tsuki
en:
one breeze
reaches the cellar...
summer moon

jp: .夏山に花なし蔓の世也けり
ro: natsu yama ni hana nashi-zuru no yo nari keri
en:
summer mountain--
a world
of flowerless vines

jp: .夏山や仏のきらひさうな花
ro: natsu yama ya hotoke no kirai sôna hana
en:
summer mountain--
a flower even Buddha
would hate

jp: .売わらぢ松につるして苔清水
ro: uri waraji matsu ni tsuru shite koke shimizu
en:
straw sandals for sale
hang in the pine...
pure water over moss

jp: .惜るる人の青田が一番ぞ
ro: oshimaruru hito no aoda ga ichiban zo
en:
the stingy farmer's rice field--
the first
to turn green

jp: .三人が枕にしたる青田哉
ro: sannin ga makura ni shitaru aoda kana
en:
three men
use it for a pillow...
green rice field

jp: .四五本の青田の主の我家哉
ro: shi go hon no aoda no nushi no waga ya kana
en:
lording over four
or five rice plants...
my house

jp: .たのもしや青田のぬしの這出しぬ
ro: tanomoshi ya aoda no nushi no haidashinu
en:
a good omen--
the green rice field's master
crawl outs

jp: .合点して蛍も寝るか夏花桶
ro: gaten shite hotaru mo neru ka gebana oke
en:
firefly, are you planning
to sleep here?
bucket of summer flowers

jp: .袖垣も女めきけり夏花つみ
ro: sodegaki mo onna-meki keri gebana tsumi
en:
the little fence too
looks feminine...
plucked summer flowers

jp: .雲霧もそこのけ富士を下る声
ro: ummu mo soko noke fuji wo oriru koe
en:
cloud and fog
move aside! voices
descend Mount Fuji

jp: .涼しさや五尺程でもお富士山
ro: suzushisa ya go shaku hodo demo o-fuji yama
en:
cool air--
just five feet tall
this Mount Fuji!

jp: .富士の気で鷺は歩くや大またに
ro: fuji no ki de sagi wa aruku ya ômata ni
en:
because it's Mount Fuji
the heron's stride
is long

jp: .富士の気で跨げば草も涼しいぞ
ro: fuji no ki de matageba kusa mo suzushii zo
en:
though I can straddle
this Mount Fuji...
cool grass

jp: .旅烏江戸の御祓にいく度逢ふ
ro: tabikarasu edo no misogi ni iku tabi au
en:
traveling crow
at Edo's purification...
how many years?

jp: .蛙等も何かぶつくさ夕はらひ
ro: kawazura mo nanika butsu-kusa yû harai
en:
hey frogs
why the grumbling?
evening purification

jp: .十ばかり蛙も並ぶ御祓哉
ro: jû bakari kawazu mo narabu misogi kana
en:
about ten frogs
in a row...
shrine boats

jp: .一番に乙鳥のくぐるちのわ哉
ro: ichiban ni tsubame no kuguru chinowa kana
en:
the first one through
is the swallow...
purification hoop

jp: .蜻蛉も起てはたらく夜川哉
ro: tombô mo okite hataraku yo kawa kana
en:
the dragonfly, too
works late...
night fishing

jp: .遊んだる夜は昔なり更衣
ro: asondaru yo wa mukashi nari koromogae
en:
my nights of pleasure
are ancient history...
new summer robe

jp: .蒲公英は天窓そりけり更衣
ro: tanpopo wa atama sori keri koromogae
en:
the dandelion gives
a nod...
my new summer robe

jp: .人らしく替もかえけり麻衣
ro: hitorashiku kae mo kae keri asagoromo
en:
like everyone else
I change to summer garb...
linen robe

jp: .町並や馬鹿正直に更衣
ro: machinami ya baka shôjiki ni koromogae
en:
row of houses--
sticklers for propriety
in their new summer robes

jp: .世に倦た顔をしっつも更衣
ro: yo ni aita kao wo shittsu mo koromogae
en:
even he loses
his world-weary expression...
new summer robe

jp: .泣虫と云れてもなく袷哉
ro: naki mushi to iwarete mo naku awase kana
en:
called a crybaby
she starts crying...
summer kimono

jp: .西山や袷序の神だのみ
ro: nishi yama ya awase tsuide no kami tanomi
en:
western mountains--
in summer kimono
trusting in the gods

jp: .冷々と蕗の葉かぶる袷かな
ro: hiya-hiya to fuki no ha kaburu awase kana
en:
feeling chilly
a butterbur leaf for a hat...
summer kimono

jp: .貧乏樽しゃにかまへつつ袷哉
ro: bimbôdaru sha ni kamaetsutsu awase kana
en:
arranged crookedly
on an old keg...
summer kimonos

jp: .我きれば皺帷とはや成ぬ
ro: ware kireba shiwa katabira to wa haya narinu
en:
I put on
my summer kimono, so quickly
wrinkled

jp: .真っ黒な大入道の日傘哉
ro: makkurona ônyûdô no higasa kana
en:
perfectly black
the big priest's
parasol

jp: .くら住や田螺に似せてひとり蚊屋
ro: kura-zumi ya tanishi ni nisete hitori kaya
en:
living in a storehouse
like a pond snail
in my mosquito net, alone

jp: .五十婿天窓をかかす扇かな
ro: go jû muko atama wo kakasu ôgi kana
en:
the fifty year-old son-in-law
hides his head...
paper fan

jp: .二百膳ばかり並て団扇かな
ro: ni hyaku zen bakari narabete uchiwa kana
en:
two hundred dinner trays
in a row...
fans fanning

jp: .雀等が寝所へもはふ蚊やり哉
ro: suzumera ga nedoko e mo hau ka yari kana
en:
it crawls
to the sparrows' bed too...
smudge pot smoke

jp: .虫干や吹かれて鳴やきりぎりす
ro: mushiboshi ya fukarete naku ya kirigirisu
en:
airing out the bedding--
he's blown away, still singing
katydid

jp: .今に行今に行とや門涼み
ro: ima ni yuku ima ni yuku to ya kado suzumi
en:
it's time to go
time to go!
cool air at the gate

jp: .片天窓剃って乳を呑夕涼
ro: kata atama sotte chi wo nomu yûsuzumi
en:
she shaves a side of his head
while he nurses...
cool evening

jp: .母親や涼がてらの祭り帯
ro: haha oya ya suzumi ga tera no matsuri obi
en:
mother cools off--
the Buddhist temple's
festive sash

jp: .薮むらや貧乏馴て夕すずみ
ro: yabu mura ya bimbô narete yûsuzumi
en:
in a remote village
they're used to poverty...
evening cool

jp: .木がくれや大念仏で田を植る
ro: kogakure ya ônembutsu de ta wo ueru
en:
hidden in trees
praising Amida Buddha...
rice planter

jp: .夕立の相伴したるかのこ哉
ro: yûdachi no shôban shitaru kanoko kana
en:
partaking
of the cloudburst...
a fawn

jp: .かはほりやさらば汝と両国へ
ro: kawahori ya saraba nanji to ryôgoku e
en:
bats are flying--
let's go, then
to Ryogoku Bridge!

jp: .羽抜鳥親の声にもかくれけり
ro: hanuke tori oya no koe ni mo kakure keri
en:
mother bird molting--
her babies hide
when she calls

jp: .羽抜鳥どちらに親よ妻よ子よ
ro: hanuke tori dochira ni oya yo tsuma yo ko yo
en:
molting birds--
which one is father?
mother? child?

jp: .赤門やおめずおくせず時鳥
ro: akamon ya omezu okusezu hototogisu
en:
through the great red gate
no fear...
cuckoo

jp: .江戸へいざ江戸へいざとやほととぎす
ro: edo e iza edo e iza to ya hototogisu
en:
to Edo, to Edo
off you go!
cuckoo

jp: .門の木もまめ息災でほととぎす
ro: kado no ki mo mame sokusai de hototogisu
en:
the gate's tree too
in good health...
cuckoo

jp: .此雨にのっ引ならじ時鳥
ro: kono ame ni noppiki naraji hototogisu
en:
in this rain
we ain't going anywhere...
cuckoo

jp: .時鳥俗な庵とさみするな
ro: hototogisu zokuna iori to sami suruna
en:
don't disdain
my worldly hut
cuckoo!

jp: .三日月に天窓うつなよ時鳥
ro: mi[ka]zuki ni atama utsu na yo hototogisu
en:
don't bump your head
on that sickle moon!
cuckoo

jp: .一昨日もきのふもけふもかんこ鳥
ro: ototoi mo kinou mo kyô mo kankodori
en:
day before yesterday
yesterday, today...
mountain cuckoo

jp: .吉日の卯月八日もかんこ鳥
ro: kichi nichi no uzuki yôka mo kankodori
en:
on the lucky Eighth Day
of Fourth Month...
a mountain cuckoo

jp: .地獄へは斯う参れとや閑古鳥
ro: jigoku e wa kô maire to ya kankodori
en:
"This way to hell,
pilgrim!"
mountain cuckoo

jp: .死んだならおれが日を鳴け閑古鳥
ro: shinda nara ore ga hi wo nake kankodori
en:
when I'm dead
sing my requiem
mountain cuckoo!

jp: .俳諧を囀るやうなかんこ鳥
ro: haikai wo saezuru yôna kankodori
en:
like warbling pure haiku
mountain
cuckoo

jp: .人の世に花はなしとや閑古鳥
ro: hito no yo ni hana wa nashi to ya kankodori
en:
"In the world of man
there are no blossoms!"
mountain cuckoo

jp: .涼風を鼻にかけてや行々し
ro: suzukaze wo hana ni kakete ya gyôgyôshi
en:
taking credit
for the cool breeze...
reed thrush

jp: .それからは我松島か行々し
ro: sore kara wa waga matsushima ka gyôgyôshi
en:
is that next one
my pine island?
reed thrush

jp: .よし切とうしろ合せの笹家哉
ro: yoshikiri to ushiro awase no sasaya kana
en:
the back yard suits
the reed thrush...
thatched house

jp: .市中や大骨折ってとぶ蛍
ro: ichi naka ya ôhone otte tobu hotaru
en:
at the market
with all his might
firefly flits

jp: .犬どもが蛍まぶれに寝たりけり
ro: inu domo ga hotaru mabure ni netari keri
en:
the dog sparkling
with fireflies
sound asleep

jp: .馬の草食らふ音してとぶ蛍
ro: uma no kusa kurau oto shite tobu hotaru
en:
sound of a horse
gobbling grass...
fireflies flitting

jp: .来よ蛍一本草も夜の露
ro: ko yo hotaru ippon kusa mo yoru no tsuyu
en:
come, firefly!
even on one blade of grass
evening dew

jp: .はつ蛍都の空はきたないぞ
ro: hatsu-botaru miyako no sora wa kitanai zo
en:
first firefly--
the sky over Kyoto
is smoggy!

jp: .人声や大骨折ってとぶ蛍
ro: hito-goe ya ôhone otte tobu hotaru
en:
people's voices--
with all their might
the fireflies flit

jp: .本町をぶらりぶらりと蛍哉
ro: honchô wo burari-burari to hotaru kana
en:
in the Old Quarter
without rhyme or reason...
fireflies

jp: .蚊柱の穴から見ゆる都哉
ro: ka-bashira no ana kara miyuru miyako kana
en:
through a hole
in the mosquito swarm...
Kyoto

jp: .蚊柱のそれさへ細き栖かな
ro: ka-bashira no sore sae hosoki sumika kana
en:
mosquito swarm--
even you
have a narrow home

jp: .蚊柱や是もなければ小淋しき
ro: ka-bashira ya kore mo nakereba ko sabishiki
en:
without the column
of mosquitoes...
a bit lonely

jp: .方々から叩き出されて来る蚊哉
ro: hôbô kara tataki dasarete kuru ka kana
en:
driven from many houses
here they come...
mosquitoes

jp: .蝿一つ打てはなむあみだ仏哉
ro: hae hitotsu utte wa namu amida butsu kana
en:
while swatting a fly
"All praise to Amida
Buddha!"

jp: .我宿の蝿とり猫とうたひけり
ro: waga yado no hae tori neko to utai keri
en:
I sing the praises
of my fly-catching
housecat!

jp: .追な追な追な子どもよ子持蚤
ro: ouna ouna ouna kodomo yo ko mochi nomi
en:
don't chase, don't chase
children!
that flea has kids

jp: .狭くともいざ飛習へ庵の蚤
ro: semaku to mo iza tobinarae io no nomi
en:
though it's cramped
practice your jumping
hut's fleas

jp: .辻堂を蚤蚊に借て寝たりけり
ro: tsuji dô wo nomi ka ni karite netari keri
en:
borrowing the crossroads temple
from fleas and mosquitoes
I sleep

jp: .草家は蚤蚊に借て寝たりけり
ro: sôan wa nomi ka ni karite netari keri
en:
borrowing my hut
from fleas and mosquitoes
I sleep

jp: .蝉鳴や物喰ふ馬の頬べたに
ro: semi naku ya mono kuu uma no hobbeta [ni]
en:
the cicada chirrs
on the grazing horse's
cheek

jp: .夏の蝉なくが此世の栄よう哉
ro: natsu no semi naku ga kono yo no eyô kana
en:
the chirring of summer cicadas
this world
of luxury!

jp: .はつ蝉や馬のつむりにちょっと鳴く
ro: hatsu semi [ya] uma no tsumuri ni chot[to] naku
en:
first cicada--
on the horse's head
a quick song

jp: .かたつぶり見よ見よおのが影ぼふし
ro: katatsuburi mi yo mi yo ono ga kagebôshi
en:
little snail
look! look!
at your shadow

jp: .でで虫や赤い花には目もかけず
ro: dedemushi ya akai hana ni wa me mo kakezu
en:
little snail--
for the red flower
not even a glance

jp: .並んだぞ豆つぶ程なかたつぶり
ro: naranda zo mame tsubu hodo na katatsuburi
en:
look! they've lined up!
little bean-sized
snails

jp: .昼顔や畠掘っても湯のけぶり
ro: hirugao ya hatake hotte mo yu no keburi
en:
dayflowers--
even for the dirt farmer
hot bath steam

jp: .昼顔やふんどし晒らす傍に杭
ro: hirugao ya fundoshi sarasu soba ni kui
en:
dayflowers--
a loincloth airing
on a post

jp: .夕顔の花に冷つく枕かな
ro: yûgao no hana ni hiyatsuku makura kana
en:
kept cool
by the moonflowers...
my pillow

jp: .汁椀にぱっと夕顔明り哉
ro: shiru wan ni patto yûgao akari kana
en:
in the soup bowl
suddenly the moonflower's
glow

jp: .夕顔や祭の客も一むしろ
ro: yûgao ya matsuri no kyaku mo hito mushiro
en:
moonflowers--
for the festival guest too
a straw mat

jp: .子を喰ふ猫も見よ見よけしの花
ro: ko wo kura[u] neko mo mi yo mi yo keshi no hana
en:
even the cat
who ate her kittens...
look! poppies

jp: .足洗ふ拍子にひらく蓮の花
ro: ashi arau hyôshi ni hiraku hasu no hana
en:
unfolding to the rhythm
of washing feet...
lotus blossoms

jp: .穏坊のむつきほしたり蓮の花
ro: ombô [no] mutsuki hoshitari hasu [no] hana
en:
the cemetery guard
dries his loincloth...
lotus blossoms...

jp: .雲霧もそっちのけとや蓮の花
ro: kumo-giri mo sotchi noke to ya hasu [no] hana
en:
move aside
cloud and fog!
lotuses are blooming

jp: .蝶鳥もそっちのけとや蓮の花
ro: chô tori mo sotchi noke to ya hasu [no] hana
en:
move aside
butterflies and birds!
lotuses are blooming

jp: .蓮池にうしろつんむく後架哉
ro: hasu ike ni ushiro tsunmuku kôka kana
en:
turning a cold shoulder
to the lotus pond...
outhouse

jp: .さをしかの口とどかぬや杜若
ro: saoshika no kuchi todokanu ya kakitsubata
en:
the young buck's
mouth can't reach...
the iris

jp: .乙鳥にも節句をさせよ杜若
ro: tsubame ni mo sekku wo sase yo kakitsubata
en:
swallows join in
the festival...
Irises

jp: .我庵や花のちいさいかきつばた
ro: waga io ya hana no chiisai kakitsubata
en:
at my hut
an iris with the tiniest
blossoms

jp: .大馬の口のとどかぬあやめ哉
ro: ôuma no kuchi no todokanu ayame kana
en:
the big horse's mouth
can't reach it...
blooming irises

jp: .此所かすみ盛りや麦の秋
ro: kono tokoro kasumi sakari ya mugi no aki
en:
the mist 'round here
in full bloom...
ripened barley

jp: .のさばるや黒い麦のほ里蜻蛉
ro: nosabaru ya kuroi mugi no ho sato tombo
en:
lording over
the black barley ears...
village dragonflies

jp: .麦の穂や大骨折って行小蝶
ro: mugi no ho ya ôhoneotte yuku ko chô
en:
ears of barley--
with back-breaking effort
the little butterfly

jp: .苔咲くや自慢を聞に来る雀
ro: koke saku ya jiman wo kiki ni kuru suzume
en:
moss is blooming!
sparrows come
to hear me brag

jp: .さわぐぞよ竹も小笹もわか盛り
ro: sawagu zo yo take mo ko-zasa mo waka-zakari
en:
what a racket!
for bamboo and pampas grass
the peak of youth

jp: .なよ竹や今のわかさを庵の垣
ro: na yo take ya ima no wakasa wo io no kaki
en:
greens! bamboo!
now enjoy their youth
at my hut's gate

jp: .細竹もわかわかしさよゆかしさよ
ro: hoso take mo wakawakashisa yo yukashisa yo
en:
even the skinny bamboo
young and fresh!
charming!

jp: .わか竹や山はかくれて入間川
ro: waka take ya yama wa kakurete iruma-gawa
en:
young bamboo
hiding the mountain...
Iruma River

jp: .筍の連に咲けり赤い花
ro: takenoko no tsure ni saki keri akai hana
en:
keeping bamboo shoots
company, blooming
red flower

jp: .しんとしてわか葉の赤い御寺哉
ro: shin to shite wakaba no akai o-tera kana
en:
perfectly still
the new red leaves...
a temple

jp: .辻番の窓をせうじをわか葉哉
ro: tsuji ban no mado wo shôji wo wakaba kana
en:
at the crossroads guard's
window and paper door...
fresh leaves

jp: .なぜかして赤いわか葉がもろいぞよ
ro: naze ka shite akai wakaba ga moroi zo yo
en:
why are you like this
new red leaves?
so flimsy!

jp: .寝ころべば腹の上迄わか葉哉
ro: ne-korobeba hara no ue made wakaba kana
en:
lying to sleep
even on my belly...
a fresh leaf

jp: .古垣の仕様事なしのわか葉哉
ro: furu kaki no shiyôji nashi no wakaba kana
en:
on the old fence
to no avail...
fresh leaves

jp: .向ふ三軒隣々へわか葉哉
ro: mukau san ken tonari tonari e wakaba kana
en:
for three neighbors
across the way...
fresh green leaves

jp: .わか葉さへ日陰もの也鉢の木は
ro: wakaba sae hikage mono nari hachi no ki wa
en:
even new leaves
are shady characters...
potted tree

jp: .わか葉して又もにくまれ榎哉
ro: wakaba shite mata mo nikumare enoki kana
en:
fresh leaves again
make it hateful...
nettle tree

jp: .故郷やちさいがおれが夏木立
ro: furusato ya chisai ga ore ga natsu kodachi
en:
home village--
my summer grove is small
but it's mine!

jp: .渋柿のしぶしぶ花の咲にけり
ro: shibugaki no shibu-shibu hana no saki ni keri
en:
the astringent persimmon tree's
reluctant
blossoms

jp: .卯の花や神と乞食の中に咲
ro: u no hana ya kami to kojiki no naka ni saku
en:
deutzia shrub--
among gods and beggars
it blooms

jp: .卯の花や乞食村の大祭
ro: u no hana ya konjiki mura no ômatsuri
en:
deutzia blossoms--
a big festival
in beggar-town

jp: .ずっぷりと濡て卯の花月よ哉
ro: zuppuri to nurete u no hana tsuki yo kana
en:
the deutzia blossoms
utterly drenched...
bright moon

jp: .立秋もしらぬ童が仏哉
ro: tatsu aki mo shiranu warabe ga hotoke kana
en:
not knowing that
autumn's begun, a child
Buddha!

jp: .けさ秋と云ばかりでも小淋しき
ro: kesa aki to iu bakari demo ko sabishiki
en:
"First autumn morning!"
just saying it...
lonely

jp: .けさ秋と合点でとぶかのべの蝶
ro: kesa aki to gaten de tobu ka nobe no chô
en:
are you aware
that autumn has dawned?
meadow butterfly

jp: .母親に猿がおぶさる夜寒哉
ro: haha oya ni saru ga obusaru yozamu kana
en:
the monkey rides
his mother's back...
a cold night

jp: .腹上で字を書習ふ夜寒哉
ro: hara ue de ji wo kakinarau yozamu kana
en:
practicing calligraphy
on my belly...
a cold night

jp: .六十に二ッふみ込む夜寒哉
ro: roku jû ni futatsu fumikomu yozamu kana
en:
another year closer
to sixty...
the cold night

jp: .へら鷺や水が冷たい歩き様
ro: herasagi ya mizu ga tsumetai aruki sama
en:
spoonbill, you walk
through that water
like it's chilly!

jp: .さぼてんやのっぺらぼうの秋の夕
ro: saboten ya nopperabô no aki no yû
en:
cactuses--
a facelessly dull
autumn evening

jp: .野歌舞伎や秋の夕の真中に
ro: no kabuki ya aki no yû no mannaka ni
en:
outdoor kabuki
in the autumn evening's
dead center

jp: .青空に指で字をかく秋の暮
ro: ao-zora ni yubi de ji wo kaku aki no kure
en:
writing with a finger
in the clear blue sky...
"autumn dusk"

jp: .朝顔の生れ替りや秋の暮
ro: asagao no umare kawari ya aki no kure
en:
instead of morning-glories
unfolding...
autumn dusk

jp: .芦の葉を蟹がはさみて秋のくれ
ro: ashi no ha wo kani ga hasamite aki no kure
en:
crabs jam themselves
into the rushes...
autumn dusk

jp: .江戸江戸とえどへ出れば秋の暮
ro: edo edo to edo e izureba aki no kure
en:
when heading to Edo
Edo, Edo!
autumn dusk

jp: .狼も穴から見るや秋の暮
ro: ôkami mo ana kara miru ya aki no kure
en:
the wolf too
peeks out his hole...
autumn dusk

jp: .草からも乳は出るぞよ秋の暮
ro: kusa kara mo chi wa deru zo yo aki no kure
en:
from the grasses, too
milk flowing!
autumn dusk

jp: .杉で葺く小便桶や秋の暮
ro: sugi de fuku shôben oke ya aki no kure
en:
with cedars for a roof
the piss bucket...
autumn dusk

jp: .化されに稲むら歩行秋の暮
ro: bakasare ni inamura aruku aki no kure
en:
enchanted
I walk among straw stacks...
autumn dusk

jp: .むさし野へ投出ス足や秋の暮
ro: musashi no e nagedasu ashi ya aki no kure
en:
stretching my legs
toward Musashi Plain...
autumn dusk

jp: .むら雨やおばばがまきも秋の暮
ro: murasame ya o-baba ga maki mo aki no kure
en:
rain shower--
for granny's evergreen too
autumn dusk

jp: .庵門に流れ入けり天の川
ro: io kado ni nagare-iri keri ama no kawa
en:
flowing in the hut's
gate...
the Milky Way

jp: .我星は年寄組や天の川
ro: waga hoshi wa toshiyori-gumi ama no kawa
en:
my stars--
a gang of old men
in the Milky Way

jp: .木母寺は反吐だらけ也けふの月
ro: mokuboji wa hedo darake nari kyô no tsuki
en:
Mokubo Temple
covered in vomit...
tonight's moon

jp: .半分も又名月ぞ名月ぞ
ro: hambun mo mata meigetsu zo meigetsu zo
en:
only half there
but still the harvest moon!
harvest moon!

jp: .秋風や櫛の歯を引おく道者
ro: aki kaze ya kushi no ha wo hiku oku dôsha
en:
autumn wind--
sawing the teeth of a comb
a hermit

jp: .秋風やのらくら者のとぼけ顔
ro: aki kaze ya norakuramono no toboke-gao
en:
autumn wind--
the loafer's blank
expression

jp: .秋風やひょろひょろ山の影法師
ro: aki kaze ya hyoro-hyoro yama no kagebôshi
en:
autumn wind--
the mountain's shadow
is trembling

jp: .秋風や曲がり曲がりて門に入
ro: aki kaze ya magiri magirite kado ni iru
en:
the autumn wind
twisting and turning
enters my gate

jp: .膝節の古びも行か秋の風
ro: hizabushi no furubi mo yuku ka aki no kaze
en:
will these old knees
journey on?
autumn wind

jp: .赤椀のだぶだぶ酒を野分哉
ro: aka wan no dabu-dabu sake wo nowaki kana
en:
sake in the red bowl
flowing...
autumn gale

jp: .世の中や祈らぬ野分きっと吹
ro: yo [no] naka ya inoranu nowaki kitto fuku
en:
in this world
unprayed-for autumn gales
surely blow

jp: .朝顔の花に何盃けさの露
ro: asagao no hana ni nanbai kesa no tsuyu
en:
in the morning-glories
how many cups?
morning dew

jp: .くよくよとさわぐな翌は翌の露
ro: kuyo-kuyo to sawagu na asu wa asu no tsuyu
en:
don't mope and moan!
tomorrow brings
tomorrow's dewdrops

jp: .白露の丸く成るにもいそがしや
ro: shira tsuyu no maruku naru ni mo isogashi ya
en:
the silver dew
becoming round, this too
takes work!

jp: .白露や乞食村の祭り客
ro: shira tsuyu ya konjiki mura no matsuri kyaku
en:
silver dewdrops--
beggar-town has festival
guests

jp: .白露や茶腹で越るうつの山
ro: shira tsuyu ya cha-bara de koeru utsu no yama
en:
silver dewdrops--
with a bellyful of tea
crossing Mount Utsu

jp: .只頼め頼めと露のこぼれけり
ro: tada tanome tanome to tsuyu no kobore keri
en:
simply trust! trust!
dewdrops spilling
down

jp: .露ちるや地獄の種をけふもまく
ro: tsuyu chiru ya jigoku no tane wo kyô mo maku
en:
dewdrops scatter--
today, too,
sowing hell seeds

jp: .身の上の露とは更にしらぬ哉
ro: mi no ue no tsuyu to wa sara ni shiranu kana
en:
not at all aware
that life's dewdrop
is fading...

jp: .よい世じゃと露がざんぶりざんぶり哉
ro: yoi yo ja to tsuyu ga zanburi zanburi kana
en:
a good world?
dewdrop
dribbling down

jp: .蓬生や露の中なる粉引唄
ro: yomogifu ya tsuyu no naka naru ko hiki uta
en:
thick-grown weeds--
among dewdrops a miller
singing

jp: .稲妻を浴せかけるや死ぎらい
ro: inazuma wo abise-kakeru ya shinigirai
en:
lightning strikes!
I'm afraid
to die

jp: .稲妻にけらけら笑ひ仏哉
ro: inazuma ni kera-kera warai hotoke kana
en:
in the lightning
how he laughs...
Buddha!

jp: .稲妻の打力なき草家哉
ro: inazuma no utsu chikara naki kusa ya kana
en:
the lightning
powerless to strike it...
thatched hut

jp: .稲妻やうっかりひょんとした顔へ
ro: inazuma ya ukkari hyon to shita kao e
en:
lightning flash--
his absentminded
expression

jp: .朝ぎりのろくには晴ぬ山家哉
ro: asagiri no roku ni wa harenu yamaga kana
en:
the morning mist
scarcely clears away...
mountain home

jp: .大仏の鼻から出たりけさの霧
ro: daibutsu no hana kara detari kesa no kiri
en:
from the great bronze
Buddha's nostrils...
morning mist

jp: .つりがねの中から霧の出たりけり
ro: tsurigane no naka kara kiri no detari keri
en:
pouring out
the hanging temple bell...
mist

jp: .山霧や瓦の鬼が明く口へ
ro: yama-giri ya kawara no oni ga aku kuchi e
en:
mountain mist--
the gargoyle demon
devours it

jp: .明神の猿遊ぶや秋の山
ro: myôjin no mashira asobu ya aki no yama
en:
the great god's
monkeys are playing...
autumn mountain

jp: .夜に入れば入程秋の山辺哉
ro: yo ni ireba iru hodo aki no yamabe kana
en:
the more night falls
the more autumnal
the mountain

jp: .夜々や枕ほどでも秋の山
ro: yoru-yoru ya makura hodo demo aki no yama
en:
night after night
like pillows...
the autumn mountains

jp: .猿の子につかはるる花の哉
ro: saru no ko ni tsukawaruru hanano kana
en:
the baby monkey
puts it to good use...
field of flowers

jp: .玉棚に孫の笑ひを馳走哉
ro: tama-dana ni mago no warai wo chisô kana
en:
at the ancestors' altar
a grandchild's laughter
offered up

jp: .魂棚や上座して鳴くきりぎりす
ro: tama-dana ya jôza shite naku kirigirisu
en:
ancestors' altar--
in the seat of honor
a katydid chirrs

jp: .妙法の火に点をうつ烏哉
ro: myôhô no hi ni ten wo utsu karasu kana
en:
"Marvelous Law" written in fire--
but a black spot
a crow

jp: .御祝儀に楫もそよぐか星いはひ
ro: o-shûgi ni kaji mo soyogu ka hoshi iwai
en:
do you celebrate
Tanabata too?
rustling mulberry leaves

jp: .七夕にかくれてさくや女郎花
ro: tanabata ni kakurete saku ya ominaeshi
en:
on Tanabata Night
hidden it blooms...
maiden flower

jp: .七夕や天よりつづく女郎花
ro: tanabata ya ten yori tsuzuku ominaeshi
en:
Tanabata Night--
straight from the heavens
maiden flowers

jp: .子宝が蚯蚓のたるぞ梶の葉に
ro: ko-dakara ga mimizu no taru zo kaji no ha ni
en:
the treasured child's
wormy scribbles...
mulberry leaf

jp: .久かたの花婿星よ婿星よ
ro: hisakata no hanamuko-boshi yo muko-boshi yo
en:
up in the Heavens
the Bridegroom Star!
Bridegroom Star!

jp: .婿星も見よ山盛の稲の花
ro: muko-boshi mo mi yo yamamori no ine no hana
en:
O Bridegroom Star
look! piles
of blossoming rice

jp: .嫁星の行儀可笑しやけふの雨
ro: yome-boshi no gyôgi [o]kashi ya kyô no ame
en:
the Bride Star
has funny manners...
tonight's rain

jp: .大それた花火の音も祭哉
ro: daisoreta hanabi no oto mo matsuri kana
en:
a rogue firework
explodes too...
autumn festival

jp: .世につれて花火の玉も大きいぞ
ro: yo ni tsurete hanabi no tama mo okii zo
en:
following the times
the fireworks...
bigger and bigger!

jp: .角力とりやはるばる来る親の塚
ro: sumôtori ya haru-baru kinuru oya no tsuka
en:
the sumo wrestler
has come from afar...
parents' grave

jp: .墓の木の陰法師ふまぬ角力哉
ro: haka no ki no kageboshi fumanu sumô kana
en:
not trodding on the shadow
of the tomb's tree...
sumo wrestler

jp: .梟が笑ふ目つきや辻角力
ro: fukurô ga warau metsuki ya tsuji sumô
en:
seems like the owl
is laughing!
outdoor sumo match

jp: .ぬっぽりと月見顔なるかがし哉
ro: nuppori to tsukimi kao naru kagashi kana
en:
that gentle
moon-gazing face...
a scarecrow

jp: .うかと来て我をかがしの替哉
ro: uka to kite ore wo kagashi no kawari kana
en:
absent-minded
I'm the scarecrow's
replacement

jp: .立かがし三つ四つ五つ六つかしや
ro: tatsu kagashi mi[tsu] yo[tsu] itsu[tsu] mu[tsu] kashiya
en:
scarecrows standing--
three, four, five, six
houses for rent

jp: .立田山紅葉御覧のかがし哉
ro: tachida yama momiji goran no kagashi kana
en:
inspecting the red leaves
of Mount Tachida...
a scarecrow

jp: .どこもどこも若いかがしはなかりけり
ro: doko mo doko mo wakai kagashi wa nakari keri
en:
nowhere, nowhere
can a young scarecrow
be found

jp: .とぶ蝶を憐み給へ立かがし
ro: tobu chô wo awaremi tamae tatsu kagashi
en:
take pity
on the flitting butterfly...
scarecrow

jp: .夕鐘に野べ賑しくかがし哉
ro: yû-gane ni nobe nigiwashiku kagashi kana
en:
at evening's bell
the fields are crowded...
with scarecrows!

jp: 雨降や苔の衣を打夜とて
ro: ame furu ya koke [no] koromo wo utsu yo tote
en:
rain falls--
a night for pounding
the monk's rough clothes

jp: .芋蔓がうしろでそそる砧哉
ro: imo-zuru ga ushiro de sosoru kinuta kana
en:
stirring the potato vine
from behind...
cloth-pounding

jp: .うぢ山や木魚の外も小夜砧
ro: uji yama ya mokugyo no hoka mo sayo-ginuta
en:
night on Mount Uji--
wooden temple drums
and cloth-pounding

jp: .えのころもうかれ出たるきぬた哉
ro: enokoro mo ukare idetaru kinuta kana
en:
the dog too
runs out to play...
pounding cloth

jp: .門の木もやもめ烏よさよ砧
ro: kado no ki mo yamome karasu yo sayo-ginuta
en:
in the tree by the gate
a widow crow...
cloth-pounding at night

jp: .玉川や涼がてらの小夜砧
ro: tama-gawa [ya] suzumi ga tera no sayo-ginuta
en:
Tama River--
in the temple's cool evening
pounding cloth

jp: .鳩だまれ苔の衣を今打ぞ
ro: hato damare koke no koromo wo ima utsu zo
en:
hush, pigeon!
now the monk's rough clothes
are pounded

jp: .足枕手枕鹿のむつまじや
ro: ashi makura temakura shika no mutsumaji ya
en:
my feet for a pillow
and my hands...
the friendly deer

jp: .妻乞や秘若い鹿でなし
ro: tsuma-goi ya hisoka wakai shika de nashi
en:
calling for a wife
the deer is no
spring chicken

jp: .人ならば五処ﾊぞ鹿の恋
ro: hito naraba go jû kurai zo shika no koi
en:
if you were human
you could be about fifty...
mating deer

jp: .鵙の声かんにん袋破れたか
ro: mozu no koe kanninnbukuro yabureta ka
en:
a shrike's voice--
did your bag of patience
break?

jp: .青い虫茶色な虫の鳴にけり
ro: aoi mushi chairona mushi no naki ni keri
en:
green insect
and brown insect...
a duet

jp: .青虫よ黒よどっちが鳴まける
ro: ao mushi yo kuro yo dotchi ga naki makeru
en:
green insect, black insect
which will lose
the singing match?

jp: .こおろぎのころころ髭を自慢哉
ro: kôrogi no koro-koro hige wo jiman kana
en:
the cricket
"Cricky! Cricky!"
brags about his beard

jp: .あてがっておくぞ其薮きりぎりす
ro: ategatte oku zo sono yabu kirigirisu
en:
that thicket
is reserved for you...
katydid

jp: .きりぎりす髭をかつぎて鳴にけり
ro: kirigirisu hige wo katsugite naki ni keri
en:
the katydid
wagging his beard
is singing

jp: .逃しなや瓜喰欠てきりぎりす
ro: nigeshina ya uri kui kaite kirigirisu
en:
running away
snatching a bite of melon...
katydid

jp: .野ばくちや銭の中なるきりぎりす
ro: no bakuchi ya zeni no naka naru kirigirisu
en:
gambling in the field--
in the pot
a katydid!

jp: .雀等がはたらきぶりや草の花
ro: suzumera ga hatarakiburi ya kusa no hana
en:
the sparrows
go about their business...
wildflowers

jp: .まけぬ気やあんな小草も花が咲
ro: makenu ki ya anna ko-gusa mo hana ga saku
en:
never saying die
that little wildflower
blooms too

jp: .大菊や負るそぶりはなかりしが
ro: ôgiku ya makeru soburi wa nakarishi ga
en:
big chrysanthemum
despite its undefeated
demeanor...

jp: .片隅や去年勝たる菊の花
ro: kata sumi ya saru nen kachitaru kiku no hana
en:
off in a corner
last year's champion
chrysanthemum

jp: .勝菊にほろりと爺が涙哉
ro: kachi kiku ni horori to jiji ga namida kana
en:
a prize-winning chrysanthemum!
the old man
weeps

jp: .勝菊に餅を備て置にけり
ro: kachi kiku ni mochi wo sonaete oki ni keri
en:
for the prize-winning
chrysanthemum, a gift
of rice cake

jp: .勝声や花咲爺が菊の花
ro: kachi-goe ya hana saku jiji ga kiku no hana
en:
a victory shout--
the old man's chysanthemum
has won!

jp: .門口を犬に預けて菊の花
ro: kado-guchi wo inu ni azukete kiku no hana
en:
trusting the dog
to guard the gate...
chrysanthemum

jp: .金蔵を日除にしたり菊の花
ro: kanagura wo hiyoke ni shitari kiku no hana
en:
the treasure house
gives it shade...
chrysanthemum

jp: .けふの日や信濃育ちも菊の花
ro: kyô no hi ya shinano sodachi mo kiku no hana
en:
just today
home-grown in Shinano...
chrysanthemum

jp: .生涯に二番とはなき負たきく
ro: shôgai ni ni ban to wa naki maketa kiku
en:
in life
there's no second place...
defeated chrysanthemum

jp: .小便の香も通ひけり菊の花
ro: shôben no ka mo kayoi keri kiku no hana
en:
the smell of piss
wafting too...
chrysanthemums

jp: .七転び髪八起の花よ女郎花
ro: nana korobi ya oki no hana yo ominaeshi
en:
seven tumble down
eight rise up...
maiden flowers

jp: .さをしかにかりて寝にけり萩の花
ro: saoshika ni karate ne ni keri hagi no hana
en:
the young buck
borrows it for a nap...
blooming bush clover

jp: .猫の子のかくれんぼする萩の花
ro: neko no ko no kakurenbo suru hagi no hana
en:
the kitten plays
hide-and-seek...
in bush clover

jp: .ぶち猫も一夜寝にけり萩の花
ro: buchi neko mo hito ya ne ni keri hagi no hana
en:
a tabby cat too
spends a night...
blooming bush clover

jp: .犬に迄いただかせたる刈穂哉
ro: inu ni made itadakasetaru kariho kana
en:
even the dog
becomes a beneficiary...
harvested rice

jp: .ちさい子がきせる加へて刈穂哉
ro: chisai ko ga kiseru kuwaete kariho kana
en:
a small child
chews on a pipe...
they harvest the rice

jp: .天皇の袖に一房稲穂哉
ro: tennô no sode ni hito fusa inaho kana
en:
a fringe
for the emperor's sleeve...
heads of rice

jp: .雷をまねき落したすすき哉
ro: kaminari wo maneki otoshita susuki kana
en:
beckoning the lightning bolt
to strike...
pampas grass

jp: .芦の穂やあんな所にあんな家
ro: ashi no ho ya an[na] tokoro ni anna ie
en:
heads of the rushes--
in such a place
such a house!

jp: .芦吹や天つ乙女も斯うまへと
ro: ashi fuku ya amatsuotome mo kô mae to
en:
the blowing rushes
like celestial maidens
dancing

jp: .或人の着られし芦のほ綿哉
ro: arubito no kirareshi ashi no ho wata kana
en:
some folks weave
and wear it...
cotton of the rushes

jp: .日の暮や芦の花にて子をまねく
ro: hi no kure ya ashi no hana nite ko wo maneku
en:
sunset--
she calls for her child
in the blooming rushes

jp: .大闇にやみを添たる一葉哉
ro: ôyami ni yami wo soetaru hito ha kana
en:
adding its darkness
to the great darkness...
one leaf falls

jp: .桐の木やてきぱき散てつんと立
ro: kiri no ki ya tekipaki chitte tsunto tatsu
en:
its leaves shed quickly
the paulownia tree looking
stuck-up

jp: .寝た犬にふはとかぶさる一葉哉
ro: neta inu ni fuwa to kabusaru hito ha kana
en:
on the sleeping dog
gently, a hat...
a leaf

jp: .十月の中の十日を茶の湯哉
ro: jûgatsu no naka no tôka wo cha no yu kana
en:
first winter month
tenth day...
a tea ceremony

jp: .十二月二十九日の茶の湯哉
ro: jûnigatsu ni jû ku nichi no cha no yu kana
en:
Twelfth Month
29th day
a tea ceremony

jp: .日本の冬至も梅の咲にけり
ro: nippon no tôji mo ume no saki ni keri
en:
winter solstice in Japan--
plum trees
in bloom!

jp: .御仏の御鼻の先へつらら哉
ro: mi-botoke no o-hana no saki e tsurara kana
en:
on honorable Buddha's
honorable nose
an icicle

jp: .春来いととしより来いと鳴鳩よ
ro: haru kii to [to]shiyori kii to naku hato yo
en:
"Come, spring!
Come, old man!"
the pigeon coos

jp: .米と銭篩分けけり初時雨
ro: kome to zeni furui-wake keri hatsu shigure
en:
sifting the rice
and coins...
first winter rain

jp: .薪の山俵の山やはつ時雨
ro: maki no yama tawara no yama ya hatsu shigure
en:
a pile of firewood
a pile of rice bags...
first winter rain

jp: .今の間に十時雨程の山家哉
ro: ima no ma ni jû shigure hodo no yamaga kana
en:
as of now
about ten winter storms...
mountain home

jp: .芋運ぶ僧都の猿やむら時雨
ro: imo hakobu sôzu no saru ya mura shigure
en:
the abbot's monkey
hauls potatoes...
steady winter rain

jp: .大時雨小しぐれ寝るもむづかしや
ro: ôshigure ko shigure neru mo muzukashi ya
en:
big winter rain
or little winter rain...
sleeping is hard

jp: .おそろしや狼よりももる時雨
ro: osoroshi ya ôkami yori mo moru shigure
en:
a scary sight
worse than a wolf!
winter rain leaking in

jp: .菰簾ばたりばたりとしぐれかな
ro: komo sudare batari-batari to shigure kana
en:
reed mats, bamboo blinds
flap and clatter...
winter rain

jp: .座頭の坊中につつんで時雨けり
ro: zato no bônaka ni tsutsunde shigure keri
en:
tucking in
the blind priest...
winter rain

jp: .時雨るや細工過たる菊の花
ro: shiguru[ru] ya saiku sugitaru kiku no hana
en:
winter rain--
too many strings bend
the chrysanthemum

jp: .死山を目利しておく時雨哉
ro: shinu yama wo mekiki shite oku shigure kana
en:
forecasting the mountain
where it will die...
winter raincloud

jp: .ちんば鶏たまたま出れば時雨けり
ro: chimba-dori tama-tama dereba shigure keri
en:
when the lame chicken
ventures outside...
winter rain

jp: .蛤のつひのけぶりや夕時雨
ro: hamaguri no tsuhi no keburi ya yûshigure
en:
the clams' cremation smoke
rises...
evening's winter rain

jp: .一ッ家や馬も旅人もしぐれ込
ro: hitotsu ya ya uma mo tabibito mo shigure komu
en:
huddled in one house
travelers, horses...
winter rain

jp: .木母寺につきあたりたる時雨哉
ro: mokuboji ni tsuki ataritaru shigure kana
en:
Mokubo Temple
takes a pounding...
winter rain

jp: .罠ありてしらでしぐるる雀哉
ro: wana arite shirade shigururu suzume kana
en:
unaware of the snare
in the winter rain...
sparrow

jp: .木がらしの吹ばふけとや角田川
ro: kogarashi no fukaba fuke to ya sumida-gawa
en:
"If you're gonna blow
winter wind, then blow!'
Sumida River

jp: .ばか烏我はつ雪と思ふかや
ro: baka-garasu waga hatsu yuki to omou ka ya
en:
foolish crow
do you think this first snow
is my fault?

jp: .はつ雪の降損じたる我家哉
ro: hatsu yuki no furi-sonjitaru waga ya kana
en:
the first snowfall
didn't happen...
my house

jp: .はつ雪やどなたが這入る野雪隠
ro: hatsu yuki ya donata ga hairu no setchin
en:
first snowfall--
someone has entered
the outhouse

jp: .はつ雪やなむきえ僧の朝の声
ro: hatsu yuki ya namu kiesô no asa no koe
en:
first snow--
a priest chants
his morning prayer

jp: .大菊のさんだらぼしやけさの雪
ro: ôgiku no sandaraboshi ya kesa no yuki
en:
the big chrysanthemum
wears a straw hat...
morning snow

jp: .おらが世は臼のこだまぞ夜の雪
ro: oraga yo wa usu no kodama zo yoru no yuki
en:
my world--
rice pounding echoes
over evening snow

jp: .一握り雪持って居る仏かな
ro: hito nigiri yuki motte iru hotoke kana
en:
he's holding one
snowball...
the Buddha

jp: .びんづるの目ばかり光るけさの雪
ro: binzuru no me bakari hikaru kesa no yuki
en:
Holy Binzuru's
eyes glittering...
this morning's snow

jp: .山に雪降とて耳の鳴にけり
ro: yama ni yuki furu tote mimi no nari ni keri
en:
snow falls on the mountain
my ears
are ringing

jp: .今降が児が霰ぞそれそこに
ro: ima furu ga chigo ga arare zo sore soko ni
en:
just now it fell--
"A hailstone!" cries the toddler
Over there!"

jp: .啄木も不仕合やら薮あられ
ro: kitsutsuki mo fu shiawase yara yabu arare
en:
no luck
for the woodpecker...
hail on the thicket

jp: .ちる霰立小便の見事さよ
ro: chiru arare tachi shôben no migotosa yo
en:
to stand pissing
while hailstones fall...
quite a feat!

jp: .御談義の手まねも見ゆるかれの哉
ro: o-dangi no temane mo miyuru kareno kana
en:
the preacher's
hand gestures too...
withered fields

jp: .達磨忌や傘さしかける梅の花
ro: daruma ki ya kasa sashikakeru ume no hana
en:
Dharma's Death-Day
in umbrella shade...
plum blossoms

jp: .達磨きやちんぷんかんを鳴ち鳥
ro: daruma ki ya chinpunkan wo naku chidori
en:
on Dharma's Death-Day
spouting gibberish...
a plover

jp: .達磨忌や箒で書し不二の山
ro: daruma ki ya hôki de kakishi fuji no yama
en:
Dharma's Death-Day--
with a broom I draw
Mount Fuji

jp: .小豆粥大師の雪も降にけり
ro: azuki-gaya daishi no yuki mo furi ni keri
en:
red bean gruel--
even on the Patriarch's Death-Day
snow falling

jp: .けふの日やするする粥もおがまるる
ro: kyô no hi ya suru-suru kayu mo ogamaruru
en:
this day--
even stirring gruel
is a prayer!

jp: .株ｺに鳩も並ぶや大師粥
ro: shôban ni hato mo narabu ya daishi kayu
en:
even pigeons
line up for their share...
Patriarch's gruel

jp: .なむ大師しらぬも粥にありつきぬ
ro: namu daishi shiranu mo kayu ni aritsukinu
en:
great Patriarch--
even unbelievers
get his gruel

jp: .鶯に目を覚さすな鉢たたき
ro: uguisu ni me wo samasasu na hachi tataki
en:
don't wake up
the nightingale!
a monk beating his bowl

jp: .ろう八や我と同じく骨と皮
ro: rôhachi ya ware to onajiku hone to kawa
en:
Buddha's Enlightenment Day--
for me the same
skin and bones

jp: .寒声や不二も丸めて呑んだ顔
ro: kangoe ya fuji mo marumete nonda kao
en:
winter voice drills--
he looks like he swallowed
Mount Fuji!

jp: .よい雨や茶壷の口を切る日とて
ro: yoi ame ya chatsubo no kuchi wo ki[ru] hi tote
en:
a good rain--
today's the day to unseal
the new tea

jp: .隠家の犬も人数やすす祝
ro: kakureya no inu mo ninzu ya susu iwai
en:
secluded house--
for the dog and all humans
soot sweeping

jp: .煤ひきにげん気付ルや庵の犬
ro: susu haki ni genki-zukeru ya io no inu
en:
the soot sweeping
riles him up...
hut's dog

jp: .さてもさても六十顔のせっき候
ro: sate mo sate mo roku jû kao no se[k]kizoro
en:
well, well
his face looks sixty...
the Twelfth Month singer

jp: .庵の田もとうとう餅に成にけり
ro: io no ta mo tô-tô mochi ni nari ni keri
en:
my hut's rice field
at long last
becomes rice cakes!

jp: .鶏が餅踏んづけて通りけり
ro: niwatori ga mochi funzukete tôri keri
en:
the chickens
trample the rice cakes
as they go

jp: .餅搗や臼にさしたる梅の花
ro: mochi tsuki ya usu ni sashitaru ume no hana
en:
pounding rice cakes
in the tub something extra...
plum blossoms

jp: .餅搗や松の住吉大明神
ro: mochi tsuki ya matsu no sumiyoshi daimyôjin
en:
pounding rice cakes
among the pines
Sumiyoshi Shrine

jp: .藪陰やとしとり餅も一人つき
ro: yabu kage ya toshiyori mochi mo hitori tsuki
en:
in thicket shade
an old man pounds rice cakes
alone

jp: .浅草の鶏にも蒔ん歳暮米
ro: asakusa no tori ni mo makan seibo kome
en:
for Asakusa's chickens, too
a end-of-year gift...
scattering rice

jp: .亦打山夕越くればずきん哉
ro: matchi yama yû-goshi kureba zukin kana
en:
as Mount Matchi's
evening grows dark...
winter skullcaps

jp: .いついつは鹿が餌食ぞ紙衾
ro: itsu-itsu wa shika ga egui zo kami fusuma
en:
soon enough
the deer will eat it...
paper quilt

jp: .雀らよ小便無用古衾
ro: suzume-ra yo shôben muyô furu fusuma
en:
hey sparrows
no pissing on my old
winter quilt!

jp: .梟が念入て見る衾かな
ro: fukurô ga nenirite miru fusuma kana
en:
the owl gives
a good hard look...
winter quilt

jp: .飯粒を鳥に拾はするふとん哉
ro: meshi tsubu wo tori ni hirowasuru futon kana
en:
grains of rice
pecked by birds...
my futon

jp: .我国や子どもも作る雪仏
ro: waga kuni ya kodomo mo tsukuru yuki-botoke
en:
my province--
the children also make
snow Buddhas

jp: .三弦のばちでうけたり雪礫
ro: samisen no bachi de uketari yukitsubute
en:
blocked with her
samisen's plectrum...
snowball

jp: .炭の手を柱で拭ふ爺哉
ro: sumi no te wo hashira de nuguu jijii kana
en:
wiping charcoal
from hands to post...
the old man

jp: .炭竈やしばし里あるけぶり様
ro: sumigama ya shibashi sato aru keburi yô
en:
charcoal kiln--
a glimpse of a village
through the smoke

jp: .赤椀に竜も出さうなそば湯哉
ro: aka wan ni tatsu mo desôna soba yu kana
en:
in the red bowl
a whorling dragon!
buckwheat noodles

jp: .胡坐して猿も座とるや鰒汁
ro: agura shite saru mo za to[ru] ya fukuto-jiru
en:
sitting cross-legged
a monkey joins too...
pufferfish soup

jp: .鰒すするうしろは伊豆の岬哉
ro: fugu susuru ushiro wa izu no misaki kana
en:
slurping pufferfish soup--
behind me
Cape Izu

jp: .大津絵の鬼も見じとや暖鳥
ro: ôtsu-e no oni mo miji to ya nukume-dori
en:
even the painted devil
won't look...little bird warming
the hawk's nest

jp: .門烏一夜は鷹に雇はれよ
ro: kado karasu hito yo wa taka ni yatoware yo
en:
crow at the gate
all night used by the hawk...
nest warmer

jp: .暖鳥同士が何か咄すぞよ
ro: nukume-dori dôshi ga nani ka hanasu zo yo
en:
two nest-warming birds
conversing
about something

jp: .梅の木に大願あるかみそさざい
ro: ume no ki ni taigan aru ka misosazai
en:
in the plum tree
are you praying hard
wren?

jp: .柴けぶり立るぞ遊べみそさざい
ro: shiba keburi tateru zo asobe misosazai
en:
smoke from brushwood
is rising...
play little wrens!

jp: .野はこせん見ることなかれみそさざい
ro: no hako sen miru koto nakare misosazai
en:
pooping in the field--
avert your eyes
little wren!

jp: .草庵の寝事の真似やなく千鳥
ro: kusa io no negoto no mane ya naku chidori
en:
imitating the sleep talk
in the hut...
a plover sings

jp: .むら千鳥犬をじらして通りけり
ro: mura chidori inu wo jirashite tôri keri
en:
a flock of plovers
gangs up on the dog
passing through

jp: .木母寺の雪隠からも千鳥哉
ro: mokuboji no setchin kara mo chidori kana
en:
from Mokubo Temple's
outhouse too...
a plover

jp: .水鳥のよい風除や筑波山
ro: mizudori no yoi kazayoke ya tsukuba yama
en:
a good windbreak
for the waterfowl...
Mount Tsukuba

jp: .水鳥よ今のうき世に寝ぼけるな
ro: mizudori yo ima no ukiyo ni nebokeru na
en:
waterfowl--
in today's floating world
half-asleep

jp: .見れば見るほど仏頂面の鰒哉
ro: mireba miru hodo butsu chôzura no fukuto kana
en:
the more you look at it
the more sour the face...
pufferfish

jp: .浮け海鼠仏法流布の世なるぞよ
ro: uke namako buppô rufu no yo naru zo yo
en:
float, sea slug--
Buddha's law permeates
this world!

jp: .鬼もいや菩薩もいやとなまこ哉
ro: oni mo iya bosatsu mo iya to namako kana
en:
not a devil
not a saint...
just a sea slug

jp: .ほのぼのと明石が浦のなまこ哉
ro: hono-bono to akashi ga ura no namako kana
en:
gliding dimly
in Akashi Bay...
a sea slug

jp: .大根引大根で道を教へけり
ro: daiko hiki daikon de michi wo oshie keri
en:
with a just-yanked
radish
pointing the way

jp: .どの草も犬の後架ぞ散紅葉
ro: dono kusa mo inu no kôka zo chiru momiji
en:
any grass serves
as the dog's toilet...
red leaves falling

jp: .枯々や俵の山になく烏
ro: kare-gare ya tawara no yama ni naku karasu
en:
winter withering--
on a pile of rice bags
the crow caws

jp: .冬がれの五百がなけや山烏
ro: fuyugare no go hyaku ga nake ya yama-garasu
en:
in winter's withering
all five hundred, sing!
mountain crows

jp: .藪並におれが首も枯にけり
ro: yabu nami ni ore ga kôbe mo kare ni keri
en:
stand of trees--
my head too
withered and bare

jp: .狼も上下で出よ戌の春
ro: ôkami mo kamishimo de deyo inu no haru
en:
even you, wolf
go out dressed in a robe...
Year of the Dog

jp: .年神や又も御世話に成りまする
ro: toshi-gami ya mata mo o-sewa ni nari masuru
en:
New Year's god--
once again I rely
on your help

jp: .人の日や本堂いづる汗けぶり
ro: hito no hi ya hondô izuru ase keburi
en:
Mankind's Day--
from the main temple
the steam of bodies

jp: .生神の凧とり榎たくましや
ro: ikigami [no] tako tori enoki takumashi ya
en:
the sacred kite
grabbed by the nettle tree...
a bold one!

jp: .凧きれて犬もきょろきょろ目哉
ro: tako kirete inu mo kyoro-kyoro manako kana
en:
runaway kite!
the dog also eyes it
restlessly

jp: .人真似や犬の見て居る凧
ro: hito mane ya inu no mite iru ikanobori
en:
imitating his master
the dog watching
the kite

jp: .鶏の仲間割して日永哉
ro: niwatori no nakama wareshite hi naga kana
en:
among the chickens
a bitter feud...
a long day

jp: .日の長い日の長いとて涙かな
ro: hi no naga[i] hi no nagai to[te] namida kana
en:
the day is long
the day is so long!
tears

jp: .行灯で菜をつみにけり春の雨
ro: andon de na wo tsumi ni keri haru no ame
en:
picking veggies
with a paper lantern...
spring rain

jp: .しんしんとしんらん松の春の雨
ro: shin-shin to shinran matsu no haru no ame
en:
perfect calm--
Shinran's pine
in the spring rain

jp: .春雨や菜をつみに行小行灯
ro: harusame ya na wo tsumi ni yuku ko andon
en:
spring rain--
gone vegetable-picking
with a little lantern

jp: .春風や今つくねたる山の月
ro: haru kaze ya ima tsukunetaru yama no tsuki
en:
spring breeze--
a fresh-made moon
over the mountain

jp: .春風や畠掘っても涌く油
ro: haru kaze ya hatake hotte mo waku abura
en:
spring breeze--
even while digging a garden
oils gushes out

jp: .霞から人さす虫が出たりけり
ro: kasumi kara hito sasu mushi ga detari keri
en:
from the mist
stinging insects
emerge

jp: .けふの日も喰つぶしけり春がすみ
ro: kyô no hi mo kuitsubushi keri harugasumi
en:
today too
spent stuffing my face...
spring mist

jp: .土橋や立小便も先かすむ
ro: tsuchi-bashi ya tatsu shôben mo mazu kasumu
en:
earthen bridge--
I stand pissing
in morning mist

jp: .菜も蒔いてかすんで暮らす小家哉
ro: na mo maite kasunde kurasu ko ie kana
en:
planting vegetables
living in mist...
little house

jp: .陽炎に扇を敷いて寝たりけり
ro: kagerô ni ôgi wo shiite netari keri
en:
in heat shimmers
paper fan spread wide
he sleeps

jp: .陽炎に子を返せとや鳴く雀
ro: kagerô ni ko wo kaese to ya naku suzume
en:
in heat shimmers
"Give back my child!"
a sparrow sings

jp: .陽炎や狐の穴の赤の飯
ro: kagerô ya kitsune no ana no aka no meshi
en:
heat shimmers--
at the fox's hole
red beans and rice

jp: .陽炎や敷居でつぶす髪虱
ro: kagerô ya shiki-i de tsubusu kami-jirami
en:
heat shimmers--
in the threshold crushing
hair lice

jp: .陽炎の猫にもたかる歩行神
ro: kagerô no neko ni mo takaru aruki-gami
en:
a cat in heat shimmers
also follows
the God of Wandering

jp: .陽炎や馬糞も銭に成にけり
ro: kagerô ya ma-guso mo zeni ni nari ni keri
en:
heat shimmers--
even horse dung
becomes money

jp: .さむしろや銭としきみと陽炎と
ro: samushiro ya zeni to shikimi to kagerô to
en:
little straw mat--
coins, offered branches
heat shimmers

jp: .朝夕にせつてふされて残る雪
ro: asa yû ni sechô sarete nokoru yuki
en:
morning and night
bullied about...
leftover snow

jp: .残る雪雀に迄もなぶらるる
ro: nokoru yuki suzume ni made mo naburaruru
en:
the last snow pile--
even the sparrows
make fun of it

jp: .世に住めばむりにとかすや門の雪
ro: yo ni su[me]ba muri ni tokasu ya kado no yuki
en:
such is life--
the gate's snow is forced
to melt

jp: .我庵や貧乏がくしの雪とける
ro: waga io ya bimbô gakushi no yuki tokeru
en:
my hut--
the poverty-hiding snow
melts away

jp: .我門や此界隈の雪捨場
ro: waga kado ya kono kaiwai no yuki suteba
en:
my gate--
the neighborhood's
snow dump

jp: .我雪も連に頼むぞ千曲川
ro: waga yuki mo tsure ni tanomu zo chikuma kawa
en:
my snow too
entrusted to join
Chikuma River

jp: .ねはん会やそよとなでしこ女郎花
ro: nehan e ya soyo to nadeshiko ominaeshi
en:
Buddha's Death-Day--
gently blowing pinks
and maiden flowers

jp: .ねはん像銭見ておはす顔も有
ro: nehanzô zeni mite owasu kao mo ari
en:
the face of Buddha
on his Death-Day
watching the coins

jp: .花咲くや在家のみだも御開帳
ro: hana saku ya zaika no mida mo o-kaichô
en:
spring blossoms--
even in a farmhouse
Amida Buddha on display

jp: .飴売も花かざりけり終御影講
ro: ame uri [mo] hana kazari keri mieikô
en:
even the candy stand
decked with flowers...
the Founder's image

jp: .こんにゃくも拝まれにけり御影講
ro: konnyaku mo ogamare ni keri mi-eikô
en:
the festive jelly
is prayed to too...
the Founder's image

jp: .御影講や泥坊猫も花の陰
ro: mieikô ya dorobô neko mo hana no kage
en:
Founder's image on display--
even the thief cat
in blossom shade

jp: .さてもさても六十顔の出代りよ
ro: sate mo sate mo roku jû kao no degawari yo
en:
well, well
his face looks sixty...
the laid-off servant

jp: .出代が駕にめしたる都哉
ro: degawari ga kago ni meshitaru miyako kana
en:
one migrating servant
rides a palanquin...
Kyoto

jp: .出代の市にさらすや五十顔
ro: degawari no ichi ni sarasu ya go jû kao
en:
a laid-off servant at market--
his fifty year-old face
exposed

jp: .雨漏を何とおぼすぞ雛達
ro: amamore wo nanto obosu zo hiinatachi
en:
what do you think
of my leaking roof?
Doll Festival dolls

jp: .ちる花に御目を塞ぐ雛哉
ro: chiru hana ni on-me wo fusagu hiina kana
en:
closing her eyes
to the scattering blossoms...
the doll

jp: .土人形もけふの祭りに逢にけり
ro: tsuchi ningyô mo kyô no matsuri ni ai ni keri
en:
clay dolls too
are gathering today...
festival

jp: .おらが世やそこらの草も餅になる
ro: oraga yo ya sokora no kusa mo mochi ni naru
en:
my world--
those herbs over yonder
become my cake

jp: .草餅や臼の中から蛙鳴
ro: kusamochi ya usu no naka kara kawazu naku
en:
herb cakes--
inside the mixing tub
a croaking frog

jp: .松の木に笠をならべる汐干哉
ro: matsu no ki ni kasa wo naraberu shioi kana
en:
in a pine tree
umbrella-hats in a row...
low tide

jp: .負た子が花ではやすや茶つみ唄
ro: ôta ko ga hana de hayasu [ya] cha tsumi uta
en:
the child on her back
beats time with a flower...
tea-picking song

jp: .ぶつぶつと大念仏でつむ茶哉
ro: butsu-butsu to ônembutsu de tsumu cha kana
en:
grumbling his praise
to Amida Buddha...
tea picker

jp: .君が代は女も畠打にけり
ro: kimi ga yo wa onna mo hatake uchi ni keri
en:
Great Japan!
a woman, also
digs with the plow

jp: .浮かれ猫いけんを聞いて居たりけり
ro: ukare neko iken wo kiite itari keri
en:
the love-crazed cat
listens
to my scolding

jp: .うかれ猫狼谷を通りけり
ro: ukare [neko] ôkami tani wo tôri keri
en:
love-struck cat--
down into Wolf Valley
he goes

jp: .嗅で見てよしにする也猫の恋
ro: kaide mite yoshi ni suru nari neko no koi
en:
they stop sniffing
and go their separate ways...
lover cats

jp: .恋序よ所の猫とは成にけり
ro: koi tsuide yoso no neko to wa nari ni keri
en:
love-smitten
my cat becomes
the neighbor's pet

jp: .恋ゆへにぬすっと猫と呼れけり
ro: koi yue ni nusutto neko to yobare keri
en:
because of love
they call him
"thieving cat!"

jp: .鼻先に飯粒つけて猫の恋
ro: hana saki ni meshi tsubu tsukete neko no koi
en:
a grain of rice
stuck to his nose...
lover cat

jp: .我窓は序に鳴や猫の恋
ro: waga mado wa tsuide ni naku ya neko no koi
en:
while at my window
a yowl...
the lover cat

jp: .むつまじや軒の雀もいく世帯
ro: mutsumaji ya noki no suzume mo iku setai
en:
living in harmony
how many generations?
sparrows in the eaves

jp: .草の戸やみやげをねだる雀の子
ro: kusa no to ya miyage wo nedaru suzume [no] ko
en:
at my humble hut
he begs for a present
a baby sparrow

jp: .柴門や足にからまる雀の子
ro: shiba no to ya ashi ni karamaru suzume no ko
en:
my humble hut--
with baby sparrows
underfoot

jp: .雀子のはや喰逃をしたりけり
ro: suzumego no haya kûnige wo shitari [keri]
en:
baby sparrow
so quickly you've learned
to eat and run

jp: .雀子や銭投る手に鳴かかる
ro: suzumego ya zeni hôru te ni naki-kakaru
en:
in the hand
tossing coins, baby sparrow
starts cheeping

jp: .頬べたのお飯をなくや雀の子
ro: hohobeta [no] o-meshi wo naku ya suzume no ko
en:
chirping for the rice
on my cheek...
baby sparrow

jp: .家跡や此鶯に此さくら
ro: ie ato ya kono uguisu ni kono sakura
en:
behind the house--
this nightingale
these cherry blossoms

jp: .鶯や雨だらけなる朝の声
ro: uguisu ya ame darake naru asa no koe
en:
nightingale--
his rain-drenched
morning voice

jp: .鶯や此声にして此山家
ro: uguisu ya kono koe ni shite kono yamaga
en:
nightingale--
this voice for this
mountain home

jp: .鶯や花なき家も捨ずして
ro: uguisu ya hana naki ie mo sutezu shite
en:
nightingale--
not neglecting even a house
without blossoms

jp: .鶯よ何百鳴いた飯前に
ro: uguisu yo nan-byaku naita meshimae ni
en:
nightingale--
how many hundreds of songs
before you eat?

jp: .いざこざをじっと見て居る乙鳥哉
ro: izakoza wo jitto mite iru tsubame kana
en:
keeping a steady eye
on the quarrel...
the swallow

jp: .急度した宿もなくて夕乙鳥
ro: kitto shita yado mo naku[te] yû tsubame
en:
no definite place
to spend the night...
evening swallow

jp: .京も京々の五条の乙鳥哉
ro: kyô mo kyô kyô no go jô no tsubame kana
en:
Kyoto, Kyoto!
on Kyoto's Fifth Avenue...
swallows

jp: .乙鳥やゆききの人を深山木に
ro: tsubakuro ya yuki[ki] no hito wo miyamagi ni
en:
swallows watch the people
come and go...
deep wooded mountains

jp: .やよ燕細いけぶりを先祝へ
ro: yayo tsubame hosoi keburi wo saki iwa[e]
en:
hey swallows!
for my thin, rising smoke
congratulate me first

jp: .世がよいぞよいぞ野燕里つばめ
ro: yo ga yoi zo yoi zo no tsubame sato tsubame
en:
a good world! good world!
country swallows
and town swallows

jp: .大地獄小じごくからも雲雀哉
ro: ô[ji]goku ko jigoku kara mo hibari kana
en:
from great hell
and from little hell--
skylarks

jp: .子を捨し藪を離れぬ雲雀哉
ro: ko wo suteshi yabu wo hanarenu hibari kana
en:
sticking to the thicket
where she left her children...
skylark

jp: .地獄画の垣にかかりて鳴雲雀
ro: jigoku e no kaki [ni] kakarite naku hibari
en:
in the hell painting
perched on a fence...
a lark sings

jp: .野ばくちが打ちらかりて鳴雲雀
ro: no bakuchi ga uchi-chirakarite naku hibari
en:
gamblers in the field
scatter below...
a lark sings

jp: .朝もやの紛に雁の立にけり
ro: asa moya no magire ni kari no tachi ni keri
en:
under the cover
of morning's haze
geese taking off

jp: .小田の雁長居はおそれおそれとや
ro: oda no kari naga-i wa osore osore to ya
en:
rice field geese
if you stay too long
danger! danger!

jp: .釣人のぼんの凹より帰る雁
ro: tsuribito no bon no kubo yori kaeru kari
en:
behind the fisherman's neck
departing
geese

jp: .どこへなと我をつれてよ帰る雁
ro: doko e na to ware wo tsure[te] yo kaeru kari
en:
wherever you like
lead me along...
departing geese

jp: .念仏がうるさいとてや雁帰る
ro: nembutsu ga urusai tote ya kari kaeru
en:
our praising Buddha
is a nuisance! the geese
depart

jp: .御地蔵の手に居へ給ふ蛙かな
ro: o-jizô no te ni sue tamau kawazu kana
en:
safe in holy
Jizo's hand, squats
a frog

jp: .亀どのに負さって鳴蛙哉
ro: kame dono ni obusatte naku kawazu kana
en:
hitching a ride
on Mr. Turtle...
a singing frog

jp: .炬をはやし立てや鳴蛙
ro: taimatsu wo hayashi tatete ya naku kawazu
en:
raising a cheer
for the torches...
croaking frogs

jp: .ちる梅をざぶりと浴てなく蛙
ro: chiru ume wo zaburi to abite naku kawazu
en:
bathing in the fallen
plum blossoms...
a croaking frog

jp: .天下泰平と居並ぶ蛙かな
ro: tenka taihei to i-narabu kawazu kana
en:
sitting in a row
peace on earth...
frogs

jp: .人を吐やうに居て鳴く蛙
ro: hito wo haku yô ni suwatte naku kawazu
en:
squatting like he's vomiting
a man!
croaking frog

jp: .目出度の煙聳へてなく蛙
ro: medetasa no keburi sobiete naku kawazu
en:
celebratory smoke
rising, the croaking
frogs

jp: .犬と蝶他人むきでもなかりけり
ro: inu to chô tanin muki demo nakari keri
en:
the dog and the butterfly
not strangers
at all

jp: .寝るてふ鼠の米も通りがけ
ro: ineru chô nezumi no kome mo tôrigake
en:
on the way to bed
the butterfly visits
the mouse's rice

jp: .桟を歩んで渡る小てふ哉
ro: kakehashi wo ayunde wataru ko chô kana
en:
crossing the hanging bridge
on foot...
butterfly

jp: .がむしゃらの犬とも遊ぶ小てふ哉
ro: gamushara no inu tomo asobu ko chô kana
en:
playing with
the rambunctious dog...
little butterfly

jp: .此方が善光寺とや蝶のとぶ
ro: kono kata ga zenkôji to ya chô no tobu
en:
"Follow me to Zenko Temple!"
a butterfly
flies

jp: .鹿の角かりて休みし小てふ哉
ro: shika no tsuno karite yasumishi ko chô kana
en:
borrowing an antler
the little butterfly
rests

jp: .蝶とぶや草葉の陰も湯がわくと
ro: chô tobu ya kusaba no kage mo yu ga waku to
en:
a butterfly flits--
even in grassy shade
a hot bath's ready

jp: .笛役は名主どの也蝶のまひ
ro: fue yaku wa nanushi dono nari chô no mau
en:
the flute-playing servant
is the village headman!
butterflies dance

jp: .舞賃に紙をとばすぞのべの蝶
ro: maichin ni kami wo tobasu zo nobe no chô
en:
for your dancing fee
I let fly this piece of paper...
meadow butterfly

jp: .薮中も仏おはして蝶のまふ
ro: yabu naka mo hotoke owashite chô no mau
en:
in a thicket, too
around the Buddha...
butterflies dance

jp: .おのれらも花見虱に候よ
ro: onorera mo hanami-jirami [ni] sôrô yo
en:
you too
are viewing the blossoms...
lice!

jp: .痩虱花の御代にぞ逢にけり
ro: yase-jirami hana no miyo ni zo ai ni keri
en:
a skinny louse
born into the realm
of blossoms

jp: .鮎迄もわか盛也吉の川
ro: ayu made mo waka-zakari nari yoshino kawa
en:
the trout too
hit their peak young...
Yoshino River

jp: .逃るやら遊ぶやら鮎小鮎哉
ro: nigeru yara asobu yara ayu ko ayu kana
en:
a lot of fleeing
a lot of playing...
little trout

jp: .なの花をとらまへて立鼠哉
ro: na no hana wo toramaete tatsu nezumi kana
en:
seizing
the flowering rape...
mouse on tiptoe

jp: .菜の花にちんと蛙の居りけり
ro: na no hana ni chon to kawazu no suwari keri
en:
on the flowering rape
plop! sits
the frog

jp: .菜の花や鼠と遊ぶむら雀
ro: na no hana ya nezumi to asobu mura suzume
en:
flowering rape--
the sparrows play
with the mouse

jp: .菜の花やふはと鼠のとまりけり
ro: na no hana ya fuwa to nezumi no tomari keri
en:
flowering rape--
a soft seat
for the mouse

jp: .我庵は菜種の花の台哉
ro: waga io [wa] na tane no hana no utena kana
en:
my hut--
atop the stems
of flowering rape

jp: .仰のけに寝てしゃぶりけり藤の花
ro: aonoke ni nete shaburi keri fuji [no] hana
en:
lying on her back
sucking on the dangling
wisteria

jp: .菜所や御休所藤の花
ro: na-dokoro ya o-yasumi-dokoro fuji no hana
en:
land of vegetables--
a teahouse with blooming
wisteria

jp: .藤棚を潜れば王子海道哉
ro: fuji-dana wo kugureba ôji kaido kana
en:
creeping through
wisteria trellises...
Oji Highway

jp: .藤棚の隅から見ゆるお江戸哉
ro: fuji tana no sumi kara miyuru o-edo kana
en:
from a wisteria trellis
nook I see...
great Edo

jp: .藤の花南無ああああとそよぎけり
ro: fuji no hana namu aa aa to soyogi keri
en:
wisteria blossoms
"Praise Ah... Ah...!"
they rustle

jp: .門の梅不承不承に咲にけり
ro: kado no ume fushô fushô ni saki ni keri
en:
the plum tree at my gate
though reluctantly
has bloomed!

jp: .紅梅にほしておく也洗ひ猫
ro: kôbai ni hoshite oku nari aria neko
en:
among red plum blossoms
drying from its bath
a cat

jp: .膳先へ月のさしけり梅の花
ro: zen saki e tsuki no sashi keri ume [no] hana
en:
the moon shines
before the dinner tray...
plum blossoms

jp: .楽々と梅の伸たる田舎哉
ro: raku-raku to ume no nobitaru inaka kana
en:
peacefully
the plum blossoms spread...
countryside

jp: .我梅も仕様事なしに咲にけり
ro: waga ume mo shiyôgoto nashi ni saki ni keri
en:
even my plum tree
in its own sweet time
has bloomed!

jp: .送られし狼鳴や花の雲
ro: okurareshi ôkami naku ya hana no kumo
en:
the wolf that followed me
howls...
clouds of blossoms

jp: .日々の屎だらけ也花の山
ro: nichi-nichi no kuso darake nari hana no yama
en:
day after day
more and more poop...
blossoming mountain

jp: .花さくや下手念仏も銭が降る
ro: hana saku ya heta nembutsu mo zeni ga furu
en:
cherry blossoms--
even for a poor "Praise Buddha!"
a shower of coins

jp: .花さくや弥陀成仏の此かたは
ro: hana saku ya mida jôbutsu no kono kata wa
en:
cherry blossoms--
since the day
Amida became Buddha

jp: .花ちるや一開帳の集め銭
ro: hana chiru [ya] hito kaichô no atsume zeni
en:
scaterring blossoms--
money is collected
Buddha on display

jp: .閻魔王も目をむき出して桜哉
ro: emma-ô mo me wo mukidashite sakura kana
en:
even popeyed Emma
hell's king, gawks...
cherry blossoms!

jp: .親ありて笠にさしたるさくら哉
ro: oya arite kasa ni sashitaru sakura kana
en:
parents stick them
in their umbrella-hats...
cherry blossoms

jp: .門桜はらりはらりとかきま哉
ro: kado sakura harari-harari to kakima kana
en:
my gate's cherry tree
flits and flutters...
hole in the fence

jp: .散花の桜きげんや小犬ども
ro: chiru hana no sakura kigen ya ko inu domo
en:
relishing the falling
cherry blossoms...
puppies

jp: .日本は這入口からさくらかな
ro: nippon wa hairiguchi kara sakura kana
en:
from Japan's
front door on...
cherry blossoms!

jp: .湯も浴て仏おがんで桜かな
ro: yu mo abite hotoke ogande sakura kana
en:
a hot bath
a prayer
then cherry blossoms!

jp: .よしの山変桜もなかりけり
ro: yoshino yama kawari sakura mo nakari keri
en:
Yoshino Hill--
not a single cherry blossom
with a flaw

jp: .留主寺にせい出してさく桜哉
ro: rusu tera ni seidashite saku sakura kana
en:
vacant temple--
cherry trees blooming
industriously

jp: .蛇に成るけいこにくねる柳かな
ro: hebi ni naru keiko ni kuneru yanagi kana
en:
becoming snakes
practicing their wriggle...
branches of willow

jp: .今に知れ夜が短いという男
ro: ima ni shire yo ga mijika[i] to iu otoko
en:
he'll soon find out--
he who says
"Nights are short!"

jp: .短夜を公家で埋たる御山哉
ro: mijika yo wo kuge de umetaru o-yama kana
en:
the short summer night
filled with courtiers...
mountain

jp: .短夜のなんのと叱る榎哉
ro: mijika yo no nanno to shikaru enoki kana
en:
"What a short summer night!"
the nettle tree
scolds

jp: .短夜や樹下石上の御僧達
ro: mijika yo ya jukasekijô no o-sôtachi
en:
short summer night--
under a tree, on a stone
priests

jp: .わるびれな野に伏とても短夜ぞ
ro: warubire na no ni fusu totemo mijika yo zo
en:
fear not!
if you sleep in the field
night is short

jp: .暑き夜をにらみ合たり鬼瓦
ro: atsuki yo [wo] nirami aitari onigawara
en:
scowling
at the hot night...
gargoyle

jp: .竹縁の鳩に踏るるあつさ哉
ro: take en no hato ni fumaruru atsusa kana
en:
a pigeon pacing
at the edge of bamboo...
the heat

jp: .蕗の葉にぽんと穴明く暑哉
ro: fuki no ha ni ponto ana aku atsusa kana
en:
a butterbur leaf
pops open a hole...
the heat

jp: .涼風に欠序の湯治哉
ro: suzukaze ni akubi tsuide no tôji kana
en:
cool breeze--
he yawns in the hot
healing bath

jp: .涼風の曲りくねって来たりけり
ro: suzukaze no magarikunette kitari keri
en:
the cool breeze
meandering
arrives

jp: .涼風も隣の松のあまり哉
ro: suzukaze mo tonari no matsu no amari kana
en:
the cool breeze
through my neighbor's pine
just a remnant

jp: .涼風は雲のはづれの小村かな
ro: suzukaze wa kumo no hazure no ko mura kana
en:
cool breeze--
on the cloud's outskirts
a little village

jp: .涼しいといふ夜も今少し哉
ro: suzushii to iu yoru mo ima sukoshi kana
en:
the so-called
"cool evenings" of summer...
soon to be over

jp: .涼しさやお汁の中も不二の山
ro: suzushisa ya o-shiru no naka mo fuji no yama
en:
cool air--
even in my soup
Mount Fuji!

jp: .涼しさや大大名を御門番
ro: suzushisa ya ôdaimyô wo o-monban
en:
cool air--
for the great lord's
gatekeeper

jp: .涼しさや湯けぶりそよぐ田がそよぐ
ro: suzushisa ya yu keburi soyogu ta ga soyogu
en:
cool air--
bath steam and rice field
stirring

jp: .涼しやな弥陀成仏の此かたは
ro: suzushi ya na mida jôbutsu no kono kata wa
en:
this cool air comes
from Amida Buddha's
direction!

jp: .夕涼や草臥に出る上野山
ro: yûsuzu ya kutabire ni deru ueno yama
en:
evening cool--
visiting Ueno Hill
wears me out

jp: .足ばやの逃夕立よ夕立よ
ro: ashibaya no nige yûdachi yo yûdachi yo
en:
swift-footed it flees--
cloudburst!
cloudburst!

jp: .お汁桶一夕立は過にけり
ro: o-jiru oke hito yûdachi wa sugi ni keri
en:
soup bucket--
the summer cloudburst
has passed

jp: .夕立を鐘の下から見たりけり
ro: yûdachi wo kane no shita kara mitari keri
en:
watching the downpour
under a temple
bell

jp: .白雨がせんだくしたる古屋哉
ro: yûdachi ga sendaku shitaru furu ya kana
en:
the cloudburst
scrubs it clean...
the old house

jp: .夕立と加賀もぱっぱと飛にけり
ro: yûdachi to kaga mo pappa to tobi ne keri
en:
the cloudburst
and Lord Kaga
splishing, splashing!

jp: .夕立もむかひの山の贔負哉
ro: yûdachi mo mukai no yama no hiiki kana
en:
even the cloudburst
shows the facing mountain
favoritism

jp: .夕立や臼に二粒箕に三粒
ro: yûdachi ya usu ni ni tsubu mi ni mi tsubu
en:
rainstorm--
two drops for the rice cake tub
three drops for the winnow

jp: .我恋のつくば夕立夕立よ
ro: waga koi no tsukuba yûdachi yûdachi yo
en:
my lovemaking--
Mount Tsukuba's clouds
bursting!

jp: .青垣や蛙がはやす雲の峰
ro: ao kaki ya kawazu ga hayasu kumo no mine
en:
green hedge--
a frog cheers
the billowing clouds

jp: .けふも亦見せびらかすや雲の峰
ro: kyô mo mata misebirakasu ya kumo no mine
en:
today again
they're putting on a show...
billowing clouds

jp: .雲の峰行よ太鼓のなる方へ
ro: kumo no mine yuku yo taiko no naru hô e
en:
billowing clouds--
toward the big drums
bring your rain

jp: .ちょぼちょぼと小峰並べる小雲哉
ro: chobo-chobo to ko mine naraberu ko-gumo kana
en:
like little dots
little billows in a row...
little clouds

jp: .目道りへ並べ立たよ雲の峰
ro: medôri e narabe-tateta yo kumo no mine
en:
toward my line of sight
standing in a row...
cloud billows

jp: .青嵐吹くやずらりと植木売
ro: aoarashi fuku ya zurari to ueki uri
en:
wind on the greenery--
a row of shrubs
for sale

jp: .大の字にふんばたがりて清水哉
ro: dai no ji ni funbatagarite shimizue kana
en:
arms and legs spread wide
straddling
pure water

jp: .毒草の花の陰より清水哉
ro: dokusô no hana no kage yori shimizu kana
en:
from the shade
of the poison plant...
pure water

jp: .古郷や杖の穴からわく清水
ro: furusato ya tsue no ana kara waku shimizu
en:
my home village--
from my walking stick's hole
pure water gushes

jp: .君が田も我田も同じ青み哉
ro: kimi ga ta mo waga ta mo onaji aomi kana
en:
your rice field
my rice field
the same green

jp: .雀子がざくざく浴る甘茶哉
ro: suzumego ga zaku-zaku abiru amacha kana
en:
the baby sparrow
splish-splash bathes...
in Buddha's tea

jp: .神棚のつつじとそよぐ粽哉
ro: kami-dana no tsutsuji to soyogu chimaki kana
en:
on a little shrine
rustling with the azaleas...
rice dumplings

jp: .鶯の声の薬かけさの雨
ro: uguisu no koe no kusuri ka kesa no ame
en:
medicine
for the nightingale's voice?
this morning's rain

jp: .衣替て袂に入れる豆腐かな
ro: kinu kaete tamoto ni ireru tôfu kana
en:
in my new summer robe
tucked in the sleeve...
tofu

jp: .三介も菩薩気どりよ更衣
ro: sansuke mo bosatsu kidori yo koromogae
en:
even the servant
poses like a saint...
new summer robe

jp: .腹のへる工夫尽てや更衣
ro: hara no heru kufû tsukite ya koromogae
en:
growing weary
of the diet...
my new summer robe

jp: .としよれば犬も嗅ぬぞ初袷
ro: toshiyoreba inu mo kaganu zo hatsu awase
en:
growing old--
even a dog won't sniff
my summer kimono

jp: .初袷しなのへ嫁にござるげな
ro: hatsu awase shinano e yome ni gozaru-gena
en:
summer kimono--
a present for my bride
in Shinano

jp: .帷を雨が洗ってくれにけり
ro: katabira wo ame ga aratte kure ni keri
en:
summer kimono--
the rain kindly
washes it

jp: .翌は翌の風が吹とやひとり蚊屋
ro: asu wa asu no [kaze] ga fuku to ya hitori kaya
en:
tomorrow's wind
blows tomorrow...
in my mosquito net, alone

jp: .逢坂や荷牛の上に一昼寝
ro: ausaka ya ni ushi no ue ni hito hirune
en:
Osaka--
on the back of an ox
a siesta

jp: .闇がりにひらりひらりと扇哉
ro: kuragari ni hirari-hirari to ôgi kana
en:
in the darkness
swishing, swishing...
paper fan

jp: .づうづうと猫の寝ころぶ扇哉
ro: zû-zû to neko no ne-korobu ôgi kana
en:
softly snoring--
the cat curled up
on the fan

jp: .貰よりはやくおとした扇哉
ro: morau yori hayaku otoshita ôgi kana
en:
after getting it
it's dropped so soon...
paper fan

jp: .我庵やたばこを吹ておく蚊やり
ro: waga io ya tabako wo fuite oku ka yari
en:
at my hut
with tobacco, smoking out
the mosquitoes

jp: .虫干に猫もほされて居たりけり
ro: mushiboshi ni neko mo hosarete itari keri
en:
airing out the bedding
and
the cat

jp: .翌しらぬ盥の魚や夕涼
ro: asu shiranu tarai no uo ya yûsuzumi
en:
the fish in the tub
won't know tomorrow...
evening cool

jp: .魚どもは桶としらでや夕涼
ro: uo domo wa oke to shirade ya yûsuzumi
en:
the fish
unaware of the bucket...
a cool evening

jp: .神の木に御詫申して一涼
ro: kami no ki ni o-wabi mô[shi]te hito suzumi
en:
saying my apology
to the sacred tree...
a cool breeze

jp: .土べたにべたりべたりと夕涼
ro: tsuchi beta ni betari-betari yûsuzumi
en:
on the ground
we stick and sit...
evening cool

jp: .妻なしが草を咲かせて夕涼
ro: tsuma nashi [ga] kusa wo sakasete yûsuzumi
en:
a wifeless man
makes his plants bloom...
evening cool

jp: .屁くらべや夕顔棚の下涼み
ro: he kurabe ya yûgao-dana no shita suzumi
en:
a farting contest
under the moonflower trellis...
cool air

jp: .庖丁で鰻よりつつ夕すずみ
ro: hôchô de unagi yoritsutsu yûsuzumi
en:
with a kitchen knife
choosing eels...
a cool evening

jp: .松瘤で肩たたきつつ夕涼
ro: matsu kobu de kata tataki tsutsu yûsuzumi
en:
massaging my back
with the pine tree's gnarl...
evening cool

jp: .夜涼や足でかぞへるえちご山
ro: yo suzumi ya ashi de kazoeru echigo yama
en:
evening cool--
with my feet counting
Echigo mountains

jp: .夜涼みやにらみ合たる鬼瓦
ro: yo suzumi ya nirami autaru onigawara
en:
scowling
at the cool night...
gargoyle

jp: .おれが田も唄の序に植りけり
ro: ore ga ta mo uta no tsuide ni uwari keri
en:
my rice field too
song by song
is planted

jp: .田植歌どんな恨みも尽ぬべし
ro: taue uta donna urami mo tsukinubeshi
en:
rice-planting song--
let everyone's anger
be cured

jp: .薮陰やたった一人の田植唄
ro: yabu kage ya tatta hitori no taue uta
en:
in the thicket shade
all alone...
rice-planting song

jp: .八文で家内が祝ふ氷かな
ro: hachi mon de kanai ga iwau kôri kana
en:
for eight pennies
the whole family celebrates...
summer ice!

jp: .朝起が薬といふぞほととぎす
ro: asa oki ga kusuri to iu zo hototogisu
en:
early rising
is medicine, they say!
cuckoo

jp: .跡からも日光もどりや時鳥
ro: ato kara mo nikkô modori ya hototogisu
en:
also behind me
returning from Nikko Shrine...
a cuckoo

jp: .江戸入やおめずおくせず時鳥
ro: edo iri ya omezu-okusezu hototogisu
en:
entering Edo
without fear or qualm...
cuckoo!

jp: .宗鑑に又しかられな時鳥
ro: sôkan ni mata shikarare na hototogisu
en:
scolded by old Sokan
never again...
cuckoo

jp: .日光を鼻にかけてや時鳥
ro: nikko wo hana ni kakete ya hototogisu
en:
taking credit
for glorious Nikko...
cuckoo

jp: .日光の祭りはどうだ時鳥
ro: nikkô no matsuri wa dô da hototogisu
en:
how was the festival
up at Nikko...
cuckoo?

jp: .人丸の筆の先より時鳥
ro: hitomaro no fude no saki yori hototogisu
en:
from the tip
of Hitomaro's brush...
a cuckoo

jp: .貧乏雨とは云もののほととぎす
ro: bimbô ame to wa iu mono no hototogisu
en:
"That's a poor excuse
for rain!"
sings the cuckoo

jp: .蕗の葉をかぶって聞や時鳥
ro: fuki no ha wo kabutte kiku ya hototogisu
en:
a butterbur leaf
on his head, listen:
"cuckoo!"

jp: .時鳥馬をおどして通りけり
ro: hototogisu uma wo odoshite tôri keri
en:
the cuckoo hurls threats
at the horse
passing by

jp: .夜かせぎや八十島かけて時鳥
ro: yo kasegi ya yaso shima kakete hototogisu
en:
night work
on countless islands...
cuckoos

jp: .ろうそくでたばこ吸けり時鳥
ro: rôsoku de tabako sui keri hototogisu
en:
lighting my pipe
with a candle...
"cuckoo!"

jp: .柿崎やしぶしぶ鳴のかんこ鳥
ro: kakizaki ya shibu-shibu naki no kankodori
en:
Kakizaki--
with a stammering song
the mountain cuckoo

jp: .かんこ鳥鳴や蟇どのの弔いに
ro: kankodori naku ya hiki dono no tomurai ni
en:
the mountain cuckoo sings
at Mr. Toad's
funeral

jp: .下陰は蟻の地獄ぞかんこ鳥
ro: shita kage wa ari no jigoku zo kankodori
en:
down in the shadows
lurks the ant's hell...
mountain cuckoo

jp: .先住のつけわたり也かんこ鳥
ro: senjû no tsukewatari nari kankodori
en:
the house's former tenant
kindly left...
the mountain cuckoo!

jp: .草庵の虱でも喰へかんこ鳥
ro: sôan no shirami demo kue kankodori
en:
help yourself to the lice
in my thatched hut!
mountain cuckoo

jp: .守るかよお竹如来のかんこ鳥
ro: mamoruka yo otake nyorai no kankodori
en:
are you standing guard
like O-Take Buddha?
mountain cuckoo

jp: .我宿を守り給ふよかんこ鳥
ro: waga yado wo mamori tamau yo kankodori
en:
deigning to guard
my house...
the mountain cuckoo

jp: .舟引の足にからまる蛍哉
ro: funahiki no ashi ni karamaru hotaru kana
en:
swarming 'round
the boat-hauler's legs...
fireflies

jp: .筏士が飯にかけたる蛍かな
ro: ikadashi ga meshi ni kaketaru hotaru kana
en:
sprinkled on
the raftsman's rice...
fireflies

jp: .妹が子やくねた形りでよぶ忖
ro: imo ga ko ya jikuneta nari de yobu hotaru
en:
my child strikes
a sulky pose
calling fireflies

jp: .牛の背を掃おろしたる蛍哉
ro: ushi no se wo haki-orishitaru hotaru kana
en:
sweeping them off
the cow's back...
fireflies

jp: .狗も同じく出てよぶ蛍
ro: enokoro mo onajiku idete yobu hotaru
en:
the puppy comes out
and calls them too...
fireflies

jp: .来る蛍おれが庵とあなどるか
ro: kuru hotaru ore ga iori to anadoru ka
en:
my firefly guest
do you disdain
my hut?

jp: .小便の滝を見せうぞ来よ蛍
ro: shôben no taki wo mishô zo ko yo hotaru
en:
get ready to see
my piss waterfall...
come, firefly!

jp: .手の皺に蹴つまづいたる蛍かな
ro: te [no] shiwa ni ketsu mazuitaru hotaru kana
en:
tripping
on the wrinkles of my hand...
firefly

jp: .出よ蛍錠をおろすぞ出よ蛍
ro: deyo hotaru jô wo orosu zo deyo hotaru
en:
out! fireflies
I'm locking up...
out! fireflies

jp: .はつ蛍仏の膝へ逃げ入ぬ
ro: hatsu hotaru hotoke no hiza e nige irinu
en:
the first firefly
to Buddha's lap
has fled

jp: .懐を通り抜たる蛍かな
ro: futokoro wo tôri nuketaru hotaru kana
en:
visiting my chest
on its way...
firefly

jp: .古桶に稲葉そよぎてとぶ忖
ro: furu oke ni ine ha soyogite tobu hotaru
en:
in an old bucket
rice plants rustle
fireflies flit

jp: .蛍火や庵を横竪十文字
ro: hotarubi ya io wo yokotate jûmonji
en:
firefly's light--
flitting through my hut
forms a cross

jp: .蛍見の案内やするや庵の犬
ro: hotaru mi no anai ya suru ya io no inu
en:
guiding the way
to firefly-viewing...
the hut's dog

jp: .行く蛍尻見よ観音観音と
ro: yuku hotaru shiri mi yo kannon kannon to
en:
hey firefly
sneak a peek behind her!
Goddess Kannon

jp: .我宿に鼻つかへてや行蛍
ro: waga yado ni hana tsukaete ya yuku hotaru
en:
my home
a bit too cramped...
departing firefly

jp: .我宿や棚捜しして行蛍
ro: waga yado ya tana sagashi shite yuku hotaru
en:
my home--
surveying its flaws
a firefly

jp: .ぼうふりも御経の拍子とりにけり
ro: bôfuri mo okyô no hyôshi tori ni keri
en:
mosquito larvae too
keep the sutra's
rhythm

jp: .蝿打やあみだ如来の御天窓
ro: hae utsu ya amida nyorai no on-atama
en:
swatting a fly
on Buddha's holy
head

jp: .留主にするぞ恋して遊べ庵の蝿
ro: rusu ni suru zo koi shite asobe io no hae
en:
while I'm away
enjoy your lovemaking
hut's flies

jp: .門の蚤犬がまぶって走りけり
ro: kado no nomi inu ga mabutte hashiri keri
en:
after plastering
the gate with fleas
the dog runs off

jp: .猫の子が蚤すりつける榎かな
ro: neko no ko ga nomi suritsukeru enoki kana
en:
the kitten rubs
her fleas
on the nettle tree

jp: .うす赤い花から蝉の生れけり
ro: usuakai hana kara semi no umare keri
en:
from the pale red flower
a cicada
is born!

jp: .唖蝉それも中々安気かな
ro: ôshi-zemi sore mo naka-naka anki kana
en:
mute cicada--
he, too, perfectly
at peace

jp: .小坊主や袂の中の蝉の声
ro: ko bozû ya tamoto no naka no semi no koe
en:
little monk--
deep in his sleeve
singing, a cicada

jp: .ざんぶりと一雨浴て蝉の声
ro: zanburi to hito ame abite semi no koe
en:
drenched
by a rain shower
the cicada's voice

jp: .住吉やあひに相生の蝉の声
ro: sumiyoshi ya ai ni aioi no semi no koe
en:
Sumiyoshi--
growing up together
the cicadas sing

jp: .涼風やあひに相生の蝉の声
ro: suzukaze ya ai ni aioi no semi no koe
en:
cool breeze--
growing up together
the cicadas sing

jp: .蝉鳴て疫病にしたりけり
ro: semi naite hayariyamai ni shitari keri
en:
cicadas singing
it's a contagious
disease

jp: .蝉鳴や今伐倒ス松の木に
ro: semi naku ya ima kiritaosu matsu no ki ni
en:
a cicada chirrs--
in the soon-to-be cut
pine tree

jp: .蝉鳴やまゆが干るる干るると
ro: semi naku ya mayu ga hosaruru hosaruru to
en:
cicadas chirr--
cocoons are drying up
drying up

jp: .鳴蝉や袂の下をついととぶ
ro: naku semi ya tamoto no shita wo tsui to tobu
en:
a cicada chirrs--
then flies in a flash
up my sleeve

jp: .初蝉の目見へに鳴か如来堂
ro: hatsu semi no memie ni naku ka nyrai dô
en:
first cicada
are you singing for him?
Buddha's temple

jp: .松の蝉経聞ながら生れけり
ro: matsu no semi kyô kiki nagara umare keri
en:
cicada in the pine
listening to the sutra
is born

jp: .一っぱしの面魂やかたつむり
ro: ippashi no tsuradamashii ya katatsumuri
en:
a face
like everyone else's...
the snail

jp: .柴門や錠のかはりのかたつぶり
ro: shiba no to ya jô no kawari no katatsuburi
en:
the brushwood door's
substitute lock...
a snail

jp: .夕立がよろこばしいかかたつぶり
ro: yûdachi ga yorokobashii ka katatsuburi
en:
does the cloudburst
make you happy?
snail

jp: .涼風をはやせば蛭が降りにけり
ro: suzukaze wo hayaseba hiru ga furi ni keri
en:
while praising the cool breeze
leeches
dropped

jp: .今日の志いふけしの花
ro: konnichi no kokorozashi iu keshi no hana
en:
speaking
this day's deepest thoughts...
poppies

jp: .世の中よ針だらけでも蓮の花
ro: yo [no] naka yo hari darake demo hasu [no] hana
en:
this world
bristles with thorns...
yet there are lotuses

jp: .余苗馬さへ喰ず成にけり
ro: amari nae uma sae kuwazu nari ni keri
en:
leftover rice plants--
even the horse
won't gobble them

jp: .捨早苗馬も踏ずに通りけり
ro: sute sanae uma mo fumazu ni tôri keri
en:
leftover rice plants--
even the horse
won't trample them

jp: .我上にやがて咲らん苔の花
ro: waga ue ni yagate sakuran koke no hana
en:
over me
soon enough you'll bloom
moss blossoms

jp: .娑婆の風にはや筍の痩にけり
ro: shaba no kaze ni haya takenoko no yase ni keri
en:
in this world's wind
they thin out quick...
bamboo shoots

jp: .順々に大竹の子の曲りけり
ro: jun-jun [ni] ôtakenoko no magari keri
en:
one by one
the tall bamboo shoots
bending

jp: .筍の兄よ弟よついついと
ro: takenoko no ani yo ototo yo tsui-tsui to
en:
bamboo shoots--
big brothers, little brothers
swish, swish!

jp: .竹の子のうんぷてんぷの出所哉
ro: takenoko no unputenpu no dedoko kana
en:
blind luck--
bamboo shoots sprout
where they sprout

jp: .我庵や小川をかりて冷し瓜
ro: waga io ya kogawa wo karite hiyashi uri
en:
my hut--
a creek serves
as my melon cooler

jp: .堂守りが茶菓子売る也夏木立
ro: dômori ga chagashi uru nari natsu kodachi
en:
the temple guard
sells tea cakes...
grove of summer trees

jp: .突さした柳もぱっと茂り哉
ro: tsukisashita yanagi mo patto shigeri kana
en:
even on the grafted willow
so quick!
thick summer grasses

jp: .門脇や麦つくだけの木下闇
ro: kado waki ya mugi tsuku dake no ko shita yami
en:
no lazing at the gate
they husk barley...
deep tree shade

jp: .堂守が茶菓子売也木下闇
ro: dômori ga chagashi uru nari koshitayami
en:
the temple guard
sells tea cakes...
deep tree shade

jp: .卯の花を先かざしけり菩薩役
ro: u no hana wo mazu kazashi keri bosatsu yaku
en:
first, a deutzia blossom
for his hair...
temple actor

jp: .卯の花に活た雛見る御山哉
ro: u no hana ni ikita hina miru o-yama kana
en:
in deutzia blossoms
a hatchling peeks out...
mountain

jp: .石橋を足で尋ねる夜寒哉
ro: ishi-bashi wo ashi de tazuneru yozamu kana
en:
feeling for the stone bridge
with my feet...
a cold night

jp: .狼どのより漏どのが夜寒哉
ro: ôkami dono yori mori dono ga yozamu kana
en:
from Mr. Wolf
to Mr. Watchman...
night's cold

jp: .せつかれてむりに笛吹く夜寒哉
ro: setsukarete muri ni fue fuku yozamu kana
en:
I'm forced to play
the flute...
a cold night

jp: .次の間の灯で飯を喰ふ夜寒哉
ro: tsugi no ma no hi de meshi wo kuu yozamu kana
en:
by the next room's lamplight
eating my rice...
a cold night

jp: .ならはしや木曾の夜寒の膝頭
ro: narahashi ya kiso no yozamu no hizagashira
en:
old habit--
the cold nights of Kiso
on my knees

jp: .膝がしら山の夜寒に古びけり
ro: hizagashira yama no yozamu ni furubi keri
en:
my knees
this cold night in the mountains
feel older

jp: .笛吹くや已に夜寒が始ると
ro: fue fuku ya sude no yozamu ga hajimaru to
en:
a flute plays--
suddenly night's coldness
begins

jp: .豆煎を足で尋る夜寒哉
ro: mame iri wo ashi de tazuneru yozamu kana
en:
feeling for parched beans
with my feet...
a cold night

jp: .椋鳥といふ人さはぐ夜寒哉
ro: mukudori to iu hito sawagu yozamu kana
en:
those who call me "starling"
raise a ruckus...
a cold night

jp: .むだ人の遊かげんの夜寒哉
ro: muda hito no asobi kagen no yozamu kana
en:
vain mankind
feeling like carousing...
a cold night

jp: .餅腹をこなして歩く夜寒哉
ro: mochi hara wo konashite aruku yozamu kana
en:
walking off
a bellyful of rice cakes...
a cold night

jp: .我庵は尻から先へ夜寒哉
ro: waga io wa shiri kara saki e yozamu kana
en:
my hut--
moving from back to front
night's coldness

jp: .小猿めがきせる咥へて秋の暮
ro: ko saru me ga kiseru kuwaete aki no kure
en:
the little monkey
chews on a pipe...
autumn dusk

jp: .寝むしろやたばこ吹かける天の川
ro: nemushiro ya tabako fukakeru ama no kawa
en:
sleeping mat--
blowing pipe smoke
at the Milky Way

jp: .掃溜を山と見なして秋の月
ro: hakidame wo yama to minashite aki no tsuki
en:
consider this rubbish heap
a mountain...
autumn moon

jp: .むだ人を叱なさるや秋の月
ro: muda-bito wo shikari nasaru ya aki no tsuki
en:
scolding
vain man...
the autumn moon

jp: .壁穴に我名月の御出哉
ro: kabe ana ni waga meigetsu no oide kana
en:
hole in the wall--
my harvest moon
comes in

jp: .名月や西に向へばぜん光寺
ro: meigetsu ya nishi ni mukaeba zenkôji
en:
harvest moon
and looking west
Zenko Temple!

jp: .名月や松ない島も天窓数
ro: meigetsu ya matsu nai shima mo atama kazu
en:
harvest moon--
even islands without pines
add to the head-count

jp: .破壁や我が名月の今後座る
ro: yare kabe ya waga meigetsu no ima gozaru
en:
broken wall--
my harvest moon's
grand entrance

jp: .秋風が吹くにものらりくらり哉
ro: akikaze ga fuku ni mo norari kurari kana
en:
though the autumn wind blows--
still
lazy

jp: .秋風や我うしろにもうそり山
ro: akikaze ya waga ushiro ni mo usori yama
en:
autumn wind--
also behind me
Mount Usori

jp: .むだ人や花の都も秋の風
ro: muda hito ya hana no miyako mo aki no kaze
en:
vain mankind!
even in blossoming Kyoto
autumn wind

jp: .流さるる蚕の蝶を秋の風
ro: nagasaruru kaiko no chô wo aki no kaze
en:
setting the silkworm
moth adrift...
autumn wind

jp: .いびつでも露の白玉白玉ぞ
ro: ibitsu demo tsuyu no shiro tama shiro tama zo
en:
sloppy, yes
but the dewdrops are pearls!
pearls!

jp: .おく露や猫なで声の山烏
ro: oku tsuyu ya nekonadegoe no yama-garasu
en:
"Dewdrops here!"
the coaxing voice
of a mountain crow

jp: .白露のどっちへ人をよぶ烏
ro: shira tsuyu no dotchi e hito wo yobu karasu
en:
to which side
of the silver dew?
the crow's summons

jp: .玉になれ大玉になれけさの露
ro: tama ni nare ôtama ni nare kesa no tsuyu
en:
become pearls
great big pearls!
morning dew

jp: .稲妻やあっけとられし犬の顔
ro: inazuma ya akke torareshi inu no kao
en:
lightning flash--
the astonished face
of the dog

jp: .稲妻や一もくさんに善光寺
ro: inazuma ya ichimokusan ni zenkôji
en:
lightning flash--
running like hell
to Zenko Temple

jp: .我犬が蜻蛉返りの花の哉
ro: waga inu ga tombo kaeri no hana no kana
en:
my dog
turns a somersault...
field of flowers

jp: .瓜の馬くれろくれろと泣く子哉
ro: uri no uma kurero kurero to naku ko kana
en:
horse-shaped melon--
"Gimme! Gimme!" cries
the crying child

jp: .負た子が手でとどく也迎鐘
ro: ôta ko ga te de todoku nari mukae-gane
en:
the child on her back
reaches to touch...
bell for the ancestors

jp: .こおろぎのふいと乗けり茄子馬
ro: kôrogi no fui to nori keri nasubi uma
en:
a cricket rides
unsteadily...
horse-shaped eggplant

jp: .としとへば片手広げる棚経哉
ro: toshi toeba katate hirogeru tanagyô kana
en:
she tells her age
spreading five fingers...
memorial for the dead

jp: .なぐさみに打としりつつ迎鐘
ro: nagusami ni utsu to shiritsutsu mukae-gane
en:
realizing it's being hit
just for fun...
bell for the ancestors

jp: .雀らもせうばんしたり蓮の飯
ro: suzumera mo shôban shitari hasu no meshi
en:
even the sparrows
partake...
Bon Festival rice

jp: .蓮の葉に盛れば淋しきお飯哉
ro: hazu no ha ni moreba sabishiki o-meshi kana
en:
served on a lotus leaf
a lonely sight...
Bon Festival rice

jp: .送り火の明り先也角田川
ro: okuribi no akari saki nari sumida-gawa
en:
lit by a bonfire
for the dead...
Sumida River

jp: .夕月や涼がてらの墓参
