ro: yûzuki ya suzumi gatera no hakamairi
en:
evening moon--
in the cool air
visiting graves

jp: .おどる夜も盆もけふ翌ばかり哉
ro: odoru yo mo bon mo kyô asu bakari kana
en:
night of dancing
Bon Festival, just today
and tomorrow

jp: .星待や人は若くも思ふかと
ro: hoshi matsu ya hito wa wakaku mo omou ka to
en:
awaiting the stars--
does the grown man
feel young again?

jp: .嫁星の御顔をかくす榎哉
ro: yome-boshi no o-kao wo kakusu enoki kana
en:
veiling the face
of the Bride Star...
nettle tree

jp: .青ばしのちぐはぐなるも祭り哉
ro: ao-bashi no chiguhagu naru mo matsuri kana
en:
chopsticks of green
pampas grass, uneven...
festival

jp: .一日の名所也けりお花小屋
ro: ichi nichi no meisho nari keri obana-goya
en:
for one day
it's a famous resort...
pampas grass barn

jp: .猪も一夜は寝かせほや作り
ro: inoshishi mo hito ya wa nekase hoya tsukuri
en:
wild boar
spend a night!
thatched hunter's hut

jp: .お花から出現したかふじの山
ro: obana kara shutsugen shita ka fuji no yama
en:
from pampas grass
has it arisen?
Mount Fuji

jp: .きりぎりすほやを葺れて鳴にけり
ro: kirigirisu hoya [wo] fukarete naki ni keri
en:
building a hunter's hut--
in the thatch a katydid
sings

jp: .四角のは今様らしやほや作り
ro: yosumi no wa ima yôrashi ya hoya tsukuri
en:
looking trendy
with four corners...
thatched hunter's hut

jp: .しなの中皆すは山の夜露哉
ro: shinano chû mina suwa yama no yo tsuyu kana
en:
throughout Shinano
on every Mount Suwa...
evening dew

jp: .すすき箸見たばかりでも涼しいぞ
ro: susuki-bashi mita bakari demo suzushii zo
en:
just the sight
of pampas grass chopsticks...
cool air!

jp: .すは風にとんじゃくもなきすすき哉
ro: suwa kaze ni tonjaku mo naki susuki kana
en:
paying no heed
to Suwa Shrine's wind...
pampas grass

jp: .ちぐはぐのすすきの箸も祝哉
ro: chiguhagu no susuki no hashi mo iwai kana
en:
uneven chopsticks
of pampas grass too...
celebrate the festival

jp: .ちっぽけなほ屋から先にそよぐ也
ro: chippokena hoya kara saki ni soyogu nari
en:
from the tiny thatched
hunter's hut, first...
a rustling

jp: .はつお花招き出したよ不二の山
ro: hatsu obana maneki-dashita yo fuji no yama
en:
the first pampas grass
has called it forth...
Mount Fuji

jp: .花すずきほやと成っても招く也
ro: hana susuki hoya to natte mo maneku nari
en:
flowering pampas grass
even shaped as a hunter's hut...
is inviting

jp: .ほやつずきことさら不二のきげん哉
ro: hoya tsuzuki kotosara fuji no kigen kana
en:
with thatched hunter's huts
Mount Fuji
in a good mood

jp: .かまくらや犬にも一ッ御なん餅
ro: kamakura ya inu ni mo hitotsu o-nan mochi
en:
in Kamakura
one for the dog...
sacred rice cakes

jp: .苔衣わざと敲いて仕舞けり
ro: koke koromo waza to tataite shimai keri
en:
the monk's rough clothes
pounded
with a purpose

jp: .小夜砧妹が茶の子の大きさよ
ro: sayo-ginuta imo ga cha no ko no ôkisa yo
en:
night cloth-pounding--
my wife's tea cakes
are huge!

jp: .山住や僧都が打もさよ砧
ro: yamazuma ya sôto ga utsu mo sayo-ginuta
en:
life in the mountains--
even priests
pound cloth at night

jp: .草の戸も衣打石は持にけり
ro: kusa no to mo kinu utsu ishi wa mochi ni keri
en:
at my hut too
a stone for pounding
cloth

jp: .連のない雁よ来よ来よ宿かさん
ro: tsure no nai kari yo ko yo ko yo yado kasan
en:
wild goose without companions
come! come!
to shelter

jp: .はつ雁や畠の稲も五六尺
ro: hatsu kari ya hatake no ine mo go roku shaku
en:
autumn's first geese--
my rice field too
is five or six feet!

jp: .我が門に来て痩雁と成にけり
ro: waga kado ni kite yase kari to nari ni keri
en:
begging at my gate
the geese lose
weight

jp: .黒組よ青よ茶色よ虫の鳴
ro: kurogumi yo ao yo chairo yo mushi no naku
en:
the black, the green,
the brown...
insect chorus

jp: .虫鳴くやとぶやてんでん我々に
ro: mushi naku ya tobu ya tenden ware-ware ni
en:
insects sing, fly
here and there...
"just for us"

jp: .日ぐらしやついつい星の出やうに
ro: higurashi ya tsui-tsui hoshi no deru yô ni
en:
a cicada chirrs--
there! and there!
stars appear

jp: .大犬の天窓張たる蜻蛉哉
ro: ôinu no atama haritaru tombo kana
en:
resting
on the big dog's head
dragonfly

jp: .こおろぎの寝所にしたる馬ふん哉
ro: kôrogi no nedoko ni shitaru bafun kana
en:
the cricket
makes his bedroom...
horse dung

jp: .きりぎりすまんまと籠を出たりけり
ro: kirigirisu manma to kago wo detari keri
en:
the katydid
has given his cage
the slip

jp: .小むしろや粟の山よりきりぎりす
ro: samushiro [ya] awa no yama yori kirigirisu
en:
little straw mat--
on the mountain of millet
katydid

jp: .柴の戸や渋茶色なるきりぎりす
ro: shiba no to ya shibucha iro naru kirigirisu
en:
my humble hut--
it's turned tea-brown
the katydid

jp: .蟷螂が片手かけたりつり鐘に
ro: tôrô ga katate kaketari tsurigane ni
en:
the praying mantis
hangs by one hand...
temple bell

jp: .あはう草花も苦はなかりけり
ro: ahô kusabana mo nigami wa nakari keri
en:
foolish wildflower
without a trace
of bitterness

jp: .門口や折角咲た草の花
ro: kado-guchi ya sekkaku saita kusa no hana
en:
in the gateway
it struggled but bloomed...
wildflower

jp: .我菊や形にもふりにもかまはずに
ro: waga kiku ya nari ni mo furi ni mo kamawazu ni
en:
my chrysanthemum
doesn't care about looks
or style

jp: .朝顔の花に顔出す鼠かな
ro: asagao no hana ni kao dasu nezumi kana
en:
in the morning-glories
peeking out...
mouse

jp: .寝むしろやたばこ吹かける女郎花
ro: nemushiro ya tabako fukakeru ominaeshi
en:
sleeping mat--
pipe smoke wafts over
the maiden flowers

jp: .古郷や貧乏馴れし女郎花
ro: furusato ya bimbô nareshi ominaeshi
en:
in my home village
they're used to poverty...
maiden flowers

jp: .萩咲や子にかくれたる鹿の顔
ro: hagi saku ya ko ni kakuretaru shika no kao
en:
blooming bush clover--
hiding from the child
a deer's face

jp: .一雨を招き当たるすすき哉
ro: hito ame wo mane[ki] atetaru susuki kana
en:
beckoning
the rain shower to strike...
pampas grass

jp: .さをしかの尻にべったり紅葉哉
ro: saoshika no shiri ni bettari momiji kana
en:
sticking to
the young buck's butt...
red leaves

jp: .柿の葉や仏の色に成るとちる
ro: kaki no ha ya hotoke no iro ni naru to chiru
en:
persimmon leaves
turn Buddha-colored...
then fall

jp: .我国や薮の仏も綿初穂
ro: waga kuni ya yabu no hotoke mo wata hatsu ho
en:
my province--
for the Buddha of the thicket
first cotton boll

jp: .我門の猫打栗よ打栗よ
ro: waga kado no neko uchi-guri yo uchi-guri yo
en:
at my gate the cat
batting chestnuts!
chestnuts!

jp: .十月の中の十日の寝坊哉
ro: jûgatsu no naka no tôka no nebô kana
en:
first winter month
tenth day...
sleeping late

jp: .十月やうらからおがむ浅草寺
ro: jûgatsu ya ura kara ogamu sensôji
en:
first winter month--
from behind Senso Temple
I pray

jp: .冬の夜を真丸に寝る小隅哉
ro: fuyu no yo wo manmaru ni neru kosumi kana
en:
sleeping in a ball
on a winter's night...
my little nook

jp: .うら口や曲げ小便もはつ氷
ro: uraguchi ya mage shôben mo hatsu kôri
en:
back door--
pissing scribbles
in the first ice

jp: .福鼠渡り返せやはつ氷
ro: fuku nezumi watari kaese ya hatsu kôri
en:
the lucky mouse
crosses then goes back...
first ice

jp: .鶯の寝所見ゆる冬の月
ro: uguisu no nedoko miyuru fuyu no tsuki
en:
the nightingale's sleeping place
revealed...
winter moon

jp: .おんひらひら金比羅声よ冬の月
ro: on-hira-hira konpira koe yo fuyu no tsuki
en:
the god Kompira's
fluttering voice...
winter moon

jp: .老人の下駄も鳴りけり冬の月
ro: rôjin no geta mo nari keri fuyu no tsuki
en:
an old man's
clogs clacking too...
winter moon

jp: .寒月や雁も金毘羅祈る声
ro: kangetsu ya kari mo konpira inoru koe
en:
cold moon--
the wild geese also pray
to Kompira

jp: .酒飯のぽっぽとけぶるはつ時雨
ro: sakameshi no poppo to keburu hatsu shigure
en:
my tea-boiled rice
puffing steam...
first winter rain

jp: .陶の杉の葉そよぐはつ時雨
ro: suemono no sugi no ha soyogu hatsu shigure
en:
the leaves of the
porcelain cedar tremble...
first winter rain

jp: .犬ころが土産をねだる夕時雨
ro: inu koro ga miyage wo nedaru yûshigure
en:
the puppy begs
for a present...
evening's winter rain

jp: .木つつきも骨折損や夕時雨
ro: kitsutsuki mo honeorizon ya yû shigure
en:
the woodpecker's effort
is wasted...
a night of winter rain

jp: .鶏頭の身に引受る時雨哉
ro: keitô no mi ni hiki-ukeru shigure kana
en:
making the blooming
cockscomb droop...
winter rain

jp: .しぐるるや在鎌倉雁かもめ
ro: shigururu ya imasu kamakura kari kamome
en:
winter rain falls
on Kamakura's residents...
geeses, gulls

jp: .しぐれ込角から二軒目の庵
ro: shigure kome kado kara ni ken me no io
en:
come in, winter rain--
from the corner two doors down
my hut

jp: .うづの山木枯し呑んで向ひけり
ro: uzu no yama kogarashi nonde mukai keri
en:
Mount Uzu
facing the winter wind
drinks it in

jp: .木がらしや鉄砲かつぎて小脇差
ro: kogarashi ya teppô katsugite ko wakizashi
en:
winter wind--
he shoulders a musket
and a short sword

jp: .土団子けふも木がらし木がらしぞ
ro: tsuchi dango kyô mo kogarashi kogarashi zo
en:
mud-dumplings--
today too, winter wind!
winter wind!

jp: .身一ッにあらし木がらしあられ哉
ro: mi hitotsu ni arashi kogarashi arare kana
en:
just for me
a storm, winter wind
and hail

jp: .やせ脛やあらし木枯らし三ケの月
ro: yase-zune ya arashi kogarashi mike no tsuki
en:
these thin legs--
winter storm winds
a sickle moon

jp: .うら町は犬の後架もはつ雪ぞ
ro: uramachi wa inu no kôka mo hatsu yuki zo
en:
the backstreet
is the dog's toilet
first snowfall

jp: .初物ぞうすっぺらでおれが雪
ro: hatsumono zo usuppera demo ore ga yuki
en:
first one of the year
thin as can be...
my snow

jp: .はつ雪と呼る小便序哉
ro: hatsu yuki to yobawaru shôben tsuide kana
en:
"First snowfall!"
he shouts in the middle
of pissing

jp: .三弦で雪を降らする二階哉
ro: samisen de yuki wo furasuru ni kai kana
en:
with her samisen
she makes snow fall...
second floor

jp: .でも花の都で候か汚れ雪
ro: demo hana no miyako de soro ka kegare yuki
en:
blossoming Kyoto
is it?
dirty snow

jp: .明神にほうり出された霰哉
ro: myôjin ni hôridasareta arare kana
en:
let loose
by some god above...
hailstones

jp: .はつ霜の草へもちょいと御酒哉
ro: hatsu shimo no kusa e mo choi to o-sake kana
en:
first frost on the grass
gets a dash...
sacred sake

jp: .はつ霜や女の声のあびらうん
ro: hatsu shimo ya onna no koe mo abiraun
en:
first frost--
a woman's voice
recites a prayer

jp: .はつ霜や並ぶ花売鉦たたき
ro: hatsu shimo ya narabu hanauri kane tataki
en:
first frost--
flower sellers in a row
hitting their bells

jp: .初霜や笑顔見世たる茶の聖
ro: hatsu shimo ya egao misetaru cha no hijiri
en:
first frost--
the smiling face
of the tea master

jp: .霜おくと呼る小便序哉
ro: shimo oku to yobawaru shôben tsuide kana
en:
"Frost has formed!"
he yells
then pisses

jp: .大数珠を首にかけたるかれの哉
ro: ôjuzu wo kubi ni kaketaru kareno kana
en:
a big rosary
'round his neck...
withered fields

jp: .枯のはら俵かぶって走りけり
ro: kareno hara tawara kabu[t]te hashiri keri
en:
withered fields--
with rice bag on her head
she runs

jp: .鳶ひょろひひょろ神の御立げな
ro: tobi hyoro-hyooro kami no o-tachigena
en:
black kites reeling
reeling in the sky...
the gods depart

jp: .朝の月夷の飯にかくれけり
ro: asa no tsuki ebisu no meshi ni kakure keri
en:
morning moon--
the God of Wealth's food pile
hides it

jp: .夷講出入の鳩も並びけり
ro: ebisu kô deiri no hato mo narabi keri
en:
God of Wealth Festival--
also going in, going out
rows of pigeons

jp: .本町や夷の飯の横がすみ
ro: honchô ya ebisu no meshi no yoko-gasumi
en:
Old Quarter--
food for the God of Wealth
in mist

jp: .宵闇やあんな藪にも里神楽
ro: yoi yama ya anna yabu ni mo sato kagura
en:
darkening dusk--
even in yonder thicket
a Shinto dance

jp: .夜神楽や焚火の中へちる紅葉
ro: yokagura ya takibi no naka e chiru momiji
en:
Shinto dance at night--
red leaves fall
into the bonfires

jp: .我家に来よ来よ下手なはち敲
ro: waga ie ni ko yo ko yo hetana hachi tataki
en:
come! come!
to my house, you off-beat
bowl-beater

jp: .口切やはやして通る天つ雁
ro: kuchikiri ya hayashite tôru amatsu kari
en:
I unseal the new tea
celestial geese
hurry on

jp: .時雨せよ茶壷の口を今切ぞ
ro: shigurese yo chatsubo no kuchi wo ima kiru zo
en:
winter rain--
time to unseal
the new tea!

jp: .なむ芭蕉先綿子にはありつきぬ
ro: namu bashô mazu watago ni wa aritsukinu
en:
praise Basho!
I've found my padded
cotton vest

jp: .赤づきん垢入道の呼れけり
ro: aka zukin aka nyûdô no yobare keri
en:
"A dirty priest
in a red skullcap"...
I'm called

jp: .屁くらべが已に始る衾かな
ro: he kurabe ga sude ni hajimaru fusuma kana
en:
the farting contest
begins at once...
winter quilt

jp: .はいかいを守らせ給へ雪仏
ro: haikai wo mamorase tamae yuki-botoke
en:
guard the haiku
I beseech you!
snow Buddha

jp: .はつ雪をおっつくねても仏哉
ro: hatsu yuki wo o[t]tsukunete mo hotoke kana
en:
first snow--
even a lump of it
is Buddha

jp: .雪仏我手の跡もなつかしや
ro: yuki-botoke waga te no ato mo natsukashi ya
en:
snow Buddha--
my handprint too
is something to cherish

jp: .寄合って雀がはやす雪仏
ro: yo[ri]atte suzume ga hayasu yuki-botoke
en:
sparrows gather
and cheer...
my snow Buddha

jp: .はつ降りや雪も仏に成にけり
ro: hatsu furi ya yuki mo hotoke ni nari ni keri
en:
first snowfall--
it too
becomes Buddha

jp: .おかしいと犬やふりむく雪礫
ro: okashii to inu ya furimuku yukitsubute
en:
funny
the dog turns 'round...
snowball!

jp: .本町の火鉢の上の夜明哉
ro: honchô no hibachi no ue no yoake kana
en:
above the hibachis
of the Old Quarter
day breaks

jp: .朝夷も一ッ笑へおこり炭
ro: asaebisu mo hitotsu warae okori-zumi
en:
another early morning
laugh!
my charcoal fire

jp: .炭もけふ俵焚く夜と成にけり
ro: sumi mo kyô tawara taku yo to nari ni keri
en:
even the bag
the charcoal came in
burned tonight!

jp: .炭竈のけぶりに陰るせうじ哉
ro: sumigama no keburi ni kageru shôji kana
en:
darkened by smoke
from the charcoal kiln...
paper door

jp: .炭竈も必ず隣ありにけり
ro: sumigama mo kanarazu tonari ari ni keri
en:
even the charcoal kiln
invariably
has neighbors

jp: .真直ぐは仏五兵衛がすみがまよ
ro: massugu [wa] hotoke gohei ga sumigama yo
en:
straight up--
the smoke of Holy Gohei's
charcoal kiln

jp: .ほたぽきりぽきりなむあみだ仏哉
ro: hota pokiri-pokiri namu amida butsu kana
en:
snap and crackle
goes the fire...
"All praise to Amida Buddha!"

jp: .茶の花に鶯の子のけいこ哉
ro: cha no hana ni uguisu no ko no keiko kana
en:
in tea blossoms
the nightingale's child's
singing lessons

jp: .けぶたくも庵を放れな鳴千鳥
ro: kebutaku mo io wo hanare na naku chidori
en:
though it's smoky
don't leave my hut!
singing plover

jp: .笹の家をふみつぶしたる千鳥哉
ro: sasa no ya wo fumi-tsubushitaru chidori kana
en:
trampling my roof thatch
to pieces...
plovers!

jp: .さよ千鳥としより声はなかりけり
ro: sayo chidori toshiyori-goe wa nakari keri
en:
plovers on a winter night--
not an old voice
among them

jp: .しゃがれ声の千鳥よ仲間はづされな
ro: shagare koe no chidori [yo] nakama hazure na
en:
hoarse-voiced plover
get in tune
with the others!

jp: .とろとろと尻やけ千鳥又どこへ
ro: toro-toro to shiriyake chidori mata doko e
en:
slowly, slowly
plover with burnt tail feathers
where to now?

jp: .鳴下手も須磨の千鳥千鳥ぞよ
ro: naki-beta mo suma no chidori chidori zo yo
en:
though out of tune
they're Suma Beach's plovers!
plovers!

jp: .吉原も壁一重也さよちどり
ro: yoshiwara mo kabe hitoe nari sayo chidori
en:
even in Yoshiwara
in a one-ply wall
plovers in the night

jp: .誰やらに似たるぞ鰒のふくれ顔
ro: dare yara ni nitaru zo fugu no fukure-gao
en:
he looks like someone
I know! pufferfish's
bloated face

jp: .鶏頭が立往生をしたりけり
ro: keitô ga tachi ôjô wo shitari keri
en:
the blooming cockscomb
dies
standing up

jp: .赤菊の赤恥かくな又時雨
ro: aka-giku no akahaji kaku na mata shigure
en:
no shame for you
red chrysanthemum!
another winter rain

jp: .金の出た菊も同じく枯にけり
ro: kane no deta kiku [mo] onajiku kare ni keri
en:
for the money-making
chrysanthemum, too...
the same withering

jp: .枯菊に傍若無人の雀哉
ro: kare-giku ni bôjaku bujin no suzume kana
en:
among the withered
chrysanthemums...
brazen sparrows

jp: .木々の葉や菊のみじめに咲にけり
ro: kigi no ha ya kiku no mijime ni saki ni keri
en:
fallen leaves--
a chrysanthemum blooms
wretchedly

jp: .薮原や何の因果で残る菊
ro: yabu hara ya nanno inga de nokoru kiku
en:
grassy thicket--
what karma lets
the chrysanthemum survive?

jp: .恋人をかくしたすすきかれにけり
ro: koibito wo kakushita susuki kare ni keri
en:
the pampas grass
that hides the lovers...
withers

jp: .風のおち葉ちょいちょい猫が押へけり
ro: kaze no ochiba choi-choi neko [ga] osae keri
en:
windblown leaves
good job, cat!
pushing them

jp: .焚くほどは風がくれたるおち葉哉
ro: ta[ku] hodo wa kaze ga kuretaru ochiba kana
en:
the wind has brought
enough to build a fire...
fallen leaves

jp: .猫の子がちょいと押へるおち葉哉
ro: neko no ko ga choi to osaeru ochiba kana
en:
the kitten catches one
for a second...
fallen leaves

jp: .こんな身も拾ふ神ありて花の春
ro: konna mi mo hirou kami arite hana [no] haru
en:
even for me
there's a guardian god!
blossoming spring

jp: .ちりの身のふはりふはりも花の春
ro: chiri no mi no fuwari-fuwari mo hana no haru
en:
this body of dust
softly, softly...
blossoming spring

jp: .何なくと生れた家ぞ花の春
ro: nan-naku to umateta ie zo hana no haru
en:
at my house
born with ease...
spring blossoms

jp: .小かざりや焼るる夜にはやさるる
ro: ko kazari ya yakeruru yo ni hayasaruru
en:
New Year's decorations--
the night I burn them
I cheer

jp: .御祝儀に雪も降也どんどやき
ro: o-shûgi ni yuki mo furu nari dondo yaki
en:
snow falls
on the celebration...
New Year's bonfire

jp: .下手もへはおれがかざりぞかざりぞよ
ro: heta moe wa ore ga kazari zo kazari zo yo
en:
they make a pitiful fire...
my New Year's
decorations

jp: .姫小松祝儀ばかりに日が伸る
ro: hime ko matsu shûgi bakari ni hi ga nobiru
en:
for the celebration
of little pines
the day stretches longer

jp: .背中から猿が引也凧の糸
ro: se[naka] kara saru ga hiku nari tako no ito
en:
tied to the monkey's
back...
string of the kite

jp: .大名の凧も悪口言れけり
ro: daimyô no tako mo warukuchi iware keri
en:
even the kite
of the provincial lord
is bad-mouthed

jp: .凧上げてゆるりとしたる小村哉
ro: tako agete yururi to shitaru komura kana
en:
a kite rises
slow and easy...
a little village

jp: .凧抱たなりですやすや寝たりけり
ro: tako daita nari de suya-suya netari keri
en:
hugging her kite
she sleeps
deep and calm

jp: .一ところに御代の大凧小凧哉
ro: hito[ko]ro ni miyo no ôtako ko tako kana
en:
in one sky--
grand imperial kites
and little kites

jp: .反古凧や隣は前田加賀守
ro: hogo-dako ya tonari wa maeda kaga no kami
en:
a wastepaper kite
next to that of Maeda
Lord Kaga!

jp: .門前の凧とり榎千代もへん
ro: kado mae no tako tori enoki chiyo mo hen
en:
before the gate
the kite-snagging nettle tree...
a thousand ages old!

jp: .舞猿も草臥顔はせざりけり
ro: mai-zaru mo kutabire-gao wa sezari keri
en:
dancing monkey--
its face also
isn't weary

jp: .我国は猿も烏帽子をかぶりけり
ro: waga kuni wa saru mo eboshi wo kaburi keri
en:
in my province
even trained monkeys
wear noble hats

jp: .我国は猿も祈とうをしたりけり
ro: waga kuni wa saru mo kitô wo shitari keri
en:
in my province
even trained monkeys
offer prayers!

jp: .春駒の歌でとかすや門の雪
ro: haru koma no uta de tokasu ya kado no yuki
en:
melting to the tune
of the New Year's singer...
snow at the gate

jp: .有がたや用ない家も日が長い
ro: arigata ya yô nai ie mo hi ga nagai
en:
the way things are--
in my do-nothing house
the day is long

jp: .老の身は日の永いにも涙かな
ro: oi no mi wa hi no nagai ni mo namida kana
en:
growing old--
even the long day
brings tears

jp: .長き日の壁に書たる目鼻哉
ro: nagaki hi no kabe ni kaitaru mehana kana
en:
in the long day
scribbling on a wall...
eyes, nose

jp: .永の日の杖の先なる火縄哉
ro: naga no hi no tsue no saki naru hinawa kana
en:
in the long day
at my cane's tip...
a fuse cord

jp: .日が長い長いとむだな此世哉
ro: hi ga nagai nagai to mudana kono yo kana
en:
the day is long!
long! in this vain
world today

jp: .むだな身に勿体なさの日永哉
ro: mudana mi ni mottainasa no hi naga kana
en:
in this vain life
a sheer waste...
the long day

jp: .山守の箒の先を行春ぞ
ro: yamamori no hôki no saki wo yuku haru zo
en:
from the end
of the forest ranger's broom...
spring departs

jp: .今敷た鋸屑を春の雪
ro: ima shiita nokogirikuzu wo haru no yuki
en:
over the just-spread
sawdust...
spring snow

jp: .春の雪あら菰敷て降らせけり
ro: haru [no] yuki ara komo shiite furase keri
en:
spring snow--
on fresh-laid reeds
it falls

jp: .春の雪扇かざさぬ人もなし
ro: haru no yuki ôgi kazasanu hito mo nashi
en:
spring snow--
not a single face
without a fan

jp: .鋤鍬を先拝む也春の雨
ro: suki kuwa wo mazu ogamu nari haru no ame
en:
the first blessing
for plow and hoe...
spring rain

jp: .猫洗ふざぶざぶ川や春の雨
ro: neko arau zabu-zabu kawa ya haru no ame
en:
splish-splash
the cat washes in the river...
spring rain

jp: .春雨や欠をうつる門の犬
ro: harusame ya akubi wo utsuru kado no inu
en:
spring rain--
he catches my yawn
dog at the gate

jp: .春風や袂にすれる亦打山
ro: haru kaze ya tamoto ni sureru matchi yama
en:
spring breeze--
her sleeves rustle over
Mount Matchi

jp: .春風や筆のころげる草の原
ro: haru kaze ya fude no korogeru kusa no haru
en:
spring wind--
the writing brush rolls away
in the field

jp: .泥坊や其身そのまま朧月
ro: dorobô ya sono mi sono mama oboro-zuki
en:
the thief
is just as he is...
hazy moon

jp: .寺の茶の二番鳴子や朝霞
ro: tera no cha no ni ban naruko ya asa-gasumi
en:
the temple teatime's
second call of the clapper...
morning mist

jp: .陽炎にまぎれ込だる伏家哉
ro: kagerô ni magire kondaru fuseya kana
en:
vanishing
in the heat shimmers...
my humble hut

jp: .陽炎や大の字形に残る雪
ro: kagerô ya dai no ji nari ni nokoru yuki
en:
heat shimmers--
shaped like a cross
the leftover snow

jp: .わかい衆よ雪とかしても遊ぶのか
ro: wakai shu yo yuki tokashite mo asobu no ka
en:
young folk--
even melting snow
is fun, no?

jp: .苗代や親子して見る宵の雨
ro: nawashiro ya oyako shite miru yoi no ame
en:
rice seedlings--
a little family watches
the evening rain

jp: .むらのない苗代とてもなかりけり
ro: mura no nai nawashiro totemo nakari keri
en:
rice-seedling beds
with no unevenness...
can't be found

jp: .草餅の桜の花にまぶれけり
ro: kusamochi no sakura no hana ni mabure keri
en:
herb cakes--
cherry blossoms sprinkled
on top

jp: .のさのさと汐干案内や里の犬
ro: nosa-nosa to shiohi anai ya sato no inu
en:
my intrepid guide
on the low tide beach...
village dog

jp: .松の葉に足拭ふたる汐干哉
ro: matsu no ha ni ashi nuguutaru shioi kana
en:
wiping my feet
on pine needles...
low tide

jp: .川霧のまくしかけたり茶つみ唄
ro: kawa kiri no makushikaketari cha tsumi uta
en:
in the river fog
a boisterous noise...
tea-picking song

jp: .正面はおばば組み茶つみ唄
ro: shômen wa o-baba-gumi nari cha tsumi uta
en:
led by a gang
of grannies...
the tea-picking song

jp: .うかれ猫どの面さげて又来たぞ
ro: ukare [neko] dono tsura sagete mata kita zo
en:
the lover cat
with a shameless face
has returned

jp: .門雀見て居て玉子とられけり
ro: kado suzume mite ite tamago torare keri
en:
while the gate's sparrow
watches
he snatches an egg

jp: .朝飯の鐘をしりてや雀の子
ro: asameshi no kane wo shirite ya suzume no ko
en:
he knows the meaning
of the breakfast bell...
baby sparrow

jp: .子どもらの披露に歩く雀哉
ro: kodomora no hirô ni aruku suzume kana
en:
introducing their children
to society...
strutting sparrows

jp: .善光寺へ行て来た顔や雀の子
ro: zenkôji e itte kita kao ya suzume no ko
en:
faces looking like
they've been to Zenko Temple
baby sparrows

jp: .手伝って虱を拾へ雀の子
ro: tetsudatte shirami wo hiroe suzume no ko
en:
do me a favor
baby sparrow...
pick at my lice

jp: .鶯がちょいと隣の序哉
ro: uguisu ga choi to tonari no tsuide kana
en:
my neighbor for a moment
the nightingale
moves on

jp: .鶯がばくち見い見い鳴にけり
ro: uguisu ga bakuchi mii mii naki ni keri
en:
the nightingale watching
watching the gamblers...
sings

jp: .鶯の朝飯だけを鳴にけり
ro: uguisu no asameshi dake wo naki ni keri
en:
nightingale's breakfast--
only for this
it sang

jp: .鶯のかせぎて鳴くや飯前に
ro: uguisu no kasegite naku ya meshimae ni
en:
the nightingale toils
at his singing...
before eating

jp: .鶯の尻目にかけしばくち哉
ro: uguisu no shirime ni kakeshi bakuchi kana
en:
while the nightingale
looks askance...
they gamble

jp: .鶯の毎旦北野参り哉
ro: uguisu no maiasa kitano mairi kana
en:
to Kitano
every morning, the nightingale's
pilgrimage

jp: .鶯や今に直らぬ木曽訛
ro: uguisu ya ima ni naoranu kiso namari
en:
nightingale--
you still haven't lost
your Kiso accent

jp: .鶯やたまたま来たにばくち客
ro: uguisu ya tama-tama kita ni bakuchi kyaku
en:
a nightingale arrives
unexpectedly...
gamblers

jp: .鶯や糞しながらもほっけ経
ro: uguisu ya kuso shi nagara mo hokkekyô
en:
nightingale--
even while pooping, sings
Lotus Sutra

jp: .鶯よ咽がかはかば角田川
ro: uguisu yo nodo ga kawakaba sumida-gawa
en:
nightingale--
if your throat gets dry
there's Sumida River

jp: .鶯や枝に猫は御ひざに
ro: uguisu ya eda ni neko wa on-hiza ni
en:
nightingale
on a branch, in her lap
a cat

jp: .木の股の弁当箱よ鶯よ
ro: ki no mata no bentôbako yo uguisu yo
en:
a box lunch
in a tree's crotch...
a nightingale sings

jp: .雀程でもほけ経を鳴にけり
ro: suzume hodo demo hokekyô wo naki ni keri
en:
no bigger than a sparrow
yet he warbles
the Lotus Sutra!

jp: .有明や雨の中より鳴雲雀
ro: ariake ya ame no naka yori naku hibari
en:
at dawn
deep in the rain
a lark is singing

jp: .蛤も大口明くぞ鳴雲雀
ro: hamaguri mo ôkuchi aku zo naku hibari
en:
the clam too
opens wide...
a lark is singing

jp: .むさしのや野屎の伽に鳴雲雀
ro: musashi no ya no-guso no togi ni naku hibari
en:
Musashi Plain--
while he poops entertained
by a lark

jp: .野談義や大な口へ雉の声
ro: no dangi ya ôkina kuchi e kiji no koe
en:
sermon in the field--
the priest's wide-open mouth
a pheasant's voice

jp: .山雉子袖をこすって走りけり
ro: yama kigisu sode wo kosutte hashiri keri
en:
a mountain pheasant
ruffling my sleeve
runs away

jp: .帰る雁浅間のけぶりいく度見る
ro: kae[ru] kari asama no keburi iku do miru
en:
departing geese--
how many times have you seen
Mount Asama's smoke?

jp: .帰る雁花のお江戸をいく度見た
ro: kae[ru] kari hana no o-edo wo iku do mita
en:
departing geese--
how many times have you seen
blossom-filled Edo?

jp: .雁よ雁いくつのとしから旅をした
ro: kari yo kari ikutsu no toshi kara tabi wo shita
en:
goose, wild goose
when did your
journey begin?

jp: .連もたぬ雁もとぼとぼ帰りけり
ro: tsure motanu kari mo tobo-tobo kaeri keri
en:
a goose without companions
plodding along
returns

jp: .どこでどう正月をした帰る雁
ro: doko de dô shôgatsu wo shita kae[ru] kari
en:
where and how
did you spend First Month?
returning geese

jp: .一組は千住留りか帰る雁
ro: hito kumi wa senju-domari ka kae[ru] kari
en:
will one flock
stop at Senju town?
geese flying north

jp: .夫婦雁話して行ぞあれ行ぞ
ro: meoto kari hanashite yuku zo are yuku zo
en:
Mr. and Mrs. Goose
talking as they go...
going... gone...

jp: .木母寺の念仏さづかりて帰る雁
ro: mokuboji no nembutsu suzukarite kae[ru] kari
en:
learning to praise Buddha
at Mokubo Temple...
geese flying north

jp: .我家を置ざりにして帰る雁
ro: waga ie wo okizari ni shite kae[ru] kari
en:
finalizing the divorce
leaving my house behind...
departing geese

jp: .亀どのに上座ゆづりて鳴蛙
ro: kame dono no jôza yuzurite naku kawazu
en:
yielding the seat of honor
to Mr. Turtle...
croaking frog

jp: .来かかりて一分別の蛙かな
ro: ki-kakarite hitofunbetsu no kawazu kana
en:
he comes to visit
with such gravitas...
a frog

jp: .車座に居直りて鳴く蛙哉
ro: kurumaza ni i-naorite naku kawazu kana
en:
sitting up straight
in their circle...
croaking frogs

jp: .小仏の御首からも蛙かな
ro: ko-botoke no o-kashira kara mo kawazu kana
en:
the little Buddha's head
a launch pad too...
frogs

jp: .ことしや世がよいぞ小蛙大蛙
ro: kotoshi ya yo ga yoi zo ko kawazu ôkawazu
en:
"This year the world is good!"
little frogs
big frogs

jp: .西行のやうに居て鳴蛙
ro: saigyô no yô ni suwatte naku kawazu
en:
like Saigyo
squatting, croaking
frog

jp: .笹の家の小言の真似を鳴蛙
ro: sasa no ya no kogoto no mane wo naku kawazu
en:
copying the nagging
in the thatched house...
croaking frogs

jp: .叱ってもしゃあしゃあとして蛙哉
ro: shikatte mo shaa-shaa to shite kawazu kana
en:
despite the scolding
composed and shameless...
frog

jp: .上人の口真似してやなく蛙
ro: shônin no kuchi mane shite ya naku kawazu
en:
taking up the holy man's
chant...
croaking frogs

jp: .小便を致しながらもなく蛙
ro: shôben wo itashi nagara mo naku kawazu
en:
taking a leak
he keeps on croaking...
frog

jp: .順々に座につきてなく蛙
ro: jun-jun ni za ni tsukite naku kawazu kana
en:
one by one
they take their seats...
croaking frogs

jp: .住吉の神の御前の蛙哉
ro: sumiyoshi no kami no mimae no kawazu kana
en:
in the divine presence
of Sumiyoshi's gods...
a frog

jp: .同音に口を明たる蛙かな
ro: dôon ni kuchi wo aketaru kawazu kana
en:
with one voice
their mouths open wide...
frogs

jp: .なむなむと口を明たる蛙かな
ro: namu namu to kuchi wo aketaru kawazu kana
en:
praising Buddha
mouths gaping wide...
frogs

jp: .逃しなに何をぶつくさ夕蛙
ro: nigeshina ni nani wo butsu-kusa yuu kawazu
en:
running away
grumbling, mumbling...
evening frog

jp: .女房を追なくしてや鳴く蛙
ro: nyôbô wo ou naku shite ya naku kawazu
en:
chasing a lady
who gets away...
croaking frog

jp: .花蓙や先へ居りている蛙
ro: hana goza ya saki e suwarite iru kawazu
en:
blossom-viewing mat--
squatting at its front
a frog

jp: .痩蛙まけるな一茶是に有り
ro: yasegaeru makeru na issa kore ni ari
en:
scrawny frog, hang tough!
Issa
is here

jp: .山吹や先御先へととぶ蛙
ro: yamabuki ya mazu o-saki e to tobu kawazu
en:
yellow rose--
please, you go first
frog jumping

jp: .夕やけにやけ起してや鳴蛙
ro: yûyake ni yakeokoshite ya naku kawazu
en:
in evening's glow
they glow...
frogs croaking

jp: .我庵に用ありそうな蛙哉
ro: waga io ni yô ari sôna kawazu kana
en:
in my hut
on urgent business...
a frog

jp: .我庵や用ありそうな来る蛙
ro: waga io ya yô ari sôna kuru kawazu
en:
my hut--
a frog has come
on urgent business

jp: .我門へしらなんで這入る蛙哉
ro: waga kado e shiranande hairu kawazu kana
en:
entering my gate
unknowingly
a frog

jp: .夕不二に手をかけて鳴蛙哉
ro: yû fuji [ni] te wo kakete naku kawazu kana
en:
his hands hanging
in Mount Fuji's evening
a croaking frog

jp: .馬の耳一日なぶる小てふ哉
ro: uma no mimi ichi nichi naburu ko chô kana
en:
all day teasing
the horse's ear...
little butterfly

jp: .門畠や烏叱れば行小蝶
ro: kado hata ya karasu shikareba yuku ko chô
en:
gate's garden--
when the crow scolds
the little butterfly leaves

jp: .門筵小蝶の邪魔をしたりけり
ro: kado mushiro ko chô no jama wo shitari keri
en:
on a mat by the gate
I'm the butterfly's
roadblock

jp: .銭の出た窓きらふてや行小蝶
ro: zeni no deta mado kiraute ya yuku ko chô
en:
miffed by the coin
tossed out the window...
little butterfly leaves

jp: .たのもしやしかも小てふの若夫婦
ro: tanomoshi ya shikamo ko chô no waka fûfu
en:
brimming with hope
little butterflies...
a young couple

jp: .蝶とぶやそれ仏法の世の中と
ro: chô tobu ya sore buppô no yo [no] naka to
en:
flitting butterfly--
thus is Buddha's law
in this world

jp: .蝶とぶや茶売さ湯うり野酒売
ro: chô tobu ya cha uri sayu uri nozake uri
en:
a butterfly flits--
hot tea, hot water
and sake for sale

jp: .蝶とまれも一度留れ草もちに
ro: chô tomare mo ichi  do tomare kusamochi ni
en:
stop, butterfly
once more, stop!
on the festival rice cake

jp: .蝶とまれも一度留れ盃に
ro: chô tomare mo ichi do tomare sakazuki ni
en:
stop, butterfly
once more, stop!
on the sake cup

jp: .猫の子の命日をとぶ小てふ哉
ro: neko no ko no meinichi wo tobu ko chô kana
en:
to the kitten's
death anniversary it flits...
little butterfly

jp: .はつ蝶の夫婦連して来たりけり
ro: hatsu chô no meoto-zurete shite kitari keri
en:
two by two
spring's first butterflies
arrive

jp: .はつ蝶やしかも三夫婦五夫婦
ro: hatsu chô ya shikamo san fûfu go fûfu
en:
spring's first butterflies--
three couples!
five couples!

jp: .ひざの児の頬っべたなめる小てふ哉
ro: hiza no ko no hobbeta nameru ko chô kana
en:
licking the lap-baby's
cheek...
little butterfly

jp: .目黒へはこちへこちへと小てふ哉
ro: mekuro e wa kochi e kochi e to ko chô kana
en:
"Come this way, this way
blind man!"
little butterfly

jp: .やよや蝶そこのけそこのけ湯がはねる
ro: yayoya chô soko noke soko noke yu ga haneru
en:
hey butterfly
move aside!
bath water's splashing

jp: .湯入衆の頭かぞへる小てふ哉
ro: yu iri shû no atama kazoeru ko chô kana
en:
counting heads
in a hot tub...
little butterfly

jp: .世にあれば蝶も朝からかせぐぞよ
ro: yo ni areba chô mo asa kara kaesgu zo yo
en:
life in the world--
even butterflies from morning on
must toil!

jp: .鳩の藪雀の垣やから蜆
ro: hato no yabu suzume no kaki ya kara shijimi
en:
in the pigeon's thicket
on the sparrow's fence...
clamshells

jp: .かくれ家や日々草は若くなる
ro: kakurega ya nichi-nichi kusa wa wakaku naru
en:
secluded house--
day after day more
baby grass

jp: .わか草に笠投やりて入る湯哉
ro: wakakusa ni kasa nageyarite iru yu kana
en:
my umbrella-hat
left on the baby grass...
a hot bath

jp: .小菜の花いかなる鬼もつみ残す
ro: ona no hana ikanaru oni mo tsumi nokosu
en:
little rape flowers
what devil
plucked so many?

jp: .なの花の中を浅間のけぶり哉
ro: na no hana no naka wo asama no keburi kana
en:
in the middle
of flowering rape
Mount Asama's smoke

jp: .藪の菜のだまって咲て居たりけり
ro: yabu no na no damatte saite itari keri
en:
rape flowers
in the thicket, hushed
have bloomed

jp: .鰻屋のうなぎ逃けり梅の花
ro: unagi ya no unagi nige keri ume no hana
en:
an eel shop eel
is escaping...
plum blossoms

jp: .梅の木や花の明りの夜念仏
ro: ume no ki ya hana no akari no yo nembutsu
en:
plum tree--
under blossoms' shine
an evening prayer

jp: .貝殻でばくちもす也梅の花
ro: kaigara de bakuchi mosu nari ume no hana
en:
betting seashells
gamblers in a frenzy...
plum blossoms

jp: .かつしかや三百店も梅の花
ro: katsushika ya san-byaku-dana mo ume no hana
en:
Katsushika--
three hundred shops
under the plum blossoms

jp: .門の梅家内安全と咲にけり
ro: kado no ume kanai anzen to saki ni keri
en:
gate's plum tree--
the family's good fortune
in bloom

jp: .猿丸がきせる加へて梅の花
ro: sarumaru ga kiseru kuwaete ume no hana
en:
Lord Monkey chews
on a pipe...
plum blossoms

jp: .散銭を投るべからず梅の花
ro: sansen wo tojiru-bekarazu ume no hana
en:
don't throw
those offering coins!
plum blossoms

jp: .雀らが喰こぼしけり梅の花
ro: susumera ga kû koboshi keri ume no hana
en:
sparrows spill their food--
plum trees
in bloom

jp: .貫之の梅よ附たり三ケの月
ro: tsurayuki no ume yo tsuketari mike no tsuki
en:
Tsurayuki's plum blossoms!
attached
to a sickle moon

jp: .蟾どのが何か侍る梅の花
ro: hiki dono ga nannika haberu ume no hana
en:
Sir Toad
on a secret mission...
plum blossoms

jp: .三ケ月や梅からついと本尊へ
ro: mikazuki ya ume kara tsui to honzon e
en:
sickle moon--
I glide from plum blossoms
to Buddha's image

jp: .身一つに大な月よ梅がかよ
ro: mi hitotsu ni ôkina tsuki yo ume ga ka yo
en:
just for me...
the great moon!
the plum blossom scent!

jp: .ちる花に御免の加へぎせる哉
ro: chiru hana ni gomen no kuwae giseru kana
en:
scattering cherry blossoms
please pardon
my pipe!

jp: .散花もつかみ込けりばくち銭
ro: chiru hana mo tsukami komi keri bakuchi zeni
en:
a fistful of fallen
cherry blossoms too...
gamblers' pot

jp: .花咲て本ンのうき世と成にけり
ro: hana saite hon no ukiyo to nari ni keri
en:
cherry blossoms--
a floating world of pleasure
has begun

jp: .起伏も桜明りや念仏坊
ro: okifushi mo sakura akari ya nebutsu-bô
en:
going about
in cherry blossom light...
Pure Land priest

jp: .小うるさや山の桜も評判記
ro: ko urusaya yama no sakura mo hyôbanki
en:
a nuisance--
even mountain cherry blossom
rumors fly

jp: .是程にけちな桜も都哉
ro: kore hodo ni kechina sakura mo miyako kana
en:
even around here
paltry cherry trees...
Kyoto

jp: .財布から焼飯出して桜哉
ro: saifu kara yakimeshi dashite sakura kana
en:
fried rice emerges
from my pouch...
cherry blossoms!

jp: .尿をやる子にあれあれと桜哉
ro: shito wo yaru ko ni are-are to sakura kana
en:
a child pissing
"Look! Look!"
cherry blossoms

jp: .としよりの目の正月ぞさくら花
ro: toshiyori no me [no] shôgatsu zo sakura hana
en:
it's New Year's Day
to these old eyes...
cherry blossoms

jp: .なむなむと桜明りに寝たりけり
ro: namu namu to sakura akari ni netari keri
en:
praise Buddha!
sleeping in the light
of cherry blossoms

jp: .日本はばくちの銭もさくら哉
ro: nippon wa bakuchi no zeni mo sakura kana
en:
it's gambling money
here in Japan...
cherry blossoms

jp: .蕗の葉に煮〆配りて山桜
ro: fuki no ha ni nishime kubarite yama-zakura
en:
a vegetable hodgepodge
on butterbur leaves...
mountain cherry blossoms

jp: .老が世に桃太郎も出よ桃の花
ro: oi ga yo ni momotarô mo deyo momo no hana
en:
in an old man's world
Peach Boy, go outside!
peach blossoms

jp: .なぐさみに馬のくはへる桃の花
ro: nagusami ni uma no kuwaeru momo no hana
en:
just for fun
a peach blossom
in the horse's mouth

jp: .石下戸の門も青柳と成りにけり
ro: ishi geko no kado mo ao yagi to nari [ni] keri
en:
gracing the gate
of a non-drinker too...
a greening willow

jp: .大犬をこそぐり起す柳哉
ro: ôinu wo kosoguri okosu yanagi kana
en:
giving the big dog
a tickle...
willow tree

jp: .隠坊が門もそよそよ青柳ぞ
ro: ombô ga kado mo soyo-soyo ao yagi zo
en:
at the cemetery guard's
gate too...
a green willow rustles

jp: .加へぎせる無用でもなし門柳
ro: kuwae giseru muyô de mo nashi kado yanagi
en:
pipe in my mouth--
smoking's allowed here
by my gate's willow

jp: .倒れ家といほ相もちの柳哉
ro: taore ya to io aimochi no yanagi kana
en:
mutual aid
for ruined house and hut...
willow

jp: .垂柳門の曲りはかくれぬぞ
ro: tare yanagi kado no magari wa kakurenu zo
en:
drooping willow--
the gate's crookedness
not quite hidden

jp: .田も見へて大事の大事の短夜ぞ
ro: ta mo miete daiji no daiji no mijika yo zo
en:
my rice field
the greatest sight of all!
summer's early dawn

jp: .短夜をさっさと露の草ば哉
ro: mijika yo wo sassa to tsuyu no kusaba kana
en:
in the short night
the dew works fast...
blades of grass

jp: .短夜やゆうぜんとして桜花
ro: mijika yo ya yûzen to shite sakura hana
en:
short summer night--
the serene and still
cherry blossoms

jp: .暑き夜を唄で参るや善光寺
ro: atsu[ki] yow o uta de mairu ya zenkôji
en:
a hot night's pilgrimage
with song...
Zenko Temple

jp: .大家の大雨だれの暑哉
ro: ôie no ôamadare no atsusa kana
en:
in a big house's
big raindrops from the eaves...
the heat

jp: .あら涼し涼しといふもひとり哉
ro: ara suzushi suzushi to iu mo hitori kana
en:
"Ah cool air! cool air!"
even while saying this
I'm alone

jp: .涼風の吹木へ縛る我子哉
ro: suzukaze no fuku ki e shibaru waga ko kana
en:
tied to the tree
where cool wind blows
my child

jp: .涼しさに転ぶも上手とはやしけり
ro: suzushisa ni marobu mo jyôzu to hayashi keri
en:
in cool air
"what a good tumble!"
I cheer

jp: .涼しさに夜はえた村でなかりけり
ro: suzushisa ni yo wa eta mura de nakari keri
en:
in the evening cool
no village
of outcasts

jp: .涼しさは仏の方より降る雨か
ro: suzushisa wa hotoke no kata yori furu ame ka
en:
cool air--
is rain coming from
Buddha's direction?

jp: .さしつつじ花々しさや五月雨
ro: sashi tsutsuji hanabanashisa ya satsuki ame
en:
the planted azaleas
in full glory...
Fifth Month rain

jp: .五月雨の初日をふれる烏哉
ro: samidare no shonichi wo fureru karasu kana
en:
proclaiming the Fifth Month
rain's first day...
a crow

jp: .薮陰やひとり鎌とぐ五月雨
ro: yabu kage ya hitori kama togu satsuki ame
en:
in the thicket shade
he sharpens his sickle...
Fifth Month rain

jp: .虻出よせうじの破の五月晴
ro: abu ide yo shôji no yare no satsuki-bare
en:
go, horsefly
through the ripped paper door!
Fifth Month rains are over

jp: .浅間から別て来るや小夕立
ro: asama kara wakarete kuru ya ko yûdachi
en:
leaving Mount Asama
coming this way...
little cloudburst

jp: .あっさりと朝夕立のお茶屋哉
ro: assari to asa yûdachi no ochaya kana
en:
with a light touch
morning's cloudburst...
teahouse

jp: .てんてんに遠夕立の目利哉
ro: ten-den ni tô yûdachi no mekiki kana
en:
distant storm--
each one of the watchers
has his opinion

jp: .一つ家や一夕立の真中に
ro: hitotsu ya ya hito yûdachi no mannaka ni
en:
one house
in one summer rain...
dead center

jp: .夕立に大行灯の後光哉
ro: yûdachi ni ôandon no gokô kana
en:
in the cloudburst
the big lantern's
halo

jp: .夕立やおそれ入たり蟾の顔
ro: yûdachi ya osore-iritari hiki no kao
en:
rainstorm--
an annoyed look
on the toad's face

jp: .赤々と出来揃けり雲の峰
ro: aka-aka to deki soroi keri kumo no mine
en:
shining bright
one and all...
the billowing clouds

jp: .大雲や峰と成ってもずり歩く
ro: ôkumo ya mine to natte mo zuri-aruku
en:
big cloud--
though with lofty peaks
it creeps along

jp: 先繰りにおつ崩しけり雲の峰
ro: senguri ni otsu kuzushi keri kumo no mine
en:
one by one
they fall and crumble...
the peaks of clouds

jp: .相応な山作る也根なし雲
ro: sôôna yama tsukuru [nari] ne nashi kumo
en:
a suitable mountain
for me...
cloud without peaks

jp: .山と成り雲と成る雲のなりや
ro: yama to nari kumo to naru kumo no nari ya
en:
cloud becomes a mountain
becomes
a cloud

jp: .行灯を虫の巡るや青あらし
ro: andon wo mushi no meguru ya aoarashi
en:
around the lamp
insects swarm...
wind on the greenery

jp: .我庵や左は清水右は月
ro: waga io ya hidari wa shimizu migi wa tsuki
en:
my hut--
to the left pure water
to the right the moon

jp: .柴の戸の田やひとりでに青くなる
ro: shiba no to no ta ya hitori de ni aoku naru
en:
my humble hut's rice field
all alone...
so green

jp: .そよ吹や田も青ませて旅浴衣
ro: soyo fuku ya ta mo aomasete tabi yukata
en:
wind wafts
rice field so green...
travelers in bathrobes

jp: .田が青む田が青むとやけいこ笛
ro: ta ga aomu ta ga aomu to ya keiko fue
en:
the rice fields
greener and greener!
flute practice

jp: .茶仲間や田も青ませて京参り
ro: cha nakama ya ta mo aomasete kyô mairi
en:
stopping for tea
by rice fields so green...
pilgrims to Kyoto

jp: .露の世をさっさと青む田づら哉
ro: tsuyu no yo wo sassa to aomu ta-zura kana
en:
the world of dew
so fast turns green...
rice fields

jp: .人真似に庵の門田も青みけり
ro: hito mane ni io no kado ta mo aomi keri
en:
copy cat--
the hut's gate's rice field, too
is green

jp: .よい風や青田はづれの北の院
ro: yoi kaze ya aoda hazure no kita no in
en:
a good wind--
beyond the green rice fields
Northern Mansion

jp: .りんりんと凧上りけり青田原
ro: rin-rin to tako agari keri aodabara
en:
with high spirits
the kite ascends...
green rice fields

jp: .御指に銭が一文たん生仏
ro: on-yubi ni zeni ga ichi mon tanjô butsu
en:
on his finger
one penny...
Buddha's birthday

jp: .門前の爺が作し灌仏ぞ
ro: monzen no jiji ga tsukuri[shi] kanbutsu zo
en:
before the gate
an old man's homemade
birthday Buddha

jp: .ともどもに犬もはらばふ夕はらひ
ro: tomodomo ni inu mo harabau yû harai
en:
the dog too
lies prostrate...
evening purification

jp: .形代に虱おぶせて流しけり
ro: katashiro ni shirami obusete nagashi keri
en:
riding the plague god
the lice
float away

jp: .今葺たあやめにちょいと乙鳥哉
ro: ima fuita ayame ni choi to tsubame kana
en:
eaves thatched with irises
then right away...
swallows

jp: .馬の子がなめたがる也さししょうぶ
ro: uma no ko ga name-tagaru nari sashi shôbu
en:
the pony tries
to take a bite...
thatch of irises

jp: .かくれ家やそこらむしってふくしょうぶ
ro: kakurega ya sokora mushitte fuku shôbu
en:
secluded house--
here they pluck irises
for thatch

jp: .草の戸の菖蒲や猫の手もとどく
ro: kusa no to no ayame ya neko no te mo todoku
en:
my hut's
thatch of irises, even the cat
can reach it

jp: .十ばかり笹にならせる粽哉
ro: jû bakari sasa ni naraseru chimaki kana
en:
about ten decorate
the bamboo grass...
rice dumplings

jp: .叱られて又疲うの入にけり
ro: shikararete mata tsukare u no iri ni keri
en:
after a scolding
the weary cormorants
dive again

jp: .つかれ鵜や子をふり返りふり返り
ro: tsukare u ya ko wo furikaeri furikaeri
en:
the weary cormorant
turns back to her children
turns back...

jp: .夕月やうにかせがせて茶碗酒
ro: yûzuki ya u ni kasegasete chawan sake
en:
night moon--
while cormorants must work
sake in a teacup

jp: .ふんどしで汗を拭き拭きはなし哉
ro: fundoshi de ase wo fuki-fuki hanashi kana
en:
wiping and wiping his sweat
with his loincloth
as he talks

jp: .我庵は草も夏痩したりけり
ro: waga io wa kusa mo natsuyase shitari keri
en:
at my hut
even the grass this summer
lost weight

jp: .うしろから見れば若いぞ更衣
ro: ushiro kara mireba wakai kogomogae
en:
looking behind me
more young folk...
new summer robes

jp: .門並にぼろぼろ衣替にけり
ro: kadonami ni boro-boro-goromo kae ni keri
en:
like everyone else
I change from rags
to summer robe

jp: .かりぎとも子はしらぬ也更衣
ro: karigi tomo ko wa shiranu nari koromogae
en:
the child doesn't know
it's borrowed...
new summer robe

jp: .けふばかり隣ほしさよ更衣
ro: kyô bakari tonari hoshisa yo koromogae
en:
just today
I wish I had neighbors...
my new summer robe

jp: .御祝儀に雨も降けり更衣
ro: o-shûgi ni ame mo furi keri koromogae
en:
rain falls
on the celebration...
the change to summer robes

jp: .手盥に魚遊ばせて更衣
ro: te-darai ni uo asobasete koromogae
en:
in a hand tub his fish
is allowed to play...
new summer robe

jp: .門外は本のうき世ぞ更衣
ro: kado soto wa hon no ukiyo zo koromogae
en:
outside my gate
a floating world of pleasure...
new summer robes

jp: .たのもしやてんつるてんの初袷
ro: tanomoshi ya tentsuruten no hatsu awase
en:
how promising!
his summer kimono
already too short

jp: .杖によい竹に目のつく初袷
ro: tsue ni yoi take ni me no tsuku hatsu awase
en:
I spot some bamboo
good for a walking stick...
summer kimono

jp: .はつ袷にくまれ盛にはやくなれ
ro: hatsu awase nikumare-zakari ni hayaku nare
en:
his first summer kimono--
hurry and grow
into a menace!

jp: .馬柄杓を伊達にさしたる袷哉
ro: ma-bishaku wo date ni sashitaru awase kana
en:
looking jaunty
on the horse's ladle...
summer kimono

jp: .老けりな扇づかいの小ぜはしき
ro: oi keri na ôgi-zukai no ko-zewashiki
en:
growing old--
my paper fan waving's
a bit overdone

jp: .おとろへの急に見へけり赤扇
ro: otoroe no kyû ni mie keri aka ôgi
en:
how quickly
the color fades...
red paper fan

jp: .大猫のどさりと寝たる団扇哉
ro: ôneko no dosari to netaru uchiwa kana
en:
the big cat
flops down to sleep
on the fan

jp: .膝抱て団扇握って寝たりけり
ro: hiza daite uchiwa nigitte netari keri
en:
hugging her knees
clutching her paper fan...
asleep

jp: .行あたりばったりばたり団扇哉
ro: yuki-atari-battari-batari uchiwa kana
en:
helter-skelter
they flap and flap...
paper fans

jp: .蚊いぶしの真風下に仏哉
ro: ka ibushi no makkaza shimo ni hotoke kana
en:
downwind
from the smudge pot smoke...
a Buddha

jp: .蚊いぶしも只三文の住居哉
ro: ka ibushi mo tada san mon no sumai kana
en:
smudge pot smoke--
just three pennies' worth
does the house

jp: .さく花もちょいと蚊やりのそよぐ哉
ro: saku hana mo choi to kayari no soyogu kana
en:
the blooming flower
suddenly shivers...
smudge pot smoke

jp: .新しい水湧音や井の底に
ro: atarashii mizu waku oto ya i no soko ni
en:
the sound of fresh water
boiling...
deep in the well

jp: .庵の井は手でかへほして仕廻けり
ro: io no i wa te de kaehoshite shimai keri
en:
my hut's well--
I do its summer cleaning
by hand

jp: .井の底をちょっと見て来る小てふ哉
ro: i no soko wo chotto mite kuru ko chô kana
en:
a quick inspection
of the well's bottom...
little butterfly

jp: .井の中に屁をひるやうな咄哉
ro: i no naka ni he wo hiru yôna hanashi kana
en:
deep in the well
a sound like farting...
the cleaner's voice

jp: .涼しくば一寝入せよ井戸の底
ro: suzushikuba hito neiri seyo i[do] no soko
en:
since it's cool down there
take a little nap...
bottom of the well

jp: .あこよあこよ転ぶも上手夕涼
ro: ako yo ako yo korobu mo jyôzu yûsuzumi
en:
my child, my child
he tumbles so well!
evening cool

jp: .草のほにこそぐられけり夕涼
ro: kusa no ho ni kosogurare keri yûsuzumi
en:
the beards of grasses
tickling me...
evening cool

jp: .下り虫蓑作りつつ夕涼み
ro: sagari mushi mino tsukuri tsutsu yûsuzumi
en:
the hanging worm
makes himself a raincoat...
evening cool

jp: .大門や涼がてらの草むしり
ro: daimon ya suzumi ga tera no kusa mushiri
en:
great temple gate--
in the cool air a monk
plucks grass

jp: .立涼寝涼さても涼しさや
ro: tachi suzumi ne suzumi sate mo suzushisa ya
en:
cooling off standing
cooling lying down...
well, it's cool!

jp: .たばこの火手にうち抜て夕涼
ro: tabako no hi te ni uchinuite yûsuzumi
en:
knocking my pipe's ember
into my hand...
evening cool

jp: .ばか蛙すこたん云な夕涼
ro: baka kawazu sukotan iu na yûsuzumi
en:
foolish frog
don't talk nonsense!
evening cool

jp: .真丸に芝青ませて夕涼
ro: manmaru ni shiba aomasete yûsuzumi
en:
making grass green
in a perfect circle...
evening cool

jp: .むさしのや涼む草さへ主がある
ro: musashi no ya suzumu kusa sae nushi ga aru
en:
Musashi Plain--
a grassy place for cooling off
already occupied

jp: .宵々や屎新道も夕涼
ro: yoi yoi ya kuso shindô mo yûsuzumi
en:
every evening
there's a new shit road...
cool air

jp: .わんぱくや縛れながら夕涼
ro: wanpaku ya shibare nagara yûsuzumi
en:
naughty child
though tethered enjoys
evening's cool

jp: .蕗の葉にいわしを配る田植哉
ro: fuki no ha ni iwashi wo kubaru taue kana
en:
sardines served
in butterbur leaves...
planting rice

jp: .我庵も田植休の仲間哉
ro: waga io mo ta ue yasumi no nakama kana
en:
at my hut too
a rice-planting rest...
comrades

jp: .住吉やさ乙女迄もおがまるる
ro: sumiyoshi ya saotome made mo ogamaruru
en:
Sumiyoshi--
even the rice-planting girls
are worshipped

jp: .かはほりが中で鳴けり米瓢
ro: kawahori ga naka de naki keri kome fukube
en:
the little bat
chirps inside
the rice gourd

jp: .かはほりのちょいちょい出たり米瓢
ro: kawahori no choi-choi detari kome fukube
en:
good job! the bat
crawls out
the rice gourd

jp: .行灯に笠をかぶせて時鳥
ro: andon ni kasa wo kabusete hototogisu
en:
putting an umbrella-hat
over the lantern...
"cuckoo!"

jp: .うの花に食傷するな時鳥
ro: u no hana ni shokushô suru na hototogisu
en:
don't get indigestion
from the tofu dregs!
cuckoo

jp: .うの花も馳走にちりぬほととぎす
ro: u no hana mo chisô ni chirinu hototogisu
en:
I scatter tofu dregs too
for his feast...
cuckoo

jp: .川越や肩で水きる時鳥
ro: kawa-goshi ya kata de mizu kiru hototogisu
en:
the river porter
crossing with a swagger
a cuckoo

jp: .是はさて寝耳に水の時鳥
ro: kore wa sate nemimi ni mizu no hototogisu
en:
well, well
out of the blue...
"cuckoo!"

jp: .叱らるる貧乏雨もほととぎす
ro: shikararuru bimbô ame mo hototogisu
en:
scolding the poor
rain as well...
cuckoo

jp: .銭投るやつを叱るか時鳥
ro: zeni hôru yatsu wo shikaru ka hototogisu
en:
are you scolding
that coin-tossing fellow?
cuckoo

jp: .ちっぽけな田も見くびらず時鳥
ro: chippokena ta mo mikubirazu hototogisu
en:
not despising
the tiny rice field...
cuckoo

jp: .としよりと見てや大声に時鳥
ro: toshiyori to mite ya ôgoe ni hototogisu
en:
thinking I'm old
what a loud voice!
cuckoo

jp: .掃溜の江戸へ江戸へと時鳥
ro: hakidame no edo e edo e to hototogisu
en:
"I'm off to that rubbish heap
Edo! Edo!"
the cuckoo

jp: .兀山の天窓こっきりほととぎす
ro: hage yama no atama kokkiri hototogisu
en:
rapping the bald
mountain's head...
cuckoo

jp: .馬上からおおいおいとや時鳥
ro: bajô kara ooi oi to ya hototogisu
en:
on the horse's back
"Yee-haw!"
a cuckoo

jp: .頬かぶりならぬならぬぞほととぎす
ro: hoho kaburi naranu naranu zo hototogisu
en:
don't try acting
the innocent babe!
cuckoo

jp: .時鳥なけなけ一茶是に有
ro: hototogisu nake-nake issa kore ni ari
en:
little cuckoo
sing! sing!
Issa is here

jp: .時鳥何を忘て引返す
ro: hototogisu nani wo wasurete hikikaesu
en:
cuckoo
what did you forget?
retracing steps

jp: .時鳥人間界をあきたげな
ro: hototogisu ningenkai wo akitagena
en:
hey cuckoo--
don't look like you're sick
of the human race!

jp: .むだ山も脇よれ脇よれ時鳥
ro: muda yama mo waki yore waki yore hototogisu
en:
on a vain mountain too--
move aside! move aside!
for Sir Cuckoo

jp: .飯けぶり聳る里やほととぎす
ro: meshi keburi sobieru sato ya hototogisu
en:
rising over the village
rice cooking smoke...
"cuckoo!"

jp: .よい蔵にうしろ見せるな時鳥
ro: yoi kura ni ushiro miseru na hototogisu
en:
it's a good grain barn
stand your ground!
cuckoo

jp: .我を見て引返すぞよほととぎす
ro: ware wo mite hikikaesu zo yo hototogisu
en:
looking at me
retracing his steps...
the cuckoo

jp: .づぶ濡の仏立けりかんこ鳥
ro: zubunure no hotoke tachi keri kankodori
en:
Buddha stands
drenched to the bone...
mountain cuckoo

jp: .我門に入らぬ御世話ぞ行々し
ro: waga kado ni iranu o-sewa zo gyôgyôshi
en:
at my gate
thanks for nothing!
reed thrush

jp: .大雨や四五丁北の鳴水鶏
ro: ôame ya shi go chô kita no naki kuina
en:
big rain--
five hundred yards north
a moorhen's cry

jp: .おれが田に水がないとや鳴水鶏
ro: ore ga ta ni mizu ga nai to ya naku kuina
en:
my rice field
is waterless...
a moorhen complains

jp: .我門や水鶏も鳴かず屁もへらず
ro: waga kado ya kuina mo nakazu he mo herazu
en:
at my gate--
no moorhen crying
no farts

jp: .四五丁の事で来ぬ也鳴水鶏
ro: shi go chô no koto de konu nari naki kuina
en:
from five hundred yards
or so it comes...
moorhen's cry

jp: .とぶ蛍女の髪につながれな
ro: tobu hotaru onna no kami ni tsuna[ga]re na
en:
flitting firefly--
don't get tangled
in women's hair!

jp: .入道が気に喰ぬやら行く蛍
ro: nyûdô ga ki ni kuwanu yara yuku hotaru
en:
they shun
the priest...
flitting fireflies

jp: .寝むしろや尻をかぞへて行蛍
ro: ne mushiro ya shiri wo kazoete yuku hotaru
en:
sleeping mats--
the fireflies counting
butts

jp: .蛍見や転びながらもあれ蛍
ro: hotaru mi ya korobi nagara mo are hotaru
en:
viewing fireflies
he takes a tumble...
"There's one!"

jp: .本道りゆらりゆらりと蛍哉
ro: hondôri yurari-yurari to hotaru kana
en:
lightly, nimbly
down the main road...
a firefly

jp: .我門や折角に来て行蛍
ro: waga kado ya sekkaku ni kite yuku hotaru
en:
at my gate
they pay their respects...
fireflies

jp: .我髪を薮と思ふかはふ蛍
ro: waga kami wo yabu to omou ka hau hotaru
en:
do you think
my hair's a thicket?
firefly

jp: .わんぱくや縛れながらよぶ蛍
ro: wanpaku ya shibarare nagara yobu hotaru
en:
naughty child
though tethered calling
fireflies

jp: .泣蔵や縛れながらよぶ蛍
ro: nakizô ya shibarare nagara yobu hotaru
en:
through the tears
though he's tethered
calling fireflies

jp: .汁鍋にちらりちらりと蛍かな
ro: shiru nabe ni chirari chirari to hotaru kana
en:
into the soup kettle
flitting, flitting
firefly

jp: .蚊柱の足らぬ所や三ケ月
ro: ka-bashira no taranu tokoro ya mike no tsuki
en:
a place
short on mosquito swarms...
sickle moon

jp: .蚊柱や月の御邪魔でないやうに
ro: ka-bashira ya tsuki no o-jama de nai yô ni
en:
mosquito swarm--
don't block my view
of the moon!

jp: .涼風が口へ吹込む薮蚊哉
ro: suzukaze ga kuchi e fukikomu yabu ka kana
en:
the cool breeze
blows into the mouth...
a mosquito!

jp: .それがしが宿は薮蚊の名所哉
ro: soregashi ga yado wa yabu ka no meisho kana
en:
my home--
for the mosquitoes
a famous resort

jp: .なむああと大口明けば薮蚊哉
ro: namu aa to ôkuchi akeba yabu ka kana
en:
while praising Buddha
with wide-open mouth...
a mosquito

jp: .むらの蚊の大寄合や軒の月
ro: mura no ka no ôyoriai ya noki no tsuki
en:
the village mosquitoes'
great convocation...
moon on the eaves

jp: .目出度さはことしの蚊にも喰れけり
ro: medetasa wa kotoshi no ka ni mo kuware keri
en:
a celebration--
this year's mosquitoes too
feast

jp: .我宿は口で吹ても出る蚊哉
ro: waga yado wa kuchi de fuite mo deru ka kana
en:
my home
where I even exhale
mosquitoes

jp: .武士に蝿を追する御馬哉
ro: samurai ni hae wo owasuru o-uma kana
en:
the samurai is ordered
to shoo the flies...
Sir Horse

jp: .すりこ木で蠅を追けりとろろ汁
ro: surikogi de hae wo oi keri tororo-jiru
en:
chasing off flies
with a pestle...
grated yam soup

jp: .蝿打に花さく草も打れけり
ro: hae uchi ni hana saku kusa mo utare keri
en:
swatting a fly
and a blooming
wildflower

jp: .我出れば又出たりけり庵の蝿
ro: waga dereba mata detari keri io no hae
en:
when I go out
they go out...
hut's flies

jp: .飛下手の蚤のかわいさまさりけり
ro: tobi-beta no nomi no kawaisa masari keri
en:
not a good jumper
but a cuter flea
than the rest

jp: .じっとして見よ見よ蝉の生れ様
ro: jitto shite mi yo mi yo semi no uma[re] yô
en:
keep stone still
and look! a cicada
being born

jp: .蝉鳴や六月村の炎天寺
ro: semi naku ya rokugatsumura no entenji
en:
a cicada chirrs--
Rokugatsu Village's
Enten Temple

jp: .初蝉のちょと鳴て見し柱哉
ro: hatsu semi no choto naite mishi hashira kana
en:
first cicada--
for a quick song sighted
on the post

jp: .人の世や山は山とて蛭が降る
ro: hito no yo ya yama wa yama tote hiru ga furu
en:
world of man--
in the mountains of course
leeches drop

jp: .蛭住としりつつ這入る沼田哉
ro: hiru sumu to shiritsutsu hairu numata kana
en:
aware of the leeches
they enter...
marshy rice field

jp: .馬上からおおいおいとや初松魚
ro: bajô kara oôi ôi to ya hatsu-gatsuo
en:
from horseback
"So many! So many!"
summer's first bonito

jp: .山かげも江戸気にしたりはつ松魚
ro: yama kage mo edoki ni shitari hatsu-gatsuo
en:
even in mountain shade
a taste of Edo...
first bonito

jp: .みたらしや梅の葉およぐ鮎およぐ
ro: mitarashi ya ume no ha oyogu ayu oyogu
en:
purification font--
swimming plum leaves
swimming trout

jp: .大水や大昼顔のけろり咲く
ro: ômizu ya ôhirugao no kerori saku
en:
a flood--
the tall dayflower keeps
her cool

jp: .昼顔に虫もぎいちょぎいちょ哉
ro: hirugao ni mushi mo giicho giicho kana
en:
among dayflowers
an insect
"geecho! geecho!"

jp: .夕顔の次其次が我家かな
ro: yûgao no tsugi sono tsugi ga waga ya kana
en:
two doors down
from the moonflowers...
my house

jp: .夕顔の中より馬の屁玉哉
ro: yûgao no naka yori uma no hedama kana
en:
wafting in
from the moonflowers...
the horse's fart

jp: .夕顔や馬の尻へも一つ咲く
ro: yûgao ya uma no shiri e mo hitotsu saku
en:
moonflowers--
aimed at the horse's rump
one blooms

jp: .茶けぶりのそよと不運のぼたん哉
ro: cha keburi no soyo to fuun no botan kana
en:
the tea smoke
wafts its way...
unlucky peony

jp: .千軒の垢も流るる蓮の花
ro: sen ken no aka mo nagaruru hasu no hana
en:
the grime of a thousand
houses floats too...
lotus blossoms

jp: .張出しや蓮の台の乞食小屋
ro: hari dashi ya hasu no utena no kojiki goya
en:
overhang--
perched on the lotus's stem
a beggar's hut

jp: .人の世に田に作るる蓮の花
ro: hito no yo ni ta ni tsukuraruru hasu no hana
en:
world of man--
a rice field replaces
lotus blossoms

jp: .虻蠅になぶらるる也捨早苗
ro: abu hae ni naburaruru nari sute sanae
en:
flies and horseflies
sport with them...
leftover rice plants

jp: .里の子が犬に付たるさ苗哉
ro: sato no ko ga inu ni tsuketaru sanae kana
en:
the village child
sticks them on the dog...
rice plants

jp: .捨さ苗犬の寝所にしたりけり
ro: sute sanae inu no nedoko ni shitari keri
en:
the leftover rice plants
a bed
for the dog

jp: .大道へとなりとなりや捨早苗
ro: daidô e tonari tonari ya sute sanae
en:
flanking the highway
on both sides...
leftover rice plants

jp: .妹が子は穂麦の風にふとりけり
ro: imo ga ko wa ho mugi no kaze ni futori keri
en:
my child
in the barley field wind...
nicely plump

jp: .辻仏守り給ふや麦一穂
ro: tsuji-botoke mamori tamau ya mugi hito ho
en:
the crossroads Buddha
guards
one beard of barley

jp: .軒下や一本麦も五六尺
ro: noki shita ya ippon mugi mo go roku shaku
en:
under the eaves
one spear of barley
five, six feet

jp: .かくれ家や枕元よりことし竹
ro: kakurega ya makura moto yori kotoshi take
en:
secluded house--
extending from my pillow
this year's bamboo

jp: .足序若竹の子も折れけり
ro: ashi tsuide waka takenoko mo orare keri
en:
once on their feet
bamboo shoots, too
break

jp: .筍の三本目より月よ哉
ro: takenoko no sanbon me yori tsuki yo kana
en:
spotting three shoots
of new bamboo...
the moonlit night

jp: .竹の子のついと揃も揃たよ
ro: takenoko no tsui to soroi mo sorouta yo
en:
quick-growing bamboo shoots--
the whole gang
the same

jp: .瓜西瓜ねんねんころりころり哉
ro: uri suikuwa nennen korori korori kana
en:
cantaloupes, watermelons--
rock-a-bye
babies

jp: .我桜わか葉盛りもちりにけり
ro: waga sakura wakaba sakari mo chiri ni keri
en:
my cherry blossoms
even flush with fresh leaves
scatter

jp: .屁のやうな茶もうれる也夏木立
ro: he no yôna cha mo ureru nari natsu kodachi
en:
they even sell tea
not worth a fart!
summer trees

jp: .鶯も隠居じたくの茂り哉
ro: uguisu mo inkyo jitaku no shigeri kana
en:
the nightingale's hermitage
too
in thick summer grasses

jp: .下闇に清めの手水手水哉
ro: shita yami ni kiyome no chôzu chôzu kana
en:
in deep shade
purifying hand washing
hand washing

jp: .下闇や虫もふらふら蓑作る
ro: shita yami ya mushi mo fura-fura mino tsukuru
en:
deep shade--
the worm, too, shakes
making his raincoat

jp: .卯の花の門はわらぢの名代哉
ro: u no hana no kado wa waraji no nadai kana
en:
deutzia blossom gate--
famous straw sandals
for sale

jp: .鬼茨も花咲にけり咲にけり
ro: onibara mo hana saki ni keri saki ni keri
en:
even the thorn bush
is blooming!
blooming!

jp: .わらじ売窓に朝寒始りぬ
ro: waraji uru mado ni asa-zamu hajimarinu
en:
a sandal vendor
at the window, morning's
cold beginning

jp: .大声に夜寒かたるや垣越に
ro: ôgoe ni yozamu kataru ya kaki-goe ni
en:
loud talk
about the cold night...
over the fence

jp: .おもしろう豆の転る夜寒哉
ro: omoshirou mame no korogaru yozamu kana
en:
delightfully the beans
roll and tumble...
a cold night

jp: .垣外へ屁を捨に出る夜寒哉
ro: kaki soto e he wo sute ni deru yozamu kana
en:
going outside the fence
to fart...
a cold night

jp: .ぼつぼつと猫迄帰る夜寒哉
ro: botsu-botsu to neko made kaeru yozamu kana
en:
one by one
even the cats come home...
cold nights

jp: .見上皺見下ル皺の夜寒哉
ro: mi-age shiwa mi-sagaru shiwa no yozamu kana
en:
looking up, wrinkles
looking down, wrinkles...
a cold night

jp: .身一つ是は朝寒夜寒哉
ro: mi hitotsu kore wa asa-zamu yozamu kana
en:
this is my life--
cold mornings
cold nights

jp: .有明や窓からおがむぜん光寺
ro: ariake ya mado kara ogamu zenkôji
en:
moon in the autumn dawn--
prayers from a window
at Zenko Temple

jp: .馬の子も旅に立也秋の暮
ro: uma no ko mo tabi ni tatsu nari aki no kure
en:
the pony also
sets off on a journey...
autumn dusk

jp: .親なしや身に添かげも秋の暮
ro: oya nashi ya mi ni sou kage mo aki no kure
en:
parentless
I only have my shadow...
autumn dusk

jp: .又ことし死損じけり秋の暮
ro: mata kotoshi shini-sonji keri aki no kure
en:
another year
I didn't die...
autumn dusk

jp: .梁の横にさしても名月ぞ
ro: utsubari no yoko ni sashite mo meigetsu zo
en:
next to the roof beam
shining bright...
harvest moon

jp: .ふしぎ也生た家でけふの月
ro: fushigi nari umareta ie de kyô no tsuki
en:
amazing--
in the house I was born
seeing this moon

jp: .名月にけろりと立しかがし哉
ro: meigetsu ni kerori to tatashi kagashi kana
en:
in harvest moonlight
keeping his cool...
scarecrow

jp: .名月や石の上なる茶わん酒
ro: meigetsu ya ishi no ue naru cha wan sake
en:
harvest moon--
on a stone a teacup
filled with sake

jp: .名月やすすきの陰の居酒呑
ro: meigetsu ya susuki no kage no izaka nomi
en:
harvest moon--
in pampas grass shadows
drinking sake

jp: .名月や山のかがしの袂から
ro: meigetsu ya yama no kagashi no tamoto kara
en:
harvest moon
on the mountain scarecrow's
sleeve

jp: .はづかしやおれが心と秋の空
ro: hazukashi ya ore ga kokoro to aki no sora
en:
a wretched shame--
my heart
like the autumn sky

jp: .小庇や砂利打やうな秋の雨
ro: ko-bisashi ya jari utsu yôna aki [no] ame
en:
like pebbles pounding
the eaves...
autumn rain

jp: .秋風の袂にすがる小てふ哉
ro: aki kaze no tamoto ni sugaru ko chô kana
en:
in the autumn wind
clutching my sleeve...
little butterfly

jp: .秋風や鶏なく家のてっぺんに
ro: aki kaze ya tori naku ie no teppen ni
en:
autumn wind--
a cock-a-doodling rooster
on the roof

jp: .のらくらや花の都も秋の風
ro: norakura ya hana no miyako mo aki no kaze
en:
loafing--
even in the blossom capital
autumn wind

jp: .朝々や庵の茶おけの草の露
ro: asa-asa ya io no chaoke no kusa no tsuyu
en:
every morning
enough for my tea kettle...
dew in the grass

jp: .あばら家やむだ骨折って露のおく
ro: abaraya ya muda honeotte tsuyu no oku
en:
my ramshackle hut--
the dewdrops' great exertion
in vain

jp: .けふからは見るもおがむも草の露
ro: kyô kara wa miru mo ogamu mo kusa no tsuyu
en:
from today on
to see is to pray...
dewdrops in the grass

jp: .山霧の足にからまる日暮哉
ro: yama-giri no ashi ni karamaru higure kana
en:
mountain mist
twining 'round my legs...
sunset

jp: .牛もうもうもうと霧から出たりけり
ro: ushi mô mô mô to kiri kara detari keri
en:
moo, moo, moo
from the mist cows
emerge

jp: .大仏や鼻の穴から霧が出る
ro: daibutsu ya hana no ana kara kiri ga deru
en:
from the great bronze
Buddha's nostrils
mist escapes

jp: .大仏や鼻より霧はふはふはと
ro: [daibutsu ya] hana yori kiri wa fuwa-fuwa to
en:
from the great bronze
Buddha's nose mist...
softly, softly

jp: .古郷をとく降かくせ霧時雨
ro: furusato wo toku furikakuse kiri shigure
en:
fall quickly, hide
my home village...
mist and cold rain

jp: .山霧の通り抜たり大座敷
ro: yama-giri no tôri nuketari ôzashiki
en:
mountain mist
just passing through...
big sitting room

jp: .夕晴や浅黄に並ぶ秋の山
ro: yûbare ya asagi ni narabu aki no yama
en:
clear evening--
lined up in the pale blue
autumn mountains

jp: .山里は小便所も花の哉
ro: yama-zato wa shôbenjo mo hanano kana
en:
even the mountain village's
pissing place...
a field of flowers

jp: .逢坂や手馴し駒にいとまごひ
ro: ôsaka ya te nareshi koma ni itomagoi
en:
Osaka--
bidding the tamed pony
farewell

jp: .駒鳴くやけふ望月のはなれ際
ro: koma naku ya kyô bôgetsu no hanare-giwa
en:
the pony neighs--
under a full moon
led away from his mother

jp: .天下泰平と立たるかがし哉
ro: tenka taihei to tachitaru kagashi kana
en:
standing in a world
of tranquility...
the scarecrow

jp: .蜻蛉の寝所したるかがし哉
ro: tombô no ne-dokoro shitaru kagashi kana
en:
the dragonfly
settles to sleep...
on the scarecrow

jp: .昼飯をぶらさげて居るかがし哉
ro: hiru meshi wo burasagete iru kagashi kana
en:
the farmer's lunch
dangles...
on the scarecrow

jp: .こおろぎに唄うたわせて小夜砧
ro: kôrogi ni uta uta[wa]sete sayo-ginuta
en:
accompanying
the cricket's song...
pounding cloth at night

jp: .小夜砧見かねて猫のうかれけり
ro: sayo-ginuta mikanete neko no ukare keri
en:
pounding cloth at night--
the cat that can't stand it
happy-go-lucky

jp: .故郷は寝ながらもうつ砧哉
ro: furusato wa ne nagara mo utsu kinuta kana
en:
home village--
even in their sleep pounding
cloth

jp: .なくな雁けふから我も旅人ぞ
ro: naku na kari kyô kara ware mo tabibito zo
en:
don't cry, geese!
from now on
I'm a traveler too

jp: .うつくしい鳥はだまって渡りけり
ro: utsukushii tori wa damatte watari keri
en:
a pretty bird
passes in silence...
migrating

jp: .来るも来るも同じつれなり渡り鳥
ro: kuru mo kuru mo onaji tsure nari watari-dori
en:
again and again
my same companion...
migrating bird

jp: .むさい家もすぐ通りせず渡り鳥
ro: musai ie mo sugu tôri sezu watari-dori
en:
don't pass by
my crappy house too!
migrating birds

jp: .手枕や虫も夜なべを鳴中に
ro: temakura ya mushi mo yonabe wo naku naka ni
en:
an arm for a pillow--
insects, too, do their night work
while singing

jp: .仰のけに寝て鳴にけり秋の蝉
ro: aonoke ni nete naki ni keri aki no semi
en:
lying belly-up
yet still singing...
autumn cicada

jp: .ついついとから身でさわぐ蜻蛉哉
ro: tsui-tsui to kara mi de sawagu tombo kana
en:
swish swish
his body's husk...
dragonfly

jp: .蜻蛉の夜かせぎしたり門の月
ro: tombô no yo kasegi shitari kado no tsuki
en:
the dragonfly goes about
his night work...
moon at the gate

jp: .ばん石にかぢり付たるとんぼ哉
ro: banjaku ni kajiritsuketaru tombo kana
en:
holding fast
to the boulder...
a dragonfly

jp: .我門に煤びた色のとんぼ哉
ro: waga kado [ni] susubita iro no tombo kana
en:
at my gate
just a soot-colored
dragonfly

jp: .きりぎりす庵の柱をかじりけり
ro: kirigirisu io no hashira wo kajiri keri
en:
the katydid
on my hut's post
gnawing away

jp: .きりぎりす尿瓶のおともほそる夜ぞ
ro: kirigirisu shibin no oto mo hosoru yo zo
en:
katydid's song
and my tinkling in the piss-pot
weaken in the night

jp: .米箱に住かはりけりきりぎりす
ro: komebako ni sumi-kawari keri kirigirisu
en:
moving to live
in the rice box...
katydid

jp: .小むしろや粉にまぶれしきりぎりす
ro: samushiro ya kona ni mabureshi kirigirisu
en:
little straw mat--
dusted with flour
the katydid

jp: .白露の玉ふみかくなきりぎりす
ro: shira tsuyu no tama fumika[ku] na kirigirisu
en:
don't crush
the dewdrop pearls!
katydid

jp: .寝返りをするぞそこのけきりぎりす
ro: negaeri wo suru zo soko noke kirigirisu
en:
turning over in bed--
move aside!
katydid

jp: .山犬の穴の中よりきりぎりす
ro: yama inu no ana no naka yori kirigirisu
en:
crawling out
the wild dog's hole...
a katydid

jp: .女郎花からみ付けり皺足に
ro: ominaeshi karamitsuki keri shiwa ashi ni
en:
entwined
by the maiden flower...
my wrinkled foot

jp: .我家をくねり倒すな女郎花
ro: waga ie wo kuneri tao[su]na ominaeshi
en:
don't shake my house
down!
maiden flower

jp: .鹿の子はとっていくつぞ萩の花
ro: shika no ko wa totte ikutsu zo hagi [no] hana
en:
that fawn--
how old is it?
blooming bush clover

jp: .山の井を花で埋る小萩哉
ro: yama no i wo hana de uzumuru ko hagi kana
en:
the mountain well
all clogged up...
bush clover blooms

jp: .かくれ家や一人前のそばの花
ro: kakurega ya ichinimmae no soba no hana
en:
secluded house--
enough buckwheat blooms
for one

jp: .庵の田やどうやら斯うやら稲に出る
ro: io no ta ya dô yara kô yara ine ni ideru
en:
my hut's rice field
somehow pulled it off...
harvest time

jp: .今の世はすすきも縞を吹れけり
ro: ima no yo wa susuki mo shima wo fukare keri
en:
this world today--
even pampas grass
is blown in stripes

jp: .くやしくも熟柿仲間の座につきぬ
ro: kuyashiku mo jukushi nakama no za ni tsukinu
en:
regretfully I've joined them--
the mushy
persimmon eaters

jp: .渋柿をはむは烏のまま子哉
ro: shibugaki wo hamu wa karasu no mamako kana
en:
eating the astringent
persimmon, the crow
stepchild

jp: .高枝や渋柿一つなつかしき
ro: taka eda ya shibugaki hitotsu natsukashiki
en:
on the high branch
one astringent persimmon...
like old times

jp: .老が世に桃太郎も出よ捨瓢
ro: oi ga yo ni momotarô mo deyo sute fukube
en:
to an old man's world
Peach Boy, come out!
hollow gourd

jp: .大栗や旅人衆に拾はるる
ro: ôguri ya tabibito shû ni hirowaruru
en:
big chestnuts--
the travelers stop
and gather

jp: .茹栗と一所に終るはなし哉
ro: yude-guri to isshô ni owaru hanashi kana
en:
with the boiled chestnuts
finished, so is
the conversation

jp: .御地蔵よ我も是からかみな月
ro: o-jizô yo ware mo kore kara kamina-zuki
en:
holy Jizo--
for me, too, winter
begins

jp: .有明や壁の穴から寒が入
ro: ariake ya kabe no ana kara kan ga iru
en:
dawn--
through a hole in the wall
the cold

jp: .古盆の灰で手習ふ寒さ哉
ro: furu bon no hai de tenarau samu[sa] kana
en:
drawing words
in an old tray's ashes...
winter cold

jp: .僧正の天窓で折し氷柱哉
ro: sôjô no atama de orishi tsurara kana
en:
using his head
the high priest breaking
icicles

jp: .年の内に春は来にけりいらぬ世話
ro: toshi no uchi ni haru wa ki ni keri iranu sewa
en:
the year's not over
but spring comes anyway...
who cares?!

jp: .羽生へて銭がとぶ也としの暮
ro: hane haete zeni ga tobu nari toshi no kure
en:
my money sprouted wings
and flew away...
the year ends

jp: .有がたや能なし窓の日も伸る
ro: arigata ya nô nashi mado no hi mo nobiru
en:
the way things are--
through my worthless window
days grow longer

jp: .むだ草や汝も伸る日も伸る
ro: muda-gusa ya nanji mo nobiru hi mo nobiru
en:
vain grass--
you grow longer
as do the days

jp: .石切のかちかち山や冬の月
ro: ishikiri no kachi-kachi yama ya fuyu no tsuki
en:
the stonecutter
chop-chops the mountain...
winter moon

jp: .下駄音や庵へ曲ル冬の月
ro: geta oto ya iori e magaru fuyu no tsuki
en:
clacking clogs
turn toward my hut...
winter moon

jp: .金比羅の幟ひらひら冬の月
ro: konpira no nobori hira-hira fuyu no tsuki
en:
the god Kompira's
banner fluttering...
winter moon

jp: .四五寸の橘赤し冬の月
ro: shi go sun no tachibana akashi fuyu no tsuki
en:
a five or six inch
red mandarine orange...
winter moon

jp: .笛ぴいぴい杖もかちかち冬の月
ro: fue pii-pii tsue mo kachi-kachi fuyu no tsuki
en:
a toy flute trills
a cane click-clacks...
winter moon

jp: .ふんどしに脇ざしさして冬の月
ro: fundoshi ni wakizashi sashite fuyu no tsuki
en:
a short sword
stuck in his loincloth...
winter moon

jp: .むだ人や冬の月夜をぶらぶらと
ro: muda hito ya fuyu no tsuki yo wo bura-bura to
en:
vain mankind--
idling away this night
of winter moon

jp: .我はけば音せる下駄ぞ冬の月
ro: ware hakeba oto seru geta zo fuyu no tsuki
en:
in my wooden clogs
raising a racket!
winter moon

jp: .寒月やむだ呼されし座頭坊
ro: kangetsu ya muda yobisareshi zatôbô
en:
cold moon--
the blind priest is called
by mistake

jp: .棒突や石にかんかん寒の月
ro: bô tsuku ya ishi ni kan-kan kan no tsuki
en:
a cane strikes stone
clack-clack...
cold moon

jp: .義中寺や拙者も是にはつ時雨
ro: gichû ji ya sessha mo kore ni hatsu shigure
en:
Gichu Temple--
I'm here too
first winter rain

jp: .干栗の数珠もいく連初時雨
ro: hoshiguri no juzu mo iku ren hatsu shigure
en:
round and round
the dried chestnut rosary...
first winter rain

jp: .小便の供がつくばふ時雨哉
ro: shôben no tomo ga tsukubau shigure kana
en:
the outhouse attendant
squats...
under the winter rain

jp: .一時雨行あたりけりうしろ窓
ro: hito shigure yuki-atari keri ushiro mado
en:
a winter rain
bumps into the back
window

jp: .古郷や時雨当りに立仏
ro: furusato ya shigure atari ni tatsu hotoke
en:
my home village--
the winter rain targets
a standing Buddha

jp: .冬の雨火箸をもして遊びけり
ro: fuyu no ame hibashi wo moshite asobi keri
en:
winter rain--
burning the fire chopsticks
for fun

jp: .木がらしや餌蒔の跡をおふ烏
ro: kokgarashi ya emaki no ato wo ou karasu
en:
winter wind--
behind the farmer sowing seeds
a crow

jp: .鉄棒のからりからりやちる霰
ro: tetsubô no karari-karari ya chiru arare
en:
the iron rod
goes cling! clang!
a hailstorm

jp: .指さして笑ふ仏よ玉丸雪
ro: yubisashite warau-botoke yo tama arare
en:
the laughing Buddha
points...
at a hailstone

jp: .おく霜のたしに捨たる髻哉
ro: oku shimo no tashi ni sutetaru tabusa kana
en:
adding to the frost
the samurai's discarded
topknot

jp: .氏神の留主事さわぐ烏哉
ro: ujigami no rusu koto sawagu karasu kana
en:
with our gods out of town
they raise a ruckus...
crows

jp: .翁忌や何やらしゃべる門雀
ro: okinaki ya naniyara shaberu kado suzume
en:
Basho's Death-Day--
what are you chattering
sparrows at my gate?

jp: .梟も一句侍れ此時雨
ro: fukurô mo ikku hanbere kono shigure
en:
you too owl
dedicate a haiku...
this winter rain

jp: .杉箸で火をはさみけり夷講
ro: sugi-bashi de hi wo hasami keri ebisu kô
en:
cedar chopsticks
hold the flame...
God of Wealth Festival

jp: .御烏もついと並ぶや煤祝
ro: o-karasu mo tsui to narabu ya susu iwai
en:
Sir Crow too
quickly gets in line...
for soot sweeping

jp: .我家は団扇で煤をはらひけり
ro: waga ie wa uchiwa de susu wo harai keri
en:
my house--
I sweep its soot
with a fan

jp: .庵の餅つくにも千代を諷ひけり
ro: io no mochi tsuku ni mo chiyo wo utai keri
en:
even pounding rice cakes
at my hut, I chant
"Great Japan!"

jp: .犬のぶん烏の餅も搗にけり
ro: inu [no] bun karasu no mochi mo tsuki ni keri
en:
for the dog
and crow too...
pounding rice cakes

jp: .町並やどんな庵でも餅さわぎ
ro: machinami ya donna io demo mochi sawagi
en:
row of houses--
from every one of them
a rice cake commotion

jp: .餅とぶやぴたりと犬の大口へ
ro: mochi tobu ya pitari to inu no ôkuchi e
en:
the rice cake flies
smack into the dog's
open mouth

jp: .麦蒔て妻有寺としられけり
ro: mugi maite tsuma aru tera to shirare keri
en:
the wife sowing wheat--
it's that
kind of temple

jp: .松の月頭巾序に見たりけり
ro: matsu no tsuki zukin tsuide ni mitari keri
en:
looking at the moon
in the pine...
skullcaps too

jp: .初ものや雪も仏につくらるる
ro: hatsumono ya yuki mo hotoke ni tsukuraruru
en:
first of the season--
the snow, too
made into Buddha

jp: .我門は雪で作るも小仏ぞ
ro: waga kado wa yuki de tsukuru mo ko-botoke zo
en:
at my gate too
made of snow...
little Buddha

jp: .我とてもおがむ気になる雪仏
ro: ware totemo ogamu ki ni naru yuki-botoke
en:
putting me into
a praying mood...
snow Buddha

jp: .屁くらべが又始るぞ冬篭
ro: he kurabe ga mata hajimaru zo fuyugomori
en:
the farting contest
begins again...
winter seclusion

jp: .京辺や冬篭さへいそがしき
ro: miyakobe ya fuyugomori sae isogashiki
en:
in a Kyoto suburb
even "winter seclusion"...
hustle and bustle

jp: .ほたの火や仏もずらり並びつつ
ro: hota no hi ya hotoke mo zurari narabi tsutsu
en:
a cozy wood fire--
the Buddhas too
all lined up

jp: .大江戸や只四五文も薬喰
ro: ôedo ya tada shi go mon mo kusuri-gui
en:
great Edo--
four or five pennies
for medicine

jp: .薬喰から始るやあばれ喰
ro: kusuri kuu kara hajimaru ya abare kuu
en:
after taking medicine
it begins...
the eating binge

jp: .松の葉を添て送れし薬喰
ro: matsu no ha wo soete okurareshi kusuri kuu
en:
after eating pine needles
a chaser
of medicine

jp: .から鮭の口へさしけり梅の花
ro: karazake no kuchi e sashi keri ume no hana
en:
thrust into
the dried salmon's mouth
plum blossoms

jp: .から鮭も敲ば鳴ぞなむあみだ
ro: karazake mo tatakeba naku zo namu amida
en:
beating time
on a dried salmon too...
praise Buddha!

jp: .鶯の倅が鳴ぞあれなくぞ
ro: uguisu no segare ga naku zo are naku zo
en:
the nightingale's son
is singing!
he's singing!

jp: .せい出してうぐひすも鳴けいこ哉
ro: seidashite uguisu mo naku keiko kana
en:
slaving away--
even the nightingale
has a singing lesson

jp: .入相に少もさわがずみそさざい
ro: iriai ni sukoshi mo sawagazu misosazai
en:
at sunset
not another peep...
little wren

jp: .みそさざい大事の大事三十日ぞと
ro: misosazai daiji no daiji misoka zo to
en:
wrens chirping--
"It's our big day
the 30th!"

jp: .汝等も福を待かよ浮寝鳥
ro: nanjira mo fuku wo matsu ka yo ukinedori
en:
are you, too
waiting for good luck?
waterfowl

jp: .横柄にまかり出たる鰒哉
ro: ôhei ni makari-idetaru fukuto kana
en:
arrogantly
he presents himself...
the pufferfish

jp: .さる人のそぶりに似たり鰒の面
ro: saru hito no soburi ni nitari fugu no tsura
en:
the guy who just left
looked the same...
face of a pufferfish

jp: .さる人の面にも似たり鰒哉
ro: saru hito no tsura ni mo nitari fukuto kana
en:
the guy who just left
had a similar face...
pufferfish

jp: .誰やらが面にも似たる鰒哉
ro: dare yara ga tsura ni mo nitaru fukuto kana
en:
someone I know
has a similar face...
pufferfish

jp: .枯草と一つ色なる小家哉
ro: karegusa to hitotsu iro naru ko ie kana
en:
the same color
as the winter hay...
little house

jp: .とがとがし枯ても針のある草は
ro: toga-togashi karete mo hari no aru kusa wa
en:
putting up a fight--
withered grasses
with prickles

jp: .女郎花何の因果に枯かねる
ro: ominaeshi nan no inga ni karekaneru
en:
maiden flower
for what karmic reason
do you not fade?

jp: .庵の大根客有度引れけり
ro: io no daikon kyaku aru tabi ni hikare keri
en:
hut's radish--
when there's a visitor
you'll be yanked

jp: .人の世や木の葉かくさへ叱らるる
ro: hito no yo ya ko [no] ha kaku sae shikararuru
en:
world of man--
even raking leaves
brings a scolding

jp: .かれがれや一緒に超し角田川
ro: kare-gare ya issho ni koeshi sumida-gawa
en:
winter withering--
we cross Sumida River
together

jp: .霜がれにとろとろせいび参り哉
ro: shimogare ni toro-toro seibi mairi kana
en:
in frost-killed grass
to Seibi's house, slowly
I go

jp: .霜がれや米くれろとて鳴雀
ro: shimogare ya kome kurero tote naku suzume
en:
frost-killed grass
"Gimme rice!"
a sparrow sings

jp: .霜がれや何を手向にせいび仏
ro: shimogare ya nani[wo] tamuke ni seibi-butsu
en:
frost-killed grass--
what tribute can I offer
Seibi, now a Buddha?

jp: .竹ぎれで手習ひをするまま子哉
ro: takegire de tenarai [wo] suru mamako kana
en:
with a bamboo splinter
practicing calligraphy...
the stepchild

jp: .元日をするや揃ふて小田の雁
ro: ganjitsu wo suru ya sorou[te] oda no kari
en:
celebrating New Year's
en masse...
rice field geese

jp: .小菜畠元日さへをしたりけり
ro: ko na-batake ganjitsu sae wo shitari keri
en:
little farm field--
even here
it's New Year's Day

jp: .ぬくぬくと元日するや寺の縁
ro: nuku-nuku to ganjitsu suru ya tera no heri
en:
warmly
I greet the new year...
temple verandah

jp: .鑓にやり大元日の通り哉
ro: yari ni yari ôganjitsu no tôri kana
en:
spear after spear
on New Year's Day
they pass

jp: .我門は昼過からが元日ぞ
ro: waga kado wa hiru sugi kara ga ganjitsu zo
en:
at my gate
New Year's starts
at noon

jp: .影ぼしもまめ息災でけさの春
ro: kageboshi mo mame sokusai de kesa no haru
en:
my shadow too
in good health...
dawn of spring

jp: .ちりじりに居てもする也花の春
ro: chiri-jiri ni ite mo suru nari hana no haru
en:
though far from home
a new spring
is blossoming

jp: .春立や牛にも馬にもふまれずに
ro: haru tatsu ya ushi ni mo uma nimo fumarezu ni
en:
a new spring--
neither cow nor horse
has trod on it

jp: .誂の通り浅黄のはつ空ぞ
ro: atsurae no tôri asagi no hatsu-zora zo
en:
a made-to-order
pale blue...
the year's first sky

jp: .草枕雨のない日が初空ぞ
ro: kusamakura ame no nai hi ga hatzu-zora zo
en:
traveling--
and a rainless day
for the year's first sky!

jp: .初空をはやしこそすれ雀迄
ro: hatsu-zora wo hayashi koso sure suzume made
en:
cheer the year's
first sky...
even sparrows!

jp: .初空を夜着の袖から見たりけり
ro: hatsu-zora wo yogi no sode kara mitari keri
en:
through my pajama sleeve
taking a peek...
the year's first sky

jp: .はつ空にはやきず付るけぶり哉
ro: hatsu-zora ni haya kizu tsukeru keburi kana
en:
the year's first sky's
first blemish...
smoke

jp: .はつ空の祝儀や雪のちらちらと
ro: hatsuzora no shûgi ya yuki no chira-chira to
en:
the year's first sky
gives a gift...
snow flitting down

jp: .初空の行留り也上総山
ro: hatsuzora no yukidomari nari kazusa yama
en:
the year's first sky
hits a dead end...
Kazusa mountains

jp: .うらの戸や北より三が明の方
ro: ura no to ya kita yori san ga aki no hô
en:
back door facing south--
three directions
for my New Year's walk

jp: .薮入が必ず立や思案橋
ro: yabuiri ga kanara[zu] tatsu ya shian-bashi
en:
the homecoming servants
all stop here...
Meditation Bridge

jp: .薮入が薮入の駕かきにけり
ro: yabuiri ga yabuiri no kago kaki ni keri
en:
servants on holiday
carry a servant on holiday...
palanquin

jp: .薮入の片はなもつや奉加橋
ro: yabuiri no kata-hana motsu ya hôga-bashi
en:
the homecoming servants
pay their share...
Hoga Bridge

jp: .薮入や犬も見送るかすむ迄
ro: yabuiri ya inu mo miokuru kasumu made
en:
the Servants' Holiday is over--
the dog, too, sees him off
in the mist

jp: .薮入や涙先立人の親
ro: yabuiri ya namida sakidatsu hito no oya
en:
homecoming servant--
tears precede everything
for the parents

jp: .薮入や二人して見る又打山
ro: yabuiri ya futari shite miru matchi yama
en:
Servants' Holiday--
two sighted
on Mount Matchi

jp: .薮入や三組一つに成田道
ro: yabuiri ya mikumi hitotsu ni narita michi
en:
servants on holiday--
three of them
on Narita Road

jp: .烏帽子きてどさり寝ころぶ子の日哉
ro: eboshi kite dosari ne-korobu ne [no] hi kana
en:
in his courtier's cap
flopped down to sleep...
first day of Rat

jp: .太刀佩て芝に寝ころぶ子の日哉
ro: tachi haite shiba ni ne-korobu ne [no] hi kana
en:
with a sword strapped on
he sleeps on the lawn...
first day of Rat

jp: .我庵や元日も来る雑煮売
ro: waga io ya ganjitsu mo kuru zôni uri
en:
to my hut too
New Year's arrives...
the zoni vendor

jp: .七草を打ってそれから寝役哉
ro: nanakusa wo utte sore kara ne yaku kana
en:
after pounding
the seven herbs of health...
he sleeps

jp: .餅臼に鶏諷ひけり君が代と
ro: mochi usu ni tori utai keri kimi ga yo to
en:
on the rice cake mill
the rooster sings too
"Oh Great Japan!"

jp: .春雨や薮に吹るる捨手紙
ro: harusame ya yabu ni fukaruru sute tegami
en:
spring rain--
in the thicket
a discarded letter blows

jp: .春風や犬の寝聳るわたし舟
ro: haru kaze ya inu no nesoberu watashibune
en:
spring breeze--
a dog stretched to sleep
in the ferryboat

jp: .春風や八文芝居だんご茶や
ro: harukaze ya hachi mon shibai dango chaya
en:
spring breeze--
an eight-penny play
a tea-and-dumpling shop

jp: .春風やおばは四十九でしなの道
ro: haru kaze ya obaba shi jû ku de shinano michi
en:
spring breeze--
forty-nine old women
on the Shinano road

jp: .笠でするさらばさらばや薄がすみ
ro: kasa de suru saraba saraba ya usu-gasumi
en:
waving umbrella-hats
farewell! farewell!
thin mist

jp: .呉服やの朝声かすみかかりけり
ro: gofukuya no asa koe kasumi kakari keri
en:
voices in the dry goods store
hang
on the mist

jp: .吼る犬かすみの衣きたりけり
ro: hoeru inu kasumi no koromo ki[ta]ri keri
en:
the barking dog
is wearing a robe...
of mist

jp: .旅浴衣雪はくりくりとけにけり
ro: tabi yukata yuki wa kuri-kuri toke ni keri
en:
travelers in bathrobes--
snow has melted
clean away!

jp: .とけ残る雪や草履がおもしろい
ro: toke nokoru yuki ya zôri ga omoshiroi
en:
the last snow pile--
straw clogs make it
a delight

jp: .町並や雪とかすにも銭がいる
ro: machinami ya yuki tokasu ni mo zeni ga iru
en:
a row of houses--
even melting snow
costs money

jp: .雪どけや大手ひろげし立ち榎
ro: yuki-doke ya ôtehirogeshi ta[chi] enoki
en:
snow has melted--
plenty of elbow room
for the nettle tree

jp: .雪どけや鷺が三疋立臼に
ro: yuki-doke ya sagi ga sambiki tachi usu ni
en:
snow melting--
three herons perch
on the rice cake tub

jp: .畠打や尾上の松を友として
ro: hata uchi ya onoe no matsu wo tomo to shite
en:
plowing the field
he keeps the mountain ridge pine
company

jp: .有明にかこち顔也夫婦猫
ro: ariake ni kakochi kao nari meoto neko
en:
at daybreak
what grouchy faces...
Mr. and Mrs. Cat

jp: .庵の猫しゃがれ声にてうかれけり
ro: io no neko shagare koe nite ukare keri
en:
my hut's cat
with a hoarse voice
goes carousing

jp: .うかれきて鶏追まくる男猫哉
ro: ukare kite tori oimakuru oneko kana
en:
so love-crazed
he even chases a chicken...
tomcat

jp: .浄はりの鏡見よ見よ猫の恋
ro: jôhari no kagami mi yo mi yo neko no koi
en:
into hell's mirror
look! look!
lover cat

jp: .竹の雨ざっぷり浴て猫の恋
ro: take no ame zappuri abite neko no koi
en:
the rain in bamboo
a drenching bath...
lover cat

jp: .寝て起て大欠して猫の恋
ro: nete okite ôakubi shite neko no koi
en:
he sleeps, he wakes
has a big yawn...
the cat goes courting

jp: .ばか猫や身体ぎりのうかれ声
ro: baka neko ya shintai-giri no ukare koe
en:
fool cat--
putting his whole body
into his yowl

jp: .屋根の声見たばかり也不精猫
ro: yane no koe mita bakari nari bushô neko
en:
just a glance
at the yowler on the roof...
lazy cat

jp: .山寺や祖師のゆるしの猫の恋
ro: yamadera ya soshi no yurushi no neko no koi
en:
mountain temple--
with the Founder's blessing
cats make love

jp: .よい所があらば帰るなうかれ猫
ro: yoi tokoro ga araba kaeru na ukare neko
en:
if he finds a good place
he won't return...
love-crazed cat

jp: .我猫が盗みするとの浮名哉
ro: waga neko ga nusumi suru to no ukina kana
en:
my cat is known
as a thief of hearts
scandalous!

jp: .親としてかくれんぼする子猫哉
ro: oya to shite kakurenbo suru ko neko kana
en:
mother cat
plays hide-and-seek...
with her kittens

jp: .雀子やお竹如来の流し元
ro: suzumego ya otake nyorai no nagashimoto
en:
baby sparrow
is O-Take Buddha
at the sink

jp: .鶯の涙か曇る鈴鹿山
ro: uguisu no namida ka kumoru suzuka yama
en:
is the nightingale weeping
at your cloudiness?
Mount Suzuka

jp: .鶯が命の親の御墓哉
ro: uguisu ga inochi no oya no o-haka kana
en:
nightingale
a fount of life
at the grave

jp: .鶯も添て五文の茶代哉
ro: uguisu mo soete go mon no chadai kana
en:
a nightingale singing
included in the price...
five-penny tea

jp: .鶯や大盃のぬれ色に
ro: uguisu ya ôsakazuki no nure iro ni
en:
nightingale
in the big sake cup's
wet color

jp: .鶯やたばこけぶりもかまはずに
ro: uguisu ya tabako kemuri mo kamawazu ni
en:
nightingale--
he doesn't mind
my pipe smoke

jp: .鶯よ弥勒十年から来たか
ro: uguisu yo miroku jû nen kara kita ka
en:
nightingale--
did you come ten years after
the Future Buddha?

jp: .けふ迄はようしんぼした門の雁
ro: kyô made wa yô shi[m]bo shita kado no kari
en:
up to today
such great perserverance...
goose at my gate

jp: .夜伽してくれたる雁も帰りけり
ro: yotogi shite kuretaru kari mo kaeri keri
en:
after many nights
telling me bedtime stories
the geese have left

jp: .桶伏の猫を見舞やとぶ小蝶
ro: okebuse no neko wo mimau ya tobu ko chô
en:
visiting the cat
on the turned-over tub...
little butterfly

jp: .蝶の身も業の秤にかかる哉
ro: chô no mi mo gô no hakari ni kakaru kana
en:
the butterfly too
on the scales of karma
is weighed

jp: .ぬかるみに尻もちつくなでかい蝶
ro: nukarumi ni shiri mochitsuku na dekai chô
en:
don't dip your butt
in that mud!
big butterfly

jp: .春の蝶平気で上座いたす也
ro: haru no chô heiki de jôza itasu nari
en:
a spring butterfly
peaceful, calm
in the seat of honor

jp: .それ虻に世話をやかすなせうじ窓
ro: sore abu ni sewa wo yakasu na shôji mado
en:
don't be mean
to that horsefly
paper door!

jp: .又虻に世話をやかすぞ明り窓
