ro: mata abu ni sewa wo yakasu zo akarimado
en:
once again
giving a horsefly grief
skylight

jp: .梅を折る手が浄はりにうつりけり
ro: ume wo oru te ga jôhari ni utsuri keri
en:
the hand that broke off
the plum blossom branch...
in hell's mirror

jp: .梅折やえんまの帳につく合点
ro: ume oru ya emma no chô ni tsuku gaten
en:
plum blossom thievery--
added to the account book
of hell's king Emma

jp: .梅がかに喰あひのない烏哉
ro: ume ga ka ni kuiai no nai karasu kana
en:
in plum blossom scent
they stop fighting...
crows

jp: .梅咲て虱の孫も遊ぶぞよ
ro: ume saite shirami no mago mo asobu zo yo
en:
plum blossoming--
how the lice's grandchildren
play!

jp: .梅咲くや現金酒の通帳
ro: ume saku ya genkin-zake no kayoichô
en:
plum blossoms--
in my account book I enter
"cash for sake"

jp: .梅の木にわる口たたく烏哉
ro: ume no ki ni waru-guchi tataku karasu kana
en:
cursing like sailors
in the plum tree...
crows

jp: .おさなごや尿やりながら梅の花
ro: osanago ya shito yari nagara ume no hana
en:
little child--
while Mama helps him pee-pee
plum blossoms

jp: .方々は草履道也梅の花
ro: kata-kata wa zôri michi nari ume no hana
en:
on one side
sandal tracks, the other
plum blossoms

jp: .がらがらやぴいぴいうりや梅の花
ro: gara-gara ya pii-pii uri ya ume no hana
en:
the toy flute seller
clatters along...
plum blossoms

jp: .さをしかはとっていくつぞ梅の花
ro: saoshika wa totte ikutsu zo ume no hana
en:
young buck--
how many is he taking?
plum blossoms

jp: .雀らになぶられてさく野梅哉
ro: suzumera ni naburarete saku no ume kana
en:
made fun of
by the sparrows...
the field's blooming plum trees

jp: .線香にいぶされつつも梅の花
ro: senkô ni ibusare tsutsu mo ume no hana
en:
though smoky
with incense
plum trees in bloom

jp: .野仏も赤い頭巾や梅の花
ro: no-botoke mo akai zukin ya ume no hana
en:
the Buddha in the field
with a red skullcap...
plum blossoms

jp: .隙さうな里也梅のだらり咲
ro: hima sôna sato nari ume no darari saku
en:
a village of slackers
lackadaisical
plum blossoms

jp: .不精犬寝て吼る也梅の咲
ro: bushô inu nete hoeru nari ume no saku
en:
the lazy dog
barks lying down...
plum trees in bloom

jp: .道の記や一つ月一つ梅の花
ro: michi no ki ya hitotsu tsuki hitotsu ume no hana
en:
travel journal--
one moon
one blooming plum tree

jp: .都ぢや梅干茶屋の梅の花
ro: miyakoji ya umeboshi chaya no ume no hana
en:
road to Kyoto--
at the pickled plum teahouse
plum blossoms

jp: .いういうと茨のおくの野梅哉
ro: iu-iu to ibara no oku no no ume kana
en:
cool and calm
deep in the thorn thicket...
blooming plum

jp: .おとろへや花を折にも口曲げる
ro: otoroe ya hana wo oru ni mo kuchi mageru
en:
growing feeble--
breaking off blossoms
with twisted mouth

jp: .深山木やしなのの育の花盛
ro: miyamagi ya shinano no sodachi [no] hana-zakari
en:
deep wooded mountains--
home-grown in Shinano
glorious blossoms

jp: .ばばが餅爺が桜咲にけり
ro: baba ga mochi jijii ga sakura saki ni keri
en:
grandma's rice cakes
grandpa's cherry tree
in bloom

jp: .窮屈に並られけり山桜
ro: kyûkutsu ni naraberare keri yama-zakura
en:
trees lined up
cramped together...
mountain cherry blossoms

jp: .三文が桜植けり吉野山
ro: san mon ga sakura ue keri yoshino yama
en:
for three pennies
a cherry tree for planting...
Yoshino Hill

jp: .素人の念仏にさへ桜ちる
ro: shirôto no nembutsu ni sae sakura chiru
en:
even a layman
praises Amida Buddha...
cherry blossoms fall

jp: .釣人の邪魔を折々桜哉
ro: tsuribito no jama wo ori-ori sakura kana
en:
distracting the fisherman
now and then...
cherry blossoms

jp: .釣人やいまいましいと夕桜
ro: tsuribito ya ima-imashii to yûzakura
en:
for the fisherman
they're a nuisance...
evening cherry blossoms

jp: .天下泰平とうに咲桜哉
ro: tenka taihei tô ni saku sakura kana
en:
peace to the world
from time immemorial...
cherry blossoms

jp: .手の込んだ草の花ぞよ短夜に
ro: te no konda kusa no hana zo yo mijika yo ni
en:
such intricate
wildflowers bloomed!
in one short night

jp: .短夜にさて手の込んだ草の花
ro: mijika yo ya sate te no konda kusa no hana
en:
from one short night--
how intricate
the wildflowers

jp: .短夜や草はついついついと咲
ro: mijika yo ya kusa wa tsui-tsui-tsui to saku
en:
short summer night--
the grasses bloom
swish, swish, swish!

jp: .短夜を嬉しがりけり隠居村
ro: mijika yo wo ureshigari keri inkyo mura
en:
a short summer night
of rejoicing...
secluded village

jp: .遊女めが見てけっかるぞ暑い舟
ro: yûjome ga mite kekkaru zo atsui fune
en:
the whores
are looking me over...
from their boat in the heat

jp: .夕涼や汁の実を釣るせどの海
ro: yûsuzu ya shiru no mi wo tsuru sedo no umi
en:
evening cool--
fishing for soup stock
in his back door sea

jp: .我宿といふばかりでも涼しさよ
ro: waga yado to iu bakari demo suzushisa yo
en:
just saying the words
"my house"
the cool air!

jp: .入梅や蟹かけ歩大座敷
ro: nyûbai ya kani kake-aruku ôzashiki
en:
rainy season--
a crab strolls into
the big sitting room

jp: .入梅の晴損ひや箱根山
ro: nyûbai no hare-zokonai ya hakone yama
en:
the rainy season is over
everywhere else...
Mount Hakone

jp: .下手晴の入梅の山雲又出たぞ
ro: heta-bare no tsuyu no yama kumo mata deta zo
en:
some "clear day"!
rainy season clouds again
on the mountain

jp: .ざぶざぶと五月雨る也法華原
ro: zabu-zabu to samidaruru nari hôkebara
en:
splish splash
drenched in Fifth Month rain
Lotus Field

jp: .手始はおれが草家か五月雨
ro: tehajime wa ore ga kusaya ka satsuki ame
en:
must you start
with my thatched hut?
Fifth Month rain

jp: .夕立や祈らぬむらは三度迄
ro: yûdachi ya inoranu mura wa san do made
en:
cloudbursts--
the village that doesn't pray
gets three

jp: .大の字に寝て見たりけり雲の峰
ro: dai no ji ni nete mitari keri kumo no mine
en:
lying spread-eagle
and watching...
the peaks of clouds

jp: .今一度婆々もかぶれよつくま鍋
ro: ima ichi do baba mo kabure yo tsukuma nabe
en:
once again
grannies, wear them too!
pots on heads

jp: .入相の鐘にちらばふ鵜舟哉
ro: iriai no kane ni chirabau u-bune kana
en:
at sunset's bell
they scatter...
cormorant boats

jp: .門出の鵜に馳走する妻よ子よ
ro: kado ide no u ni chisô suru tsuma yo ko yo
en:
going out the gate
the cormorant's treated royally...
wife, child

jp: .一村やうにかせがせて夕枕
ro: hito mura ya u ni kasegasete yûmakura
en:
the whole town sleeps
while the cormorants
toil

jp: .雨乞にから鉄砲のきげん哉
ro: amagoi ni kara teppô no kigen kana
en:
after praying for rain
in a mood
to shoot the musket

jp: .蚊所がくらしよいぞよ裸組
ro: ka tokoro ga kurashi yoi zo yo hadaka-gumi
en:
for the mosquitoes
life is good...
a naked party

jp: .門並に替もおかし苔衣
ro: kadonami ni kaeru mo okashi kokegoromo
en:
as for everyone else
clothes-changing is fun...
new summer robe

jp: .誰か又我死がらで更衣
ro: dare ka mata waga shinigara de koromogae
en:
when I'm dead
who'll wear it next?
new summer robe

jp: .のらくらも御代のけしきぞ更衣
ro: norakura mo miyo no keshiki zo koromogae
en:
even the loafer
looks imperial!
new summer robe

jp: .念仏の給金とりや初袷
ro: nembutsu no kyûkin tori ya hatsu awase
en:
his prayers for pay
pay off...
a new summer kimono

jp: .一人呑茶も朔日ぞ青簾
ro: hitori nomu cha mo tsuitachi zo ao sudare
en:
drinking tea alone
on the month's first day...
green bamboo blinds

jp: .剰へ反古の紙帳ぞ紙帳ぞよ
ro: amatsusa[e] hogu no shichô zo shichô zo yo
en:
recycling--
waste paper mosquito net!
mosquito net!

jp: .月さすや紙の蚊屋でもおれが家
ro: tsuki sasu ya kami no kaya demo ore ga ie
en:
the moon shines--
this paper mosquito net
my home

jp: .画団扇やあつかましくも菩薩顔
ro: e uchiwa ya atsukamashi[ku] mo bosatsu kao
en:
the face on my paper fan
is shameless...
but a saint!

jp: .天から下りた顔して団扇哉
ro: ten kara orita kao shite uchiwa kana
en:
with a face
come down from heaven
she is fanning

jp: .欲心の口を押へる団扇哉
ro: yokushin no kuchi wo osaeru uchiwa kana
en:
covering
my sinful mouth...
my paper fan

jp: .涼まんと出れば下に下に哉
ro: susuman to izureba shita ni shita ni kana
en:
if you go out
to enjoy the cool air...
grovel and grovel!

jp: .大の字にふんぞり返る涼哉
ro: dai no ji ni funzori-kaeru suzumi kana
en:
falling to my back
spread eagle...
the cool air

jp: .松の木に蟹も上りて夕涼
ro: matsu no ki ni kani [mo] noborite yûsuzumi
en:
a crab, too
climbs the pine tree...
evening cool

jp: .門の月蚊を喰ふ鳥が時得たり
ro: kado no tsuki ka wo kuu tori ga toki etari
en:
moon at the gate--
the mosquito-eating bats
prosper

jp: .一寸も引ぬやえどの時鳥
ro: issun mo hikanu ya edo no hototogisu
en:
not backing down
even an inch...
Edo cuckoo

jp: .今出た不二をさっそく時鳥
ro: ima ideta fuji wo sassoku hototogisu
en:
he just now appeared
and he's off to Mount Fuji...
cuckoo

jp: .入月や一足おそき時鳥
ro: iru tsuki ya hito ashi osoki hototogisu
en:
the setting moon--
you just missed it
cuckoo!

jp: .大江戸や闇らみっちゃに時鳥
ro: ôedo ya yamira-mittcha ni hototogisu
en:
great Edo--
amid the hustle and bustle
a cuckoo

jp: .大江戸や槍おし分てほととぎす
ro: ôedo ya yari oshiwakete hototogisu
en:
in Great Edo
fearing no evil...
the cuckoo

jp: .吉も吉上吉日ぞほととぎす
ro: kichi mo kichi jôkichi nichi zo hototogisu
en:
a lucky, lucky
MOST lucky day
"cuckoo!"

jp: .神ぎ祇や何れまことや時鳥
ro: jingi gi ya izure makoto ya hototogisu
en:
of all the gods
which ones are real?
cuckoo

jp: .鳴まけなけふからえどの時鳥
ro: naki makena kyô kara wa edo no hototogisu
en:
from today on
let no one out-sing you!
Edo cuckoo

jp: .這渡る橋の下より時鳥
ro: hai-wataru hashi no shita yori hototogisu
en:
crawling across a bridge
far below...
"cuckoo!"

jp: .時鳥五月八日も吉日ぞ
ro: hototogisu gogatsu yôka mo kichi nichi zo
en:
cuckoo--
even Fifth Month, Eighth Day
is lucky!

jp: .わたのべの芒にいざや時鳥
ro: watanobe no susuki ni iza ya hototogisu
en:
into Watanobe's pampas grass
off you go!
cuckoo

jp: .翌も来よあさっても来よかんこ鳥
ro: asu mo ki yo asatte mo ki yo kankodori
en:
come back tomorrow
and the next day
mountain cuckoo!

jp: .打鉦と互い違いやかんこ鳥
ro: utsu kane to tagai chigai ya kankodori
en:
taking turns
with the prayer gong...
mountain cuckoo

jp: .帰る迄庵の番せよ閑古鳥
ro: kaeru made io no ban seyo kankodori
en:
till I return
guard my hut...
mountain cuckoo

jp: .それがしがひぜんうつるな閑古鳥
ro: soregashi ga hizen utsuru na kankodori
en:
don't catch scabies
from me!
mountain cuckoo

jp: .長居して蔦に捲れなかんこ鳥
ro: naga-i shite tsuta ni makare na kankodori
en:
don't stay long
and get caught in the ivy!
mountain cuckoo

jp: .たしなめよ口がすぐるぞ行々し
ro: tashiname yo kuchi ga suguru zo gyôgyôshi
en:
shame on you
you're all mouth!
reed thrush

jp: .かくれ家や手負ひ蛍の走入る
ro: kakurega ya teoi hotaru no hashiri iru
en:
secluded house--
the wounded firefly
rushes inside

jp: .庵の蚊のかせぎに出や暮の月
ro: io no ka no kasegi ni deru ya kure no tsuki
en:
my hut's mosquitoes
go out to make a living...
moon at dusk

jp: .蚤噛んだ口でなむあみだ仏哉
ro: nomi kanda kuchi de namu amida butsu kana
en:
the mouth that gnawed
a flea: "All praise
to Amida Buddha!"

jp: .大川へ虱とばする美人哉
ro: ôkawa e shirami tobasuru bijin kana
en:
into the big river
tossing her lice...
pretty woman

jp: .門川や逃出しさうな初松魚
ro: kado-gawa ya nigedashi sô na hatsu-gatsuo
en:
river at the gate--
summer's first bonito
look fresh enough to swim away

jp: .虻蜂もそっちのけのけ蓮の花
ro: abu-bachi mo sotchi noke noke hasu [no] hana
en:
move aside
horseflies and bees!
lotuses are blooming

jp: .灯かげなき所が本んの蓮哉
ro: hokage naki tokoro ga hon no harasu kana
en:
in a place
where no light flickers
the perfect lotus

jp: .ちさい子がたばこ吹也麦の秋
ro: chisai ko ga tabako fuku nari mugi no aki
en:
a little child
smoking a pipe...
ripened barley

jp: .畠縁に酒を売也麦の秋
ro: hata-beri ni sake wo uru nari mugi no aki
en:
at the field's edge
sake for sale...
ripened barley

jp: .ごろり寝の枕にしたる真瓜哉
ro: gorori ne no makura ni shitaru makuwa kana
en:
curled up to sleep--
his pillow
a muskmelon

jp: .白笠を少さますや木下陰
ro: shiro kasa wo sukoshi samasu ya ko shita kage
en:
cooling the white umbrella-hat
just a tad...
tree shade

jp: .下闇や精進犬のてんてんと
ro: shita yami ya shôjin inu no ten-ten to
en:
deep shade--
the fasting dog
rolls and rolls

jp: .たばこ盆を足で尋る夜寒哉
ro: tabako bon wo ashi de tazuneru yozamu kana
en:
feeling for the tobacco tray
with my feet...
a cold night

jp: .いろりから茶の子掘出す夜寒哉
ro: irori kara cha [no] shi hori-dasu yozamu kana
en:
digging a tea cake
out of the hearth...
a cold night

jp: .草の穂のつんと立たる夜寒哉
ro: kusa no ho no tsunto tatetaru yozamu kana
en:
beards of grasses
stuck-up they stand...
a cold night

jp: .こおろぎの大声上る夜寒哉
ro: kôrogi no ôkoe ageru yozamu kana
en:
the katydid
cranks up the volume...
a cold night

jp: .立臼の蓑きせておく夜寒哉
ro: tachi usu no mino kisete oku yozamu kana
en:
putting the rice tub's
raincoat on...
a cold night

jp: .掌に藍染め込んで夜寒哉
ro: tenohira ni ai some konde yozamu kana
en:
dyeing the hands
indigo blue...
the cold night

jp: .ばか咄嗅出したる夜寒哉
ro: baka-banashi kagi-idashitaru yozamu kana
en:
the blabbering fool
pokes out his nose to sniff...
a cold night

jp: .咄する一方は寝て夜寒哉
ro: hanashi suru ippô wa nete yozamu kana
en:
on one side
a sleep talker...
a cold night

jp: .下冷の菰をかぶってごろり哉
ro: shitabie no komo wo kabutte gorori kana
en:
in mountain chill
under his reed mat
curled to sleep

jp: .下冷や臼の中にてきりぎりす
ro: shitabie ya usu no naka nite kirigirisu
en:
mountain chill--
in the rice cake tub
a katydid

jp: .下冷よ又上冷よ庵の夜は
ro: shitabie yo mata uebie yo io no yo wa
en:
a chill comes down the mountain
a chill comes up...
night in my hut

jp: .赤雲や蝶が上にも秋の暮
ro: aka-gumo ya chô ga ue ni mo aki no kure
en:
red clouds--
above the butterfly too
autumn dusk

jp: .鳴くな雁どこも旅寝の秋の月
ro: naku na kari doko mo tabine no aki no tsuki
en:
don't cry, geese!
your inn is wherever
the autumn moon shines

jp: .ころび寝や庵は茶の子の十三夜
ro: korobi ne ya io wa cha no ko no jû san yo
en:
restless sleep--
tea cakes in the hut
for Ninth Month moon

jp: .秋雨や乳放れ馬の旅に立
ro: aki ame ya chibanare uma no tabi ni tatsu
en:
autumn rain--
the weaned pony
begins his journey

jp: .笹の家や猫も杓子も秋の雨
ro: sasa no ya ya neko mo shakushi mo aki no ame
en:
thatched house--
everything drenched
by the autumn rain

jp: .青臭きたばこ吹かける秋の風
ro: ao kusaki tabako fukakeru aki no kaze
en:
the tobacco
has a green smell...
autumn wind

jp: .秋風や翌捨らるる姥が顔
ro: akikaze ya asu suteraruru uba ga kao
en:
autumn wind--
tomorrow they throw you away
old woman

jp: .秋風や戸を明残すうら座敷
ro: akikaze ya to wo akenokosu ura zashiki
en:
autumn wind--
the back sitting room's door
half open

jp: .秋の風宿なし烏吹かれけり
ro: aki no kaze yado nashi karasu fukare keri
en:
in autumn wind
a homeless crow
is blown

jp: .空ッ坊な徳本堂や秋の風
ro: karappôna toku hondô ya aki no kaze
en:
completely empty
the main temple...
autumn wind

jp: .秋風や谷向ふ行影法師
ro: akikaze ya tani mukau yuku kagebôshi
en:
autumn wind--
walking along the valley's cliff
my shadow

jp: .一升でいくらが物ぞ露の玉
ro: isshô de ikura ga mono zo tsuyu no tama
en:
how much
for two quarts?
pearls of dew

jp: .白露やいさくさなしに丸く成る
ro: shira tsuyu ya isakusa nashi ni maruku naru
en:
silver dewdrops--
without fussing
become round

jp: .露の世は得心ながらさりながら
ro: tsuyu no yo wa tokushin nagara sari nagara
en:
it's a dewdrop world
surely it is...
yes... but...

jp: .我庵は露の玉さへいびつ也
ro: waga io wa tsuyu no tama sae ibitsu nari
en:
my hut--
where even beads of dew
are bent

jp: .よい雨や二文花火も夜の体
ro: yoi ame ya ni mon hanabi mo yoru no tei
en:
a good rain--
two-penny fireworks
in the night

jp: .べったりと人のなる木や宮角力
ro: bettari to hito no naru ki ya miya sumô
en:
it's become a tree
of clinging people!
sumo match

jp: .出来立や山のかがしもめづらしき
ro: dekitate ya yama no kagashi mo mezurashiki
en:
newly made
the mountain scarecrow
is a wonder

jp: .牛かひや笛に合する小夜砧
ro: ushikai ya fue ni awasuru sayo-ginuta
en:
a cowherd--
his flute and night's
cloth-pounding mingle

jp: .としよりと見えて始まる近砧
ro: toshiyori to miete hajimaru chika-ginuta
en:
seeing that I'm old
he starts pounding cloth...
nearby

jp: .年寄は遠い所より近砧
ro: toshiyori wa tôi toko yori chika kinuta
en:
growing old--
nearby cloth-pounding
better than distant

jp: .不拍子はたしか我家ぞ小夜砧
ro: fu hyôshi wa tashika waga ya zo sayo-ginuta
en:
utterly rhythmless
at my house!
night cloth-pounding

jp: .来た雁や片足上て一思案
ro: kita kari ya kata ashi agete isshian
en:
the newly arrived goose
lifts one leg...
deep meditation

jp: .青い虫茶色な虫よ庵の夜は
ro: aoi mushi chairona mushi yo iro no yo wa
en:
green insect
and brown insect...
night in my hut

jp: .行灯にちょっと鳴けり青い虫
ro: andon ni chotto naki keri aoi mushi
en:
in the paper lantern
for a quick chirp...
green insect

jp: .虫どもにとしより声はなかりけり
ro: mushi-domo ni toshiyori koe wa nakari keri
en:
among the insects
not a single old voice
is heard

jp: .虫なくなそこは諸人の這入口
ro: mushi naku na soko wa shonin no hairiguchi
en:
don't cry, insects!
we're all headed
for the same exit

jp: .辻風やぼた餅程な秋の蝶
ro: tsujikaze ya botamochi hodona aki no chô
en:
in the whirlwind
like rice cakes...
autumn butterflies

jp: .御祭の赤い出立の蜻蛉哉
ro: o-matsuri no akai dedachi no tombo kana
en:
departing for the festival
all in red
dragonfly

jp: .づぶ濡にぬれてまじまじ蜻蛉哉
ro: zubunure ni nurete maji-maji tombo kana
en:
getting drenched
with big, blinking eyes...
dragonfly

jp: .なぐさみにいなごのおよぐ湖水哉
ro: nagusami ni inago no oyogu kosui kana
en:
just for fun
the locust goes swimming...
lake

jp: .湖をちょっと泳しいなご哉
ro: mizuumi wo chotto oyogishi inago kana
en:
a quick dip
in the lake...
locust

jp: .みぞ川をおぶさってとぶいなご哉
ro: mizogawa wo obusatte tobu inago kana
en:
catching a ride
on the ditch water...
locust

jp: .小むしろや米の山よりきりぎりす
ro: samushiro [ya] kome no yama yori kirigirisu
en:
little straw mat--
on the mountain of rice
katydid

jp: .一方は尿瓶の音ぞきりぎりす
ro: ippô wa shibin no oto zo kirigirisu
en:
on one sinde
the sound of the piss pot...
on the other, a katydid

jp: .うるさしや菊の上にも負かちは
ro: urusashi ya kiku no ue ni mo make-kachi wa
en:
how annoying!
among chrysanthemums too
the nobles win

jp: .菊さくや山の天窓も白くなる
ro: kiku saku ya yama no atama mo shiroku naru
en:
chrysanthemums bloom--
the mountain's head, too
turns white

jp: .大名を味方にもつやきくの花
ro: daimyô wo mikata ni motsu ya kiku no hana
en:
the war lord
has pull...
chrysanthemum contest

jp: .人間がなくば曲らじ菊の花
ro: ningen ga nakuba magaraji kiku no hana
en:
if it weren't for people
they'd not grow crooked...
chrysanthemums

jp: .負てから大名の菊としられけり
ro: makete kara daimyô no kiku to shirare keri
en:
losing the contest
surprise! the lord's chrysanthemum
won

jp: .負馴れて平気也けりきくの花
ro: make narete heiki nari keri kiku no hana
en:
used to losing
I'm peaceful, calm...
chrysanthemum

jp: .我菊や向たい方へつんむいて
ro: waga kiku ya mukitai hô e tsunmuite
en:
my chrysanthemum
faces the direction
she chooses

jp: .朝顔にをしつぶされし扉かな
ro: asagao ni oshitsubusareshi tobira kana
en:
crushed under
the morning-glories...
my door

jp: .我庵や竹には烏萩に猫
ro: waga io ya take ni wa karasu hagi ni neko
en:
my hut--
in the bamboo, a crow
in the bush clover, a cat

jp: .しなのぢやそばの白さもぞっとする
ro: shinano ji ya soba no shirosa mo zotto suru
en:
Shinano road--
blooming buckwheat's whiteness
makes me shiver

jp: .そば咲やその白ささへぞっとする
ro: soba saku ya sono shirosa sae zotto suru
en:
buckwheat blooming--
that whiteness
makes me shiver

jp: .それぞれに花の咲けり日やけ稲
ro: sore-zore ni hana no saki keri hiyake ine
en:
each and every one
has come to blossom...
sun-warmed rice

jp: .鰐口にちょいと加へし紅葉哉
ro: waniguchi ni choi to kuwaeshi momiji kana
en:
quickly stuffing
the temple gong...
red leaves

jp: .鳴蝉も連てふはりと一葉哉
ro: naku semi mo tsurete fuwari to hito ha kana
en:
with a singing cicada
softly...
one leaf falls

jp: .朝寒を引くり返す木槿哉
ro: asa-zamu wo hikkurikaesu mukuge kana
en:
overturning the cold
of morning...
roses of Sharon

jp: .代々の貧乏垣の木槿哉
ro: dai-dai no bimbô kaki no mukuge kana
en:
for generations
from this poor hedge...
roses of Sharon

jp: .火のふけぬ家をとりまく木槿哉
ro: hi no fukenu ie [wo] torimaku mukuge kana
en:
encircling the house
that emits no smoke...
roses of Sharon

jp: .大栗や刺の中にも虫の住
ro: ôguri ya toge no naka ni mo mushi no sumu
en:
the big chestnut
shares his prickly home
with a worm

jp: .うす壁にづんづと寒が入にけり
ro: usu kabe ni zunzu to kan ga iri ni keri
en:
through the thin wall
the cold barges
in

jp: .庵の夜はしんそこ寒ししんしんと
ro: io no yo wa shinsoku samushi shin-shin to
en:
night in the hut--
the deep, deep heart
of cold

jp: .しんしんと心底寒し新坊主
ro: shin-shin to shinsoko samushi shin bôzu
en:
down to the bone
bitter cold...
the novice priest

jp: .米負て小唄で渡る氷哉
ro: kome ôte kouta de wataru kôri kana
en:
carrying rice
while singing a ditty
crossing the ice

jp: .我家の一つ手拭氷りけり
ro: waga ie [no] hitotsu tenugui kôri keri
en:
my house's
only face towel
frozen stiff

jp: .野仏の御鼻の先の氷柱哉
ro: no-botoke no o-hana no saki no tsurara kana
en:
from the tip
of the field Buddha's nose...
an icicle

jp: .我家や初氷柱さへ煤じみる
ro: waga ie ya hatsu tsurara sae susu-jimiru
en:
my house--
even the first icicle
soot-stained

jp: .惣〆只三軒のむら時雨
ro: sô shimete tada san ken no mura shigure
en:
falling on only
three houses...
steady winter rain

jp: .継っ子や指を咥へて行時雨
ro: mamakko ya yubi wo kuwaete yuku shigure
en:
the stepchild's finger
in his mouth...
winter rain

jp: .木がらしに女だてらの跨火哉
ro: kogarashi ni onnadatera no matabi kana
en:
in winter wind
unladylike she crouches
astride the brazier

jp: .木がらしや木の葉にくるむ塩肴
ro: kogarashi ya ki [no] ha ni kurumu shio sakana
en:
winter wind--
wrapped in tree leaves
a salted fish

jp: .木がらしや軒の虫籠釣し柿
ro: kogarashi ya noki no mushikago tsurushigaki
en:
winter wind--
in the eaves an insect cage
and dried persimmons

jp: .はつ雪を引握ったる烏哉
ro: hatsu yuki wo hiki-nigittaru karasu kana
en:
the first snowfall
scratched to bits...
crows

jp: .初雪といふ声ことしよはりけり
ro: hatsu yuki to iu koe kotoshi yowari keri
en:
"First snowfall!"
this year the voice
is weaker

jp: .はつ雪や机の上に一握り
ro: hatsu yuki ya tsukue no ue ni hito nigiri
en:
first snow--
on the desktop
a snowball

jp: .うら壁やしがみ付たる貧乏雪
ro: ura kabe ya shigami tsuketaru bimbô yuki
en:
clinging fast
to my house's rear wall...
dirty snow

jp: .ちょんぼりと雪の明りや後架道
ro: chombori to yuki no akari ya kôkamichi
en:
just a smidgen of light
from the snow...
latrine alley

jp: .鍋の尻ほしておく也雪の上
ro: nabe no shiri hoshite oku nari yuki no ue
en:
bottoms up
the kettles drying
on the snow

jp: .雪の日や字を書習ふ盆の灰
ro: yuki no hi ya ji wo kakinarau bon [no] hai
en:
snowy day--
practicing writing
in the tray's ashes

jp: .ちりめんの猿を負ふ子や玉霰
ro: chirimen no saru wo ou ko ya tama arare
en:
the child carries
her cloth monkey...
hailstones

jp: .村中を膳もて行や玉霰
ro: mura naka wo zen mote yuku ya tama arare
en:
to the town's center
under a table he goes...
hailstones

jp: .わらはべや箕をかぶりつつ玉霰
ro: waraabe ya mi wo kaburitsutsu tama arare
en:
a child holds a winnow
over his head...
hailstones

jp: .初時雨お十二日を忘ぬや
ro: hatsu shigure o-jû ni nichi wo wasurenu ya
en:
the first winter rain
didn't forget...
the twelfth day!

jp: .したはしやむかししのぶの翁椀
ro: shitawashi ya mukashi shinobu no okina wan
en:
olden times tug at the heart--
the Old Man's
wooden bowl

jp: .庵の煤嵐が掃てくれにけり
ro: io no susu arashi ga haite kure ni keri
en:
my hut's soot--
a storm kindly
does the sweeping

jp: .庵の煤口で吹ても仕廻けり
ro: io no susu kuchi de fuite mo shimae keri
en:
my hut's soot--
just blowing it
does the job

jp: .庵の煤掃く真似をして置にけり
ro: io no susu haku mane [wo] shite oki ni keri
en:
my hut's soot--
going through the motions
of sweeping it

jp: .煤掃て垣も洗て三ケの月
ro: susu haite kaki mo araute mike no tsuki
en:
sweeping the soot
washing the fence...
sickle moon

jp: .それ遊べ煤もはいたぞ門雀
ro: sore asobe susu mo haita zo kado suzume
en:
play in this soot
I swept!
gate's sparrows

jp: .鶏の餅ふん付ておかしさよ
ro: niwatori no mochi funzukete okashisa yo
en:
chickens trampling
the rice cakes...
a comedy

jp: .ひえ餅はつく音にてもしられけり
ro: hie mochi [wa] tsuku oto nite mo shirare keri
en:
the sound of pounding--
millet dumpling
being made

jp: .餅搗のもちがとぶ也犬の口
ro: mochi tsuki no mochi ga tobu nari inu no kuchi
en:
the fresh rice cake
goes flying...
the dog's mouth

jp: .世の中やおれがこねても餅になる
ro: yo [no] naka ya ore [ga] konete mo mochi ni naru
en:
in this world
even my kneading makes
rice cakes!

jp: .鳩雀来よ来よおれも貰ひ餅
ro: hato suzume ki yo ki yo ore mo morai mochi
en:
pigeons and sparrows
come! come!
I've got rice cakes

jp: .深川や舟も一組とし忘
ro: fukagawa ya fune mo hito-gumi toshiwasure
en:
Fukagawa--
on a boat, too, a party
drinks away the year

jp: .掛乞に水など汲で貰ひけり
ro: kakegoi ni mizu nado kunde morai keri
en:
from the bill collector
a ladel full
of water

jp: .旅すれば猫のふとんも借にけり
ro: tabi sureba neko no futon mo kari ni keri
en:
on the road
even a cat's futon
I borrow

jp: .かじき佩て出ても用はなかりけり
ro: kanjiki haite idete mo yô wa nakari keri
en:
putting on snowshoes
going outside...
for no reason

jp: .三介が開眼したり雪仏
ro: sansuke ga kaigen shitari yuki-botoke
en:
the servant displays
a holy image...
snow Buddha

jp: .犬の子が追ふて行也雪礫
ro: inu no ko ga oute yuku nari yukitsubute
en:
the puppy
chases after it...
snowball

jp: .榎迄ことしは行かず雪礫
ro: enoki made kotoshi wa yukazu yukitsubute
en:
this year it doesn't reach
the nettle tree...
my snowball

jp: .親犬が尻でうけけり雪礫
ro: oya inu ga shiri de uke keri yukitsubute
en:
mother dog
blocks with her butt...
snowball

jp: .親犬や天窓で明る雪囲
ro: oya inu ya atama [de] akeru yukigakoi
en:
mother dog
opens it with her head...
snow shed

jp: .どら犬の尻で明るや雪囲
ro: dora inu no shiri de akeru ya yukigakoi
en:
the stray dog
opens it with his butt...
snow shed

jp: .どら犬や天窓でこぢる雪囲
ro: dora inu ya atama de kojiru yukigakoi
en:
the stray dog
wriggles in head-first...
snow shed

jp: .蝿打が巧者也けり冬篭
ro: hae uchi ga kôsha nari keri fuyugomori
en:
for the expert
at swatting flies...
winter seclusion

jp: .大名は濡れて通るを炬燵哉
ro: daimyô wa nurete tôru wo kotatsu kana
en:
a war lord
drenching wet, passes
my cozy brazier

jp: .先よしと足でおし出すたんぽ哉
ro: mazu yoshi to ashi de oshidasu tanpo kana
en:
"It's good at first!"
her foot pushes
the foot-warmer

jp: .浅ましや炭のしみ込む掌に
ro: asamashi ya sumi no shimi komu tenohira ni
en:
how shameful--
with my charcoal-stained
palms...

jp: .けふけふとうき世の事も計り炭
ro: kyôkyô to ukiyo no koto mo hakari sumi
en:
in careful bits
another thing of this floating world...
weighing charcoal

jp: .僧正もほた火仲間の座とり哉
ro: sôjô mo hotabi nakama no za tori kana
en:
a cozy wood fire--
the high priest also
takes a seat

jp: .膝節でほたを折さへ手柄哉
ro: hizabushi de hota wo oru sae tegara kana
en:
even breaking firewood
with my knee...
a feat

jp: .埋火の真闇がりもたのみ哉
ro: uzumibi no makkuragari mo tanomi kana
en:
though night is pitch black
the banked fire
works fine

jp: .ばさら画の遊女も笑へ薬喰
ro: basara-e no yûjo mo warae kusuri kuu
en:
painted fan's prostitute
laugh at me too!
taking medicine

jp: .きょろきょろきょろきょろ何をみそさざい
ro: kyoro-kyoro kyoro-kyoro nani wo misosazai
en:
why so restless
restless, restless?
little wren

jp: .大切の九月三十日をみそさざい
ro: taisetsu no kugatsu misoka wo misosazai
en:
it's your big day
the 30th of Ninth Month!
wren

jp: .みそさざい犬の通ぢくぐりけり
ro: misosazai inu no kayoiji kuguri keri
en:
a wren
on the dog's prowling route
creeps

jp: .みそさざい身を知る雨が降にけり
ro: misosazai mi wo shiru ame ga furi ni keri
en:
little wren
in falling rain drenched
to the bone

jp: .あちこちに小より合する千鳥哉
ro: achi-kochi ni ko yoriai suru chidori kana
en:
here and there
in little meetings...
plovers

jp: .小便の百度参りやさよ千鳥
ro: shôben no hyaku do mairi ya sayo chidori
en:
going out to piss
for the hundredth time...
plovers in the night

jp: .月さして千鳥に埋る笹家哉
ro: tsuki sashite chidori ni umeru sasa ya kana
en:
bright moon--
the plovers all buried
in the house's thatch

jp: .何事の大より合ぞ浜千鳥
ro: nanigoto no ôyoriai zo hama chidori
en:
what a huge convocation!
plovers
on the beach

jp: .降雪は声の薬か小夜千鳥
ro: furu yuki wa koe no kusuri ka sayo chidori
en:
is the falling snow
medicine for your voices
plovers?

jp: .水鳥の紅葉かぶって寝たりけり
ro: mizudori no momiji kabutte netari keri
en:
with red leaves
on their heads, the waterfowl
asleep

jp: .菊なども交ぜてかれけり寺の道
ro: kiku nado mo mazete kare keri tera no michi
en:
chrysanthemums, too
in the withering mix...
temple road

jp: .人をさす草もへたへた枯にけり
ro: hito wo sasu kusa mo heta-heta kare ni keri
en:
even the grasses
that stab people
clumsily wither

jp: .枯すすきむかし婆々鬼あったとさ
ro: kare susuki mukashi baba oni atta to sa
en:
withered grassland--
once upon a time there was
a she-demon...

jp: .大根で叩くき会たる子ども哉
ro: daikon de tataki autaru kodomo kana
en:
a battle royal
with radishes...
children

jp: .おち葉して親孝行の烏哉
ro: ochiba shite oya kôkô no karasu kana
en:
in fallen leaves
the crow who respects
his parents

jp: .恋猫の糞ほり埋るおち葉哉
ro: koi neko no kuso hori umeru ochiba [kana]
en:
burying the latrine
of the lover cat...
fallen leaves

jp: .君なくて誠に多太の木立哉
ro: kimi nakute makoto ni tadai no kodachi kana
en:
without you--
how vast
is the grove

jp: .神々やことしも拝む子二人
ro: kami-gami ya kotoshi mo ogamu ko futari
en:
oh gods
this year again I pray...
two children, please?

jp: .正月も廿日過けりはおり客
ro: shôgatsu mo hatsuka sugi keri haori kaku
en:
though it's First Month
twenty days
in my winter coat

jp: .正月やえたの玄関も梅の花
ro: shôgatsu ya eta no genkan mo ume no hana
en:
First Month--
even at the outcast's porch
plum blossoms

jp: .正月や夜は夜とて梅の月
ro: shôgatsu ya yoru wa yoru tote ume no tsuki
en:
First Month--
tonight a night
of plum blossom moon

jp: .這へ笑へ二ッになるぞけさからは
ro: hae warae futatsu ni naru zo kesa kara wa
en:
crawl and laugh--
from this morning on
a two year old!

jp: .足元に鳥が立也春も立
ro: ashi moto ni tori ga tatsu nari haru mo tatsu
en:
at my feet
a bird springs up
with the spring!

jp: .春立や弥太郎改め一茶坊
ro: haru tatsu ya yatarô aratame issa-bô
en:
new spring
Yataro dies, priest Issa
is born

jp: .春もはや立ぞ一ひ二ふ三けの月
ro: haru mohaya tatsu zo hitohi fu mike no tsuki
en:
spring has sprung--
a one-day, two-day
sickle moon

jp: .ひへ餅にあんきな春が来たりけり
ro: hie mochi ni ankina haru ga kitari keri
en:
with millet dumplings
a peaceful spring
rolls in

jp: .朝雫皺手につたふ初日哉
ro: asa shizuku shiwade ni tsutau hatsu hi kana
en:
morning's raindrops trace
the wrinkles of my hands...
year's first day

jp: .内中にてらてら鍬の初日哉
ro: uchi-uchi ni tera-tera kuwa no hatsu hi kana
en:
in the storehouse
the hoe glinting...
year's first dawn

jp: .隠家は昼時分さす初日哉
ro: kakurega wa hiru jibun sasu hatsu hi kana
en:
at my hermitage
it starts at noon...
the year's first day

jp: .はつ旭鍬も拝まれ給ひけり
ro: hatsu asahi kuwa mo oga[ma]re tamai keri
en:
year's first sunrise--
even the hoe
gets a prayer

jp: .足の向く村が我らが恵方哉
ro: ashi no muku mura ga warera ga ehô kana
en:
we follow our feet
to the village...
our New Year's walk

jp: .鶯や折戸半分明の方
ro: uguisu ya orido hambun ake no hô
en:
nightingale--
through a half-folded folding door
my New Year's walk

jp: .大雪や出入の穴も明の方
ro: ôyuki ya deiri no ana mo ake no hô
en:
a big snow--
the exit tunnel
is my lucky direction

jp: .おくさがや恵方に出し杖の穴
ro: oku saga ya ehô ni ideshi tsue no ana
en:
deep in Saga--
my New Year's walk
follows holes made by canes

jp: .畠縁や恵方に出し杖の穴
ro: hata heri ya ehô ni ideshi tsue no ana
en:
edge of a field--
my New Year's walk
follows holes made by canes

jp: .とし棚の灯に鍬の後光哉
ro: toshi-dana no tomoshi ni kuwa no gokô kana
en:
lit by the New Year's
shelf...
the hoe's halo

jp: .とし棚や闇い方より福鼠
ro: toshi-dana ya kurai hô yori fuku nezumi
en:
New Year's shelf--
from a dark nook
a lucky mouse

jp: .吾庵や曲たなりに恵方棚
ro: waga io ya magatta nari ni ehô tana
en:
my hut--
it's a crooked path
to the New Year's shelf

jp: .引下す畚の中より雀哉
ro: hiki-orosu fugo no naka yori suzume kana
en:
hauled up
in the bamboo basket...
a sparrow!

jp: .左義長に月は上らせ給ひけり
ro: sagichô ni tsuki wa noborase tamai keri
en:
Little New Year's--
and the moon has deigned
to rise!

jp: .左義長や其上月の十五日
ro: sagichô ya sono jôgatsu no jû go nichi
en:
Little New Year's
on the First Month's
15th day

jp: .どんど焼どんどと雪の降りにけり
ro: dondo yaku dondo to yuki no furi ni keri
en:
New Year's bonfire
and a New Year's snow
coming down

jp: .蓬莱を引とらまへて泣子哉
ro: hôrai wo hikitoramaete naku ko kana
en:
clinging to
the eternal youth ornament
the crying child

jp: .蓬莱の天窓をしゃぶるをさな子哉
ro: hôrai no atama wo shaburu wo sana [ko] kana
en:
sucking on
the eternal youth ornament...
sleeping child

jp: .犬の子やかくれんぼする門の松
ro: inu no ko ya kakurenbo suru kado [no] matsu
en:
the puppy plays
hide-and-seek...
New Year's pine

jp: .から崎や門松からも夜の雨
ro: karasaki ya kadomatsu kara mo yoru no ame
en:
Karasaki--
even from the New Year's pine
evening rain

jp: .君が世や主なし塚もかざり松
ro: kimi ga yo ya nushi nashi tsuka mo kazari matsu
en:
Great Japan!
even an ownerless grave
decorated with pine

jp: .赤馬の口はとどかずかざり縄
ro: aka uma no kuchi wa todokazu kazari nawa
en:
beyond the reach
of the red horse's mouth...
New Year's rope

jp: .輪飾や辻の仏の御首へ
ro: wakazari ya tsuji no hotoke no o-kashira e
en:
a New Year's wreath
for the crossroads Buddha's
head

jp: .大御代やからたち垣も御慶帳
ro: ômiyo ya karatachi kaki mo gyokei kana
en:
imperial Japan--
even from the quince hedge
"Happy New Year!"

jp: .かつしかや川むかふから御慶いふ
ro: katsushika ya kawamukau kara gyokei iu
en:
Katsushika--
from across the river
"Happy New Year!"

jp: .ざぶざぶと泥わらんじの御慶哉
ro: zabu-zabu to doro waraji no gyokei kana
en:
splish-splash
with muddy straw sandals...
"Happy New Year!"

jp: .武家丁やからたち藪も年始帳
ro: buke machi ya karatachi yabu mo nenshijô
en:
samurai street--
even from the quince thicket
"Happy New Year!"

jp: .楽な世やからたち藪の年始帳
ro: rakuna yo ya karatachi yabu no nenshijô
en:
a good world--
even from the quince thicket
"Happy New Year!"

jp: .茶けぶりや我わか水も角田川
ro: cha keburi ya waga wakamizu mo sumida-gawa
en:
tea smoke--
my year's first water
from Sumida River

jp: .名代のわか水浴びる雀哉
ro: myôdai ni wakamizu abiru suzume kana
en:
bathing in the
New Year's water...
my proxy the sparrow

jp: .欲どしくわか水つかふ女哉
ro: yoku-doshiku wakamizu tsukau onna kana
en:
greedily using up
the year's first water...
the woman

jp: .若水や並ぶ雀もまめな顔
ro: wakamizu ya narabu suzume mo mamena kao
en:
year's first water--
sparrows in a row
with healthy faces

jp: .若水や先は仏のしきみ桶
ro: wakamizu ya mazu wa hotoke no shikimi oke
en:
year's first water--
the first goes to Buddha's
bucket of branches

jp: .つく羽を犬が加へて参りけり
ro: tsuku hane wo inu ga kuwaete mairi keri
en:
the dog chewing
the shuttlecock
comes running along

jp: .つく羽の落る際也三ケの月
ro: tsukuhane no ochiru kiwa nari mike no tusku
en:
the shuttlecock reaches
its edge...
crescent moon

jp: .神の代はおらも四角な雑煮哉
ro: kami no ya wa ora mo shikaku-na zôni kana
en:
age of the gods!
even for me a square
of zoni

jp: .目出度といふも二人の雑煮哉
ro: medetai to iu mo futari no zôni kana
en:
though we say
"Happy New Year!"
zoni for only two

jp: .朝不二やとそのてうしの口の先
ro: asa fuji ya toso no chôshi no kuchi no saki
en:
Mount Fuji dawn--
a New Year's sake toast
at my lips

jp: .御関やとその銚子の不二へむく
ro: onkan ya toso no chôshi no fuji e muku
en:
barrier gate--
a New Year's sake toast
while facing Mount Fuji

jp: .月代にとそぬり付て出たりけり
ro: sakayaki ni toso nuritsukete detari keri
en:
a New Year's toast
on his shaved head...
he goes forth

jp: .女衆に出し抜れつつつむわかな
ro: onna-shû ni dashi-nukare tsutsu tsumu wakana
en:
beaten out
by the women...
picking herbs

jp: .二葉三葉つみ切って来るわかな哉
ro: ni ha samba tsumi kitte kuru wakana kana
en:
two or three leaves
then calling it quits...
picking herbs

jp: .三ケ月はそるぞ寒は冴かへる
ro: mikazuki wa soru zo samusa wa saekaeru
en:
the sickle moon
curls up, winter's cold
returns

jp: .長き日やここにもごろりごろり寝
ro: nagaki hi ya koko ni mo gorori gorori neru
en:
a long day--
here too everyone's
curled asleep

jp: .長き日や大福帳をかり枕
ro: naga[ki] hi ya daifukuchô wo kari makura
en:
a long day--
his account book serves
as a pillow

jp: .ばか長い日やと口明く烏哉
ro: baka nagai hi ya to kuchi aku karasu kana
en:
"It's a foolishly long
day!"...the crow opens
his mouth

jp: .べら坊に日の長い哉長い哉
ro: berabô ni hi no nagai kana nagai kana
en:
the day is devilishly
long!
long!

jp: .梅どこか二月の雪の二三尺
ro: ume doko ka nigatsu no yuki no ni san shaku
en:
plum blossoms, where?
Second Month snow
two or three feet deep

jp: .梅どこかはらはら雪のむら雀
ro: ume doko ka hara-hara yuki no mura suzume
en:
plum blossoms, where?
snow falls in clumps
among the sparrows

jp: .雁鴨のきげん直るや春の雪
ro: kari kamo no kigen naoru ya haru no yuki
en:
improving the mood
of the geese and ducks...
spring snow

jp: .我村や春降雪も二三尺
ro: waga mura ya haru furu yuki mo ni san shaku
en:
my village--
even the spring snow
two or three feet!

jp: .明六を鳩も諷ふや春の雨
ro: akemutsu wo hato mo utau ya haru no ame
en:
the pigeon too
sings to six a.m.
spring rain

jp: .有明や石の凹みの春の雨
ro: ariake ya ishi no kubomi no haru no ame
en:
dawn--
in a stone's hollow
spring rain

jp: .傘さして箱根越也春の雨
ro: kasa sashite hakone kosu nari haru no ame
en:
under their parasols
crossing Mount Hakone...
spring rain

jp: .草の葉に鹿のざれけり春の雨
ro: kusa no ha ni shika no zare keri haru no ame
en:
deer gamboling
in the grass...
spring rain

jp: .小社の餅こそ見ゆれ春の雨
ro: ko yashiro no mochi koso miyure haru [no] ame
en:
little shrine
with rice cake, of course...
spring rain

jp: .酒法度たばこ法度や春の雨
ro: sake hatto tabako hatto ya haru no ame
en:
no drinking, no smoking
allowed...
spring rain

jp: .笹ﾂ葉の春雨なめる鼠哉
ro: sasappa no harusame nameru nezumi kana
en:
licking a bamboo leaf's
spring rain...
mouse

jp: .山門の長雨だれの春雨哉
ro: sanmon no naga amadare no harusame kana
en:
from the temple's great gate
long drops from the eaves...
spring rain

jp: .釣り棚のつつじ咲けり春の雨
ro: tsuridana no tsutsuji saki keri haru no ame
en:
the hanging shelf's
azaleas bloom...
spring rain

jp: .春雨やしたたか銭の出た窓へ
ro: harusame ya shitataka zeni no deta mado e
en:
spring rain--
hitting the windows
that cost me so much

jp: .春雨やばくち崩と夜談義と
ro: harusame ya bakuchi kuzure to yo dangi to
en:
spring rain--
backsliding gamblers
and a night sermon

jp: .春雨や髭を並べるせうじ紙
ro: harusame ya hige wo naraberu shôji-gami
en:
spring rain--
beards in a row
at the paper door

jp: .春雨や窓から値ぎる肴売
ro: harusame ya mado kara negiru sakana uri
en:
spring rain--
in the window they haggle
over fish

jp: .雨だれの中から吹や春の風
ro: amadare no naka kara fuku ya haru no kaze
en:
blowing from the raindrops
from the eaves...
spring wind

jp: .春風や馬をほしたる門の原
ro: haru kaze ya uma wo hoshitaru kado no hara
en:
the spring breeze
dries the horse...
field by the gate

jp: .春風や女も越える箱根山
ro: haru kaze ya onna mo koeru hakone yama
en:
spring breeze--
a woman also crosses
Mount Hakone

jp: .春風や供の娘の小脇差
ro: harukaze ya tomo no musume no ko wakizashi
en:
spring breeze--
the little servant girl
has a short sword

jp: .春風や曲り曲りの奉加橋
ro: harukaze ya meguri-meguri no hôga-bashi
en:
spring breeze--
after twists and turns
Hoga Bridge

jp: .降雪の中も春風吹にけり
ro: furu yuki no naka mo haru kaze fuki ni keri
en:
through falling snow
a spring breeze
blows

jp: .すっぽんも時や作らん春の月
ro: suppon mo toki ya tsukuran haru no tsuki
en:
a snapping turtle too
crows the time...
spring moon

jp: .朧夜や酒の流し滝の月
ro: oboro yo ya sake no nagareshi taki no tsuki
en:
hazy night--
sake is flowing
waterfall and moon

jp: .梅ばちの大挑灯やかすみから
ro: ume bachi no daichôchin ya kasumi kara
en:
great lanterns
with the plum blossom crest...
out of mist

jp: .かすむ野にいざや命のせんたくに
ro: kasumu no ni iza ya inochi no sentaku ni
en:
into the misty field
let's go!
refreshing our souls

jp: .霞やら雪の降やら古郷山
ro: kasumu yara yuki no furu yara kokyô yama
en:
spring mist
and falling snow...
my home mountains

jp: .さらし布かすみの足に聳へけり
ro: sarashi nuno kasumi no tashi ni sobie keri
en:
cloth hung to dry
adds to the mist...
soaring

jp: .古郷はかすんで雪の降りにけり
ro: furusato wa kasunde yuki no furi ni keri
en:
my home village
in the spring mist, snow
is falling

jp: .我家はどうかすんでもいびつ也
ro: waga ie [wa] dô kasunde mo ibitsu nari
en:
even in the mist
my house
is a mess

jp: .陽炎のとり付て立草家哉
ro: kagerô no toritsuite tatsu kusaya kana
en:
possessed
by the heat shimmers...
thatched hut

jp: .陽炎や歩行ながらの御法談
ro: kagerô ya aruki nagara no o-hôdan
en:
heat shimmers--
walking along he preaches
his sermon

jp: .陽炎や庇の草も花の咲く
ro: kagerô ya hisashi no kusa mo hana no saku
en:
heat shimmers--
among grasses of the eaves
flowers

jp: .町住や雪とかすにも銭がいる
ro: machizuma ya yuki tokasu ni mo zeni ga iru
en:
city life--
even melting snow
costs money

jp: .大川に四角な雪も流けり
ro: ôkawa ni yosumina yuki mo nagare keri
en:
in the big river
square slabs of snow, too
float away

jp: .門の雪四角にされて流けり
ro: kado no yuki shikaku ni sarete nagare keri
en:
the gate's snow
in a perfect square
flows away

jp: .小庇に薪並おく雪解哉
ro: kobisashi ni maki narabe oku yukige kana
en:
firewood laid out
on the eaves...
snow is melting!

jp: .小庇の薪と猫と雪解哉
ro: kobisashi ni maki to neko to yukige kana
en:
on the eaves
firewood and a cat...
snow is melting!

jp: .里犬の渡て見せる雪げ哉
ro: sato inu no wattate miseru yukige kana
en:
the village dog
shows the river crossing
melting snow

jp: .雀迄かち時作る雪げ哉
ro: suzume made kachidoki tsukuru yukige kana
en:
even the sparrow
gives a victory cry...
snow is melting!

jp: .雪解や貧乏町の痩せ子達
ro: yuki-doke ya bimbô machi no yase kodachi
en:
snow melting--
the thin children
of the slum

jp: .六尺の暖簾ひたひた雪げ哉
ro: roku shaku no noren hita-hita yukige kana
en:
six feet of curtain
flapping...
the snow is melting!

jp: .茶のけぶり庵の苗代青みけり
ro: cha no keburi io no nawashiro ao[mi] keri
en:
tea smoke--
the hut's rice seedlings
turning green

jp: .苗代も庵のかざりに青みけり
ro: nawashiro mo io no kazari ni aomi keri
en:
the rice seedlings
my hut's adornment...
so green!

jp: .苗代や草臥顔の古仏
ro: nawashiro ya kutabire kao no furu-botoke
en:
rice seedlings--
the old Buddha's
weary face

jp: .我植た稲も四五本青みけり
ro: waga ueta ine mo shi go hon aomi keri
en:
the rice plants
I planted, five or six
so green!

jp: .雨に雪しどろもどろのひがん哉
ro: ame ni yuki shidoro-modoro no higan kana
en:
a confusing mix
of rain and snow...
spring equinox

jp: .西方は善光寺道のひがん哉
ro: nishi kata wa zenkôji michi no higan kana
en:
the west lies
on the other shore
of the road to Zenko Temple

jp: .ばくち小屋降つぶしけり彼岸雨
ro: bakuchi goya furitsubushi keri higan ame
en:
the little gambling shack
is pounded...
spring equinox rain

jp: .我村はぼたぼた雪のひがん哉
ro: waga mura wa bota-bota yuki no higan kana
en:
in my village
snow falls pit-a-pat...
spring equinox

jp: .桃の日や深草焼のかぐや姫
ro: momo no hi ya fukakusa yaki no kaguya hime
en:
Peach Festival--
a doll of Princess Kaguya
fired in Fukakusa

jp: .いとこ雛孫雛と名の付合ふ
ro: itoko hina mago hina to na no tsuki tamau
en:
"Cousin Doll"
and "Grandchild Doll"
she names them

jp: .小筵や畠の中の蓬餅
ro: samushiro ya hatake no naka no yomogi mochi
en:
little straw mat--
in the middle of a field
eating herb cakes

jp: .一対に並ぶ茶つみの儀式哉
ro: ittsui ni narabu cha tsumi no gishiki kana
en:
lined up double file
the tea pickers'
ritual dance

jp: .小袋に米も少々扱茶哉
ro: ko-bukuro ni kome mo shôshô koku cha kana
en:
in his little bag--
rice and few
tea leaves

jp: .僧正が音頭とる也茶つみ唄
ro: sôjô ga ondo toru nari cha tsumi uta
en:
the high priest
joins right in...
tea-picking song

jp: .豊年のほの字にやけよしなの山
ro: hônen no ho no ji ni yake yo shinano yama
en:
a fruitful year's
letter "F" burning...
Shinano mountain

jp: .山焼の明りに下る夜舟哉
ro: yama yaki no akari ni kudaru yobune kana
en:
lit by mountain fires
floating downriver...
night boat

jp: .畠打や足にてなぶる梅の花
ro: hata uchi ya ashi nite naburu ume [no] hana
en:
plowing the field
crushed underfoot...
plum blossoms

jp: .山畠や人に打たせてねむる鹿
ro: yama hata ya hito ni utasete nemaru shika
en:
mountain field--
a man plows it
for the sleeping deer

jp: .梅持って接木の弟子が御時宜哉
ro: ume motte tsugiki no deshi ga o-jigi kana
en:
a plum branch in his hand
the tree-grafting apprentice
bows

jp: .接木する我や仏に翌ならん
ro: tsugiki suru ware ya hotoke ni asu naran
en:
grafting a branch--
I might be dead
tomorrow

jp: .庭先や接木の弟子が茶をはこぶ
ro: niwa saki ya tsugiki no deshi ga cha wo hakobu
en:
garden's entrance--
the tree-grafting apprentice
brings the tea

jp: .のらくらが三人よれば接木哉
ro: norakura ga sannin yoreba tsugiki kana
en:
when three loafers
happen to meet...
grafting branches

jp: .餅腹をこなしがてらのつぎほ哉
ro: mochi hara wo konashi gatera no tsugiho kana
en:
to help digest
the rice cakes, grafting
the tree

jp: .謹で犬がつくばふさし木哉
ro: tsutsushinde inu ga tsukubau sashi-gi kana
en:
the dog bows to it
with reverence...
grafted tree

jp: .へたへたと蛙が笑ふさし木哉
ro: heta-heta to kawazu ga warau sashi-gi kana
en:
"A clumsy job!"
a frog laughs
at my grafted tree

jp: .朝飯を髪にそよそよ猫の恋
ro: asameshi wo kami ni soyo-soyo neko [no] koe
en:
breakfast rice
stuck in his whiskers...
lover cat in a rush

jp: .闇より闇に入るや猫の恋
ro: kuraki yori kuraki ni iru ya neko no koi
en:
from darkness
into darkness
the lover cat

jp: .面の皮いくらむいてもうかれ猫
ro: tsura no kawa ikura muite mo ukare neko
en:
though everyone knows
his secret, still
a love-crazed cat

jp: .攣れて来て飯を食する女猫哉
ro: tsurete kite meshi wo kuwasuru me neko kana
en:
tagging along
for the meal...
the cat's lady friend

jp: .盗喰する片手間も猫の恋
ro: nusumi-gui suru katadema mo neko no koi
en:
a food thief
in his spare time...
lover cat

jp: .ばか猫や縛れながら恋を鳴く
ro: baka neko ya shibarare nagara koi wo naku
en:
fool cat
though tethered still crying
for love

jp: .猫の子や秤にかかりつつざれる
ro: neko no ko ya hakari ni kakari tsutsu zareru
en:
the kitten
being weighed in the scales
keeps playing

jp: .しよんぼりと雀にさへもまま子哉
ro: shonbori to suzume ni sae mo mamako kana
en:
dejected--
even among sparrows
a stepchild

jp: .雀らもおや子連にて善光寺
ro: suzumera mo oyako-zure nite zenkôji
en:
sparrow parents too
bring their children...
Zenko Temple

jp: .それ馬が馬がとやいふ親雀
ro: sore uma ga uma ga to ya iu oya suzume
en:
"Watch out for that horse!
Watch out!"
mother sparrow calls

jp: .やつれたよ子に疲たぞ門雀
ro: yatsureta yo ko ni tsukareta zo kado suzume
en:
looking haggard
from her baby-sitting...
sparrow at the gate

jp: .鶯や朝々おがむ榎から
ro: uguisu ya asa-asa ogamu enoki kara
en:
nightingale--
morning after morning
in the nettle tree I pray to

jp: .鶯や桶をかぶって猫はなく
ro: uguisu ya oke wo kabutte neko wa naku
en:
nightingale--
the cat under the bucket
meows

jp: .鶯や垣踏んで見ても一声
ro: uguisu ya kaki funde mite mo hitotsu koe
en:
nightingale--
even strutting on the fence
a song

jp: .鶯や廻り廻て来る庵
ro: uguisu ya mawari mawarite kuru iori
en:
nightingale--
after his rounds
back to my hut

jp: .鶯よけさは弥太郎事一茶
ro: uguisu yo kesa wa yatarô koto issa
en:
hey nightingale!
from this morning on Yataro
is Issa

jp: .うら窓やはつ鶯もぶさた顔
ro: ura mado ya hatsu uguisu mo busata kao
en:
back window--
the first nightingale too
a blank face

jp: .薮超の乞食笛よ鶯よ
ro: yabu goshi no kojiki fue yo uguisu yo
en:
wafting through trees
a beggar's flute
a nightingale's song

jp: .あらかんの鉢の中より雲雀哉
ro: arakan no hachi no naka yori hibari kana
en:
out of the saint's
big pot...
a lark

jp: .追分の一里手前の雲雀哉
ro: oiwake no ichi ri temae no hibari kana
en:
two miles to go
to Oiwake...
a skylark!

jp: .小島にも畠打也鳴雲雀
ro: kojima ni mo hatake utsunari naku hibari
en:
on a tiny island, too
plowing
to the lark's song

jp: .坂本はあれぞ雲雀と一里鐘
ro: sakamoto wa are zo hibari to ichi ri kane
en:
"Sakamoto's that way!"
says the lark and temple bell
two miles off

jp: .小な市の菜の祭り雲雀哉
ro: chiisana ichi no na no matsuri hibari kana
en:
at a tiny market's
vegetable festival...
a skylark

jp: .松島やあちの松から又雲雀
ro: matsushima ya achi no matsu kara mata hibari
en:
Matsushima--
from yonder isle
another lark

jp: .松島やかすみは暮て鳴雲雀
ro: matsushima ya kasumi wa kurete naku hibari
en:
island of pines--
while mist turns dark
a skylark singing

jp: .蓑を着て寝たる人より雲雀哉
ro: mino wo ki[te] netaru hito yori hibari kana
en:
a man sleeping
in a straw raincoat...
the lark's wake-up call

jp: .加賀どのの御先をついと雉哉
ro: kaga dono no osaki wo tsui to kigisu kana
en:
an impromptu audience
with Lord Kaga...
a pheasant

jp: .雉なくや臼と盥の間から
ro: kiji naku ya usu to tarai no aida kara
en:
a pheasant cries--
from the rice cake tub
from the wash tub

jp: .雉なくや座頭が橋を這ふ時に
ro: kiji naku ya zatô ga hashi wo hau toki ni
en:
a pheasant cries
just when the blind man
crawls across the bridge

jp: .雉鳴や寺の座敷の真中に
ro: kiji naku ya tera [no] zashiki no man naka ni
en:
a pheasant cries
in the temple room's
dead center

jp: .大雨やずっぷり濡て帰る雁
ro: ôame ya zuppuri nurete kae[ru] kari
en:
big rain--
soaked to the skin
the returning geese

jp: .帰り度雁は思ふやおもはずや
ro: kaeri taku kari wa omou ya omowazu ya
en:
are the geese yearning
to depart...
or not?

jp: .帰る雁細い煙を忘るるな
ro: kae[ru] kari hosoi keburi wo wasururu na
en:
geese flying north
don't neglect to stop
for my thin smoke!

jp: .雁にさへ袖引雨は降りにけり
ro: kari ni sae sode-hiku ame wa furi ni keri
en:
on the geese, too
the seductive rain
falling

jp: .こんな日も旅立よしか帰る雁
ro: konna hi mo tabi tatsu yoshi ka kae[ru] kari
en:
is today a good day
to journey too?
returning geese

jp: .松の木を置去にして帰る雁
ro: matsu no ki wo okizari [ni] shite kae[ru] kari
en:
divorcing
the pine tree...
geese on the move

jp: .我村はいく日に通る帰る雁
ro: waga mura wa iku hi ni tôru kaeru kari
en:
on what day
will you pass my village?
geese flying north

jp: .いも神のさんだらぼしに蛙哉
ro: imo kami no sandara-boshi ni kawazu kana
en:
on the straw lid
of the smallpox god...
a frog

jp: .足下の月を見よ見よ鳴蛙
ro: ashi moto no tsuki wo mi yo mi yo naku kawazu
en:
the moon at your feet
look!
croaking frog

jp: .大蛙から順々に座とりけり
ro: ô kawazu kara jun-jun ni za tori keri
en:
after the big frog
one by one
they take their seats

jp: .散花を奪とりがちになく蛙
ro: chiru hana wo baitorigachi ni naku kawazu
en:
falling blossoms...
"I'll conquer you!"
croaks the frog

jp: .爪先は夜に入にけり鳴く蛙
ro: tsumasaki wa yo ni iri ni keri naku kawazu
en:
standing on tiptoe
as night falls...
croaking frog

jp: .蕗の葉を引っかぶりつつ鳴蛙
ro: fuki no ha wo hikkaburi tsutsu naku kawazu
en:
tucking themselves in
under butterbur leaves...
croaking frogs

jp: .三ケ月を白眼つめたる蛙哉
ro: mikazuki wo nirami tsumetaru kawazu kana
en:
scowling
at the sickle moon...
a frog

jp: .祝ひ日や白い僧達白い蝶
ro: iwai-bi ya shiroi sôdachi shiroi chô
en:
festival day--
white monks
and a white butterfly

jp: .うつくしき仏になるや蝶夫婦
ro: utsukushiki hotoke ni naru ya chô fûfu
en:
becoming beautiful
Buddhas, butterfly
husband and wife

jp: .大猫の尻尾でじゃらす小てふ哉
ro: ôneko no shippo de jarasu ko  chô kana
en:
playing with
the big cat's tail...
a little butterfly

jp: .かいだんの穴よりひらり小てふ哉
ro: kaidan no ana yori hirari ko chô kana
en:
from a hole in the temple's
pulpit, swish!
little butterfly

jp: .神垣や白い花には白い蝶
ro: kamigaki ya shiroi hana ni wa shiroi chô
en:
shrine fence--
on a white flower
a white butterfly

jp: .それぞれや蝶も白組黄色組
ro: sore-zore ya chô mo shiro-gumi kiiro-gumi
en:
segregation
among butterflies too...
white gang, yellow gang

jp: .蝶とぶや大晴天の虎の門
ro: chô tobu ya ôseiten no tora no kado
en:
a butterfly flits--
the vast blue sky
over Tiger Gate

jp: .蝶行やしんらん松も知った顔
ro: chô yuku ya shinran matsu mo shitta kao
en:
butterfly departs--
even Shinran's pine
seems to know

jp: .虎の門蝶もぼつぼつ這入けり
ro: tora no kado chô mo botsu-botsu hairi keri
en:
Tiger Gate--
the butterfly, too
enters with courage

jp: .一莚蝶もほされておりにけり
ro: hito mushiro chô mo hosarete ori ni keri
en:
one straw mat--
a butterfly is drying
too

jp: .ふり上る箒の下やねる小蝶
ro: furiageru hôki no shita ya neru ko chô
en:
swinging the broom
underneath, asleep
little butterfly

jp: .舞は蝶三弦流布の小村也
ro: mau wa chô samisen rufu no ko mura nari
en:
butterfly dance--
someone plays samisen
in the little village

jp: .まへや蝶三弦流布のあさぢ原
ro: mae ya chô samisen rufu no asaji-bara
en:
dance, butterfly!
someone plays samisen
in Asaji Field

jp: .さまづけに育られたる蚕哉
ro: samazuke ni sodateraretaru kaiko kana
en:
called "mister"
by those who raise them...
silkworms

jp: .たのもしや棚の蚕も喰盛り
ro: tanomoshi ya tana no kaiko mo kui-zakari
en:
a promising sound--
silkworms in the tray
stuff themselves

jp: .人並に棚の蚕も昼寝哉
ro: hitonami ni tana no kaiko mo hirune kana
en:
like people
silkworms in the tray
take a siesta

jp: .村中にきげんとらるる蚕哉
ro: mura naka ni kigen toraruru kaiko kana
en:
the whole village
pays them court...
silkworms

jp: .家うちして夜食あてがふ蚕哉
ro: ya-uchi shite yashoku ategau kaiko kana
en:
the whole family
serves the midnight meal
for silkworms

jp: .隠家を蜂も覚て帰る也
ro: kakurega wo hachi mo oboete kaeru nari
en:
secluded house--
the bees also memorize
the way back

jp: .辻堂の蜂の威をかる雀哉
ro: tsuji dô no hachi no i wo karu suzume kana
en:
at the crossroads temple
usurping the bees...
sparrows

jp: .蜂鳴て人のしづまる御堂哉
ro: hachi naite hito no shizumaru midô kana
en:
bees buzzing
people grow quiet
in the temple

jp: .蜂の巣や地蔵菩薩の御肱に
ro: hachi no su [ya] jizô bosatsu no on-hiji [ni]
en:
beehive--
safe on holy Jizo's
elbow

jp: .門畠憎くまれ草もわかわかし
ro: kado hatake nikumare kusa mo wakawakashi
en:
garden at the gate--
even the naughty weeds
young and fresh

jp: .わか草に背をこする野馬哉
ro: wakakusa ni senaka wo kosuru no uma kana
en:
on baby grass
rubbing his back...
field horse

jp: .狗の鼻で尋る菫哉
ro: enokoro no hana de tazunuru sumire kana
en:
using his nose
the puppy searches
the violets

jp: .是からは庵の領とて菫哉
ro: kore kara wa io no ryô tote sumire kana
en:
"From here on in
the hut's our territory!"
violets

jp: .鼻紙を敷て居れば菫哉
ro: hanagami wo Shiite suwareba sumire kana
en:
spreading tissue paper
sitting down...
violets

jp: .小盥に臼になの花吹雪哉
ro: ko-darai ni usu ni na no hana fubuki kana
en:
in the little tub
in the rice cake tub...
a rape flower blizzard

jp: .折々に猫が顔かく木の芽哉
ro: ori-ori ni neko ga kao kaku ki no me kana
en:
now and then
the cat scratches his face...
budding trees

jp: .家一つ有梅一つ三ケの月
ro: ie hitotsu ari ume hitotsu mike no tsuki
en:
one house
one plum tree...
a sickle moon

jp: .梅がかよ湯の香よ外に三ケの月
ro: ume ga ka yo yu no ka yo soto ni mike no tsuki
en:
plum blossom scent
hot bath scent, outside
a sickle moon

jp: .梅咲くや地獄の釜も休日と
ro: ume saku ya jigoku no kama mo yasumu hi to
en:
plum blooming
even hell's cauldrons
CLOSED

jp: .梅咲やせうじに猫の影法師
ro: ume saku ya shôji ni neko no kagebôshi
en:
plum blossoms--
in the paper door
a cat's shadow

jp: .梅咲くや目にもろもろの人通り
ro: ume saku ya me ni moro-moro no hito tôri
en:
plum blossoms--
all sorts of people
pass my gaze

jp: .梅の花庵の鬼門に立りけり
ro: ume no hana io no kimon ni tatari keri
en:
blooming plum tree
in the hut's
unlucky direction

jp: .梅の世や蓑きて暮す虫も有
ro: ume no yo ya mino ki[te] kurasu mushi mo ari
en:
plum blossom world--
worms in straw raincoats
are here too

jp: .うら店やつっぱり廻る梅の花
ro: uradana ya tsuppari mawaru ume no hana
en:
back-alley house--
thrust out, swaying
plum in bloom

jp: .烏帽子きた馬士どのや梅の花
ro: eboshi kita umakata dono ya ume no hana
en:
with his courtier's hat
on his high horse...
plum blossoms

jp: .大馬の尻引こする野梅哉
ro: ôuma no shiri hikkosuru no ume kana
en:
the big horse
rubs his rump...
plum blossoms in the field

jp: .子地蔵よ御手出し給へ梅の花
ro: ko jizô yo o-te dashi tamae ume no hana
en:
holy Jizo
stretch forth your hand!
plum blossoms

jp: .小坊主よも一ッ笑へ梅の花
ro: ko bôzu yo mo hitotsu warae ume no hana
en:
little boy
laugh once more!
plum blossoms

jp: .そら錠と人には告よ梅の花
ro: sora-jô to hito ni wa tsuge yo ume no hana
en:
tell passers-by
my door lock's broken!
plum blossoms

jp: .三ケ月の御きげんもよし梅の花
ro: mikazuki no o-kigen mo yoshi ume [no] hana
en:
the sickle moon
in a fine mood too...
plum blossoms!

jp: .明星や庵の鬼門の梅の花
ro: myôjô ya io no kimon no ume [no] hana
en:
morning star--
on my hut's unlucky side
plum blossoms

jp: .餅の座につくも有けり梅の花
ro: mochi no za ni tsuku mo [ari] keri ume no hana
en:
even the rice cake
has a seat...
plum blossoms

jp: .湯けぶりにせっかれて咲梅の花
ro: yu keburi ni sekkarete saku ume no hana
en:
in hot water steam
struggling to bloom...
plum blossoms

jp: .駕かきは女也けり花の山
ro: kagokaki wa onna nari keri hana no yama
en:
the palanquin bearers
are women!
blossoming mountain

jp: .けふは花見まじ未来がおそろしき
ro: kyô wa hanamimaji mirai ga osoroshiki
en:
today no blossom viewing
for me...
feeling afraid

jp: .下馬札や是より花の這入口
ro: geba fuda ya kore yori hana no hairiguchi
en:
a "Dismount Your Horse" sign--
the cherry blossoms'
front door

jp: .散花の辰巳へそれる屁玉哉
ro: chiru hana no tatsu mi e soreru hedama kana
en:
all morning
to the falling blossoms...
my farts

jp: .散花や長々し日も往生寺
ro: chiru hana ya naga-nagashi hi mo ôjôji
en:
cherry blossoms scatter
on a long, long day...
Ojo Temple

jp: .畠縁りに酒を売也花盛
ro: hata-beri ni sake wo uru nari hana-zakari
en:
at the field's edge
a sake vendor...
glorious blossoms

jp: .花を折る拍子にとれししゃくり哉
ro: hana wo oru hyôshi ni toreshi shakuri kana
en:
breaking off blossoms--
my hiccups
are cured

jp: .花さくや伊達に加へし空ぎせる
ro: hana saku ya date ni kuwaeshi kara giseru
en:
cherry blossoms--
playing the dandy, in my mouth
an empty pipe

jp: .花ちるやとある木陰も開帳仏
ro: hana chiru ya to aru kokage mo kaichôbutsu
en:
blossoms scatter--
under every tree
a Buddha on display

jp: .花ちるや日の入かたが往生寺
ro: hana chiru ya hi [no] iru kata ga ôjôji
en:
blossoms scatter
toward the setting sun...
Ojo Temple

jp: .花の世を笠きて暮す仏哉
ro: hana no yo wo kasa kite kurasu hotoke kana
en:
in a world of blossoms
wearing an umbrella-hat...
a Buddha

jp: .花の世は仏の身さへおや子哉
ro: hana no yo wa hotoke no mi sae oyako kana
en:
world of blossoms--
even among the Buddhas
parents and children

jp: .日ぐらしや花の中なる喧嘩買
ro: higurashi ya hana no naka naru kenka kau
en:
all day
amid the cherry blossoms
picking fights

jp: .大馬に尻こすらるる桜哉
ro: ô uma ni shiri kosuraruru sakura kana
en:
the big horse
rubs his butt
on cherry blossoms

jp: .君が代は紺のうれんも桜哉
ro: kimi ga yo wa kon nôren mo sakura kana
en:
Great Japan--
on the dark blue shop-curtains
more cherry blossoms

jp: .桜へと見えてじんじんばしより哉
ro: sakura e to miete jin-jin bashiyori kana
en:
off to view cherry blossoms
old man with kimono
tucked

jp: .小筵にざぶとまぶせる桜哉
ro: samushiro ni zabu to mabuseru sakura kana
en:
little straw mat
splashed all over...
cherry blossoms

jp: .釣針に引上て見る桜哉
ro: tsuribari ni hiki-agete miru sakura kana
en:
pulling up
his fishhook he looks...
at cherry blossoms!

jp: .堂守が人に酔たる桜哉
ro: dômori ga hito ni yoitaru sakura kana
en:
the temple guard
sick from the crowds...
cherry blossoms

jp: .塗下駄の音やかんじてちる桜
ro: nurigeta no oto ya kanjite chiru sakura
en:
sensing the sound
of lacquered clogs...
cherry blossoms scatter

jp: .塗下駄の方へと桜ちりにけり
ro: nurigeta no hô e to sakura chiri ni keri
en:
toward lacquered clogs
cherry blossoms
scatter

jp: .寝て起て大欠して桜哉
ro: nete okite ôakubi shite sakura kana
en:
waking with a big
yawn...
cherry blossoms

jp: .はらはらと畠のこやしや桜花
ro: hara-hara to hata no koyashi ya sakura kana
en:
fluttering down
mulch for the field
cherry blossoms

jp: .はらはらの飯にまぶれる桜哉
ro: hara-hara no meshi ni mabureru sakura kana
en:
falling, falling
all over the food...
cherry blossoms

jp: .山吹の花のはだへの蛙哉
ro: yamabuki no hana no hadae no kawazu kana
en:
on the flesh
of the yellow rose...
a frog

jp: .山吹や四月の春もなくなるに
ro: yamabuki ya shigatsu no haru mo nakunaru ni
en:
the yellow rose
in Fourth Month's "spring"
finally dies

jp: .山吹よちるな蛍の夕迄
ro: yamabuki yo chiru na hotaru no yû made
en:
yellow rose
don't die! until evenings
of fireflies

jp: .青柳のあいそう付る我家哉
ro: ao yagi no aisô tsukeru waga ya kana
en:
the green willow's
friendliness rubs off
on my house

jp: .穴一の穴十ばかり柳哉
ro: ana ichi no ana jû bakari yanagi kana
en:
penny toss gamblers
ten games at once...
willow trees

jp: .ぢちむさい庵も今は青柳ぞ
ro: jichi musai iori mo ima wa ao yagi zo
en:
even for my truly
crappy hut, now...
a green willow!

jp: .通りぬけせよと垣から柳哉
ro: tôrinuke seyo to yanagi kara yanagi kana
en:
"Take a shortcut though me!"
the willow
suggests

jp: .ひょいひょいとぶっ切棒の柳哉
ro: hyoi-hyoi to bukkirabô no yanagi kana
en:
here and there
a plain and to-the-point
willow

jp: .我柳しだるる芸はなかりけり
ro: waga yanagi shidaruru gei wa nakari keri
en:
my willow tree--
not that good
at drooping

jp: .青蔓の窓へ顔出す暑哉
ro: ao-zuru no mado e kao dasu atsusa kana
en:
the green vine
peeks in the window...
summer heat

jp: .暑き日やひやと算盤枕哉
ro: atsuki hi ya hiya to soroban makura kana
en:
hot day--
the cool abacus
for a pillow

jp: .あらあつしあつしと寝るを仕事哉
ro: ara atsushi atsushi to neru wo shigoto kana
en:
so hot! so hot!
sleeping
is a chore

jp: .栗の木の白髪太夫の暑哉
ro: kuri no ki no shiraga tayû no atsusa kana
en:
the white caterpillar
on the chestnut tree...
also is hot!

jp: .しなの路の山が荷になる暑哉
ro: shinano ji no yama ga ni ni naru atsusa kana
en:
Shinano road's mountains
bearing down...
the heat!

jp: .蝮住草と聞より暑哉
ro: mamushi sumu kusa to kiku yori atsusa kana
en:
vipers live
in this grass, I've heard...
summer heat

jp: .涼しさにみだ同体のあぐら哉
ro: suzushisa ni mida dôtai no agura kana
en:
in the cool air
like Amida Buddha...
cross-legged

jp: .涼しさに釈迦同体のあぐら哉
ro: suzushisa ni shaka dôtai no agura kana
en:
in the cool air
like Gautama Buddha...
cross-legged

jp: .朝涼や外村迄も祈り雨
ro: suzushisa ya soto mura made mo inori ame
en:
cool air--
even beyond the village
the prayed-for rain

jp: .涼しさや飯を掘出すいづな山
ro: suzushisa ya meshi wo hori-dasu izuna yama
en:
cool air--
digging up moss
on Mount Izuna

jp: .五月雨や石に坐を組む引がえる
ro: samidare ya ishi ni za wo kumu hikigaeru
en:
Fifth Month rain--
taking his seat on a rock
toad

jp: .五月雨や線香立したばこ盆
ro: samidare ya senkô tateshi tabako bon
en:
Fifth Month rain--
an incense stick stuck
in the tobacco tray

jp: .五月雨や天水桶のかきつばた
ro: samidare ya tensui oke no kakitsubata
en:
Fifth Month rain--
in a rain barrel
irises

jp: .ひきどのの仏頂面や五月雨
ro: hiki dono no butsu chôzura ya satsuki ame
en:
Mr. Toad's
sour Buddha face...
Fifth Month rain

jp: .面壁の三介どのや五月雨
ro: mempeki no sansuke dono ya satsuki ame
en:
a servant in Zen meditation
faces a wall...
Fifth Month rain

jp: .夕立を三日待たせて三粒哉
ro: yûdachi wo mikka matasete mi tsubu kana
en:
three days waiting
for this cloudburst...
three drops

jp: .夕立に拍子を付る乙鳥哉
ro: yûdachi ni hyôshi wo tsukeru tsubame kana
en:
darting to the beat
of the downpour...
a swallow

jp: .夕立や今二三盃のめのめと
ro: yûdachi ya ima ni sanbai nome nome to
en:
rainstorm--
two or three cups, now
drink up! drink up!

jp: .夕立や大肌ぬいで小盃
ro: yûdachi ya ôhadanuide ko sakazuki
en:
rainstorm--
bare-chested with a little
sake cup

jp: .夕立や上手に走るむら乙鳥
ro: yûdachi ya jyôzu ni hashiru mura tsubame
en:
gliding through the cloudburst
so cleverly...
swallows

jp: .うき雲の苦もなく峰を作りけり
ro: uki kumo no ku mo naku mine wo tsukuri keri
en:
the floating cloud
pushes up peaks
with ease

jp: .寝むしろや足でかぞへる雲の峰
ro: nemushiro ya ashi de kazoeru kumo no mine
en:
on my sleeping mat
counting with my feet...
billowing clouds

jp: .夕鐘や雲もつくねる法の山
ro: yûgane ya kumo mo tsukuneru nori no yama
en:
evening bell--
even the clouds convene
at the temple

jp: .よい程に塔の見へけり雲の峰
ro: yoi hodo ni tô no mie keri kumo no mine
en:
how good
to see a pagoda!
billowing clouds

jp: .大川や盃そそぐ夏の月
ro: ôkawa ya sakazuki sosogu natsu no tsuki
en:
big river--
pouring into my sake cup
the summer moon

jp: .夏山やばかていねいに赤い花
ro: natsu yama ya bakate inei ni akai hana
en:
summer mountain--
an excessively polite
red flower

jp: .灌仏をしゃぶりたがりて泣子哉
ro: kanbutsu wo shaburi-tagarite naku ko kana
en:
wanting to lick
the birthday Buddha...
crying child

jp: .子どもらも天窓に浴る甘茶哉
ro: kodomora mo atama ni abiru amacha kana
en:
anointing the heads
of children too...
Buddha's birthday tea

jp: .花御堂月も上らせ給ひけり
ro: hanamidô tsuki mo noborese tamai keri
en:
Buddha amid birthday flowers--
even the moon
deigns to rise

jp: .へぼ蜂が孔雀気どりや花御堂
ro: hebo-bachi ga kujaku kidori ya hanamidô
en:
the ordinary bee
struts like a peacock...
Buddha's birthday flowers

jp: .御仏のう月八日や赤い花
ro: mi-botoke no uzuki yôka ya akai hana
en:
Buddha's Fourth Month
Eighth Day...
red flowers

jp: .御仏や乞食町にも御誕生
ro: mi-botoke ya kojiki-chô ni mo o-tanjô
en:
the Buddha
even in beggar-town
is born

jp: .門の木にくくし付たる幟哉
ro: kado no ki ni kukushi-tsuketaru nobori kana
en:
wrapped in a knot
'round the tree at my gate...
summer banner

jp: .乙鳥のちょいと引っつく幟哉
ro: tsubakura no choi to hittsuku nobori kana
en:
briefly a swallow
clings to it...
summer banner

jp: .けふは鵜も骨休みする祭哉
ro: kyô wa u mo honeyasumi suru matsuri kana
en:
even the cormorants
on holiday today...
festival

jp: .子もち鵜や門から呼るもどり声
ro: ko mochi u ya kado kara yobaru modori koe
en:
the mother cormorant
cries at the gate
"Come home!"

jp: .としとへば片手出す子や更衣
ro: toshi toeba katate dasu ko ya koromogae
en:
she answers "How old?"
with one hand...
summer kimono

jp: .福耳と母がいふ也更衣
ro: fukumimi to haha ga iu nari koromogae
en:
"She has lucky ears"
her mother says...
summer kimono

jp: .おもしろう汗のしみたる浴衣哉
ro: omoshirô ase no shimitaru yukata kana
en:
how delightful--
my sweat-soaked
bathrobe!

jp: .おそ起や蚊屋から呼るとうふ売
ro: oso oki ya kaya kara yobaru tôfu uri
en:
sleeping late
under my mosquito net...
call of the tofu vendor

jp: .十露盤を肱につっ張る昼寝哉
ro: soroban wo hiji ni tsupparu hirune kana
en:
with elbows propped
on his abacus...
a siesta

jp: .大の字にふんばたがって昼寝哉
ro: dai no ji ni funbatagatte hirune kana
en:
spread-eagle arms
legs opened wide...
siesta

jp: .継っ子や昼寝仕事に蚤拾ふ
ro: mamakko ya hirune shigoto ni nomi hirou
en:
siesta work
for the stepchild...
picking brother's fleas

jp: .小うたひの尻べたたたく扇哉
ro: ko utai no shiribeta tataku ôgi kana
en:
singing a song
and slapping his butt...
with a fan

jp: .ごろり寝の顔にかぶせる扇哉
ro: gorori ne no kao ni kabuseru ôgi kana
en:
covering his face
curled up to sleep...
a paper fan

jp: .大般若はらりはらりと扇哉
ro: ôhannya harari-harari to ôgi kana
en:
the great demoness
flits and flutters...
paper fan

jp: .手にとれば歩たく成る扇哉
ro: te ni toreba arukitaku nari ôgi kana
en:
when it's in hand
I want to promenade...
paper fan

jp: .としよれば煤け扇もたのみ哉
ro: toshiyoreba susuke ôgi mo tanomi kana
en:
growing old--
a sooty paper fan
works fine

jp: .二階から我をも透す扇哉
ro: ni kai kara ware wo mo sukasu ôgi kana
en:
from the second floor
she peers at me too!
paper fan

jp: .かり住の敷居の上の蚊やり哉
ro: karizumi no shiki-i no ue no kayari kana
en:
over the rented room's
threshold...
smudge pot smoke

jp: .犬ころが火入れの番や夕涼み
ro: inukoro ga hi-ire no ban ya yûsuzumi
en:
the puppy guards
my pipe lighting tool...
evening cool

jp: .大海を手ですくひつつ夕涼
ro: dai umi wo te de sukui tsutsu yûsuzumi
en:
scooping up the ocean
in my hands...
evening cool

jp: .人形に餅を売らせて夕涼
ro: ningyô ni mochi wo urasete yûsuzumi
en:
making the doll
sell rice cakes...
evening cool

jp: .頬べたに筵の跡や一涼み
ro: hôbeta ni mushiro no ato ya hito suzumi
en:
straw mat marks
on my cheek...
a cool breeze

jp: .本堂の長雨だれや夕涼
ro: hondô no naga amadare ya yûsuzumi
en:
the main temple's roof
dripping long raindrops...
evening cool

jp: .それがしも田植の膳に居りけり
ro: soregashi mo taue no zen ni suwari keri
en:
I sit too
at the rice planters'
dinner tray

jp: .よその子や十そこらにて田植唄
ro: yoso no ko ya tô sokora nite taue uta
en:
someone else's child
just ten or thereabouts...
rice-planting song

jp: .只った今旅から来しを田植馬
ro: tatta ima tabi kara kishi wo taue uma
en:
back from his journey
into the saddle...
rice-planting horse

jp: .かはほりや四十島田も更衣
ro: kawahori ya shi jû shimada mo koromogae
en:
bats flying--
for the well coifed woman in her forties too
a new summer robe

jp: .石山へ雨を逃すなほととぎす
ro: ishiyama e ame wo nigasu na hototogisu
en:
don't let the rain
escape to Ishiyama!
cuckoo

jp: .うす墨を流した空や時鳥
ro: usu-zumi wo nagashita sora ya hototogisu
en:
the sky painted
with washed-out ink...
"cuckoo!"

jp: .大水の百年忌也時鳥
ro: ômizu no hyaku nenki nari hototogisu
en:
on the great flood's
100th anniversary...
"cuckoo!"

jp: .から崎の雨よせて又ほととぎす
ro: karasaki no ame yosete mata hototogisu
en:
once again summoning
Karasaki's rain...
the cuckoo

jp: .品玉の赤い襷やほととぎす
ro: shinadama no akai tasuki ya hototogisu
en:
the juggler's red
sleeve cord...
and a cuckoo

jp: .次郎寝よばか時鳥鳴過る
ro: jirô ne yo baka hototogisu naki-sugiru
en:
Jiro, go to sleep!
the foolish cuckoo
sings too much

jp: .白妙の花の卯月や時鳥
ro: shirotae no hana no uzuki ya hototogisu
en:
for pure white flowers
it's the Fourth Month...
"cuckoo!"

jp: .八文がつつじ咲けり時鳥
ro: hachi mon ga tsutsuji saki keri hototogisu
en:
my eight-penny azaleas
are blooming...
"cuckoo!"

jp: .時鳥咄の腰を折にけり
ro: hototogisu hanashi no koshi wo ori ni keri
en:
the cuckoo
breaking in, shuts
me up

jp: .時鳥貧乏耳とあなどるな
ro: hototogisu bimbô mimi to anadoru na
en:
oh cuckoo--
don't disdain
these poor ears!

jp: .やかましや追かけ追かけ時鳥
ro: yakamashi ya oikake oikake hototogisu
en:
what a racket--
chase him! chase him!
cuckoo

jp: .行な行なおらが仲間ぞ閑古鳥
ro: yuku na yuku na oraga nakama zo kankodori
en:
don't go! don't go!
these are my friends
a mountain cuckoo

jp: .あちこちの声にまごつく蛍哉
ro: achi kochi no koe ni magotsuku hotaru kana
en:
voices calling
here and there, perplexing
for the firefly

jp: .一群は石山方の蛍かな
ro: hito mure wa ishiyama-gata no hotaru kana
en:
one swarm
comes from Ishiyama...
fireflies

jp: .喧嘩せば外へ出よ出よはつ蛍
ro: kenka seba soto e deyo deyo hatsu-botaru
en:
when we quarrel
out you go!
first firefly

jp: .西なるはなむあみ方の蛍哉
ro: nishi naru wa namu ami-gata no hotaru kana
en:
in the west
battling like ancients monks
fireflies

jp: .寝むしろや雨もぽちぽちとぶ忖
ro: ne mushiro ya ame mo pochi-pochi tobu hotaru
en:
sleeping mat--
rain drips, drops
a firefly takes off

jp: .はつ蛍ついとそれたる手風哉
ro: hatsu-botaru tsui to soretaru te kaze kana
en:
the first firefly
deftly swerves away...
wind from my hand

jp: .番町や大骨折って行蛍
ro: banchô ya ôhone otte yuku hotaru
en:
Bancho Town--
with all his might
the firefly flits

jp: .蛍火や呼らぬ亀は手元迄
ro: hotarubii ya yobaranu kame wa temoto made
en:
firefly lights--
a turtle not called for
close at hand

jp: .本町の真中通る蛍かな
ro: honchô no man naka tôru hotaru kana
en:
smack in the middle
of the Old Quarter...
fireflies

jp: .我袖に一息つくや負け蛍
ro: waga sode ni hito iki tsuku ya make hotaru
en:
on my sleeve
catching his breath...
worn-out firefly

jp: .あばれ蚊に数珠をふりふり回向哉
ro: abare ka ni juzu [wo] furi-furi ekô kana
en:
swatting prayer beads
at a pesky mosquito...
memorial service

jp: .蚊の声に貧乏樽を枕哉
ro: ka no koe ni bimbô-daru wo makura kana
en:
a mosquito whines--
an old keg
my pillow

jp: .蚊柱の三本目より三ケの月
ro: ka-bashira no sanbonme yori mike no tsuki
en:
from the third column
of the mosquito swarm...
a sickle moon

jp: .蚊柱のそっくりするや畠迄
ro: ka-bashira no sokkuri suru ya hatake made
en:
mosquito column--
unbroken from here
to the field

jp: .真直に蚊のくみ立し柱哉
ro: mattsugu ni ka [no] kumi tateshi hashira kana
en:
straight up and down--
the mosquitoes swarm
a column

jp: .子の蚤を休み仕事に拾いけり
ro: ko no nomi wo yasumi shigoto ni hiroi keri
en:
child's fleas--
it's leisure time work
picking them

jp: .蚤の跡かぞへながらに添乳哉
ro: nomi no ato kazoe nagara ni soeji kana
en:
she counts flea bites
while her child
suckles

jp: .継っ子や昼寝仕事に蚤拾ふ
ro: mamakko ya hirune shigoto ni nomi hirou
en:
the stepchild's chore--
during baby's midday nap
picking fleas

jp: .水桶の尻干す日也羽蟻とぶ
ro: mizu oke no shiri hosu hi ari ha-ari tobu
en:
upside-down
the bucket's drying day...
winged ants flying

jp: .大牡丹貧乏村とあなどるな
ro: ôbotan bimbô mura to anadoru na
en:
oh great peony
don't disdain
this poor neighborhood!

jp: .おのづから頭の下たるぼたん哉
ro: onozukara zu no sagaritaru botan kana
en:
by itself
the head is bowing...
peony!

jp: .影ぼしも七尺去ってぼたん哉
ro: kageboshi mo shichi shaku satte botan kana
en:
its shadow, too
seven feet away...
the peony

jp: .是程のぼたんと仕かたする子哉
ro: kore hodo no botan to shikata suru ko kana
en:
"The peony is this big!"
the child's arms
outstretched

jp: .盃をちよいと置たるぼたん哉
ro: sakazuki wo choi to okitaru botan kana
en:
I lay my sake cup
on top for a moment...
peony

jp: .侍が傘さしかけるぼたん哉
ro: samurai ga kasa sashikakeru botan kana
en:
shaded by the
samurai's umbrella...
the peony

jp: .蟇どのも福と呼るるぼたん哉
ro: hiki dono mo fuku to yobaruru botan kana
en:
I call Mr. Toad
"Lucky" too...
peony

jp: .小便のたらたら下や杜若
ro: shôben no tara-tara dare ya kakitsubata
en:
where piss dribbles,
dribbles down...
irises

jp: .古杭の古き夜明やかきつばた
ro: furu-gui no furuki yoake ya kakitsubata
en:
an old-time daybreak
for the old post...
irises

jp: .細長い蛇の社や杜若
ro: hoso-nagai hebi no yashiro ya kakitsubata
en:
the long skinny snake's
Shinto shrine...
irises

jp: .黒い穂も世の賑しや麦畠
ro: kuroi ho mo yo no nigiwashi ya mugi hatake
en:
black ears too
bustling in the world...
barley field

jp: .古郷や寝所に迄ことし竹
ro: furusato ya ne-dokoro ni made kotoshi take
en:
my home village--
even where people sleep
this year's bamboo

jp: .門の垣わか葉盛もなかりけり
ro: kado no kaki wakaba-zakari mo nakari keri
en:
my gate's hedge--
no flourishing
of fresh green

jp: .ざぶざぶと白壁洗ふわか葉哉
ro: zabu-zabu to shira kabe arau wakaba kana
en:
splish-splash
the white wall washed...
by fresh leaves

jp: .念入て虫が丸しわか葉哉
ro: nen irite mushi ga marumeshi wakaba kana
en:
so carefully rolled
by a bug...
new green leaf

jp: .橋守が桶の尻干わか葉哉
ro: hashi mori ga oke no shiri hosu wakaba kana
en:
the bridge guard's bucket
upside-down to dry...
fresh leaves

jp: .わか葉して男日でり在所哉
ro: wakaba shite otoko hideri no zaisho kana
en:
new leaves forming--
in the town a drought
of men

jp: .ぶら下るわらじと虫や木下闇
ro: burasagaru waraji to mushi ya koshitayami
en:
straw sandals and insects
dangling...
deep tree shade

jp: .小盥に臼にうの花吹雪哉
ro: ko-darai ni usu ni u no hana fubuki kana
en:
in the wash basin
in the rice cake tub...
a deutzia blossom blizzard

jp: .一人と書留らるる夜寒哉
ro: ichi nin to kaki tomeraruru yozamu kana
en:
"A man"
is registered at the inn...
a cold night

jp: .かくれ家や夜寒をしのぐあつめ垣
ro: kakurega ya yozamu [wo] [shinogu] atsume-gaki
en:
secluded house--
keeping out night's cold
a patchwork fence

jp: .木のはしの法師に馴るる夜寒哉
ro: kinohashi no hôshi ni naruru yozamu kana
en:
the good-for-nothing priest
is used to it...
a cold night

jp: .盆の灰いろはを習ふ夜寒哉
ro: bon no hai iroha wo narau yozamu kana
en:
practising writing
in the tray's ashes...
a cold night

jp: .宮守を鼬のなぶる夜寒哉
ro: miyamori wo itachi no naburu yozamu kana
en:
a weasel sports
with the shrine's guard...
a cold night

jp: .藪陰をてうちん通る夜寒哉
ro: yabu kage wo chôchin tôru yozamu kana
en:
with a lantern
crossing the shady thicket...
a cold night

jp: .追分の一里手前の秋の暮
ro: oiwake no ichi ri temae no aki no kure
en:
two miles to go
to Oiwake...
autumn dusk

jp: .鬼の寝た穴よ朝から秋の暮
ro: oni no neta ana yo asa kara aki no kure
en:
in her cave the demon sleeps--
from morning on
autumn's last day

jp: .米炊ぐ水とくとくや秋の暮
ro: kome kashigu mizu to toku-toku ya aki no kure
en:
rice water boiling
bubble, bubble!
autumn dusk

jp: .床の間の杖よわらじよ秋の暮
ro: toko-no-ma no tsue yo waraji yo aki no kure
en:
stowed in the alcove
walking stick, straw sandals...
autumn dusk

jp: .一二三四と薪よむ声や秋の暮
ro: hi fu mi yo to maki yomu koe ya aki no kure
en:
one, two, three, four
counting the firewood...
autumn dusk

jp: .我家も一里そこらぞ秋の暮
ro: waga ie mo ichi ri sokora zo aki no kure
en:
my house
just two miles more...
autumn dusk

jp: .秋の夜やうらの番屋も祭客
ro: aki no yo ya ura no banya mo matsuri kyaku
en:
autumn evening--
even in the watchman's shack out back
festival guests

jp: .木曽山に流入けり天の川
ro: kiso yama ni nagare iri keri ama no kawa
en:
into the Kiso Mountains
it flows...
Milky Way

jp: .小坊主が子におしへけり天の川
ro: ko bôzu ga ko ni oshie keri ama no kawa
en:
a little boy
shows another child...
Milky Way

jp: .さむしろや鍋にすじかふ天の川
ro: samushiro ya nabe ni sujikau ama no kawa
en:
little straw mat--
in the kettle slantwise
Milky Way

jp: .すっぽんと月と並ぶや角田川
ro: suppon to tsuki to narabu ya sumida-gawa
en:
the turtle and moon
merge...
Sumida River

jp: .小柱もせんたくしたり盆の月
ro: ko-bashira mo sentaku shitari bon no tsuki
en:
the little post
gets a scrubbing too...
Bon Festival moon

jp: .草の穂は雨待宵のきげん哉
ro: kusa no ho wa ame matsuyoi no kigen kana
en:
the beards of grasses
in a mood for rain...
night before the harvest moon

jp: .みたらしやすみ捨てある後の月
ro: mitarashi ya sumi sutete aru nochi no tsuki
en:
purification font--
thrown in a corner
the Ninth Month moon

jp: .秋日和負ふて越るや箱根山
ro: akibiyori oute koeru ya hakone yama
en:
clear fall weather--
with burdens they cross
Mount Hakone

jp: .秋日和とも思はない凡夫かな
ro: akibiyori to mo omowanai bompu kana
en:
unaware
of the clear fall weather...
layman

jp: .順礼が馬にのりけり秋日和
ro: junrei ga uma ni nori keri akibiyori
en:
a pilgrim rides by
on a horse...
clear fall weather

jp: .なぐさみのはっちはっちや秋日和
ro: nagusami no hatchi-hatchi ya akibiyori
en:
just for fun
a game of cards...
clear fall weather

jp: .雷に焼かれし山よ秋の雨
ro: kaminari ni yaki kareshi yama yo aki no ame
en:
on the lightning-scorched
mountain...
autumn rain

jp: .秋風や小さい声の新乞食
ro: akikaze ya chiisai koe no shin kojiki
en:
autumn wind--
the new beggar's
small voice

jp: .秋風やつみ残されし桑の葉に
ro: akikaze ya tsumi-nokosareshi kuwa no ha ni
en:
autumn wind
on the mulberry leaves
left unplucked

jp: .上人の目には御舎利か草の露
ro: shônin no me ni wa o-shari ka kusa no tsuyu
en:
to enlightened eyes
Buddha's bones?
dewdrops in the grass

jp: .仏法がなくば光らじ草の露
ro: buppô ga nakuba hikaraji kusa no tsuyu
en:
without Buddha's law
no glitter...
dewdrops in the grass

jp: .稲妻や三人一度に顔と顔
ro: inazuma ya sannin ichi do ni kao to kao
en:
lightning flash--
suddenly three people
face to face

jp: .稲妻や屁とも思はぬひきが顔
ro: inazuma ya he to mo omo[wa]nu hiki ga kao
en:
lightning flash--
not giving a damn
the toad's face

jp: .磯寺や座敷の霧も絶え絶えに
ro: iso-dera ya zashiki no kiri mo tae-dae ni
en:
seaside temple--
the room in the mist
grows faint

jp: .霧雨や夜霧昼霧我庵は
ro: kiri ame ya yo-giri hiru-giri waga io ha
en:
misty rain
misty nights, misty days...
my hut

jp: .神風や飯を掘出す秋の山
ro: kamikaze ya meshi wo hori-dasu aki no yama
en:
divine wind--
digging up moss
on the autumn mountain

jp: .御仏も笠きて立や辻踊
ro: mi-botoke mo kasa kite tatsu ya tsuji odori
en:
the Buddha also
with umbrella-hat...
crossroads dance

jp: .髪のない天窓並べて星迎
ro: kami no nai atama narabete hoshi mukae
en:
bald heads in a row...
greeting the stars
of Tanabata

jp: .しゃんしゃんと虫もはたおりて星迎
ro: shan-shan to mushi mo hata orite hoshi mukae
en:
chirr-chirr! insects also
work their looms...
stars of Tanabata

jp: .梶の葉の歌をしゃぶりて這ふ子哉
ro: kaji no ha no uta wo shaburite ha[u] ko kana
en:
sucking on the
mulberry leaf poem...
the crawling child

jp: .紙でした梶の葉にさへ祭哉
ro: kami de shita kaji no ha ni sae matsuri kana
en:
though made of paper
a mulberry leaf poem...
for the festival

jp: .星合の閨に奉る蚊やり哉
ro: hoshi ai no neya ni hôzuru ka yari kana
en:
reaching the bedroom
of the Star Couple...
smudge pot smoke

jp: .ふいに寄っても角力也門の月
ro: fui ni yotte mo sumô nari kado no tsuki
en:
suddenly a crowd
for the sumo match...
moon at the gate

jp: .ふいと立おれをかがしの替哉
ro: fui to tatsu ore wo kagashi no kawari kana
en:
staggering
I'm the scarecrow's
replacement

jp: .蜻蛉の休み所のかがし哉
ro: tombô no yasumi-dokoro no kagashi kana
en:
the dragonflies'
resort spot...
the scarecrow

jp: .夕ぐれやかがしと我と只二人
ro: yûgure ya kagashi to ware to tada futari
en:
evening falls--
me and a scarecrow
just us two

jp: .おとし水おさらばさらばさらば哉
ro: otoshi mizu o-saraba saraba saraba kana
en:
draining the rice field--
farewell! farewell!
farewell!

jp: .落し水鰌も滝を上る也
ro: otoshi mizu dojô mo taki wo noboru nari
en:
draining the rice field--
a loach also
climbs the rapids

jp: .小夜砧うつや隣の其の隣
ro: sayo-ginuta utsu ya tonari no sono tonari
en:
cloth-pounding at night--
the neighbor's
neighbor

jp: .我家の一理そこらぞ夕砧
ro: waga ie [no] ichi ri sokora zo yûginuta
en:
that's my house
about two miles away...
evening cloth-pounding

jp: .我庵の一里手前の砧哉
ro: waga io no ichi ri temae no kinuta kana
en:
my hut, two miles
from where you're pounding
cloth

jp: .わか鹿や二ッ並んで対の声
ro: waka shika ya futatsu narande tsui no koe
en:
two young deer
side by side...
a duet

jp: .鵙鳴や七日の説法屁一つ
ro: mozu naku ya nanuka no seppô he hitotsu
en:
a shrike sings--
seven days of sermons
one fart

jp: .五百崎や鍋の中迄雁おりる
ro: isozaki ya nabe no naka made kari oriru
en:
Isozaki--
wild geese descend
even into a kettle!

jp: .はつ雁や同行五人善光寺
ro: hatsu kari ya dôkô go nin zenkôji
en:
autumn's first geese--
five people enroute
to Zenko Temple

jp: .籠の虫妻恋しとも鳴ならん
ro: kago no mushi tsuma koishi tomo nakunaran
en:
the caged insect
sings a love song
to his wife

jp: .日ぐらしの朝からさわぐ山家哉
ro: higurashi no asa kara sawagu yamaga kana
en:
cicada, from morning on
its ruckus...
mountain home

jp: .御仏の代におぶさる蜻蛉哉
ro: mi-botoke no kawari ni obusaru tombo kana
en:
leaving my shoulder
for the Buddha's...
dragonfly

jp: .よい世とや虫が鈴ふり鳶がまふ
ro: yoi yo to ya mushi ga suzu furi tobi ga mau
en:
a good world!
crickets ring
a black kite wheels

jp: .門畠や筵敷かせてとぶいなご
ro: kado hata ya mushiro shikasete tobu inago
en:
spreading a straw mat
at the gate's field...
a locust lands

jp: .鎌の刃をくぐり巧者のいなご哉
ro: kama no ha wo kuguri kôsha no inago kana
en:
crossing the sweep
of the sickle's blade...
a brave locust

jp: .行灯にちょいと鳴けりきりぎりす
ro: andon ni choi to naki keri kirigirisu
en:
a quick song
inside the lantern...
katydid

jp: .きりぎりす紙袋にて鳴にけり
ro: kirigirisu kamibukuro nite naki ni keri
en:
the katydid
in the paper bag...
still singing

jp: .勝菊は大名小路もどりけり
ro: katsu kiku wa daimyô kôji modori keri
en:
the champion chrysanthemum
down the war lord's lane
returns

jp: .菊ぞのや女ばかりが一床机
ro: kiku-zono ya onna bakari ga hito shôgi
en:
chrysanthemum garden--
only women
on the one bench

jp: .酒臭し小便くさし菊の花
ro: sake kusashi shôben kusashi kiku no hana
en:
smelling like sake
smelling like piss
chrysanthemums

jp: .人声の江戸にも馴れて菊の花
ro: hito-goe no edo ni mo narete kiku no hana
en:
getting used
to to voices of Edo...
chrysanthemum

jp: .負菊の叱られて居る小隅哉
ro: make kiku [no] shikararete iru kosumi kana
en:
the losing chrysanthemum
punished...
in a corner

jp: .山寺や茶の子のあんも菊の花
ro: yamadera ya cha no ko no an mo kiku no hana
en:
mountain temple--
even sweet tea cakes
chrysanthemum-shaped

jp: .好い菊と云れて菊を喰ひけり
ro: yo[i] kiku [to] iwarete kiku wo kurai keri
en:
the chrysanthemum
I call "good"
I eat

jp: .朝顔をざぶとぬらして枕哉
ro: asagao wo zabu to nurashite makura kana
en:
rain splashing
the morning-glories...
my pillow

jp: .朝顔の黒く咲けり我髪は
ro: asagao no kuroku saki keri waga kami wa
en:
morning-glories
have bloomed blackly...
but my hair...

jp: .朝顔の花や一寸先は闇
ro: asagao no hana ya issun saki wa yami
en:
morning-glory--
one inch from its tip
darkness

jp: .朝顔やなむあ--あ--と一時に
ro: asagao ya namu aa-aa to hito toki ni
en:
morning-glories--
all praise to Ah...
Ahhhh!

jp: .木がくれや白朝顔のすまし顔
ro: kogakure ya shira asagao no sumashi-gao
en:
hidden in trees
the white morning-glory's
demure face

jp: .人の世や新朝顔のほだし咲
ro: hito no yo ya shin asagao no hodashi-zaki
en:
world of man--
a new morning-glory
blooms in bondage

jp: .片隅につんと立けり女郎花
ro: kata sumi ni tsunto tachi keri ominaeshi
en:
in a little nook
acting stuck-up...
maiden flowers

jp: .刈跡や一穂もとらばなむあみだ
ro: kari ato ya hito ho [mo] toraba namu amida
en:
after the harvest
finding a rice stalk...
Praise Buddha!

jp: .鶺鴒がふんで流るるおち穂哉
ro: sekirei ga funde nagaruru ochibo kana
en:
wagtails march through
sucking them up...
rice gleanings

jp: .日本の外ケ浜迄おち穂哉
ro: nippon no hokake hama made ochibo kana
en:
to Japan's
farthest shores...
rice gleanings

jp: .拾へとて鳥がおとしたおち穂哉
ro: hiroe tote tori ga otoshita ochibo kana
en:
dropped by the
foraging birds...
rice gleanings

jp: .新わらにふはりふはりと寝楽哉
ro: shinwara ni fuwari fuwari to neraku kana
en:
the new hay is soft
so soft...
a pleasant snooze

jp: .馬の子や口さん出すや柿紅葉
ro: uma no ko ya kuchi sandasu ya kaki momiji
en:
the pony stretches
its mouth...
red persimmon leaves

jp: .そっくりと蛙の乗し一葉哉
ro: sokkuri to kawazu [no] norishi hito ha kana
en:
down it comes
with a frog rider...
the leaf

jp: .落栗や先へ烏に拾はるる
ro: ochi-guri ya saki e karasu ni hirowaruru
en:
fallen chestnuts--
the crow gets first
dibs

jp: .山寺や畳の上の栗拾ひ
