ro: yamadera ya tatami no ue no kuri hiroi
en:
mountain temple--
on tatami mats, gathering
chestnuts

jp: .十二月二十九日も入相ぞ
ro: jûnigatsu ni jû ku nichi mo iriai zo
en:
on the 29th day
of Twelfth Month, too...
a sunset

jp: .狼の糞を見てより草寒し
ro: ôkami no kuso wo mite yori kusa samushi
en:
spotting wolf shit--
the grass
is so cold!

jp: .ひいき目に見てさへ寒き天窓哉
ro: hiiki me ni mite sae samuki atama kana
en:
even to my
biased eyes it's a cold
head!

jp: .ひいき目に見てさへ寒し影法師
ro: hiiki me ni mite sae samushi kagebôshi
en:
even to my
biased eyes it's a cold
shadow!

jp: .真丸に小便したる夜寒哉
ro: manmaru ni shôben shitaru yozamu kana
en:
pissing a perfect
circle...
a cold night

jp: .むちゃくちゃやあはれことしも暮の鐘
ro: mucha-kucha [ya] aware kotoshi mo kure no kane
en:
clang! bang!
this damned year, too
ends with a bell

jp: .入相の鐘も仕廻の三十日哉
ro: iriai no kane mo shimai no misoka kana
en:
sunset's bell
finishes it off...
year's last day

jp: .かくれ家や大三十日も夜の雪
ro: kakurega ya ômisoka mo yoru no yuki
en:
secluded house--
even on the year's last day
evening snow

jp: .ごろり寝や先はことしも仕廻酒
ro: gorori ne ya mazu wa kotoshi mo shimai sake
en:
curling to sleep--
but first ending this year, too
with a toast

jp: .旅人の悪口す也初時雨
ro: tabibito no waru-guchi su nari hatsu shigure
en:
cursing
the traveler...
first winter rain

jp: .小盲や右も左もむら時雨
ro: ko mekura ya migi wa hidari mo mura shigure
en:
a blind child--
to his right, to his left
steady winter rain

jp: .小便に手をつく供や横時雨
ro: shôben ni te wo tsuku tomo ya yoko shigure
en:
after pissing
rinsing the hands...
slanting winter rain

jp: .鳩どもも泣事をいふしぐれ哉
ro: hato domo mo nakigoto wo iu shigure kana
en:
even the pigeon
grumbles...
winter rain

jp: .はつ雪に打かぶせたる尿瓶哉
ro: hatsu yuki ni uchi-kabusetaru shibin kana
en:
the first snowfall
caps it...
the piss pot

jp: .はつ雪や今重ねたる庵の薪
ro: hatsu yuki ya ima kasa[ne]taru io no maki
en:
the first snowfall
adds to the stack...
huts' firewood

jp: .はつ雪やいろはにほへと習声
ro: hatsu yuki ya i-ro-ha-ni-o-e to narau-goe
en:
first snowfall--
"A B C D E F..."
she practices

jp: .はつ雪は御堂参りの序哉
ro: hatsu yuki wa midô mairi no tsuide kana
en:
first snow--
and now a temple
pilgrimage

jp: .闇夜のはつ雪らしやぼんの凹
ro: yami no yo no hatsu yuki rashi ya bon no kubo
en:
dark night--
the first snowflakes
hit my neck

jp: .雪ちりて犬の大門通り哉
ro: yuki chirite inu no daimon tôri kana
en:
snow falling--
a dog passes through
the temple's great gate

jp: .一吹雪拍子つきけり米洗
ro: hito fubuki hyôshi tsuki keri kome arai
en:
to the rhythm
of the blizzard
washing rice

jp: .霰こんこんこん触ル狐哉
ro: arare kon kon kon fureru kitsune kana
en:
going nuts in hailstones
crashing down...
a fox

jp: .懐に袂に霰々哉
ro: futokoro ni tamoto ni arare arare kana
en:
in the pockets
in the sleeves...
hailstones!

jp: .我門は無きずな旦も小霜哉
ro: waga kado wa mukizuna asa mo ko shimo kana
en:
at my gate
a flawless little patch...
morning frost

jp: .名代の寒水浴る雀哉
ro: myôdai no kanmizu abiru suzume kana
en:
my proxy bathes
in the cold water...
sparrow

jp: .煤はきや旭に向ふ鼻の穴
ro: susu haki ya asahi ni mukau hana no ana
en:
soot sweeping--
toward the rising sun I aim
my nostrils

jp: .大仏の鼻から出たり煤払
ro: daibutsu no hana kara detari susu harau
en:
from the great bronze
Buddha's nose...
soot-sweeping

jp: .ほちゃほちゃと菜遣しぬ煤払
ro: hocha-hocha to na tsukawashinu susu harau
en:
a chubby girl
offered pickles...
soot sweeping

jp: .ほのぼのと明わたりけり煤の顔
ro: hono-bono to akewatari keri susu no kao
en:
dimly seen
in the dawn light...
a sooty face

jp: .えどの世は女もす也節き候
ro: edo no yo wa onna mo su nari sekkizoro
en:
Edo's world--
women also
are Twelfth Month singers

jp: .門口や上手に滑る節季候
ro: kado-guchi ya jyôzu ni suberu sekkizoro
en:
at my gate
slipping so skillfully...
a Twelfth Month singer

jp: .せき候の尻の先也角田川
ro: sekizoro no shiri no saki nari sumida-gawa
en:
Twelfth Month singers--
their butts facing
Sumida River

jp: .鶺鴒の尻ではやすやせっき候
ro: sekirei no shiri de hayasu ya se[k]kizoro
en:
performing
behind a waterfall...
Twelfth Month singers

jp: .隠家や手の凹ほども餅さわぎ
ro: kakurega ya te no kubo hodo mo mochi sawagi
en:
secluded house--
even for a palm-sized rice cake
a commotion

jp: .のし餅や子どものつかふ大団扇
ro: noshi mochi ya kodomo no tsukau ôuchiwa
en:
flat rice cake--
a child uses it
as a big fan

jp: .世は安し焼野の小屋も餅さわぎ
ro: yo wa yasushi yakeno no koya mo mochi sawagi
en:
world at peace--
even at a shack in a burnt field
a rice cake commotion

jp: .藪並に餅もつく也宵の月
ro: yabu nami ni mochi mo tsuku nari yoi no tsuki
en:
in a stand of trees
pounding rice cakes...
evening moon

jp: .山の手や渋茶すすりてとし忘
ro: yamanote ya shibucha susurite toshiwasure
en:
Yamanote--
slurping coarse tea
drinking away the year

jp: .鬼打の豆に滑って泣子哉
ro: oni utsu no mame ni subette naki ko kana
en:
slipping on
the demon-expelling beans...
crying child

jp: .雪車負て坂を上るや小さい子
ro: sori ôte saka wo noboru ya chiisai ko
en:
lugging his snow sled
up the slope...
little child

jp: .五百崎や雉子の出て行く炭俵
ro: iozaki ya kiji no dete yuku sumi-dawara
en:
at Iozaki
pheasants rise and go...
charcoal bags

jp: .ぬかるみにはや踏れけり炭俵
ro: nukarumi ni haya fumare keri sumidawara
en:
in the mud
trampled so quickly...
empty charcoal bag

jp: .若い衆に頼んで寝たるほた火哉
ro: wakai shu ni tanonde netaru hotabi kana
en:
entrusting it to young folk
I sleep...
cozy wood fire

jp: .有明をなくや千鳥も首尾の松
ro: ariake wo naku ya chidori mo shubi [no] matsu
en:
singing to the dawn
the plovers too...
Shubi Pine

jp: .橋守の鍋蓋ふんで鳴千鳥
ro: hashimori no nabebuta funde naku chidori
en:
trampling the bridge watchman's
kettle lid...
a singing plover

jp: .散すすき寒く成ったが目に見ゆる
ro: chiru susuki samuku natta ga me ni miyuru
en:
pampas grass flowers
scatters, it's grown cold
I see

jp: .あにかれじかれじと見しは欲目也
ro: ani kareji kareji to mishi wa yokume nari
en:
my thought
the tree would never wither
was wrong

jp: .今見れば皆欲目也枯た梅
ro: ima mireba mina yokume nari kareta ume
en:
remembering how it was
with yearning...
bare winter plum

jp: .冬がれて親孝行の烏哉
ro: fuyugarete oya kôkô no karasu kana
en:
winter withering--
the crow respects
his parents

jp: .朽ち桜何の願ひに帰り花
ro: kuchi-zakura nan no negai ni kaeri-bana
en:
rotten cherry tree
what prayer brought you
out-of-season blooms?

jp: .士の供を連たる御犬哉
ro: samurai no tomo wo tsuretaru o-inu kana
en:
joining the samurai's
company...
Sir Dog

jp: .正月や夜は夜とて梅の花
ro: shôgatsu ya yoru wa yoru tote ume no hana
en:
First Month--
tonight a night
of plum blossoms

jp: .正月や貸下駄並ぶ日陰坂
ro: shôgatsu ya kashi geta narabu hikage-zaka
en:
First Month--
a row of clogs for rent
on the shady hillside

jp: .鶯のいな鳴やうも今朝の春
ro: uguisu no i na naki yô mo kesa no haru
en:
the nightingale's song
wonderfully strange...
spring's first dawn

jp: .あばら家や其身其まま明の春
ro: abaraya ya sono mi sono mama ake no haru
en:
my ramshackle hut--
just as it is...
spring begins

jp: .目出度さもちう位也おらが春
ro: medetasa mo chû kurai nari oraga haru
en:
my "Happy New Year!"
about average
my spring

jp: .春立や弥太郎改めはいかい寺
ro: haru tatsu ya yatarô aratame haikai-ji
en:
new spring
Yataro is reborn...
into Haiku Temple

jp: .今春が来たよふす也たばこ盆
ro: ima haru ga kita yôsu nari tabako bon
en:
now spring has come
for sure...
tobacco tray

jp: .土蔵からすじかいにさすはつ日哉
ro: dozô kara sujikai ni sasu hatsu hi kana
en:
from the storehouse
shining slantwise...
year's first sun

jp: .ぬかるみに筑つつ張てはつ日哉
ro: nukarumi ni tsue tsupatte hatsu hi kana
en:
sticking my cane
in the mud...
the year's first dawn

jp: .西方のはつ空拝む法師哉
ro: saihô no hatsu-zora ogamu hôshi kana
en:
westward he prays
to the year's first sky...
priest

jp: .御盛りや草の庵ももりはじめ
ro: osaga[ri] ya kusa no iori mo mori hajime
en:
the year's first rain--
my grass roof's
first leak

jp: .雪降や夜盗も鼻を明の方
ro: yuki furu ya yatô mo hana wo ake no hô
en:
with snow falling
the night thief must follow his nose too...
New Year's walk

jp: .御地蔵の御首にかける飾り哉
ro: o-jizô no o-kubi ni kakeru kazari kana
en:
hanging from
St. Jizo's neck...
a New Year's decoration

jp: .二つ三つ藪にかけるやあまり七五三
ro: futa[tsu] mi[tsu] yabu ni kakeru ya amari shime
en:
two or three
hang in the thicket...
New Year's ropes

jp: .又ことし七五三かける也顔の皺
ro: mata kotoshi shime kake[ru] nari kao no shiwa
en:
another year
hanging the New Year's rope...
wrinkled face

jp: .年頭に孫の笑ふをみやげ哉
ro: nentô ni mago no wara[u] wo miyage kana
en:
for laughing grandchildren
on New Year's Day...
presents!

jp: .白髪の天窓をふり立て御慶哉
ro: haku hatsu no atama wo furitate gyokei kana
en:
his head of white hair
perks up...
"Happy New Year!"

jp: .かくれ家や猫にも一ッ御年玉
ro: kakurega ya neko [ni] mo hitotsu o-toshidama
en:
secluded house--
even for the cat
a New Year's gift

jp: .番丁や窓から投る御年玉
ro: banchô ya mado kara hôru o-toshidama
en:
night watchman--
from his window he hurls
New Year's gifts

jp: .書賃のみかんみいみい吉書哉
ro: kakichin no mikan mii mii kissho kana
en:
looking, looking
at the mandarin orange...
year's first calligraphy

jp: .小坊主が棒を引ても吉書始
ro: ko bôzu ga bô wo hikite mo kissho hajime
en:
the little boy
uses a cane...
New Year's first writing

jp: .ついついと棒を引ても吉書哉
ro: tsui-tsui to bô wo hiite mo kissho kana
en:
swish, swish
writing with my cane...
year's first calligraphy

jp: .わんぱくや先掌に筆はじめ
ro: wanpaku ya mazu tenohira ni fude hajime
en:
in the naughty child's
palm first, a brush...
New Year's writing

jp: .名代のわか水浴びる烏哉
ro: myôdai ni wakamizu abiru karasu kana
en:
bathing in the
New Year's water...
my proxy the crow

jp: .三文が若水あまる庵哉
ro: san mon ga wakamizu amaru iori kana
en:
three pennies of New Year's
water is enough...
little hut

jp: .親よぶや凧上ながら小順礼
ro: oya yobu [ya] tako age nagara ko junrei
en:
calling his parents
while his kite rises!
little pilgrim

jp: .お袋が福手をちぎる指南哉
ro: o-fukuro ga fukude wo chigiru shinan kana
en:
Mama's way
of shaping rice cake offerings...
a lesson

jp: .葉固の歯一枚もなかりけり
ro: hagatame no ha ichi mai mo nakari keri
en:
New Year's tooth-hardening
meal...
yet toothless!

jp: .竃の門に置するわかな哉
ro: hettsui no kado ni okasuru wakana kana
en:
laid out
at the hearth's door...
New Year's herbs

jp: .長閑さや浅間のけぶり昼の月
ro: nodokasa ya asama no keburi hiru no tsuki
en:
spring peace--
Mount Asama's smoke
and the noon moon

jp: .山の湯やだぶりだぶりと日の長き
ro: yama no yu ya daburi-daburi to ni no nagaki
en:
a mountain hot bath
slish-slosh...
a long day

jp: .白犬の眉書れたる日永哉
ro: shiro inu no mayu kakaretaru hi naga kana
en:
drawing eyebrows
on the white dog...
a long day

jp: .大道にころころ犬の日永哉
ro: daidô ni koro-koro inu no hi naga kana
en:
a dog rolling
in the highway...
a long day

jp: .朝市の大肌ぬぎや春の雨
ro: asa ichi no ôhadanugi ya haru no ame
en:
at morning market
he bares his chest...
spring rain

jp: .馬迄もはたご泊りや春の雨
ro: uma made mo hatago tomari ya haru no ame
en:
even a horse
is the inn's guest...
spring rain

jp: .芝居へと人はいふ也春の雨
ro: shibai e to hito wa iu nari haru no ame
en:
"We're off to see
the play," they say...
spring rain

jp: .掃溜の赤元結や春の雨
ro: hakidame no aka motoyui ya haru no ame
en:
a red hair string
in the rubbish heap...
spring rain

jp: .福狐出た給ふぞよ春の雨
ro: fuku kitsune ide tamau zo yo haru no ame
en:
a lucky fox
deigns to come out...
spring rain

jp: .ぼた餅や藪の仏も春の風
ro: botamochi ya yabu no hotoke mo haru no kaze
en:
rice cake with bean paste
for the Buddha of the thicket...
spring breeze

jp: .春風に御用の雁のしぶとさよ
ro: harukaze ni goyô no kari no shibutosa yo
en:
in the spring breeze
a goose on a mission...
headstrong!

jp: .朧夜や天の音楽聞し人
ro: oboro yo ya ten no ongaku kikishi hito
en:
hazy night--
people listening
to heavenly music

jp: .後の家見るやかすめばかすむとて
ro: ato no ie miru ya kasu[me]ba kasumu tote
en:
looking back at my house
the mist
even mistier

jp: .あとの家もかすんで音途々哉
ro: ato no ie mo kasunde kadode kadode kana
en:
looking back at her house
just mist...
I depart, I depart

jp: .家舟の音途々もかすみけり
ro: iebune no kadode kadode mo kasumi keri
en:
leaving the houseboat
behind me, behind me
in the mist

jp: .おのが門見るやかすめばかすむとて
ro: ono ga kado miru ya kasumeba kasumu tote
en:
looking at my gate
the mist
even mistier

jp: .思ふまじ見まじかすめよおれが家
ro: omoumaji mimaji kasume yo ore ga ie
en:
don't want to remember it
or see it...
cover my house, mist!

jp: .かすむ日やしんかんとして大座敷
ro: kasumu hi ya shinkan to shite ôzashiki
en:
misty day--
a hush in the big
sitting room

jp: .白壁のそしられつつもかすみけり
ro: shira kabe no soshirare tsutsu mo kasumi keri
en:
even their white walls
are slandered!
spring mist

jp: .古郷や朝茶なる子も春がすみ
ro: furusato ya asa[cha] naruko mo harugasumi
en:
my home village--
the call to morning tea
a clap in the mist

jp: .横乗の馬のつづくや夕がすみ
ro: yokonori no uma no tsuzuku ya yûgasumi
en:
riding sidesaddle
one by one...
evening mist

jp: .陽炎の中にうごめく衆生かな
ro: kagerô no naka ni ugomeku shujô kana
en:
squirming
amid the heat shimmers
people

jp: .陽炎や手に下駄はいて善光寺
ro: kagerô ya te ni geta haite zenkôji
en:
heat shimmers--
wooden clogs on his hands
at Zenko Temple

jp: .陽炎や掃捨塵も銭になる
ro: kagerô ya hakisute-gomi no zeni ni naru
en:
heat shimmers--
someone's thrown-out garbage
for sale

jp: .愛らしく両手の跡の残る雪
ro: airashiku ryôte no ato no nokoru yuki
en:
lovely--
in the leftover snow
both handprints

jp: .鍋の尻ほし並たる雪解哉
ro: nabe no shiri hoshi narabetaru yukige kana
en:
cooking pots bottoms up
dry in a row...
snow is melting

jp: .昔なり両手の跡の残る雪
ro: mukashi nari ryôte no ato no nokori yuki
en:
olden times--
two handprints worth
of leftover snow

jp: .門前や子どもの作る雪げ川
ro: monzen ya kodo[mo] no tsukuru yukige kawa
en:
at the gate
children dig a channel...
river of melting snow

jp: .薮の雪ちょっととけるもけむり哉
ro: yabu no yuki chotto tokeru mo kemuri kana
en:
in the thicket
snow melts easily...
smoke

jp: .雪どけや大旅篭屋のうらの松
ro: yuki-doke ya ôhatago[ya] no ura no matsu
en:
snow is melting!
the pine tree behind
the inn

jp: .雪の道片方とけてやみにけり
ro: yuki no michi kata kata tokete yami ni keri
en:
snowy road--
on one side melts
to darkness

jp: .引連て代もかく也子もち馬
ro: hikitsurete shiro mo kaku nari ko mochi uma
en:
helping to rake
the rice-seedling bed...
horse and pony

jp: .小うるさい花が咲とて寝釈迦かな
ro: ko urusai hana ga saku tote neshaka kana
en:
a little tiresome
these blooming flowers...
the Buddha sleeps

jp: .寝ておわしても仏ぞよ花が降る
ro: nete owashite mo hotoke zo yo hana ga furu
en:
even lying down
he's Buddha!
shower of blossoms

jp: .涅槃会や鳥も法華経法華経と
ro: nehan-e ya tori mo hokekyô hokekyô to
en:
Buddha's Death-Day
a bird too, sings Lotus Sutra!
Lotus Sutra!

jp: .御仏や寝てござっても花と銭
ro: mi-botoke ya nete gozatte mo hana to zeni
en:
the Buddha
even lying down, showered
with blossoms and coins

jp: .はつ午や火たく畠の夜の雪
ro: hatsu uma ya hi wo taku hata no yoru no yuki
en:
Fox Festival night--
snow falling
on the bonfire

jp: .初午に無官の狐鳴にけり
ro: hatsu uma ni mukan no kitsune naki ni keri
en:
Fox Festival--
the non-divine foxes
crying

jp: .花の世を無官の狐鳴にけり
ro: hana no yo wo mukan no kitsune naki ni keri
en:
world of blossoms--
the non-divine foxes
crying

jp: .鋲打の駕で出代る都哉
ro: byôuchi no kago de degawaru miyako kana
en:
a studded palanquin
for the migrating servant...
Kyoto

jp: .隠れ屋や猫のもすえる二日灸
ro: kakureya ya neko ni mo sueru futsukakyû
en:
secluded house--
even the cat gets a dose
of burning wormwood

jp: .片すみに煤け雛も夫婦哉
ro: kata sumi ni susu[ke] hiina mo fûfu kana
en:
in one corner
soot-covered dolls...
husband and wife

jp: .煤け雛しかも上座をめされけり
ro: susuke hina shikamo jôza wo mesare keri
en:
a soot-covered doll
but displayed in the seat
of honor

jp: .土雛は花の木かげに隠居哉
ro: tsuchi hina wa hana no kokage ni inkyo kana
en:
the clay doll
shaded by blossoms...
hermit

jp: .土雛も祭の花はありにけり
ro: tsuchi hina mo matsuri no hana wa ari ni keri
en:
even the clay doll
is decked with flowers...
festival

jp: .花の世や寺もさくらの雛祭
ro: hana no yo ya tera mo sakura no hina matsuri
en:
blossom world--
even in a temple's cherry grove
the Doll Festival

jp: .ひな棚にちょんと直りし小猫哉
ro: hina-dana ni chon to naorishi ko neko kana
en:
landing plop! on all fours
on the shelf of dolls...
kitten

jp: .へな土の雛も同じ祭り哉
ro: henatsuchi no hina mo onaji matsuri kana
en:
even for a doll
made from black muck...
the same festival

jp: .我こねた土のひなでも祭り哉
ro: waga koneta tsuchi no hina demo matsuri kana
en:
though my doll of clay
is homemade...
Girls' Festival

jp: .草餅を鍋でこねてもいはひ哉
ro: kusamochi wo nabe de konete mo iwai kana
en:
in the herb cake pan
also kneading in
a prayer

jp: .山焼や仏体と見へ鬼と見へ
ro: yama yaki ya buttai to mie oni to mie
en:
fires on the mountain--
look like Buddha
look like devil

jp: .山焼や夜はうつくしきしなの川
ro: yama yaki ya yo wa utsukushiki shinano-gawa
en:
fires on the mountain
make it pretty at night...
Shinano river

jp: .ざくざくと雪かき交ぜて田打哉
ro: zaku-zaku to yuki kakimazete ta uchi kana
en:
crunch! crunch!
plowing the rice field
snow

jp: .浅間根のけぶる側迄畠かな
ro: asama ne no keburu soba made hatake kana
en:
at the verge
of Mount Asama's smoke...
a farmer's field

jp: .畠打や子が這ひ歩くつくし原
ro: hata uchi ya ko ga hai-aruku tsukushi-bara
en:
plowing the field--
a child crawls through
horsetails

jp: .我と来て遊べや親のない雀
ro: ware to kite asobe ya oya no nai suzume
en:
come and play
with me...
orphan sparrow

jp: .大勢の子を連歩く雀哉
ro: ôzei no ko wo tsure aruku suzume kana
en:
a troop of children
march behind her...
mother sparrow

jp: .ぎりのある子を呼ばるかよ夕雀
ro: giri no aru ko wo yobaru ka yo yû suzume
en:
are you calling
for your stepchild?
evening sparrow

jp: .雀子のしをしをぬれて鳴にけり
ro: suzumego no shio-shio nurete naki ni keri
en:
baby sparrow
pitifully, pitifully wet
he cries

jp: .雀子や川の中迄親をよぶ
ro: suzumego ya kawa no naka made oya wo yobu
en:
baby sparrow
in the middle of the river
cries for mama

jp: .雀の子そこのけそこのけ御馬が通る
ro: suzume no ko soko noke soko noke o-uma ga tôru
en:
baby sparrows
move aside!
Sir Horse passes

jp: .筍と品よくあそべ雀の子
ro: takenoko to shinayoku asobe suzume no ko
en:
bamboo shoots, baby sparrows
play together
gently!

jp: .今の世も鳥はほけ経鳴にけり
ro: ima no yo mo tori wa hokekyô naki ni keri
en:
world of corruption
but a bird still sings
the Lotus Sutra

jp: .鶯の兄弟連れか同じ声
ro: uguisu no kyôdai zure ka onaji koe
en:
are those nightingales
brothers?
identical voices!

jp: .鶯の馳走にはきしかきね哉
ro: uguisu no chisô ni hakishi kakine kana
en:
in the nightingale's honor
sweeping off
the fence

jp: .鶯の鳴かげぼしや明り窓
ro: uguisu no naku kageboshi ya akari mado
en:
a nightingale's shadow
singing...
bright window

jp: .鶯の目利してなくわが家哉
ro: uguisu no mekiki shite naku waga ya kana
en:
the nightingale
sizes it up, singing...
my house

jp: .鶯も上鶯のいなかかな
ro: uguisu mo jô uguisu no inaka kana
en:
even among nightingales
royalty
and bumpkins

jp: .鶯や男法度の奥の院
ro: uguisu ya otoko hatto no oku no in
en:
hey nightingale--
no men allowed
in the harem!

jp: .君が代は鳥も法華経鳴にけり
ro: kimi ga yo wa tori mo hokkekyô naki ni keri
en:
Great Japan!
where a bird sings
the Lotus Sutra

jp: .来るも来るも下手鶯ぞおれが垣
ro: kuru mo kuru mo heta uguisu zo ore ga kaki
en:
one by one they come
off-key nightingales
to my fence

jp: .なつかしや下手鶯の遠鳴は
ro: natsukashi ya heta uguisu no tô naki wa
en:
missing home--
an off-key nightingale's
faraway song

jp: .乙鳥を待ってみそつく麓哉
ro: tsubame wo matte miso tsuku fumoto kana
en:
waiting for the swallows
pounding bean-paste...
mountain's foot

jp: .松島や小隅は暮て鳴雲雀
ro: matsushima no ko sumi wa kurete naku hibari
en:
darkness settles
over a tiny isle of pines...
a skylark singing

jp: .子をかくす薮の廻りや鳴雲雀
ro: ko wo kakusu yabu no meguri ya naku hibari
en:
circling the thicket
that hides her children...
a lark sings

jp: .横のりの馬のつづくや夕雲雀
ro: yokonori no uma no tsuzuku ya yûhibari
en:
riding sidesaddle
on horse after horse...
an evening lark

jp: .小社を三遍舞て帰る雁
ro: ko yashiro wo san-ben maite kaeru kari
en:
three times 'round
the little shrine...
departing geese

jp: .早立は千住留りか帰る雁
ro: haya tatsu wa senju-domari ka kaeru kari
en:
rising early
will you stop at Senju town?
departing geese

jp: .有明や火を打つまねを鳴く蛙
ro: ariake ya hi wo utsu mane wo naku kawazu
en:
dawn--
mimicking me striking fire
croaking frog

jp: .おれとしてかがみくらする蛙かな
ro: ore to shite kagamikura suru kawazu kana
en:
squatting low
eye to eye...
with the frog

jp: .おれとして白眼くらする蛙かな
ro: ore to shite niramikura suru kawazu kana
en:
locked in a staring contest
me...
and a frog

jp: .親分と見へて上座に鳴蛙
ro: oyabun to miete jôza ni naku kawazu
en:
looks like the boss
in the seat of honor...
croaking frog

jp: .蛙鳴や狐の嫁が出た出たと
ro: kawazu naku ya kitsune no yome ga deta deta to
en:
frogs croaking--
"There goes fox's bride!
fox's bride!"

jp: .鶺鴒の尻ではやすや鳴蛙
ro: sekirei no shiri de hayasu ya naku kawazu
en:
the wagtail beats time
with his butt...
croaking frogs

jp: .其声で一つおどれよなく蛙
ro: sono koe de hitotsu odore yo naku kawazu
en:
as long as you're singing
go ahead, dance!
frog

jp: .木母寺の鐘に孝行かはづ哉
ro: mokuboji no kane ni kôkô kawazu kana
en:
Mokubo Temple's bell
fills him with filial piety...
the frog

jp: .大猫の尻尾でなぶる小てふ哉
ro: ô neko no shippo de naburu ko chô kana
en:
sporting with
the big cat's tail...
a little butterfly

jp: .葎からあんな小蝶が生れけり
ro: mugura kara an[na] ko chô ga umare keri
en:
from the weeds
that little butterfly
is born!

jp: .塵塚にあんな小蝶が生れけり
ro: chirizuka ni anna ko chô ga umare keri
en:
in the trash heap
that little butterfly
is born!

jp: .てふてふのふはりととんだ茶釜哉
ro: chôchô no fuwari to tonda chagama kana
en:
the butterfly's
soft landing...
in the tea kettle!

jp: .蝶ひらひら庵の隅々見とどける
ro: chô hira-hira io no sumi-zumi mitodokeru
en:
flitting butterfly--
every corner of my hut
is inspected

jp: .びんずるの御鼻をなでる小蝶哉
ro: binzuru no o-hana wo naderu ko chô kana
en:
rubbing St. Binzuru's
holy nose...
little butterfly

jp: .門の草芽出すやいなやむしらるる
ro: kado no kusa me dasu ya inaya mushiraruru
en:
grass by the gate--
soon as it sprouts
it's plucked

jp: .芽出しから人さす草はなかりけり
ro: me dashi kara hito sasu kusa wa nakari keri
en:
among the sprouts
not one man-stabbing
blade of grass

jp: .うちはぐみ人さす草でなかりけり
ro: uchiwa-gumi hito sasu kusa de nakari keri
en:
people with fans--
no stabbing grass
in sight

jp: .竹の葉につれて葎もわか葉哉
ro: take no ha ni tsurete mugura mo wakaba kana
en:
keeping bamboo shoots
company, weeds
fresh green too

jp: .わか草や北野参りの子ども講
ro: wakakusa ya kitano mairi no kodomo kô
en:
baby grass--
a troop of little pilgrims
visit Kitano

jp: .九輪草四五りん草で仕廻けり
ro: kurinsô shi go rinsô de shimai keri
en:
the nine-ring flower
blooms only four or five
then quits

jp: .野大根大髭どのに引れけり
ro: no daikon ôhige dono ni hikere keri
en:
radish in the field--
Sir Whiskers
yanks it up

jp: .梅折や天窓の丸い陰ぼふし
ro: ume oru ya atama no marui kagebôshi
en:
the plum blossom theif's
round head's
shadow

jp: .梅が香や小藪の中も正一位
ro: ume ga ka yak o yabu no naka mo sei ichi-i
en:
plum blossom scent
even in the little thicket
first class

jp: .梅さくや泥わらじにて小盃
ro: ume saku ya doro waraji nite ko sakazuki
en:
plum blooming--
muddy straw sandals
and a sake cup

jp: .梅の花ここを盗めとさす月よ
ro: ume no hana koko wo nusume to sasu tsuki yo
en:
here's a plum blossom
steal it!
bright moon

jp: .梅の花ここを盗めとさす月か
ro: ume no hana koko wo nusume to sasu tsuki ka
en:
are you pointing out
these plum blossoms for stealing,
moon?

jp: .大淀や大曙のんめの花
ro: ôyodo ya ô akebono no n-me no hana
en:
Oyodo Town--
plum blossoms the colors
of dawn

jp: .男禁制の門也梅の花
ro: otoko kinsei no kado nari ume no hana
en:
a "No Men Allowed" sign
on the gate...
plum blossoms

jp: .欠茶碗開帳したる梅の花
ro: kake chawan kaichô shitaru ume no hana
en:
my cracked teacup
like Buddha on display...
plum blossoms

jp: .関守りの灸点はやる梅の花
ro: sekimori no kyûten hayaru ume no hana
en:
the barrier guard's
wormwood burn sores in vogue...
plum blossoms

jp: .ちさい子の麻上下も梅の花
ro: chisai ko mo asa kamishimo ya ume no hana
en:
a little child dressed
like a Shinto priest...
plum blossoms

jp: .一入に新善光寺ぞよ梅の花
ro: hito shio ni shin zenkôji zo ume no hana
en:
one dip in the dye
renews Zenko Temple...
plum blossoms

jp: .薮尻のさいせん箱や梅の花
ro: yabu shiri no saisen hako ya ume no hana
en:
deep in the thicket
an offering box...
plum blossoms

jp: .藪村やまぐれあたりも梅の花
ro: yabu mura ya magure-atari mo ume no hana
en:
remote village--
a stroke of rare luck
these plum blossoms!

jp: .苦の娑婆や花が開けばひらくとて
ro: ku no saba ya hana ga hirakeba hiraku tote
en:
world of pain--
and blossoms blooming
add to it!

jp: .小倅はちに泣花の盛りかな
ro: kosegare wa chi ni naku hana [no] sakari kana
en:
a baby boy
cries for milk...
glorious blossoms

jp: .花ちるや末代無智の凡夫衆
ro: hana chiru ya matsudai muchi no bonpu shû
en:
cherry blossoms scatter--
the ignorant masses
of these latter days

jp: .花の陰赤の他人はなかりけり
ro: hana no kage aka no tanin wa nakari keri
en:
cherry blossom shade--
no one an utter
stranger

jp: .花の世に穴ほしげなる狐哉
ro: hana no yo ni ana hoshige naru kitsune kana
en:
he wants his hole
in the world of blossoms...
fox

jp: .山の月花ぬす人をてらし給ふ
ro: yama no tsuki hana nusubito wo terashi tamau
en:
the mountain moon
gives the blossom thief
light

jp: .苦の娑婆や桜が咲ば咲いたとて
ro: ku no shaba ya sakura ga sakeba saita tote
en:
world of pain--
and the cherry blossoms
add to it!

jp: .さくらさくらと唄れし老木哉
ro: sakura sakura to utawareshi oiki kana
en:
"Cherry blossoms! Cherry blossoms!"
they sang
under this old tree

jp: .茶屋村の出現したるさくらかな
ro: chaya mura [no] shutsugen shitari sakura kana
en:
a bevy of teahouses
suddenly!
cherry blossoms

jp: .茶屋村の一夜に出来しさくらかな
ro: chaya mura no hito yo ni dekishi sakura kana
en:
a bevy of teahouses
built overnight!
cherry blossoms

jp: .弥陀仏の見ておはす也ちる桜
ro: mida butsu no mite owasu nari chiru sakura
en:
Amida Buddha watches
them scatter...
cherry blossoms

jp: .山畠やこやしのたしにちる桜
ro: yama hata ya koyashi no tashi ni chiru sakura
en:
for the mountain field
mulch is falling...
cherry blossoms

jp: .夜桜や天の音楽聞し人
ro: yo-zakura ya ten no ongaku kikishi hito
en:
evening cherry blossoms--
people listening
to heavenly music

jp: .通りぬけせよと垣から柳哉
ro: tôrinuke seyo to kaki kara yanagi kana
en:
"Take a shortcut
through the hedge!"
the willow suggests

jp: .青柳に金平娘立にけり
ro: ao yagi ni kinpira musume tachi ni keri
en:
standing within
the green willow...
a warrior woman

jp: .入口のあいそになびく柳かな
ro: iriguchi no aiso ni nabiku yanagi kana
en:
waving at the entrance
the friendly
willow

jp: .江戸もえどえど真中の柳哉
ro: edo mo edo edo mannaka no yanagi kana
en:
smack in the middle
of Edo's very heart...
a willow

jp: .門柳天窓で分て這入けり
ro: kado yanagi atama de wakete hairi keri
en:
willow at the gate--
I part it with my head
going in

jp: .白猫のやうな柳もお花哉
ro: shiro neko no yôna yanagi mo o-hana kana
en:
the willow
like a white cat...
a temple flower too

jp: .灰猫のやうな柳もお花哉
ro: hai neko no yôna yanagi mo o-hana kana
en:
the willow
like a gray cat...
a temple flower too

jp: .野雪隠のうしろをかこふ柳哉
ro: no setchin no ushiro wo kakou yanagi kana
en:
shrouding his rear
as he poops in the field...
a willow

jp: .人声にもまれて青む柳かな
ro: hito-goe ni momarete aomu yanagi kana
en:
stirred by people's voices
the greening
willow

jp: .一吹にほんの柳と成にけり
ro: hito fuki ni hon no yanagi to nari ni keri
en:
with one gust
it becomes the perfect
willow

jp: .我門はしだれ嫌ひの柳哉
ro: waga kado wa shidare kirai no yanagi kana
en:
at my gate
refusing to droop...
the willow

jp: .戸口から青水な月の月夜哉
ro: toguchi kara aomina-zuki no tsuki yo kana
en:
from the doorway on
a Sixth Month night
of moon

jp: .六月にろくな月夜もなき庵哉
ro: rokugatsu ni rokuna tsuki yo mo naki ya kana
en:
in all of Sixth Month
not one good moon...
little hut

jp: .六月や月幸に煤はらひ
ro: rokugatsu ya tsuki saiwai ni susu harai
en:
Sixth Month--
for the moon's blessing
sweeping soot

jp: .六月や月夜見かけて煤はらひ
ro: rokugatsu ya tsuki yo mikakete susu harai
en:
Sixth Month--
catching sight of the moon
sweeping soot

jp: .短夜をよろこぶとしと成にけり
ro: mijika yo wo yorokobu toshi to nari ni keri
en:
short summer nights--
I've grown old enough
to love them

jp: .短夜や赤い花咲蔓の先
ro: mijika yo ya akai hana saku tsuru no saki
en:
short summer night--
a new red flower
on the vine's tip

jp: .あついとてつらで手習した子かな
ro: atsui tote tsura de tenari shita ko kana
en:
ink-stained hands
sweaty face...
the child's calligraphy!

jp: .暑き日や庇をほじるばか烏
ro: atsuki hi ya hisashi wo hojiru baka-garasu
en:
hot day--
the foolish crow picks
at the eaves

jp: .暑き夜の荷と荷の間に寝たりけり
ro: atsu[ki] yo no ni to ni no ai ni netari keri
en:
a hot night--
among bags and burdens
they sleep

jp: .暑き夜や蝙蝠かける川ばたに
ro: atsuki yo ya kômori kakeru kawa-bata ni
en:
hot night--
bats dangle
at the river's edge

jp: .稲の葉に忝さのあつさ哉
ro: ine no ha ni katajikenasa no atsusa kana
en:
the rice shoots
are grateful...
summer heat

jp: .米国の上々吉の暑さかな
ro: kome-guni no jôjôkichi no atsusa kana
en:
here in rice country
the lucky, lucky
heat

jp: .大帳を枕としたる暑かな
ro: daichô wo makura to shitaru atsusa kana
en:
account book
for a pillow...
the summer heat

jp: .なを暑し今来た山を寝て見れば
ro: nao atsushi ima kita yama wo nete mireba
en:
looking hotter now
those mountains I came from...
lying down

jp: .白山の雪きらきらと暑かな
ro: hakusan no yuki kira-kira to atsusa kana
en:
Mount Haku's snowcap
twinkling...
summer heat

jp: .草臥や涼しい木陰見て廻る
ro: kutabire ya suzushii kokage mite mawaru
en:
so weary--
cool tree shade makes me
double back

jp: .涼風の出口もいくつ松かしは
ro: suzukaze no deguchi mo ikutsu matsu kashiwa
en:
how many gateways
for the cool breeze?
pines and oaks

jp: .涼しさにしゃんと髪結御馬哉
ro: suzushisa ni shan to kamiyuu o-uma kana
en:
in the cool air
slap! slap! his hair is combed...
Sir Horse

jp: .涼しさに大福帳を枕かな
ro: suzushisa ni daifukuchô wo [makura] kana
en:
in summer cool
the account book
for a pillow

jp: .涼しさや極楽浄土の這入口
ro: suzushisa ya goraku jôdo no hairiguchi
en:
summer cool--
the gate to Buddha's
Pure Land

jp: .涼しさやしなのの雪も銭になる
ro: suzushisa ya shinano no yuki mo zeni ni naru
en:
cool air--
even the snow of Shinano
for sale

jp: .すしさや沈香もたかず屁もひらず
ro: suzushisa ya jinkô mo takazu he mo hirazu
en:
in summer cool air--
no incense
no farts

jp: .入梅晴や二軒並んで煤はらひ
ro: tsuyubare ya ni ken narande susu harai
en:
rainy season over--
two houses, two neighbors
sweeping soot

jp: .五月雨も仕廻のはらりはらり哉
ro: samidare mo shimai no harari-harari kana
en:
the last
of the Fifth Month rain...
drip, drip

jp: .此闇に鼻つままれな五月雨
ro: kono yami ni hana tsumamare na satsuki ame
en:
in this darkness
don't get your nose picked!
Fifth Month rain

jp: .五月雨も中休みぞよ今日は
ro: samidare mo nakayasumi zo yo konnichi wa
en:
even the Fifth Month rain
takes a day off
today

jp: .五月雨の中休みかよ今日は
ro: samidare no nakayasumi ka yo konnichi wa
en:
has the Fifth Month rain
taken a day off
today?

jp: .女郎花つんと立けり虎が雨
ro: ominaeshi tsunto tachi keri tora ga ame
en:
maiden flowers looking
stuck-up...
Rain of the Tiger

jp: .とし寄りの袖としらでや虎が雨
ro: toshiyori no sode to shirade ya tora ga ame
en:
unknowingly wetting
an old man's sleeves...
Rain of the Tiger

jp: .とらが雨など軽じてぬれにけり
ro: tora ga ame nado karonjite nure ni keri
en:
forgetting that today
is "the Rain of the Tiger"...
I'm drenched

jp: .我庵は虎が涙もぬれにけり
ro: waga io wa tora ga namida mo nure ni keri
en:
my hut, too
drenched by the Tiger's
tears

jp: .寝並んで遠夕立の評義哉
ro: ne narande tô yûdachi no hyôgi kana
en:
lying down in a row--
discussing
the distant storm

jp: .夕立の拍子に伸て葎哉
ro: yûdachi no hyôshi ni nobite mugura kana
en:
growing to the beat
of the cloudburst...
weeds

jp: .夕立や樹下石上の小役人
ro: yûdachi ya juka sekijô no ko yakunin
en:
rainstorm--
monk-like on a rock, under a tree
a minor official

jp: .寝むしろや足でかぞへる雪の峰
ro: nemushiro ya ashi de kazoeru yuki no mine
en:
on my sleeping mat
counting with my feet...
snowy peaks

jp: .蟻の道雲の峰よりつづきけり
ro: ari no michi kumo no mine yori tsuzuki keri
en:
the ants' road
from peaks of clouds
to here

jp: .風有をもって尊し雲の峰
ro: kaze aru wo motte tôtoshi kumo no mine
en:
thanks to the wind
they are precious...
billowing clouds

jp: .山人の枕の際や雲の峰
ro: yamaudo no makura no kiwa ya kumo no mine
en:
at the edge
of the mountain hermit's pillow...
billowing clouds

jp: .小むしろや茶釜の中の夏の月
ro: samushiro ya chagama no naka no natsu no tsuki
en:
little mat...
in the tea kettle
a summer moon

jp: .なぐさみにわらをうつ也夏の月
ro: nagusami ni wara wo utsu nari natsu no tsuki
en:
just for fun
beating the straw...
summer moon

jp: .二番火の酒の騒ぎや夏の月
ro: ni ban hi no sake no sawagi ya natsu no tsuki
en:
a twice-fired sake
induced ruckus...
summer moon

jp: .此入は西行庵か苔清水
ro: kono iri wa saigyô io ka koke shimizu
en:
in this remote place
is it Saigyo's hut?
pure water over moss

jp: .此入はどなたの庵ぞ苔清水
ro: kono iri wa donata no io zo koke shimizu
en:
in this remote place
whose hut is it?
pure water over moss

jp: .水風呂へ流し込だる清水哉
ro: suifuro e nagashi kondaru shimizu kana
en:
sluicing in
to fill the bath...
pure water

jp: .母馬が番して呑す清水哉
ro: haha uma ga ban shite nomasu shimizu kana
en:
letting pony drink
mother stands guard...
pure water

jp: .山守の爺が祈りし清水哉
ro: yama mori no jiji ga inorishi shimizu kana
en:
the old mountain guard
prayed to find it...
trickle of pure water

jp: .起々の慾目引っぱる青田哉
ro: oki-oki no yokume hipparu aoda kana
en:
morning's first thing--
greedy eyes
on the green rice field

jp: .そんじよそこここと青田のひいき哉
ro: sonji yo soko koko to aoda no hiiki kana
en:
this or that green rice field?
each farmer
is biased

jp: .寝並びておのが青田をそしる也
ro: ne narabite ono ga aoda wo soshiru nari
en:
lying in a row--
he slanders his own
green rice field

jp: .卯の花も仏の八日つとめけり
ro: u no hana mo hotoke no yôka tsutome keri
en:
deutzia blossoms, too
on Buddha's birthday
report for duty

jp: .長の日にかわく間もなし誕生仏
ro: naga no hi ni kawaku ma [mo] nashi tanjôbutsu
en:
through the long day
not a thirsty moment...
birthday Buddha

jp: .疫病神蚤も負せて流しけり
ro: yakubyôgami nomi mo obusete nagashi keri
en:
a flea
on the little plague god
floats away

jp: .おどる魚桶とおもふやおもはぬや
ro: odoru uo oke to omou ya omowanu ya
en:
thrashing fish
knowing they're in a bucket
and not knowing

jp: .青柳の木陰を頼む寄鵜哉
ro: ao yagi no kokage wo tanomu yose u kana
en:
relying on
the green willow's shade
cormorant flock

jp: .鵜の真似を鵜より巧者な子供哉
ro: u no mane wo u yori kôsha-na kodomo kana
en:
outdoing the cormorant
in skillful imitation...
a child

jp: .鵜の真似は鵜より上手な子供哉
ro: u no mane wa u yori jyôzu-na kodomo kana
en:
outdoing the cormorant
with a fine imitation...
a child

jp: .鵜もおや子うかいも親子三人哉
ro: u mo oyako ukai mo oyako mitari kana
en:
cormorants and fishermen--
families
of three

jp: .子もち鵜が大声上てもどりけり
ro: ko mochi u ga ôgoe agete modori keri
en:
the mother cormorant
raising a ruckus..
her child comes home

jp: .放鵜の子の鳴舟にもどりけり
ro: hanare u no ko no naku fune ni modori keri
en:
baby comorant cries--
his mother returns
to the boat

jp: .ひいき鵜は又もからみで浮にけり
ro: hiiki u wa mata mo kara mi de uki ni keri
en:
my favorite cormorant
again floats up
with an empty beak

jp: .衣替て居って見てもひとりかな
ro: kinu kaete suwatte mite mo hitori kana
en:
though sitting
in a new summer robe...
all alone

jp: .杉で葺く小便桶やころもがい
ro: sugi de fuku shôben oke ya koromogai
en:
cedar thatch
for the piss bucket...
new summer robes

jp: .其門に天窓用心ころもがへ
ro: sono kado ni atama yôjin koromogae
en:
watch your head
on that gate!
summer kimono

jp: .髪結も大小さして初袷
ro: kamiyui mo daishô sashite hatsu awase
en:
their hairstyles
long and short...
new summer kimonos

jp: .三間の木太刀をかつぐ袷かな
ro: san-gen no kidachi wo katsugu awase kana
en:
a twelve-foot wooden sword
on their shoulders...
summer kimonos

jp: .四五間の木太刀をかつぐ袷かな
ro: shi go ken no kidachi wo katsugu awase kana
en:
a thirty-foot wooden sword
on their shoulders...
summer kimonos

jp: .京の夜や白い帷子しろい笠
ro: kyô no yo ya shiroi katabira shiroi-gasa
en:
Kyoto night--
white summer kimonos
white umbrella-hats

jp: .此風の不足いふ也夏さしき
ro: kono kaze no fusoku iu nari natsu zashiki
en:
this wind
isn't enough, they say...
summer room

jp: .松陰やござ一枚のなつ座敷
ro: matsu kage ya goza ichi mai no natsu zashiki
en:
pine tree shade--
one straw mat
my summer room

jp: .今迄は罰もあたらず昼寝蚊屋
ro: ima made wa bachi mo atarazu hirune kaya
en:
no divine punishment yet--
napping
under the net

jp: .馬迄も萌黄の蚊屋に寝たりけり
ro: uma made mo moegi no kaya ni netari keri
en:
even the horses
sleep in light green
mosquito nets!

jp: .ごろり寝の紙帳の窓や三ケの月
ro: gorori ne no shichô no mado ya mike [no] tuski
en:
curling to sleep--
in the paper mosquito net's window
a sickle moon

jp: .塵の身もともにふはふは紙帳哉
ro: chiri no mi mo tomo ni fuwa-fuwa shichô kana
en:
this body of dust
suits this wispy-soft
paper mosquito net

jp: .手をすりて蚊屋の小すみを借りにけり
ro: te wo surite kaya no kosumi wo kari ni keri
en:
wringing hands
in the mosquito netting...
let me have just a corner!

jp: .出ル月は紙帳の窓の通り哉
ro: deru tsuki wa shichô no mado no tôri kana
en:
the rising moon
in my paper mosquito net's window
passes by

jp: .始から釣り放しなる紙帳哉
ro: hajime kara tsuri hanashinaru shichô kana
en:
from the beginning
it has hung loose...
my paper mosquito net

jp: .留守中も釣り放しなる紙帳哉
ro: rusuchû mo tsuri hanashinaru shichô kana
en:
while I'm away
hang loose
paper mosquito net

jp: .ひとり寝の太平楽の紙帳哉
ro: hitori ne no taiheiraku no shichô kana
en:
sleeping alone
building castles in the sky...
paper mosquito net

jp: .今見ればつぎだらけ也おれが蚊屋
ro: ima mireba tsugi darake nari ore ga kaya
en:
upon inspection
it's covered with patches...
my mosquito net

jp: .今迄は罰もあたらぬ昼寝哉
ro: ima made wa [bachi] mo ataranu hirune kana
en:
up to now
no divine punishment...
siesta

jp: .十ろばんに肱をもたせて昼寝かな
ro: soroban ni hiji wo motasete hirune kana
en:
with his elbows
on his abacus...
a siesta

jp: .蓮の葉に片足のせて昼寝哉
ro: hasu no ha ni kata [ashi] nosete hirune kana
en:
one foot propped
on the lotus leaves...
siesta

jp: .貰よりはやくうちなふ扇哉
ro: morau yori hayaku ushinau ôgi kana
en:
after getting it
it's lost so soon...
paper fan

jp: .小座頭の天窓にかむる扇かな
ro: ko zatô no atama ni kamuru ôgi kana
en:
the little blind minstrel
wears it like a hat...
paper fan

jp: .子道者の年はいくつぞ赤扇
ro: ko dôsha no toshi wa ikutsu zo aka ôgi
en:
how old
is this little pilgrim?
red paper fan

jp: .小道者や手を引れつつ赤扇
ro: ko dôsha ya te wo hitaretsutsu aka ôgi
en:
the little pilgrim
being led by hand...
red paper fan

jp: .小坊主が襟にさしたる扇哉
ro: ko bôzu ga eri ni sashitaru ôgi kana
en:
the little boy
stows it in his neckband...
paper fan

jp: .太郎冠者まがいに通る扇かな
ro: tarô kaja magai ni tôru ôgi kana
en:
he passes by
like Taro Kaja...
paper fan

jp: .花つむや扇をちょいとぼんの凹
ro: hana tsumu ya ôgi wo choi to bon no kubo
en:
picking flowers--
his paper fan stowed
behind his neck

jp: .ぼのくぼに扇をちょいと小僧哉
ro: bonokubo ni ôgi wo [cho]i to ko bôzu
en:
he stows his fan
behind his neck...
little boy

jp: .山寺や扇でしれる小僧の名
ro: yamadera ya ôgi de shireru kozô no na
en:
mountain temple--
the little boy's name
on his fan

jp: .大寺や扇でしれし小僧の名
ro: ô tera ya ôgi de shireshi kozô no na
en:
great temple--
the little boy's name
on his fan

jp: .風上におくや舳先の蚊やり鍋
ro: kazakami ni oku ya hesaki no kayari nabe
en:
placed to the windward
the prow's
smudge pot

jp: .魚どもや桶ともしらで門涼み
ro: uo domo ya oke to mo shirade kado suzumi
en:
the fish
unaware of the bucket...
cool air at the gate

jp: .青草も銭だけそよぐ門涼
ro: ao-gusa mo zeni dake soyogu kado suzumi
en:
even green grass
rustles only for money...
cool air at the gate

jp: .一尺の滝も音して夕涼み
ro: isshaku no taki mo oto shite yûsuzumi
en:
a one-foot waterfall
splashes too...
evening cool

jp: .有明や二番尿から門涼み
ro: ariake ya ni ban bari kara kado suzumi
en:
at dawn
after my second piss...
cool air at the gate

jp: .鬼茨も添て見よ見よ一涼み
ro: onibara mo sôte mi yo mi yo hito suzumi
en:
even adding in
a thorn bush, behold!
a cool breeze

jp: .極楽に片足かけて夕涼
ro: gokuraku ni kata ashi kakete yûsuzumi
en:
dangling one leg
in Paradise...
evening cool

jp: .銭なしは青草も見ず門涼み
ro: zeni nashi wa aokusa mo mizu kado suzumi
en:
penniless
the green grass unnoticed...
cool air at the gate

jp: .線香の火でたばこ吹くすすみかな
ro: senkô no hi de [ta]bako fuku suzumi kana
en:
lighting my pipe
with an incense stick...
cool air

jp: .なぐさみに鰐口ならす涼み哉
ro: nagusami ni waniguchi narasu suzumi kana
en:
banging the temple gong
just for fun...
cool air

jp: .人形に茶をはこばせて門涼み
ro: ningyô ni cha wo hakobasete kado suzumi
en:
a doll is made
to bring my tea...
cool air at the gate

jp: .寝た鹿に片肱ついて夕涼
ro: neta shika ni kata hiji tsuite yûsuzumi
en:
one elbow
on a sleeping deer...
evening cool

jp: .母おやや涼がてらの針仕事
ro: haha oya ya suzumi-gatera no harishigoto
en:
mother--
while enjoying the cool air
stitching

jp: .ままっ子や涼み仕事にわらたたき
ro: mamakko ya suzumi shigoto ni wara tataki
en:
the stepchild's chore
in the cool air...
beating straw

jp: .水に湯にどの流でも夕涼
ro: mizu ni yu ni dono nagare demo yûsuzumi
en:
soaking in cold water
or hot, whichever...
evening cool

jp: .夜に入ば下水の上も涼み哉
ro: yo ni ireba gesui no ue mo suzumi kana
en:
as evening falls
even above a sewer...
cool air

jp: .馬どもも田休す也門の原
ro: uma domo mo ta yasumisu nari kado no hara
en:
the horse too
on rice-planting break...
field by the gate

jp: .おのが里仕廻ふてどこへ田植笠
ro: ono ga sato shimaute doko e taue-gasa
en:
when your village is done
where next?
rice-planting umbrella-hat

jp: .唐人も見よや田植の笛太鼓
ro: karabito mo mi yo ya taue no fue taiko
en:
a foreigner watches
the rice planting too...
flutes and drums

jp: .鹿の子や横にくはへし萩の花
ro: shika no ko ya yoko ni kuwaeshi hagi no hana
en:
the fawn munches
lying on his side...
bush clover blooms

jp: .俄川飛で見せけり鹿の親
ro: niwaka kawa tonde mise keri shika no oya
en:
leaping over
a sudden stream
mother deer looks back

jp: .人声に子を引かくす女鹿かな
ro: hito-goe ni ko wo hikikakusu me-jika kana
en:
hearing people's voices
she hides her fawn...
the doe

jp: .わやわやと土産をねだる鹿の子哉
ro: waya-waya to miyage wo nedaru kanoko kana
en:
noisily demanding
a present...
the fawn

jp: .急グかよ京一見のほととぎす
ro: isogu ka yo kyô ikken no hototogisu
en:
in a hurry?
he's off to see Kyoto
the cuckoo

jp: .卯の花や梅よ桜よ時鳥
ro: u no hana ya ume yo sakura yo hototogisu
en:
blossoming deutzia!
plum! cherry!
"cuckoo!"

jp: .つき山や祝て一ッほととぎす
ro: tsukiyama ya iwaute hitotsu hototogisu
en:
on a man-made hill
celebrating...
a cuckoo

jp: .ひきどのの弔いはやせほととぎす
ro: hiki dono no tomurai hayase hototogisu
en:
sing at Mr. Toad's
funeral, hurry
cuckoo!

jp: .時鳥なけや頭痛の抜る程
ro: hototogisu nake ya zutsû no nukeru hodo
en:
sing, cuckoo!
you're just about curing
my headache

jp: .時鳥蝿虫めらもよっく聞け
ro: hototogisu hae mushimera mo yokku kike
en:
cuckoo--
"O flies and worms
listen well!"

jp: .我家に恰好鳥の鳴にけり
ro: waga ie ni kakkôdori no naki ni keri
en:
for my house
a suitable mountain cuckoo
sings his song

jp: .雨乞のばかばかしとや行々し
ro: amagoi no bakabakashi to ya gyôgyôshi
en:
"Your praying for rain's
ridiculous!"
reed thrush

jp: .牛の子の寝入ばな也行々し
ro: ushi no ko no neiribana nari gyôgyôshi
en:
just when the calf
has fallen asleep...
the reed thrush sings

jp: .行々し一本芦ぞ心せよ
ro: gyôgyôshi ippon ashi zo kokoro seyo
en:
just one reed
for the reed thrush...
take heart!

jp: .十日程雨うけあふか行々し
ro: tôka hodo ame ukeau ka gyôgyôshi
en:
are you predicting rain
in ten days
reed thrush?

jp: .へら鷺は無言の行や行々し
ro: herasagi wa mugon no gyô ya gyôgyôshi
en:
the spoonbill takes
a vow of silence...
reed thrush singing

jp: .しほらしや蛇も浮世を捨衣
ro: shiorashi ya hebi mo ukiyo wo sute-goromo
en:
what delicateness!
a snake too sheds
his worldly robe

jp: .法の山や蛇も浮世を捨衣
ro: nori no yama ya hebi mo ukiyo wo sute-goromo
en:
temple grounds--
a snake too sheds
his worldly robe

jp: .法の世や蛇もそっくり捨衣
ro: nori no yo ya hebi mo sokkuri sute-koromo
en:
world of Buddha's law--
the snake strips
his clothes

jp: .稲妻に天窓なでけり引蟇
ro: inazuma ni atama nade keri hikigaeru
en:
lightning flash--
the toad
rubs his head

jp: .霧に乗る目付して居る蟇かな
ro: kiri ni noru metsuki shite iru hiiki kana
en:
looking like
"I can ride the mist"...
a toad

jp: .霧に乗る目付して居る烏かな
ro: kiri ni noru metsuki shite iru karasu kana
en:
looking like
"I can ride the mist"...
a crow

jp: .雲を吐く口つきしたり引蟇
ro: kumo wo haku kuchi tsukishitari hikigaeru
en:
with that mouth
he could vomit a cloud...
toad

jp: .蟇どのの妻や待らん子鳴らん
ro: hiki dono no tsuma ya matsuran ko nakuran
en:
Mister Toad--
the wife may be waiting
your children crying

jp: .一雫天窓なでけり引がえる
ro: hito shizuku atama nade keri hikigaeru
en:
a raindrop falls
he rubs his head...
toad

jp: .罷出るは此薮の蟾にて候
ro: [makari] izuru wa kono yabu no hiki nite sôrô
en:
"Allow me to present myself--
I am the toad
of this thicket!"

jp: .大蛍ゆらりゆらりと通りけり
ro: ôbotaru yurari-yurari to tôri keri
en:
a big firefly
lightly, nimbly
passes by

jp: .片息に成って逃入る蛍かな
ro: kata iki ni natte nige-iru hotaru kana
en:
his chest heaving
he's chased indoors...
firefly

jp: .逃て来てため息つくかはつ蛍
ro: nigete kite tame-iki tsukuka hatsu-botaru
en:
seeking sanctuary
with a sigh of relief?
first firefly

jp: .二三遍人をきょくって行蛍
ro: ni samben hito wo kyokutte yuku hotaru
en:
teasing us
two or three times...
a firefly

jp: .初蛍上手の手でももりにけり
ro: hatsu hotaru jyôzu no te de[mo] mori ni keri
en:
first firefly
though the hand is skillful
slips free

jp: .はつ蛍其手はくはぬとびぶりや
ro: hatsu hotaru sono te wa kuwanu tobiburi ya
en:
first firefly--
uncaught by the hand
flies free

jp: .飛蛍其手はかはぬくはぬとや
ro: tobu hotaru sono te wa kuwanu kuwanu to ya
en:
flitting firefly--
uncaught by the hand
uncaught again!

jp: .鼻紙に引つつんでもほたるかな
ro: hana kami ni hittsutsunde mo hotaru kana
en:
though wrapped in
tissue paper...
a firefly's light

jp: .人声の方へやれやれはつ蛍
ro: hito-goe no hô e yare-yare hatsu-botaru
en:
toward people's voices
well, well!
first firefly

jp: .蛍火やだまって居れば天窓まで
ro: hotarubi ya damatte ireba atama made
en:
firefly lights--
if you keep still
even on your head

jp: .我袖を親とたのむか逃ぼたる
ro: waga sode wo oya to tanomu ka nige-botaru
en:
do you think my sleeve
is your parent?
fleeing firefly

jp: .虫に迄尺とられけり我柱
ro: mushi ni made sashi torare keri waga hashira
en:
measured by an inchworm
too...
my house's pillar

jp: .けふの日も棒ふり虫と暮にけり
ro: kyô no hi mo bôfuri mushi to kure ni keri
en:
today too
mosquito larvae and me
at sunset

jp: .けふの日も棒ふり虫よ翌も又
ro: kyô no hi mo bôfurimushi yo asu mo mata
en:
today again
mosquito larvae...
tomorrow the same

jp: .ぼうふりが天上するぞ三ケの月
ro: bôfuri ga tenjô suru zo mike no tsuki
en:
up to heaven
the mosquito larva flies...
sickle moon

jp: .旦の蚊の弥陀のうしろにかくれけり
ro: asa no ka no mida no ushiro ni kakure keri
en:
morning's mosquitoes--
behind Amida Buddha
they hide

jp: .あばれ蚊のついと古井に忍びけり
ro: abare ka no tsui to furu i ni shinobi keri
en:
pesky mosquito--
into an old well
he sneaks

jp: .蚊の声に馴れてすやすや寝る子哉
ro: ka no koe ni narete suya-suya neru ko kana
en:
to the lullaby
of mosquitoes
she sleeps

jp: .蚊もちらりほらり是から老が世ぞ
ro: ka mo chirari horari kore kara oi ga yo zo
en:
a smattering of mosquitoes--
from today on
an old man's world

jp: .かはいらし蚊も初声ぞ初声ぞ
ro: kawairashi ka mo hatsu koe zo hatsu koe zo
en:
this is cute too--
the year's first mosquito's
whiny voice

jp: .桜迄悪く言する薮蚊哉
ro: sakura made waruku iwasuru yabu ka kana
en:
making even the cherry tree
curse...
mosquitoes

jp: .年寄と見るや鳴蚊も耳の際
ro: toshiyori to miru ya naku ka mo mimi no kiwa
en:
the whining mosquito
also thinks I'm old...
edge of my ear

jp: .なむあみだ仏の方より鳴蚊哉
ro: namu amida butsu no kata yori naku ka kana
en:
from the direction
of "all praise to Amida Buddha!"
a mosquito's buzz

jp: .閨の蚊の初出の声を焼れけり
ro: neya no ka no hatsude no koe wo yakare keri
en:
a bedroom mosquito's
first buzz
in the flame

jp: .閨の蚊のぶんとばかりに焼れけり
ro: neya no ka no bun to bakari ni yakare keri
en:
a bedroom mosquito
poof!
in the flame

jp: .一ッ蚊のだまってしくりしくり哉
ro: hitotsu ka no damatte shikuri-shikuri kana
en:
one mosquito
perfectly quiet...
and relentless!

jp: .夕空に蚊も初声をあげにけり
ro: yûzora ni ka mo hatsu koe wo age ni keri
en:
first voice rising
in the evening sky...
a mosquito

jp: .縁の蝿手をする所を打れけり
ro: en no hae te wo suru toko wo utare keri
en:
where the verandah fly
rubbed his hands...
swat!

jp: .かくれ家は蝿も小勢でくらしけり
ro: kakurega wa hae mo kozei de kurashi keri
en:
secluded house--
even my flies
are few

jp: .笠の蝿もうけふからは江戸者ぞ
ro: kasa no hae mô kyô kara wa edo mono zo
en:
fly on my umbrella-hat
from today on
a citizen of Edo!

jp: .笠の蠅我より先へかけ入ぬ
ro: kasa no hae ware yori saki e kakeirinu
en:
the fly on my umbrella-hat
beats me
inside

jp: .ぬり盆にころりと蝿の滑りけり
ro: nuribon ni korori to hae no suberi keri
en:
a lacquered tray--
whoops!
the fly slips

jp: .人一人蝿も一つや大座敷
ro: hito hitori hae mo hitotsu ya ôzashiki
en:
one man, one fly
one large
sitting room

jp: .古郷は蝿すら人をさしにけり
ro: furusato wa hae sura hito wo sashi ni keri
en:
my home village
where even the flies
bite

jp: .世がよくばも一つ留れ飯の蝿
ro: yo ga yokuba mo hitotsu tomare meshi no hae
en:
it's a good world!
one more, help yourself
flies on my rice

jp: .草原にこすり落や猫の蚤
ro: kusabara ni kosuri otosu ya neko no nomi
en:
in a grassy meadow
she rubs them off...
cat's fleas

jp: .とぶな蚤それそれそこが角田川
ro: tobu na nomi sore-sore soko ga sumida-gawa
en:
don't jump flea!
that's Sumida River
over there

jp: .とべよ蚤同じ事なら蓮の上
ro: tobe yo nomi onaji koto nara hasu no ue
en:
if you jump flea
jump
on the lotus

jp: .羽蟻出る迄に目出度柱哉
ro: ha-ari deru made ni medetaki hashira kana
en:
until the winged ants
come out
a fortunate pillar

jp: .狗にここへ来よとや蝉の声
ro: enokoro ni koko e koyo to ya semi no koe
en:
"Hey puppy
come here!" sings
a cicada

jp: .せみなくやつくづく赤い風車
ro: semi naku ya tsuku-zuku aka[i] kazaguruma
en:
a cicada chirrs--
the pinwheel so utterly
red

jp: .はつ蝉のうきを見ん見んみいん哉
ro: hatsu semi no uki wo min min miin kana
en:
first cicada
"Look at the floating world!
Look! Loo-ook!"

jp: .松のせみどこ迄鳴て昼になる
ro: matsu no semi doko made naite hiru ni naru
en:
cicada in the pine
how much will you cry
till it's noon?

jp: .山ぜみや袂の下を通りけり
ro: yama-zemi no tamoto no shita wo tôri keri
en:
a mountain cicada--
into my sleeve
he goes

jp: .鰐口のくちのおくより蝉の声
ro: waniguchi no kuchi no oku yori semi no koe
en:
from deep in the temple gong
the cicada
sings

jp: .昼顔や古僧部の僧が窓に迄
ro: hirugao ya kosobe no sô ga mado ni made
en:
dayflowers--
even at the ancient priest's
window

jp: .昼顔やぽっぽと燃る石ころへ
ro: hirugao ya poppo to moeru ishikoro e
en:
day flowers--
burn amid steaming
pebbles

jp: .夕顔の花にて洟をかむ子哉
ro: yûgao no hana nite hana wo kamu ko kana
en:
blowing his nose
on the moonflower...
a child

jp: .扇にて尺を取たるぼたん哉
ro: ôgi nite shaku wo toritaru botan kana
en:
measuring foot by foot
with a fan...
the peony

jp: .紙屑もぼたん顔ぞよ葉がくれに
ro: kami kuzu mo botan kao zo yo ha-gakure ni
en:
scrap paper faces
of peonies...
shaded by leaves

jp: .鶏の抱かれて見たるぼたん哉
ro: niwatori no dakarete mitaru botan kana
en:
sitting on her eggs
the hen admires
the peony

jp: .福の神やどらせ給ふぼたん哉
ro: fuku no kami yadorase tamau botan kana
en:
the god of fortune
and luck dwells here...
a peony!

jp: .福もふく大福花のぼたん哉
ro: fuku mo fuku ôfuku-bana no botan kana
en:
lucky, lucky
luckiest of flowers...
the peony!

jp: .ぼたん迄果報のうすき我家哉
ro: botan made kahô no usuki waga ya kana
en:
even the peony's
good karma wears thin...
my house!

jp: .唐土の真似する寺のぼたん哉
ro: morokoshi no mane suru tera no botan kana
en:
a temple
in the Chinese style...
with peonies!

jp: .咲花も此世の蓮はまがりけり
ro: saku hana mo kono yo no hasu wa magari keri
en:
blooming lotuses
in this world...
bent

jp: .直き世や小銭ほどでも蓮の花
ro: naoki yo ya ko zeni hodo de mo hasu no hana
en:
it's a better world--
but they're only penny-sized
lotus blossoms

jp: .蓮の花少曲がるもうき世哉
ro: hasu no hana sukoshi magaru mo ukiyo kana
en:
even lotus blossoms
bend a bit...
oh floating world!

jp: .我門にうつせば小さし蓮の花
ro: waga kado ni utsuseba chisashi hasu no hana
en:
transferred to my gate
the little lotus
blossom

jp: .なでし子に二文が水を浴せけり
ro: nadeshiko ni ni mon ga mizu wo abise keri
en:
blooming pink--
two pennies' worth of water
for your bath

jp: .なでしこやままはは木々の日陰花
ro: nadeshiko ya mamahaha kigi no hikage-bana
en:
the pink
in the shade of stepmother trees
blooms

jp: .馬の髪結ひて立也かきつばた
ro: uma mo kami iite tatsu nari kakitsubata
en:
even the horse's
hair is done up...
irises

jp: .けさ程や芥に一本かきつばた
ro: kesa hodo ya gomi ni ippon kakitsubata
en:
this morning
one's in the trash...
irises

jp: .浮草の花からのらんあの雲へ
ro: ukikusa no hana kara noran ano kumo e
en:
on the blooming duckweed
let us ride...
to that cloud!

jp: .馬柄杓にちょいと浮草咲にけり
ro: ma-bishaku ni choi to ukikusa saki ni keri
en:
in the horse's ladle
the duckweed suddenly
has bloomed!

jp: .かくれ家の畠に植る早苗かな
ro: kakurega no hatake ni ueru sanae kana
en:
planted in the garden
of the secluded house...
leftover rice plants

jp: .道ばたや馬も喰はぬ捨早苗
ro: michibata ya uma mo kurawanu sute sanae
en:
roadside--
even the horse won't eat
the leftover rice plants

jp: .隠れ家の柱で麦をうたれけり
ro: kakurega no hashira de mugi wo utare keri
en:
secluded house--
using its pillar to thresh
the barley

jp: .麦秋や子を負ながらいはし売
ro: mugi aki ya ko wo oi nagara iwashiuri
en:
ripened barley--
with a child on her back
the sardine vendor

jp: .いそがしや山の苔さへ花盛り
ro: isogashi ya yama no koke sae hana-zakari
en:
a busy time--
even the mountain's moss
in full bloom

jp: .山苔も花咲世話のありにけり
ro: yama-goke mo hana saku sewa no ari ni keri
en:
the mountain moss
lends a hand
to the blooming

jp: .赤住連や疱瘡神のことし竹
ro: aka shime ya hôsô-gami no kotoshi take
en:
red sacred rope--
the smallpox god's
crop of young bamboo

jp: .あっぱれの大若竹ぞ見ぬうちに
ro: appare no ôwaka take zo minu uchi ni
en:
a splendid, tall
young bamboo!
while I was away

jp: .少し見ぬうちに天晴若竹ぞ
ro: sukoshi minu uchi ni appare waka take zo
en:
while I was away
just for a while...
a splendid young bamboo!

jp: .それであれうす紫の今年竹
ro: sore de are usu murasaki no kotoshi take
en:
well, well
pale purple, this year's color...
for young bamboo

jp: .苦竹をよい事にして若葉哉
ro: niga take wo yoi koto ni shite wakaba kana
en:
it's a good thing
being bitter bamboo...
fresh new shoots

jp: .竹の子の千世もぽっきり折にけり
ro: takenoko no chiyo mo pokkiri ore ni keri
en:
the thousand year
bamboo shoot...
snap! broken

jp: .筍の人の子なくば花さかん
ro: takenoko no hito no ko nakuba hana sakan
en:
bamboo shoots--
if it weren't for people's "shoots"
you'd live to flower

jp: .苦竹の子や幸にしてそろふ
ro: niga takenoko ya saiwai ni shite sorou
en:
bitter bamboo shoots--
a lucky
assembly

jp: .御座敷や瓜むく事もむつかしき
ro: o-zashiki ya uri muku koto mo mutsukashiki
en:
fancy sitting room--
even peeling melons
an ordeal

jp: .初瓜を引とらまえて寝た子哉
ro: hatsu uri wo hittorama[e]te neta ko kana
en:
first melon of the season
in her grasp...
sleeping child

jp: .三日月と一ッ並びや冷し瓜
ro: mikazuki to hitotsu narabi ya hiyashi uri
en:
aligned
with the sickle moon...
the cooling melon

jp: .頬べたにあてなどしたる真瓜哉
ro: hôbeta ni ate nado shitaru makuwa kana
en:
holding it
against her cheek...
muskmelon

jp: .赤い葉の栄耀にちるや夏木立
ro: akai ha no eiyo ni chiru ya natsu kodachi
en:
a red leaf falls
showing off...
summer trees

jp: .芝でした休所や夏木立
ro: shiba de shita yasumi-dokoro ya natsu kodachi
en:
making the lawn
a vacation spot...
summer trees

jp: .一本は昼寝の足しの茂り哉
ro: ippon wa hirune no tashi no shigeri kana
en:
just one branch
helps my siesta...
summer tree

jp: .界隈のなまけ所や木下闇
ro: kaiwai no namake tokoro ya ko shita yami
en:
the neighborhood's
relaxation spot...
the tree's deep shade

jp: .卯の花に一人切の鳥井哉
ro: u no hana ni hitorikiri no torii kana
en:
amid deutzia blossoms
all alone...
a torii gate

jp: .卯の花に一人切の社哉
ro: u no hana ni hitorikiri no yashiro kana
en:
amid deutzia blossoms
all alone...
a shrine

jp: .卯の花の吉日もちし後架哉
ro: u no hana no kichi nichi mochishi kôka kana
en:
with deutzia blossoms
on this lucky day...
outhouse

jp: .卯の花の花なきさへうられけり
ro: u no hana no hana no naki sae urare keri
en:
a deutzia shrub
even without blossoms...
for sale

jp: .卯の花もほろりほろりやひきの塚
ro: u no hana mo horori horori ya hiki no tsuka
en:
even the deutzia shrub
is moved to tears...
the toad's grave

jp: .寝所見る程は卯の花月夜哉
ro: nedoko miru hodo wa u no hana tsuki yo kana
en:
reflecting enough moonlight
to light my bedroom...
deutzia blossoms

jp: .寝所見る程は卯の花明りかな
ro: nedoko miru hodo wa u no hana akari kana
en:
enough light
to light my bedroom...
deutzia blossoms

jp: .けさ秋や瘧の落ちたやうな空
ro: kesa aki ya okori no ochita yôna sora
en:
first autumn morning--
a fever-curing
kind of sky

jp: .盆の灰いろは書く子の夜寒哉
ro: bon no hai iroha kaku ko no yozamu kana
en:
a child writes
in the tray's ashes...
a cold night

jp: .赤馬の苦労をなでる夜寒哉
ro: aka uma no kurô wo naderu yozamu kana
en:
brushing away
the red horse's hard day...
a cold night

jp: .親のいふ字を知ってから夜寒哉
ro: oya [to] iu ji wo shitte kara yozamu kana
en:
since the day I knew
the word "Parent"...
cold nights

jp: .影法師に恥よ夜寒のむだ歩き
ro: kagebôshi ni haji yo yozamu no muda aruki
en:
our shameful shadows!
in the cold night walking
in vain

jp: .から樽を又ふって見る夜寒哉
ro: kara-daru wo mata futte miru yozamu kana
en:
shaking the empty keg
once again...
a cold night

jp: .小便所ここと馬呼ぶ夜寒哉
ro: shôbenjo koko to uma yo[bu] yozamu kana
en:
"Here's the outhouse!"
the horse calls...
a cold night

jp: .のらくらが遊びかげんの夜寒哉
ro: norakura ga asobi kagen [no] yozamu kana
en:
in the mood for loafing
and carousing...
a cold night

jp: .古郷を心でおがむ夜寒哉
ro: furusato wo kokoro de ogamu yozamu kana
en:
bowing to my home village
in my heart...
a cold night

jp: .子どもらを心でおがむ夜寒哉
ro: kodomora wo kokoro de ogamu yozamu kana
en:
bowing to my children
in my heart...
a cold night

jp: .若い衆のつき合に寝る夜寒哉
ro: wakai shu no tsukiai ni neru yozamu kana
en:
the young folk
sleep together...
a cold night

jp: .馬の背の土をはくなり秋の暮
ro: uma no se no tsuchi wo haku nari aki no kure
en:
sweeping dirt
off the horse's back...
autumn dusk

jp: .膝抱て羅漢顔して秋の暮
ro: hiza daite [ra]kan-gao shite aki no kure
en:
hugging his knees
his face at peace...
autumn dusk

jp: .一人通るとかべに書く秋の暮
ro: hitori tôru to kabe ni kaku aki no kure
en:
walking on alone
I write on a wall...
autumn dusk

jp: .行な雁住ばどっこも秋の暮
ro: yuku na kari sumeba dokko mo aki no kure
en:
don't leave, geese!
wherever you live
it's autumn's dusk

jp: .影法師に恥よ夜永のむだ歩き
ro: kagebôshi ni haji yo yonaga no muda aruki
en:
our shameful shadows!
in the long night walking
in vain

jp: .行秋や馬の苦労をなでる人
ro: yuku aki ya uma no kurô wo naderu hito
en:
autumn ends--
a man strokes away
his horse's troubles

jp: .名月を取ってくれろと泣く子哉
ro: meigetsu wo totte kurero to naku ko kana
en:
"Gimme that harvest moon!"
cries the crying
child

jp: .庵のかぎ松にあづけて月見哉
ro: io no kagi matsu ni azukete tsukimi kana
en:
guard my hut's key
pine tree!
going moon gazing

jp: .御祝儀に月見て閉る庵かな
ro: go-shûgi [ni] tsuki mite shimeru iori kana
en:
a present for me--
moon gazing then locking
my hut

jp: .酒尽て真の座に付月見哉
ro: sake tsukite shin no za ni tsuku tsukimi kana
en:
the sake gone
time to buckle down
and moon-gaze

jp: .そば国のたんを切つつ月見哉
ro: soba-guni no tan wo kiritsutsu tsukimi kana
en:
buckwheat country's
sharp tongues cutting...
moon gazing

jp: .古郷の留守居も一人月見哉
ro: furusato no rusui mo hitori tsukimi kana
en:
in my home village
she guards our house...
moon gazing alone

jp: .名月やあたりにせまる壁の穴
ro: meigetsu ya atari ni semaru kabe no ana
en:
the harvest moon
draws close...
hole in the wall

jp: .名月や五十七年旅の秋
ro: meigetsu ya go jû nana nen tabi no aki
en:
harvest moon--
fifty-seven years
of traveling autumns

jp: .名月や膳に這よる子があらば
ro: meigetsu ya zen ni haiyoru ko ga araba
en:
harvest moon--
she'd crawl to my dinner tray
if my child were here

jp: .名月や膝を枕の子があらば
ro: meigetsu ya hiza [wo] makura no ko ga araba
en:
harvest moon--
my lap would be a pillow
if my child were here

jp: .名月や松に預ける庵の鍵
ro: meigetsu ya matsu ni azukeru io no kagi
en:
harvest moon--
leaving my hut's key
with the pine

jp: .籾倉の陰の小家も月見哉
ro: momigura no kage no ko ie mo tsukimi kana
en:
little house
in a rice barn's shadow...
here too, moon gazing

jp: .石山や蝕名月の目利役
ro: ishiyama ya shoku meigetsu no mekiki yaku
en:
Ishiyama--
a harvest moon eclipse
gazer

jp: .欠様の立派もさすが名月ぞ
ro: kake yô no rippa mo sasuga meigetsu zo
en:
eclipsed splendidly
as one would expect...
harvest moon

jp: .十五夜や闇に成のも待遠き
ro: jûgoya ya yami ni naru no mo machidôki
en:
night of the 15th--
a long wait
for darkness

jp: .世話好が蝕名月の目利哉
ro: sewazuki ga shoku meigetsu no mekiki kana
en:
an officious one--
the harvest moon eclipse
gazer

jp: .僭上に月の欠るを目利哉
ro: senjô ni tsuki no kakeru wo mekiki kana
en:
boldy he forecasts
the moon's
full eclipse

jp: .忽に無病な月と成にけり
ro: tachimachi ni mubyôna tsuki to nari ni keri
en:
in a flash
the moon's sickness
is cured

jp: .出直して大名月ぞ名月ぞ
ro: denaoshite ô meigetsu zo meigetsu zo
en:
returning to us
the great harvest moon!
harvest moon!

jp: .瑞l数は月より先へ欠にけり
ro: hito kazu wa tsuki yori saki e kake ni keri
en:
before the moon does--
the crowd of people
wanes

jp: .人顔は月より先へ欠にけり
ro: hito-gao wa tsuki yori saki e kake ni keri
en:
before the moon does--
people's faces
wane

jp: .人の声闇でさすか十五夜ぞ
ro: hito no koe yami demo sasuga jûgoya zo
en:
voices in the dark--
yet this is the night
of harvest moon

jp: .人の世へ月も出直し給ひけり
ro: hito no yo e tsuki [mo] denaoshi tamai keri
en:
to the world of man
the moon deigns
to return

jp: .人の世は月もなやませたまいけり
ro: hito no yo wa tsuki mo nayamase tamai keri
en:
world of man--
even the moon
suffers!

jp: .名月の御名代かや白うさぎ
ro: meigetsu no gyomei dai ka ya shiro usagi
en:
are you the harvest moon's
representative?
white rabbit

jp: .名月も出直し給ふ浮世哉
ro: meigetsu mo denaoshi tamau ukiyo kana
en:
the harvest moon
deigns to return...
floating world!

jp: .名月や欠けしまふたが山の雨
ro: meigetsu ya kake shimauta ga yama no ame
en:
ending the harvest moon
eclipse...
mountain rain

jp: .世は斯うと月も煩ひ給ひけり
ro: yo wa kô to tsuki mo wazurai tamai keri
en:
such is our world--
even the moon
gets sick!

jp: .雁どもの腹もふくれて十三夜
ro: kari-domo no hara mo fukurete jû san yo
en:
the geese too
stuffing their bellies...
Ninth Month moon

jp: .箕の中の箸よ御札よ秋日和
ro: mi no naka no hashi yo o-fuda yo akibiyori
en:
stuck in his winnow
chopsticks and a charm...
clear fall weather

jp: .秋風や磁石にあてる古郷山
ro: aki kaze ya jishaku ni ateru kokyô yama
en:
autumn wind--
the compass points
to my native mountains

jp: .秋風やむしりたがりし赤い花
ro: aki kaze ya mushiritagarishi akai hana
en:
autumn wind--
red flowers she wanted
to pick

jp: .露の玉袖の上にも転りけり
ro: tsuyu no tama sode no ue ni mo korori keri
en:
pearls of dew--
even on my sleeves
rolling down

jp: .露の玉つまんだ時も仏哉
ro: tsuyu no tama tsumanda toki mo hotoke kana
en:
a dewdrop pearl--
I pinched it into
a Buddha

jp: .露の玉つまんで見たるわらべ哉
ro: tsuyu no tama tsumande mitaru warabe kana
en:
looking for the bead
of dew she pinched...
a child

jp: .露の世は露の世ながらさりながら
ro: tsuyu no yo wa tsuyu no yo nagara sari nagara
en:
this world
is a dewdrop world
yes... but...

jp: .蓮の露一つもあまる朝茶哉
ro: hasu no tsuyu hitotsu mo amaru asa cha kana
en:
dew from a lotus leaf
plenty
for morning tea

jp: .蓮の葉に此世の露はいびつ也
ro: hasu no ha ni kono yo no tsuyu wa ibitsu nari
en:
on lotus leaves
this world's dewdrops
are warped

jp: .蓮の葉に此世の露は曲りけり
ro: hasu no ha ni kono yo no tsuyu wa magari keri
en:
on lotus leaves
this world's dewdrops
are bent

jp: .石川はぐはらり稲妻さらり哉
ro: ishi-gawa wa garari inazuma sarari kana
en:
across the dried river
lightning
flickers

jp: .稲妻につむりなでけり引蟇
ro: inazuma ni tsumuri nade keri hikigaeru
en:
in the lightning flash
rubbing his head...
toad

jp: .稲妻にへなへな橋を渡りけり
ro: inazuma ni hena-hena hashi wo watari keri
en:
in flashes of lightning
crossing the shaky
bridge

jp: .稲妻や門に寝並ぶ目出度顔
ro: inazuma ya kado ni ne-narabu medeta kao
en:
lightning flash--
lying in a row at the gate
happy faces

jp: .稲妻や一切づつに世がなをる
ro: inazuma ya hito kire-zutsu ni yo ga naoru
en:
lightning--
streak by streak
cures the world

jp: .さむしろや一文橋も霧の立
ro: samushiro ya ichi mon hashi mo kiri no tatsu
en:
little straw mat--
even on a one-penny bridge
mist rises

jp: .夕霧や馬の覚し橋の穴
ro: yûgiri ya uma no oboeshi hashi no ana
en:
night mist--
the horse remembers
the bridge's hole

jp: .歌書や梶のかはりに糸瓜の葉
ro: uta kaku ya kaji no kawari ni hechima no ha
en:
writing the poem
on the mulberry substitute...
leaf of a loofah

jp: .世を捨ぬ人の庇のすすきかな
ro: yo wo sutenu hito no hisashi no susuki kana
en:
the eaves
of the holy man's hut...
pampas grass

jp: .名月のあるが上にも玉火哉
ro: meigetsu no aru ga ue ni mo tamabi kana
en:
out-dazzling
the harvest moon...
fireworks!

jp: .乳呑子の風よけに立かがし哉
ro: chinomi-go no kazeyoke ni ni tatsu kagashi kana
en:
a wind-break
for the nursing child...
scarecrow

jp: .雨の夜やつい隣なる小夜ぎぬた
ro: ame no yo ya tsui tonari naru sayo-ginuta
en:
a rainy night--
my next-door neighbor
pounding cloth

jp: .行灯を畑に据へて砧かな
ro: andon wo hata ni suete kinuta kana
en:
setting a lantern
in the field...
someone pounding cloth

jp: .行灯を松につるして小夜ぎぬた
ro: andon wo matsu ni tsurushite sayo-ginuta
en:
hanging a lantern
in the pine...
cloth-pounding in the night

jp: .木の下に茶の沸にけり小夜砧
ro: ki no shita ni cha no waki ni keri sayo-ginuta
en:
under the tree
tea is brewing...
cloth-pounding in the night

jp: .恋衣打るる夜あり庵の石
ro: koi koromo utaruru yo ari io no ishi
en:
a night for pounding
the love-making clothes...
hut's stone

jp: .衣打槌の下より吉の川
ro: koromo utsu tsuchi no shita yori yoshino-gawa
en:
under the cloth-pounding
mallet...
Yoshino River

jp: .鳴鹿も母や恋しき小夜ぎぬた
ro: naku shika mo haha ya koi shiki sayo-ginuta
en:
a crying deer
yearns for its mother...
night cloth-pounding

jp: .はたはたは母が砧としられけり
ro: hata-hata wa haha ga kinuta to shirare keri
en:
clink-clonk
the one pounding cloth
is Mother

jp: .梟が拍子とる也小夜ぎぬた
ro: fukurô ga hyôshi toru nari sayo-ginuta
en:
an owl hooting
to the beat...
pounding cloth

jp: .春日野や駄菓子に交る鹿の尿
ro: kasugano ya dagashi ni majiru shika no kuso
en:
Kasuga Field--
penny candy mingles
with deer poop

jp: .さをしかの角にかけたり手行灯
ro: saoshika no tsuno ni kaketari te andon
en:
hanging from the buck's
antler...
a hand-lamp

jp: .さをしかやことし生れも秋の声
ro: saoshika ya kotoshi umare mo aki no koe
en:
young bucks--
even those born this year
autumn voices

jp: .爺鹿が寝所見付て呼りけり
ro: jii shika ga ne-doko mitsukete yobari keri
en:
grandfather buck
searching for a sleeping place
calls out

jp: .爺鹿の瀬ぶみ致スや俄川
ro: jii shika no sebumi itasu ya niwaka-gawa
en:
grandfather buck
testing the depth...
flash flood river

jp: .鹿笛や下手が吹ても夜の声
ro: shika fue ya heta ga fuite mo yoru no koe
en:
the deer's flute playing
off-key...
song in the night

jp: .神前に鳴さをしかも子やほしき
ro: shinzen ni naku saoshika mo ko ya hoshiki
en:
at the shrine
a buck, too, prays
to have a child

jp: .息災に紅葉を見るよ夫婦鹿
ro: sokusai ni momiji wo miru yo meoto shika
en:
with Buddha's peace
gazing at red leaves...
Mr. and Mrs. Deer

jp: .高縁を睨でよぶや男鹿
ro: taka en wo nirande yobu ya otoko shika
en:
glaring at the high verandah
he barks...
the buck

jp: .鳴鹿の片顔かくす鳥居哉
ro: naku shika no kata koe kakusu tôri kana
en:
hiding
the singing deer's face...
torii gate

jp: .鳴な鹿柳が蛇になるほどに
ro: naku na shika yanagi ga hebi ni naru hodo ni
en:
don't cry deer!
the willow tree only looks
like snakes

jp: .はいかいの主集を負せん庵の鹿
ro: haikai no shû wo owasen io no shika
en:
don't carry off
my haiku collection!
deer at my hut

jp: .不精しか鳴放しにて寝たりけり
ro: bushô shika naki-hanashi [ni]te netari keri
en:
the lazy buck
croons his mating call
lying down

jp: .下手笛によっくきけとや鹿のなく
ro: heta fue ni yokku kike to ya shika no naku
en:
listen well
to that off-key flute!
cry of a deer

jp: .山寺や縁の上なるしかの声
ro: yamadera ya en no ue naru shika no koe
en:
mountain temple--
on the verandah
a deer cries

jp: .夕暮や鹿に立添ふ羅かん顔
ro: yûgure ya shika ni tachi sou rakan kao
en:
as evening falls
he stands among the deer...
face of the holy man

jp: .啄木のけいこにたたく柱哉
ro: kitsutsuki no keiko ni tataku hashira kana
en:
the woodpecker knocks it
for practice...
the post

jp: .啄木の目利して見る庵哉
ro: kitsutsuki no mekiki shite miru iori kana
en:
the woodpecker
sizes it up...
my hut

jp: .啄木もやめて聞かよ夕木魚
ro: kitsutsuki mo yamete kiku ka yo yû mokugyo
en:
is the woodpecker
stopping to listen too?
evening's wooden drum

jp: .得手物の片足立や小田の雁
ro: ete mono no kata [ashi]-dachi ya oda no kari
en:
a talented one
posed on one foot...
rice field geese

jp: .大組を呼おろしけり小田の雁
ro: ôgumi wo yobi-oroshi keri oda no kari
en:
calling a big gang
down to join them...
rice field geese

jp: .おりよ雁一もくさんに我前へ
ro: ori yo kari hito mokusan ni waga mae e
en:
come down, wild goose!
plan your landing
at my feet

jp: .片足立して見せる也杭の雁
ro: kata ashi dachi miseru nari kui no kari
en:
trying out
standing on one leg...
goose on a post

jp: .門の雁片足立って思案哉
ro: kado no kari kata ashi tatte shian kana
en:
goose at the gate
standing on one leg...
deep meditation

jp: .雁鴨や御成りもしらで安堵顔
ro: kari kamo ya onari mo shirade ando kao
en:
geese and ducks
unaware of the August Presence...
peaceful faces

jp: .雁どもも夜を日に次で渡りけり
ro: kari-domo mo yo wo hi ni tsuide watari keri
en:
you too, wild geese
all day, into the night
must travel

jp: .一ッ雁夜々ばかり渡りけり
ro: hitotsu kari yoru yoru bakari watari keri
en:
lone wild goose--
fly night after night
on your way

jp: .木母寺古き夕や芦に雁
ro: mokuboji no furuki yûbe ya ashi ni kari
en:
tonight like old times
at Mokubo Temple...
geese in the reeds

jp: .追れても人住里や渡り鳥
ro: owarete mo hito sumu sato ya watari-dori
en:
chased away
from the village of people...
migrating birds

jp: .喧嘩すなあひみたがひに渡り鳥
ro: kenka suna aimitagai ni watari-dori
en:
don't quarrel
stick together!
migrating birds

jp: .どふ追れても人里を渡り鳥
ro: dô owarete mo hito-zato wo watari-dori
en:
no matter how often
they're chased from the village...
migrating birds

jp: .山雀の輪抜しながら渡りけり
ro: yamagara no wanuke shi nagara watari keri
en:
flying through hoops
titmice
through the trees

jp: .虫の屁を指して笑ひ仏哉
ro: mushi no he wo yubisashite warai hotoke kana
en:
pointing
at the fart bug...
laughing Buddha

jp: .こおろぎのとぶや唐箕のほこり先
ro: kôrogi no tobu ya tômi no hokori saki
en:
the cricket hops
atop the winnowing fan's
dust pile

jp: .きりぎりすかがしの腹で鳴にけり
ro: kirigirisu kagashi no hara de naki ni keri
en:
a katydid
in the scarecrow's gut
singing

jp: .蟷螂や五分の魂見よ見よと
ro: tôrô ya gobu no tama mi yo mi yo to
en:
the praying mantis's
brave chest, half an inch...
look!

jp: .夜々や涼しい連に鳴蚯蚓
ro: yoru-yoru ya suzushii tsure ni naku mimizu
en:
night after night
accompanying the cool air...
earthworms sing

jp: .鰯めせめせとや泣子負ながら
ro: iwashi mese mese to ya naku ko oi nagara
en:
"Sardines! Get your sardines!"
she cries, a crying baby
on her back

jp: .井筒から日本風ぞ菊の花
ro: izutsu kara nippon kaze zo kiku no hana
en:
from the well
a breeze of Japan!
chrysanthemum

jp: .開山は芭蕉さま也菊の花
ro: kaizan wa bashô-sama nari kiku no kana
en:
the sect founder
is Great Basho...
chrysanthemums

jp: .菊園や歩きながらの小盃
ro: kiku-zono ya aruki nagara no ko sakazuki
en:
chrysanthemum garden--
we walk with little
sake cups

jp: .鍬さげて新農顔やきくの花
ro: kuwa sagete shinnô kao ya kiku no hana
en:
wielding his hoe
with a face like Shinno's...
chrysanthemums

jp: .下戸庵が疵也こんな菊の花
ro: gekoan ga kizu nari konna kiku no hana
en:
no drinking at this hut
that's a flaw...
but such chrysanthemums!

jp: .小菊なら縄目の恥はなかるべし
ro: ko-giku nara nawame no haji wa nakarubeshi
en:
if you were small, chrysanthemum
there'd be no shame
of shackles!

jp: .幸にらくらく咲くや屋草菊
ro: saiwai ni raku-raku saku ya yakuza kiku
en:
happy and peaceful
they bloom...
the riffraff mums

jp: .幸に遅々さくややたら菊
ro: saiwai ni oso-oso saku ya yatara kiku
en:
happily they've bloomed
though they took their time...
wild mums

jp: .酒臭き紙屑籠やきくの花
ro: sake nioki kami kuzu kago ya kiku no hana
en:
the waste paper basket
smells of sake...
chrysanthemums

jp: .杖先で画解する也菊の花
ro: tsue saki de e toki suru nari kiku no hana
en:
with the tip of his cane
he points and lectures...
chrysanthemums

jp: .入道の大鉢巻できくの花
ro: nyûdô no ôhachi maki de kiku no hana
en:
the priest has a towel
wrapped 'round his head...
chrysanthemums

jp: .寝る連に瓢もごろり菊の花
ro: neru tsure ni fukube mo gorori kiku no hana
en:
curled asleep
side-by-side, a gourd
a chrysanthemum

jp: .藪菊のこっそり独盛りけり
ro: yabu-giku no kossori hitori sakari keri
en:
the thicket's chrysanthemum
blooms
in secret

jp: .山寺や糧の内なる菊の花
ro: yamadera ya kate no nai naru kiku no hana
en:
mountain temple--
among the provisions
chrysanthemums

jp: .らくらくと寝て咲にけり名無菊
ro: raku-raku to nete saki ni keri na nashi kiku
en:
peacefully asleep
it has bloomed...
nameless chrysanthemum

jp: .ろくろくに露も呑さぬ菊の花
ro: roku-roku ni tsuyu mo nomasanu kiku no hana
en:
lazy, lazy! I water it
not even with dewdrops...
my chrysanthemum

jp: .我やうにどっさり寝たよ菊の花
ro: waga yô ni dossari neta yo kiku no hana
en:
like me
getting plenty of sleep...
chrysanthemum

jp: .朝顔にかして咲する庇かな
ro: asagao ni kashite saki suru hisashi kana
en:
rented to the blooming
morning-glories...
my eaves

jp: .念仏の指南所や庵の蔦
ro: nembutsu no shinansho ya io no tsuta
en:
a school for praising
Buddha...
my hut's ivy

jp: .さおしかの食こぼしけり萩の花
ro: saoshika no kui koboshi keri hagi no hana
en:
dropping from
the young buck's mouth
bush clover blossoms

jp: .葛蔓の手にしてまとふ柱かな
ro: kuzu tsuru no te ni shite matou hashira kana
en:
the arrowroot vine
holds on tight...
a post

jp: .下戸庵が疵也こんな蘭の花
ro: geko io ga kizu nari konna ran no hana
en:
the nondrinker's hut
is an eyesore...
blooming orchids

jp: .馬のくび曲らぬ程の稲穂哉
ro: uma no kubi magaranu hodo no inaho kana
en:
the horse doesn't hardly
bend his neck...
heads of rice

jp: .首出して稲付馬の通りけり
ro: kubi dashite ine tsuke uma no tôri keri
en:
stretching its neck
the rice-loaded horse
passes

jp: .蜻蛉もおがむ手つきや稲の花
ro: tombô mo ogamu te tsuki ya ine no hana
en:
the dragonfly too
folds hands in prayer...
rice blossoms

jp: .まけぬきに畠もそよぐ稲穂哉
ro: makenu ki ni hatake mo soyogu inaho kana
en:
never giving up
my field rustles too...
heads of rice

jp: .夕月や刈穂の上の神酒徳り
ro: yûzuki ya kariho no ue no miki tokuri
en:
evening moon--
on the harvested rice
a bottle of sake

jp: .一念仏申す程してすすき哉
ro: hito nebutsu mô[su] hodo shite susuki kana
en:
offering a prayer
to Amida Buddha...
pampas grass

jp: .頬べたにあてなどするや赤い柿
ro: hôbeta ni ate nado suru ya akai kaki
en:
holding it
against her cheek...
the red persimmon

jp: .団栗がむけんの鐘をたたく也
ro: donguri ga muken no kane wo tataku nari
en:
an acorn strikes
the bell
of evil

jp: .木末から猿がをしへる茸哉
ro: kozue kara saru ga oshieru kinoko kana
en:
from the treetop
the monkey points out
the mushrooms

jp: .五六人只一ッ也きの子がり
ro: go roku nin tada hitotsu nari kinoko-gari
en:
for five or six people
only one...
mushroom hunting

jp: .猿の子に酒くれる也茸狩
ro: saru no ko ni sake kureru nari kinoko-gari
en:
for the baby monkey
a nip of sake...
mushroom hunting

jp: .旅の子に酒くれる也茸狩
ro: tabi no ko ni sake kureru nari kinoko-gari
en:
for the traveling child
a nip of sake...
mushroom hunting

jp: .茸がりのから手でもどる騒かな
ro: take-gari no kara te de modoru sawagi kana
en:
the mushroom hunters
return empty-handed...
fussing

jp: .雪ちらりちらり冬至の祝儀哉
ro: yuki chirari chirari tôji no shûgi kana
en:
snowflakes flitting down--
a winter solstice
celebration

jp: .一文に一つ鉦うつ寒さ哉
ro: ichi mon ni hitotsu kane utsu samu[sa] kana
en:
for one penny
one hit on the prayer gong...
how cold it is!

jp: .狼は糞ばかりでも寒さかな
ro: ôkami wa kuso bakari demo samu[sa] kana
en:
merely the sight
of wolf shit...
how cold it is!

jp: .古札の薮にひらひら寒さ哉
ro: furu fuda no yabu ni hira-hira samu[sa] kana
en:
the old banner
flaps in a thicket
in the cold

jp: .椋鳥と人に呼るる寒さ哉
ro: mukudori to hito ni yobaruru samu[sa] kana
en:
"A starling from the sticks!"
he taunts...
how cold it is

jp: .夕やけや唐紅の初氷
ro: yûyake ya karakurenai no hatsu-gôri
en:
evening's glow--
the deep, deep red
first ice

jp: .棒先の紙のひらひら小春哉
ro: bô saki no kami no hira-hira ko haru kana
en:
at the tip of the pole
paper flapping...
a spring day in winter

jp: .ともかくもあなた任せのとしの暮
ro: tomokaku mo anata makase no toshi no kure
en:
come what may
trusting in the Buddha
the year ends

jp: .大三十日とんじゃくもなし浮寝鳥ｹ
ro: [ô]misoka tonjaku mo nashi uki ne tori
en:
paying no heed
to the year's last day...
a floating bird, asleep

jp: .夕山やそば切色のはつ時雨
ro: yû yama ya sobakiri iro no hatsu shigure
en:
evening mountain--
the color of buckwheat noodles
first winter rain

jp: .子を負て川越す旅や一しぐれ
ro: ko wo ô[te] kawa kosu tabi ya hito shigure
en:
the child rides piggyback
across the river...
winter rain

jp: .業の鳥罠を巡るやむら時雨
ro: gô no tori wana wo meguru ya mura shigure
en:
the bird of karma
circles the trap...
steady winter rain

jp: .小座頭の追つめられし時雨哉
ro: ko zatô no oi-tsumerareshi shigure kana
en:
the little blind child
is overrun...
winter rain

jp: .小夜しぐれなくは子のない鹿に哉
ro: sayo shigure naku wa ko no nai shika ni gana
en:
night of winter rain--
the cries of a deer
without a child

jp: .三助が敲く木魚も時雨けり
ro: sansuke ga tataku mokugyo mo shigure keri
en:
the servant beats
his wooden drum...
winter rain

jp: .時雨るや親碗たたく唖乞食
ro: shigururu ya oyawan tataku oshikojiki
en:
winter rain--
the deaf and dumb beggar beats
his bowl

jp: .重箱の銭四五文や夕時雨
ro: jûbako no zeni shi go mon ya yû shigure
en:
in the box
four or five pennies...
night of winter rain

jp: .椋鳥の仲間に入や夕時雨
ro: mukudori no nakama ni iru ya yû shigure
en:
joining the "starlings"
a night of winter
rain

jp: .椋鳥と我をよぶ也村時雨
ro: mukudori to ware wo yobu nari mura shigure
en:
"A starling from the sticks"
I'm called...
steady winter rain

jp: .木がらしや折介帰る寒さ橋
ro: kogarashi ya orisuke kaeru samusa-bashi
en:
winter wind on Samusa Bridge--
a samurai's servant
goes home

jp: .木がらしやから呼されし按摩坊
ro: kogarashi ya kara yobisareshi anmabô
en:
winter wind--
a voice from nowhere calls
the blind masseur

jp: .こがらしや隣と云もえちご山
ro: kogarashi ya tonari to iu mo echigo yama
en:
winter wind--
the frozen north
draws near

jp: .木がらしや二十四文の遊女小家
ro: kogarashi ya ni jû shi mon no yûjo-goya
en:
winter wind--
a twenty-four cent
whorehouse

jp: .木がらしや人なき家の角大師
ro: kogarashi ya hito naki ie no tsunodaishi
en:
winter wind--
on the vacant house
a painted devil

jp: .木がらしや埃にのりしせたら馬
ro: kogarashi ya hokori ni norishi setara uma
en:
winter wind--
riding a packhorse
through the dust

jp: .はつ雪の降り捨てある家尻哉
ro: hatsu furi no sutete aru yajiri kana
en:
a dumping ground
for the first snow...
my backyard

jp: .初雪や今おろしたる上草り
ro: hatsu yuki ya ima oroshitaru uwazôri
en:
first snowfall--
I take down my indoor
slippers

jp: .初雪や今に煮らるる豚あそぶ
ro: hatsu yuki ya ima ni niraruru buta asobu
en:
first snowfall--
soon to be boiled
the playful pig

jp: .うら壁や貧乏雪のしっかりと
ro: ura kabe ya bimbô yuki no shikkari to
en:
my house's rear wall--
the dirty snow
holds on

jp: .雪ちるやおどけも云へぬ信濃空
ro: yuki chiru ya odoke mo ienu shinano-zora
en:
snow flitting down--
the sky over Shinano
isn't joking

jp: .雪ふれや貧乏徳利のこけぬ内
ro: yuki fure ya bimbô tokuri no kokenu uchi
en:
fall, snow!
my poor sake bottle
is dry

jp: .霰ちれちれちれ孫が福耳に
ro: arare chire chire chire mago ga fukumimi ni
en:
fall, hailstones, fall!
one in grandchild's
long-lobed ear

jp: .さをしかやえひしてなめるけさの霜
ro: saoshika ya eishite nameru kesa no shimo
en:
young bucks
licking each other...
morning frost

jp: .張番に庵とられけり夜の霜
ro: hariban ni io torare keri yoru no shimo
en:
offering my hut
to the watchman...
night frost

jp: .西方は極楽道よかれのはら
ro: saihô wa gokuraku [michi] yo kareno hara
en:
to the west
is Buddha's Paradise...
withered fields

jp: .御十夜は巾着切も月夜也
ro: o-jûya wa kinchakukiri mo tsuki yo nari
en:
winter prayers--
a cutpurse, too
in moonlight

jp: .辻堂の一人たたきの十夜哉J
ro: tsuji dô no hitori tataki no jûya kana
en:
in a crossroads temple
he claps alone...
winter prayers

jp: .菜畠を通してくれる十夜哉
ro: na-batake wo tôshite kureru jûya kana
en:
he lets me cross
his field...
night of winter prayers

jp: .塀間を通してくれる十夜哉
ro: heiai wo tôshite kureru jûya kana
en:
he lets me pass
through the gap in the fence...
night of winter prayers

jp: .こんにゃくもお十二日はつ時雨J
ro: konnyaku mo o-jû ni nichi zo hatsu shigure
en:
for festive jelly too
the venerable Twelfth Day...
first winter rain

jp: .寒垢離にせなかの竜の披露哉
ro: kangori ni senaka no tatsu no hirome kana
en:
midwinter bathers--
on their backs posters
of dragons

jp: .寒声と云もなむあみだ仏哉
ro: kangoe to iu mo namu amida butsu kana
en:
winter voice drills--
for this, too
all praise to Amida Buddha!

jp: .雨の夜やしかも女の寒念仏
ro: ame no yo ya shikamo onna no kan nebutsu
en:
rainy night--
yet she chants winter prayers
nonetheless

jp: .一文に一つづつかよ寒念仏
ro: ichi mon ni hitotsu-zutsu ka yo kan nebutsu
en:
one by one
don't the pennies drop?
winter prayers

jp: .煤竹にころころ猫がざれにけり
ro: susutake ni koro-koro neko ga zare ni keri
en:
rolling
with the bamboo soot broom
the cat gambols

jp: .煤払の世話がなき身の涙かな
ro: susu harai no sewa ga naki mi no namida
en:
no one to help
with the soot sweeping...
my tears

jp: .猫連て松へ隠居やすすはらひ
ro: neko tsurete matsu e inkyo ya susu harai
en:
accompanied by the cat
I hide it by the pine...
swept soot

jp: .子の真似を親もする也せっきぞろ
ro: ko no mane wo oya mo suru nari sekkizoro
en:
parents acting
like little kids...
Twelfth Month singers!

jp: .せき候やはるばる帰る寺の門
ro: sekizoro ya haru-baru kaeru tera no kado
en:
the Twelfth Month singers
return from afar...
temple gate

jp: .梅の木や御祓箱を負ながら
ro: ume no ki ya o-harai-bako wo oi nagara
en:
plum blossoms--
a box of old charms
on my back

jp: .犬の餅烏が餅もつかれけり
ro: inu no mochi karasu ga mochi mo tsukare keri
en:
one for the dog
one for the crow...
rice cakes

jp: .餅搗が隣へ来たと云子哉
ro: mochi tsuki ga tonari e kita to iu ko nari
en:
"The rice cake man
is next door!"
the child announces

jp: .もちつくや棚の大黒にこにこと
ro: mochi tsuki ya tana no daikoku niko-niko to
en:
pounding rice cakes--
the altar's god of wealth
beams a smile

jp: .我所へ来のではなし餅の音
ro: waga toko e kuru no dewa nashi mochi no oto
en:
not reaching my place--
the sound
of rice cake pounding

jp: .我門へ来さうにしたり配り餅
ro: waga kado e kisô ni shitari kubari mochi
en:
to my gate
he seemed to be coming...
neighbor with rice cakes

jp: .妹が子のせおふたなりや配り餅
ro: imo ga ko no se outa nari ya kubari mochi
en:
burdening my child's
back...
rice cakes for the neighbors

jp: .かまけるな柳の枝に餅がなる
ro: kamakeru na yanagi no eda ni mochi ga naru
en:
stop pestering!
rice cakes are growing
on willow branches

jp: .一人の太平楽や年わすれ
ro: ichi nini no taiheiraku ya toshiwasure
en:
all alone
babbling idiocies...
drinking away the year

jp: .うら山や十所ばかり年忘
ro: ura yama ya to tokoro bakari toshiwasure
en:
hill behind my home
at least ten places...
they drink away the year

jp: .御仲間に猫も坐とるや年わすれ
ro: o-nakama ni neko mo za toru ya toshiwasure
en:
the cat joins
the party...
drinking away the year

jp: .都哉橋の下にも年わすれ
ro: miyako kana hashi no shita ni mo toshiwasure
en:
Kyoto--
even under bridges
drinking away the year

jp: .我家やたった一人も年わすれ
ro: waga ie ya tatta hitori mo toshiwasure
en:
my house--
all by myself
drinking away the year

jp: .山里や藪の中にも年の市
ro: yama-zato ya yabu no naka ni mo toshi no ichi
en:
mountain village--
even in a thicket
a year's end fair

jp: .おさな子やただ三ッでも年の豆
ro: osanago ya tada mittsu demo toshi no mame
en:
the child's only three
but gets his share...
lucky beans

jp: .鬼よけの浪人よけのさし柊
ro: oni yoke no rônin yoke no sashi hiragi
en:
protection from demons
and wild samurai...
lucky holly

jp: .けふからは正月分ぞ麦の色
ro: kyô kara wa shôgatsu bun zo mugi no iro
en:
after today
