outside the hairdresser's
a potted pine

jp: .夕立や芝から芝へ小盃
ro: yûdachi ya shiba kara shiba e ko sakazuki
en:
rainstorm--
on this lawn, that lawn
just a cup's worth

jp: .夕立や寝蓙の上の草の花
ro: yûdachi ya negoza no ue no kusa no hana
en:
rainstorm--
atop the sleeping mat
wildflowers

jp: .着ながらにせんだくしたり夏の雨
ro: ki nagara ni sendaku shitari natsu no ame
en:
washing my laundry
with my clothes on...
summer rain

jp: .雨雲やまごまごしては峰と成る
ro: ame-gumo ya magomago shite wa mine to naru
en:
rainclouds--
just to kill time
billowing

jp: .小さいのも数に並ぶや雲の峰
ro: chisai no mo kazu ni narabu ya kumo no mine
en:
though small
they line up too...
peaks of clouds

jp: .山国やあるが上にも雲の峰
ro: yama-guni ya aru [ga] ue ni mo kumo no mine
en:
mountain country--
and above, too
peaks of clouds

jp: .けふからは乾さるる番ぞ青田原
ro: kyô kara wa hosaruru ban zo aodabara
en:
after today
it's your turn to dry up...
green rice field

jp: .念仏も三絃に引く祭り哉
ro: nembutsu mo samisen ni hiku matsuri kana
en:
praising Buddha too
with her samisen...
festival

jp: .赤々と旭長者や花御堂
ro: aka-aka to asahi chôja ya hanamidô
en:
shining in the dawn
a rich VIP...
Buddha amid birthday flowers

jp: .虻蜂の大吉日や花御堂
ro: abu hachi no ôkichi nichi ya hanamidô
en:
horseflies' and bees'
big lucky day...
Buddha's birthday flowers

jp: .蟻の道はや付にけり花御堂
ro: ari no michi haya tsuki ni keri hanamidô
en:
the ants rush
to make a road...
Buddha's birthday flowers

jp: .蛙にもちとなめさせよ甘茶水
ro: kawazu ni mo [chi]to namesase yo amacha mizu
en:
even a frog
is offered a sip...
Buddha's birthday tea

jp: .灌仏をなめて見たがるわらべ哉
ro: kanbutsu wo namete mitagaru warabe kana
en:
wanting to give
birthday Buddha a lick...
little child

jp: .灌仏の御指の先や暮の月
ro: kanbutsu no o-yubi no saki ya kure no tsuki
en:
on the tip
of birthday Buddha's finger
setting moon

jp: .白妙の花の卯月の八日哉
ro: shirotae no hana no uzuki no yôka kana
en:
for pure white flowers
Fourth Month, Eighth Day
has arrived!

jp: .むだにして蜘が下るや花御堂
ro: muda ni shite kumo ga sagaru ya hanamidô
en:
a spider descends
in vain...
Buddha's birthday flowers

jp: .山寺や蝶が受取甘茶水
ro: yamadera ya chô ga uketoru amacha mizu
en:
mountain temple--
the butterfly sips
Buddha's tea water

jp: .ものしりの真似して籠る夏心
ro: monoshiri no mane shite komoru natsu kokoro
en:
like wise men do
I go into seclusion...
summer heart

jp: .神の代や不二の峰にも泊り宿
ro: kami no yo ya fuji no mine [ni mo] tomari yado
en:
age of the gods!
atop Mount Fuji too
an inn

jp: .斯々と虻の案内や不二詣で
ro: kôkô to abu no annai ya fuji môde
en:
"Come this way!"
the horsefly guides
Mount Fuji's pilgrims

jp: .明ぬ間に不二十ばかり上りけり
ro: akenu ma ni fuji jû bakaqri nobori keri
en:
in one morning
I climb around ten...
Mount Fujis

jp: .涼しさや一またぎでも不二の山
ro: suzushisa ya hito matagi demo fuji no yama
en:
cool air--
I can straddle it
this Mount Fuji!

jp: .口がるな蛙也けり夕はらひ
ro: kuchiga[ru]na kawazu nari keri yû harai
en:
the frogs become
talkative...
evening's shrine boats

jp: .子を連て猫もそろそろ御祓哉
ro: ko wo tsurete neko mo soro-soro misogi kana
en:
with the child
the cat, too, goes slow...
shrine boats

jp: .笹舟を流して遊ぶ御祓哉
ro: sasa-bune wo nagashite asobu misogi kana
en:
floating to play
with a bamboo grass boat...
Shinto shrine

jp: .早速に虫も鈴ふる御祓哉
ro: sassoku ni mushi mo rin furu misogi kana
en:
an insect too
quickly shakes a bell...
purification ritual

jp: .しかつべに蛙も並んで夕はらひ
ro: shikatsube ni kawazu mo narande yû harai
en:
with grave seriousness
frogs line up too...
evening's purification

jp: .正直に風そよぐ也御祓川
ro: shôjiki ni kaze soyogu nari misogi-gawa
en:
the wind rustles
truthfulness...
river shrine boats

jp: .痩蚤を振ふや猫も夕祓
ro: yase nomi wo furuu ya neko mo yû harai
en:
rousting his skinny fleas
the cat too...
evening's purification

jp: .髪のない頭も撫る茅の輪哉
ro: kami no nai atama mo naderu chinowa kana
en:
rubbing even
the hairless head...
purification hoop

jp: .茅の輪哉手引て潜る子があらば
ro: chinowa kana te hiite kuguru ko ga araba
en:
purification hoop--
we'd go through hand-in-hand
if I had a child

jp: .蝶々の夫婦連してちの輪哉
ro: chôchô no fûfu-zure shite chinowa kana
en:
two butterflies
pass through together...
purification hoop

jp: .形代も肩身すぼめて流れけり
ro: katashiro mo katami subomete nagare keri
en:
with a shrug
the little plague god
floats away

jp: .形代も吹ばとぶ也軽い身は
ro: katashiro mo fukeba tobu nari karui mi wa
en:
the little plague god
flies in the gust...
its body so light!

jp: .形代や乗て流て笹葉舟
ro: katashiro ya nosete nagarete sasaha fune
en:
little plague god--
setting sail on a boat
of bamboo grass

jp: .草花にくくり添たる粽かな
ro: kusabana ni kukuri soetaru chimaki kana
en:
bundled
with wildflowers too...
rice dumplings

jp: .小坊主の首にかけたる粽かな
ro: ko bôzu no kubi ni kaketaru chimaki kana
en:
dangling from
the little boy's neck...
a rice dumpling

jp: .猫の子のほどく手つきや笹粽
ro: neko no ko no hodoku tetsuki ya sasa chimaki
en:
the kitten unwraps it
with clever paws...
rice dumpling

jp: .御祭や鵜も寝並んで骨休
ro: o-matsuri ya u mo ne narande honeyasumi
en:
festival--
cormorants asleep in a row
on holiday

jp: .はなれ鵜や子の鳴門へ鳴もどる
ro: hanare u ya ko no naku kado e naki modoru
en:
baby comorant cries--
his mother, calling back
returns to the gate

jp: .けふの日やけぶり立る鵜のかせぎ
ro: kyô no hi ya keburi tateru mo u no kasegi
en:
today--
even in thick smoke
cormorants make their living

jp: .子の鳴をかへり見い見い行鵜哉
ro: ko no naku wo kaeri mii mii yuku u kana
en:
looking back, back
to her crying children
cormorant departs

jp: .雨ごひのあげくの果の出水哉
ro: amegoi no ageku no hate no demizu kana
en:
after praying for rain
the result...
a flood!

jp: .今日も今日も今日も今日もやだまし雲
ro: kyômo kyômo kyômo kyômo ya da[ma]shi kumo
en:
today too
today too...
cheating clouds

jp: .さをしかに書物負せて更衣
ro: saoshika ni shomatsu owasete koromogae
en:
I let the buck
carry my notebook...
new summer robe

jp: .手八丁口八丁やころもがへ
ro: te hatchô kuchi hatchô ya koromogae
en:
skillful hands
skillful mouths...
new summer robes

jp: .むだ人や隙にあぐんでころもがい
ro: muda hito ya hima ni agunde koromogai
en:
vain mankind!
so soon sick of their
new summer robes

jp: .一丁に三人計りあはせ哉
ro: itchô [ni] sannin bakari awase kana
en:
about three people
per block...
summer robes

jp: .忽に寝じはだらけの袷哉
ro: tachimachi ni ne-jiwa darake no awase kana
en:
in no time
filled with sleep wrinkles...
my summer kimono

jp: .目出度さの浅ぎ袷や朝参り
ro: medetasa no asagi awase ya asa mairi
en:
in celebratory light blue
kimonos...
morning pilgrimage

jp: .十露盤にあごつっ張って昼寝哉
ro: soroban ni ago tsuppatte hirune kana
en:
with his chin propped
on his abacus...
siesta

jp: .わんぱくの相伴したる昼寝哉
ro: wanpaku no shôban shitaru hirune kana
en:
a naughty child
joins the adults...
siesta

jp: .うんうんと坂を上りて扇かな
ro: un-un to saka wo noborite ôgi kana
en:
they huff and puff
up the hill...
paper fans flitting

jp: .子宝よも一ッ力め武者扇
ro: ko takara yo mo hitotsu rikime musha ôgi
en:
treasured child--
one more mighty effort
with the samurai's fan

jp: .灸点の背中をあをぐ団扇哉
ro: kyûten no senaka wo aogu uchiwa kana
en:
fanning his back sores
from burning wormwood...
Edo paper fan

jp: .蚊いぶしをまたぎて這入る庵哉
ro: kaibushi wo matagite hairu iori kana
en:
stepping over
the smudge pot to enter...
my hut

jp: .蚊いぶしの中から出たる茶の子哉
ro: ka ibushi no naka kara detaru cha no ko kana
en:
emerging from
the smudge pot smoke...
tea cakes

jp: .尻べたに筵の形や一涼み
ro: shiribeta ni mushiro no nari ya hito suzumi
en:
straw mat marks
on my butt...
a cool breeze

jp: .あきらめて涼ずに寝る小僧哉
ro: akiramete suzumazu ni neru kozô kana
en:
giving up
waiting for cool air...
the little boy sleeps

jp: .江戸で見た山は是也一涼み
ro: edo de mita yama wa kore nari hito suzumi
en:
the mountain I saw from Edo
is now here...
a cool breeze

jp: .鍬鍛冶が涼む真似して夜なべ哉
ro: kuwa kaji ga suzumu mane shite yonabe kana
en:
the blacksmith basks
in the cool air...
night work

jp: .捨人やよなべさわぎを門涼
ro: sutebito ya yonabe sawagi wo kado suzumi
en:
others toil in the evening
not the hermit...
cool air at the gate

jp: .大切の涼相手も草の露
ro: taisetsu no suzumi aite mo kusa no tsuyu
en:
my treasured companion
for the cool air...
now, dew on the grass

jp: .手八丁口八丁や門涼
ro: te hatchô kuchi hatchô ya kado suzumi
en:
skillful hands
skillful mouths...
cool air at the gate

jp: .山陰や涼みがてらのわらぢ茶屋
ro: yama kage ya suzumi-gatera no waraji chaya
en:
mountain shade--
while enjoying the cool air
straw sandals, teahouse

jp: .山々の講釈するや門涼み
ro: yama-yama no kôshaku suru ya kado suzumi
en:
talking about this mountain
and that...
cool air at the gate

jp: .両国やちと涼むにも迷子札
ro: ryôgoku ya chito suzumu ni mo maigo fuda
en:
Ryogoku Bridge--
even in this moment of cool air
a lost child sign

jp: .虻一ッ馬の腹にて涼みけり
ro: abu hitotsu uma no hara nite suzumi keri
en:
one horsefly
on the horse's belly
cooling off

jp: .温泉のけぶる際より田植哉
ro: onsen no keburu kiwa yori taue kana
en:
touched by
the hot spring's steam...
planting rice

jp: .しなのぢや山の上にも田植笠
ro: shinano ji ya yama no ue ni mo taue kasa
en:
Shinano road--
atop the mountain, too
rice planters' umbrella-hats

jp: .人の世や山の上でも田植うた
ro: hito no yo ya yama no ue demo taue uta
en:
world of man--
even atop a mountain
rice planters singing

jp: .俗人に抱れながらもかのこ哉
ro: zokunin ni dakare [na]gara mo kanoko kana
en:
being hugged
by a worldly fellow...
fawn

jp: .母親と同じ枕の手負哉
ro: haha oya to onaji makura no teoi kana
en:
sharing
his mother's pillow...
wounded deer

jp: .垣外へ必らず出るな羽抜鳥
ro: kaki soto e kanarazu deruna hanuke tori
en:
by all means
stay inside the fence!
molting bird

jp: .子は親をつくづく見るや羽ぬけ鳥
ro: ko wa oya wo tsuku-zuku miru ya hanuke tori
en:
the baby birds' eyes
riveted on mother...
molting

jp: .有明のすてっぺん也ほととぎす
ro: ariake no suteppen nari hototogisu
en:
the morning moon
is straight overhead...
"cuckoo!"

jp: .今の間やえど見てもどる時鳥
ro: ima no ma ya edo mite modoru hototogisu
en:
just now
back from its Edo tour...
cuckoo

jp: .大降や業腹まぎれのほととぎす
ro: ôburi ya gôhara magire no hototogisu
en:
in heavy rain
seething with resentment
cuckoo

jp: .猿はなぜ耳をふさぐぞ時鳥
ro: saru wa naze mimi wo fusagu zo hototogisu
en:
why does the monkey
plug his ears
cuckoo?

jp: .三介が蛇の目の傘やほととぎす
ro: sansuke ga ja no me no kasa ya hototogisu
en:
the servant has
a snake-eye parasol...
cuckoo

jp: .挑灯にすり違ひけりほととぎす
ro: chôchin ni surichigai keri hototogisu
en:
breezing past
the paper lantern...
a cuckoo

jp: .ばか喧嘩はやして行やほととぎす
ro: baka-genka hayashite yuku ya hototogisu
en:
a stupid quarrel!
the cuckoo hurries
away

jp: .初声は江戸へ江戸へと時鳥
ro: hatsu-goe wa edo [e] edo [e] to hototogisu
en:
morning's first voice
"To Edo! To Edo!"
cuckoo

jp: .人々をまた寝せ付てほととぎす
ro: hito-bito wo mata nesetsukete hototogisu
en:
once again
sending us humans to bed...
cuckoo

jp: .本丸を尻目にかけてほととぎす
ro: honmaru wo shirime ni kakete hototogisu
en:
looking askance
at the great lord's fortress...
cuckoo

jp: .やあれまて声が高いぞ時鳥
ro: yaare mate koe ga takai zo hototogisu
en:
that voice of yours
too shrill!
cuckoo

jp: .山人に鼻つままれなほととぎす
ro: yamaudo [ni] hana tsumama[re]na hototogisu
en:
don't get your nose picked
by the mountain hermit!
cuckoo

jp: .我先へ浅間巡りやほととぎす
ro: ware saki e asama meguri ya hototogisu
en:
trying to beat
Mount Asama's pilgrims...
cuckoo

jp: .金の花咲た山より閑古鳥
ro: kane no hana saita yama yori kankodori
en:
on a mountain
of golden flowers in bloom
a cuckoo

jp: .閑古鳥でも来てくれようしろ窓
ro: kankodori demo kite kure yo ushiro mado
en:
even you, mountain cuckoo
visit me!
back window

jp: .閑古鳥鳴やねまればねまるとて
ro: kankodori naku ya nemareba nemaru tote
en:
a mountain cuckoo singing--
if I could only
sleep!

jp: .此おくに山湯ありとやかんこ鳥
ro: kono oku ni yamayu ari to ya kankodori
en:
"In these wilds
there's a hot spring!"
mountain cuckoo

jp: .古郷は雲の下なり閑古鳥
ro: furusato wa kumo no shita nari kankodori
en:
my home village
beneath that cloud...
mountain cuckoo

jp: .山寺や炭つく臼もかんこ鳥
ro: yamadera ya sumi tsuku usu mo kankodori
en:
on the mountain temple's
coal grinder too...
mountain cuckoo

jp: .鶯や年が寄ってもあんな声
ro: uguisu ya toshi ga yotte mo anna koe
en:
nightingale
you're growing old...
but what a voice!

jp: .年は寄っても鶯はうぐいすぞ
ro: toshi wa yotte mo uguisu [wa] uguisu zo
en:
though growing old
the nightingale's
a nightingale!

jp: .行々し口から先へ生れたか
ro: gyôgyôshi kuchi kara saki e umareta ka
en:
reed thrush
were you born
mouth first?

jp: .頭巾きた阿房阿房とや夕水鶏
ro: zukin kita ahô ahô to ya yû kuina
en:
"You're a lot of fools
wearing skullcaps!"
evening moorhen

jp: .蛇も一皮むけて涼しいか
ro: kuchinawa mo hito kawa mukete suzushii ka
en:
with skin peeled off
snake
are you cool now?

jp: .馬の背を掃おろしたる蛍哉
ro: uma no se wo haki-orishitaru hotaru kana
en:
sweeping them off
the horse's back...
fireflies

jp: .かくれ家は蛍の休所哉
ro: kakurega wa hotaru no yasumi-dokoro kana
en:
secluded house--
a firefly
resort

jp: .初蛍仏の花にいく夜寝る
ro: hatsu hotaru hotoke no hana ni iku yo neru
en:
first firefly
how many nights did you sleep
in Buddha's flowers?

jp: .枕にも足のうらにもほたる哉
ro: makura ni mo ashi no ura ni mo hotaru kana
en:
from my pillow
to the soles of my feet
fireflies

jp: .ぼうふりの念仏おどりや墓の水
ro: bôfuri no nebutsu odori ya haka no mizu
en:
mosquito larvae
dance in memoriam...
the tomb's puddle

jp: .蚊柱や犬の尻から天窓から
ro: ka-bashira ya inu no shiri kara atama kara
en:
mosquito swarms--
from the dog's butt
and head

jp: .隙人や蚊が出た出たと触歩く
ro: himajin ya ka ga deta deta to fure aruku
en:
men of leisure--
"Mosquitoes have come!"
they say

jp: .群蠅を口で追いけり門の犬
ro: mure-bae wo kuchi de oi keri kado no inu
en:
chasing the fly swarm
with his mouth...
dog at the gate

jp: .老牛も蠅はらふ尾は持にけり
ro: oi ushi mo hae harau o wa mochi [ni] keri
en:
even the old cow
has a fly-whisking
tail

jp: .老の手や蝿を打さへ逃た跡
ro: oi no te ya hae wo utsu sae nigeta ato
en:
the old hand
swats a fly
already gone

jp: .口明て蝿を追ふ也門の犬
ro: kuchi akete hae wo ou nari kado no inu
en:
gaping mouthed
and fly-hungry...
dog at the gate

jp: .そり立のつぶりを蠅に踏れけり
ro: sori tate no tsuburi wo hae ni fumare keri
en:
my clean-shaven head--
the flies
stomp on it

jp: .堂の蝿数珠する人の手をまねる
ro: dô no hae juzu suru hito no te wo maneru
en:
temple fly mimic--
hands
praying beads

jp: .群蠅の逃げた跡打皺手哉
ro: mure-bae no nigeta ato utsu shiwade kana
en:
after the fly swarm
escapes, swat!
my wrinkled hand

jp: .やれ打な蝿が手をすり足をする
ro: yare utsuna hae ga te wo suri ashi wo suru
en:
don't swat the fly!
praying hands
praying feet

jp: .でくでくと蚤まけせぬや田舎猫
ro: deku-deku to nomi make senu ya inaka neko
en:
trudging along
enduring his fleas...
country cat

jp: .湖や山を目当に蚤およぐ
ro: mizuumi ya yama wo meate ni nomi oyogu
en:
in the lake
heading for the mountain...
the flea swims

jp: .我宿は蚤捨薮のとなり哉
ro: waga yado wa nomi sute yabu no tonari kana
en:
my home--
next door to a thicket
of fleas

jp: .狗の夢見て鳴か夜のせみ
ro: enokoro no yume mite naku ka yoru no semi
en:
are you watching
the puppy's dream?
cicada singing at night

jp: .鳴ながら蝉の登るやぬり柱
ro: naki nagara semi no noboru ya nuri-bashira
en:
chirring as he climbs
cicada on the lacquered
post

jp: .もろ蝉やもろ雨垂や大御堂
ro: moro-zemi ya moro amadare ya ômidô
en:
so many cicadas
so many raindrops from the eaves!
great temple hall

jp: .薮寺や夜もおりおり蝉の声
ro: yabu tera ya yoru mo ori-ori semi no koe
en:
temple in the thicket--
even at night, now and then
cicada song

jp: .鳴明す蓼くふ虫も好々に
ro: naki akasu tade kuu mushi mo suki-zuki ni
en:
some sing all night
some eat knotweed...
a matter of taste

jp: .縁はなや上手に曲るかたつむり
ro: en hana ya jyôzu ni magaru katatsumuri
en:
verandah flower--
making a skillful turn
a snail

jp: .かたつぶり気がむいたやらごろり寝る
ro: katatsuburi ki ga muita yara gorori neru
en:
the snail does just
as he pleases...
curled asleep

jp: .元政の垣に昼寝やかたつむり
ro: gensei no kaki ni hirune ya katatsumuri
en:
having a siesta
on Gensei's fence...
a snail

jp: .でで虫の其身其まま寝起哉
ro: dedemushi no sono mi sono mama neoki kana
en:
little snail, no different
asleep
awake

jp: .わら垣や上手に落るかたつむり
ro: wara kaki ya jyôzu ni ochiru katatsumuri
en:
straw fence--
coming down skillfully
a snail

jp: .暑い世へ出るが蚯蚓の栄よう哉
ro: atsui yo e deru ga mimizu [no] eyô kana
en:
coming out
to a hot world, earthworm's
prosperity

jp: .あばらやに痩がまんせぬぼたん哉
ro: abaraya ni yasegaman senu botan kana
en:
in my ramshackle hut
she holds her head high...
the peony

jp: .痩庭にやせぼたんではなかりけり
ro: yase niwa ni yase botan dewa nakari keri
en:
in the pitiful garden
no pitiful
peonies!

jp: .なでしこのなぜ折たぞよおれたぞよ
ro: nade[shi]ko no naze oreta zo yo oreta zo yo
en:
why did the blooming
pink break?
oh why?

jp: .物陰にこっそり咲や小なでしこ
ro: monokage ni kossori saku ya ko nadeshiko
en:
in something's shadow
slyly blooming...
little pink

jp: .浮草にふはり蛙の遊山かな
ro: ukikusa ni fuwari kawazu no yusan kana
en:
on the duckweed's softness
the frog's
picnic

jp: .浮草や桶に咲ても風そよぐ
ro: ukikusa ya oke ni saite mo kaze soyogu
en:
duckweed--
even blooming in a bucket
wind-rustled

jp: .御鼠ちょろちょろ浮草渡り哉
ro: on-nezumi choro-choro ukikusa watari kana
en:
Sir Mouse
nimbly, nimbly crosses
the duckweed

jp: .麦つくや大道中の大月夜
ro: mugi tsuku ya daidô naka no ôtsuki yo
en:
barley husking--
in the middle of the highway
a bright moon

jp: .御地蔵の膝も眼鼻も苔の花
ro: o-jizô [no] hiza mo mehana mo koke no hana
en:
in holy Jizo's
lap, eyes, nose...
blooming moss

jp: .猫の寝た跡もつかぬぞ苔の花
ro: neko no neta ato mo tsukanu zo koke no hana
en:
undented
by the cat's nap...
moss blossoms

jp: .屋根の苔花迄咲いて落にけり
ro: yane no koke hana made saite ochi ni keri
en:
even the roof's moss
blooms
then scatters

jp: .家の棟や烏が落す苔の花
ro: ya no mune ya karasu ga otosu koke no hana
en:
house's ridge-pole--
the crow flings down
moss blossoms

jp: .夕陰や下手が植ても苔の花
ro: yûkage ya heta ga uete mo koke no hana
en:
evening shadows--
even the poorly growing
moss has bloomed

jp: .老僧が塵拾ひけり苔の花
ro: rôsô ga chiri hiroi keri koke no hana
en:
the old priest
picks off the dust...
moss blossoms

jp: .うら窓の明り先なりことし竹
ro: ura mado no akarisaki nari kotoshi take
en:
blocking the light
of the back window...
this year's bamboo

jp: .若竹のわかい盛りも直過る
ro: waka take no wakai sakari mo sugu sugiru
en:
the young bamboo's
peak of youth, too
soon passes

jp: .筍の面かく猫の影法師
ro: takenoko no tsura kaku neko no kagebôshi
en:
scratching the face
of a bamboo shoot...
cat's shadow

jp: .筍の番してござる地蔵哉
ro: takenoko no ban shite gozaru jizô kana
en:
kindly guarding
the bamboo shoots...
holy Jizo

jp: .桶の尻並べ立たるわか葉かな
ro: oke no shiri narabe-tatetaru wakaba kana
en:
upside-down buckets
stand in a row...
fresh green leaves

jp: .けし炭の庇にかわくわか葉哉
ro: keshizumi no hisashi ni kawaku wakaba kana
en:
charcoal cinders
dry on the eaves...
fresh new leaves

jp: .隙人やだらつきあきてわか葉陰
ro: himajin ya daratsuki akite wakaba kage
en:
a man of liesure
lazily sprawls...
shadow of new leaves

jp: .塀の猫庇の桶やむら若葉
ro: hei no neko hisashi no oke ya mura wakaba
en:
cat on the fence
bucket on the eaves...
fresh green leaves

jp: .若葉して猫と烏と喧嘩哉
ro: wakaba shite neko to karasu to kenka kana
en:
fresh new leaves--
the cat and the crow
quarrel

jp: .若葉して福々しさよ無縁寺
ro: wakaba shite fukubukushisa yo muenji
en:
the fresh new leaves
happy and well...
Muen Temple

jp: .上人が昼寝つかふや夏木立
ro: shônin ga hirune tsukau ya natsu kodachi
en:
the holy man
grabs a siesta...
grove of summer trees

jp: .むら雨や墓のしきみも夏木立
ro: murasame ya haka no shikimi mo natsu kodachi
en:
rain shower--
the grave's shikimi branches, too
are summer trees

jp: .作りながらわらぢ売なり木下闇
ro: tsukuri nagara waraji uru nari ko shita yami
en:
making a straw sandal
while selling it...
deep tree shade

jp: .卯の花に布子の膝の光哉
ro: u no hana ni nunoko no hiza no hikari kana
en:
the deutzia blossoms
light up
my lap

jp: .卯の花の四角に暮る在所哉
ro: u no hana no yosumi ni kureru zaisho kana
en:
deutzia blossoms
on all four corners...
farmhouse at dusk

jp: .卯の花の四角に暮名主哉
ro: u no hana no yosumi ni kureru nanushi kana
en:
deutzia blossoms
on all four corners...
headman's house at dusk

jp: .卯の花や子供の作る土だんご
ro: u no hana ya kodomo no tsukuru tsuchi dango
en:
deutzia in bloom
the children make
mud-dumplings

jp: .大江戸にまぢりて赤き李哉
ro: ôedo ni majirite akaki sumomo kana
en:
sprinkled into
great Edo...
red plums

jp: .もまれてや江戸の李は赤くなる
ro: momarete ya edo no sumomo wa akaku naru
en:
handled and squeezed
Edo's plums
turn red

jp: .小盥の魚どものいふけさの秋
ro: ko-darai no uo-domo no iu kesa no aki
en:
the little tub's fish
announce...
"It's autumn's first morning!"

jp: .門の月暑がへれば友もへる
ro: kado no tsuki atsusa ga hereba tomo mo heru
en:
moon at the gate--
as the heat dwindles
so do companions

jp: .朝寒に拭ふや石の天窓迄
ro: asa-zamu ni nuguu ya ishi no atama made
en:
in morning's cold
wiping even the head
of the stone

jp: .朝寒や雑巾あてる門の石
ro: asa-zamu ya zôkin ateru kado no ishi
en:
morning cold--
a wipe of the cleaning rag
for the gate's stone

jp: .朝寒や茶ふくで巡る七大寺
ro: asa-zamu ya chafuku de meguru shichidaiji
en:
morning cold--
bloated with tea, visiting
Schichidai Temple

jp: .御地蔵も人をばかすぞ秋の暮
ro: o-jizô mo hito wo bakasu zo aki no kure
en:
even holy Jizo
bewitches people...
autumn dusk

jp: .秋の夜や木を割にさへ小夜ぎぬた
ro: aki no yo ya ki wo waru ni sae sayo-ginuta
en:
autumn evening--
a sound to split trees even
pounding cloth

jp: .秋の夜や乞食村へも祭り客
ro: aki no yo ya kojiki mura e mo matsuri kyaku
en:
autumn evening--
even for beggar-town
festival guests

jp: .おのが田へ夜水を引て天の川
ro: ono ga ta e yo mizu no hiite ama no kawa
en:
haul some night water
to my rice field...
Milky Way!

jp: .かしましき寝ぼけ烏や天の川
ro: kashimashiki neboke karasu ya ama no kawa
en:
the half-asleep crow
raises a ruckus...
Milky Way

jp: .深川や蠣がら山の秋の月
ro: fukugawa ya kakigara yama no aki no tsuki
en:
Fukagawa--
an oyster shell mountain
and autumn's moon

jp: .片里は盆の月夜の日延かな
ro: kata-zato wa bon no tsuki yo no hinobe kana
en:
remote village--
the Bon Festival moon
postponed

jp: .戸しょうじの洗濯したり盆の月
ro: to shôji no sentaku shitari bon no tsuki
en:
the paper door
gets a scrubbing...
Bon Festival moon

jp: .もろこしをあぶり焦すや盆の月
ro: morokoshi wo aburi kogasu ya bon no tsuki
en:
roasting millet
till it's charred...
Bon Festival moon

jp: .翌の夜の月を請合ふ爺かな
ro: asu no yo no tsuki wo ukeau jijii kana
en:
"tomorrow night
the harvest moon!"
old man's promise

jp: .虻もとらぬ蜂をもとらぬ月見哉
ro: abu mo toranu hachi [wo] mo toranu tsukimi kana
en:
not swatting horseflies
not swatting bees...
moon gazing

jp: .在合の山ですますやけふの月
ro: ariai no yama de sumasu ya kyô no tsuki
en:
this here mountain
will have to do...
tonight's moon

jp: .二番小便から直に月見哉
ro: ni ban shôben kara sugu ni tsukimi kana
en:
after a second piss
right away...
moon gazing

jp: .松が枝の上に座どりて月見哉
ro: matsu ga e no ue ni za-dorite tsukimi kana
en:
taking a seat
on the pine's branch...
moon gazing

jp: .松の木のてっぺんにざす月見哉
ro: matsu no ki no teppen ni zasu tsukimi kana
en:
on the pine tree's
tippy-top...
moon gazing

jp: .名月や梅もさくらも帰り花
ro: meigetsu ya ume mo sakura mo kaeri hana
en:
harvest moon--
plum and cherry tree
blossoms return!

jp: .名月や出家士諸商人
ro: meigetsu ya shukke samurai shoakindo
en:
harvest moon-gazing
priests, samurai
merchants

jp: .名月や茶碗に入れる酒の銭
ro: meigetsu ya cha wan ni ireru sake no zeni
en:
harvest moon--
digging in the teacup
for sake money

jp: .名月や八文酒を売あるく
ro: meigetsu ya hachi mon sake wo uri-aruku
en:
harvest moon--
the peddler selling
eight-penny sake

jp: .名月や横に寝る人おがむ人
ro: meigetsu ya yoko ni neru hito ogamu hito
en:
harvest moon--
some are stretched out
some praying

jp: .積薪の一ッ二ッや後の月
ro: tsumu maki no hitotsu futatsu ya nochi no tsuki
en:
firewood piles
one... two...
Ninth Month moon

jp: .朝顔の再び咲や後の月
ro: asagao no futatabi saku ya nochi no tsuki
en:
the morning-glories bloom
a second time!
Ninth Month moon

jp: .月の顔としは十三そこら哉.
ro: tsuki no kao toshi wa jû san sokora kana
en:
the moon's face
just about 13
give or take

jp: .口重の烏飛也秋の雨
ro: kuchiomo no karasu tobu nari aki no ame
en:
tongue-tied
the crow flies along...
autumn rain

jp: .秋風にふいとむせたる峠かな
ro: aki kaze [ni] fui to musetaru tôge kana
en:
in autumn wind
staggering breathlessly...
mountain pass

jp: .角力取が立て呉けり秋の風
ro: sumotori ga tatete kure keri aki no kaze
en:
a sumo wrestler
makes it blow...
autumn wind

jp: .葬礼の見物人や秋の風
ro: tomurai no kembutsunin ya aki no kaze
en:
onlookers
at a funeral...
the autumn wind

jp: .朝やけに染るでもなし露の玉
ro: asayake ni someru demo nashi tsuyu no tama
en:
dawn's glow
hasn't quite yet dyed
the dewdrops

jp: .芋の葉や我作りたる露の玉
ro: imo no ha ya waga tsukuritaru tsuyu no tama
en:
potato leaf--
I make a pearl
of dew

jp: .白露もちんぷんかんのころり哉
ro: shira tsuyu mo chinpunkan no korori kana
en:
even for silver dewdrops
gibberish
rolling down

jp: .白露やどっと流るる山の町
ro: shira tsuyu ya dotto nagaruru yama no machi
en:
with the silver dew
flowing along
mountain town

jp: .葉から葉に転びうつるや秋の露
ro: ha kara ha ni koro[bi] utsuru ya aki no tsuyu
en:
from leaf to leaf
tumbling down...
autumn dew

jp: .人鬼の天窓くだしや露時雨
ro: hito oni no atama kudashi ya tsuyu shigure
en:
the human goblins
bow their heads...
dew dripping down

jp: .一丸メ一升づつや蓮の露
ro: hito marume hito shô tsutsu ya hasu no tsuyu
en:
each round ball
two quarts...
lotus blossom dewdrops

jp: .一丸メいくらが物ぞ蓮の露
ro: hito marume ikura ga mono zo hasu no tsuyu
en:
how much water
in each round ball?
lotus blossom dewdrops

jp: .むだ草は露もむだ置したりけり
ro: muda kusa wa tsuyu mo muda oku shitari keri
en:
in vain grass
dewdrops forming
in vain

jp: .村雨が露のにせ玉作りけり
ro: murasame ga tsuyu no nise tama tsukuri keri
en:
the rain shower left
imitation pearls...
dewdrops

jp: .山の町とっとと露の流れけり
ro: yama no machi totto to tsuyu no nagare keri
en:
the mountain town
with dewdrops everywhere
flowing

jp: .梁上の君子も見やれ草の露
ro: ryôjô no kunshi mo mi yare kusa no tsuyu
en:
you look too
robber! dewdrops
in the grass

jp: .翌も翌も翌も天気ぞ浅間霧
ro: asu mo asu mo asu mo tenki zo asama-giri
en:
tomorrow, tomorrow
and tomorrow's weather...
Mount Asama mist

jp: .灯ろ見の朝からさわぐ都かな
ro: torô mi no asa kara sawagu miyako kana
en:
Bon lantern viewing
from morning on a ruckus...
Kyoto

jp: .いざおどれ我よりましの門雀
ro: iza odore waga yorimashi no kado suzume
en:
dance, my little
dervishes!
sparrows at the gate

jp: .石太郎此世にあらば盆踊
ro: ishitarô kono yo ni araba bon odori
en:
if Ishitaro
were still in this world...
Bon Festival dance

jp: .踊から直に朝草かりにけり
ro: odori kara sugu ni asa kusa kari ni keri
en:
after the dance
right away, cutting
the morning grass

jp: .踊から直に草刈さはぎ哉
ro: odori kara sugu ni kusa karu sawagi kana
en:
after the dance
right away, grass-cutting
clamor

jp: .おわかいぞ若いぞ夫婦星
ro: o-wakai zo yare o-waka[i] zo meoto hoshi
en:
so young
so very young!
husband and wife stars

jp: .神国や天てる星も夫婦連
ro: kami kuni [ya] amateru hoshi mo meoto-zure
en:
Land of Gods--
even among Heaven's stars
husband and wife

jp: .にこにこと御若い顔や夫婦星
ro: niko-niko to o-wakai kao ya meoto hoshi
en:
smiles beaming
on their young faces...
husband and wife stars

jp: .すは山の風のなぐれか尾花吹く
ro: suwa yama no kaze no nagure ka obana fuku
en:
beaten down
by Mount Suwa's wind?
pampas grass

jp: .へし折しすすきのはしも祭り哉
ro: heshi-orishi suzuki no hashi mo matsuri keri
en:
even with broken
pampas-grass chopsticks...
festival meal

jp: .ほすすきもそよそよ神もきげん哉
ro: ho susuki mo soyo-soyo kami mo kigen kana
en:
beards of pampas grass, too
rustle, rustle
divinely

jp: .みさ山の馬にも祝ふすすき哉
ro: misayama no uma ni mo iwau susuki kana
en:
at Misayama
even a horse celebrates...
pampas grass

jp: .御射山やけふ一日のはなすすき
ro: misayama ya kyô ichi nichi no hana susuki
en:
Misayama--
today, all day
blooming pampas grass

jp: .みさ山やこんな在所も女郎花
ro: misayama ya konna zaisho mo ominaeshi
en:
Misayama--
even for a farmhouse
maiden flowers

jp: .みさ山やほ屋もてなしの女郎花
ro: misayama ya hoya motenashi [no] ominaeshi
en:
Misayama--
regaling a hunter's hut
maiden flowers

jp: .みさ山や見ても涼しきすすき箸
ro: misayama ya mite mo suzushiki susuki-bashi
en:
Misayama--
their sight alone cools the air...
pampas grass chopsticks

jp: .八朔や徳りの口の草の花
ro: hassaku ya tokuri no kuchi no kusa no hana
en:
harvest gift--
a bottle stuffed
with wildflowers

jp: .八朔や秤にかける粟一穂
ro: hassaku ya hakiri ni kakaru awa hito ho
en:
harvest gift--
on the scale a beard
of millet

jp: .あさぢふの素人花火に勝れけり
ro: asajiu no shirôto hanabi ni sugure keri
en:
better than
amateur fireworks...
cogan grass

jp: .川舟や花火の夜も花火売
ro: kawa-bune ya hanabi no yoru mo hanabi uri
en:
river boat--
on a night of fireworks
still selling fireworks

jp: .手枕に花火のどうんどうん哉
ro: temakura ni hanabi no dôn dôn kana
en:
an arm for a pillow
fireworks boom!
ka-boom!

jp: .どをんどんどんとしくじり花火哉
ro: dôn don don to shikujiri hanabi kana
en:
boom! boom! ka-boom!
so many duds...
fireworks

jp: .朝寒の祝ひに坊主角力哉
ro: asa-zamu no iwai ni bôzu sumô kana
en:
in morning cold
a temple festival...
priests' sumo match

jp: .乞食の角力にさへも贔屓かな
ro: kojiki no sumô ni sae mo hiiki kana
en:
even for the beggar--
a favorite
wrestler

jp: .月かげや素人角力もひいきもつ
ro: tsukikage ya shiroto sumô mo hiiki motsu
en:
moonlight--
even the sumo amateur
has fans

jp: .女房も見て居りにけり負角力
ro: nyôbô mo mite iri ni keri make-zumô
en:
his wife watched
the match...
defeated wrestler

jp: .板行にして売れけり負角力
ro: hankô ni shite urare keri make-zumô
en:
in a woodblock print
for sale...
defeated wrestler

jp: .松の木に馬を縛って角力哉
ro: matsu no ki ni uma wo shibatte sumô kana
en:
he ties his horse
to the pine...
a sumo match

jp: .芥火にかがしもつひのけぶり哉
ro: akutabi ni kagashi mo tsui no keburi kana
en:
burning rubbish--
a scarecrow too
goes up in smoke

jp: .風形に杖を月夜のかがし哉
ro: kazanari ni tsue wo tsuki yo no kagashi kana
en:
wind-bent in moonlight
the scarecrow leans
on a cane

jp: .去年から立道しなるかがし哉
ro: kyonen kara tachidôshi naru kagashi kana
en:
since last year
still standing...
scarecrow

jp: .国土安穏とのん気にかがし哉
ro: kokudo annon to nonki ni kagashi kana
en:
across the land
calm and happy-go-lucky...
scarecrows

jp: .子供らに開眼されしかがし哉
ro: kodomora ni kaigen sareshi kagashi kana
en:
children perform
the "opening of eyes"...
for the scarecrow

jp: .里犬のさっととがめるかがし哉
ro: sato inu no satto togameru kagashi kana
en:
the village dog
suddenly disapproves...
the scarecrow

jp: .爺おやや仕舞かがしに礼を云
ro: jiji oya ya shimau kagashi ni rei wo iu
en:
packing away the scarecrow
grandpa pays
his respects

jp: .名所の月見てくらすかがし哉
ro: nadokoro no tsuki mite kurasu kagashi kana
en:
in a fine spot
for moon gazing...
scarecrow

jp: .我よりは若しかがしの影法師
ro: ware yori wa wakashi kagashi no kagebôshi
en:
looking younger than me
the scarecrow casts
his shadow

jp: .田の水やさらばさらばと井にもどる
ro: ta no mizu ya saraba saraba to i ni modoru
en:
rice paddy drains--
goodbye! goodbye!
back to the well

jp: .囲炉裏には茶の子並んで小夜砧
ro: irori ni wa cha no ko narande sayo-ginuta
en:
on the hearth
tea cakes in a row...
night cloth-pounding

jp: .京人やわら叩さへ小夜ぎぬた
ro: keijin ya wara tataku sae sayo-ginuta
en:
Kyoto people
even beat their straw!
night cloth-pounding

jp: .晴天の真昼中のきぬた哉
ro: seiten [no] mappiru naka no kinuta kana
en:
a clear blue sky
at high noon...
pounding cloth

jp: .其家やら其隣やら小夜砧
ro: sono ya yara sono tonari yara sayo-ginuta
en:
that house
and the neighbor's house...
pounding cloth at night

jp: .つり棚に茶の子のおどるきぬた哉
ro: tsuri-dana ni cha no ko no odoru kinuta kana
en:
tea cakes jumping
on the hanging shelf...
cloth-pounding

jp: .ねんぶつを申しながらにきぬた哉
ro: nembutsu wo môshi nagara ni kinuta kana
en:
while chanting
praise to Buddha!
pounding cloth

jp: .我家や前もうしろも下手ぎぬた
ro: waga ie ya mae mo ushiro mo heta-ginuta
en:
my house--
in front and in back
a cloth-pounding cacophony

jp: .さをしかはおれをうさんと思ふ哉
ro: saoshika wa ore wo usan to omou kana
en:
young buck--
you think I'm a suspicious
character!

jp: .あきらめて子のない鹿は鳴ぬなり
ro: akiramete ko no nai shika wa nakinu nari
en:
giving up
the childless deer
calls no more for love

jp: .子をもたぬ鹿も寝かねて鳴夜哉
ro: ko wo motanu shika mo ne kanete naku yo kana
en:
the childless deer, too
can't sleep...
cries in the night

jp: .恋風や山の太山の鹿に迄
ro: koi kaze ya yama no miyama no shika ni made
en:
a wind of love
even for the great mountain's
deer!

jp: .しほらしやおく山鹿も色好み
ro: shiorashi ya oku yama shika mo irogonomi
en:
what delicateness!
even for deep-mountain deer
lust

jp: .ぞっとして逃げば鹿も追にけり
ro: zotto shite nigereba shika mo oi ni keri
en:
a shiver--
the deer in flight
now chases me!

jp: .日の本や深山の鹿も色好む
ro: hi no moto ya miyama no shika mo irogonomu
en:
Land of the Rising Sun!
even for deep-mountain deer
lust

jp: .穴に入蛇も三人ぐらし哉
ro: ana ni iru hebi mo sannin-gurashi kana
en:
another snake
into the hole...
three roommates

jp: .親蛇の穴から穴へ這入のは
ro: oya hebi no ana kara ana e hairu no wa
en:
mother snake--
leaving the hole
then back in

jp: .親蛇や烏さらばと穴に入
ro: oya hebi ya karasu saraba to ana ni iru
en:
mother snake--
a farewell to the crow
then down the hole

jp: .此世こそ蛇なれ西の穴に入
ro: kono yo koso hebi nare nishi no ana ni iru
en:
in this world you're a snake--
enter the hole
toward Buddha's West!

jp: .それ也になる仏いたせ穴の蛇
ro: sore nari ni narubutsu itase ana no hebi
en:
just as you are
become Buddha!
snake in your hole

jp: .徳本の御杖の穴や蛇も入
ro: tokuon no o-tsue no ana ya hebi mo iru
en:
a hole made by Tokuon's
holy staff...
a snake enters too

jp: .古蛇やはや西方の穴に入
ro: furu hebi ya haya saihô no ana ni iru
en:
the old snake
toward the Western Paradise
enters his hole

jp: .蛇入なぞこは邪見の人の穴
ro: hebi iru na soko wa jaken no hito no ana
en:
don't go in, snake!
that's a hole
a cruel man made

jp: .蛇も入るや上人様の杖の穴
ro: hebi mo iru ya shônin-sama no tsue no ana
en:
the snake enters, too--
the saint's walking stick's
hole

jp: .蛇ははや穴から見るや欲の娑婆
ro: hebi wa haya ana kara miru ya yoku no shaba
en:
from his hole the snake
glances back...
corrupt world of desire

jp: .蛇は又人嫌ふてや穴に入
ro: hebi wa mata hito kiraute ya ana ni iru
en:
the snake has had it
with humans too...
entering his hole

jp: .又の世は蛇になるなと法の山
ro: mata no yo wa hebi ni naru na to nori no yama
en:
in the next life
don't be a snake!
temple grounds

jp: .みだ頼め蛇もそろそろ穴に入
ro: mida tanome hebi mo soro-soro ana ni iru
en:
trust in Amida Buddha!
snake inching
into its hole

jp: .来年は蝶にでもなれ穴の蛇
ro: rainen wa chô ni demo nare ana no hebi
en:
next year
become a butterfly!
snake in his hole

jp: .一方は猫の喧嘩やむしの声
ro: ippô wa neko no kenka ya mushi no koe
en:
on one side
the cats' quarrel, on the other
insects sing

jp: .寒いとて虫が鳴事始るぞ
ro: samui tote mushi ga nakigoto hajimaru zo
en:
"It's cold!"
the insects' complaining
has begun

jp: .じれ虫が身をゆすぶって鳴にけり
ro: jire mushi ga mi wo yusubutte naki ni keri
en:
an upset insect!
his whole body shakes
as he sings

jp: .虫聞や二番小便から直ぐに
ro: mushi kiku ya ni ban shôben kara sugu ni
en:
listening to the insect chorus
right after
night's second piss

jp: .世が直る直るとむしもをどり哉
ro: yo ga naoru naoru to mushi mo odori kana
en:
"The world is better!
better!"
the insect dances too

jp: .夜鳴虫汝母あり父ありや
ro: yo naku mushi nanji haha ari chichi ari ya
en:
insects chirp in the night--
what of your mothers?
your fathers?

jp: .蝶とんぼ吹とばされつ屁ひり虫
ro: chô tombo fuki-tobasaretsu hehirimushi
en:
butterfly and dragonfly
are blown away...
fart bug

jp: .連立って御盆御盆や赤蜻蛉
ro: tsuredatte o-bon o-bon ya aka tombo
en:
coming along
to the Bon Festival...
red dragonfly

jp: .蜻蛉が鹿のあたまに昼寝哉
ro: tombô ga shika no atama ni hirune kana
en:
the dragonfly
on the deer's head...
a siesta

jp: .蜻蛉や犬の天窓を打ってとぶ
ro: tombo ya inu no atama wo utte tobu
en:
dragonfly--
flying smack into
the dog's head

jp: .軒下に蜻蛉とるやひとり宿
ro: noki shita [ni] tombô toru ya hitori yado
en:
under the eaves
the dragonfly checks in...
alone

jp: .一人宿こばやくとりしとんぼ哉
ro: hitori yado kobayaku torishi tombo kana
en:
quickly checking in
for his lonely stay...
a dragonfly

jp: .虫の屁に吹飛さるるとんぼ哉
ro: mushi no he ni fuki-tobasaruru tombo kana
en:
blown away
by the fart bug...
dragonfly

jp: .したたかに人をけりとぶいなご哉
ro: shitataka ni hito wo keri tobu inago kana
en:
flying into people
kicking them hard...
locusts

jp: .きりぎりす売られ行手で鳴にけり
ro: kirigirisu urare yukute de naki ni keri
en:
katydid--
on his way to being sold
still singing

jp: .きりぎりす夜昼小言ばかりかな
ro: kirigirisu yoru hiru kogoto bakari kana
en:
katydid--
noon and night, nothing
but nagging!

jp: .小便をするぞ退け退けきりぎりす
ro: shôben wo suru zo noke noke kirigirisu
en:
I'm taking a leak
look out! look out!
katydid

jp: .片陰に日向ぼこりや隠居菊
ro: kata kage ni hinata bokori ya inkyo kiku
en:
in a secret place
basking in the sun...
hermit chrysanthemum

jp: .菊の日は過て揃ふた菊の酒
ro: kiku no hi wa sugite sorouta kiku no sake
en:
only after the Chrysanthemum Festival
festival
wine

jp: .汁のみの足に咲けり菊の花
ro: shiru no mi no tashi ni saki keri kiku no hana
en:
they've bloomed
for the soup stock...
chrysanthemums

jp: .草の庵は菊迄杖を力哉
ro: kusa no io wa kiku made tsue wo chikara kana
en:
in my thatched hut
even the chrysanthemum
needs a cane

jp: .念入て尺とる虫や菊の花
ro: nen irete sashi toru mushi ya kiku no hana
en:
carefully measured
by the inchworm...
chrysanthemum

jp: .赤くてもああ朝顔はあさ顔ぞ
ro: akakute mo aa asagao wa asagao zo
en:
though it's red
it's a morning-glory!
morning-glory!

jp: .朝顔を一ぱい浮す茶碗哉
ro: asagao wo ippai ukasu chawan kana
en:
filled with floating
morning-glories...
the teacup

jp: .朝顔の大花小花さはさはし
ro: asagao no ôhana ko hana sawa-sawashi
en:
morning-glories--
big blossoms, little blossoms
rustling

jp: .朝顔の花やさらさらさあらさら
ro: asagao no hana ya sara-sara saara-sara
en:
morning-glories
rustling, rustling
rustling!

jp: .朝顔や瘧のおちし花の顔
ro: asagao ya okori no ochishi hana no kao
en:
faces of morning-glories--
their cold and fever
cured

jp: .朝顔やそろりそろりと世を送り
ro: asagao ya sorori-sorori to yo wo okuri
en:
morning-glories--
rustling and rustling
their lives away

jp: .朝顔や這入口まであはれ咲
ro: asagao ya hairiguchi made aware-zaki
en:
morning-glories--
even in the doorway
damn blooms

jp: .おとなしや白朝顔のつんと咲
ro: otonashi ya shiro asagao no tsunto saku
en:
well-behaved--
the white morning-glory
stuck-up, blooms

jp: .しめやかに浅黄朝顔おとなしや
ro: shimeyaka ni asagi asagao otonashi ya
en:
how quiet
the light blue morning-glory...
such good manners

jp: .猫の子に萩とられてはとられては
ro: neko no ko [ni] hagi tora[re]te wa tora[re]te wa
en:
kitten, the bush clover
grabbing you!
grabbing you!

jp: .国がらや田にも咲するそばの花
ro: kunigara ya ta ni mo saki suru soba no hana
en:
such is my homeland!
blooming in rice fields
buckwheat

jp: .蘭のかや異国のやうに三ケの月
ro: ran no ka ya ikoku no yô ni mika no tsuki
en:
scent of orchids--
like a foreign country
the sickle moon

jp: .一斉にそよぐ畠の稲穂哉
ro: issei ni soyogu hatake no inaho kana
en:
all at once
the field is rustling...
heads of rice

jp: .御祝儀を犬にも負す刈穂哉
ro: go-shûgi wo inu ni mo owasu kariho kana
en:
the dog carries some
to the celebration too...
harvested rice

jp: .老らくもことしたばこのかぶり哉
ro: oiraku mo kotoshi tabako no keburi kana
en:
old man's leisure--
this year's tobacco too
becomes smoke

jp: .小けぶりも若ひ匂ひのたばこ哉
ro: ko keburi mo wakai nioi no tabako kana
en:
just a little smoke--
the tobacco
smells young

jp: .な畑のあいそに立や唐がらし
ro: na-batake no aiso ni tatsu ya tôgarashi
en:
growing politely
in the vegetable patch...
hot peppers

jp: .猫の子のまま事をするすすき哉
ro: neko no ko no mamagoto wo suru susuki kana
en:
the kittens
play house
in the pampas grass

jp: .釣人は這入べからず芦の花
ro: tsurubito wa hairu-bekarazu ashi no hana
en:
don't crawl through
fisherman!
blooming rushes

jp: .綿ちるや小藪小社小溝迄
ro: wata chiru ya ko yabu ko yashiro ko mizo made
en:
cotton fluff scatters--
little thicket, little shrine
little ditch

jp: .大柿のつぶる迄も渋さ哉
ro: ôkaki no tsubureru made mo shibusa kana
en:
big persimmon--
even when it's crushed
it's astringent

jp: .大々渋と柿盗人の笑哉
ro: ôshibu to kaki nusutto no warai kana
en:
"Ooo astringent!"
the persimmon thief's
laughter

jp: .柿の木の弓矢けおとす烏哉
ro: kaki no ki no yumiya keotosu karasu kana
en:
knocked from the persimmon tree
by an arrow...
crow

jp: .それがしも其日暮しぞ花木槿
ro: soregashi mo sono higuarashi zo hana mukige
en:
I too eke out
a living...
rose of Sharon

jp: .馬の沓尻にあてがふふくべ哉
ro: uma no kutsu shiri ni ategau fukube kana
en:
a horseshoe
to steady its butt...
the gourd

jp: .猫又の頭にこっきり木の実哉
ro: nekomata no atama kokkiri kinomi kana
en:
on the old cat's head
clonk!
falling fruit

jp: .団栗とはねつくらする小猫哉
ro: donguri to hanetsukurasuru ko neko kana
en:
prancing about
with the acorn...
kitten

jp: .いがぐりやどさりと犬の枕元
ro: iga-guri ya dosari to inu no makura moto
en:
a chestnut falls
plop! at the dog's
pillow

jp: .今が世に爺打栗と呼れけり
ro: ima ga yo ni jii uchi-guri to yobare keri
en:
in today's world
they're "old man beaters"...
chestnuts

jp: .大栗や我が仲間もいが天窓
ro: ôguri ya ware ga nakama mo iga atama
en:
big chestnuts--
I'm one of you
with my prickly head

jp: .おち栗や仏も笠をめして立
ro: ochi-guri ya hotoke mo kasa wo meshite tatsu
en:
chestnuts dropping--
even the stone Buddha
with umbrella-hat!

jp: .笠のおち栗とられけり後の人
ro: kasa no ochi kuri torare keri ato no hito
en:
chestnuts bounced off
the umbrella-hat gathered...
by the person behind

jp: .爺打った栗と末代言れけり
ro: jii utta kuri to matsudai iware keri
en:
"a chestnut hit
an old man..."
a story told for ages

jp: .ばか猫や逃たいが栗見にもどる
ro: baka neko ya nigeta iga kuri mi ni modoru
en:
fool cat--
eyes returning to where
the chestnut was

jp: .ぱしぱちは栗としらるる雨夜哉
ro: pachi-pachi wa kuri to shiraruru amayo kana
en:
the pitter-patter
of falling chestnuts...
a rainy night

jp: .狼の穴の中より鼠茸
ro: ôkami no ana no naka yori nezumi kinoko
en:
growing from the hole
of the wolf...
mouse mushroom

jp: .天狗茸立けり魔所の入口に
ro: tengudake tachi keri masho no iriguchi ni
en:
Tengu's mushrooms sprout--
the entrance
to a haunted place

jp: .初茸を握りつぶして笑ふ子よ
ro: hatsu take wo nigiri tsubushite warau ko yo
en:
crushing the year's
first mushroom...
the laughing child

jp: .初茸や一ッは吾子が持遊び
ro: hatsu take ya hitotsu wa goko ga mochi-asobi
en:
year's first mushrooms--
my child
plays with one

jp: .極楽が近くなる身の寒さ哉
ro: gokuraku ga chikaku naru mi no samu[sa] kana
en:
drawing nearer
to the Pure Land...
life's cold winter

jp: .寒さにも馴て歩くやしなの道
ro: samu[sa] ni mo narete aruku ya shinano michi
en:
walking along
he's used to the cold...
Shinano road

jp: .渡りたる後で気が付氷哉
ro: wataritaru ato de ki ga tsuku kôri kana
en:
after crossing it
now being careful...
ice

jp: .下戸の立たる蔵もなし年の暮
ro: geko no tatetaru kura mo nashi toshi no kure
en:
no storehouse was ever
built by a non-drinker...
the year ends

jp: .屁もひらず沈香もたかず年の暮
ro: he mo hirazu jinkô mo takazu toshi no kure
en:
no incense
no farts...
the year ends

jp: .座敷から湯に飛び入るや初時雨
ro: zashiki kara yu [ni] tobi-iru ya hatsu shigure
en:
from sitting rooms
into hot tubs...
first winter rain

jp: .門の木に時雨損じて帰りけり
ro: kado no ki ni shigure sonjite kaeri keri
en:
the winter rain
thrashes the gate's tree
again

jp: .門の木に時雨損じて通りけり
ro: kado no ki ni shigure sonjite tôri keri
en:
the winter rain
thrashes the gate's tree
in passing

jp: .しぐるるや芭蕉翁の塚まはり
ro: shigururu ya bashô okina no tsuka mawari
en:
winter rain--
around Basho's grave
falling down

jp: .しぐれ捨てしぐれ捨てけり辻仏
ro: shigure sute shigure sute keri tsuji-botoke
en:
the winter rain
dumps and dumps...
a crossroads Buddha

jp: .度々にばか念入てしぐれ哉
ro: tabi-tabi ni baka nen irete shigure kana
en:
time and again
foolishly persistent...
the winter rain

jp: .一日の祝にさっとしぐれ哉
ro: tsuitachi no iwai ni satto shigure kana
en:
first day of winter
suddenly
a storm

jp: .古郷は小意地の悪い時雨哉
ro: furusato wa ko iji no warui shigure kana
en:
my home village
in an ugly mood...
the winter rain

jp: .南北東西よりしぐれ哉
ro: minami kita higashi nishi yori shigure kana
en:
from south, north
east, west...
winter storms

jp: .み仏の身に引受て時雨哉
ro: mi-botoke no mi ni hiki-ukete shigure kana
en:
Buddha's body
accepts it...
winter rain

jp: .川向ふ隣と云もえちご山
ro: kawa mukau tonari to iu mo echigo yama
en:
facing the river--
next door, it seems
Echigo mountains

jp: .木枯しにさて結構な月夜哉
ro: kogarashi ni sate kekkôna tsuki yo kana
en:
winter wind--
well at least it's a nice
moonlit night

jp: .木がらしや桟を這ふ琵琶法師
ro: kogarashi ya kakehashi wo hau biwa hôshi
en:
winter wind--
crawling across the hanging bridge
minstrel priest

jp: .初雪と供に降たる布子哉
ro: hatsu yuki to tomo ni furitaru nunoko kana
en:
first snow--
and coming down with it
the padded clothes

jp: .初雪や一二三四五六人
ro: hatsu yuki ya ichi ni san yon go roku hito
en:
first snowfall
one, two, three, four
five, six people

jp: .初雪やおれが前には布子降
ro: hatsu yuki ya ore ga mae ni wa nunoko furu
en:
first snow--
I see the padded clothes
coming down

jp: .はつ雪や雪駄ならして善光寺
ro: hatsu yuki ya setta narashite zenkôji
en:
in first snowfall
snow clogs crunching...
Zenko Temple

jp: .小便所の油火にちる粉雪哉
ro: shôbenjo no abura-bi ni chiru kona yuki kana
en:
flitting to the oil lamp
of the pissing place...
powdery snow

jp: .雪ちらちら一天に雲なかりけり
ro: yuki chira-chira itten ni kumo nakari keri
en:
snowflakes flitting--
in the whole sky
not a cloud

jp: .東西南北より吹雪哉
ro: higashi nishi minami kita yori fubuki kana
en:
from east, west
south, north...
the blizzard

jp: .あながちに雪にかまわぬ霰哉
ro: anagachi ni yuki ni kamawanu arare kana
en:
messing up the snow
like always...
hailstones

jp: .三絃のばちで掃きやる霰哉
ro: samisen no bachi de haki yaru arare kana
en:
with the samisen's
plectrum sweeping up...
hailstones

jp: .たまれ霰たんまれ霰手にたまれ
ro: tamare arare tanmare arare te ni tamare
en:
collect hailstones!
hailstones!
in your hand

jp: .灯蓋に霰のたまる夜店哉
ro: hiohoi ni arare no tamaru yomise kana
en:
on the lamp's cover
hailstones piling up...
night stall

jp: .さぼてんは大合点か今朝の霜
ro: saboten wa ôgatten ka kesa no shimo
en:
does the cactus
grasp the great truth?
morning frost

jp: .霜をくや此夜はたして子を捨る
ro: shimo oku ya kono yo hatashite ko wo suteru
en:
frost forming--
such a night
to abandon a child!

jp: .夜の霜しんしん耳は蝉の声
ro: yoru no shimo shin-shin mimi wa semi no koe
en:
night frost--
the ring-ringing in my ears
like cicadas

jp: .小猿ども神の御留主を狂ふ哉
ro: ko-zaru domo kami no o-rusu wo kuruu kana
en:
little monkey--
with the gods all gone
he's running amuck

jp: .住吉や御留主の庭も掃除番
ro: sumiyoshi ya o-rusu no niwa mo sôjiban
en:
the god has left
Sumiyoshi's garden...
still they rake it

jp: .なら山の神の御流主に鹿の恋
ro: nara yama no kami no o-rusu ni shika no koi
en:
Mount Nara's gods
gone for the month...
the deer make love

jp: .犬に迄みやげをくばる十夜哉
ro: inu ni made miyage wo kubaru jûya kana
en:
even the dog
gets a souvenir...
winter prayers

jp: .大犬がみやげをねだる十夜哉
ro: ôinu ga miyage wo nedaru jûya kana
en:
the big dog
begs for a souvenir...
winter prayers

jp: .霜花もばせう祭のもやう哉
ro: shimo hana mo bashô matsuri no moyô kana
en:
frost-covered blossom
perfect
for Basho's day

jp: .芭蕉忌と申すも歩きながら哉
ro: bashôki to mô[su] mo aruki nagara kana
en:
"It's Basho's Death-Day!"
he says
while walking

jp: .芭蕉忌や垣に雀も一並び
ro: bashôki ya kaki ni suzume mo hito narabi
en:
Basho's Death-Day--
the fence's sparrows too
form a line

jp: .芭蕉忌や鳩も雀も客めかす
ro: bashôki ya hato to suzume mo kyaku mekasu
en:
Basho's Death-Day--
pigeons and sparrows
dressed for company

jp: .うら町や貧乏徳りの夷講
ro: ura machi ya bimbô tokuri no ebisu kô
en:
back alley--
a poor sake bottle
for the God of Wealth

jp: .煤はきやねらひすまして来る行脚
ro: susu haki ya nerai sumashite kuru angya
en:
sweeping soot
with careful aim...
at the pilgrim

jp: .隅の蜘案じな煤はとらぬぞよ
ro: sumi no kumo anjina susu wa toranu zo yo
en:
corner spider
rest easy, my soot-broom
is idle

jp: .三弦でせきぞろするや今浮世
ro: sangen de sekizoro suru ya ima ukiyo
en:
with a samisen
the Twelfth Month singers...
our Floating World!

jp: .草の庵年取餅を買にけり
ro: kusa no io toshitori mochi wo kai ni keri
en:
thatched hut--
the year's last rice cakes
are bought

jp: .春待や子のない家ももちをつく
ro: haru matsu ya ko no nai ie mo mochi wo tsuku
en:
waiting for spring
in a house without children
pounding rice cakes

jp: .餅つきをせがむ子もなし然りながら
ro: mochi tsuki wo segamu ko mo nashi sari nagara
en:
pounding rice cakes
though there's no child
to beg for them

jp: .我餅や只一升も唄でつく
ro: waga mochi ya tada isshô mo uta de tsuku
en:
my rice cakes--
just four quarts' worth
but pounded with a song

jp: .草の家も夜はものものし年忘
ro: kusa no ya mo yo wa monomonoshi toshiwasure
en:
in my thatched hut
a gala night...
drinking away the year

jp: .床の間へ安置しにけり歳暮酒
ro: toko-no-ma e anchi shi ni keri seibo sake
en:
enshrined in the alcove--
my year's end gift
of sake

jp: .宵過の一村歩く歳暮哉
ro: yoi sugi no hito mura aruku seibo kana
en:
the whole evening
walking through the village...
end-of-year gifts

jp: .誂へてやるや扇の厄おとし
ro: atsuraete yaru ya ôgi no yaku otoshi
en:
by special request
my paper fan
is exorcised

jp: .御庭や松迄雪の厄おとし
ro: on-niwa ya matsu made yuki no yaku otoshi
en:
shrine garden--
even pines are exorcised
of their snow

jp: .狼を一切提げし紙衣哉
ro: ôkami wo hito kire sageshi kamiko kana
en:
the wolf makes off
with a piece of it...
paper robe

jp: .皺足と同じ色なる紙衣哉
ro: shiwa ashi to onaji iro naru kamiko kana
en:
now the same color
as my wrinkled feet...
paper robe

jp: .小頭巾や其身そのまま貧乏神
ro: ko zukin ya sono mi sono mama bimbô-gami
en:
with a little skullcap
not putting on airs...
god of the poor

jp: .桟や凡人わざに雪車を引
ro: kakehashi ya bonnin waza ni sori wo hiku
en:
hanging bridge--
mere mortals just drag
their snow sleds

jp: .そり引や屋根から投るとどけ状
ro: sori hiku ya yane kara nageru todokejô
en:
pulling a snow sled
from the roof he tosses
a letter

jp: .寺道や老母を乗てそりを引
ro: tera michi ya rôbo wo nosete sori wo hiku
en:
temple road--
his aged mother rides
the snow sled

jp: .門先や雪降とはき降とはき
ro: kado-zaki ya yuki furu to haki furu to haki
en:
front gate--
snow falls, is swept
falls, is swept

jp: .門先や童の作る雪の山
ro: kado-zaki ya warabe no tsukuru yuki no yama
en:
front gate--
a child is building
Snow Mountain

jp: .雪掃や地蔵菩薩のつもり迄
ro: yuki haku ya jizô bosatsu no tsumori made
en:
sweeping snow--
even off the head
of holy Jizo

jp: .母親を霜よけにして寝た子哉
ro: haha oya wo shimoyoke ni shite neta ko kana
en:
Mother
is the frost-guard...
sleeping child

jp: .とうふ屋と酒屋の間を冬篭
ro: tôfu ya to sakaya no ai wo fuyugomori
en:
between tofu shop
and the tavern...
my winter seclusion

jp: .冬篭あく物ぐいのつのりけり
ro: fuyugomori akumono-gui no tsunori keri
en:
winter seclusion--
on a foul food eating
binge

jp: .冬篭る蛇の隣や鼠穴
ro: fuyugomoru hebi no tonari ya nezumi ana
en:
next door to the
hibernating snake...
a mouse's hole

jp: .煩悩の犬もつきそふ冬篭
ro: bonnô no inu mo tsukisô fuyugomori
en:
my sinful dog
at my side...
winter seclusion

jp: .居仏や炬燵で叱る立仏
ro: i-botoke ya kotatsu de shikaru tachi-botoke
en:
sitting Buddha nags
at the brazier...
standing Buddha

jp: .同じ世やこたつ仏に立ぼとけ
ro: onaji yo ya kotatsu hotoke ni tachi-botoke
en:
same world--
a Buddha at the brazier
a Buddha standing

jp: .炭の火に峰の松風通ひけり
ro: sumi no hi ni mine no matsukaze kayoi keri
en:
the mountain's pine wind
reaches
my charcoal fire

jp: .あつものをものともせぬよ薬喰
ro: atsumono wo monotomosenu yo kusuri kuu
en:
having no faith
in broth...
taking medicine

jp: .納豆をわらの上から貰ひけり
ro: nattô wo wara no ue kara morai keri
en:
getting my natto
from atop its bed
of straw

jp: .わらづとにしてもけぶれる納豆哉
ro: warazuto ni shite [mo] kebureru natto kana
en:
in its straw wrapper
my smoldering
natto

jp: .江戸店や初そばがきに袴客
ro: edo mise ya hatsu sobagaki ni hakama kyoku
en:
Edo shop--
for the soba porridge
customers in trousers

jp: .草のとや初そばがきをねだる客
ro: kusa no to ya hatsu sobagaki wo nedaru kyaku
en:
rustic hut--
"Come and get
your soba porridge!"

jp: .人鬼の里にもどるやぬくめ鳥
ro: hito oni no sato ni modoru ya nukume-dori
en:
the hawk returns it
to the goblin village...
nest-warming bird

jp: .木兎の寝てくらしても一期哉
ro: mimizuku no nete kurashite mo ichi go kana
en:
though sleeping
for the scops owl
it's a life

jp: .みそさざい西へ鼠は東へ
ro: misosazai nishi e nezumi wa hingashi e
en:
the wren goes west
the mouse
east

jp: .冬枯のほまちざかりや菊の花
ro: fuyugare no homachi-zakari ya kiku no hana
en:
the withered side-field
in full bloom...
chrysanthemums

jp: .霜がれや東海道の這入口
ro: shimogare ya tôkaidô no hairiguchi
en:
frost-killed grass--
the Eastern Sea Road's
front door

jp: .霜がれて猫なで声の烏哉
ro: shimogarete nekonadegoe no karasu kana
en:
frost kills the grass
the coaxing voice
of a crow

jp: .霜がれや鍋の炭かく小傾城
ro: shimogare ya nabe no sumi kaku ko keisei
en:
frost-killed grass--
the little beauty
scrapes soot from a kettle

jp: .悪い夢のみ当りけり鳴く烏
ro: warui yume nomi atari keri naku karasu
en:
just bad dreams
are my fate...
a crow caws

jp: .年立や雨おちの石凹む迄
ro: toshi tatsu ya ameochi no ishi hekomu made
en:
a new year--
until the rain-catching stone
dents

jp: .年立やもとの愚が又愚にかへる
ro: toshi tatsu ya moto no gu ga mata gu ni kaeru
en:
a new year--
the same nonsense
piled on nonsense

jp: .後の々は正月ぞともいはぬ也
ro: nochi-nochi wa shôgatsu zo to mo iwanu nari
en:
in a few days
no one talks about it...
New Year's

jp: .正月も二ッは人のあきる也
ro: shôgatsu mo futatsu wa hito no akiru nari
en:
the second "New Year" comes--
people already
sick of it

jp: .二ッあれば又三ッほしやお正月
ro: futatsu areba mata mitsu hoshi ya o-shôgatsu
en:
the second one comes
already longing for the third...
"New Year's"

jp: .二つでもつかひではなしお正月
ro: futatsu demo tsukai dewa nashi o-shôgatsu
en:
the second one
is redundant...
New Year's celebrations

jp: .二つでも欲には足らずお正月
ro: futatsu demo yoku ni wa tarazu o-shôgatsu
en:
the second one
doesn't satisfy their greed...
New Year's celebrations

jp: .先以って別条はなしけさの春
ro: mazu motte betsujô wa nashi kesa no haru
en:
at first blush
not a thing wrong with it...
spring's first dawn

jp: .拙者儀も異議なく候君が春
ro: sesshagi mo igi naku sôrô kimi ga haru
en:
even I
have no objection
"Happy New Year!"

jp: .引窓の一度にあくや江戸の春
ro: hikimado no ichi do ni aku ya edo no haru
en:
all the windows
slid wide open...
Edo's spring

jp: .家根の窓一度に引や江戸の春
ro: yane no mado ichi do ni hiku ya edo no haru
en:
all the skylights
open wide...
Edo's spring

jp: .鶯のぐな鳥さへも窓の春
ro: uguisu no gu na tori sae mo mado no haru
en:
there's even a foolish
nightingale...
spring window

jp: .一面にろくな春也門の雪
ro: ichimen ni rokuna haru nari kado no yuki
en:
everywhere I look
a decent spring...
snow at my gate

jp: .大雪のどこがどこ迄ろくな春
ro: ôyuki no do[ko] ga doko made rokuna haru
en:
how far across
this deep snow?
for a decent spring

jp: .ろくな春立にけらしな門の雪
ro: rokuna [haru] tachi ni kerashi na kado no yuki
en:
a decent spring
has arrived, perhaps...
snow at my gate

jp: .さればこそろくな春なれ門の雪
ro: sareba koso rokuna haru nare kado no yuki
en:
do your best, Spring
make a decent effort...
snow at the gate

jp: .まんろくの春こそ来れ門の雪
ro: manroku no haru koso kitare kado no yuki
en:
just make it
a proper spring...
snow at my gate

jp: .まん六の春と成りけり門の雪
ro: manroku no haru to nari keri kado no yuki
en:
some "proper spring"
this is!
snow at the gate

jp: .ろくな春とはなりけり門の雪
ro: rokuna haru to wa nari keri kado no yuki
en:
making it
a decent spring...
snow at my gate

jp: .新桶は同じ水でもわかわかし
ro: ara oke wa onaji mizu demo wakawakashi
en:
in a new bucket
the same water...
young and fresh!

jp: .一桶をわか水わか湯わか茶哉
ro: hito oke wo wakamizu waka yu waka cha kana
en:
from one bucket
the year's first cold water
first hot water, first tea

jp: .すすけ紙まま子の凧としられけり
ro: susuke kami mamako no tako to shirare keri
en:
with sooty paper
the stepchild's kite
easy to spot

jp: .凧の糸引とらまへて寝る子哉
ro: tako no ito hikitoramaete neru ko kana
en:
clinging to the kite's
string...
the sleeping child

jp: .凧の尾を咥て引や鬼瓦
ro: tako no o wo kuwaete hiku ya onigawara
en:
catching the kite's tail
with his mouth...
gargoyle

jp: .日の暮に凧の揃ふや町の空
ro: hi no kure ni tako no sorou ya machi no sora
en:
sunset--
an assembly of kites
in the sky over the town

jp: .あそこらがえどの空かよ凧
ro: asokora ga edo no sora ka yo ikanobori
en:
over yonder is that
Edo's sky?
a kite

jp: .転んでも目出度いふ也わかなつみ
ro: koronde mo medeta iu nari wakana tsumi
en:
even while falling down
"Happy New Year!"
picking herbs

jp: .爺が家のぐるりもけふはわかな哉
ro: jiji ga ya no gururi mo kyô wa wakana kana
en:
the old man's house
is surrounded...
herb pickers

jp: .畠の門錠の明けりわかなつみ
ro: hata no kado jô no aki keri wakana tsumi
en:
the garden's gate
left unlocked...
picking herbs

jp: .髭どのに叱られにけりわかなつみ
ro: hige dono ni shikarare ni keri wakana tsumi
en:
Mr. Long-Beard
gives them a scolding...
herb pickers

jp: .脇差の柄にかけたるわかな哉
ro: wakizashi no tsuka ni kaketaru wakana kana
en:
from the short sword's
hilt hanging...
herbs

jp: .童に刀持たせてわかなつみ
ro: warabe ni katana motasete wakana tsumi
en:
letting the child
hold his sword...
picking herbs

jp: .歩行よい程に風吹く日永哉
ro: aruki yoi hodo ni kaze fuku hi naga kana
en:
good for walking
wind blows
all the long day

jp: .永き日や風の寒もよい位
ro: nagaki hi ya kaze no samusa mo yoi kurai
en:
this long day
with this cold breeze
almost...not bad

jp: .永き日やたばこ法度の小金原
ro: nagaki hi ya tabako hatto no kogane hara
en:
a long day--
no smoking allowed
in Kogane Plain

jp: .のらくらや勿体なくも日の長き
ro: norakura ya mottainaku mo hi no nagaki
en:
idleness--
the day is so wastefully
long!

jp: .淡雪にまぶれてさはぐがきら哉
ro: awayuki ni maburete sawagu gakira kana
en:
dusted with snow
how they clamor!
the little brats

jp: .市人の大肌ぬぐや春の雪
ro: ichibito no ôhadanugu ya haru no yuki
en:
the market workers
bare-chested...
spring snow falling

jp: .雷の光る中より春の雪
ro: kaminari no hikaru naka yori haru no yuki
en:
from deep
in the lightning's flash...
spring snow falling

jp: .草山のこやしになるや春の雪
ro: kusa yama no koyashi ni naru ya haru no yuki
en:
turning the haystack
to compost...
spring snow

jp: .春の雪遊がてらに降りにけり
ro: haru no yuki asobi-gatera ni furi ni keri
en:
spring snow--
while it carouses
it falls

jp: .安房霜いつが仕廻ぞ仕廻ぞよ
ro: ahô shimo itsu ga shimai zo shimai zo yo
en:
oh foolish frost
when will you be gone?
be gone!

jp: .是きりと見へてどっさり春の霜
ro: korekiri to miete dossari haru no shimo
en:
the last of it--
a load of spring
frost

jp: .山里や毎日日日わかれじも
ro: yama-zato ya mainichi hi nichi wakare-jimo
en:
mountain village--
every day, day after day
the last frost

jp: .片方は雪の降也春の雨
ro: kata-kata wa yuki no furi nari haru no ame
en:
on one side
snow falling, the other
spring rain!

jp: .出た人を梓に寄る春の雨
ro: deta hito wo azusa ni yoseru haru no ame
en:
everyone outside
under the umbrella-tree...
spring rain

jp: .春風に肩衣かけて御供かな
ro: harukaze ni kataginu kakete o-tomo kana
en:
in spring breeze
his stole billowing...
a monk comes too

jp: .春風に猿もおや子の湯治哉
ro: haru kaze ni saru mo oyako no tôji kana
en:
spring breeze--
monkey families, too
take healing baths

jp: .春風に吹出されたる道者かな
ro: harukaze ni fuki-dasaretaru dôja kana
en:
blown forth
by the spring breeze...
pilgrims

jp: .春風の女見に出る女かな
ro: haru kaze no onna mi ni deru onna kana
en:
in the spring breeze
they're out to watch the women...
women!

jp: .春風や越後下りの本願寺
ro: harukaze ya echigo kudari no honganji
en:
spring breeze--
going down to Echigo's
Hongan Temple

jp: .春風や肩衣かけて長の供
ro: harukaze ya kataginu kakete osa no tomo
en:
spring breeze--
a monk in a stole accompanies
the village elder

jp: .夕東風に吹れ下るや女坂
ro: yû kochi ni fukare oriru ya onnazaka
en:
blown downhill
by evening's east wind...
gentle slope

jp: .夕東風や埒にもたする犬のあご
ro: kuchi kaze ya rachi ni motasuru inu no ago
en:
east wind--
the dog rests his chin
on the stake

jp: .川霧の手伝ふ朧月夜かな
ro: kawa-giri no tetsudau oboro tsuki yo kana
en:
the river's mist
helps out the haze...
moonlit night

jp: .初虹もわかば盛りやしなの山
ro: hatsu niji mo wakaba sakari ya shinano yama
en:
first rainbow
new leaves in their glory!
Shinano mountain

jp: .春もまた雪雷やしなの山
ro: haru mo mata yuki kaminari ya shinano yama
en:
even in spring
a snowstorm's thunder...
Shinano mountain

jp: .傘の雫ながらにかすみかな
ro: karakasa no shizuku nagara ni kasumi kana
en:
with the dripping
of paper umbrellas...
spring mist

jp: .傘の雫もかすむ都哉
ro: karakasa no shizuku mo kasumu miyako kana
en:
paper umbrellas
dripping...
misty Kyoto

jp: .誰それとしれてかすむや門の原
ro: taresore to shirete kasumu ya kado no hara
en:
there's So-and-so
in the mist...
field by the gate

jp: .盗人のかすんでげけら笑ひかな
ro: nusubito no kasunde gekera warai kana
en:
in thick spring mist
the burglar
laughing

jp: .古郷やあれ霞あれ雪が降る
ro: furusato ya are kasumu are yuki ga furu
en:
my home village--
look! spring mist
look! falling snow

jp: .古郷や我を見る也うすがすみ
ro: furusato wa ware wo miru nari usu-gasumi
en:
at my village
they watch me...
a thin spring mist

jp: .法談の手つきもかすむ御堂かな
ro: hôdan no tetsuki mo kasumu midô kana
en:
the preacher's
hand gestures too...
lost in temple mist

jp: .真直にかすみ給ふや善光寺
ro: massugu ni kasumi tamau ya zenkôji
en:
the mist forms
a straight line...
Zenko Temple

jp: .我を見る姿も見へてうすがすみ
ro: ware wo miru sugata mo miete usu-gasumi
en:
that shape's watching me
watching him...
thin mist

jp: .陽炎の立や垣根の茶ん袋
ro: kagerô no tatsu ya kakine no chan-bukuro
en:
heat shimmers rise--
on the fence
a pouch of tea

jp: .凍どけの盛りに果し談義哉
ro: ite-doke no sakari ni hateshi dangi kana
en:
at the peak
of the ice's melting it finishes...
sermon

jp: .凍解や山の在家の昼談義
ro: ite-doke ya yama no zaike no hiru dangi
en:
ice melting--
the mountain holy man's
noon sermon

jp: .梅の木の連に残るや門の雪
ro: ume no ki no tsure ni nokoru [ya] kado no yuki
en:
keeping company
with the plum tree--
the gate's last snow

jp: .嫌れた雪も一度に消へにけり
ro: kirawareta yuki mo ichi do ni kie ni keri
en:
the snow I hated
all at once
has melted away

jp: .小便の穴だらけ也残り雪
ro: shôben no ana darake nari nokori yuki
en:
riddled with piddle
the last
snow pile

jp: .菜畠やたばこ吹く間の雪げ川
ro: na-batake ya tabako fuku ma no yukige kawa
en:
farm field--
from the tobacco break
a snow-melting river

jp: .のら猫の爪とぐ程や残る雪
ro: nora neko no tsume togu hodo ya nokoru yuki
en:
the stray cat
sharpens his nails...
last snow pile

jp: .みだ堂にすがりて雪の残りけり
ro: mida dô ni sugarite yuki no nokori keri
en:
on Amida Buddha's
temple clinging...
leftover snow

jp: .寝ころぶや手まり程でも春の山
ro: ne-korobu ya temari hodo demo haru no yama
en:
lying down
they look like handballs...
spring mountains

jp: .雪国や雪ちりながら春の山
ro: yukiguni ya yuki chiri nagara haru no yama
en:
snow country--
snow flits down
on spring mountains

jp: .ああ寒いあらあら寒いひがん哉
ro: aa samui ara-ara samui higan kana
en:
damn it's cold
it's damn cold!
spring equinox

jp: .小筵にのさのさ彼岸虱かな
ro: samushiro ni nosa-nosa higan shirami kana
en:
on the straw mat
at spring's equinox
shameless lice

jp: .野原にも並ぶ乞食のひがん哉
ro: nohara ni mo narabu kojiki no higan kana
en:
even in a field
a line of beggars...
spring equinox

jp: .門雀なくやいつ迄出代ると
ro: kado suzume naku ya itsu made degawaru to
en:
gate's sparrow singing--
until when
a migrating servant?

jp: .出代ってなりし白髪やことし又
ro: degawatte narishi shiraga ya kotoshi mata
en:
the servant's hair
made white by migrating...
this year too

jp: .出代や江戸をも見ずにさらば笠
ro: degawari ya edo wo mo mizu ni saraba-gasa
en:
the migrating servants
never really saw Edo...
umbrella-hats wave farewell

jp: .出代や江戸の見物もしなの笠
ro: degawari ya edo no kembutsu mo shinano-gasa
en:
migrating servants--
in Edo, too
Shinano's umbrella-hats

jp: .出代や両方ともに空涙
ro: degawari ya ryôhô tomo ni sora namida
en:
migrating servants--
both of them shed
crocodile tears

jp: .としよりもあれ出代るぞことし又
ro: toshiyori [mo] are degawaru zo kotoshi mata
en:
old men
among the migrating servants...
this year too

jp: .鳩鳴や爺いつ迄出代ると
ro: hato naku ya jijii itsu made degawaru to
en:
the pigeon coos
"Old man, how much longer
a migrating servant?"

jp: .居並んで達磨も雛の仲間哉
ro: inarande daruma mo hina no nakama kana
en:
lined up too
among the dolls...
Dharma

jp: .雛達に咄しかける子ども哉
ro: hina-dachi ni hanashi shikakeru kodomo kana
en:
giving her dolls
a good talking-to...
the child

jp: .人形の口へつけるや草の餅
ro: ningyô no kuchi e tsukeru ya kusa no mochi
en:
she offers a piece
to her doll...
herb cake

jp: .むさしのの草をつむとてはれ着哉
ro: musashi no no kusa wo tsumu tote haregi kana
en:
picking herbs
in Musashi Plain, dressed
to the nines

jp: .ぬり笠へばらりばらりと扱き茶哉
ro: nurigasa e barari-barari to koki cha kana
en:
fluttering onto
the lacquered umbrella-hat...
tea leaves

jp: .婆どのの目がねをかけて茶つみ哉
ro: baba dono no megane wo kakete cha tsumi kana
en:
granny puts on
her spectacles...
tea picking

jp: .ざくざくと雪切交る山田哉
ro: zaku-zaku to yuki kirimazaru yamada kana
en:
crunch! crunch!
a mountain rice field
mixed with snow

jp: .雪ともに引くり返す山田かな
ro: yuki tomo ni hikurikaesu yamada kana
en:
plowing as much snow
as earth...
mountain rice field

jp: .大猫が恋草臥の鼾かな
ro: ôneko ga koi kutabire no ibiki kana
en:
the big cat
worn out from lovemaking
snores

jp: .大猫や呼出しに来て作り声
ro: ôneko ya yobi-dashi ni kite tsukuri-goe
en:
the big cat
comes yowling for love
falsetto

jp: .恋猫の鳴かぬ顔してもどりけり
ro: koi neko no nakanu kao shite modori keri
en:
the lover cat
with a poker face
comes home

jp: .恋猫や互に天窓はりながら
ro: koi neko ya tagai ni atama hari nagara
en:
the cats are courting
bumping
heads

jp: .恋猫や竪横むらを鳴歩行
ro: koi neko ya tate yoko mura wo naki-aruku
en:
the lover cat
crisscrosses the village
yowling

jp: .さし足やぬき足や猫も忍ぶ恋
ro: sashiashi ya nukiashi ya neko mo shinobu koi
en:
sly steps, tiptoe--
the cat, too
a secret Romeo

jp: .四五尺の雪かき分て猫の恋
ro: shi go shaku no yukikaki wakete neko no koi
en:
through five feet of snow
plowing his way...
lover cat

jp: .不精猫きき耳立て又眠る
ro: bushô neko kikimimi tatete mata nemuru
en:
lazy cat--
he cocks his ears
then back to sleep

jp: .山猫も作り声して忍びけり
ro: yama neko mo tsukuri-goe shite shinobi keri
en:
the wild cat too
yowls falsetto...
a sneaky lover

jp: .親雀子を返せとや猫を追ふ
ro: oya suzume ko wo kaese to ya neko wo ou
en:
"Give back my child!"
mother sparrow chases
the cat

jp: .鶯の気張て鳴くやたびら雪
ro: uguisu no ki harite naku ya tabira yuki
en:
the nightingale sings
tensely...
flitting snowflakes

jp: .鶯の高ぶり顔はせざりけり
ro: uguisu no takaburi kao wa sezari keri
en:
nightingale--
his face doesn't look
stuck up

jp: .鶯の名代になく雀かな
ro: uguisu no myôdai ni naku suzume kana
en:
a substitute singer
for the nightingale...
sparrow

jp: .鶯も素通りせぬや窓の前
ro: uguisu mo sudôri senu ya mado no mae
en:
hey nightingale
don't pass without stopping!
my window

jp: .鶯やざぶざぶ雨を浴びて鳴く
ro: uguisu ya zabu-zabu ame wo abite naku
en:
the nightingale
splish-splash, sings
in the shower

jp: .鶯や少し勿体つけてから
ro: uguisu ya sukoshi mottai tsukete kara
en:
the nightingale sings
after putting on airs
a bit

jp: .大仏の鼻から出たる乙鳥哉
ro: daibutsu no hana kara detaru tsubame kana
en:
from the great bronze
Buddha's nose...
a swallow!

jp: .田を打によしといふ日や来る乙鳥
ro: ta wo utsu ni yoshi to iu hi ya kuru tsubame
en:
a good day
for plowing the rice field...
swallows return!

jp: .乙鳥来る日を吉日の味そ煮哉
ro: tsubame kuru hi wo kichi nichi no misoni kana
en:
to honor the swallows arriving
I boil my lucky day
bean-paste

jp: .どれもどれもどれも口まめ乙鳥哉
ro: doremo doremo doremo kuchimame tsubame kana
en:
each one
has plenty to say...
swallows

jp: .おりおりに子を見廻っては雲雀哉
ro: ori-ori ni ko wo mi-mawatte wa hibari kana
en:
circling now and then
to eye the children...
skylark

jp: .来よ雲雀子のいる藪が今もゆる
ro: ko yo hibari ko no iru yabu ga ima moyuru
en:
come, skylark!
your children's thicket
is on fire!

jp: .漣や雲雀の際の釣小舟
ro: sazanami ya hibari no kiwa no tsuri kobune
en:
ripples on water--
beside the larks
a little fishing boat

jp: .吹れ行く舟や雲雀のすれ違ひ
ro: fukare yuku fune ya hibari no surechigai
en:
a wind-blown boat
a skylark
crossing paths

jp: .湖におちぬ自慢や夕雲雀
ro: mizuumi ni ochinu jiman ya yû hibari
en:
"I won't fall
in the lake!"
brags the evening lark

jp: .山猫のあっけとられし雲雀哉
ro: yama neko no akke torareshi hibari kana
en:
the wild cat
looks astonished...
a skylark

jp: .夕雉の寝にもどるとや大声に
ro: yû kiji no ne ni modoru to ya ôgoe ni
en:
the evening pheasant
back to sleep
with a great cry

jp: .大組の後やだまって帰る雁
ro: ôgumi no ato ya damatte kaeru kari
en:
after the big flock
silence...
geese flying north

jp: .此国のものに成る気か行ぬ雁
ro: kono kuni no mono ni naru ki ka ikanu kari
en:
are you planning
to stay in this province?
goose

jp: .なくな雁とても一度は別れねば
ro: naku [na] kari tote mo ichi do wa wakareneba
en:
don't cry, geese!
in the end our parting
is inevitable

jp: .何事ぞ此大雨に帰る雁
ro: nanigoto zo kono ôame ni kaeru kari
en:
what a thing!
in this deluge
the geese depart

jp: .満月の図を抜しとや帰る雁
ro: mangetsu no zu wo nukeshi to ya kaeru kari
en:
straight out of a full moon
painting...
the geese depart

jp: .雪の降る拍子に雁の帰りけり
ro: yuki no furu hyôshi ni kari no kaeri keri
en:
to the rhythm
of the falling snow
the geese depart

jp: .行雁の下るや恋の軽井沢
ro: yuku kari no oriru ya koi no karuizawa
en:
traveling geese
go down to make love...
the town of Karuizawa

jp: .雨降と槍が降とも鳴かわづ
ro: ame furu to yari ga furu to mo naku kawazu
en:
whether rain falls
or the sky
frogs keep croaking

jp: .入相の尻馬にのる蛙哉
ro: iriai no shiriuma ni noru kawazu kana
en:
blindly following
the setting sun...
a frog

jp: .かり橋にそりの合ふてや鳴く蛙
ro: karibashi ni sori no aute ya naku kawazu
en:
on a makeshift bridge
we make friends...
croaking frog

jp: .散花をはったとにらむ蛙哉
ro: chiru hana wo hatta to niramu kawazu kana
en:
glaring steadily
at the scattering blossoms...
a frog

jp: .なむなむと蛙も石に並びけり
ro: namu-namu to kawazu mo ishi ni narabi keri
en:
they praise Buddha too--
frogs on a rock
in a row

jp: .なむなむと田にも並んでなく蛙
ro: namu-namu to ta ni mo narande naku kawazu
en:
praising Buddha
in a row in a rice field...
frogs

jp: .負さって蝶もぜん光寺参かな
ro: obusatte chô mo zenkôji mairi kana
en:
riding piggy-back
a butterfly too is a pilgrim...
Zenko Temple

jp: .笠取って見ても寝ている小てふ哉
ro: kasa totte mite mo nete iru ko chô kana
en:
grabbing my umbrella-hat
I find, asleep...
little butterfly

jp: .菓子盆を滑りおちたる小てふ哉
ro: kashi bon wo suberi-ochitaru ko chô kana
en:
slipping off
the candy tray...
a little butterfly

jp: .蝶とぶや石の上なる笠着物
ro: chô tobu ya ishi no ue naru kasa kimono
en:
a butterfly flits--
an umbrella-hat and kimono
on the rock

jp: .野談義をついととりまく小蝶哉
ro: no dangi wo tsui to torimaku ko chô kana
en:
suddenly circling
the outdoor sermon...
little butterflies

jp: .末の子も別にねだりて蚕かな
ro: sue no ko mo betsu ni nedarite kaiko kana
en:
even the youngest child
urges them on...
silkworms

jp: .馬の虻喰くたびれて寝たりけり
ro: uma no abu kui kutabire[te] netari keri
en:
tired of feeding
on the horse
the horsefly naps

jp: .馬の尾にそら死したり草の虻
ro: uma no o ni sorajini shitari kusa no [abu]
en:
playing dead
on the horse's tail
a meadow horsefly

jp: .神風や虻が教へる山の道
ro: kamikaze ya abu ga oshieru yama no michi
en:
divine wind--
the horsefly leads
on the mountain road

jp: .斯来いと虻がとぶ也草の道
ro: kô kii to abu ga tobu nari kusa no michi
en:
"Come this way!"
my horsefly guide
through the meadow

jp: .蜂の巣に借しておいたる柱哉
ro: hachi no su ni kashite oitaru hashira kana
en:
leasing a spot
for the beehive...
the post

jp: .蜂の巣のぶらり仁王の手首哉
ro: hachi no su no burari niô no tekubi kana
en:
the beehive dangles
from the Deva King's
wrist

jp: .巣の蜂やぶんともいはぬ御法だん
ro: su no hachi ya bun to mo iwanu o-hôdan
en:
the beehive
hushes up...
a Buddhist sermon

jp: .山蜂もしたふて住や人の里
ro: yama hachi mo shitaute sumu ya hito no sato
en:
the mountain bees, too
yearn to live there...
town of people

jp: .のさのさとさし出て花見虱かな
ro: nosa-nosa to sashidashite hanami-jirami kana
en:
shameless
in my blossom-viewing robe...
lice

jp: .草蔓や向ふの竹へつひつひは
ro: kusa tsuru ya mukau no take e tsui-tsui wa
en:
grass and vines--
a steady march
toward the bamboo

jp: .わか草にべたりと寝たる袴哉
ro: waka-gusa ni betari to netaru hakama kana
en:
asleep in new grass
to his formal trousers
it clings

jp: .わかくてもでも葎とはしられけり
ro: wakakute mo demo mugura to wa shirare keri
en:
fresh green leaves
sprouting turn out to be...
weeds!

jp: .泥道やここを歩めと草青む
ro: doro michi ya koko wo arume to kusa aomu
en:
muddy road--
"Come walk on me!"
grass turning green

jp: .うすくともはやいが勝と菫哉
ro: usuku tomo hayai ga kachi to sumire kana
en:
though straggly
soon they conquer all...
violets

jp: .あながちに丸くならでも梅の月
ro: anagachi ni maruku narade mo ume no tsuki
en:
as usual
not quite round...
plum blossom moon

jp: .鶯も親子づとめや梅の花
ro: uguisu mo oyako-zutome ya ume no hana
en:
nightingale parents
and children on duty too...
plum blossoms

jp: .梅がかに穴のおく迄浮世哉
ro: ume ga ka ni ana no oku made ukiyo kana
en:
plum blossom scent--
deep in a hole, even
the "floating world!"

jp: .梅咲や天神経をなく雀
ro: ume saku ya tenjinkyô wo naku suzume
en:
plum blossoms--
singing Tenjin's sutra
a sparrow

jp: .なむ自在神経や梅の花
ro: namu jizai tenjin kyô ya ume no hana
en:
"Praise the unshackled
heavenly gods!"
plum blossoms

jp: .梅咲くや門跡を待つ青畳
ro: ume saku ya monzeki wo matsu ao-datami
en:
plum in bloom--
a green tatami mat
awaits the priest

jp: .梅咲けど湯桁は水で流れけり
ro: ume sakedo yugeta wa mizu de nagare keri
en:
when plum trees bloom
hot tubs
overflow

jp: .梅見るや梅干爺と呼れつつ
ro: ume miru ya umeboshi jijii to yobaretsutsu
en:
viewing plum blossoms--
they call old men
pickled plums

jp: .幼子や目を皿にして梅の花
ro: osanago ya me wo sara ni shite ume no hana
en:
little child--
eyes wide as saucers
for plum blossoms

jp: .小坊主や筆を加へて梅の花
ro: ko bôzu ya fude wo kuwaete ume no hana
en:
the little boy's writing brush
in his mouth...
plum blossoms

jp: .正札を体にさげけり梅の花
ro: shôfuda wo karada ni sage keri ume no hana
en:
a price tag
dangles from his body...
plum blossoms

jp: .雪隠にさへ神ありてうめの花
ro: setchin ni sae kami arite ume no hana
en:
even the outhouse
has a guardian god...
plum blossoms

jp: .雪隠の錠も明く也梅の花
ro: setchin no jô mo aku nari ume no hana
en:
he leaves the outhouse
unlatched...
plum blossoms!

jp: .羽織きた女も出たり梅の花
ro: haori kita onna mo detari ume no hana
en:
bundled in her coat
a woman goes out too...
plum blossoms

jp: .水桶も大名の紋や梅の花
ro: mizuoke mo daimyô no mon ya ume no hana
en:
even on the water bucket
the war lord's crest...
plum blossoms

jp: .痩がまんして咲にけり門の梅
ro: yase gaman shite saki ni keri kado no ume
en:
with a yogi's self-denial
it's bloomed...
my gate's plum tree

jp: .雨降りて地のかたまりて花盛り
ro: ame furite ji no katamarite hana-zakari
en:
after the rain
the ground hardens...
glorious blossoms

jp: .今の世や花見がてらの小盗人
ro: ima no yo ya hanami-gatera no ko nusubito
en:
the world today!
even while blossom viewing
a little thief

jp: .京迄は一筋道ぞ花見笠
ro: kyô made wa hitosuji michi zo hanami-gasa
en:
a straight line
all the way to Kyoto...
umbrella-hatted blossom viewers

jp: .国中は惣びいき也花の雲
ro: kunijû wa sô-biiki nari hana no kumo
en:
a whole country
of favorite spots...
blossom clouds

jp: .下戸衆はさもいんき也花の陰
ro: geko shû wa samo kinki nari hana no kage
en:
all the nondrinkers
seem gloomy...
blossom shade

jp: .ちる花は鬼の目にさへ涙かな
ro: chiru hana wa oni no me ni sae namida kana
en:
blossoms scatter--
even the devil
sheds a tear

jp: .妻や子が我を占ふか花もちる
ro: tsuma ya ko ga ware wo uranau ka hana mo chiru
en:
a wife, a child...
foretelling my fate?
blossoms scatter too

jp: .寺の花はり合もなく散りにけり
ro: tera no hana hariai mo naku chiri ni keri
en:
the temple blossoms
without struggle
fall

jp: .長旅や花も痩せたるよしの山
ro: nagatabi ya hana mo yase[ta]ru yoshino yama
en:
long journey--
the blossoms, too, have lost weight
on Mount Yoshino

jp: .花さくや今廿念前ならば
ro: hana saku ya ima ni jû nen mae naraba
en:
cherry blossoms!
if I were twenty years
younger...

jp: .花咲や大権現の風定
ro: hana saku ya dai gongen no kaze sadame
en:
cherry blossoms--
Buddha's karmic wind
awaits you

jp: .花の木の持って生たあいそ哉
ro: hana no ki no motte umareta aiso kana
en:
the blossoming tree
born to a friendly
existence

jp: .花の世に西の望はなかりけり
ro: hana no yo ni nishi no nozomi wa nakari keri
en:
in this world of blossoms
nobody longs
for Paradise

jp: .花の世や出家士諸商人
ro: hana no yo ya shukke samuari shoakindo
en:
world of blossoms--
priests, samurai
merchants

jp: .花は雲人はかぶりと成にけり
ro: hana wa kumo hito wa keburi to nari ni keri
en:
blossoms become clouds--
people become
smoke

jp: .人声や西もひがしも花吹雪
ro: hitogoe ya nishi mo higashi mo hana fubuki
en:
people clamor--
in the west, in the east
a blossom blizzard

jp: .迷子札爺もさげて花見笠
ro: maigo fuda jijii mo sagete hanami-gasa
en:
even grandpa wears
a "lost child" sign...
umbrella-hatted blossom viewer

jp: .みよしのや寝起も花の雲の上
ro: mi-yoshino ya neoki mo hana no kumo no ue
en:
Great Yoshino--
waking up over clouds
of blossoms

jp: .焼飯をてんでにかじる花見哉
ro: yakimeshi wo tende [ni] kajiru hanami kana
en:
each one nibbles
his fried rice...
blossom viewing

jp: .菅笠に日傘に散しさくら哉
ro: suge-gasa ni hi-gasa ni chirishi sakura kana
en:
on sedge hats
and parasols falling...
cherry blossoms

jp: .寺々や拍子抜してちる桜
ro: tera tera ya hyôshi nuke shite chiru sakura
en:
temple to temple
with no rhythm...
cherry blossoms fall

jp: .西へちるさくらやみだの本願寺
ro: nishi e chiru sakura ya mida no honganji
en:
to the west
cherry blossoms scatter...
Amida's Hongan Temple

jp: .婆々どのも牛に引かれて桜かな
ro: baba dono mo ushi ni hikarete sakura kana
en:
granny comes too
led by a cow...
cherry blossoms

jp: .拍子抜して散りかかる桜哉
ro: hyôshi nuke shite chiri kakaru sakura kana
en:
down they fall
with no rhythm...
cherry blossoms

jp: .灯や柳がくれのわかい声
ro: tomoshibi ya yanagi-gakure no wakai koe
en:
lamplight--
hidden in the willow
young voices

jp: .目ざはりになれど隣の柳哉
ro: mezawari ni naredo tonari [no] yanagi kana
en:
though it blocks
my view...
neighbor's willow

jp: .柳は縁花は紅のうき世かな
ro: yagi wa fuchi hana wa beni no ukiyo kana
en:
around the willow
a floating world...
red blossoms

jp: .大柳村の印と成りにけり
ro: ôyanagi mura no shirushi to nari ni keri
en:
the big willow
has become the village's
trademark

jp: .短夜や草もばか花利口花
ro: mijika yo ya kusa mo baka hana rikô hana
en:
short summer night--
foolish flowers, clever flowers
bloom

jp: .手に足におきどころなき暑哉
ro: te ni ashi ni oki-dokoro naki atsusa kana
en:
nowhere to lay
my hands or feet...
summer heat

jp: .身一ツをひたと苦になる暑哉
ro: mi hitotsu wo hita to ku ni naru atsusa kana
en:
making my life
a total pain...
summer heat

jp: .涼風や何喰はせても二人前
ro: suzukaze ya nani kuwasete mo ni nin mae
en:
cool breeze--
she eats with an appetite
for two

jp: .涼しさや里はへぬきの夫婦松
ro: suzushisa ya sato haenuki no meoto matsu
en:
cool air--
native citizens of the village
Mr. and Mrs. Pine

jp: .笠の下吹てくれけり土用東風
ro: kasa no shita fuite kure keri doyô kochi
en:
kindly blowing
under my umbrella-hat...
midsummer's east wind

jp: .白菊のつんと立たる土用哉
ro: shiro kiku no tsunto tachitaru doyô kana
en:
the white chrysanthemum
acting stuck-up...
midsummer

jp: .人声や夜も両国の土用照り
ro: hito-goe ya yo mo ryôgoku no doyô teri
en:
people's voices
on Ryogoku Bridge even at night...
midsummer drought

jp: .満月もさらに無きずの土用哉
ro: mangetsu [mo] sara ni mukizu no doyô kana
en:
the full moon
is utterly flawless...
midsummer

jp: .今の代や入梅雷のだまし雨
ro: ima no yo ya nyûbai kaminari no damashi ame
en:
such is our age--
rainy season thunder
but no rain

jp: .気に入らぬ里もあらんをとらが雨
ro: ki ni iranu sato [mo] aran wo tora ga ame
en:
this village lacks
the spirit of the day...
Rain of the Tiger

jp: .誠なき里は降ぬか虎が雨
ro: makoto naki sato wa furanu ka tora ga ame
en:
not falling
on the insincere village?
Rain of the Tiger

jp: .見るうちに二夕立やむかふむら
ro: miru uchi ni futa yûdachi ya mukau mura
en:
while I watched
two cloudbursts in a row...
that village yonder

jp: .夕立のとりおとしたる小村哉
ro: yûdachi no tori-otoshitaru ko mura kana
en:
left out
of the cloudburst...
the little village

jp: .夕立の二度は人のそしる也
ro: yûdachi no futa tabi wa hito no soshiru nari
en:
come the second cloudburst
people
are griping

jp: .夕立や追かけ追かけ又も又
ro: yûdachi ya oikake oikake mata mo mata
en:
cloudbursts--
one after another
again and again!

jp: .あの中に鬼やこもらん雲のみね
ro: ano naka ni oni ya komoran kumo no mine
en:
in that throng
there must be a demon...
billowing clouds

jp: .雲切や何の苦もなく峰作る
ro: kumogire ya nanno ku mo naku mine tsukuru
en:
rift in the clouds--
how easily peaks
pop up

jp: .米国や夜もつつ立雲の峰
ro: kome-guni ya yoru mo tsuttatsu kumo no mine
en:
rice country--
even at night standing tall
billowing clouds

jp: .造作なく作り直すや雲の峰
ro: zôsa naku tsukurinaosu ya kumo no mine
en:
with ease
they reconstruct...
billowing clouds

jp: .手ばしこく畳み仕舞ふや雲のみね
ro: tebashikoku tatami-shimau ya kumo no mine
en:
rushing to put away
the tatami mats...
billowing clouds

jp: .松の木で穴をふさぐや雲のみね
ro: matsu no ki de ana wo fusagu ya kumo no mine
en:
plugging the hole
with a pine tree...
billowing clouds

jp: .湖水から出現したり雲の峰
ro: kosui kara shutsugen shitari kumo no mine
en:
making their entrance
from the lake...
billowing clouds

jp: .田の人の日除になるや雲の峰
ro: ta no hito no hiyoke ni naru ya kumo no mine
en:
the rice planter's
sunshade...
billowing cloud

jp: .てっぺんは雪や降らん山清水
ro: teppen wa yuki ya fururan yama shimizu
en:
at the peak
maybe it's snowing...
pure mountain water

jp: .人里へ出れば清水でなかりけり
ro: hito-zato e dereba shimizu de nakari keri
en:
through a village of people
the water no longer
pure

jp: .山清水人のゆききに濁りけり
ro: yama shimizu hito no yukiki ni nigori keri
en:
pure mountain water--
people coming and going
muddy it

jp: .夕風や病もなく田の青む
ro: yûkaze ya yamai ke mo naku ta no aomu
en:
evening wind--
disease-free
the rice field greens

jp: .天人の気どりの蝶や花御堂
ro: tennin no kidori no chô ya hanamidô
en:
butterflies
like celestial maidens...
Buddha amid birthday flowers

jp: .としどしに生れ給へる仏かな
ro: toshi-doshi ni umare tamaeru hotoke kana
en:
year after year
deigning to be born...
Buddha

jp: .二三文銭もけしきや花御堂
ro: ni san mon zeni mo keshiki ya hanamidô
en:
two or three pennies
complete the scene...
Buddha amid birthday flowers

jp: .雪隠の歌も夏書の一ッ哉
ro: setchin no uta mo natsusho no hitotsu kana
en:
an outhouse song too
one of my choices...
summer calligraphy

jp: .猫の子が玉にとる也夏書石
ro: neko no ko ga tama ni toru nari natsusho ishi
en:
the kitten grasps
its ball...
summer calligraphy stone

jp: .目出度さはつぎだらけなる幟哉
ro: medetasa wa tsugi darake naru nobori kana
en:
"Good Fortune!"
the summer banner
riddled with patches

jp: .笹粽猫が上手にほどく也
ro: sasa chimaki neko ga jyôzu ni hodoku nari
en:
rice dumpling in bamboo grass--
skillfully the cat
unwraps it

jp: .福耳にかけてくれたる粽かな
ro: fukumimi ni kakete kuretaru chimaki kana
en:
from his long-lobed ear
a gift dangles...
rice dumpling

jp: .神国は天から薬降りにけり
ro: kami-guni [wa] ten kara kusuri furi ni keri
en:
this land of gods!
medicine rains
from the sky

jp: .けふの日に降れ降れ皺の延薬
ro: kyô no hi ni fure-fure shiwa no nobi kusuri
en:
fall from the sky today!
wrinkle-curing
medicine

jp: .薬降日や毒虫も木から降る
ro: kusuri furu hi ya dokumushi mo ki kara furu
en:
the day medicine rains
a stinging bug, too
falls from a tree

jp: .正直の首に薬降る日かな
ro: shôjiki no kôbe ni kusuri furi hi kana
en:
on honest heads
medicine rains down
today

jp: .上見なといふ人が先ころもがえ
ro: ue mina to iu hito ga mazu koromogae
en:
the man with his nose
in the air is first...
new summer robe

jp: .がきどもも下見て暮せころもがへ
ro: gakidomo mo shita mite kurase koromogae
en:
hungry devil
you, too, look down in shame...
new summer robes

jp: .着ながらに値ぶみすむ也更衣
ro: ki nagara ni nebumi sumu nari koromogae
en:
while putting it on
the price is settled...
new summer robe

jp: .草の家や子は人並に衣替え
ro: kusa no ya ya ko wa hitonami ni koromogae
en:
thatched hut--
like everyone the child changes
to summer clothes

jp: .更衣世にはあきたと云ながら
ro: koromogae yo ni wa akita to ii nagara
en:
my new summer robe--
though I say I'm sick
of this world

jp: .一日や仕様事なしの更衣
ro: tsuitachi ya shiyô koto nashi no koromogae
en:
first day of summer
