and like it or not...
new summer robes

jp: .姫のりの丸看板やころもがえ
ro: himanori no maru kanban ya koromogae
en:
"Rice Paste"
on a round sign board...
new summer robes

jp: .昼過の出来心也ころもがえ
ro: hiru sugi no dekikokoro nari koromogae
en:
past noon
acting on impulse...
a new summer robe

jp: .虫も髪さげても出たりころもがえ
ro: mushi mo kami sagete mo detari koromogae
en:
insect hairpins
and hair pieces too...
new summer robes

jp: .やがて焼く身とは思へど更衣
ro: yagate yaku mi to wa omoedo koromogae
en:
you don't think how this flesh
will soon burn...
new summer robe

jp: .帷子の青空色や朝参り
ro: katabira no ao-zora no ya asa mairi
en:
summer kimonos
the color of blue sky...
morning pilgrimage

jp: .上人や草をむしるも日傘持
ro: shônin ya kusa wo mushiru mo higasa mochi
en:
holy man--
even while plucking grass
a parasol holder

jp: .老僧の草引むしる日傘かな
ro: rôsôno hiki-mushiru higarakasa kana
en:
old priest--
even while plucking grass
a parasol holder

jp: .門前の草むしるにも日傘哉
ro: monzen no kusa mushiru ni mo higasa kana
en:
even while plucking
the grass at the gate...
a parasol

jp: .よい猫が爪かくす也夏座敷
ro: yoi neko ga tsume kakusu nari natsu zashiki
en:
the good cat
hides his claws...
summer room

jp: .ことしこそ小言相手も夏座敷
ro: kotoshi koso kogoto aite mo natsu zashiki
en:
this year there's someone
for me to nag...
summer room

jp: .蚊屋釣て夕飯買に出たりけり
ro: kaya tsurite yû[han] kai ni detari keri
en:
dangling a mosquito net
out to dinner
I go

jp: .小にくしや蚊屋のうちなる小盃
ro: ko nikushi ya kachô no uchi naru ko sakazuki
en:
what a pain!
inside the mosquito net
with my little sake cup

jp: .酒一升かりと書たる紙帳哉
ro: sake isshô kari to kakitaru kachô kana
en:
"borrowed two quarts
of sake"...
a note in my mosquito net

jp: .俵引く牛の上にて昼寝哉
ro: tawara hiku ushi no ue ni hirune kana
en:
on the back of an ox
hauling straw...
a siesta

jp: .くっさめの蓋にしておく団扇哉
ro: kussame no futa ni shi[te] oku uchiwa kana
en:
a sneeze
a cover-up...
with her fan

jp: .昼ごろの机の上の蚊やり哉
ro: hiru goro no tsukue no ue no ka yari kana
en:
by noon
it's over the desk
smudge pot smoke

jp: .武士町や四角四面に水を蒔く
ro: bushi machi ya shikaku-shimen ni mizu wo maku
en:
samurai street--
methodically he waters
the plants

jp: .井戸替へて石の上なる御神酒哉
ro: i[do] kaete ishi no ue naru omiki kana
en:
on a stone
by the drained well...
sacred sake

jp: .井の底もすっぱりかはく月よ哉
ro: i no soko mo suppari kawaku tsuki yo kana
en:
the well's bottom, too
utterly dry...
moonlit night

jp: .かけ声を井戸の底からこたへけり
ro: kakegoe wo i[do] no soko kara kotae keri
en:
calling down--
from deep in the well
an answer

jp: .さらし井に魚ももどるや暮の月
ro: sarashi i ni uo mo modoru ya kure no tsuki
en:
after cleaning the well
putting back the fish...
moon at dusk

jp: .さらし井や草の上にてなく蛙
ro: sarashi i ya kusa no ue nite naku kawazu
en:
the well is drained--
on the grass a frog
croaking

jp: .はやし唄井戸の底から付にけり
ro: hayari uta i[do] no soko kara tsuke ni keri
en:
a popular song--
from the bottom of the well
he joins in

jp: .一休み井戸のそこから咄かな
ro: hito yasumi ido no soko [ka]ra hanashi kana
en:
rest break--
from the bottom of the well
voices

jp: .旅人や歩ながらの土用干
ro: tabibito ya aruki nagara no doyôboshi
en:
a traveler
walking along, airing
out his clothes

jp: .夜涼みや大僧正のおどけ口
ro: yo suzumi ya ôsôjô no odoke kuchi
en:
evening cool--
the great high priest
tells jokes

jp: .今の世や見へ半分の田植唄
ro: ima no yo ya mie hambun no taue uta
en:
in today's world
it's half for show...
rice-planting song

jp: .大蟾ものさのさ出たり田植酒
ro: ôhiki mo nosa-nosa detari taue-zake
en:
even a big toad
boldly joins the fun...
rice-planting sake

jp: .笠とれば坊主也けり田植唄
ro: kasa toreba bôzu nari keri taue uta
en:
taking off his umbrella-hat
a bald priest...
rice-planting song

jp: .むだな身も呼び出されけり田植酒
ro: mudana mi mo yobidasare keri taue sake
en:
even worthless me
is invited...
rice-planting sake

jp: .若い衆は見へ半分や田植笠
ro: wakai shu wa mie hambun ya taue-gasa
en:
the young men wear them
half for show...
rice-planting umbrella-hats

jp: .一文が水を馬にも呑せけり
ro: ichi mon ga mizu wo uma ni mo nomise keri
en:
a penny's worth of
cold water, the horse
drinks too

jp: .月かげや夜も水売る日本橋
ro: tsukikage ya yoru mo mizu uru nihombashi
en:
moonlight--
even at night they sell water
on Nihon Bridge

jp: .冷水や桶にし汲ば只の水
ro: hiya mizu ya oke nishi kumeba tada no mizu
en:
cold water--
scooped into a bucket
just water

jp: .逢坂や牛の上からところてん
ro: ausaka ya ushi no ue kara tokoroten
en:
Mount Ausaka--
from a cow's back
sweet jelly

jp: .心太牛の上からとりにけり
ro: tokoroten ushi no ue kara tori ni keri
en:
sweet jelly--
from a cow's back
is served

jp: .狩人の矢先としらぬかの子哉
ro: kariudo no yasaki to shiranu ka no ko kana
en:
oblivious
to the hunter's arrows...
a fawn

jp: .鹿の子や矢先もしらでどち狂ふ
ro: shika no ko ya yasaki mo shirade dochi kuruu
en:
the fawn
unaware of the arrow
cavorts

jp: .上人の声を聞しるかのこ哉
ro: shônin no koe wo kikishiru kanoko kana
en:
hearing the holy man's
sermon...
a fawn

jp: .鶏にまぶれて育つ鹿の子哉
ro: niwatori ni fumarete sodatsu ka no ko kana
en:
growing up
in the thick of chickens...
a fawn

jp: .一貫目過たぞ引なほととぎす
ro: hito kanme sugita zo hiku na hototogisu
en:
over eight pounds--
don't haul that!
cuckoo

jp: .一寸も引かぬけぶりやほととぎす
ro: issun mo hikanu keburi ya hototogisu
en:
unwilling to back down
even an inch...
cuckoo

jp: .一寸も引なお江戸の時鳥
ro: issun mo hiku na o-edo no hototogisu
en:
don't back down
even an inch!
cuckoo of Great Edo

jp: .重き荷を引かせとやほととぎす
ro: omoki ni wo hikase to ya hototogisu
en:
that's a heavy load
to be hauling!
cuckoo

jp: .気まぐれを起した声や時鳥
ro: kimagure wo okoshita koe ya hototogisu
en:
breaking out in song
on a whim...
cuckoo

jp: .其やうに喰らひそべるなほととぎす
ro: sono yô ni kurai-soberu na hototogisu
en:
don't eat
lying down like that!
cuckoo

jp: .何喰て其音ぼねぞ時鳥
ro: nan kuute sono oto-bone zo hototogisu
en:
what are you eating
to make such a noise!
cuckoo

jp: .時鳥鳴けり酒に火が入ると
ro: hototogisu naki keri sake ni hi ga iru to
en:
the cuckoo sings
"Watch out! The sake's
burning!"

jp: .鶯は籠で聞かよ閑古鳥
ro: uguisu wa kago de kiku ka yo kankodori
en:
does the caged
nightingale hear?
mountain cuckoo

jp: .木の門や朝から晩迄かん子鳥
ro: ki no kado ya asa kara ban made kankodori
en:
tree at the gate--
morning to evening
a mountain cuckoo

jp: .鶯の云合せてや鳴仕廻ふ
ro: uguisu no iiawasete ya naki shimau
en:
by common consent
the nightingales' singing
stops

jp: .鶯もとしのよらぬ山出湯の山
ro: uguisu mo toshi no yoranu yama deyu no yama
en:
the nightingale, too
isn't growing old!
hot springs mountain

jp: .行々し大河しんと流れけり
ro: gyôgyôshi taiga wa shin to nagare keri
en:
noisy reed thrush--
the big river flows
in silence

jp: .行々し何に追われて夜なべ鳴
ro: gyôgyôshi nan ni owarete yonabe naku
en:
reed thrush--
what's chasing you
to make you sing all night?

jp: .行々し一村うまく寝たりけり
ro: gyôgyôshi hito mura umaku netari keri
en:
hey reed thrush
the whole town's
sound asleep!

jp: .月かげやよしきり一ッ夜なべ鳴
ro: tsukikage ya yoshikiri hitotsu yonabe naku
en:
moonlight--
one reed thrush
working, singing

jp: .ゆたかさようらの苫屋の行々し
ro: yutakasa youra no tomaya no gyôgyôshi
en:
so many!
on the shore at a hut of reeds
reed thrushes

jp: .よし切も月をかけての夜なべ哉
ro: yoshikiri mo tsuki wo kakete [no] yonabe kana
en:
the reed thrush too
uses the moonlight...
night work

jp: .よし切や一本竹のてっぺんに
ro: yoshikiri ya ippon take no teppen ni
en:
reed thrush
on a bamboo stalk's
tippy-top

jp: .よし切や水盗人が来た来たと
ro: yoshikiri [ya] mizu nusubito ga kita kita to
en:
a reed thrush sings--
"The water thief is here!
he's here!"

jp: .御仏の膝の上也蛇の衣
ro: mi-botoke no hiza no ue nari hebi no kinu
en:
on Buddha's lap
a snake's forsaken
garment

jp: .寝た人の尻の先なる蛍かな
ro: neta hito no shiri no saki naru hotaru kana
en:
on top
of a sleeping man's butt...
firefly

jp: .ぼうふりが天上するぞ門の月
ro: bôfuri ga tenjô suru zo kado no tsuki
en:
up to heaven
the mosquito larva flies...
moon at the gate

jp: .寝た人を昼飯くひに来た蚊哉
ro: neta hito [wo] hirumeshi kui ni kita ka kana
en:
coming to lunch
on the sleeping man...
mosquito

jp: .青畳音して蠅のとびにけり
ro: ao-datami oto shite hae no tobi ni keri
en:
green tatami mat--
a fly lands
with a thump

jp: .打って打ってと逃て笑ふ蝿の声
ro: utte utte to nogarete warau hae no koe
en:
swat! swat!
the escaping fly buzzes
with laughter

jp: .とく逃げよにげよ打たれなそこの蠅
ro: toku nige yo nige yo utare na soko no hae
en:
fly away quick
quick! don't get swatted!
fly over there

jp: .なぐさみに猫がとる也窓の蠅
ro: nagusami ni neko ga toru nari mado no hae
en:
just for fun
the cat catches them...
window's flies

jp: .坐頭坊と知って逃ぬか蓙の蚤
ro: zattô bô to shitte nigenu ka goza no nomi
en:
knowing the priest is blind
is that why you stay?
fleas on the mat

jp: .としよりも蚤を追ふ目はかすまぬか
ro: toshiyori mo nomi wo ou me wa kasumanu ka
en:
growing old--
these eyes no good
for flea chasing

jp: .新畳蚤の飛ぶ音さはさはし
ro: nii-datami nomi no [tobu] oto sawa-sawashi
en:
a new tatami mat--
fleas jumping
bumpity bump!

jp: .人の世や山松陰も蚤がすむ
ro: hito no yo ya yama matsu kage mo nomi ga sumu
en:
world of man--
even in mountain pine shade
fleas

jp: .夜の庵や蚤の飛ぶ音騒々し
ro: yo no io ya nomi no tobu oto sawa-sawashi
en:
evening hut--
the fleas jumping
bumpity-bump

jp: .門柱羽蟻と化して仕廻ふかよ
ro: kado-bashira ha-ari to kashite shimau ka yo
en:
pillar at the gate--
have you become all
flying ants?

jp: .きのふには一ばいましの羽蟻哉
ro: kinou ni wa i-baimashi no ha-ari kana
en:
twice as big
as yesterday...
flying ant swarm

jp: .けふ替た庵の柱を羽蟻哉
ro: kyô kaeta io no hashira wo ha-ari kana
en:
my hut's pillar
today is transformed...
flying ants

jp: .蝉鳴や山から見ゆる大座敷
ro: semi naku ya yama kara miyuru ôzashiki
en:
cicadas chirr--
viewed from the mountain
a big sitting room

jp: .そよ風は蝉の声より起る哉
ro: soyo kaze wa semi no koe yori okoru kana
en:
the soft breeze
from the cicada's voice
wafts

jp: .むら雨の雫ながらや蝉の声
ro: murasame no shizuku nagara ya semi no koe
en:
like dribbles
of rain the singing
cicadas

jp: .もろ蝉の鳴こぼれけり笠の上
ro: moro-zemi no naki kobore keri kasa no ue
en:
so many cicadas
singing and tumbling off...
umbrella-hat

jp: .炎天に蓼くふ虫のきげん哉
ro: enten ni tade kuu mushi no kigen kana
en:
sweltering heat--
the knotweed-eating bug
in fine mood

jp: .蓼あれば蓼喰ふ虫ありにけり
ro: tade areba tade kurau mushi ari ni keri
en:
where there's knotweed
there's the knotweed-eating
bug

jp: .蓼くふや火に入虫も好々に
ro: tade kuu ya hi ni iru mushi mo suki-zuki ni
en:
some eat knotweed
some fly into flames...
a matter of taste

jp: .蜘の子はみなちりじりの身すぎ哉
ro: kumo no ko wa mina chirijiri no misugi kana
en:
all the baby spiders
scatter
to make a living

jp: .かたつぶりこちら向く間にどちへやら
ro: katatsuburi kochira muku ma ni dochi e yara
en:
little snail
facing this way
where to now?

jp: .出るやいな蚯蚓は蟻に引れけり
ro: deru ya ina mimizu wa ari ni hikare keri
en:
just coming out
the earthworm dragged off
by ants

jp: .おぼたんや刀預る仮番屋
ro: ôbotan ya katana azukaru karibanya
en:
peonies--
the swords stowed
at the watchman's shack

jp: .錠明て人通しけりぼたん畠
ro: jô akete hito tôshi keri botan hata
en:
the lock unlocked
for visitors...
peony garden

jp: .池の蓮金色に咲く欲はなし
ro: ike no hasu konjiki ni saku yoku wa nashi
en:
lotuses in the pond--
no desire to bloom
golden

jp: .いつの時在家には咲く蓮の花
ro: itsu no toki zaika ni wa saku hasu no hana
en:
house in the country--
when will the lotuses
bloom?

jp: .えっ太らが家の尻より蓮の花
ro: ettara ga ie no shiri yori hasu no hana
en:
from the rear
of the outcasts' house...
lotus blossoms

jp: .大きさよしかも在家の蓮の花
ro: ôkisa yo shikamo zaika no hasu no hana
en:
lotuses blooming large
even at the house
in the country

jp: .さく蓮下水下水のおち所
ro: saku harasu gesui gesui no ochi dokoro
en:
blooming lotuses
where sewer water
pours

jp: .泥中の蓮と力んで咲にけり
ro: deichû no hasu to rikinde saki ni keri
en:
amid the muck
a lotus defiantly
has bloomed

jp: .沼の蓮葉さへ花さへ売られけり
ro: numa no hasu ha sae hana [sa]e urare keri
en:
they even sell
the swamp's lotuses...
leaf and blossom

jp: .人喰た虻が乗る也蓮の花
ro: hito kûta abu ga noru nari hasu no hana
en:
after feasting on people
the horsefly mounts
the lotus

jp: .なでしこや人が作れば直ほそる
ro: nadeshiko ya hito ga tsukureba sugu hosoru
en:
blooming pinks--
when planted by people
growing thin so fast

jp: .旅人や野にさして行流れ苗
ro: tabibito ya no ni sashite yuku nagare nae
en:
the traveler fixes
the farmer's floating
rice stalks

jp: .くりくりと月のさしけり坊主麦
ro: kuri-kuri to tsuki no sashi keri bôzu mugi
en:
fat and round
the shining moon...
the priest's barley field

jp: .黒いのは烏が蒔た穂麦かな
ro: kuroi no wa karasu ga maita ho mugi kana
en:
the black ones
sown by a crow...
heads of barley

jp: .麦秋や土台の石も汗をかく
ro: mugi aki ya dodai no ishi mo ase wo kaku
en:
ripened barley--
even the foundation stone
sweats

jp: .藪竹や親の真似してつん曲る
ro: yabu take ya oya no mane shite tsun-magaru
en:
the thicket's bamboo
imitating his parents
grows crooked

jp: .笹の子も竹の替りに出たりけり
ro: sasa no ko mo take no kawari ni detari keri
en:
bamboo shoots' substitute--
bamboo
grass

jp: .笹の子も一はばするやおく信濃
ro: sasa no ko mo hito haba suru ya oku shinano
en:
new bamboo grass
all one width...
deep Shinano

jp: .竹の子も育つ度んびに痩にけり
ro: takenoko mo sodatsu tanbi ni yase ni keri
en:
bamboo shoots, too--
when they grow up
grow skinny

jp: .竹の子や竹に成るのはまんがまれ
ro: takenoko ya take ni naru no wa man ga mare
en:
bamboo shoots
that become bamboo...
one in ten thousand

jp: .筍やともども育つ雀の子
ro: takenoko ya tomo-domo soda[tsu] suzume no ko
en:
growing up together--
bamboo shoots
and baby sparrows

jp: .若竹の子さへのがれぬうき世哉
ro: waka takenoko sae nogarenu ukiyo kana
en:
even for bamboo shoots
there's no escape...
floating world

jp: .みたらしや冷し捨たる真桑瓜
ro: mitarashi ya hiyashi sutetaru makuwa uri
en:
purification font--
a muskmelon
left to cool

jp: .一不二の晴れて立けり初茄子
ro: ichi fuji no karete tachi keri hatsu nasubi
en:
a Mount Fuji
emerges from clouds...
first eggplant

jp: .扇から扇にとるやはつ茄子
ro: ôgi kara ôgi ni toru ya hatsu nasubi
en:
from one paper fan
to another...
the first eggplant

jp: .けふもけふももがずに見るやはつ茄子
ro: kyô mo kyô mo mogazu ni miru ya hatsu nasubi
en:
today too
I don't break it off...
first eggplant

jp: .芝門や貰ふたる日がはつ茄子
ro: shiba no to ya morautaru hi ga hatsu nasubi
en:
humble hut--
today the first eggplant
if someone gives me one!

jp: .前栽に立や茄子の守り札
ro: senzai ni tatsu ya nasubi no mamori fuda
en:
amid the garden shrubbery--
eggplant's
protective charm

jp: .手のひらや見て居るうちが初茄子
ro: te no hira ya mite iru uchi ga hatsu nasubi
en:
in my open palms
look!
the first eggplant

jp: .鉢植や見るばかりなる初茄子
ro: hachi ue ya miru bakari naru hatsu nasubi
en:
raised in a pot
just for show...
the first eggplant

jp: .守り札かけて育つやはつ茄子
ro: mamori fuda kakete sodatsu ya hatsu nasubi
en:
raised with a protective
charm...
the first eggplant

jp: .御仏に見せたばかりやはつ茄子
ro: mi-botoke ni miseta bakari ya hatsu nasubi
en:
I show it off
to Buddha...
first eggplant

jp: .伴僧が手習す也わか葉陰
ro: bansô ga tenaraisu nari wakaba kage
en:
the monk practices
calligraphy
in the shade of new leaves

jp: .卯の花にけ上げの泥も盛り哉
ro: u no hana ni ke-age no doro mo sakari keri
en:
though spattered
with kicked-up mud...
deutzia in full bloom

jp: .卯の花や垣のこちらの俄道
ro: u [no] hana ya kaki no kochira no niwaka michi
en:
deutzia blossoms--
here's a new path
through the hedge

jp: .泥道を出れば卯の花なかりけり
ro: doro michi wo dereba u [no] hana nakari keri
en:
leaving the muddy road
and the blooming deutzia
behind

jp: .茨垣犬の上手に潜りけり
ro: ibara kaki inu no jyôzu ni kuguri keri
en:
thorn hedge--
the dog crawls through
like a pro

jp: .鬼茨もなびくやみだの本願寺
ro: onibara mo nabiku ya mida no honganji
en:
even the thorn bush
bows low!
Amida's Hongan Temple

jp: .花茨ちょっけいを出す小猫哉
ro: hana ibara chokkei wo dasu ko neko kana
en:
poking her nose
into thorny wild roses...
kitten

jp: .茨垣や上手に明し犬の道
ro: bara kaki ya jyôzu ni akeshi inu no michi
en:
through the thorny hedge
cleverly...
dog's path

jp: .見らるるや垣の茨も花盛り
ro: miraruru ya kaki no ibara mo hana sakari
en:
worth a look--
the thorny hedge, too
in full bloom

jp: .秋立といふばかりでも寒かな
ro: aki tatsu to iu bakari demo samusa kana
en:
"Autumn's begun"
just saying it
I feel cold

jp: .科もない風な憎みそけさの秋
ro: toga mo nai kaze na nikumi so kesa no aki
en:
don't blame the wind
don't hate!
first autumn morning

jp: .朝寒のうちに参るや善光寺
ro: asa-zamu no uchi ni mairu ya zenkôji
en:
deep in morning's cold
I visit...
Zenko Temple

jp: .足で追ふ鼠が笑ふ夜寒哉
ro: ashi de ou nezumi ga warau yozamu kana
en:
the stomped-at mouse
squeaks with laughter...
a cold night

jp: .草の家は秋も昼寒夜寒哉
ro: kusa no ya wa aki mo hiru samu yozamu kana
en:
autumn in the hut--
cold day
cold night

jp: .さをしかのきげんの直ル夜寒哉
ro: saoshika no kigen no naoru yozamu kana
en:
the buck's mood
improves...
a cold night

jp: .窓際や虫も夜寒の小寄合
ro: mado-giwa ya mushi mo yozamu no ko yoriai
en:
at the window
insects too
a cold night huddle

jp: .知った名のらく書見へて秋の暮
ro: shitta na no rakugaki miete aki no kure
en:
I know this wall scribbler's
name...
autumn dusk

jp: .近づきのらく書見へて秋の暮
ro: chikazuki no rakugaki miete aki no kure
en:
friends of mine
scrawled on this wall...
autumn dusk

jp: .秋もはや西へ行く也角田川
ro: aki mo haya nishi e yuku nari sumida-gawa
en:
autumn also
hurries to the west...
Sumida River

jp: .山陰も寄って祭るや天の川
ro: yama kage mo yotte matsuru ya ama no kawa
en:
mountain shade--
here, too, a festival crowd
under the Milky Way

jp: .我星はひとりかも寝ん天の川
ro: waga hoshi wa hitori ka mo nen ama no kawa
en:
does my star too
sleep alone?
Milky Way

jp: .盆の月参る墓さへなかりけり
ro: bon no tsuki mairu haka sae nakari keri
en:
a Bon Festival moon
but nobody visiting
the graves

jp: .大雨や此十五夜も只の山
ro: ôame ya kono jûgoya mo tada no yama
en:
a big rain--
this harvest moon night
an ordinary mountain

jp: .大井戸も小井戸もかへて月見哉
ro: ô i[do] mo ko ido [mo] kaete tsukimi kana
en:
after cleaning the big well
and the little well...
moon gazing

jp: .御の字の月と成りけり草の雨
ro: on no ji no tsuki to nari keri kusa no ame
en:
it's become a top-notch
harvest moon!
rain-drenched grass

jp: .十五夜の萩にすすきに雨見哉
ro: jûgoya no hagi ni susuki ni ame mi kana
en:
on harvest moon night
in bush clover and pampas grass...
rain gazing

jp: .十五夜月にもまさる山の雨
ro: jûgoya ya tsuki ni mo masaru yama no ame
en:
on harvest moon night
surpassing the moon...
mountain rain

jp: .曙ﾜ夜や月のかはりに雨がもる
ro: jûgoya ya tsuki no kawari ni ame ga moru
en:
harvest moon night--
instead of the moon
leaking rain

jp: .名月に来て名月を鼾かな
ro: meigetsu ni kite meigetsu wo ibiki kana
en:
on harvest moon night
greeting the moon...
with snores

jp: .名月や生れたままの庭の松
ro: meigetsu ya umarareta mama no niwa no matsu
en:
harvest moon--
still looking like a newborn
garden's pine

jp: .名月や角の小すみの小松島
ro: meigetsu ya sumi no kosumi no ko matsushima
en:
harvest moon--
in a little pine island's
little nook

jp: .名月や山有川有寝ながらに
ro: meigetsu ya yama ari kawa ari ne nagara ni
en:
the harvest moon
over mountain and river...
while I sleep

jp: .秋風によわみを見せぬ藪蚊哉
ro: akikaze ni yowami wo misenu yabu ka kana
en:
no sign of weakness
in the autumn wind...
mosquito

jp: .草の葉の釘のとがるや秋の風
ro: kusa no ha no kugi no togaru ya aki no kaze
en:
sharpening the blades
of grass...
autumn wind

jp: .草の葉も人をさす也秋の風
ro: kusa no ha mo hito wo sasu nari aki no kaze
en:
blades of grass, too
stab people...
autumn wind

jp: .墨染の蝶もとぶ也秋の風
ro: sumizome no chô mo tobu nari aki no kaze
en:
a black butterfly
also flits by...
autumn wind

jp: .西方をさした指より秋の風
ro: saihô wo sashita yubi yori aki no kaze
en:
a finger pointing
to the west...
autumn wind

jp: .でで虫の捨家いくつ秋の風
ro: dedemushi no sute ie ikutsu aki no kaze
en:
so many castaway
snail shells!
autumn wind

jp: .うら窓に露の玉ちるひびき哉
ro: ura mado ni tsuyu no tama chiru hibiki kana
en:
on the back window
dewdrops scatter
loudly

jp: .しら露としらぬ子どもが仏かな
ro: shira tsuyu to shiranu kodomo ga hotoke kana
en:
the child unaware
of the white dewdrops
a Buddha

jp: .田かせぎや人の上にも露のおく
ro: ta kasegi ya hito no ue ni mo tsuyu no oku
en:
even on the rice field
workers...
dewdrops form

jp: .花売の花におくや露の玉
ro: hanauri [no] hana ni oku ya tsuyu no tama
en:
on the flower vendor's
flowers...
pearls of dew

jp: .我庵が玉にきずかよ草の露
ro: waga io ga tama ni kizu ka yo kusa no tsuyu
en:
is my hut an eye-sore
among your pearls?
dewy grass?

jp: .稲妻やかくれかねたる人の皺
ro: inazuma ya kakure kane[ta]ru hito no shiwa
en:
lightning flash--
no way to hide
the wrinkles

jp: .稲妻や畠の中の風呂の人
ro: inazuma ya hatake no naka no furo no hito
en:
lightning flash--
in the field
a hot tub bather

jp: .稲妻や浦のおとこの供養塚
ro: inazuma ya ura no otoko no kuyôzuka
en:
lightning flash--
a seaside man's
grave mound

jp: .霧晴て足の際なる仏かな
ro: kiri harete ashi no kiwa naru hotoke kana
en:
mist clearing--
at my feet
a Buddha!

jp: .雲霧が袂の下を通りけり
ro: kumo-giri ga tamoto no shita wo tôri keri
en:
cloud and fog--
into my sleeves
they go

jp: .人の吹く霧もかすむやえぞが島
ro: hito no fuku kiri mo kasumu ya ezo ga shima
en:
from people's mouths, too
mist in clouds...
Hokkaido

jp: .人の吹く霧も寒いぞえぞが島
ro: hito no fuku kiri mo samui zo ezo ga shima
en:
from people's mouths, too
cold mist...
Hokkaido

jp: .吹かける霧にむせけり馬の上
ro: fukikakeru kiri ni muse keri uma no ue
en:
choking on the mist
blowing in...
on horseback

jp: .山寺や仏の膝に霧の立
ro: yamadera ya hotoke no hiza ni kiri no tatsu
en:
mountain temple--
in Buddha's lap mist
rising

jp: .秋山や雨のない日はあらし吹
ro: aki yama ya ame no nai hi wa arashi fuku
en:
autumn mountain--
on a rainless day
a gale

jp: .月かげにうかれ序や墓参り
ro: tsukikage ni ukare tsuide ya hakamairi
en:
after merriment
in the moonlight...
a grave visit

jp: .ある時は履見せる灯籠哉
ro: aru toki wa hakimono miseru tôro kana
en:
at times I use it
to find my shoes...
lantern for the dead

jp: .うら住の二軒もやひの灯ろ哉
ro: urazumi no ni ken moyai no tôro kana
en:
two back-alley homes
share it...
lantern for the dead

jp: .来て見れば在家也けり高灯籠
ro: kite mireba zaika nari keri takadôro
en:
if you come and look
at this farmhouse...
a tall Bon lantern

jp: .草蔓もわざとさらざる灯ろ哉
ro: kusa tsuru mo waza to sarazaru tôro kana
en:
even grass and vines
don't part willingly...
lantern for the dead

jp: .灯籠の火で夜なべする都かな
ro: tôro no hi de yonabe suru miyako kana
en:
night work lit
by a lantern for the dead...
Kyoto

jp: .履の用心がてら灯籠かな
ro: hakimono no yôjin ga tera tôro kana
en:
the shoes guarded
by the temple's lantern...
for the dead

jp: .泣虫が母とおどるや門の月
ro: naki mushi ga haha [to] odoru ya kado no tsuki
en:
the crybaby dances
with Mother...
moon at the gate

jp: .六十年踊る夜もなく過しけり
ro: rokujû nen odoru yo mo naku sugoshi keri
en:
in sixty years
not one night spent
dancing

jp: .涼しさは七夕竹の夜露かな
ro: suzushisa wa tanabata take no yo tsuyu kana
en:
cool air of Tanabata Night
coats the bamboo
with dew

jp: .七夕や野も女郎花男へし
ro: tanabata ya no mo ominaeshi otokoeshi
en:
Tanabata Night--
in the field maiden flowers
and boy flowers

jp: .星の歌腕に書てはなめる也
ro: hoshi no uta ude ni kaite wa nameru nari
en:
the "Star Poem"
written on his arm...
is licked

jp: .川中に涼み給ふや夫婦星
ro: kawa naka ni suzumi tamau ya meoto hoshi
en:
mid-river
they cool themselves...
husband and wife stars

jp: .御馳走に涼風吹や星の閨
ro: o-chisô ni suzukaze fuku ya hoshi no neya
en:
as an added treat
cool wind blows...
bedroom of stars

jp: .鳴な虫別るる恋はほしにさへ
ro: naku na mushi wakaruru koi wa hoshi ni sae
en:
don't cry, insects--
lovers part
even among the stars

jp: .月かげや山のすすきも祭らるる
ro: tsukikage ya yama no susuki mo matsurareru
en:
moonlight--
even the mountain's pampas grass
has a festival!

jp: .古き神古きすすきの名所哉
ro: furuki kami furuki susuki [no] meisho kana
en:
an old god
old pampas grass...
a famous resort

jp: .穂すすき諏訪の湖から来る風か
ro: ho susuki ni suwa no umi kara kuru kaze ka
en:
ripe pampas grass--
did the wind blowing you
come from Lake Suwa?

jp: .昼顔のもやうにからむかがし哉
ro: hirugao no moyô ni karamu kagaqshi kana
en:
his figure intertwined
with day flowers...
scarecrow

jp: .狗の通るたんびに鳴子かな
ro: enokoro no tôru tanbi ni naruko kana
en:
the puppy passes by
to admire it...
bird clapper

jp: .極楽に行かぬ果報やことし酒
ro: gokuraku ni ikanu kahô ya kotoshi sake
en:
this blessing
not allowed in Paradise...
new sake

jp: .さをしかの角に結びし手紙哉
ro: saoshika no tsuno ni musubishi tegami kana
en:
tied to the young
buck's antler...
a letter

jp: .鹿鳴や川をへだてて忍ぶ恋
ro: shika naku ya kawa wo hedatete shinobu koi
en:
they cry to each other
across a river
deer in love

jp: .ほたへるや犬なき里の鹿の声
ro: hotaeru ya inu naki sato no shika no koe
en:
barking--
in a village without dogs
cries of deer

jp: .鵙鳴て柿盗人をおどす也
ro: mozu naite kaki nusubito wo odosu nari
en:
the shrike hurling
threats
at the persimmon thief

jp: .鵙鳴や是より殺生禁断と
ro: mozu naku ya kore yori sesshô kindan to
en:
a shrike sings
"From now on, no meat
no fish!"

jp: .大組の空見おくるや小田の雁
ro: ôgumi no sora miokuru ya oda no kari
en:
seeing off
a big gang in the sky...
rice field geese

jp: .用心は雁もおき番寝ばん哉
ro: yôjin wa kari [mo] okiban neban kana
en:
how prudent!
the geese post guards
awake, asleep

jp: .叱らるることも馴てや渡り鳥
ro: shikararuru koto mo narete ya watari-dori
en:
getting used
to all the scoldings...
migrating birds

jp: .雀らも真似してとぶや渡り鳥
ro: suzumera mo mane shite tobu ya watari-dori
en:
the copycat sparrows
fly along...
migrating birds

jp: .何用に後へもどるぞ渡り鳥
ro: nan yô ni ato e modoru zo watari-dori
en:
what business brings you
back the wrong way?
migrating bird

jp: .渡り鳥の真似が下手ぞむら雀
ro: wata[ri]-dori no mane ga heta zo mura suzume
en:
poor imitators
of the migrating birds...
sparrows

jp: .今迄に穴にも入らで流れ蛇
ro: ima made ni ana ni mo irade nagare hebi
en:
still not in your hole
even now?
water snake

jp: .石となる楠さへ虫に喰れけり
ro: ishi to naru kusu sae mushi ni kuware keri
en:
even the stone-hard camphor tree
devoured
by insects

jp: .声々に虫も夜なべのさわぎ哉
ro: koe-goe ni mushi mo yonabe no sawagi kana
en:
voices of insects, too--
night work
ruckus

jp: .泰平の世にそばへてや虫の鳴く
ro: taihei no yo ni sobaete ya mushi no naku
en:
in a peaceful world
a mad frolic...
insects singing!

jp: .鳴ながら虫の乗行浮木かな
ro: naki nagara mushi no noriyuku ukigi kana
en:
still singing the insect
is swept away...
floating branch

jp: .鳴な虫だまって居ても一期也
ro: naku na mushi damatte ite mo ichi go nari
en:
don't sing, insects!
observe a period
of silence

jp: .虫の外にも泣事や藪の家
ro: mushi no soto ni mo nakigoto ya yabu no ie
en:
the insects outside
are grumbling too...
house in the trees

jp: .日ぐらしの涼しくしたる家陰哉
ro: higarashi no suzushiku shitaru ya kage kana
en:
a cicada
cools it down...
shade of the house

jp: .馬の耳ちょこちょこなぶるとんぼ哉
ro: uma no mimi choko-choko naburu tombo kana
en:
buzzing and teasing
the horse's ear...
dragonfly

jp: .立馬の鼻であしらふとんぼかな
ro: tachi uma no hana de ashirau tombo kana
en:
the horse's nose
gives him a sniff...
dragonfly

jp: .とんぼうや人と同じくはたをへる
ro: tombo ya hito to onajiku hata wo heru
en:
dragonfly--
like what people use
in their looms

jp: .町中や列を正して赤蜻蛉
ro: machi naka ya retsu wo tadashite aka tombo
en:
flying in formation
right through the town...
red dragonflies

jp: .草の花菌のゆへに踏れけり
ro: kusa no hana kinoko no yue ni fumare keri
en:
wildflowers
trampled thanks
to the mushrooms!

jp: .草花や露の底なる鐘の声
ro: kusabana ya tsuyu no soko naru kane no koe
en:
wildflowers--
in the depths of the dew
the bell tolls

jp: .大菊や杖の陰にて花もさく
ro: ôgiku ya tsue no kage nite hana mo saku
en:
big chrysanthemum--
in my walking stick's shadow
it blooms

jp: .隠家の糧にもなるやきくの花
ro: kakurega no kate ni mo naru [ya] kiku no hana
en:
it too becomes food
in the secluded house...
chrysanthemum

jp: .菊園や下向は左へ左へと
ro: kiku-zono ya gekô wa hidari e hidari e to
en:
chrysanthemum garden--
I bow my head
"To the left! the left!"

jp: .斯来よと菊の立けり這入口
ro: kô ko yo to kiku no tachi keri hairi-guchi
en:
"Come this way!"
a chrysanthemum stands
in the doorway

jp: .此おくへ斯う通れとや門の菊
ro: kono oku e kô tôre to ya kado no kiku
en:
"This way to the inside,
pass through!"
gate's chrysanthemum

jp: .斯う通れ通れとや門の菊
ro: kô tôre tôre to ya kado no kiku
en:
"This way, pass through
pass through!"
the gate's chrysanthemum

jp: .斯う通れとや門に立菊の花
ro: kô tôre to ya kado ni tatsu kiku no hana
en:
"Pass through this way!"
standing in the gate
a chrysanthemum

jp: .酒呑まぬ者入べからず菊の門
ro: sake nomanu mono iru[beka]razu kiku no kado
en:
nondrinkers
stay out!
gate to the chrysanthemums

jp: .侍にてうし持たせて菊の花
ro: samurai ni chôshi motasete kiku no hana
en:
letting the samurai
hold the sake dipper...
chrysanthemums

jp: .白妙の山も候きくの花
ro: shirotae no yama mo sôrô kiku no hana
en:
it's also
a white capped mountain...
chrysanthemum

jp: .其門に天窓うつなよ菊畠
ro: sono kado ni [atama] utsu na yo kiku hatake
en:
don't hit your head
on the gate!
chrysanthemum garden

jp: .負菊をじっと見直す独かな
ro: make kiku wo jitto minaosu hitori kana
en:
for my defeated chrysanthemum
a second hard look...
all alone

jp: .山里は小便所さへきくの花
ro: yama-zato wa shôben toko sae ki[ku no] hana
en:
mountain village--
even in the pissing place
a chrysanthemum!

jp: .鬼ばらに添ふて咲けり女郎花
ro: oni-bara ni soute saki keri ominaeshi
en:
blooming alongside
the devil bramble...
a maiden flower

jp: .松の木に少かくれて女郎花
ro: matsu no ki ni sukoshi kakurete ominaeshi
en:
some hidden
by the pine tree...
maiden flowers

jp: .くふ飯に蔦ぶら下る山家哉
ro: kuu meshi ni tsuta burasagaru yamaga kana
en:
ivy dangles
in my rice bowl...
mountain home

jp: .我垣やうき世の葛の花盛り
ro: waga kaki ya uki yo no kuzu no hana-zakari
en:
my fence--
the floating world's arrowroot
in full bloom

jp: .草花と握り添へたるいな穂哉
ro: kusabana to nigiri soetaru inaho kana
en:
garnishing the wildflower
bouquet...
heads of rice

jp: .子どもらが犬に負せる稲穂哉
ro: kodomora ga inu ni owaseru inaho kana
en:
the children load up
the dog...
heads of rice

jp: .旅人が薮にはさみし稲穂哉
ro: tabibito ga yabu ni hasamishi inaho kana
en:
the traveler clips some
in the thicket...
heads of rice

jp: .半分は汗の玉かよ稲の露
ro: hambun wa ase no tama ka yo ine no tsuyu
en:
is half of it
human sweat?
rice field dew

jp: .庵をふくたしに一株すすき哉
ro: io wo fuku tashi ni ikkabu susuki kana
en:
adding to my hut's
thatch, a smidgen
of pampas grass

jp: .折々に小滝をなぶる紅葉哉
ro: ori-ori ni ko taki wo naburu momiji kana
en:
taking turns
down the little waterfall...
red leaves

jp: .欠椀も同じ流れや立田川
ro: kake wan mo onaji nagare ya tachida-gawa
en:
a broken bowl also
floats downstream...
Tachida River

jp: .谷川の背に冷つくや夕紅葉
ro: tanigawa no se ni hiyatsuku ya yûmomiji
en:
cooling the back
of the valley stream...
evening's red leaves

jp: .掃溜も又一入の紅葉かな
ro: hakidame mo mata hitoshio no momiji kana
en:
the rubbish heap's
special ingredient...
red leaves

jp: .狗が敷いてねまりし一葉哉
ro: enokoro ga shiite nemarishi hito ha kana
en:
the puppy sprawling
for a nap...
a fallen leaf

jp: .桐の木や散らぬ一葉は虫の穴
ro: kiri no ki ya chiranu hito ha wa mushi no ana
en:
paulownia tree--
in the unfallen leaf
lives a bug

jp: .きり一葉数珠の置所と成りにけり
ro: kiri hito ha juzu no okidoko to nari [ni] keri
en:
the paulownia leaf
becomes
my rosary holder

jp: .幸に数珠のせておく一葉哉
ro: saiwai ni juzu nosete oku hito ha kana
en:
blessedly serving
as a rosary holder...
the fallen leaf

jp: .洪水の泥の一花木槿かな
ro: kôzui no doro ni hito hana mukuge kana
en:
in the mud
after the flood, one rose
of Sharon

jp: .今の世や山の栗にも夜番小屋
ro: ima no yo ya yama no kuri ni mo yoban goya
en:
the world today!
even for mountain chestnuts
a night watchman

jp: .まけぬきに栗の皮むく入歯哉
ro: make[nu] ki ni kuri no kawa muku ireba kana
en:
an indomitable soul--
a chestnut husk
a false tooth

jp: .海見ゆる芝に座とるや焼茸
ro: umi miyuru shiba ni za toru ya yaki kinoko
en:
watching the sea
sitting on the lawn...
roasted mushrooms

jp: .えんま王笑ひ菌をちと進れ
ro: enma-ô warai kinoko wo chito maire
en:
Emma, king of hell,
have a bite of laughing
mushrooms!

jp: .茸狩やおのがおちたるおとし穴
ro: kinokogari ya o[no]ga ochitaru otoshiana
en:
mushroom hunt--
into my own pit
I fall

jp: .鶏のかき出したる茸かな
ro: niwatori no kaki-idashitaru kinoko kana
en:
the chicken
scratches up
a mushroom

jp: .極楽の道が近よる寒さかな
ro: gokuraku no michi ga chikayoru samu[sa] kana
en:
the road to Paradise
draws nearer...
winter cold

jp: .しんしんとしんそこ寒し小行灯
ro: shin-shin to shin soko samushi ko andon
en:
down to the bone
bitter cold...
a little lantern

jp: .猫の穴から物をかふ寒さ哉
ro: neko no ana kara mono wo kau samu[sa] kana
en:
buying from the vendor
through the cat's door...
it's cold!

jp: .云訳に出すや硯の厚氷
ro: iiwake ni dasu ya suzuri no atsu kôri
en:
an apology to send--
my ink-stone's
thick ice

jp: .云訳の手がたに氷る硯かな
ro: iiwake no tegata ni [kôru} suzuri kana
en:
upon writing a note
of apology, ice
in my ink-stone

jp: .山寺は鋸引の氷柱かな
ro: yamadera wa nokogiribiki no tsurara kana
en:
mountain temple--
with a pull-saw cutting
icicles

jp: .うら町や大三十日の猫の恋
ro: uramachi ya ômisoka no neko no koi
en:
backstreet--
on the year's last day
a lover cat

jp: .背たけの箕をかぶる子やはつ時雨
ro: seitake no mi wo kaburu ko ya hatsu shigure
en:
with a winnow the boy
covers his head...
first winter rain

jp: .木がらしや数万の鳥のへちまくる
ro: kogarashi ya suman no tori no hechima kuru
en:
winter wind--
tens of thousands of birds
cursing!

jp: .はつ雪に一の宝尿瓶かな
ro: hatsu yuki ni hitotsu no takara shibin kana
en:
in the year's
first snowstorm a treasure!
the piss-pot

jp: .はつ雪や御きげんのよい御烏
ro: hatsu yuki ya o-kigen no yoi on-garasu
en:
first snowfall--
in a splendid mood
Sir Crow

jp: .はつ雪や酒屋幸つひとなり
ro: hatsu yuki ya sakaya saiwai tsui tonari
en:
first snowfall--
I'm so lucky the tavern's
next door

jp: .初雪やとは云ながら寝る思案
ro: hatsu yuki ya to wa ii nagara neru shian
en:
"First snowfall!"
I say but then
go to sleep

jp: .はつ雪やとはいふものの寝相だん
ro: hatsu yuki ya to wa iu mono no ne sodan
en:
"First snowfall!"
I say but then
"Let's go to bed"

jp: .はつ雪やなどと世にある人のいふ
ro: hatsu yuki ya nado to yo ni aru hito no iu
en:
"First snowfall, blah-blah"
people in the world
talk

jp: .犬どもがよけて居る也雪の道
ro: inu domo ga yoke[te] kure keri yuki no michi
en:
the dogs
make way for me...
snowy road

jp: .子どもらが雪喰ながら湯治かな
ro: kodomora ga yuki kui nagara tôji kana
en:
children eat snow
soaking
in the hot spring

jp: .橋下の乞食がいふや乞食雪
ro: hashi shita no kojiki ga iu ya kojiki yuki
en:
beggars talking
under a bridge...
a beggarly snow

jp: .山里や風呂にうめたる門の雪
ro: yama-zato ya furo ni umetaru kado no yuki
en:
mountain village--
plugging up the bath
snow at the gate

jp: .霜の夜や横丁曲る迷子鉦
ro: shimo no yo ya yokochô magaru maigo-gane
en:
frosty night--
ringing a bell for the lost child
'round a corner

jp: .けふからは薬利くべし神迎
ro: kyô kara wa kusuri kikubeshi kami mukae
en:
from today on
may my medicine work!
welcoming the gods

jp: .ちえ粥をなめ過したる雀哉
ro: chie-gayu wo name-sugoshitaru suzume kana
en:
gorging himself
on the temple's gruel...
sparrow

jp: .ちえ粥をなめて口利く雀哉
ro: chie-gayu wo namete kuchi kiku suzume kana
en:
after licking the temple's gruel
talking
sparrows

jp: .寒声につかはれ給ふ念仏かな
ro: kangoe ni tsukaware tamau nebutsu kana
en:
for my winter voice drills
chanting praises
to Buddha!

jp: .寒声に念仏をつかふ寝覚哉
ro: kangoe ni nembutsu wo tsukau nezame kana
en:
for my winter voice drills
"Praise Buddha!"...
insomnia

jp: .寒声や乞食小屋の娘の子
ro: kangoe ya kojiki goya no musume no ko
en:
winter voice drills
in the beggar's little hut...
little girl

jp: .跡供に犬の鳴く也寒念仏
ro: atodomo ni inu no naku nari kan nebutsu
en:
trailing behind
the dog barks along...
winter prayers

jp: .つぐらから猫が面出すいろり哉
ro: tsugura kara neko ga tsura dasu irori kana
en:
from a straw basket
the cat's face...
by the hearth

jp: .としよりやいろり明りに賃仕事
ro: toshiyori ya irori akari ni chin shigoto
en:
growing old--
by the hearth's light
piecework

jp: .煤竹や仏の顔も一なぐり
ro: susutake [ya] hotoke no kao mo hito naguri
en:
bamboo soot broom--
Buddha's face too
gets a smack

jp: .煤はきや我は人形につかはるる
ro: susu haki ya waga wa ningyô ni tsukawaruru
en:
soot sweeping--
I do it
with a doll

jp: .節き候のとりおとさぬや藪の家
ro: sekizoro no toriotosanu ya yabu no ie
en:
Twelfth Month singers--
don't forget
my house in the trees!

jp: .木がくれやとしとりもちもひとりつく
ro: kogakure ya toshitori mochi mo hitori tsuku
en:
tree shade--
an old man pounds rice cakes
alone

jp: .古ばばが丸める餅の口伝哉
ro: furu baba ga marumeru mochi no kuden kana
en:
old granny teaches
her secret...
rice cakes perfectly round

jp: .老松と二人で年を忘れけり
ro: oi matsu to futari de toshi wo wasure keri
en:
with the old pine
the two of us...
forgetting the year

jp: .跡の子はわざと転ぶやとしの豆
ro: ato no ko wa waza to korobu toshi no mama
en:
my child takes a tumble
on purpose...
the year's last day

jp: .今夜から正月分ンぞ子ども衆
ro: konya kara shôgatsubun zo kodomoshû
en:
after this night
a new year dawns!
children

jp: .鬼の出た跡はき出してあぐら哉
ro: oni no deta ato hakidashite agura kana
en:
driving out demons
sweeping out beans...
now I sit cross-legged

jp: .うき旅も炬燵でとしをとりにけり
ro: uki tabi mo kotatsu de toshi wo tori ni keri
en:
on a restless journey
by a brazier, a year
older

jp: .膳先の猫にも年をとらせけり
ro: zen saki no neko ni mo toshi wo torase keri
en:
the cat at my
dinner tray too...
a year older

jp: .紙衣きる世にさへのぞみ好哉
ro: kamiko kiru yo ni sae nozomi konomi kana
en:
even for paper robe
wearers...
fashion trends

jp: .負けぬ気も紙子似合ふと云れけり
ro: makenu ki mo kamiko niau to iware keri
en:
an indomitable spirit
suits paper robes...
they say

jp: .南天に一ッかぶせる頭巾哉
ro: nanten ni hitotsu kabuseru zukin kana
en:
on the head
of the sacred bamboo...
winter skullcap

jp: .赤足袋を手におっぱめる子ども哉
ro: aka tabi wo te ni oppameru kodomo kana
en:
trying the red toe socks
on his hands...
the child

jp: .拇の出てから足袋の長さ哉
ro: oyayubi no dete kara tabi no nagasa kana
en:
my big toes
stick out, such well-worn
toe socks!

jp: .老たりな衾かぶるもどっこいな
ro: oitari na fusuma kaburu mo dokkoi na
en:
so old--
even covering myself with a quilt
"Heave ho!"

jp: .小衾やつづらの中に寝る僧都
ro: o-fusama ya tsuzura no naka ni neru sôzu
en:
tucked in a little quilt
in vines, asleep...
scarecrow

jp: .病つかうてかぶる衾かな
ro: yamai tsukaute kaburu fusuma kana
en:
while sick
I wear it on my head...
winter quilt

jp: .身代の地蔵菩薩や雪礫
ro: migawari no jizô bosatsu ya yukitsubute
en:
holy Jizo
is my scapegoat...
snowballs

jp: .雪隠とうしろ合せや冬籠
ro: setchin to ushiro awa[se] ya fuyugomori
en:
right behind
the outhouse...
my winter retreat

jp: .雪隠と背合せや冬籠
ro: setchin to senaka awase ya fuyugomori
en:
back to back--
the outhouse
and my winter retreat

jp: .猫の穴から物買って冬篭り
ro: neko no ana kara mono katte fuyugomori
en:
buying from the vendor
through the cat's door...
winter seclusion

jp: .人誹る会が立なり冬籠
ro: hito soshiru kai ga tatsunari fuyugomori
en:
the slander parties
begin...
winter seclusion

jp: .親達は斯抱かれたるたんぽ哉
ro: oyatachi wa kô dakaretaru tanpo kana
en:
my parents
hugged it this way, once...
hot water bottle

jp: .一廻りまはりて戻るたんぽ哉
ro: hito mawari mawarite modoru tanpo kana
en:
moving and moving
then back where it started...
foot-warmer

jp: .負くじの僧がはなさぬ湯婆哉
ro: make kuji no sô ga hanasanu tanpo kana
en:
the priest who lost
the lottery won't give it up...
hot water bottle

jp: .我恋は夜ごとごとの湯婆哉
ro: waga koi wa yoru goto-goto no tampo kana
en:
my love life--
all night long
with my foot-warmer

jp: .童が天窓へのせるたんぽかな
ro: warabe ga atama e noseru tanpo kana
en:
the child lays it
on his head...
foot warmer

jp: .炭の火に月落烏啼にけり
ro: sumi no hi ni tsuki ochi karasu naki ni keri
en:
by the charcoal fire
after the moon has set
a crow caws

jp: .炭迄も鋸引や京住居
ro: sumi made mo nokogiri hiku ya kyô-zumai
en:
they even cut charcoal
with a saw!
life in Kyoto

jp: .はかり炭一升買の安気哉
ro: hakari sumi isshô kau no anki kana
en:
weighing charcoal--
one measure buys
peace of mind

jp: .むづかしやわずみ点ずみ白いすみ
ro: muzukashi ya wazumi tenzumi shiroi sumi
en:
a hard choice--
round charcoal, nuggets
or white

jp: .老僧が炭の打ったを手がら哉
ro: rôsô ga sumi no otta wo tegara kana
en:
for the old priest
breaking charcoal...
a feat

jp: .ひよ鳥のちょこちょこ見廻ふかけ菜哉
ro: hiyodori no choko-choko mi mau kake na kana
en:
a bulbul-bird bustles
around inspecting...
vegetables hung to dry

jp: .蛇の鮨も喰かねぬ也薬なら
ro: ja no sushi mo kuwa-kanenu nari kusuri nara
en:
even snake sushi
is given a try...
winter medicine

jp: .相ばんに猫も並ぶや薬喰
ro: shôban ni neko mo narabu ya kusuri kuu
en:
even the cat
lines up for his share...
taking medicine

jp: .ひとり身や薬喰にも都迄
ro: hitori mi ya kusuri kuu ni mo miyako made
en:
my life alone--
just to take medicine
a trip to Kyoto

jp: .うす壁や鼠穴よりみそさざい
ro: usu kabe ya nezumi ana yori misosazai
en:
thin wall--
from the mouse's hole
a wren!

jp: .雪国や土間の小すみのねぶか畠
ro: yukiguni ya doma no kosumi no nebuka hata
en:
snow country--
dirt floor's little corner
a leek garden

jp: .霜がれや引っくり返る鹿の椀
ro: shimogare ya hikkurikaeru shika no wan
en:
frost-killed grass--
the deer's bowl
upside-down

jp: .江戸風を吹かせて行くや蝦夷が島
ro: edo kaze wo fukasete yuku ya ezo ga shima
en:
making the wind blow
in Edo...
Hokkaido

jp: .おのづから頭が下る也神ぢ山
ro: onozukara zu ga sagaru nari kamiji yama
en:
by itself
my head bows...
Mount Kamiji

jp: .あら玉や江戸はへぬきの男松
ro: aratama ya edo haenuki no otoko matsu
en:
a new year--
an Edo born and bred
black pine

jp: .梅さくや先あら玉の御制札
ro: ume sake ya mazu aratama no o-seisatsu
en:
plum trees will bloom
but first the new year's
edicts

jp: .正月の二日ふたつとなまけけり
ro: shôgatsu no futsuka futatsu to namake keri
en:
by First Month's
second day, second day...
lazy again

jp: .正月や店をかざれる番太郎
ro: shôgatsu ya mise wo kazareru bantarô
en:
for New Year's
he's decorated his little shop...
gatekeeper

jp: .小便もうかとはならずけさの春
ro: shôben mo uka to wa narazu kesa no haru
en:
even pissing
should be done with care...
spring's first dawn

jp: .散る雪も行儀正しやけさの春
ro: chi[ru] yuki mo gyôgi tadashi ya kesa no haru
en:
even the snow falls
graciously...
spring's first dawn

jp: .武士町やしんかんとして明の春
ro: bushi machi ya shinkan to shite ake no haru
en:
the samurai street
perfectly silent
spring's first dawn

jp: .春立や愚の上に又愚にかへる
ro: haru tatsu ya gu no ue ni mata gu ni kaeru
en:
spring begins--
more foolishness
for this fool

jp: .正月は青葉のかゆも祝かな
ro: shôgatsu wa aona no kayu mo iwai kana
en:
in First Month
even a gruel of greens
a celebration

jp: .三寸の胸ですむ也店おろし
ro: san-zun no mune de sumu nari tana oroshi
en:
there's so little
I do it in my head...
New Year's inventory

jp: .不士山もかぞへ込けり店おろし
ro: fuji-san mo kazoe-komi keri tana oroshi
en:
even Mount Fuji
makes the list...
New Year's inventory

jp: .物陰に笑ふ鼠や店おろし
ro: monokage ni warau nezumi ya tana oroshi
en:
hidden in shadows
a laughing mouse...
New Year's inventory

jp: .とし玉を天窓におくやちいさい子
ro: toshi-dama wo atama ni oku ya chiisai ko
en:
her New Year's present
laid on her head...
little child

jp: .とし玉のさいそくに来る孫子哉
ro: toshidama no saisoku ni kuru magoko kana
en:
clamoring for New Year's
gifts, children
and grandchildren

jp: .すりこ木と並べて張るはつ暦
ro: surikogi to narabete haru ya hatsu-goyomi
en:
spread out
alongside the pestle
the new almanac

jp: .どち向て酒を呑ぞよはつ暦
ro: dochi muite sake wo nomu zo yo hatsu-goyomi
en:
which lucky direction
for drinking sake?
the new almanac

jp: .乞食やもらひながらのはつ笑ひ
ro: kojiki ya morai nagara no hatsu warai
en:
a beggar receives
alms, the year's first
laughter

jp: .一はなに猫がいねつむ座敷哉
ro: hito hana ni neko ga ine tsumu zashiki kana
en:
the cat steals
a New Year's nap...
sitting room

jp: .膝の子も口を明く也はつうたひ
ro: hiza no ko mo kuchi wo aku nari hatsu utai
en:
even the lap-baby
joins in...
year's first song

jp: .わか水やわらが浮ても福といふ
ro: wakamizu [ya] wara ga uite mo fuku to iu
en:
year's first water--
even a floating straw
they call "lucky!"

jp: .ままっ子やつぎだらけなる凧
ro: mamakko ya tsugi darake naru ikanobori
en:
stepchild--
the kite covered with patches
is his

jp: .もともとの一人前ぞ雑煮膳
ro: motomoto no ichininmae zo zôni zen
en:
like in the beginning
just one helping...
zoni on the table

jp: .人真似に歯茎がための豆腐哉
ro: hito mane ni ha-guki-gatame no tôfu kana
en:
imitating others
hardening their teeth...
tofu for me

jp: .七草は隣のおとで置にけり
ro: nanakusa wa tonari no oto de oki ni keri
en:
pounding the seven herbs--
my next door neighbor
in sync

jp: .初声はあはう烏でなかりけり
ro: hatsu koe wa awau karasu de nakari keri
en:
year's first birdsong--
and not a foolish
crow!

jp: .鶯はきかぬ気でなく余寒かな
ro: uguisu wa kikanu ki de naku yokan kana
en:
the nightingale sings
despite it all...
winter lingers

jp: .彼岸迄とは申せども寒哉
ro: higan made to wa môsedo mo samusa kana
en:
"Fair weather by spring's equinox"
so they say...
liars!

jp: .長の日や沈香も焚かず屁もひらず
ro: naga no hi ya jinkô mo takazu he mo hirazu
en:
a long day--
no incense
no farts

jp: .鶏の座敷を歩く日永哉
ro: niwatori no zashiki wo aruku hi naga kana
en:
a chicken strolls
through the sitting room...
a long day

jp: .淡雪や連出して行く薮の雪
ro: awayuki ya tsuredashite yuku yabu no yuki
en:
the light spring snow
melts alongside it...
snow in the thicket

jp: .紅皿にうはうけにけり春の雪
ro: beni-zara ni uwauke ni keri haru no yuki
en:
into the red dish
flitting down...
spring snow

jp: .薮の雪を連出すや春の雪
ro: yabu no yuki wo tsuredasu ya haru no yuki
en:
a melting escort
for snow in the thicket...
spring snow

jp: .白妙の雪の上也春の雨
ro: shirotae no yuki no ue nari haru no ame
en:
on the white blanket
of snow...
spring rain

jp: .山里も銭湯わいて春の雨
ro: yama-zato mo sentô waite haru no ame
en:
even in a mountain village
a public bath is ready...
spring rain

jp: .春風や武士も吹るる女坂
ro: haru kaze ya bushi mo fukaruru onnazaka
en:
spring breeze--
even a samurai is blown
down the slope

jp: .錦着て夜行く人やおぼろ月
ro: nijiki kite yoru iku hito ya oboro-zuki
en:
wearing brocade
he walks in the night...
hazy moon

jp: .しなの路やそれ霞それ雪が降る
ro: shinano ji ya sore kasumu sore yuki ga furu
en:
Shinano road--
spring mist
and snow falling

jp: .空色の傘もかすむや女坂
ro: sora iro no kasa mo kasumu ya onnazaka
en:
sky-blue umbrellas
in the mist too...
gentle slope

jp: .大仏は赤いかすみの衣かな
ro: daibutsu wa akai kasumi no koromo kana
en:
the great bronze Buddha
cloaked
in red mist

jp: .陽炎や庵の庭のつくば山
ro: kagerô ya iori no niwa no tsukuba yama
en:
heat shimmers--
from the hut's garden
Mount Tsukuba

jp: .陽炎やそば屋が前の箸の山
ro: kagerô ya sobaya ga mae no hashi no yama
en:
heat shimmers--
in front of the noodle shop
a chopstick mountain

jp: .米の字にきへ残りけり門の雪
ro: kome no ji ni sae nokori keri kado no yuki
en:
the gate's melting snow
forms the word
"rice!"

jp: .一押は紅葉也けり雪げ川
ro: hito oshi wa momiji nari keri yukige kawa
en:
one push
is all red leaves...
river of melting snow

jp: .苗代のむら直りけり夜の雨
ro: nawashiro no mura naori keri yoru no ame
en:
fixing the unevenness
in the rice-seedling bed...
evening rain

jp: .花の所へ雪が降る涅槃哉
ro: hana no tokoro e yuki ga furu nehan kana
en:
snow falls
instead of blossoms...
Buddha's Death-Day

jp: .寺町は犬も団子のひがん哉
ro: tera machi wa inu mo dango no higan kana
en:
temple town--
for the dog, too
an equinox dumpling

jp: .出代や山越て見る京の空
ro: degawari ya yama koshite miru kyô no sora
en:
migrating servants
crossing the mountain see...
Kyoto's sky

jp: .男なればぞ出代るやちいさい子
ro: otoko nareba zo degawaru ya chiisai ko
en:
becoming a man
this migrating servant...
a little child

jp: .五十里の江戸を出代る子ども哉
ro: go jû ri no edo [wo] degawaru kodomo kana
en:
a hundred miles to Edo
and his new job...
the child servant

jp: .旅笠や唄で出代るぞえど見坂
ro: tabi-gasa ya uta de degawaru edo misaka
en:
with traveling umbrella-hats
migrating servants sing...
Edo hillside

jp: .出代や十ばかりでもおとこ山
ro: degawari ya jû bakari demo otoko yama
en:
migrating servants--
about ten
on the steep slope

jp: .雛棚に糞をして行く雀哉
ro: hina-dana ni hako wo shite yuku suzume kana
en:
to the doll's shelf
he comes crapping...
sparrow

jp: .人通る道を残して田打哉
ro: hito tôru michi wo nokoshite ta uchi kana
en:
leaving just enough room
for a man to walk...
plowing the rice field

jp: .菜の畠打や談義を聞ながら
ro: na [no] hata uchi ya dangi wo kiki nagara
en:
plowing the field
listening to
the sermon

jp: .畠打や通してくれる寺参
ro: hata uchi ya tôshite kureru tera mairi
en:
the plowman lets me
cross his field...
temple pilgrimage

jp: .山人や畠打に出る二里三里
ro: yamaudo ya hata uchi [ni] deru ni ri san ri
en:
mountain man--
off to plow his field
five, six miles away

jp: .雨の夜や勘当されし猫の恋
ro: ame no yo ya kandôsareshi neko no koi
en:
on a rainy night
banished from the house
lover cat

jp: .浄破利のかがみは見ぬか猫の恋
ro: jôhari no kagami wa minu ka neko no koi
en:
not a peek
at hell's mirror?
lover cat

jp: .女猫子ゆへの盗とく逃よ
ro: onna neko ko yue no nusumi toku nige yo
en:
mother cat
steals for her kittens...
run faster!

jp: .人中を猫も子故のぬすみ哉
ro: hitonaka wo neko mo ko yue no nusumi kana
en:
from the human race
for her kittens' sake...
mother cat steals

jp: .君が家雀も家はもちにけり
ro: kimi ga ie suzume mo ie wa mochi ni keri
en:
at your house
the sparrow, too
makes a home

jp: .猫の飯相伴するや雀の子
ro: neko no meshi shôban suru ya suzume no ko
en:
sharing the food
in the cat's dish...
baby sparrow

jp: .牢屋から出たり入ったり雀の子
ro: rôya kara detari ittari suzume no ko
en:
in and out
of prison they go...
baby sparrows

jp: .鶯のこそと掃溜栄やう哉
ro: uguisu no koso to hakidame eyô kana
en:
the nightingale's secret--
the rubbish heap
is a luxury

jp: .鶯の若い声なり苔清水
ro: uguisu no wakai koe nari koke shimizu
en:
the nightingale's voice
sounds young...
pure water over moss

jp: .金の蔓でも見つけたか雉の声
ro: kane no tsuru demo mitsuketa ka kiji no koe
en:
is it a golden vine
you've found?
pheasant's cry

jp: .引明や鶏なき里の雉の声
ro: hikiake ya tori naki sato no kiji no koe
en:
daybreak--
in a rooster-less village
a pheasant's cry

jp: .江戸の水呑みおふせてやかへる雁
ro: edo no mizu nomi ôsete ya kaeru kari
en:
drinking Edo's water
at last...
returning geese

jp: .浅黄蝶浅黄頭巾の世也けり
ro: asagi chô asagi zukin no yo nari keri
en:
it's become a world
of pale blue butterflies!
pale blue skullcaps!

jp: .御座敷の隅からすみへ小てふ哉
ro: o-zashiki no sumi kara sumi e ko chô kana
en:
sitting room
from one corner to another...
little butterfly

jp: .籠の鳥蝶をうらやむ目つき哉
ro: kago no tori chô wo urayamu metsuki kana
en:
caged bird--
watching the butterfly
with envy

jp: .菓子盆やはしの先よりとぶ小てふ
ro: kashi bon ya hashi no saki yori tobu ko chô
en:
dessert tray--
from my chopstick's tip
a little butterfly flies

jp: .草の蝶何をすねるぞ小一日
ro: kusa no chô nani wo suneru zo ko ichinichi
en:
meadow butterfly
why are you sulking?
all day

jp: .蝶とぶや児這ひつけばつけば又
ro: chô tobu ya chigo hai-tsukeba tsukeba mata
en:
the butterfly flits
when baby crawls
when baby crawls

jp: .蝶一ッ仲間ぬけしてすねるかよ
ro: chô hitotsu nakama nukeshite suneru ka yo
en:
one butterfly
apart from the crowd...
are you sulking?

jp: .ちりひじの山より上へ小てふかな
ro: chirihiji no yama yori kami e ko chô kana
en:
from the rubbish mountain
taking off...
little butterfly

jp: .湯の中や首から首へとぶ小蝶
ro: yu no naka ya kubi kara kubi e tobu ko chô
en:
hot tub--
from head to head flitting
little butterfly

jp: .古郷は家根のわか草つみにけり
ro: furusato wa yane no wakakusa tsumi ni keri
en:
my home village--
picking baby grass
off the rooftops

jp: .木々の芽の春さめざめと小鳥鳴く也
ro: kigi [no] me no haru same-zame to ko tori naku nari
en:
for the budding trees' spring
a little bird
gushes song

jp: .梅さくや手垢に光るなで仏
ro: ume saku ya teaka ni hikaru nade-botoke
en:
plum blossoms--
gleaming from the hands
the rubbed Buddha

jp: .ここらから江戸のうちかよ梅の花
ro: kokora kara edo no uchi ka yo ume no hana
en:
hereabouts
are we still in Edo?
plum blossoms

jp: .はこするも暦見る也梅の花
ro: hako suru mo koyomi miru nari ume no hana
en:
even while pooping
reading his almanac...
plum blossoms

jp: .遠山の花に明るしうしろ窓
ro: tôyama no hana ni akarushi ushiro mado
en:
the distant mountain's
blossoms cast their light...
back window

jp: .産声に降りつもりけり花と金
ro: ubugoe ni furi tsumori keri hana to kane
en:
ready to fall
for baby's first cry...
blossoms and coins

jp: .えどを見に上る人哉花の山
ro: edo wo mi ni noboru hito kana hana no yama
en:
the man climbs
for a view of Edo...
blossoming mountains

jp: .さく花の雲の上にて寝起哉
ro: saku hana no kumo no ue nite neoki kana
en:
clouds of blossoms
below me...
waking up

jp: .空色の傘つづく也花の雲
ro: sora iro no kasa tsuzuku nari hana no kumo
en:
sky-blue parasols
one by one...
blossom clouds

jp: .花さくや京の美人の頬かぶり
ro: hana saku ya kyô no bijin no hohokaburi
en:
cherry blossoms--
the pretty women of Kyoto
cheeks wrapped in scarves

jp: .花咲くやそこらは野屎野小便
ro: hana saku ya sokora wa no-guso no shôben
en:
cherry blossoms--
in yonder field
pooping and pissing

jp: .花踏んだわらぢながらやどたどた寝
ro: hana funda waraji nagara ya dota-dota ne
en:
straw sandals stomp
on fallen blossoms...
they snore

jp: .人々や笠きて花の雲に入
ro: hito-bito [ya] kasa kite hana no kumo ni iru
en:
wearing umbrella-hats
they enter the blossom
clouds

jp: .こちとらも目の正月ぞさくら花
ro: kochitora mo me no shôgatsu zo sakura hana
en:
we watch
with New Year's eyes...
cherry blossoms

jp: .山猿と呼ばるる里のさくら哉
ro: yama-zaru to yobaruru sato no sakura kana
en:
at a village called
Mountain Monkey...
cherry blossoms

jp: .よい所の片膝瘤や垂れ柳
ro: yoi toko no katahiza kobu ya tare yanagi
en:
at the good place
they show a kneecap!
drooping willow

jp: .夜に入れば遊女袖引く柳哉
ro: yo ni ireba yûjo sode hiku yanagi kana
en:
when night falls
whores tug at sleeves...
willow tree

jp: .六月もそぞろに寒し時の声
ro: rokugatsu mo sozoro ni samushi toki no koe
en:
though Sixth Month
it's strangely cold...
a time-tolling bell

jp: .六月はよりとし達の月よ哉
ro: rokugatsu wa yoritoshi-tachi no tsuki yo kana
en:
Sixth Month--
just for the old folks
a bright moon

jp: .炎天のとっぱづれ也炭を焼
ro: enten no toppazure nari sumi wo yaku
en:
at the edge
of the sweltering day...
burning charcoal

jp: .草葉より暑い風吹く座敷哉
ro: kusaba yori atsui kaze fuku zashiki kana
en:
from blades of grass
a hot wind blows...
sitting room

jp: .洪水の川から帰るあつさ哉
ro: kôzui no kawa kara kaeru atsusa kana
en:
reflected
off the flooded river...
the heat

jp: .涼風も身に添ぬ也鳴烏
ro: suzukaze mo mi ni sowanu nari naku karasu
en:
even the cool breeze
doesn't feel right...
a crow caws

jp: .涼風や仏のかたより吹給ふ
ro: suzukaze ya hotoke no kata yori fuki-tamau
en:
cool breeze--
from Buddha's direction
blowing a blessing

jp: .涼しさやどこに住んでもふじの山
ro: suzushisa ya doko ni sunde mo fuji no yama
en:
cool air--
wherever you live
it's Mount Fuji!

jp: .涼しさや夜水のかかる井戸の音
ro: suzushisa ya yo mizu no kakaru ido no oto
en:
cool air--
the sound of well water
drawn at night

jp: .朝顔の花から土用入りにけり
ro: asagao no hana kara doyô iri ni keri
en:
from the morning-glory's
blossom
midsummer begins

jp: .鶯に土用休はなかりけり
ro: uguisu ni doyô yasumi wa nakari keri
en:
for the nightingale
there's no break...
midsummer heat

jp: .此雨は天から土用見廻かな
ro: kono ame wa ten kara doyô mimai kana
en:
this rain
a greeting card from heaven...
midsummer heat

jp: .吹風も土用休みか草の原
ro: fuku kaze mo doyô yasumi ka kusa no hara
en:
is the wind
on summer vacation?
grassy field

jp: .降る雨もけふより土用休哉
ro: furu ame mo kyô yori doyô yasumi kana
en:
from today on
the rain's summer vacation...
midsummer heat

jp: .湯も浴て土用しらずの座敷哉
ro: yu mo abite doyô shirazu no zashiki kana
en:
soaking in a hot tub
midsummer's heat forgotten...
sitting room

jp: .夕立やたたいて諷ふ貧乏樽
ro: yûdachi ya tataite utau bimbôdaru
en:
rainstorm--
beating a song
on the old keg

jp: .夕立や登城の名主組がしら
ro: yûdachi ya tojô no nanushi kumigashira
en:
a rainstorm--
running to the castle
village headman and sergeant

jp: .夕立や枕にしたる貧乏樽
ro: yûdachi ya makura ni shitaru bimbôdaru
en:
rainstorm--
using an old keg
for a pillow

jp: .夕立や蓑きてごろり大鼾
ro: yûdachi ya mino kite gorori ôibiki
en:
rainstorm--
in his straw raincoat
snoring loud

jp: .梢から蛙はやせり雲の峰
ro: kozue kara kawazu hayaseri kumo no mine
en:
clinging to a twig
a frog cheers...
billowing clouds

jp: .羽団扇で招き出したか雲の峰
ro: ha uchiwa de maneki-dashita ka kumo no mine
en:
did my feathered fan
summon you?
billowing clouds

jp: .子は鼾親はわらうつ夏の月
ro: ko wa ibiki oya wa wara utsu natsu no tsuki
en:
the child snores
the mother pounds straw...
summer moon

jp: .寝せつけし子のせんたくや夏の月
ro: ne-setsukeshi ko no sentaku ya natsu no tsuki
en:
her child tucked in
she washes his clothes...
summer moon

jp: .夏山や鶯雉ほととぎす
ro: natsu yama ya uguisu kigisu hototogisu
en:
summer mountain--
nightingale, pheasant
and cuckoo!

jp: .山里は米をつかする清水かな
ro: yama-zato wa kome wo tsukasuru shimizu kana
en:
mountain village--
pure water
husks the rice

jp: .青い田の露を肴やひとり酒
ro: aoi ta no tsuyu wo sakana ya hitori sake
en:
the green rice field's dew
my side dish...
drinking alone

jp: .晴天と一ッ色也日傘
ro: seiten to hitotsu iro nari higarakasa
en:
same color
as the clear blue sky...
parasol

jp: .山水に米を搗かせて昼寝哉
ro: yama mizu ni kome wo tsukasete hirune kana
en:
making mountain
water husk the rice...
midday nap

jp: .白扇風のおとさへ新らしき
ro: shiro ôgi kaze no oto sae atarashiki
en:
a white fan--
the sound of wind
sounds new!

jp: .大将が馬をあをぐや白扇
ro: ôshô ga uma wo aogu ya shira ôgi
en:
the general cools off
his horse...
white paper fan

jp: .松に腰かけて土民も扇哉
ro: matsu ni koshi kakete domin mo ôgi kana
en:
also left hanging
in the pine...
the farmer's paper fan

jp: .皺顔にかざされにけり江戸団扇
ro: shiwa kao ni kazasare ni keri edo uchiwa
en:
shielding a wrinkled
face...
paper fan of Edo

jp: .吹風のさらさら団扇団扇哉
ro: fuku kaze no sara-sara uchiwa uchiwa kana
en:
wind blowing
paper fans rustling
rustling

jp: .孤が手本にするや反故うちは
ro: minashigo ga tehon ni suru ya hogu uchiwa
en:
the orphan
makes his from scratch...
wastepaper fan

jp: .我手には同じ団扇も重き哉
ro: waga te ni wa onaji uchiwa mo omoki kana
en:
in my hand
the same paper fan
now feels heavy

jp: .身の上の鐘と知りつつ夕涼み
ro: mi no ue no kane to shiritsutsu yûsuzumi
en:
knowing the bell
rings away life...
evening cool

jp: .門口に湯を蒔ちらす夕涼み
ro: kado-guchi ni yu wo makichirasu yûsuzumi
en:
at the gate
scattering hot water...
evening cool

jp: .祟りなす木ともしらでやかんこ鳥
ro: tatari nasu ki to mo shirade ya kankodori
en:
unaware
the tree is cursed...
mountain cuckoo

jp: .まがきなど優に見へてもかんこ鳥
ro: magaki nado yû ni miete mo kankodori
en:
inspecting the fence
thoroughly...
mountain cuckoo

jp: .赤馬の鼻で吹たる蛍かな
ro: aka uma no hana de fukitaru hotaru kana
en:
blown off by a snort
of the red horse...
firefly

jp: .馬の屁に吹とばされし蛍哉
ro: uma no he ni fuki-tobasareshi hotaru kana
en:
blown away
by the horse's fart...
firefly

jp: .薮寺やみだの膝よりとぶ蛍
ro: yabu tera ya mida no hiza yori yobu hotaru
en:
temple in the thicket--
from Amida Buddha's lap
fireflies

jp: .又来たぞ手の盃を火とり虫
ro: mata kita zo te no sakazuki wo hitorimushi
en:
settling again
on the sake cup I hold...
tiger moth

jp: .大毛虫蟻の地獄におちにけり
ro: ô kemushi ari no jigoku ni ochi ni keri
en:
big caterpillar--
into the ants' hell
it has fallen

jp: .あばれ蚊のそれでも都そだち哉
ro: abare ka no soredemo miyako sodachi kana
en:
a pesky mosquito
though raised
in Kyoto

jp: .から紙のもようになるや蠅の屎
ro: karakami no moyô ni naru ya hae no kuso
en:
the sliding door's
decorative pattern...
fly shit

jp: .人有れば蝿あり仏ありにけり
ro: hito areba hae ari hotoke ari ni keri
en:
where there's people
there's flies
and Buddhas

jp: .むれる蠅皺手に何の味がある
ro: mureru hae shiwade ni nanno aji ga aru
en:
swarming flies
how do my wrinkled hands
taste?

jp: .野らの人の連に昼寝やかたつむり
ro: nora no hito no tsure ni hirune ya katatsumuri
en:
taking a siesta
with the farmer...
a snail

jp: .烏メにしてやられけり冷し瓜
ro: karasu me ni shite yarare keri hiyashi uri
en:
the crow
has snatched it away...
cooling melon

jp: .卯の花や本まの雪もさかり降る
ro: u no hana ya honma no yuki mo sa[ka]ri furu
en:
deutzia blossoms
in full bloom
and a real snowstorm!

jp: .下々国の茨も正覚とりにけり
ro: gege koku no bara mo shôgaku tori ni keri
en:
even wild roses
of a downtrodden land
reach enlightenment

jp: .風冷りひひやり秋や辰のとし
ro: kaze hiyari hiiyari aki ya tatsu no toshi
en:
a chilly wind
a chilly autumn...
Year of the Dragon

jp: .おさな子や笑ふにつけて秋の暮
ro: o[sa]nago ya warau ni tsukete aki no kure
en:
the laughter of a child
in the autumn
dusk

jp: .小言いふ相手のほしや秋の暮
ro: kogoto iu aite no hoshi ya aki no kure
en:
I wish I had
my companion to nag...
autumn dusk

jp: .小言いふ相手は壁ぞ秋の暮
ro: kogoto iu aite wa kabe zo aki no kure
en:
the only one to nag now
is the wall...
autumn dusk

jp: .翌はなき月の名所を夜の雨
ro: asu wa naki tsuki no meisho wo yoru no ame
en:
no moon tomorrow
in this famous resort...
evening rain

jp: .小言いふ相手もあらばけふの月
ro: kogoto iu aite mo araba kyô no tsuki
en:
if only she were here
for me to nag...
tonight's moon!

jp: .十五夜のよい御しめりよよい月夜
ro: jûgoya no yoi o-shimeri yo yoi tsuki yo
en:
night of the 15th--
good rain shower
good moon

jp: .十五夜や雨見のすすき女郎花
ro: jûgoya ya ame mi no susuki ominaeshi
en:
on harvest moon night
rain gazing...
pampas grass, maiden flowers

jp: .名月やつい指先の名所山
ro: meigetsu ya tsui yubi saki no meisho yama
en:
harvest moon--
the famous mountain
just a fingertip

jp: .夕立やしかも八月曙ﾜ日
ro: yûdachi ya shikamo hachigetsu jûgo nichi
en:
a rainstorm--
but on the 15th
of Eighth Month!

jp: .秋風や団扇もよはる手もよはる
ro: aki kaze ya uchiwa [mo] yowaru te mo yowaru
en:
autumn wind--
weakens the fan
weakens the hand

jp: .秋風や角力の果の道心坊
ro: akikaze ya sumô no hate no dôshinbô
en:
autumn wind--
the former sumo wrestler
a begging priest

jp: .唐紙の引手の穴を秋の風
ro: karakami no hikite no ana wo aki no kaze
en:
through the sliding door's
knob hole...
autumn wind

jp: .山犬や鳴口からも霧の立
ro: yama inu ya naku kuchi kara mo kiri no tatsu
en:
from the wild dog's
howling too, rising
mist

jp: .山寺や破風口からも霧の立
ro: yamadera ya hafu kuchi kara mo kiri no tatsu
en:
mountain temple--
from the gables rising
mist

jp: .翌は玉棚になるとも祭り哉
ro: asu wa tama-dana ni naru to mo matsuri kana
en:
tomorrow I might be
an ancestor at the altar...
Bon Festival

jp: .瓜の馬御仏並にをがまるる
ro: uri no uma mi-botoke nami ni ogamaruru
en:
horse-shaped melons
and ancestors
worshipped together

jp: .稲葉見て罪つくりけり墓参り
ro: ineba mite tsumi tsukuri keri haka mairi
en:
to look at harvested
rice a sin...
visiting graves

jp: .古犬が先に立也はか参り
ro: furu inu ga saki ni tatsu nari hakamairi
en:
the old dog
leads the way...
visiting graves

jp: .摂待のあいそに笑ひ仏かな
ro: settai no aiso ni warai hotoke kana
en:
laughing politely
while tea is served...
Buddha

jp: .摂待の茶にさへ笑ひむすめ哉
ro: settai no cha ni sae warai musume kana
en:
even the temple tea
makes her laugh...
little girl

jp: .摂待やけふも八十八どころ
ro: settai ya kyô mo hachi jû hachi-dokoro
en:
reception tea
today
in 88 temples

jp: .摂待や猫がうけとる茶釜番
ro: settai ya neko ga uketoru chagamaban
en:
temple tea--
the cat is served
too

jp: .見物に地蔵も並ぶおどり哉
ro: kenbutsu ni jizô mo narabu odori kana
en:
looking on, holy Jizo
lines up too...
dance for the dead

jp: .七夕に明渡す也留主の庵
ro: tanabata ni akewatasu nari rusu no io
en:
on Tanabata Night
no one at home
in the hut

jp: .七夕や乞食村でも迎ひ舟
ro: tanabata ya kojiki mura demo mukai fune
en:
Tanabata night--
even in beggar-town
star-gazing boats

jp: .星の御身にさへ別れ別れ哉
ro: hoshi no omi ni sae wakare wakare kana
en:
even among the stars
lovers must part!
must part!

jp: .目出度さはどれが彦星孫ぼしか
ro: medetasa wa [dore ga] hiko-boshi mago-boshi ka
en:
celebration--
which stars are the children?
grandchildren?

jp: .わかわかし星はことしも妻迎
ro: wakawakashi hoshi wa kotoshi mo tsuma mukae
en:
the young star
this year, once again
greets his wife

jp: .小言いふ相手もあらば菊の酒
ro: kogoto iu aite mo araba kiku no sake
en:
if only she were here
for me to nag...
mum festival sake

jp: .勝角力虫も踏ずにもどりけり
ro: kachi sumô mushi mo fumazu ni modori keri
en:
sumo champion--
he won't even step
on a bug

jp: .松の木に蛙も見るや宮角力
ro: matsu no ki ni kawazu mo miru ya miya sumô
en:
from the pines
frogs watch, too...
sumo match

jp: .宮角力蛙も木から声上る
ro: miya sumô kawazu mo ki kara koe ageru
en:
sumo match--
from trees the frogs, too
cheer

jp: .身の秋や月は無きずの月ながら
ro: mi no aki ya tsuki wa mukizu no tsuki nagara
en:
it's my life's autumn
but the moon
looks flawless

jp: .おく山の鹿も恋路に迷ふ哉
ro: oku yama no shika mo koi ji ni mayou kana
en:
deep-mountain deer
also stray off the path
to love

jp: .春日野や神もゆるしの鹿の恋
ro: kasugano ya kami mo yurushi no shika no koi
en:
Kasuga Field--
with the god's permission
deer make love

jp: .左右へぱっと散るや数万の渡り鳥
ro: sau e patto to chiru ya suman no watari-dori
en:
to left and right
dropping in a flash...
thousands of birds

jp: .行灯に鳴くつもりかよ青い虫
ro: andon ni naku tsumori ka yo aoi mushi
en:
do you want to sing
in the lamp too?
blue insect

jp: .俳人を済度に入れるか赤とんぼ
ro: haijin wo saido ni ireru ka aka tombô
en:
have you come
to save us haiku poets?
red dragonfly

jp: .きりぎりす鳴やつづいて赤子なく
ro: kirigirisu naku ya tsuzuite akago naku
en:
continuing the song
of the katydid...
a baby cries

jp: .家むねや鳥が蒔たる草の花
ro: ie mune ya tori ga maitaru kusa no hana
en:
roof of the house--
sown by the birds
wildflowers

jp: .今の世や菊一本も小ばん金
ro: ima no yo ya kiku ippon mo kobangane
en:
the world today!
for one chrysanthemum
a gold coin

jp: .大菊のてっぺんに寝る毛虫哉
ro: ôgiku no teppen ni neru kemushi kana
en:
atop the big chrysanthemum
asleep...
caterpillar

jp: .草庵に金をかす也菊の花
ro: sôan ni kane wo kasu nari kiku no hana
en:
in my thatched hut
profit grows...
chrysanthemum

jp: .大名と肩並べけりきくの花
ro: daimyô to kata narabe keri kiku no hana
en:
neck and neck
with the mighty lord...
chrysanthemum

jp: .朝顔や人の顔にはそつがある
ro: asagao ya hito no kao ni wa sotsu ga aru
en:
morning-glories--
people's faces seem
thrown together

jp: .大雨をくねり返すや女郎花
ro: ôame wo kuneri kaesu ya ominaeshi
en:
bending back
to face the big rain...
maiden flower

jp: .小便も玉と成りけり芋畠
ro: shôben mo tama to nari keri imo-batake
en:
piss also
turns to pearls...
field of yams

jp: .神風や畠の稲の五六尺
ro: kamikaze ya hatake no ine [no] go roku shaku
en:
divine wind--
the rice in the field
five, six feet tall

jp: .神風や畠の稲穂そよぐ也
ro: kamikaze ya hatake no inaho soyogu nari
en:
divine wind!
rice heads in the field
rustling

jp: .唐辛子終に青くて仕廻けり
ro: tôgarashi tsui ni aokute shimai keri
en:
red hot peppers
in the end, at last
turn blue

jp: .山陰や山伏むらの唐がらし
ro: yama kage ya yamabushi mura no tôgarashi
en:
mountain shade--
a secluded village's
hot peppers

jp: .宵過や柱みりみり寒が入
ro: yoi sugi ya hashira miri-miri kan ga iru
en:
evening passes--
the house's post crackles
as cold enters

jp: .風鈴やちんぷんかんのとしの暮れ
ro: fûrin ya chinpunkan no toshi no kure
en:
a wind-chime's
empty babble ends
the year

jp: .待つものはさらになけれどとしの暮
ro: matsu mono wa sara ni nakeredo toshi no kure
en:
nothing to look
forward to, still...
the year ends

jp: .素湯を煮る伝授する也はつ時雨
ro: sayu wo nieru denju suru nari hatsu shigure
en:
she learns how to
boil water...
first winter rain

jp: .いさこざを雀もいふや村しぐれ
ro: izakoza wo suzume mo iu ya mura shigure
en:
even the sparrows
are quarreling--
steady winter rain

jp: .大時雨小時雨大名小名かな
ro: ôshigure ko shigure daimyô shômyô kana
en:
big winter storms
little winter storms...
great lords, lesser lords

jp: .神木は釘を打れて時雨けり
ro: shinboku wa kugi wo utarete shigure keri
en:
a nail pounding
into sacred wood...
winter rain

jp: .雀らが仲間割する時雨哉
ro: suzumera ga nakama waresuru shigure kana
en:
busting up
the sparrow circle...
a winter storm

jp: .道心坊や草履ひたひたむら時雨
ro: dôshin bô ya zôri hita-hita mura shigure
en:
Priest Doshin's
straw sandals pitter-patter...
steady winter rain

jp: .豆腐煮る伝授する也小夜時雨
ro: tôfu niru denju suru nari sayo shigure
en:
she learns how
to cook tofu...
night of winter rain

jp: .一時雨人追つめてもどりけり
ro: hito shigure hito oi-tsumete modori keri
en:
a winter storm
overruns the man...
homeward bound

jp: .舟の家根より人出たり一時雨
ro: fune no yane yori hito detari hito shigure
en:
a man emerges
from the roof of a boat...
a winter storm

jp: .山寺の豆入日也むら時雨
ro: yamadera no mame iri hi nari mura shigure
en:
mountain temple--
on bean-parching day
steady winter rain

jp: .嫁入の謡盛りや小夜時雨
ro: yomeiri no utai-zakari ya sayo shigure
en:
the wedding singers
hit their peak...
night of winter rain

jp: .木がらしやいわしをくるむ柏の葉
ro: kogarashi ya iwashi wo kurumu kashiwa no ha
en:
winter wind--
wrapping sardines
in oak leaves

jp: .初雪や手引を頼む門の橋
ro: hatsu yuki ya tehiki wo tanomu kado no hashi
en:
first snow falling
I trust in his hand...
bridge by the gate

jp: .はつ雪やなどとて内に居る安房
ro: hatsu yuki ya nado tote uchi ni iru ahô
en:
"First snowfall, blah-blah"
they stay indoors
the fools

jp: .湯の中へ降るやはつ雪たびら雪
ro: yu no naka e furu ya hatsu yuki tabira yuki
en:
into the hot tub
the first snow
lightly flitting

jp: .あばら家や雪の旦の虱狩
ro: abara ya ya yuki no ashita no shirami-gari
en:
ramshackle hut--
on a snowy morning
lice-hunting

jp: .大雪やせっぱつまりし人の声
ro: ôyuki ya seppatsumarishi hito no koe
en:
a big snow--
the voices of people
trapped inside

jp: .雪ちらりちらり見事な月夜哉
ro: yuki chirari-chirari migoto na tsuki yo kana
en:
snowflakes flitting--
a splendid
moonlit night

jp: .雪ちるや雪駄の音のさわがしき
ro: yuki chiru ya setta no oto no sawagashiki
en:
falling snow--
the sound of snowshoes
chomp! chomp!

jp: .雪の戸や押せば開くと寝てていふ
ro: yuki no to ya oseba hiraku to netete iu
en:
snowed-in door--
"Push to open!"
I yell from my bed

jp: .雪の日やおりおり蝿の出てあそぶ
ro: yuki no hi ya ori-ori hae no dete asobu
en:
snowy day--
now and then the fly
goes out to play

jp: .雪払ふ拍子に都めぐり哉
ro: yuki harau hyôshi ni miyako maguri kana
en:
to the rhythm
of snow sweeping
touring Kyoto

jp: .朝市の火入にたまる霰かな
ro: asa ichi no hi-ire ni tamaru arare kana
en:
piling up
on the morning market's fire pan...
hailstones

jp: .霜の夜や窓かいて鳴く勘当猫
ro: shimo no yo ya mado kaite naku kandô neko
en:
frosty night--
scratching the window, crying
banished cat

jp: .さをしかや神の留主事寝て遊ぶ
ro: saoshika ya kami no rusu koto nete asobu
en:
young buck--
while the gods are away
sleeping and carousing

jp: .田から田へ真一文字や十夜道
ro: ta kara ta e ma ichi monji ya jûya michi
en:
rice field to rice field
cutting straight through...
winter prayers

jp: .ばせを翁の塚と二人やはつ時雨
ro: bashô okina no tsuka to futari ya hatsu shigure
en:
at Old Basho's grave
the two of us...
first winter rain

jp: .大江戸や辻の番犬も夷講
ro: ôedo ya tsuji no banken mo ebisu kô
en:
great Edo--
even for the crossroads watchdog
God of Wealth Festival

jp: .大黒も連に居るや夷講
ro: daikoku mo tsure ni suwaru ya ebisu kô
en:
money god Daikoku
sits alongside
the God of Wealth

jp: .飯の陰より顔を出る夷哉
ro: meshi no kage yori kao wo deru ebisu kana
en:
from the shadow
of food offerings
the God of Wealth peeks out

jp: .煤過やぞろりととぼる朱蝋燭
ro: susu sugi ya zorori to tobaru shu rôsoku
en:
after soot-sweeping
quickly they're lit...
red candles

jp: .煤はきや東は赤い日の出空
ro: susu haki ya higashi wa akai hi no de-zora
en:
sweeping soot--
in the east a red
dawn sky

jp: .掃煤のはく程黒き畳哉
ro: haki susu no haku hodo kuroki tatami kana
en:
the swept soot
has made it black...
tatami mat

jp: .人並や庵も夜なべのすす払
ro: hito nami ya io mo yonabe no susu harai
en:
like everyone
in my hut, too, night work...
sweeping soot

jp: .今の世や乞食むらの衣配
ro: ima no yo ya konjiki mura no kinu kubari
en:
the world today!
in the beggar-town
gifts of new clothes

jp: .小隅から猫の返しや衣配
ro: ko sumi kara neko no kaeshi ya kinu kubari
en:
from a little nook
the cat returns...
a gift of new clothes

jp: .としの夜や猫にかぶせる鬼の面
ro: toshi no yo ya neko ni kabuseru oni no men
en:
on the year's last night
a new face for the cat...
devil's mask

jp: .山里は子どもも御免帽子哉
ro: yama-zato wa kodomo mo gomen bôshi kana
en:
mountain village--
a little girl, too
in a lady's cotton veil

jp: .御仏前でも御めん頭巾哉
ro: go-butsuzen demo gomen zukin kana
en:
though in Buddha's presence
just a simple cloth
skullcap

jp: .頭巾きて見てもかくれぬ白髪哉
ro: zukin kite mite mo kakurenu shiraga kana
en:
trying on a skullcap
it doesn't hide...
my white hair

jp: .御坐敷や烏がおとす雪礫
ro: o-zashiki ya karasu ga otosu yukitsubute
en:
sitting room--
a crow drops
a snowball

jp: .かんざしでふはと留たり雪礫
ro: kanzashi de fuwa to tometari yukitsubute
en:
with her hairpin
she blocks softly...
the snowball

jp: .飛のいて烏笑ふや雪礫
ro: tobinoite karasu warau ya yukitsubete
en:
jumping aside
the crow just laughs...
snowball

jp: .ふり向ば大どしま也雪礫
ro: furimukeba ôdoshima nari yukitsubute
en:
turning 'round
it's a grown woman!
snowball

jp: .雪打や地蔵菩薩の横面へ
ro: yuki utsu ya jizô bosatsu no yokotsura e
en:
a snowball hit!
holy Jizo's
cheek

jp: .大名を眺ながらに炬燵哉
ro: daimyô wo nagame nagara ni kotatsu kana
en:
eyeing the war lord
from my toasty warm
brazier

jp: .借り髪を木兎も笑ふや神ぢ山
ro: kari kami wo zuku mo warau ya kamiji yama
en:
a scops owl laughs too
at his wig...
Mount Kamiji

jp: .雪国やいろりの隅のねぶか畠
ro: yukiguni ya irori no sumi no nebuka hata
en:
snow country--
in the hearth's corner
a leek garden

jp: .末世でも数珠のなる木や道明寺
ro: masse demo juzu no naru ki ya dômeiji
en:
though in the Latter Days
wood becomes prayer beads...
Domei Temple

jp: .元日や目出度さ尽し旅の宿
ro: ganjitsu ya medetai zukushi tabi no yado
en:
a full round
of New Year's greetings
at the inn

jp: .世の中をゆり直すらん日の始
ro: yo no naka wo yuri naosuran hi no hajime
en:
maybe this quake
will put the world right...
year's first day

jp: .正月や目につく下司の一寸戸
ro: shôgatsu ya me ni tsuku gesu no issun to
en:
First Month--
the fool's half door
an eyesore

jp: .日の本や金も子をうむ御代の春
ro: hi no moto ya kane mo ko wo umu miyo no haru
en:
Land of the Rising Sun!
money makes money...
the emperor's spring

jp: .青空にきず一つなし玉の春
ro: ao-zora ni kizu hitotsu nashi tama no haru
en:
in the clear blue sky
not a blemish...
prosperous spring

jp: .春立や米の山なるひとつ松
ro: haru tatsu ya kome no yama naru hitotsu matsu
en:
spring beings--
a mountain of rice
from one pine

jp: .紙張りの狗も口を明の方
ro: kamihari no enoko mo kuchi wo ake no hô
en:
toward the mouth
of the paper puppy too...
my New Year's walk

jp: .下駄はいて畠歩くや兄方詣
ro: geta haite hatake aruku ya ehô mairi
en:
with wooden clogs
a walk through the field...
New Year's pilgrimage

jp: .線香を雪につつさす兄方哉
ro: senkô wo yuki ni tsutsusasu ehô kana
en:
sticking incense sticks
in the snow...
New Year's lucky direction

jp: .かげ法師に御慶を申すわらじ哉
ro: kageboshi ni gyokei wo [môsu] waraji kana
en:
in shadows
a "Happy New Year!"
walking in straw sandals

jp: .むく起の小便ながら御慶哉
ro: muku oki [no] shôben nagara gyokei kana
en:
while taking
my morning piss...
"Happy New Year!"

jp: .年玉を犬にも投げる御寺哉
ro: toshidama wo inu ni mo nageru o-tera kana
en:
even for the dog
they toss a New Year's gift...
temple

jp: .年玉をおくやいなりの穴の口
ro: toshidama wo oku ya inari no ana no kuchi
en:
leaving a New Year's gift
for the fox god Inari...
hole in the ground

jp: .年玉を落して行くや留主の家
ro: toshidama wo otoshite yuku ya rusu no ie
en:
dropping off New Year's gifts
as I go...
no one's home

jp: .年玉やかたり猫にぞ打つける
ro: toshidama ya katari neko ni [zo] uchitsukeru
en:
New Year's gifts--
I toss one to the swindler
cat

jp: .年玉や懐の子も手々をして
ro: toshi-dama ya futokoro no ko mo te-te wo shite
en:
New Year's present--
the nursing baby reaches
with little hands

jp: .ばか猫や年玉入れの箕に眠る
ro: baka neko ya toshidama ire no mi ni nemuru
en:
fool cat
on the New Year's gift winnow
sound asleep

jp: .巡り々ととる年玉扇哉
ro: meguri-meguri to toru toshidama ôgi kana
en:
making the rounds
as a New Year's gift...
paper fan

jp: .古壁や炬燵むかふのはつ暦
ro: furu kabe ya kotatsu mukau no hatsu-goyomi
en:
old wall--
the new almanac
faces the brazier

jp: .初夢に猫も不二見る寝やう哉
ro: hatsu yume ni neko mo fuji miru neyô kana
en:
in the year's first dream
the cat sees Fuji...
I bet

jp: .初夢の不二の山売る都哉
ro: hatsu yume no fuji no yama u[ru] miyako kana
en:
year's first dream--
Mount Fuji is sold
in Kyoto

jp: .小さい子やわか水汲も何番目
ro: chisai ko ya wakamizu kumi mo nambanme
en:
little child
draws the year's first water...
again and again!

jp: .目覚しにわか水見るや角田川
ro: mezamashi [ni] wakamizu miru ya sumida-gawa
en:
the year's first water
looks wonderful!
Sumida River

jp: .わか水や土瓶一ッに角田川
ro: wakamizu ya dobin hitotsu ni sumida-gawa
en:
the year's first water
in an earthen teapot...
Sumida River

jp: .赤い凧引ずり歩くきげん哉
ro: akai tako hikizuri aruku kigen kana
en:
the red kite
in a drag-behind
kind of mood

jp: .江戸凧の朝からかぶりかぶり哉
ro: edo tako no asa kara kaburi-kaburi kana
en:
kites of Edo
from morning on, heads
shaking, shaking

jp: .江戸凧もこもごも上る山家哉
ro: edo tako mo komo-gomo ageru yamaga kana
en:
an Edo kite
joins the others...
mountain home

jp: .順礼や貰ひながらの凧
ro: junrei ya morai nagara no ikanobori
en:
the pilgrim
while receiving alms
kite flying

jp: .大名のかすみが関や凧
ro: daimyô no kasumi ga seki ya ikanobori
en:
the feudal lords'
Kasumi-ga-Seki...
a kite

jp: .まま子凧つぎのいろいろ見へにけり
ro: mamako tako tsugi no iro-iro mie ni keri
en:
the stepchild's kite--
various patches
appear

jp: .二葉三葉たばこの上に若な哉
ro: ni ha samba tabako no ue ni wakana kana
en:
two or three leaves
atop the tobacco...
herbs

jp: .三葉程つみ切って来る若な哉
ro: samba hodo tsumi kitte kuru wakana kana
en:
around three leaves
then calling it quits...
picking herbs

jp: .脇差の柄にぶら下る若な哉
ro: wakazashi no tsuka ni burasagaru wakana kana
en:
from the short sword's
hilt dangling...
herbs

jp: .挑灯もちらりほらりやはつ烏
ro: chôchin mo chirari horari ya hatsu karasu
en:
a smattering of lanterns
here and there...
the year's first crow

jp: .大雪をかぶって立や福寿草
ro: ôyuki wo kabutte tatsu ya fukuju kusa
en:
covered by the big snow
yet standing...
New Year's flower

jp: .二月に元日草の咲にけり
ro: kisaragi ni ganjitsu kusa no saki ni keri
en:
in Second Month
the New Year's grass
at last

jp: .大寺のたばこ法度や春の雨
ro: ôtera no tabako hatto ya haru no ame
en:
the great temple's
smoking ban...
spring rain

jp: .乞食小屋富のおちけり春の雨
ro: kojiki goya tomi no ochi keri haru no ame
en:
on a beggar's hut
riches fall...
spring rain

jp: .水仙は花と成りけり春の雨
ro: suisen wa hana to nari keri haru no ame
en:
the daffodils
have become flowers!
spring rain

jp: .春風や三人乗りのもどり馬
ro: haru kaze ya sannin nori no modori uma
en:
spring breeze--
three ride the same horse
home

jp: .一馬に三人乗りや春の風
ro: hito uma ni sannin nori ya haru no kaze
en:
on one horse
three riders...
the spring breeze blows

jp: .初虹や左り麦西雪の山
ro: hatsu niji ya hidari mugi nishi yuki no yama
en:
spring's first rainbow
from the wheat field on my left
to the western snowcaps

jp: .昼寝るによしといふ日や虹はじめ
ro: hiru neru ni yoshi to iu hi ya niji hajime
en:
a noon nap
on a good day...
first rainbow

jp: .福来る門や野山の笑顔
ro: fuku kitaru kado ya noyama no warai-gao
en:
well-wishing at the gate--
the faces of hills and fields
laughing

jp: .辻堂や苗代一枚菜一枚
ro: tsuji dô ya nawashiro ichi mai na ichi mai
en:
a crossroads temple--
one rice seedling
one vegetable

jp: .寝心や苗代に降る夜の雨
ro: ne-gokoro ya nawashiro ni furu yoru no ame
en:
peaceful sleep--
on the rice-seedling bed
the evening rain

jp: .今の世やどの出代の涙雨
ro: ima no yo ya dono degawari no namida ame
en:
this world today--
migrating servants' teardrops
the rain

jp: .越後衆や唄で出代る中仙道
ro: echigo shu ya uta de degawaru nakasendô
en:
a throng from Echigo
singing songs, down the highway
they go

jp: .大連や唄で出代る本通り
ro: ôzure ya uta de degawaru hondôri
en:
a long procession--
migrating servants singing
on the main road

jp: .うら店も江戸はえど也雛祭り
ro: uradana mo edo wa edo nari hina matsuri
en:
even in a back-alley house
Edo is Edo...
the Doll Festival!

jp: .大猫も同坐して寝る雛哉
ro: ôneko mo dôza shite neru hiina kana
en:
the big cat sleeps
in the same seat...
with the doll

jp: .吉日の御顔也けり雛達
ro: kichi jitsu no o-kao nari keri hiina-tachi
en:
wearing their lucky day
faces...
the dolls

jp: .後家雛も直にありつくお江戸哉
ro: goke hina mo sugu ni aritsuku o-edo kana
en:
even the widow's doll
is served right away...
great Edo

jp: .雛棚や隣づからの屁のひびき
ro: hina tana ya tonari zukara no he no hibiki
en:
the dolls on the shelf
neighbors...
to my fart

jp: .古雛やがらくた店の日向ぼこ
ro: furu hina ya garakuta tana no hinata-boko
en:
the old doll
in the junk store window
sunning herself

jp: .草餅や片手は犬を撫ながら
ro: kusamochi ya katate wa inu wo nade nagara
en:
eating herb cake
while one hand
pets the dog

jp: .草餅や地蔵の膝においてくふ
ro: kusamochi ya jizô no hiza ni oite kuu
en:
the herb cakes
I put on holy Jizo's lap
then eat

jp: .草餅や芝に居って犬を友
ro: kusamochi ya shiba ni suwatte inu wo tomo
en:
herb cake--
squatting on the lawn
I join the dog

jp: .ふらんどや桜の花をもちながら
ro: furando ya sakura no hana wo mochi nagara
en:
swinging on the swing
clutching
cherry blossoms

jp: .今の世は草をつむにも晴着哉
ro: ima no yo wa kusa wo tsumu ni mo haregi kana
en:
the world today--
even while gathering herbs
dressed to the nines

jp: .御仏の茶も一莚ひろげけり
ro: mi-botoke no cha mo hito mushiro hiroge keri
en:
the Buddha's tea, too
fills one straw mat...
spread out

jp: .菊畠や一打ごとに酒五盃
ro: kiku hata ya hito uchi goto ni sake go hai
en:
chrysanthemum garden--
one chop of the hoe
five cups of sake

jp: .立板の岨や畠に拵へる
ro: tateita no soba ya hatake ni koshiraeru
en:
plowing a slope
like a standing board...
mountain becomes farm

jp: .畠打や鍬でをしへる寺の松
ro: hata uchi ya kuwa de oshieru tera no matsu
en:
with his hoe the farmer
shows the way...
temple pine

jp: .畠打や寝聳て見る加賀の守
ro: hata uchi ya nesobette miru kaga no kami
en:
farmers plowing--
lying down I watch
Lord Kaga pass

jp: .恋猫やきき耳立て又眠る
ro: koi neko ya kikimimi tatete mata nemuru
en:
lover cat--
he cocks his ears
then back to sleep

jp: .浄破利のかがみそれ見よ猫の恋
ro: jôhari no kagami sore mi yo neko no koi
en:
take a peek
in hell's mirror!
lover cat

jp: .垣の梅猫の通ひ路咲とじよ
ro: kaki no ume neko no kayoiji saki-toji yo
en:
hedge's plum tree--
the cat's prowling route
blooms shut

jp: .通路も花の上也やまと猫
ro: kayoiji mo hana no ue nari yamato neko
en:
his prowling route
over the flowers...
a Japanese cat

jp: .恋猫が犬の鼻先通りけり
ro: koi neko ga inu no hana saki tôri keri
en:
the lover cat
brushing the dog's nose
passes by

jp: .恋猫や口なめづりをして逃る
ro: koi neko ya kuchi namezuri wo shite nigeru
en:
the lover cat
licking his chops
escapes

jp: .恋猫や答へる声は川むかふ
ro: koi neko ya kotaeru koe wa kawa mukau
en:
the lover cat's
call is answered...
facing the river

jp: .猫鳴や塀をへだててあはぬ恋
ro: neko naku ya hei wo hedatete awanu koi
en:
cats yowling
separated by a wall--
tragic lovers

jp: .夜すがらや猫も人目を忍ぶ恋
ro: yo-sugara ya neko mo hitome wo shino[bu] koi
en:
all night long
the cat, too
a secret Romeo

jp: .なりふりも親そっくりの子猫哉
ro: narifuri mo oya sokkuri no ko neko kana
en:
a spitting image
of her mother...
kitten

jp: .猫の子の十が十色の毛なみ哉
ro: neko no ko no tô ga to iro no kenami kana
en:
ten kittens
ten
different colors

jp: .今落た角を枕に寝じか哉
ro: ima ochita tsuno wo makura ni neji ka kana
en:
his fresh-shed antler
his pillow...
the sleeping buck

jp: .さをしかや社壇に角を奉る
ro: saoshika ya shadan ni tsuno wo tatematsuru
en:
on the shrine's altar
the buck offers
his antlers

jp: .御仏の山に落すや鹿の角
ro: mi-botoke no yama ni otosu ya shika no tsuno
en:
on Buddha's mountain
he sheds them...
the buck's antlers

jp: .鳥の巣に明渡すぞよ留守の庵
ro: tori no su ni akewatashitaru rusu no io
en:
I open my hut
for birds to make nests
while I'm gone

jp: .切る木ともしらでや鳥の巣を作る
ro: kiru ki to mo shirade ya tori no su wo tsukuru
en:
unaware the tree
is destined for the axe...
nest building

jp: .鳥の巣や寺建立はいつが果
ro: tori no su ya tera konryû wa itsu ga hate
en:
a bird making a nest
a temple being built...
when will they finish?

jp: .鳥の巣や弓矢間にあふ柿の木に
ro: tori no su ya yumiya ma ni au kaki no ki ni
en:
bird's nest--
within arrow's reach
in the persimmon tree

jp: .小日和やよし野は人を呼子鳥
ro: ko-biyori ya yoshino e hito wo yobu ko tori
en:
a bit of fair weather--
little birds call people
to Yoshino

jp: .好き好きや此としよりを呼子鳥
ro: suki-zuki ya kono toshiyori wo yobu ko tori
en:
a matter of taste--
the little bird calls
this old man

jp: .としよりも来いとぞ鳥の鳴にけり
ro: toshiyori mo koi [to] zo tori no naki ni keru
en:
even to the old man
"Come!" cries
the baby bird

jp: .鳥鳴くやとしより迄も来い来いと
