ro: tori naku ya toshiyori made mo kii kii to
en:
the baby bird chirping
even to the old man
"Come! Come!"

jp: .山に住め山に住めとや呼子鳥
ro: yama [ni] sume yama [ni] sume to ya yobu ko tori
en:
"Come live, live
in the mountains!"
little birds call

jp: .米搗は杵を枕や雀の子
ro: kome tsuki wa kine wo makura ya suzume no ko
en:
the rice pounder's mallet
is his pillow...
baby sparrows

jp: .慈悲すれば糞をする也雀の子
ro: jihi sureba hako wo suru nari suzume no ko
en:
when you hold him kindly
he poops on you...
baby sparrow

jp: .雀子に膝の飯つぶつませけり
ro: suzumego ni hiza [no] meshi tsubu tsumase keri
en:
help yourself
to the rice in my lap
baby sparrow

jp: .念仏者や足にからまる雀の子
ro: nebutsusha ya ashi ni karamaru suzume no ko
en:
he prays to Amida Buddha
a baby sparrow
underfoot

jp: .むだ鳴になくは雀のまま子哉
ro: muda naki ni naku wa suzume no mamako kana
en:
crying his cry
in vain...
the stepchild sparrow

jp: .いかな日も鶯一人我ひとり哉
ro: ikana hi mo uguisu hitori ware hitori kana
en:
whatever the day brings
the nightingale's alone
I'm alone

jp: .鶯の弟子披露する都哉
ro: uguisu no deishi hirô suru miyako kana
en:
the nightingale presents
his apprentice...
Kyoto

jp: .鶯も弟子を持たる座敷哉
ro: uguisu mo deisho wo mochitaru zashiki kana
en:
even the nightingale
has an apprentice...
sitting room

jp: .鶯や悪たれ犬も恋を鳴
ro: uguisu ya akutare inu mo koi wo naku
en:
nightingale--
even the rascally dog
howls for love

jp: .鶯や御前へ出ても同じ声
ro: uguisu ya gozen e dete mo onaji koe
en:
nightingale--
for the emperor too
the same song

jp: .鶯の子に鳴せては折々に
ro: uguisu ya ko ni nakasete wa ori-ori ni
en:
the nightingale sings
to his children
now and then

jp: .鶯や而後弟子の声
ro: uguisu ya shikaushite nochi deishi no koe
en:
nightingale--
after him his apprentice
sings

jp: .鶯や雀は竹にまけぬ声
ro: uguisu ya suzume wa take ni makenu koe
en:
nightingale--
in bamboo the sparrow sings
not conceding

jp: .鶯や猫は縛られながらなく
ro: uguisu ya neko wa shibarare nagara naku
en:
nightingale--
the cat, tied up
is yowling

jp: .鶯や糞まで紙につつまるる
ro: uguisu ya hako made kami ni tsutsumaruru
en:
nightingale--
even his shit
gets wrapped in paper

jp: .鶯や山育でもあんな声
ro: uguisu ya yama sodachi demo anna koe
en:
nightingale--
raised in the mountains
but such a voice!

jp: .大名の鶯弟子に持にけり
ro: daimyô no uguisu deishi ni mochi ni keri
en:
the war lord's
nightingale
is an apprentice

jp: .今参りましたぞ夫婦乙鳥哉
ro: ima mairi mashita zo meoto tsubame kana
en:
now they swoop
straight down...
Mr. and Mrs. Swallow

jp: .鶏の隣をかりるつばめ哉
ro: niwatori no tonari wo kariru tsubame kana
en:
renting a place
next door to the chickens...
swallows

jp: .鼠とは隣ずからの乙鳥哉
ro: nezumi to wa tonarizukara no tsubame kana
en:
he's the mouse's
bosom buddy...
a swallow

jp: .店かりて夫婦かせぎの乙鳥哉
ro: mise karite meoto kasegi no tsubame kana
en:
renting the shop
they set up house...
Mr. and Mrs. Swallow

jp: .鶏にさらばさらばと雲雀哉
ro: niwatori ni saraba saraba to hibari kana
en:
farewell! farewell!
to the chicken...
the skylark flies away

jp: .雉なくや藪の小脇のけんどん屋
ro: kiji naku ya yabu no kowaki no kendonya
en:
a pheasant cries--
tucked alongside the thicket
a noodle shop

jp: .寝た牛の腹の上にて雉の声
ro: neta ushi no hara no ue nite kiji no koe
en:
on the sleeping cow's
belly...
a pheasant cries

jp: .我庵にだっまて泊れ夜の雉
ro: waga io ni damatte tomare yoru no kiji
en:
if you stay at my hut
you'll need to shut up!
night pheasant

jp: .江戸の水呑んで声してかへる雁
ro: edo no mizu nonde koe shite kaeru kari
en:
honking while they drink
Edo's water...
returning geese

jp: .朝雨や雁も首尾よく帰る声
ro: asa ame ya kari mo shubi yoku kaeru koe
en:
morning rain--
geese, too, celebrate
their successful return

jp: .痩雁や友の帰るを見てはなく
ro: yase-gari ya tomo no kaeru wo mite wa naku
en:
scrawny goose--
honking at his friends
flying north

jp: .穴を出る蛇の頭や猫がはる
ro: ana wo deru hebi no atama ya neko ga haru
en:
from his hole
the snake pokes his head...
the cat slaps it

jp: .大蛇やおそれながらと穴を出る
ro: ôhebi ya osore nagara to ana wo deru
en:
big snake--
with trepidation coming out
his hole

jp: .苦の娑婆や蛇なのりて穴を出る
ro: ku [no] s[h]aba ya hebi nanorite ana wo deru
en:
world of corruption--
Sir Snake slithers
from his hole

jp: .けっこうな御世とや蛇も穴を出る
ro: kekkôna miyo to ya hebi mo ana wo deru
en:
a splendid world!
even the snake
leaves his hole

jp: .人鬼や蛇より先に穴を出る
ro: hito oni ya hebi yori saki ni ana wo deru
en:
human goblins--
leaving their holes
before the snakes

jp: .五百崎や庇の上になく蛙
ro: iosaki ya hisashi no ue ni naku kawazu
en:
Iosaki--
on top of the eaves
a croaking frog

jp: .大形をしてとび下手の蛙哉
ro: ônari wo shite tobi-beta no kawazu kana
en:
being so fat
he's not a good jumper...
frog

jp: .親蛙ついと横座に通りけり
ro: oya kawazu tsui to yokoza ni tôri keri
en:
father frog
quickly takes the seat
of honor

jp: .仙人の膝と思ふか来る蛙
ro: sennin no hiza to omou ka kuru kawazu
en:
do you think my lap
is a hermit's?
frog jumps on

jp: .散花に首を下る蛙哉
ro: chiru hana ni kôbe wo sageru kawazu kana
en:
bowing his head
in the scattering blossoms...
frog

jp: .掌に蛙を居るらかん哉
ro: tenohira ni kawazu wo sueru rakan kana
en:
a frog squats
in his open palm...
a holy man

jp: .天文を考へ顔の蛙哉
ro: temmon wo kangae kao no kawazu kana
en:
with a face
like he's contemplating the stars...
a frog

jp: .鳥井からえどを詠る蛙哉
ro: torii kara edo wo nagamuru kawazu kana
en:
from the shrine's entrance gate
eyeing Edo...
a frog

jp: .野仏の手に居へ給ふ蛙哉
ro: no-botoke no te ni sue tamau kawazu kana
en:
in the field Buddha's
stone hand, squatting
frog

jp: .昼過や地蔵の膝になく蛙
ro: hiru sugi ya jizô no hiza ni naku kawazu
en:
midday passes--
on holy Jizo's lap
a croaking frog

jp: .蕗の葉にとんで引くりかへる哉
ro: fuki no ha ni tonde hikkurikaeru kana
en:
onto the butterbur leaf
landing upside-down...
a frog

jp: .名々に鳴場を座とる蛙哉
ro: mei-mei ni nakuba wo za toru kawazu kana
en:
one by one
they take their croaking seats...
frogs

jp: .吉原やさはぎに過て鳴かはづ
ro: yoshiwara ya sawagi ni sugite naku kawazu
en:
Yoshiwara--
passing time raising a ruckus
frogs

jp: .かんざしの蝶を誘ふやとぶ小蝶
ro: kanzashi no chô wo sasou ya tobu ko chô
en:
lured by the butterfly
hairpin...
little butterfly

jp: .さをしかや蝶を振って又眠る
ro: saoshika ya chô wo furutte mata nemuru
en:
young buck--
shaking off the butterfly
then back to sleep

jp: .さらにとしとらぬは蝶の夫婦哉
ro: sara ni toshitoranu wa chô no meoto kana
en:
never growing old
Mr. and Mrs.
Butterfly

jp: .塵の身のちりより軽き小てふ哉
ro: chiri no mi no chiri yori karuki ko chô kana
en:
a body of dust
lighter than dust...
little butterfly

jp: .鳥さしの竿の邪魔する小てふ哉
ro: torisashi no sao no jama suru ko chô kana
en:
blocking the bird catcher's
sticky pole...
little butterfly

jp: .ほっとして壁にすがるや夕小てふ
ro: hotto shite kabe ni sugaru ya yû ko chô
en:
clinging to the wall
with relief, evening's
little butterfly

jp: .山盛りに蝶たかりけり犬の椀
ro: yama mori [ni] chô takari keri inu no wan
en:
loads of butterflies
swarming it...
the dog's bowl

jp: .門々に青し蚕の屎の山
ro: kado-gado ni aoshi kaiko no kuso no yama
en:
at gate after gate
green hills
of silkworm poop

jp: .正直の門に蜜蜂やどりけり
ro: shôjiki no kado ni mitsu hachi yadori keri
en:
at an honest man's gate
honeybees
make their home

jp: .蜂逃て猿はきょろきょろ眼哉
ro: hachi nigete saru wa kyoro-kyoro manako kana
en:
fleeing the bees
the monkey's restless
eyes

jp: .蜂の巣にかしておくぞよ留主の庵
ro: hachi no su ni kashite oku zo yo rusu no io
en:
leasing it
to the bees...
leaving my hut

jp: .みつ蜂や隣に借せばあばれ蜂
ro: mitsu-bachi ya tonari ni kaseba arare-bachi
en:
honeybees--
but right next door
hornets

jp: .首出して身寄虫見るらん巣なし鳥
ro: kubi dashite gauna miruran su nashi tori
en:
watching the hermit crab
stretching its neck?
bird with no nest

jp: .捨家に大あんどする身寄虫哉
ro: sute ie ni ôando suru gauna kana
en:
discarding his house
a huge relief...
hermit crab

jp: .住みづらい里はないとや身寄虫どの
ro: sumi-zurai sato wa nai to ya gauna dono
en:
"Life ain't hard
in my village!"
Mr. Hermit Crab

jp: .一寸寝てするべったりの身寄虫哉
ro: chotto nete suru bettari no gauna kana
en:
a quick nap
for the clinging
hermit crab

jp: .一寸寝るふりをしている身寄虫哉
ro: chotto neru furi wo shite iru gauna kana
en:
his quick nap
is just pretend...
hermit crab

jp: .世にそまばこくも薄くも菫哉
ro: yo [ni] somaba koku mo usuku mo sumire kana
en:
coloring the world
lushly, straggly
violets

jp: .梅折るや盗みますぞと大声に
ro: ume oru ya nusumi-[ma]su zo to ô koe ni
en:
breaking a plum branch
"I'm stealing it!"
he yells

jp: .梅さくやごまめちらばふ猫の墓
ro: ume saku ya gomame chirabau neko no haka
en:
plum blossoms--
dried sardines scattered
on the cat's grave

jp: .梅さくや雪隠の外の刀持
ro: ume saku ya setchin no soto no katanamochi
en:
plum blossoms--
outside the outhouse
a sword bearer

jp: .梅さくや羽織を着せる小人形
ro: ume saku ya haori wo kiseru ko ningyô
en:
plum blossoms--
the child puts a coat
on her doll

jp: .野仏のぼんのくぼより梅の花
ro: no-botoke no bon no kubo yori ume no hana
en:
from the nape
of the field Buddha's neck...
plum blossoms

jp: .花の木の持って生た果報哉
ro: hana no ki no motte umareta kahô kana
en:
the blossoming tree
born with such good
karma

jp: .馬乗や花見の中を一文字
ro: uma nori ya hanami no naka wo ichimonji
en:
on horseback he cuts
straight through...
blossom viewers

jp: .江戸声や花見の果のけん嘩かひ
ro: edo-goe ya hanami no hate no kenka kai
en:
Edo voices--
the blossom viewing ends
in a quarrel

jp: .大猫が尿かくす也花の雪
ro: ôneko ga shito kakusu nari hana no yuki
en:
the big cat hides
to piss...
snow on the blossoms

jp: .上下の酔倒あり花の陰
ro: kamishimo no yoidaore ari hana no kage
en:
in ceremonial robe
he's fallen down drunk...
blossom shade

jp: .小言いふ相手もあらば花莚ｭ
ro: kogoto iu aite mo araba hana mushiro
en:
if only she were here
for me to nag...
blossom viewing mat

jp: .十人の目利はづれて花の雨
ro: jû nin no mekiki hazurete hana no ame
en:
ten forecasters
all wrong...
rain on the blossoms

jp: .散花の降りつもりけり馬屎塚
ro: chiru hana no furi tsumori keri ma-guso tsuka
en:
the blossoms are thinking
of falling...
horse dung mound

jp: .名をしらぬ古ちかづきや花の山
ro: na wo shiranu furu chikazuki ya hana no yama
en:
your name escapes me
old friend...
blossoming mountain

jp: .花咲や道の曲りに立地蔵
ro: hana saku ya michi no magari ni tatsu jizô
en:
cherry blossoms--
'round a bend in the road
holy Jizo stands

jp: .花見るも銭をとらるる都哉
ro: hana miru mo zeni wo toraruru miyako kana
en:
even viewing the cherry blossoms
costs money...
Kyoto

jp: .飴ン棒にべったり付し桜哉
ro: amenbô ni bettari tsukishi sakura kana
en:
sticking to
her stick of candy...
cherry blossoms

jp: .神風や魔所も和らぐ山ざくら
ro: kamikaze ya madoko mo yawaragu yama-zakura
en:
divine wind--
even an evil place, less evil
mountain cherry blossoms

jp: .小筵や銭と小蝶とちる桜
ro: samushiro ya zeni to ko chô to chiru sakura
en:
little straw mat--
coins, a little butterfly
and fallen cherry blossoms

jp: .大名を馬からおろす桜哉
ro: daimyô wo uma kara orosu sakura kana
en:
the war lord
forced off his horse...
cherry blossoms

jp: .人足のほこりを浴るさくら哉
ro: hito ashi no hokori wo abiru sakura kana
en:
bathed in the dust
of people's feet...
cherry blossoms

jp: 山猿と呼ばるる宿のさくら哉
ro: yama-zaru to yobaruru yado no sakura kana
en:
at an inn called
Mountain Monkey...
cherry blossoms

jp: .御花の代りをつとむ柳哉
ro: o-hana no kawari wo tsutomu yanagi kana
en:
filling in
for temple flowers...
a willow

jp: .切れても切れてもさて柳哉
ro: kirarete mo kirarete mo sate yanagi kana
en:
trimmed and trimmed
again and again...
willow tree

jp: .ずん切際より一すじ柳哉
ro: zungiri-giwa yori hito suji yanagi kana
en:
from the cut branch
a leafy strand...
willow tree

jp: .田のくろや馬除柳馬がくふ
ro: ta no kuro ya uma yoke yanagi uma ga kuu
en:
ridge between rice fields--
the horse eats
the sheltering willow

jp: .流れ来て門の柳と成にけり
ro: nagare kite kado no yanagi to nari ni keri
en:
floating it comes--
willow tree
at my gate

jp: .あつき日や終り初ものほととぎす
ro: atsuki hi ya owari hatsumono hototogisu
en:
on a hot day
summer's last "first thing"...
"cuckoo!"

jp: .暑き日や棚の蚕の食休
ro: atsuki hi ya tana no kaiko no shokuyasumi
en:
hot day--
the silkworms take a break
from their eating

jp: .暑き日やにらみくらする鬼瓦
ro: atsuki hi ya niramikura suru onigawara
en:
hot day--
a staring contest with
a gargoyle

jp: .暑き日や火の見櫓の人の顔
ro: atsuki hi ya hinomi yagura no hito no kao
en:
hot day--
from the fire lookout tower
someone's face

jp: .大菊の立やあつさの真中に
ro: ôgiku no tatsu ya atsusa no man naka ni
en:
a tall chrysanthemum
in the dead center
of the heat

jp: .満月に暑さのさめぬ畳哉
ro: mangetsu ni atsusa no samenu tatami kana
en:
under a full moon
yet still not cool...
the straw mat

jp: .涼しさの下駄いただくやずいがん寺
ro: suzushisa no geta itadaku ya zuiganji
en:
in the cool air
wooden clogs clack...
Zuigan Temple

jp: .涼しさは直に神代の木立哉
ro: suzushisa wa sugu ni kamiyo no kodachi kana
en:
cool air--
straight from the holy grove
it comes

jp: .門川に足を浸して夏の雨
ro: kado-gawa ni ashi wo hitashite natsu no ame
en:
soaking feet
in the river at the gate...
summer rain

jp: .鍬枕かまをまくらや夏の雨
ro: kuwa makura kama wo makura ya natsu no ame
en:
hoe for a pillow
sickle for a pillow...
summer rain

jp: .海見ゆる程穴ありて雲の峰
ro: umi miyuru hodo ana arite kumo no mite
en:
through a hole
you can see the ocean...
billowing clouds

jp: .てっぺんに炭をやく也雲のみね
ro: teppen ni sumi wo yaku nari kumo no mine
en:
on the mountain's peak
charcoal being made...
billowing clouds

jp: .走り帆の追ひ々出るや雲の峰
ro: hashiri ho no oi-oi deru ya kumo no mine
en:
a boat's sail
gradually takes shape...
billowing clouds

jp: .小乞食の唄三絃や夏の月
ro: ko kojiki no uta samisen ya natsu no tsuki
en:
the beggar child
plucks and sings...
summer moon

jp: .山門の大雨だれや夏の月
ro: sanmon no ôamadare ya natsu no tsuki
en:
the great eaves
of the temple's great gate...
summer moon

jp: .捨ておいても田に成にけり夏の月
ro: sute-oite mo ta ni nari ni keri natsu no tsuki
en:
though overlooked
the rice field grows...
summer moon

jp: .どの門もめで田めで田や夏の月
ro: dono kado mo medeta medeta ya natsu no tsuki
en:
at every gate
a celebration...
summer moon

jp: .白妙の土蔵ぽっちり青田哉
ro: shirotae no dozô pocchiri aoda kana
en:
for the white storehouse
just a drop...
green rice field

jp: .御祭りや鬼ゆり姫ゆりはかたゆり
ro: o-matsuri ya oniyuri himeyuri hakata yuri
en:
festival--
tiger lilies, princess lilies
Hakata lilies

jp: .踏んまたぐ程でも江戸の不二の山
ro: fun matagu hodo demo edo no fuji no yama
en:
though I can almost
step over it...
Edo's Mount Fuji

jp: .浅草や朝飯前の不二詣
ro: asakusa ya asahan mae no fuji môde
en:
Asakusa--
before my breakfast plate
pilgrims climb Mount Fuji

jp: .浅草や犬も供して不二詣
ro: asakusa ya inu mo tomo shite fuji môde
en:
in Asakusa
a dog tags along...
Mount Fuji pilgrims

jp: .ただの鵜も相伴に来るかがり哉
ro: tada no u mo shôban ni kuru kagari kana
en:
a free cormorant
also comes to feast...
at the cage

jp: .天窓用心と張りけり更衣
ro: atama yôjin to hari keri koromogae
en:
taking care to stretch it
over the head...
new summer robe

jp: .親の親の其のおやのの[を]更衣
ro: oya no oya no sono oya no no [wo] koromogae
en:
his father's
father's father wore it too...
summer robe

jp: .草餅の又めづらしやころもがへ
ro: kusa mochi no mata mezurashi ya koromogae
en:
the herb cake
is wonderful again!
new summer robe

jp: .皺顔やしかも立派なころもがへ
ro: shiwa kao ya shikamo rippa na koromogae
en:
a wrinkled face
but a splendid new
summer robe!

jp: .でも坊主でも入道のころもがえ
ro: demo bôzu demo nyûdô no koromogae
en:
even for priests
and lay priests...
new summer robes

jp: .塗盆に猫の寝にけり夏座敷
ro: nuribon ni neko no ne ni keri natsu zashiki
en:
the cat naps
in a lacquered tray...
summer room

jp: .蚊屋のない家はうまうまいびき哉
ro: kaya no nai ie wa uma-uma ibiki kana
en:
in the house
with no mosquito net
expert snoring

jp: .蚊屋のない家はごうごううまく寝る
ro: kaya no nai ie wa gô-gô umaku neru
en:
in the house
with no mosquito net
noisy deep sleep

jp: .蠅一ッ二ッ寝蓙の見事也
ro: hae hitotsu futatsu negoza no migoto nari
en:
one fly, two flies--
my sleeping mat's become
a place to see

jp: .枝折の日陰作りて昼寝哉
ro: eda ore no hikage tsukurite hirune kana
en:
a sunshade
of broken branches...
siesta

jp: .あれあんな山里にさへ江戸うちは
ro: are anna yamazato sae edo uchiwa
en:
even in this far-off
mountain village...
paper fans from Edo

jp: .後にさす団扇を老の印哉
ro: shiri ni sasu uchiwa wo oi no shirushi kana
en:
his paper fan
tucked behind...
old man style

jp: .茶の水の蓋にしておく団扇哉
ro: cha no mizu no futa ni shite oku uchiwa kana
en:
covering up
my water for tea...
my fan

jp: .杖ほくほく団扇はさむや尻の先
ro: tsue hoku-hoku uchiwa hasamu ya shiri no saki
en:
clack-clack his cane--
a paper fan tucked
in his butt

jp: .庭竹もさらりさらさら団扇哉
ro: niwa take mo sarari sara-sara uchiwa kana
en:
the garden's bamboo, too
swish-swishing...
paper fan

jp: .寝咄の切間切間を団扇哉
ro: ne-banashi no kirema kirema wo uchiwa kana
en:
in the pauses
of our pillow talk
fanning

jp: .虫干や下駄の並びの仏達
ro: mushiboshi ya geta no narabi no hotoke-tachi
en:
airing out clothes--
the lined-up wooden clogs
of the Buddhas

jp: .鶯に水を浴せて夕涼
ro: uguisu ni mizu wo abisete yôsuzumi
en:
dousing the nightingale
with water...
evening cool

jp: .内へ来て涼み直すや窓の月
ro: uchi e kite suzumi naosu ya mado no tsuki
en:
back in the house
cooling off again...
moon in the window

jp: .親と子が屁くらべす也門涼み
ro: oya to ko ga he kurabesu nari kado suzumi
en:
father and son's
fart contest...
cool air at the gate

jp: .山の湯に米を搗せて涼み哉
ro: yama no yu ni kome wo tsukasete suzumi kana
en:
making the mountain
hot spring husk the rice...
cool air

jp: .早乙女におぶさって寝る小てふ哉
ro: saotome ni obusatte neru ko chô kana
en:
rice-planting girl--
on her back a butterfly
sleeps

jp: .かはほりに夜ほちもそろりそろり哉
ro: kawahori ni yahochi mo sorori-sorori kana
en:
like the bats
night's streetwalkers too
make their slow rounds

jp: .かはとりも土蔵住居のお江戸哉
ro: kawahori mo dozô sumai no o-edo kana
en:
the bats, too
live in a storehouse...
great Edo!

jp: .かはほりや仁王の腕にぶら下り
ro: kawahori ya niô no ude ni burasagari
en:
from the arms
of the Deva Kings
bats dangle

jp: .かはとりや人の天窓につきあたり
ro: kawahori ya hito no atama ni tsuki atari
en:
straight for his head
heads
the bat

jp: .かはほりや夜ほちの耳の辺りより
ro: kawahori ya yohochi no mimi no atari yori
en:
a bat--
buzzing the ear
of the hooker

jp: .かはほりや夜たかがぼんのくぼみより
ro: kawahori ya yotaka ga bon no kubomi yori
en:
a bat
from the nape of the streetwalker's
neck

jp: .あたり八軒が起るやほととぎす
ro: atari hakken ga okiru ya hototogisu
en:
waking up
the whole neighborhood...
cuckoo

jp: .大勢がむだ待したり時鳥
ro: ôzei ga muda machishitari hototogisu
en:
the masses wait
but all in vain...
cuckoo

jp: .来な来なしこ時鳥しこ烏
ro: kuru na kuru na shiko hototogisu shiko karasu
en:
don't come! don't come!
ugly cuckoo
ugly crow

jp: .とり辺野やしこ時鳥しこ烏
ro: toribe[no] ya shiko hototogisu shiko karasu
en:
Toribe Field--
ugly cuckoo!
ugly crow!

jp: .時鳥江戸三界を夜もすがら
ro: hototogisu edo sangai wo yo [mo] sugara
en:
the cuckoo serenades
all of Edo
all...night...long!

jp: .時鳥待もあはうの一ッかな
ro: hototogisu matsu mo ahô no hitotsu kana
en:
also waiting
for the cuckoo...
a fool

jp: .皆いぬぞしこ時鳥時鳥
ro: mina inu zo shiko hototogisu hototogisu
en:
all of them have left
the ugly cuckoos!
cuckoos!

jp: .山烏邪魔ひろぐなよほととぎす
ro: yama-garasu jama hirogu na yo hototogisu
en:
mountain crow
don't interrupt!
cuckoo

jp: .やれ起よそれ時鳥時鳥
ro: yare oki yo sore hototogisu hototogisu
en:
hey, get up!
it's a cuckoo
cuckoo!

jp: .夜る夜中おしかけ鳴やほととぎす
ro: yoru yonaka oshikake naku ya hototogisu
en:
in the middle of the night
an unwelcome song...
cuckoo

jp: .大酒の諫言らしや閑古鳥
ro: ôzake no kangen-rashi ya kankodori
en:
admonishing
my heavy drinking...
mountain cuckoo

jp: .大酒の諫言するか閑古鳥
ro: ôzake no kangen suru ka kankodori
en:
are you lecturing me
about my heavy drinking?
mountain cuckoo

jp: .爺茶屋や右に左に閑古鳥
ro: jiji chaya ya migi ni hidari ni kankodori
en:
grandpa's teahouse--
to the right, to the left
mountain cuckoos

jp: .我友に相応したりかんこ鳥
ro: waga tomo ni fusawashitari kankodori
en:
you and I
a perfect pair...
mountain cuckoo

jp: .我々も亡者の分ンか閑古鳥
ro: ware-ware mo môja no bun ka kankodori
en:
are we too
destined to die?
mountain cuckoo

jp: .筏士の飯にべったり蛍かな
ro: ikadashi no meshi ni bettari hotaru kana
en:
sticking to
the raftsman's rice...
fireflies

jp: .大家を上手に越へし蛍哉
ro: ôie wo jyôzu ni koeshi hotaru kana
en:
over the big house
an excellent flight!
firefly

jp: .大家根を越へそこなひし蛍哉
ro: ôyane wo koesokonaishi hotaru kana
en:
can't quite get over
the high rooftop...
firefly

jp: .木がくれの家真昼にとぶ蛍
ro: kogakure [no] ie mappiru ni tobu hotaru
en:
house in deep shade
at high noon...
fireflies

jp: .猿も子を負ふて指すほたる哉
ro: saru mo ko wo oute yubisasu hotaru kana
en:
mother monkey
baby on her back points...
fireflies!

jp: .はつ蛍つひに都をかけぬける
ro: hatsu hotaru tsui ni miyako wo kakenukeru
en:
first firefly--
carelessly it leaves
Kyoto

jp: .はつ蛍人の天窓につきあたり
ro: hatsu-botaru hito no atama ni tsuki-atari
en:
the first firefly
flies smack into people's
heads

jp: .町を出てほっと息する蛍哉
ro: machi wo dete hotto iki suru hotaru kana
en:
leaving the town
breathing easier...
firefly

jp: .飯櫃の蛍追ひ出す夜舟哉
ro: meshibitsu no hotaru oidasu yobune kana
en:
shooing fireflies
from the rice tub...
night boat

jp: .行当る家に泊るや大ぼたる
ro: yukiataru ie ni tomaru ya ôbotaru
en:
staying in the house
it bumped into...
big firefly

jp: .行な行なみなうそよびぞはつ蛍
ro: yuku na yuku na mina uso yobi zo hatsu hotaru
en:
don't go! don't go!
all their calls are lies
first firefly

jp: .あさぢふの痩蚊やせのみやせ子哉
ro: asajiu no yase ka yase nomi yase ko kana
en:
in cogan grass--
thin mosquito, thin flea
thin child

jp: .江戸の蚊の気が強いぞよ強いぞよ
ro: edo no ka no ki ga tsuyoi zo yo tsuyoi zo yo
en:
Edo's mosquitoes
so bold!
so bold!

jp: .ごちゃごちゃと痩蚊やせ蚤やせ子哉
ro: gocha-gocha to yase ka yase [nomi] yase-go kana
en:
thrown together--
thin mosquitoes, thin fleas
thin children

jp: .酒くさい膝もきらはぬ藪蚊哉
ro: sake kusai hiza mo kirawanu yabu ka kana
en:
knees smelling of sake
taste just fine...
mosquitoes

jp: .隣から叩き出れて来る蚊哉
ro: tonari kara tataki dasarete kuru ka kana
en:
driven from next door
here they come...
mosquitoes

jp: .仏のかたより蚊の出る御堂哉
ro: hotoke no kata yori ka no deru midô kana
en:
from Buddha's direction
a mosquito...
temple hall

jp: .痩脛は蚊も嫌ふやらつい通り
ro: yase-zune wa ka mo kirau yara tsui tôru
en:
even the mosquito hates
thin legs...
quickly moving on

jp: .打れても打れても来るや膝の蠅
ro: utarete mo utarete mo kuru ya hiza no hae
en:
the more I swat
the more they come...
flies on my lap

jp: .座頭坊や赤椀で蠅追ひながら
ro: zato bô ya aka wan de hae oi-nagara
en:
the blind priest
with his red bowl...
shooing flies

jp: .草庵にもどれば蠅ももどりけり
ro: sôan ni modoreba hae mo modori keri
en:
I go back in
my thatched hut...
the fly does the same

jp: .点一つ蠅が打たる手紙かな
ro: ten hitotsu hae ga uchitaru tegami kana
en:
the fly
left a little spot...
a letter

jp: .鶏が下手につむ也もちの蠅
ro: niwatori ga heta ni tsumu nari mochi no hae
en:
the chicken's poor
at pecking them...
rice cake's flies

jp: .塗盆を蝿が雪隠にしたりけり
ro: nuribon wo hae ga setchin ni shitari keri
en:
the lacquered tray
is the fly's
outhouse

jp: .豊年の声を上けり草の蝿
ro: hônen no koe wo age keri kusa no hae
en:
"It's a good year!"
they clamor...
flies in the grass

jp: .まめ人の人の頭の蠅を追ふ
ro: mame hito no hito no atama no hae wo ou
en:
how industrious!
shooing the fly
off someone else's head

jp: .我家へもどりて居るや門の蠅
ro: waga ie e modorite iru ya kado no hae
en:
coming back
inside my house...
the gate's flies

jp: .木の猿や蚤をとばせる犬の上
ro: ki no saru ya nomi wo tobaseru inu no ue
en:
monkey in the tree
discarding his fleas...
on the dog

jp: .道哲の仏の膝や蝉の声
ro: dôtetsu no hotoke no hiza ya semi no koe
en:
in the lap
of the holy man...
a cicada sings

jp: .大天狗の鼻やちょっぽりかたつむり
ro: ôtengu no hana ya choppori katatsumuri
en:
on the great goblin's
humongous nose
a snail

jp: .木の雫天窓張りけりかたつむり
ro: ki no shizuku atama hari keri katatsumuri
en:
under a dribbling tree
stretching her neck
a snail

jp: .此雨の降にどっちへでいろ哉
ro: kono ame no furu ni dotchi e deiro kana
en:
in this falling rain
where are you off to
snail?

jp: .笹の葉やなるや小粒のかたつむり
ro: sasa no ha ya naru ya ko tsubu no katatsumuri
en:
clinging to a leaf
of bamboo
a teeny-tiny snail

jp: .戸を〆てづんづと寝たりかたつむり
ro: to wo shimete zunzu to netari katatsumuri
en:
closing the door
he drops off to sleep...
snail

jp: .練塀や廻りくらするかたつむり
ro: neribei ya meguru kurasuru katatsumuri
en:
making the rounds
on the plaster wall...
snail

jp: .鉢の子の中より出たりかたつむり
ro: hachi no ko no naka yori detari katatsumuri
en:
emerging
from the little rice tub
a snail

jp: .天窓に箍かけ走る也はつ松魚
ro: atama ni taga kake hashiru nari hatsu-gatsuo
en:
running with a barrel
on his head...
summer's first bonito

jp: .大家や犬もありつくはつ松魚
ro: ôie ya inu mo aritsuku hatsu-gatsuo
en:
a big house--
even for the dog
summer's first bonito

jp: .芝浦や初松魚より夜が明る
ro: shibaura ya hatsu-gatsuo yori yo ga akeru
en:
Shibaura--
summer's first bonito
then sunrise

jp: .貰ふたよ只一切のはつ松魚
ro: morauta yo tada hito kire no hatsu-gatsuo
en:
my portion
just a tiny slice...
summer's first bonito

jp: .白露に福ややどらんぼたん畠
ro: shira tsuyu ni fuku ya yadoran botan hata
en:
in the silver dew
good luck dwells...
peony garden

jp: .せいたけの麦の中よりぼたん哉
ro: seitake no mugi no naka yori botan kana
en:
in the field
of towering wheat...
a peony

jp: .草庵にふつり合也さくぼたん
ro: sôan ni futsuriai nari saku botan
en:
looking out of place
at my thatched hut...
blooming peony

jp: .草庵にほぼつり合ぬぼたん哉
ro: sôan ni hobo tsuriawanu botan kana
en:
not quite fitting in
my thatched hut...
the peony

jp: .鐘と挑灯の中をぼたん哉
ro: tsurigane to chôchin no naka wo botan kana
en:
a hanging temple bell
a lantern...
and a peony

jp: .てもさてもても福相のぼたん哉
ro: temo satemo temo fukusô no botan kana
en:
my oh my
what a radiant face...
peony

jp: .猫の狂ひが相応のぼたん哉
ro: neko no kurui ga sôô no botan kana
en:
a perfect match
for the crazy cat...
peony

jp: .貧乏蔓にとり巻かれてもぼたん哉
ro: bimbô-zuru ni torimakarete mo botan kana
en:
wrapped in
a beggarly vine...
the peony

jp: .福来ると聞てほしがるぼたん哉
ro: fuku kuru to kiite hosigaru botan kana
en:
"Good luck's coming!"
the peony longs
to be heard

jp: .山寺や赤い牡丹の花の雲
ro: yamadera ya [akai] botan no hana no kumo
en:
a mountain temple--
clouds of red
peonies!

jp: .菜畠や四五本そよぐ蓮の花
ro: na-batake ya shi go hon soyogu hasu no hana
en:
farm field--
four or five rustling
lotus blossoms

jp: .鶺鴒は神の使かかきつばた
ro: sekirei wa kami no tsukai ka kakitsubata
en:
running messages, wagtail
for the shrine's god?
irises

jp: .草家根やささぬ菖蒲は花がさく
ro: kusa yane ya sasanu shô[bu] wa hana ga saku
en:
thatched roof--
the irises piercing it
bloom

jp: .法の世や在家のばせを花が咲く
ro: nori no yo ya zaike no bashô hana ga saku
en:
world of Buddha's law!
the holy man's banana tree
has bloomed

jp: .麦秋や畠を歩く小酒うり
ro: mugi aki ya hatake wo aruku ko sake uri
en:
ripened barley--
walking through the field
a little sake vendor

jp: .麦秋や本の秋より寒い雨
ro: mugi aki ya hon no aki yori samui ame
en:
the barley's autumn
like real autumn...
cold drizzle

jp: .あっぱれの大わか竹よわか竹よ
ro: appare no ôwaka take yo waka take yo
en:
a splendid, tall
young bamboo!
young bamboo!

jp: .蟻塚の中やついついことし竹
ro: arizuke no naka ya tsui-tsui kotoshi take
en:
among the anthills
swish swish...
this year's bamboo

jp: .さあらさら野竹もわかいげんき哉
ro: saara-sara no take mo wakai genki kana
en:
rustling, rustling
the field's bamboo too...
young and lively

jp: .さわがしや門のわか竹わか雀
ro: sawagashi ya kado no waka take waka suzume
en:
what a racket!
the gate's young bamboo
young sparrows

jp: .さわがしや役なし竹もわか盛り
ro: sawagashi ya yakunashi take mo waka sakari
en:
what a racket!
even good-for-nothing bamboo
at the peak of youth

jp: .杖になる小竹もわか葉盛り哉
ro: tsue ni naru ko take mo wakaba sakari keri
en:
becoming a walking stick
little bamboo
at the peak of youth

jp: .なぐさめに窓へ出たのかことし竹
ro: nagusame ni mado e deta no ka kotoshi take
en:
growing toward my window
to cheer me up?
this year's bamboo

jp: .むつましや男竹女竹のわか盛り
ro: mutsumaji ya odake medake no waka-zakari
en:
living in harmony--
boy and girl bamboos
the peak of youth

jp: .わか竹やとしより竹もともいさみ
ro: waka take ya toshiyori take mo tomo isami
en:
young bamboo
and old bamboo...
full of pluck

jp: .竹の子の木に交りて曲りけり
ro: takenoko no ki ni majiwarite magari keri
en:
bamboo shoots--
mingling with trees
they bend

jp: .いそいそと老木もわか葉仲間哉
ro: iso-iso to oiki mo wakaba nakama kana
en:
even the old tree
happy happy...
fresh green leaves

jp: .桐の木の悠々然とわか葉哉
ro: kiri no ki no yûyûzen to wakaba kana
en:
the paulownia tree
serene and still...
fresh green leaves

jp: .古壁も分ン相応にわか葉哉
ro: furu kabe mo bunsôô ni wakaba kana
en:
even the old wall
is frugal...
fresh green leaves

jp: .真丸に四角に柘のわか葉哉
ro: manmaru ni shikaku ni tsuge no wakaba kana
en:
round ones, square ones
the box tree's
fresh green leaves

jp: .山寺は留主の体也夏木立
ro: yamadera wa rusu no tei nari natsu kodachi
en:
the mountain temple
looks empty...
summer trees

jp: .闇がりやこそり立っても冷い秋
ro: kuragari ya kosori tatte mo hiyai aki
en:
under cover of darkness
sneaking in...
chilly autumn

jp: .えいやっと来て姨捨の雨見哉
ro: eiyatto kite obasute no ame mi kana
en:
after struggling to reach
Mount Obasute...
rain-gazing

jp: .十五夜に姨捨山の雨見哉
ro: jûgoya ni obasute yama no ame mi kana
en:
harvest moon night
on Mount Obasute...
rain gazing

jp: .屁くらべや芋名月の草の庵
ro: he kurabe ya imo meigetsu no kusa no io
en:
a farting contest--
harvest moon night
in the hut

jp: .藪の家や鍋つき餅の十三夜
ro: yabu no ya ya nabe tsuki mochi no jû san yo
en:
house in the thicket--
my rice cake stuck to the pan
Ninth month moon

jp: .青紙の梶の葉形を手向哉
ro: ao kami no kaji no hagata wo tamuke kana
en:
a green paper
mulberry leaf, offered
to the stars

jp: .幼子の手に書せけり星の歌
ro: osanago no te ni kakase keri hoshi no uta
en:
helping the child's hand
write it...
the "Star Poem"

jp: .御射山やけふ一日の名所哉
ro: misayama ya kyô ichi nichi no meisho kana
en:
Misayama--
today, all day
a famous resort!

jp: .大名の花火そしるや江戸の口
ro: daimyô no hanabi soshiru ya edo no kuchi
en:
griping about
the war lord's fireworks...
mouths of Edo

jp: .妹が顔見ぬふりしたりまけ角力
ro: imo ga kao minufuri shitari make-zumô
en:
pretending not to see
his wife's face...
defeated wrestler

jp: .風除に立てくれるや角力取
ro: kazeyoke ni tatte kureru ya sumôtori
en:
he makes a fine
wind-break...
sumo wrestler

jp: .角力取に手をすらせたる女哉
ro: sumôtori ni te wo surasetaru onna kana
en:
letting the wrestler
rub her hand...
a woman

jp: .角力になると祝ふ親のこころ哉
ro: sumô [ni] naru to iwau oya no kokoro kana
en:
he's become a
sumo wrestler!
the proud parents

jp: .大名にかはゆがらるる角力哉
ro: daimyô ni kawayugararuru sumô kana
en:
basking in the war lord's
good graces...
sumo wrestler

jp: .ふんどしに御酒を上けり角力取
ro: fundoshi ni miki wo age keri sumôtori
en:
to the loincloth
raising his sake...
sumo wrestler

jp: .脇向て不二を見る也勝角力
ro: waki muite fuji wo miru nari kachi sumô
en:
turning aside
to look at Mount Fuji...
sumo champion

jp: .今の世や役なし川も鳴子哉
ro: ima no yo [ya] yakunashi kawa mo naruko kana
en:
the world today!
even a good-for-nothing river
has a bird clapper

jp: .降雨やつい隣でも小夜ぎぬた
ro: furu ame ya tsui tonari demo sayo-ginuta
en:
night rain--
my next door neighbor
pounding cloth

jp: .行秋を輿でおくるや新酒屋
ro: yuku aki wo koshi de okuru ya shinshuya
en:
autumn departs
on a palanquin...
new sake in the shop

jp: .もどかしや雁は自由に友よばる
ro: modokashi ya kari [wa] jiyu ni tomo yobaru
en:
how irritating!
the wild geese freely
call their friends

jp: .渡り鳥一芸なきはなかりけり
ro: watari-dori hito geinaki wa nakari keri
en:
migrating birds--
not one of them
lacks skill

jp: .杖の穴蛇もきらふかいらぬ也
ro: tsue no ana hebi mo kirau ka iranu nari
en:
walking stick hole--
don't you like it, snake?
he doesn't enter

jp: .蛇どもや生れ故郷の穴に入
ro: hebi-domo ya umare kokyô no ana ni iru
en:
snakes--
go home to the holes
of their birth

jp: .しゃべるぞよ野づらの虫に至る迄
ro: shaberu zo yo nozura no mushi ni itaru made
en:
such chatter!
even the field's insects
join in

jp: .目のさやをはづしてさわぐとんぼ哉
ro: me no saya wo hazushite sawagu tombo kana
en:
the eye pods
come off with a crackle...
dragonfly

jp: .目のさやをずっとはづしてとんぼ哉
ro: me no saya wo zutto hazushite tombo kana
en:
the eye pods
come right off...
dragonfly

jp: .柴戸や蝿取に来るきりぎりす
ro: shiba no to [ya] hae tori ni kuru kirigirisu
en:
to my humble hut
he comes fly-hunting...
katydid

jp: .菜畠やひょいひょいひょいや菊の花
ro: na-batake ya hyoi-hyoi-hyoi ya kiku no hana
en:
farm field--
here, there...and there
chrysanthemums

jp: .朝顔に涼しくくふやひとり飯
ro: asagao ni suzushiku kuu ya hitori meshi
en:
in cool morning-glories
eating my rice
alone

jp: .ひつぢ田や青みにうつる薄氷
ro: hitsuji-da ya aomi ni utsuru usu-gôri
en:
autumn rice--
the green reflected
in thin ice

jp: .江戸へ出る迄はまだまだわかたばこ
ro: edo e deru made wa mada mada waka tabako
en:
until the trip to Edo
again and again...
young tobacco

jp: .おく山や子どももかぢるたうがらし
ro: oku yama ya ko[do]mo [mo] kajiru tôgarashi
en:
deep mountains--
a child also gnaws
a hot pepper

jp: .小粒でも見よ見よえどのたうがらし
ro: ko tsubu mo mi yo mi yo edo no tôgarashi
en:
tiny little things--
look!
Edo's hot peppers

jp: .さたなしに咲て居る也木槿哉
ro: sata nashi ni saite iru nari mukuge kana
en:
without fanfare
they have bloomed...
roses of Sharon

jp: .長咲の恥もかかぬぞ花木槿
ro: naga saki no haji mo kakanu zo hana mukuge
en:
it's no disgrace
to be long-blooming!
roses of Sharon

jp: .団栗や三べん巡って池に入
ro: donguri ya san ben mawatte ike ni iru
en:
acorn--
rolling three times
then into the pond

jp: .栗とんで惣鶏のさはぎ哉
ro: kuri tonde sôniwatori no sawagi kana
en:
chestnuts falling--
all the chickens
squawking!

jp: .此おくは魔所とや立る天狗茸
ro: kono oku wa masho to ya tateru tengudake
en:
this deep forest
is haunted!
Tengu's mushrooms sprout

jp: .あばら家や寒ある上に寒が入
ro: abaraya [ya] kan aru ue [ni] kan ga iru
en:
ramshackle hut--
adding to the cold
more cold

jp: .薄壁や月もろともに寒が入
ro: usu kabe ya tsuki morotomo ni kan ga iru
en:
thin wall--
with the moonlight comes
the cold

jp: .薄壁や鼠穴より寒が入
ro: usu kabe ya nezumi ana yori kan ga iru
en:
thin wall--
from the mouse's hole
the cold

jp: .おさな子の文庫に仕廻ふ氷かな
ro: osanago no bunko [ni] shimau kôri kana
en:
the child finishes it
with his little box...
ice

jp: .氷る夜はどんすの上の尿瓶哉
ro: kôru yo wa donsu no ue no shibin kana
en:
night of freeze--
on silk damask sits
my piss-pot

jp: .猫の目や氷の下に狂ふ魚
ro: neko no me ya kôri no shita ni kuruu uuo
en:
under the ice
the cat's eyes follow...
crazy fish

jp: .本馬のしゃんしゃん渡る氷哉
ro: hon uma no shan-shan wataru kôri kana
en:
the packhorse crosses
tat-a-tat...
the ice

jp: .本堂や手本のおしの欠氷
ro: hondô ya tehon no oshi no kake kôri
en:
main temple--
the copybook's paperweight
a shard of ice

jp: .神の猿蚤見てくれる小春哉
ro: kami no saru nomi mite kureru ko haru kana
en:
sacred monkeys
pick each other's fleas...
a spring day in winter

jp: .小春とて出歩くに蠅連にけり
ro: ko haru tote de-aruku [ni] hae tsure [ni] keri
en:
a spring day in winter--
I go out for a walk
a fly comes along

jp: .寝酒いざとしが行うと行まいと
ro: ne-zake iza toshi [ga] yukô to yukumai to
en:
bedtime sake--
whether the new year comes
or not

jp: .仏土にも獄入有りけりとしの暮
ro: butsudo ni mo goku iri ari keri toshi no kure
en:
in a Buddhist land too
prison inmates...
the year ends

jp: .行としはどこで爺を置去に
ro: yuku toshi wa doko de jijii wo okizari ni
en:
the year ending--
the old man feels somehow
abandoned

jp: .庵迄送りとどけて行時雨
ro: iori made okuri-todokete yuku shigure
en:
seeing me home
to my hut...
the winter rain

jp: .うら窓や毎日日日北しぐれ
ro: ura mado ya mai nichi hi nichi kita shigure
en:
rear window--
every day, day, day
northerly winter rain

jp: .大草履ひたりひたり村時雨
ro: ôzôri hitari-hitari mura shigure
en:
big straw sandals
pitter-patter...
steady winter rain

jp: .さいさいに時雨直して大時雨
ro: sai-sai ni shigure naoshite ôshigure
en:
again and again
the winter rain stopping
starting

jp: .寺へ人を送りとどけて行く時雨
ro: tera e hito wo okuri-todokete yuku shigure
en:
escorting the man
to the temple...
the winter rain

jp: .独寝の足しにふりけり小夜時雨
ro: hitori ne no ashi ni furi keri sayo shigure
en:
falling on my feet
as I sleep...
night's winter rain

jp: .山柴の秤にかかる時雨哉
ro: yama shiba no hakari ni kakaru shigure kana
en:
being weighed in the scales
for mountain brushwood...
winter rain

jp: .寒空のどこでとしよる旅乞食
ro: samu-zora no doko de toshiyoru tabi kojiki
en:
cold winter sky--
where will this wandering beggar
grow old?

jp: .木がらしに鼾盛りの屑家哉
ro: kogarashi ni ibiki-zakari no kuzuya kana
en:
winter wind--
a crescendo of snores
in my trashy house

jp: .木がらしに野守が鼾盛り哉
ro: kogarashi ni nomori ga ibiki-zakari kana
en:
in winter wind
the field watchman's snores
crescendo

jp: .木がらしの掃てくれけり門の芥
ro: kogarashi no haite kure keri kado no gomi
en:
kindly the winter wind
sweeps
my gate

jp: .木がらしや門の榎の力瘤
ro: kogarashi [ya] kado no enoki no chikara kobu
en:
winter wind--
by the gate the nettle tree's
big biceps

jp: .木がらしや椿は花の身づくろひ
ro: kogarashi ya tsubaki wa hana no mi-zukuroi
en:
winter wind--
camellia blossoms have fixed
their make-up

jp: .はつ雪を乞食呼り駅場哉
ro: hatsu yuki wo kojiki yoba[wa]ri tateba kana
en:
they curse the first snow
like it's a beggar...
rest stop

jp: .はつ雪を見かけて張るやせうじ穴
ro: hatsu yuki wo mikakete haru ya shô[ji] ana
en:
watching first snow--
mending holes
in the paper door

jp: .はつ雪や降りもかくれぬ犬の糞
ro: hatsu yuki ya furi ni mo kakurenu inu no kuso
en:
the first snowfall
doesn't hide it...
the dog's poop

jp: .風陰に雪がつむ也門畠
ro: kazakage ni yuki ga tsumu nari kado hatake
en:
sheltered from wind
what a snow pile!
garden by the gate

jp: .腹の虫なるぞよ雪は翌あたり
ro: hara no mushi naru zo yuki wa asu atari
en:
the worms in my belly
warn:
"Snow tomorrow!"

jp: .あばら家にとんで火に入る霰哉
ro: abaraya [ni] tonde hi ni iru arare kana
en:
in my ramshackle hut
flying into fire...
hailstones

jp: .広小路に人打散る霰哉
ro: hirokôji ni hito uchi-chiraru arare kana
en:
pelting people
on the highway...
hailstones

jp: .広小路に人ちらかって玉霰
ro: hirôkoji ni hito chirakatte tama arare
en:
making people
on the highway scatter...
hailstones

jp: .霜の夜や七貧人の小寄合
ro: shimo no yo ya shichi hinjin no ko yoriai
en:
frosty night--
seven poor men
in a huddle

jp: .暁立の人の通りもかれの哉
ro: akedachi no hito no tôri mo kareno kana
en:
at dawn people
passing through...
withered fields

jp: .雉立て人おどろかすかれの哉
ro: kiji tatte hito odorokasu kareno kana
en:
a pheasant rising
startles the man...
withered fields

jp: .吹風に声も枯野の烏かな
ro: fuku kaze ni koe mo kareno no karasu kana
en:
voices in the wind
the withered field's
crows

jp: .門違してくださるな福の神
ro: kado chigai shite kudasaru na fuku no kami
en:
don't miss my gate
please!
good luck god

jp: .神々の留主せんたくやけふも雨
ro: kami-gami no rusu sentaku ya kyô mo ame
en:
trying to do my laundry
while the gods are away...
another day of rain

jp: .苦のさばや神の御立も雨嵐
ro: ku no saba ya kami no o-tatsu mo ame arashi
en:
world of suffering--
when the gods travel, too
a storm

jp: .じゃじゃ雨の降に御帰り貧乏神
ro: ja ja ame no furu ni o-kaeri bimbô-gami
en:
well, well
coming home in the rain...
god of the poor

jp: .まめな妻忘れ給ふな神送
ro: mamena tsuma wasure tamau na kami okuru
en:
don't forget
your pink-cheeked wife!
departing god

jp: .水浴びて並ぶ烏や神迎え
ro: mizu abi[te] narabu karasu ya kami muka[e]
en:
crows line up
after their baths...
welcoming the gods

jp: .十夜から直に吉原参り哉
ro: jûya kara sugu [ni] yoshiwara mairi kana
en:
after winter prayers
right away...
a trip to Yoshiwara

jp: .念仏の十夜が十夜月夜哉
ro: nembutsu no jûya ga jûya tsuki yo kana
en:
ten nights of
winter prayers, ten nights
of moon

jp: .法の世は犬さへ十夜参哉
ro: nori no yo wa inu sae jûya mairi kana
en:
world of Buddha's law--
even a dog on winter
pilgrimage

jp: .旅の皺御覧候へばせを仏
ro: tabi no shiwa goran sôrô e bashôbutsu
en:
behold these traveler's
wrinkles...
Basho Buddha!

jp: .古郷や四五年ぶりの煤払
ro: furusato ya shi go nenburi no susu harai
en:
my home village--
four or five years of soot
needs sweeping

jp: .煤さわぎすむや御堂の朱蝋燭
ro: susu sawagi sumu ya midô no shu rôsoku
en:
after the soot-sweeping
clamor...
the temple's red candles

jp: .煤はきや和尚は居間にひとり釜
ro: susu haki ya oshô wa ima ni hitori kama
en:
sweeping soot--
in the high priest's chamber
a lonely cauldron

jp: .馬の屁の真風下やせっき候
ro: uma no he no makkaza shimo ya sekkizoro
en:
downwind
from the horse's fart...
Twelfth Month singers

jp: .門の犬じゃらしながら小せき候
ro: kado no inu jarashi nagara ya ko sekizoro
en:
playing with the dog
at the gate...
little Twelfth Month singer

jp: .子仏や指さして居るせっき候
ro: ko-botoke ya yubi [sa]shite iru sekkizoro
en:
a child Buddha
pointing...
Twelfth Month singers

jp: .せき候や長大門の暮の月
ro: sekizoro ya chôdaimon no kure no tsuki
en:
Twelfth Month singers
at the temple's great gate...
moon at dusk

jp: .一人前つくとて餅のさわぎ哉
ro: hitorimae tsuku tote mochi no sawagi kana
en:
just a single helping
of rice cake is pounded...
a commotion!

jp: .こちへ来る餅の音ぞよ遠隣
ro: kochi e kuru mochi no oto zo yo tô tonari
en:
the sound of rice cake
pounding drifts here...
distant neighbor

jp: .一丸メするとて餅のさわぎ哉
ro: hito marume suru tote mochi no sawagi kana
en:
making just one
round rice cake...
a commotion!

jp: .かくれ家や尿瓶も添て衣配
ro: kakurega ya shibin mo soete kinu kubari
en:
secluded house--
even for the piss-pot
a gift of new clothes

jp: .手軽さや紙拵への衣配
ro: tegarusa ya kami koshirae no kinu kubari
en:
feather-light
made of paper...
gift of new clothes

jp: .かくれ家や毎日日日とし忘
ro: kakurega ya mainichi-nichi-nichi toshiwasure
en:
secluded house--
every day, drinking
the year away

jp: .一人居や一徳利のとし忘
ro: hitori i ya hito tokkuri no toshiwasure
en:
living alone--
just one bottle
for drinking away the year

jp: .大御代や小村小村もとしの市
ro: ômiyo ya ko mura ko mura mo toshi no ichi
en:
our great age!
in every little town
year's end fairs

jp: .皮羽織見せに行也としの市
ro: kawa haori mise ni yuku nari toshi [no] ichi
en:
showing off
my leather coat...
year's end fair

jp: .古札と一ッにくくる暦哉
ro: furu fuda to hitotsu ni kukuru koyomi kana
en:
bundling it up
with an old charm...
last year's calendar

jp: .山人は薬といふや古ごよみ
ro: yamaudo wa kusuri to iu ya furu-goyomi
en:
the mountain hermit
calls it medicine...
last year's calendar

jp: .わづらはぬ日をかぞへけり古暦
ro: wazurawanu hi wo kazoe keri furu-goyomi
en:
I've counted
my trouble-free days...
last year's calendar

jp: .日本にとしをとるのがらくだかな
ro: nippon ni toshi wo toru no ga raku da kana
en:
growing a year older
in Japan
is a comfort

jp: .みだ仏のみやげに年を給ふ哉
ro: mida butsu no miyage ni toshi wo tama[u] kana
en:
a present from
Amida Buddha...
one year older

jp: .浅草や一厄おとす寺参り
ro: asakusa ya hito yaku otosu tera mai[ri]
en:
Asakusa--
visiting the temple
driving out a devil

jp: .おとし厄馬につけたりいせ参り
ro: otoshi yaku uma [ni] tsuketari ise mairi
en:
the devil driven
from a horse...
Ise Shrine pilgrimage

jp: .四辻や厄おとす人拾ふ人
ro: yotsutsuji ya yaku otoshi hito hirou hito
en:
four-way crossroads--
one drives out devils
one takes them in

jp: .老鳥の追れぬ先に覚悟哉
ro: oi tori no owarenu saki ni kakugo kana
en:
old bird--
even before the hunt begins
accepting the inevitable

jp: .追鳥の不足の所へ狐哉
ro: oi-dori no fusoku no toko e kitsune kana
en:
heading for where
bird hunters are few...
the fox

jp: .追鳥や狐とてしも用捨なく
ro: oi-dori ya kitsune tote shi mo yôsha naku
en:
bird hunter--
even for a fox
no mercy

jp: .追鳥や鳥より先につかれ寝る
ro: oi-dori ya tori yori saki ni tsukare neru
en:
bird hunter--
even before his falcon
a weary sleep

jp: .追鳥を烏笑ふや堂の屋根
ro: oi-dori wo karasu warau ya dô no yane
en:
the crow laughs
at the bird hunters...
temple roof

jp: .けふでいく日咽もぬらさで鳥逃る
ro: kyô de iku hi nodo mo nurasade tori nigeru
en:
up to now
how many days of thirst?
hunted bird

jp: .逃込だ寺が生捕る雉子哉
ro: nige konda tera ga ikedoru kigisu kana
en:
a fugitive in the temple
caught alive...
pheasant

jp: .逃鳥やどちへ向ても人の声
ro: nige tori ya dochi e muite mo hito no koe
en:
fleeing bird--
every direction it turns
people's voices

jp: .逃鳥よやれやれそちはおとし罠
ro: nige tori yo yare yare sochi wa otoshiana
en:
fleeing bird
watch out, that way's
a pit trap!

jp: .骨折って鳥追込やきつね穴
ro: hone otte tori oikomu ya kitsune ana
en:
laboring hard
the bird pens his prey...
foxhole

jp: .達者なは口ばかりなる紙衣哉
ro: tassha-na wa kuchi bakari naru kamiko kana
en:
now the only vigorous thing
is his mouth...
paper robe

jp: .焼穴を反故でこそぐる紙衣哉
ro: yakeana wo hogo de kosoguru kamiko kana
en:
the wastepaper patch
for the burn hold tickles...
paper robe

jp: .門先や雪の仏も苦い顔
ro: kado saki ya yuki no hotoke mo nigai-gao
en:
at my gate
the snow Buddha also
scowls

jp: .荒馬とうしろ合せや冬篭
ro: arauma to ushiro awa[se] ya fuyugomori
en:
an unruly horse
behind the house...
winter seclusion

jp: .こおろぎもついて来にけり冬篭り
ro: kôrogi mo tsuite ki ni keri fuyugomori
en:
the cricket also
moves in with me...
winter seclusion

jp: .冬篭るも一日二日哉
ro: fuyugomoru mo ichi nichi futsuka kana
en:
one more day
of winter seclusion...
makes two

jp: .御仏は柱の穴や冬ごもり
ro: mi-botoke wa hashira no ana ya fuyugomori
en:
Buddha in his niche
in the pillar...
winter seclusion

jp: .遠山の講釈をする炬燵哉
ro: tôyama [no] kôdan wo suru kotatsu kana
en:
we tell stories
of the far mountains
'round the brazier

jp: .納豆や一人前にはるばると
ro: nattô ya ichininmae ni haru-baru to
en:
natto--
for a full portion
traveling far

jp: .わらづとのみやげもけぶる納豆哉
ro: warazuto no miyage mo keburu natto kana
en:
the souvenir straw wrapper
smolders too...
my natto

jp: .わらづとや田舎納豆いなか菊
ro: warazuto ya inaka nattô to inaka kiku
en:
wrapped in straw--
country natto
country chrysanthemum

jp: .鰒汁に人呼込むや広小路
ro: fugu shiru ni hito yobi-komu ya hirokôji
en:
calling people
for the pufferfish soup...
highway

jp: .宵々や眠り薬の鰒汁
ro: yoi-yoi ya nemuri-gusuri no fukuto-jiru
en:
every evening
my sleep medicine...
pufferfish soup

jp: .猪くはぬ顔で子供の師匠哉
ro: shishi kuwanu kao de kodomo no shishô kana
en:
making a face
he turns down the boar stew...
teaching the children

jp: .店先の木兎まじりまじりかな
ro: misesaki no mimizuku majiri-majiri kana
en:
the shop front's
scops owl
fidgeting, fidgeting

jp: .木兎や上手に眠る竿の先
ro: mimizuku ya jyôzu ni nemuru sao no saki
en:
scops owl--
sleeping so well
atop the pole

jp: .五百崎や鍋の中でも鳴千鳥
ro: iosaki ya nabe [no] naka demo naku chidori
en:
Iosaki--
in a kettle a plover
singing

jp: .声々や子どもの交じる浜千鳥
ro: koe-goe ya kodomo [no] majiru hama chidori
en:
an uproar on the beach--
children
and plovers

jp: .誂たやうに染分大根哉
ro: atsuraeta yô ni somewaku daikon kana
en:
with made-to-order
motley coloring...
the radish

jp: .四五本の大根洗ふも人手哉
ro: shi go hon no daiko arau mo hitode kana
en:
even for washing
four or five radishes...
hired help

jp: .大根を丸ごとかぢる爺哉
ro: daikon wo marugoto kajiru jijii kana
en:
gnawing a radish
till it's gone...
the old man

jp: .引時ももれぬや藪の大根迄
ro: hikidoki [mo] morenu ya yabu no daikon made
en:
at picking time
not left out...the thicket's
radishes

jp: .明がたや葱明りの流し元
ro: akegata ya nebuka akari no nagashimoto
en:
dawn--
the glint of leeks
in the sink

jp: .野仏の頭をもかく木の葉哉
ro: no-botoke no atama wo mo kaku ki no ha kana
en:
scratching the field Buddha's
head too...
tree leaves

jp: .冬枯や柳の瘤の売わらじ
ro: fuyugare ya yanagi no kobu no uri-waraji
en:
winter withering--
on the willow's gnarl
straw sandals for sale

jp: .元日や庵の玄関の仕拵へ
ro: ganjitsu ya io no genkwan no shigoshirae
en:
New Year's Day--
my hut's front door
all ready

jp: .元日や闇いうちから猫の恋
ro: ganjitsu ya kurai uchi kara neko no koi
en:
New Year's Day--
in the dark before dawn
the lover cat

jp: .元朝に十念仏のゆきき哉
ro: ganchô ni jû nembutsu no yukiki kana
en:
on New Year's morning
the prayers to Buddha
come and go

jp: .苦にやんだ元日するや人並に
ro: ku ni yanda ganjitsu suru ya hito nami ni
en:
I struggled though
my New Year's Day...
like everyone

jp: .行灯のかたっぴらより明の春
ro: andon no katappira yori ake no haru
en:
on one side
of my paper lantern...
first of spring

jp: .善光寺やかけ念仏で明の春
ro: zenkôji ya kake-nembutsu de ake no haru
en:
at Zenko Temple
praising Buddha to the beat...
spring begins

jp: .爺が世や枯木も雪の花の春
ro: jiji ga yo ya kare-gi mo yuki no hana no haru
en:
an old man's world--
flowers of snow on bare trees
spring's blossoms

jp: .むさしのや大名衆も旅の春
ro: musashi no ya daimyô shû mo tabi no haru
en:
Musashi Plain--
feudal lords too
on spring journeys

jp: .小ばくちは蚊の呪や里の春
ro: ko bakuchi wa ka no majinai ya sato no haru
en:
a bit of gambling
to ward off mosquitoes this year...
spring in the village

jp: .とし棚やこんな家にも式作法
ro: toshi-dana ya konna ie ni mo shikisahô
en:
New Year's shelf--
even in this dump
etiquette

jp: .薮入や連に別れて櫛仕廻ふ
ro: yabuiri ya tsure ni waka[re]te kushi shimau
en:
Servants' Holiday--
fellow travelers part ways
combing the hair

jp: .あばら家や曲った形に門飾
ro: abaraya ya magatta nari ni kado kazari
en:
ramshackle hut--
my New Year's decorations
on crooked

jp: .吹ばとぶ家の世並や〆かざり
ro: fukeba tobu ie no yonami ya shime kazari
en:
blown away as usual
my house's
New Year's rope

jp: .正月のくせに成ったる福茶哉
ro: shôgatsu no kuse ni nattaru fukucha kana
en:
the first month
has me hooked on it...
lucky tea

jp: .外からは梅がとび込福茶哉
ro: soto kara wa ume ga tobikomu fukucha kana
en:
from outside
plum blossoms diving in...
lucky tea

jp: .親里の山へ向って御慶哉
ro: oyazato no yama e muitte gyokei kana
en:
facing the mountain
of my home village...
"Happy New Year!"

jp: .供部屋がさはぎ勝也年始酒
ro: tomobeya ga sawagi katsu nari nenshi sake
en:
the uproar in the servants' room
wins out...
New Year's toasts

jp: .百旦那ころりころころ御慶哉
ro: hyaku danna korori koro-koro gyokei kana
en:
tight-fisted donors
rolling along...
"Happy New Year!"

jp: .両方に小便しながら御慶哉
ro: ryôhô ni shôben shi nagara gyokei kana
en:
on both sides
while they and I piddle...
"Happy New Year!"

jp: .百福の始るふいご始哉
ro: hyakufuku no hajimeru fuigo hajime kana
en:
starting the New Year's luck
first stoke
of the fire

jp: .脇差の柄にぶらぶら若菜哉
ro: wakazashi no tsuka ni bura-bura wakana kana
en:
from the short sword's
hilt dingle-dangling
herbs

jp: .神国や草も元日きっと咲
ro: kamiguni ya kusa mo ganjitsu kitto saku
en:
O blessed land--
on New Year's Day
the grasses also bloom!

jp: .永き日や嬉し涙がほろほろと
ro: nagaki hi ya ureshinamida ga horo-horo to
en:
a long day--
my tears of joy
rolling down

jp: .湯に入るも仕事となれば日永哉
ro: yu ni iru mo shigoto to nareba hinaga kana
en:
when even bathing
becomes a chore...
a long day

jp: .春永と延した春も仕廻哉
ro: haru naga to noboshita haru mo shimai kana
en:
the long
stretched-out spring finally...
over

jp: .芝居日と家内は出たり春の雨
ro: shibai hi to kanai wa detari haru no ame
en:
"It's theater day!"
my wife goes out...
spring rain

jp: .春雨や腹をへらしに湯につかる
ro: harusame ya hara wo herashi ni yu ni tsukaru
en:
spring rain--
to help the digestion
a hot bath

jp: .めぐり日と俳諧日也春の雨
ro: meguri hi to haikai hi nari haru no ame
en:
a day for wandering
a day for haiku...
spring rain

jp: .春の風子どもも一箕二み哉
ro: haru [no] kaze kodomo mo hito mi futa mi kana
en:
spring breeze--
even a child has a winnow
two winnows!

jp: .陽炎や薪の山の雪なだれ
ro: kagerô ya takigi no yama no yukinadare
en:
heat shimmers--
an avalanche
on firewood mountain!

jp: .吉日に老の頭の雪解哉
ro: kichi nichi ni oi no atama no yukige kana
en:
on a lucky day
the snow on the old head
has melted!

jp: .鶏のつつきとかすや門の雪
ro: niwatori no tsutsuki tokasu ya kado no yuki
en:
the pecking chicken
makes it melt...
snow at the gate

jp: .改て吹かける也ひがん雪
ro: aratamete fukikakeru nari higan yuki
en:
rearranged
by the wind...
spring equinox snow

jp: .つみ草を母は駕から目利哉
ro: tsumi kusa wo haha wa kago kara mekiki kana
en:
picking herbs--
Mother from her palanquin
watches

jp: .蝶々を尻尾でなぶる小猫哉
ro: chôchô wo shippo de naburu ko neko kana
en:
teasing a butterfly
with his tail...
the kitten

jp: .雀子や牛にも馬にも踏れずに
ro: suzumego ya ushi ni mo uma ni mo fumarezu ni
en:
baby sparrows
by the cow and the horse
untrampled

jp: .鶯や家半分はまだ月夜
ro: uguisu ya ie hambun wa mada tsuki yo
en:
nightingale--
half of the house is still
moonlit

jp: .鶯や雀はせせる報謝米
ro: uguisu ya suzume wa seseru hôsha kome
en:
nightingale--
the sparrow pecking
the rice for the god

jp: .鶯やりん打ば鳴うてばなく
ro: uguisu [ya] rin uteba naku uteba naku
en:
nightingale--
the bell rings, he sings
the bell rings, he sings

jp: .ほけ経を鳴ば鳴也辻ばくち
ro: hokekyô wo nakeba naku nari tsuji bakuchi
en:
when he sings he sings
the Lotus Sutra...
gambling at the crossroads

jp: .じっとして馬に嗅るる蛙哉
ro: jitto shite uma ni kagaruru kawazu kana
en:
stone still
for the smelling horse...
a frog

jp: .どっさりと居り込だる蛙哉
ro: dossari to suwari kondaru kawazu kana
en:
down he sits
with a great thump...
frog

jp: .棒杭に江戸を詠る蛙哉
ro: bôgui ni edo wo nagamuru kawazu kana
en:
on top of a stake
eyeing Edo...
a frog

jp: .山吹へ片手で下る蛙哉
ro: yamabuki e katate de sagaru kawazu kana
en:
hanging from the yellow rose
with one hand...
a frog!

jp: .過去のやくそくかよ袖に寝小てふ
ro: kako no yakusoku ka yo sode ni neru ko chô
en:
a previous life's bond?
little butterfly
on my sleeve, asleep

jp: .木の陰や蝶と休むも他生の縁
ro: ki no kage ya chô to yasumu mo tashô no en
en:
in tree shade
relaxing with a butterfly...
friends in a previous life

jp: .つぐら子をこそぐり起す小てふ哉
ro: tsugura ko wo kosoguri okosu ko chô kana
en:
tickling the baby
in the basket awake...
little butterfly

jp: .つぐら子の鼻くそせせる小てふ哉
ro: tsugura ko no hanakuso seseru ko chô kana
en:
baby in a basket--
playing with her snot
a little butterfly

jp: .湯の滝を上手に廻る小てふ哉
ro: yu no taki wo jyôzu ni meguru ko chô kana
en:
skillfully skirting
the hot tub waterfall...
little butterfly

jp: .若草をむざむざふむや泥わらじ
ro: wakakusa wo muza-muza fumu ya doro waraji
en:
recklessly stomping
the baby grass...
muddy straw sandals

jp: .わか草のさてもわかいわかいぞよ
ro: waka-gusa no sate mo wakai wakai zo yo
en:
the young grasses
after all
are, well, young!

jp: .真丸に草青む也御堂前
ro: manmaru ni kusa aomu nari midô mae
en:
new green grass
makes a perfect circle...
facing the temple hall

jp: .百両の石にもまけぬつつじ哉
ro: hyaku ryô no ishi ni mo makenu tsutsuji kana
en:
just as wonderful
as the expensive garden stone...
azaleas

jp: .貝殻をはいて歩くや里の梅
ro: kaigara wo haite aruku ya sato no ume
en:
walking along
sweeping shells...
plum blossom village

jp: .あっさりとあさぎ頭巾の花見哉
ro: assari to asagi zukin no hanami kana
en:
with a plain, light-blue
skullcap...
blossom viewing

jp: .花咲て娑婆則寂光浄土哉
ro: hana saite shaba soku jakkôjôdo kana
en:
cherry trees blooming--
this corrupt world
is a Pure Land!

jp: .花の木に鶏寝るや浅草寺
ro: hana no ki ni niwatori neru ya sensôji
en:
in the blooming tree
a sleeping chicken...
Senso Temple

jp: .人来ればひとりの連や花の山
ro: hito kureba hitori no tsure ya hana no yama
en:
if someone came
I'd have a companion...
blossoming mountain

jp: .あれあれといふ口へちるさくら哉
ro: are-are to iu kuchi e chiru sakura kana
en:
toward the mouth
shouting "There! There!"
cherry blossoms fall

jp: .天狗衆の留主のうち咲く山ざくら
ro: tengushu no rusu [no] uchi saku yama-zakura
en:
mountain goblins
are out in droves...
cherry blossoms!

jp: .門の犬なぐさみ吼や桃の花
ro: kado no inu nagusami hoe ya momo no hana
en:
the dog at the gate
barks for fun...
at peach blossoms

jp: .立午の尻こする也桃の花
ro: tatsu uma no shiri kosuru nari momo no hana
en:
the horse stands
rubbing his rump...
peach blossoms

jp: .短夜の畠に亀のあそび哉
ro: mijika yo no hatake ni kame no asobi kana
en:
short summer night--
in the field turtles
cavort

jp: .短夜も寝余りにけりあまりけり
ro: mijika yo mo ne-amari ni keri amari keri
en:
though night is short
too long! too long!
for me

jp: .あつき日も子につかはるる乙鳥哉
ro: atsuki hi mo ko ni tsukawaruru tsubame kana
en:
even on a hot day
out for the children...
swallows

jp: .涼しさや汁の椀にも不二の山
ro: suzushisa ya shiru no wan ni mo fuji no yama
en:
cool air--
even in my soup bowl
Mount Fuji!

jp: .涼しさや青いつりがね赤い花
ro: suzushisa ya aoi tsurigane akai hana
en:
cool air--
a green hanging bell
red blossoms

jp: .涼しさや切紙の雪はらはらと
ro: suzushisa ya kirigami no yuki hara-hara to
en:
cool air--
paper snowflakes fluttering
down

jp: .釣鐘の青いばかりも涼しさよ
ro: tsurigane no aoi bakari mo suzushisa yo
en:
the hanging temple bell
is all green...
cool air

jp: .うつくしや雲一ッなき土用空
ro: utsukushi ya kumo hitotsu naki doyô-zora
en:
pretty--
not a cloud in the
midsummer sky

jp: .正直の国や来世も虎が雨
ro: shôjiki no kuni ya raise mo tora ga ame
en:
for a sincere land
even in the next life...
Rain of the Tiger

jp: .としよりのおれが袖へも虎が雨
ro: toshiyori no ore ga sode e mo tora ga ame
en:
wetting this old man's
sleeve too...
Rain of the Tiger

jp: .人鬼の里ももらさず虎が雨
ro: hito oni no sato mo morasazu tora ga ame
en:
the village of human goblins
isn't left out...
Rain of the Tiger

jp: .日の本や天長地久虎が雨
ro: hi no moto ya tenchô chikyû tora ga ame
en:
Land of the Rising Sun!
old as heaven and earth
Rain of the Tiger

jp: .末世でも神の国ぞよ虎が雨
ro: masse demo kami no kuni zo yo tora [ga] ame
en:
though in the Latter Days
the land of the gods!
Tiger Rain

jp: .図に乗って夕立来るやけふも又
ro: zu ni notte yûdachi kuru ya kyô mo mata
en:
all puffed up
today the cloudburst
comes again

jp: .始まるやつくば夕立不二に又
ro: hajimaru ya tsukuba yûdachi fuji ni mata
en:
origins--
Mount Tsukuba's cloudburst
becomes Mount Fuji's

jp: .夕立にこねかへされし畠哉
ro: yûdachi ni konekaesareshi hatake kana
en:
with a cloudburst
kneaded in completely...
the field

jp: .夕立や象潟畠甘満時
ro: yûdachi ya kisagata hatake kanmanji
en:
a rainstorm--
Kisa Lagoon's farmland
and Kanman Temple

jp: .夕立やしゃんと立てる菊の花
ro: yûdachi ya shan to tatteru kiku no hana
en:
in the cloudburst
chin up, back straight...
chrysanthemum

jp: .夕立や裸で乗しはだか馬
ro: yûdachi ya hadaka de norishi hadaka uma
en:
rainstorm--
a naked rider
on a naked horse

jp: .夕立や藪の社の十二灯
ro: yûdachi ya yabu no yashiro no jû ni tô
en:
rainstorm--
the shrine in the thicket's
twelve lamps

jp: .御仏や生るるまねに銭が降
ro: mi-botoke ya umaruru mane ni zeni ga furu
en:
the Buddha--
on his birthday a shower
of coins

jp: .御仏や生るるまねも鉦太鼓
ro: mi-botoke ya umaruru mane mo kane taiko
en:
Buddha pretends
to be born...
bells and big drums

jp: .御仏や銭の中より御誕生
ro: mi-botoke ya zeni no naka yori o-tanjô
en:
the Buddha
immersed in coins celebrates
his birthday

jp: .夏籠や毎晩見舞ふ引がへる
ro: ge-gomori ya maiban mimau hikigaeru
en:
summer seclusion--
every night the toad
comes calling

jp: .よそ目には夏書と見ゆる小窓哉
ro: yosome ni wa natsusho to miyuru ko mado kana
en:
others might think
I'm at my summer calligraphy...
little window

jp: .捨た身を十程くぐるちのわ哉
ro: suteta mi wo jû hodo kuguru chinowa kana
en:
about ten times through
for the foundling...
purification hoop

jp: .形代におぶせて流す虱哉
ro: katashiro ni obusete nagasu shirami kana
en:
on the little plague god
floating away...
lice

jp: .形代にさらばさらばをする子哉
ro: katashiro ni saraba saraba wo suru ko kana
en:
"Farewell! Farewell!"
the plague god floats away...
little child

jp: .川狩にのがれし魚の見すぼらし
ro: kawagari ni nogareshi uo no misuborashi
en:
night fishing--
the ones that get away
all runts

jp: .夕立のいよいよ始る太鼓哉
ro: yûdachi no iyo-iyo hajimaru taiko kana
en:
at long last
the cloudburst!
the big drum booms

jp: .夕立の蓑をきたまま酒宴哉
ro: yûdachi no mino [wo] kita mama shuen kana
en:
in straw raincoats
for the summer shower...
drinking party

jp: .乙鳥が口しゃべる也更衣
ro: tsubakura ga kuchi shaberu nari koromogae
en:
the swallow
wide-mouthed chatters...
new summer robes

jp: .おもしろう汗のしとるや旅浴衣
ro: omoshirô ase no shitoru ya tabi yukata
en:
how delightful--
my damp, sweaty
traveler's bathrobe

jp: .馬の子の目をあぶながるひがさ哉
ro: uma no ko no me wo abunagaru [hi]gasa kana
en:
the pony's eyes
look afraid...
parasols

jp: .下駄はいて細縄渡る日傘哉
ro: geta haite hoso nawa wataru higasa kana
en:
in wooden clogs
crossing a narrow rope...
with parasol

jp: .先立の念仏乞食や日傘
ro: sakidachi no nebutsu kojiki ya higarakasa
en:
a beggar goes first
praising Buddha...
with parasol

jp: .白笠や浅黄の傘や東山
ro: shiro-gasa ya asagi no kasa ya higashi yama
en:
white umbrella-hats
pale blue parasols...
Higashi Mountains

jp: .飯櫃の簾は青き屑家哉
ro: meshibitsu no sudare wa aoki kuzuya kana
en:
on the cooked rice-tub
the bamboo blind is green...
trashy house

jp: .両国や小さい舟の青簾
ro: ryôgoku ya chiisai fune no ao sudare
en:
Ryogaku Bridge--
a little boat with green
bamboo blinds

jp: .夕がやの中にそよぐや草の花
ro: yû-gaya no naka ni soyogu ya kusa no hana
en:
in evening's mosquito net
rustling
wildflowers

jp: .団扇の柄なめるを乳のかはり哉
ro: uchiwa no e nameru wo chichi no kawari kana
en:
on the fan's handle
the baby sucks...
a substitute

jp: .天狗はどこにて団扇づかひ哉
ro: tengu wa doko nite uchiwa-zukai kana
en:
wind-making goblin
where are you fanning
your fan?

jp: .負ふた子も拍子を泣や田植唄
ro: outa ko mo hyôshi wo naku ya taue uta
en:
the child on her back
cries to the beat...
rice-planting song

jp: .小さい子も内から来るや田植飯
ro: chisai ko mo uchi kara kuru ya taue meshi
en:
even a little child
comes out of the house...
rice planters' lunch

jp: .どっしりと藤も咲也田植唄
ro: dosshiri to fuji mo saku nari taue uta
en:
the wisteria too
blooming en masse...
rice-planting song

jp: .軒下の拵へ滝や心太
ro: noki shita no koshirae taki ya tokoroten
en:
making a waterfall
under the eaves...
sweet jelly

jp: .かはほりの袖下通る月夜哉
ro: kawahori no sode shita tôru tsuki yo kana
en:
a bat flits
under my sleeve...
moonlit night

jp: .かはほりの代々土蔵住居哉
ro: kawaho[ri] no dai-dai dozô sumai kana
en:
generations of bats
have called this storehouse
home

jp: .かはほりの人に交る夕薬師
ro: kawahori no hito ni majiwaru yû yakushi
en:
bats keep the pilgrims
company...
Buddha of Healing

jp: .洪水やかはほり下る渡し綱
ro: kôzui ya kawahori sagaru watshi-zuna
en:
flood waters--
bats dangle
from the crossing-rope

jp: .我宿に一夜たのむぞ蚊喰鳥
ro: waga yado ni hito yo tanomu zo ka kui tori
en:
I entrust my home
for the night
to mosquito-eating bats

jp: .大江戸の隅からすみ迄時鳥
ro: ôedo no sumi kara sumi made hototogisu
en:
great Edo
from nook to nook
"cuckoo!"

jp: .大とびや逃盗人と時鳥
ro: ôtobi ya nige nusubito to hototogisu
en:
a big leap--
the fleeing burglar
and a cuckoo

jp: .小山田の昼寝起すや時鳥
ro: o-yamada no hirune okosu ya hototogisu
en:
waking the farmer
from his siesta...
cuckoo

jp: .猪牙舟もついついついぞ時鳥
ro: chokibune mo tsui-tsui-tsui zo hototogisu
en:
while the canoe goes
swish, swish, swish...
a cuckoo

jp: .天狗衆は留守ぞせい出せ時鳥
ro: tengu shu wa rusu zo seidase hototogisu
en:
the goblins are gone
so get to work!
cuckoo

jp: .とびくらをするや夜盗と時鳥
ro: tobikura wo suru ya yatô to hototogisu
en:
having a jumping contest
a night burglar
a cuckoo

jp: .一声であいそづかしや時鳥
ro: hito koe de aisozukashi ya hototogisu
en:
just one song
then turning a cold shoulder...
cuckoo

jp: .時鳥小舟もつういつうい哉
ro: hototogisu kobune mo tsûi tsûi kana
en:
a cuckoo sings
the little boat goes
swish, swish!

jp: .待人にあいそづかしや時鳥
ro: matsu hito ni aisozukashi ya hototogisu
en:
turning a cold shoulder
to the one who waited...
cuckoo

jp: .祭垣の米粒つむや閑古鳥
ro: imigaki no kome tsubu tsumu ya kankodori
en:
pecking rice
on the shrine's fence...
mountain cuckoo

jp: .一村の鼾盛りや行々し
ro: hito mura no ibiki-zakari ya gyôgyôshi
en:
the village hits
a crescendo of snores...
reed thrush

jp: .昼飯を犬がとるとや行々し
ro: hirumeshi wo inu [ga] toru to ya gyôgyôshi
en:
"The dog took your lunch!"
the reed thrush
tattles

jp: .満月に夜かせぎするや行々し
ro: mangetsu ni yo kasegi suru ya gyôgyôshi
en:
working at night
under the full moon...
reed thrush

jp: .満月に夜なべ鳴や行々し
ro: mangetsu ni yonabe wo naku ya gyôgyôshi
en:
night work singing
under the full moon...
reed thrush

jp: .待て居る妻子もないか通し鴨
ro: matte iru saishi mo nai ka tôshi-gamo
en:
no wife and kids
waiting for you?
lingering duck

jp: .今の世や蛇の衣も銭になる
ro: ima no yo ya hebi no koromo mo zeni ni naru
en:
the world today!
even a snake's skin
for sale

jp: .行当る家に寝る也大ぼたる
ro: yukiataru ie ni neru nari ya ôbotaru
en:
sleeping in the house
it bumped into...
big firefly

jp: .戦をのがれて庵の蛍哉
ro: tatakai wo nogarete io no hotaru kana
en:
escaping the fight outside
my hut's
fireflies

jp: .又一ッ川を越せとやよぶ蛍
ro: mata hitotsu kawa wo kose to ya yobu hotaru
en:
one more
cross the river!
fireflies flit

jp: .湯上りの腕こそぐる蛍哉
ro: yuagari [no] kaina kosoguru hotaru kana
en:
after the bath
tickling my armpit...
firefly

jp: .食逃や蚊蚤もちえの文珠堂
ro: kui nige ya ka nomi mo chie no monjudô
en:
eat and run, the wisdom
of mosquitoes and fleas...
Wisdom Buddha's temple

jp: .僧正の頭の上や蝿つるむ
ro: sôjô no atama no ue ya hae tsurumu
en:
on the high priest's
head...
flies making love

jp: .無常鐘蝿虫めらもよっくきけ
ro: mujô-gane hae mushimera mo yokku kike
en:
the bell of life passing--
O flies and worms
listen well!

jp: .老ぼれと見くびって蚤も逃ぬ也
ro: oibore to mikubitte nomi mo nigenu nari
en:
since I'm decrepit
the fleas aren't worried
about escaping

jp: .としよりと見くびって蚤逃ぬぞよ
ro: toshiyori [to] mikubitte nomi nigenu zo yo
en:
since I'm old
the fleas aren't worried
about escaping

jp: .蚤焼て日和占ふ山家哉
ro: nomi yakite hiyori uranau yamaga kana
en:
burning fleas
to predict the weather...
mountain home

jp: .よい月や内へ這入れば蚤地獄
ro: yoi tsuki [ya] uchi e haireba nomi jigoku
en:
good moon--
but going inside
a hell of fleas

jp: .刀禰川や只一ッの水馬
ro: tone-gawa ya tatta hitotsu no mizusumashi
en:
Tone River--
only one solitary
water strider

jp: .蝉鳴や盲法師が扇笠
ro: semi naku ya mekura hôshi ga ôgi kasa
en:
cicadas chirr--
the blind priest's fan
his umbrella-hat

jp: .小粒なは安心げぞかたつむり
ro: ko tsubu na wa anshin ge zo katatsumuri
en:
so teeny-tiny
resting in peace
little snail

jp: .笹の葉や小とり廻しのかたつむり
ro: sasa no ha ya ko torimawashi no katatsumuri
en:
bamboo leaf--
he takes his little portion
the snail

jp: .大江戸や犬もありつくはつ松魚
ro: ôedo ya inu mo aritsuku hatsu-gatsuo
en:
great Edo--
even for the dog
summer's first bonito

jp: .鰹一本に長家のさわぎ哉
ro: katsuo ippon ni nagaya no sawagi kana
en:
a whole bonito fish
for the shotgun house
an uproar!

jp: .柴の戸へ見せて行也初松魚
ro: shiba no to e misete yuku nari hatsu-gatsuo
en:
to my humble hut
they come to gawk...
summer's first bonito

jp: .けし提てけん嘩の中を通いけり
ro: keshi sagete kenka no naka wo tôri keri
en:
carrying a poppy
he passes through
the quarrel

jp: .金まうけ上手な寺のぼたん哉
ro: kane môke jôzuna tera no botan kana
en:
a money-making
temple...
the peonies in bloom

jp: .唐びいきめさるる寺のぼたん哉
ro: karabiiki mesaruru tera [no] botan kana
en:
the temple favors
the Chinese style...
with its peonies

jp: .立石の穴をふさげるぼたん哉
ro: tateishi no ana wo fusageru botan kana
en:
stuck in a hole
in a stone signpost...
a peony

jp: .つくづくとぼたんの上の蛙哉
ro: tsuku-zuku to botan no ue no kawazu kana
en:
a masterly climb
to the top of the peony...
frog

jp: .乙鳥の泥口ぬぐふぼたん哉
ro: tsubakura [no] doro-guchi nuguu botan kana
en:
the swallow wipes
his muddy mouth...
on the peony

jp: .日に日に麦ぬか浴るぼたん哉
ro: hi [ni] hi ni mugi nuka abiru botan kana
en:
day after day
bathing in wheat chaff...
the peony

jp: .揉ぬかやぼたん畠の通り道
ro: momi nuka ya botan hatake no tôri michi
en:
rice chaff--
the path through
the peony garden

jp: .山雲や赤は牡丹の花の雲
ro: yama kumo ya aka wa botan no hana no kumo
en:
mountain clouds--
that red one is a field
of peonies!

jp: .麦搗の大道中の茶釜哉
ro: mugi tsuki no daidô naka no chagama kana
en:
barley husking--
in the middle of a highway
a tea kettle

jp: .麦搗や行灯釣す門榎
ro: mugi tsuki ya andon tsurusu kado enoki
en:
barley husking--
a paper lantern
in the gate's nettle tree

jp: .家の峰や鳥が仕わざの麦いく穂
ro: ya no mine ya tori ga shiwaza no mugi iku ho
en:
thatched roof--
how many ears of barley
did birds bring?

jp: .家の峰や鳥が仕わざの麦一穂
ro: ya no mine ya tori ga shiwaza no mugi hito ho
en:
thatched roof--
the bird has added
an ear of barley

jp: .子どもらが反閉するやわか葉陰
ro: kodomora [ga] shakkuri suru ya wakaba kage
en:
children hiccup
in the shade...
fresh green leaves

jp: .殊勝さよ貧乏垣も初わか葉
ro: shushôsa yo bimbô kaki mo hatsu wakaba
en:
a noble effort--
the scraggly hedge too
has fresh green leaves

jp: .人声に蛭の落る也夏木立
ro: hitogoe ni hiru no ochiru nari natsu kodachi
en:
hearing voices
the leech drops...
summer trees

jp: .うら窓や只一本の木下闇
ro: ura mado ya tada ippon no koshitayami
en:
back window--
just one tree
for deep tree shade

jp: .笠程の花が咲けり木下闇
ro: kasa hodo no hana ga saki keri ko shita yami
en:
a flower big
as an umbrella-hat...
deep tree shade

jp: .権禰宜が一人祭りや木下闇
ro: gonnegi ga hitori matsuri ya ko shita yami
en:
the Shinto priest's
festival for one...
deep tree shade

jp: .白妙に草花さくや木下闇
ro: shirotae ni kusabana saku ya ko shita yami
en:
wildflowers blooming
pure white...
deep tree shade

jp: .卯の花の垣根に犬の産屋哉
ro: u no hana no kakine ni inu no ubuya kana
en:
deutzia blossom hedge
the dog's
maternity room

jp: .卯の花や子らが蛙の墓参
ro: u no hana ya kora ga kawazu no hakamairi
en:
deutzia blossoms--
the children visit
the frog's grave

jp: .名所や壁の穴より秋の月
ro: nadokoro ya kabe no ana yori aki no tsuki
en:
a sight to see!
from a hole in the wall
autumn moon

jp: .古壁の穴や名所の秋の月
ro: furu kabe no ana ya meisho no aki no tsuki
en:
hole in the old wall
a famous resort...
autumn moon

jp: .壁穴で名月をする寝楽哉
ro: kade ana de meigetsu [wo] suru neraku kana
en:
through the wall's hole
the harvest moon...
sleep time's pleasure

jp: .壁穴の御名月を寝坊哉
ro: kabe ana no on-meigetsu wo nebô kana
en:
harvest moon
through the wall's hole...
a late riser

jp: .なむなむと名月おがむ子ども哉
ro: namu namu to meigetsu ogamu kodomo kana
en:
"Praise! Praise!"
in harvest moonlight
a child prays

jp: .名月を一ッうけとる小部屋哉
ro: meigetsu wo hitotsu uketoru ko heya kana
en:
one harvest moon
special-delivered...
little room

jp: .けかちでも餅になる也十三夜
ro: kekachi demo mochi [ni] naru nari jû san yo
en:
starvation gives way
to rice cakes!
Ninth Month moon

jp: .秋の風一茶心に思ふやう
ro: aki no kaze issa kokoro ni omou yô
en:
autumn wind--
Issa's heart and mind
stirring

jp: .秋風や西方極楽浄土より
ro: aki kaze ya saihô gokuraku jôdo yori
en:
autumn wind--
it's from the Buddha's
Western Paradise!

jp: .親里は見えなくなりて秋の風
ro: oya-zato wa mienaku narite aki no kaze
en:
my home village
can't see it now...
autumn wind

jp: .淋しさに飯をくふ也秋の風
ro: sabishisa ni meshi wo kû nari aki no kaze
en:
eating my rice
in solitude...
autumn wind

jp: .常に打鈴なりながら秋の風
ro: tsune ni utsu rin nari nagara aki no kaze
en:
a bell is clanging
nonstop...
autumn wind

jp: .野仏に線香けぶるやけさの露
ro: no-botoke ni senkô keburu ya kesa no tsuyu
en:
incense smoke
on the Buddha in the field...
morning dew

jp: .客人の草履におくや門の露
ro: maraudo no zôri ni oku ya kado no tsuyu
en:
on the straw sandals
of a visitor...
the gate's dewdrops

jp: .稲妻やぞろり寝ころぶ六十顔
ro: inazuma ya zorori ne-korobu roku jû kao
en:
lightning flash--
lying in a row, faces
of sixty year-olds

jp: .川縁の夜茶屋は引て小稲妻
ro: kawa-beri no yo cha[ya] wa hikete ko inazuma
en:
the evening teahouse
by the river is closing...
little lightning

jp: .笹の葉に稲妻さらりさらり哉
ro: sasa no ha ni inazuma sarari-sarari kana
en:
on leaves of bamboo
lightning
flickers, flickers

jp: .我宿は朝霧昼霧夜霧哉
ro: waga yado wa asa-giri hiru-giri yo-giri kana
en:
at my house
morning mist, noon mist
evening mist

jp: .いとし子や母が来るとて這ひ笑ふ
ro: itoshi-go ya haha ga kuru tote hai-warau
en:
the darling child
summons his mother
crawling, laughing

jp: .精霊の御覧に入る門の田哉
ro: shôryû no goran ni ireru kado ta kana
en:
the ancestors come
and inspect it...
rice field by the gate

jp: .抱た子や母が来るとて鉦たたく
ro: daita ko ya haha ga kuru tote kane tataku
en:
child in my arms--
"Mama's coming!"
he hits the prayer gong

jp: .玉棚にどさりとねたりどろぼ猫
ro: tama-dana ni dosari to netari dorobo neko
en:
on the ancestors' altar
flopping down to sleep...
thieving cat

jp: .孤や手を引れつつ墓灯篭
ro: minashigo ya te wo hikare tsutsu haka tôro
en:
an orphan led
by hand...
a lantern for the grave

jp: .踊る声母そっくりそっくりぞ
ro: odo[ru] koe haha sokkuri sokkuri zo
en:
that dancer's voice--
just like mother's
like mother's!

jp: .涼しさよどれが彦星やしゃご星
ro: suzushisa yo dore ga hiko-boshi yashago-boshi
en:
cool night--
which stars are the children?
the great-great-grandchildren?

jp: .にっこにこ上きげん也二ッ星
ro: nikko-niko jôkige[n] nari futatsu hoshi
en:
beaming smiles
in the best of moods...
two stars

jp: .昔から花嫁星よむこぼしよ
ro: mukashi kara hanayome-boshi yo muko-boshi yo
en:
from time immemorial
Bride Star!
Groom Star!

jp: .一文の花火も玉や玉や哉
ro: ichi mon no hanabi mo tamaya tamaya kana
en:
even one-penny
fireworks...
ooo! ahh!

jp: .それがしも千両花火の人数哉
ro: soregashi mo senryô hanabi no ninzu kana
en:
even for me--
fabulously expensive
fireworks!

jp: .おのが家にこごんで這入る角力哉
ro: ono[ga]ya ni kogon[de] hairu sumô kana
en:
stooping
to enter his house...
sumo wrestler

jp: .角力取が詫して逃す雀かな
ro: sumôtori ga wabi shite nogasu suzume kana
en:
the sumo wrestler
apologizing, releases
the sparrow

jp: .まけ角力直に千里を走る也
ro: make-zumô sugu ni senri wo hashiru nari
en:
the wrestler's defeat
spreads a thousand miles
quickly

jp: .寺山やかがし立ても犬ほゆる
ro: tera yama ya kagashi tatte mo inu hoyuru
en:
temple mountain--
the dog also barks
at a scarecrow

jp: .小言いひいひ底たたく新酒哉
ro: kogoto ii ii soko tataku shinshu kana
en:
nagging, nagging--
the new sake
is drained

jp: .さをしかや片膝立って月見哉
ro: saoshika ya katahiza tatte tsukimi kana
en:
the young buck kneels
on one knee...
moon gazing

jp: .神の鹿じっとして人になでらるる
ro: kami [no] shika jitto shite hito ni naderaruru
en:
the sacred deer
stand still
to be petted

jp: .大磯や早朝飯で鴫の立
ro: ôiso ya haya asameshi de shigi no tatsu
en:
on a large beach
early risers for breakfast...
snipe

jp: .門の雁我帰ってもねめつける
ro: kado no kari ware kaette mo nemetsukeru
en:
geese at my gate--
when I return
how they glare!

jp: .雁がねの気どきに並ぶ烏かな
ro: kari ga ne no kidori ni narabu karasu kana
en:
wild geese clamoring
and one pretentious
crow

jp: .雁鴨や鳴立られて馬逃る
ro: kari kamo ya naki taterarete uma nigeru
en:
geese and ducks
honking, quacking away...
the horse

jp: .くつろいで寝たり起たり門の雁
ro: kutsuroide netari okitari kado no kari
en:
making themselves at home
asleep, awake...
geese at my gate

jp: .鬼虫も妻を乞ふやら夜の声
ro: oni mushi mo tsuma wo kou yara yoru no koe
en:
even the stag beetle
calls for a wife...
night voices

jp: .草原や提灯行に虫すだく
ro: kusabara ya chôchin yuku ni mushi sudaku
en:
grassy meadow--
insects crowd 'round
the paper lantern

jp: .なかなかに捨られにけりだまり虫
ro: naka-naka ni suterare ni keri damari mushi
en:
he's utterly given up
silent
insect

jp: .泣事や虫の外には藪の家
ro: nakigoto ya mushi no soto ni wa yabu no ie
en:
grumbling--
the insects outside
the house in the trees

jp: .鳴な虫直る時には世が直る
ro: naku na mushi naoru toki ni wa yo ga naoru
en:
don't sing, insects!
the world will get better
in its own time

jp: .よわ虫もばかにはならずあんな声
ro: yowa mushi mo baka ni hanarazu anna koe
en:
though a weak insect
he holds his own...
that voice!

jp: .黒塀にかくれたふりの蜻蛉哉
ro: kuro hei ni kakure[ta] furi no tombo kana
en:
against the black fence
trying to hide...
dragonfly

jp: .蜻蛉やはったとにらむふじの山
ro: tombô ya hatta to niramu fuji no yama
en:
the dragonfly's
steady glare...
Mount Fuji

jp: .こおろぎが顔こそぐって通りけり
ro: kôrogi ga kao kosogutte tôri keri
en:
a cricket
tickling my face
passes by

jp: .こおろぎにふみつぶされし庇哉
ro: kôrogi ni fumi-tsubusareshi hisashi kana
en:
trampled to pieces
by the crickets...
my eaves

jp: .石川をりっぱにおよぐいなご哉
ro: ishi-gawa wo rippa ni oyogu inago kana
en:
in the dried river
swimming splendidly...
locust

jp: .大水に命冥加のいなご哉
ro: ômizu ni meimyôga no inago kana
en:
in the flood
trusting divine protection...
locust

jp: .洪水に運の強さよとぶいなご
ro: kôzui ni un no tsuyosa yo tobu inago
en:
in the flood
its karma is strong...
flying locust

jp: .草庵の家根の峰迄いなご哉
ro: sôan no yane no mine made inago kana
en:
even at the peak
of my hut's grass roof...
a locust

jp: .猫のとり残しや人のくふいなご
ro: neko no tori nokoshi ya hito no kû inago
en:
the leftovers
caught by the cat, people eat...
locusts

jp: .放ちやる手をかじりけりきりぎりす
ro: hanachi yaru te wo kajiri keri kirigirisu
en:
biting the hand
that sets it free...
katydid

jp: .里の子や蚯蚓の唄に笛を吹
ro: sato no ko ya mimizu no uta ni fue wo fuku
en:
village child--
accompanies the earthworms' song
with flute

jp: .其声のさっても若い蚯蚓哉
ro: sono koe no satte mo wakai mimizu kana
en:
that voice
he's a young one...
earthworm

jp: .細る也蚯蚓の唄も一夜づつ
ro: hosoru nari mimizu no uta mo hito ya-zutsu
en:
the earthworms' song
grows thinner...
night by night

jp: .海中や鰯貰ひに犬も来る
ro: uminaka ya iwashi morai ni inu mo kuru
en:
the ocean--
coming for sardines
even the dog

jp: .菜畠のもやうにひょいひょい菊の花
ro: na-batake [no] moyô ni hyoi-hyoi kiku no hana
en:
the farm field's layout--
here and there
chrysanthemums

jp: .真直や人のかまはぬ菊の花
ro: massugu ya hito no kamawanu kiku no hana
en:
perfectly straight
if we let it be...
chrysanthemum

jp: .朝顔とおっつかっつや開帳がね
ro: asagao to ottsu-kattsu ya kaichô-gane
en:
about as good
as the morning-glories...
temple bell

jp: .朝顔や貧乏蔓も連に這ふ
ro: asagao ya bimbô-zuru mo tsure ni hau
en:
morning-glory--
a poor vine accompanies it
creeping along

jp: .明がたや吹くたびれし女郎花
ro: akegata [ya] fuki kutabireshi ominaeshi
en:
dawn--
the windblown, exhausted
maiden flowers

jp: .女郎花一夜の風におとろふる
ro: ominaeshi hito yo no kaze ni otorofuru
en:
maiden flowers--
after one windy night
fallen

jp: .存の外俗な茶屋有萩の花
ro: zon no hoka zokuna chaya ari hagi no hana
en:
an unexpected
country teahouse...
blooming bush clover

jp: .さをしかにせ負する紅葉俵哉
ro: saoshika ni seowasuru momiji tawara kana
en:
the young buck
with a load on his back...
red leaves

jp: .竃の下へはき込む紅葉哉
ro: hettsui no shita e hakikomu momiji kana
en:
into the sunken hearth
they're swept...
red leaves

jp: .山寺のみな堂下へ紅葉哉
ro: yamadera no mina dô shita e momiji kana
en:
mountain temple--
all the buildings strewn
with red leaves

jp: .きり一葉蝿よけにして寝たりけり
ro: kiri hito ha hae yoke ni shite netari keri
en:
the paulownia leaf
his fly-guard...
he sleeps

jp: .老僧が団扇につかふ一葉哉
ro: rôsô ga uchiwa [ni] tsukau hito ha kana
en:
the old priest
fans himself...
paulownia leaf

jp: .からたちの不足な所へ木槿哉
ro: karatachi no fusokuna toko e mukuge kana
en:
heading for where
quince is scarce...
rose of Sharon

jp: .崩れ家の花々しさや花木槿
ro: kuzure ya no hanabanashisa ya hana mukuge
en:
crumbled house--
the glorious roses
of Sharon

jp: .こちゃはさむあちゃうらむ也木槿垣
ro: kocha hasamu acha uramu nari mukuge kaki
en:
this side trimmed
that side resentful...
hedge of roses

jp: .子どもらや烏も交る栗拾ひ
ro: kodomora ya karasu mo majiru kuri hiroi
en:
the crows join
the children...
gathering chestnuts

jp: .ああままよ年が暮よとくれまいと
ro: aa mama [yo] toshi [ga] kure yo to kuremai to
en:
makes no difference to me--
the year ends
or doesn't end

jp: .うつくしきや年暮きりし夜の空
ro: utsukushiki ya toshi kurekirishi yoru no sora
en:
so pretty--
as the year finally ends
evening's sky

jp: .二時雨並んで来るや門の原
ro: futa shigure narande kuru ya kado no hara
en:
two winter storms
come one after the other...
field by the gate

jp: .初雪を鳴出しけりせんき虫
ro: hatsu yuki wo naki ideshi keri senki mushi
en:
"First snowfall!"
they rise and sing...
worms in my gut

jp: .ちいびちいび天の雪迄ききん哉
ro: chiibi chiibi ten no yuki made kikin kana
en:
a teeny-tiny bit--
even Heaven's snow
in short supply

jp: .隣から連小便や夜の雪
ro: tonari kara tsure shôben ya yoru no yuki
en:
pissing
with the neighbor...
evening snow

jp: .雪と泥半分交の通り哉
ro: yuki to doro hambun maze no tôri kana
en:
on a half-snow
half-mud road...
slogging along

jp: .雪の日や堂にぎっしり鳩雀
ro: yuki no hi ya dô ni gisshiri hato suzume
en:
on a snowy day
the temple is packed...
pigeons, sparrows

jp: .庵の犬送ってくれる叙骰ﾆ
ro: io no inu okutte kureru jûya kana
en:
the hut's dog is escort
to the winter
prayers

jp: .ばせを忌と申すも只一人哉
ro: bashôki to mô[su] mo tatta hitori kana
en:
"It's Basho's Death-Day!"
he says
to himself

jp: .ばせを忌の入相に入しわらぢ哉
ro: bashôki no iriai ni irishi waraji kana
en:
walking into sunset
on Basho's Death-Day...
straw sandals

jp: .ばせを忌や昼から錠の明く庵
ro: bashôki ya hiru kara jô no aku iori
en:
Basho's Death-Day--
from noon on, open house
at the hut

jp: .酒時をかいで戻るや煤払
ro: saka-doki wo kaide modoru ya susu harai
en:
sneezing I take
another sake break...
sweeping soot

jp: .江戸状や親の外へも衣配
ro: edo jô ya oya no hoka e mo kinu kubari
en:
in a package from Edo
new clothes...and I'm not
his dad!

jp: .傾城や在所のみだへ衣配
ro: keisei ya zaisho no mida e kinu kubari
en:
beautiful courtesan--
new clothes for her hometown's
Buddha

jp: .身拵へして待犬や雪礫
ro: migoshirae shite matsu inu ya yukitsubute
en:
the dog
braces himself...
snowball!

jp: .世話好や不性不性に冬籠
ro: sewazuki ya fushô-bushô ni fuyugomori
en:
the do-gooder reluctantly
begins...
his winter seclusion

jp: .ふぐ汁やもやひ世帯の惣鼾
ro: fugu shiru ya moyai shotai no sô ibiki
en:
pufferfish soup--
all the houses
snoring together

jp: .芦の家は千鳥の寝ぐそだらけ哉
ro: ashi no ya wa chidori [no] ne-guso darake kana
en:
house of reeds
where plovers sleep
plastered with crap

jp: .浦千鳥鳴立られて犬逃る
ro: ura chidori naki taterarete inu nigeru
en:
beach plovers
raise a ruckus...
the dog runs away

jp: .京入も仏頂面のふくと哉
ro: kyô iri mo butsu chôzura no fukuto kana
en:
entering Kyoto too
a bunch of sour-faced
pufferfish!

jp: .大根で鹿追まくる畠哉
ro: daikon de shika oimakuru hatake kana
en:
with a radish
driving off a deer...
his field

jp: .わんぱくも一本かつぐ大根哉
ro: wanpaku mo ippon katsugu daikon kana
en:
the little imp
totes one too...
radishes

jp: .鶯の口すぎに来るおち葉かな
ro: uguisu no kuchisugi ni kuru ochiba kana
en:
so that the nightingale
can make a living
fallen leaves

jp: .霜がれや貧乏村のばか長さ
ro: shimogare ya bimbô mura no baka nagasa
en:
frost-killed grass--
the poor town stretches
foolishly long

jp: .むさし野や水溜りのふじの山
ro: musashi no [ya] mizutsu tamari no fuji no yama
en:
Musashi Plain--
in its standing water
Mount Fuji

jp: .春風や野道につづく浅黄傘
ro: haru kaze ya nomichi ni tsuzuku asagi-gasa
en:
spring breeze--
across the field a parade
of light blue parasols

jp: .死時も至極上手な仏かな
ro: shini-doki mo shigoku jôzuna hotoke kana
en:
timing his death
extremely well...
the Buddha

jp: .華の世を見すまして死ぬ仏かな
ro: hana no yo wo misumashite shinu hotoke kana
en:
observing well
this world of blossoms...
Buddha dies

jp: .鶯の野にして鳴くや留主御殿
ro: uguisu no no ni shite naku ya rusu goten
en:
a nightingale sings--
the empty palace
his field

jp: .乙鳥子のけいこにとぶや馬の尻
ro: tsubame-go no keiko ni tobu ya uma no shiri
en:
the baby swallow's
flying lesson...
off the horse's rump

jp: .じくなんで茨をくぐる蛙哉
ro: jikunande ibara wo kuguru kawazu kana
en:
taming the flesh
he moves through thorns...
a frog

jp: .湯けぶりのふはふは蝶もふはり哉
ro: yu keburi no fuwa-fuwa chô mo fuwari kana
en:
hot tub steam
wafts softly, softly...
as does a butterfly

jp: .人つきの有や草ばもわか盛
ro: hito tsuki no ari ya kusaba mo waka-zakari
en:
some of them stick
to people, young grasses
at their peak

jp: .花の陰寝まじ未来がおそろしき
ro: hana no kage nemaji mirai ga osoroshiki
en:
cherry blossom shade--
no sleeping for me
feeling afraid

jp: .今の世や猫も杓子も花見笠
ro: ima no yo ya neko mo shakushi mo hanami-gasa
en:
the world today!
umbrella-hatted princes and paupers
blossom viewing

jp: .おどされた犬のまねして花見哉
ro: odosareta inu no mane shite hanami kana
en:
imitating
the menacing dog...
blossom viewing

jp: .山寺や寝聳べる下の花の雲
ro: yama-dera ya nesoberu shita no hana no kumo
en:
mountain temple--
below where I sprawl
clouds of blossoms

jp: .穀値段どかどか下るあつさ哉
ro: koku nedan doka-doka oriru atsusa kana
en:
the price of grain
falls bitterly...
the heat

jp: .門畠やあつらへむきの一夕立
ro: kado hata ya atsuraemuki no hito yudachi
en:
garden at the gate--
a tailor-made
little cloudburst

jp: .湖見ゆる穴もありけり雲の峰
ro: umi miyuru ana mo ari keri kumo no mite
en:
through a hole
you can see the lake...
billowing clouds

jp: .雲に山作らせて鳴烏かな
ro: kumo ni yama tsukurasete naku karasu kana
en:
making mountains rise
in the clouds...
cawing crow

jp: .野畠や芥を焚く火の雲の峰
ro: no-batake ya gomi wo taku hi no kumo no mine
en:
burning trash
in a field...
billowing clouds

jp: .人のなす罪より低し雲の峰
ro: hito no nasu tsumi yori hikushi kumo no mine
en:
less high
than the sins of men...
peak of a cloud

jp: .峰をなす分別もなし走り雲
